text: Great Italian food - a lot of variety in both food and wine. Would definitely recommend for a date night or when out with friends.
Excellent all round - we were attracted by the buratta menu but they have all sort of genuine Italian dishes. Tasty and good value, friendly service.
Service was amazing! Food was delicious too. A real treat for Sunday lunch

The different types of mozzarella were amazing; however, the mains did not match at all. The waiter was intrusive, spoke very much and did not take into account when we asked to be speedy, as we were running out of time. After this note, he did not come to our table to take the dessert orders for 15 minutes. As a result, we gave up and ordered no dessert.
I love the buffalo mozzarella options available and service is always great!

This place is fantastic. We walked in for lunch yesterday and staff have welcomed us very warmly. When we looked at the menu we couldn't make our mind for quite long time as everything looked delicious. In the end I had chicken schnitzel and my partner had prawn dog. It was so nice that we decided to book in for dinner same day. This time sushi and cheeseburger spring rolls for starters and bbq rib and rib eye burgers for mains. Best ever had. Recommend for everyone. Definitely will visit again when in London.
One of the best restaurants I‚Äôve been to 100%. Best service, best food, literally best everything!

We had a great evening. The service was excellent- foot was delicious and served very fast! Waiters were very helpful and kind and quick to complete multiple orders.
We will definitely visit again and recommend to friends!
Thank you!

Really amazing restaurant experience. It was my brothers birthday and they made a real fuss of him and had the whole staff singing. Food is such good value really reasonable for central London and the service was excellent.
A simple menu, well executed with excellent service and an excellent wine and drinks menu. What's not to love??

I am a huge fan of the Ham Yard. It has been my go to for several years. But I suspect they are struggling to find good staff.

Let‚Äôs start with the chef. I had pea broth which was way over salted. Literally not possible to eat. We all fished out the peas and left the broth.

The mains were at the typical high quality I expect of the Ham Yard. The coffee we ordered never arrived.

Given all the above they gave us a desert for free - without being promoted. But we would have preferred a better experience and to have paid for the desert.

The service was ok. But we are used to so much more from the Ham Yard. We are used to a genuine friendliness matched by professionalism. Here it was stiff and not always friendly.

I will go again based on my memories of the place but I hope they find their way back to how they were.

The decor of course was beautiful. They have really got that right.
Fantastic place, great food and service - couldn't ask for more.
Really perfect evening, great food, wonderful service, and the heaters were very powerful- and kept us very warm.
Fabulous as ever.

Overall this was a great experience - great food, lovely waitress - the atmosphere is great, I would recommend this place highly, maybe I'm biased because I have been coming here since it opened. Anyway, good time had by all, and good value too.
Great ambience, stylish decor and warm and efficient service. Food very good.
Have visited before , and must say as usual it was excellent. The staff are outstanding. I will go again.
The food is overpriced for the quality. I find the quality average but prices reflect a dining experience!

Would absolutely recommend.
Outstanding food, service, ambience... fantastic!!
This is the second time I‚Äôve had lunch here and always find the food excellent. It‚Äôs a lovely dining room in which to enjoy a leisurely lunch
Superb experience and value every time we go to the Ham Yard Hotel
Bar was very busy when we arrived, but our table was ready so we could be seated.  food was excellent and waiting staff attentive but not intrusive.  Would certainly go again.
Good food.  We had the set menu, as we were dining re theatre, which was very good value.  Excellent service in a very full restaurant.  Antonio the waiter anticipated our every need.
Overall it‚Äôs fine: great location and good menu. Food quality is fine but service can be improved -  keen but a bit interrupting sometimes
We were excellently looked after and the food quality was fantastic at a very reasonable price

We are regulars at Ham Yard and have never failed to be impressed. The courtyard was busy and lively when we caught up with friends on a hot, Wednesday evening. The service was fab, as always. The menu is great value for this part of town and the food is always excellent. We will keep coming back...
Excellent food and service - we ate on the terrace which was lovely.  Had the set lunch menu which was excellent value and delicious.  Highly recommended.

Great place for a Pre-theatre meal. Small selection of choices but all sounded tempting. With a good selection of wine by the glass or carafe, a must if you plan to stay awake during the play:-) The  staff seemed really nice and suitably attentive. We will definitely come again.
Fantastic service from our waiter, wish I‚Äôd taken his name
Had a wonderful meal at the Ham Yard Restaurant.  Super place for a quality meal with great service.

My new favorite place! The ground floor restaurant and bar area are beautifully done with great decor, lighting etc.  Restaurant tables are well spaced so you are not on top of other diners.  Food and service all excellent.  The bar area has lots of nooks and cranies for you to find your perfect place.  Good bathrooms.
Excellent service, delicious set lunch menu with prosecco and  gorgeous interiors as well. Couldn't ask for more

Great night - bar and place still buzzing. Service at dinner was amazing - our waiter (Swiss but didn't get his name) was brilliant! Food, table all great.

One thing to think about - the barman was so miserable!
Amazing food, service and experience. Will 100% go back again.

I've been to the Ham Yard Restaurant several times now, and very much enjoyed this trip too. Our waiter was delightful, the food (three of us had the special - turbot - which was well cooked and served with peas and pancetta) was very nice and the wine (a NZ Sauvignon Blanc) delicious. It was a quiet night, so noise levels were low and we were able to have a great conversation. Definitely one for the Central London list...

Ham Yard is a favourite of ours The d√©cor is gorgeous and the ambience is warm and inviting.  There's always a buzz about the place.  This visit we had a pre-theatre meal which at ¬£20 for 3 courses was great value for money.  However, the drinks are expensive and when service charge added it's always a bit of a shock!  That aside, it's still a great place to go for very good quality and tasty food, beautifully presented and served by excellent friendly staff who certainly know their stuff.  If you are on a budget keep off the cocktails!
Friendly staff but extremely inefficient and slow. Lovely decor.

Brilliant food and service! Andreas made the whole experience extra special for my mother's 60th birthday.
Really great, will definitely be back again!
Was a very enjoying evening. The service and atmosphere was excellent. The food was extremely tasty.
Excellent food, starters were lovely, mains slightly disappointing in comparison.

I had previously visited the Ham Yard Hotel for dinner in August. We were initially blown away by the food, setting and ambiance, however it there were 8 of us at our table, the restaurant was packed, and as a result the service was understandably not entirely up to scratch.

When friends visiting from overseas requested dinner somewhere they that 'ticks all the boxes', I was hoping that the quality of service would have lifted in 5 months and that a great night would be had by all.

We booked dinner for four people, before 7pm and although it was a Friday night, there were only a handful of tables seated.

Once again, the food was delicious, the waitstaff friendly, and the atmosphere fantastic.
However, the speed at which our meals came out was dismal. My visiting guests had to leave no less than 3 hours into the meal (and half-way through their main courses) as they were literally falling asleep in their food. A real shame given I was looking forward to sampling the beautiful desserts I had tasted on my last visit/

Having to wait that long for food has made me second guess the service of this beautiful establishment yet again, and regrettably I think it will be a while before my next visit.

Couldn't hear other person talk in the restaurant as the bar music is so loud.  Music is blasted out.  Fine if you want to be in the funky bar but not if you wish to talk. Only 2 of us - difficult to hear - hopeless if you were in a group of 8.....had to shout!  Need to switch off music in restaurant area and let the noise just carry through. Bar/restaurant area are not enclosed. Hopeless for a business lunch. Staff moved us to orangerie area but it was still noisy and not decorated for fine dining. Staff twere very good though. Plenty of them. Food fair. Not a big menu. Delicious pavlova. Roast pork should come with apple sauce. Veal fillet too thick. Food could be a lot better. Prefer to eat at your Sumner Place Hotel! Cool decor though.

Great dining experience. Staff were all helpful and friendly. We both had steaks - one ribeye and one sirloin - both perfectly delicious. Wife absolutely loved the side of mash n graveyard!
Server attentive throughout and happy to highly recommended Hawksmoor.
Really fantastic food. One of the best meals I‚Äôve had in a long long time. And great value.
Always flawlessly brilliant. The best quality food and service!
We had a amazing night celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary with our daughters. The staff made us feel special. Food as usual, was fantastic.  Can‚Äôt wait to return.

Birthday celebrations

Great food
But quite noisy
The staff were brilliant and making the evening a pleasant experience within the social distancing rules. I was very comfortable environment. The food, as always was excellent.
Nice staff and yummy food. They really tried their best to order all our food before 9:30 when some of our table was late.
Amazing service and incredible food. Thank you so much.
Been a while since I last attend, obviously not available over the pandemic, the quality of food has not change, but the quantity has decrease, probably due to discount......
Delightful as always! Sunday Roast is divine.
Lovely food as always, staff incredibly friendly and lovely night out - would again recommend to anyone planning a night out as a couple

Food was amazing and whilst a bit on the pricey side worth every penny. Service excellent. Very low ceilings which made it a bit noisy but no complaints with the aesthetics of the place. I just wish these restaurants would stop robbing you on the price of drinks. ¬£10 for a small can of lager is robbery.

Christmas Eve booking for 4pm only to find once we were seated all the staff were packing up and ready to leave. Totally understand people don‚Äôt want to be working on Christmas Eve but if we had known this was the case we would have booked elsewhere. Really, terrible and disappointing experience for all of us a day that we had planned well in advance.
Superb chateaubriand and rib in steaks. Great sides.
Lovely food and service, been here loads of times and would highly recommended it

Everytime I go here I love it. This time we went for our anniversary and felt so special.

We had the perfect welcome, champagne and fantastic service.

We had the roast dinner and cauliflower and cheese with red wine. Everything was perfect.

The service somehow manages to make you feel special but without being fussy. I absolutely love this place!

Outstanding in every aspect! The staff are friendly and helpful, yet give you space. The food is unreal and the attention to detail - giving us a small token desert on the house on our wedding anniversary was a lovely touch. Highly recommend and would definitely go back here.

Pretty awful. Cold burnt Yorkshire puddings. Steak not rare. Sent back still substandard on its return. Embarrassing for a date in all honesty. Wouldn‚Äôt go back. There are some seriously amazing restaurants in London
- this wasn‚Äôt one of them!

We came to Hawksmoor on a whim and a google search for highly rated restaurants near the Prince of Whales Theater. Initially I was concerned that the restaurant was trying to be fancy for the sake of being fancy, but after I arrived and received my food I discovered the true reason for the hype.

The beef dripping fries were absolutely amazing. Something as simple and abundant as fries has been given the chance to stand on its own and destroy the flavor scale. The gin beverages were all delicious and my Ribeye was cooked perfectly. My wife got the 3-course pre-theater meal and absolutely loved it.

We met with friends the next morning and recommended Hawksmoor and they immediately made reservations. We look forward to visiting again when we return to London next time.
Always fantastic
Everything about our visit was fantastic. Attentive staff, great environment which wasn‚Äôt loud and exceptional food.
Great service despite a very busy restaurant. A few glitches with food but resolved by staff.
It‚Äôs quite noisy and Covent Garden is more relaxed but you cannot fault the food or service
Excellent, efficient service. Incredible food, best steak I‚Äôve ever had. High end style and slightly low lit. Bit expensive but worth it.

The food was excellent, the service outstanding. The macaroni cheese we ordered for our daughter wasn‚Äôt great. She didn‚Äôt touch it and my husband who had a little bit of it felt unwell that evening. I wish there was something else I could choose from the desert menu other than the sticky toffee pudding... the menu definitely needs some attention in my view...
We had a fantastic meal and received a couple of glasses of champagne on the house as we recently got engaged. Amazing customer service!
Couple of visits to this restaurant now and have left satisfied and impressed on both occasions.
Fish was bland - can‚Äôt say steak was any better.
Hawksmoor is a lovely restaurant with the best food. The steak was absolutely fabulous as was the whole meal. A really lovely experience.  Would definitely recommend trying, you will be back again.

Our waiter was fantastic in advising on food and drink options and allowing us to enjoy the evening at hawksmoor for as long as we wanted - no pressure to rush us into decision over food or getting bill at end of evening.

On top of some amazing steak and fantastic puddings, this level of respect and attention was wonderful and helped us have a wonderful evening. Thank you

Third visit to this branch of Hawksmoor and I will be back again.
Service was excellent and unobtrusive.

My sons had the steak and lobster (a la carte) and my husband and I went for the express menu (served up until 18:30) which at ¬£28 for 3 courses was fantastic value. The steak was delicious as were the sides of triple cooked chips and creamed spinach. Lobster was also excellent and very reasonably priced.

Whilst we got there at 8.30pm, did not realise how big this restaurant was in comparison to the other Hawksmoors which meant that we were not able to order any sharing Chateaubriand/Porterhouse/other and ended up with individual steaks - good but given that we had been looking forward to the Chateaubriand and our server had to come back 4 time to tell us each time that everything was sold out, a bit of a disappointment. Love knightsbridge/seven dials - this one not so much.
Practically perfect in every way, with the exception of unusually slow service. I‚Äôve visited many times and rated 5/5, and I‚Äôll visit again.
The food was not tasty.
Great steak and good wine what more could you ask for
Very good food one of the best steaks we have had a little pricey but nice for a treat

Lovely evening.... second visit to the Air Street site with its beautiful art deco styling. Had dinner on Sunday night - steak and turbot were both outstanding. Sides and sauces excellent. Will definitely recommend and go back again.
The best steaks in London, very consistent experience having been to the Air Street Restaurant several times, very good wine list, we always have a great meal and a very good time!

The restaurant was very busy, which, whilst always a sign of a popular venue it did result in the service being a little slower that we have been used to here. Also the dining area was rather noisy.
However, the food was of the usual high quality and the staff were as friendly and attentive as we have come to expect.
Although we did not complain about the slow service we did receive an email apologising and offering us a complimentary drink on our next visit.
Always amazing food and sides are just lovely. Great wines and desert was delicious. Always come back.
Amazing Sunday roast!!! Would go there every Sunday if I was in town for more than a week!

The steaks are great!! Service is great although we had to wait for a while to pay for our bill but that's sometimes expected when busy.

Good for Sunday roast too!
Absoluotely superb as usual will be back again soon
The food was good as to be expected, but worth going here for the cocktails alone.

My boyfriend and I went to Hawksmoor for the pre-theatre menu. The food was simple (steak and chips, fish etc.) but well prepared and executed, certainly good value for 3 courses. They also have a small but delicious selection pre-prandial cocktails :) The restaurant has a surprisingly large number of covers, but manages to retain an intimate ambience and we could easily talk without having to shout at each other.

The most notable part of the evening was the service - all the staff were very friendly and welcoming, attentive but not overly so. They had even taken note that it was our anniversary and my boyfriend's birthday and piped messages on our desserts! This was really thoughtful, a pleasant surprise.

Overall the whole meal was brilliant and I warmly recommend the restaurant, especially for special occasions or when you just fancy a nice night out.

Went before New Year's Eve celebrations, booked late, got a lovely table, staff were the friendliest I've encountered in London , food was incredible, setting was lovely as it massive upstairs , but even though it is big , the staff are always there for you.
Overall 10/10 experience , if you want a great meal , fabulous setting , and lovely staff go here !
Hawksmoor is great for steaks and an enjoyable meal overall. You get well looked after. Could do with more fish options for those who like steaks less.
Best steak in London, and I've tried most of them!

A first class experience from when we entered throughout the meal, those who had the steaks all agreed best ever eaten. Sunday roast was of a high quality

Staff where attentive and looked after us

Meal was for my daughters 30th which I mentioned when booking and they remembered this
One of the for service, food and ambience. Excellent
Our waiter Tom, was delightful and our food was excellent. A lovely afternoon with lots of laughter. Looking forward to my next visit to Air Street.
a lovely meal great service, and an enjoyable wine list - well worth a visit
Looking forward to a really good steak. It was cooked well but the sides and starters were disappointing and no dairy free sauces. The service was great but I expected more.
It was only lunch on a Tuesday but I'd promised my guests a great meal and that is what we got..friendly and attentive service  with very good food...a perfect venue...again!!
Top notch Beef Sunday Roast. Meat was unbelievable. Cocktails are great too! Service was brilliant and smiley
The Best Steakhouse in London. Even my US colleagues admit that it beats anything in New York!

Ordered Chateaubriand medium rare for two and while it did come pink in the centre, the outer bits (making up about half of the meat) were leathery and dry.
Should be almost impossible to mess up a fillet cut like this but the chef managed to remove all taste and texture in what we were served.
Extremely disappointing when spending ¬£70 on a steak!

Really must take care to maintain consistency with their steaks.  I'm sure Hawksmoor is usually very good with the steaks but my experience was only satisfactory.  The steak was Not particularly tender, and was in fact quite "chewy".  Unfortunate really - I suspect that was just unlucky on the day.

I went on Easter Monday and whilst food was ok not as good as normal and service was really not brilliant to be honest. I have been to the Hawksmoor Air Street on 6 or 7 occasions and Seven Dials on 3 occasions as well and this the worst trip I have had. The waiter was not that understandable in terms of English language and a bit over zealous in his approach. The starters were good  but the fillet steaks were over cooked and to dry, very unusual for this place, very disappointing as I had taken my kids as I usually attend for business dinners and to be honest I could've cooked the steaks better at home. Medium was requested by us all but they were medium well really and dry, certainly not a ¬£32 piece of meat. The overall bill for 2 adults an 18 year old (2 beers) and a 16 year old (non drinker) was around ¬£320, no where near worth it to be honest. A shame as previous visits had always left me feeling very satisfied. I would now think twice about going again a shame as I attend at least 2 or 3 times a year and have always recommended to friends!
The food was 5*. Best steak I've ever tasted! Loved the beef dripping fries too! Well worth the money, will definitely be going again!

We had the pre-theatre menu, one starter of prawns was delicious but eaten in a couple of minutse whereas the other of yorkshires with potted meat and gravy kept my other half busy for a good 15 mins - it was HUGE. The steaks were very tasty and sides good esp the lettuce salad, really beautifully presented.
Shared the sticky toffee pudding that was really luscious!

PLEASE can there be a better choice of drinks for those of us who don't drink? Doing the Dryathlon I found that on an 8 page drinks/cocktails menu, less than 1/4 of a page was for soft drinks - guys you're missing a chance, I'd happily pay full price for a non-alcoholic cocktail (TGi'S do them even!)

Its a very big, very busy restaurant - so not a place for a romantic meal and at ¬£90 quite pricey for a pre-theatre meal

We were a group of four enjoying a luxurious dinner. The Chateaubriand was extraordinarily well cooked (medium rare).
The triple cooked chips are an absolute "must eat" and the service was excellent.

If a Hindu should eat steak, it should be like this. Hands down the best steak I've had. Attentive staff, lovely ambience, delicous wine and dessert. It's great value for money as what you get it truly out of the ordinary.

Hawksmoor Air Street is a beautiful building. Upstairs the seating and bar area have wonderful windows and a buzzing lively atmosphere.  Service is excellent and the steaks are so so good!! Also recommended is the Dover Sole, which was ordered with a Mac & Cheese & lobster side. Extravagant but worth it. We shall definitely be visiting again very soon

All 4 of us had the Beef Roast and thought it was very very good. A big slab of beef which we were offered either pink (medium) or well done. It came with a very large yorkshire pudding, carrots, some greens and a good sized pot of gravy. Also enjoyed the creamed spinach and though the 3-cheese macaroni cheese was very tasty.

Very good food.
Delicious food, great service and an outstanding location.

Hi ordered the rib eye ¬£30 and it was partly inedible, not as good as a ¬£6 steak from Waities. Quite dissappointing tho others in party were quite happy. Expensive and small portions of veg and chips

Having heard all the rave reviews about this place I was enthusiastic to visit one of the hawksmoor eateries when I'm in London. This place is huge, so if you're looking for something more romantic this ain't it. The service was very slow and we waited 45mins to get our order, all we got was an apology and that our food will be on the table in 4minutes. The meat was anything but impressive, my fillet tasted like charcoal and was overcooked. My husband's ribeye was better cooked. The sides are expensive for what they give you, I had a fennel salad which was too watery and tasteless. These guys should go to Nopi close by and learn how food shoul taste like.

Service was slow and they made mistakes. Not overly impressed and the food was not as good as the time before. Dessert is also very average. Overall not impressed but it might have been just a one off bad experience.

Overall very good.

My only complain was the level of service.
We had to wait 20 minutes for our table without being told by the staff what was causing the delay

Took my 15year old son there for his first experience. We both thorughly enjoyed ourselves, only problem is he now wants to go back
Fantastic food, staff and ambiance
We had a very pleasant experience but there are better value options available in London.
Not a cheap option, but a foodie option! Splendid service, with no frills menu. A must try for steak fans. I had a beautiful fillet steak - worth the ¬£35 pounds.

Wonderful environment to share a girlie lunch with or a first date with out feeling to much pressure! The staff could give you details on your choices and very knowledgable about the wine. The atmosphere was wonderfully relaxed. I would very much recommend this!

Relaxed atmosphere, fantastic food and perfect service.

Everyone from the hostess on the door, to the ma√Ætre d' in the bar, to the waitress the served us was an example of how service should be in a modenr restaurant. All very friendly, helpful and relaxed.

Lobster, skeak, triple cooked fries and a bottle of Pino Noir. Little bit pricey, but well worth it.
Good steak restaurant. good serivce and vibe for a satruday afternoon. good location

Fantastic quality beef. Cooked perfectly.
Every dish delivered on quality and flavour, right down to the soused pilchards.
Great atmosphere. Love the parquet flooring.

Everything above this restaurant oozes class.
Monday night ¬£5 corkage is a great idea.

The food was absolutely outstanding, could not fault it at all the steak was cooked to perfection and the flavour was incredible. The staff were very friendly and one girl we had was lovely and went out of her way for us, she was great.
It is expensive but totally worth it.
Fantastic experience! I'll definitely be back!

We really enjoyed our meal at Hawksmoor Air St. The waiting staff were great - very personable and efficient. Bit of a wait between starters and mains (the restaurant was less than half full) but that was forgotten as soon as the food arrived - great quality ingredients, and well cooked.
The steak was the best I've ever had.

I lived in Australia for 10 years - take it from me, Ozzies know their steak - and this is the best steak I have had, here or there! It's not cheap and it's quite a lively restaurant but the food was excellent, service relaxed and attentive and the wine list extensive. The cocktail bar is a great idea. when you wrap all that up you have the recipe for a great night out - whether as a couple or a group. If you are looking for the best steak restarant with a classy edge - look no further! I will be back!
never met a woman with such vast and intricate knowledge of steak #refreshing

This has to be the best place to dine out in soho! The attentive staffs are top notch! It made our dining experience very memorable in such a busy chaotic evening especially when the rain came down, moving indoors and outdoors in such a big group. But all is well because the service is accommodating and flexible. The food is nevertheless extremely tasty and well cooked, everyone loves all the dishes. The cocktails are very nice too thank you!
Make sure not to miss the blacklock beer and cheesecake!
Excellent food and even better service! Would thoroughly recommend and will definitely be back again.
Outstanding as always!
The lamb roast was delicious and the staff were really friendly and understanding when 2 of our friends had to cancel last minute.  Highly recommend!
Never had a bad meal here, always great. Great good and service and reasonable prices on the cocktails. Can't be beat.

Great service, amazing food, fantastic atmosphere. I went with my partner for our anniversary and got the all in sharing platter and it was unreal. The meats were cooked to perfection and the chips are hands down the best chips I have ever had. The cheesecake for desert was also great. Our waiter was brilliant, explained everything to do with the cuts etc. I highly recommend anyone to dine at Blacklock.
The All-In is an excellent way to share lunch with friends and is fantastic value! Service was excellent, everything was great.
Excellent food and quick service! Beef dripping fries were amazing!
Amazing food, exceptional vibe and services! I‚Äôll be there again soon.
Incredible chops, lovely service and fantastic vibe - will be back again soon üëçüèªüòä
Amazing time! Food was delicious, staff amazing and the all place was really really nice! Def would come back!
Great food but pricing was a bit confusing so we paid far more than expected. Would go again though

Excellent venue, incredible staff and management. Everyone was helpful, polite and couldn‚Äôt do anymore to make the experience enjoyable. Great cocktail menu and they make a mean old fashioned!  This is only beaten by the meal which was sublime, amazing quality and beautifully cooked and presented.  Highly recommend anyone to visit - if you‚Äôre not in the area make the journey as you don‚Äôt want to miss out!

In one word "outstanding".. I have no doubt in my mind that this is the best Sunday lunch in London, maybe even the world! We've been for steaks as well, forget about Gaucho and Hawksmoor, there is nowhere better than Blacklock, it's our new favourite place. Thank you Matt and the rest of the team at Blacklock, a truly memorable dining experience every time, we're looking forward to the next visit already!
Phenomenal food and staff. Have been lots of times and never disappoints.
Nice place. Had the sharing platter, some of the meat was chewy but it was good value ¬£76 for 2 with a couple of cocktails each. Nice atmosphere and excellent service.

We had the steak sandwich before 6.00pm for ¬£10.
Excellent flavour of the meat, mustard was a bit much but cleared the nasal passages out!!
Our chips were a bit paltry and overdone but these were removed from the bill and we were given a free sweet, so we were happy with that. Cocktails for a ¬£5.00 were good also. Overall a good pre theatre meal.
Perfect place for Sunday roast with friends!
Good quality food for people who like meat. No fuss service with time to explain menu In detail for people not familiar with a chop house.
The food was really good the service was great
Honestly the best steak I've ever had.... Excellent quality and perfectly cooked to your liking. Seasoned impecabelly and sauses we're fantastic. 10/10
Tasty food ( if you are not a vegetarian ) , very friendly and attentive service, surprisingly spacious , fab cocktails. would definitely recommend !
Beautiful food and good value for money! The steak sandwich was delicious as were the chips! Will definitely be back next time we are in London!
Bien ras a signaler üëç
We went for the sharing platter and the meat was very fatty and burnt

Terrific from start to finish. Greeted enthusiastically at reception and looked after very well by smiling attentive staff. Relatively simple food (meat, meat and the odd chip) cooked perfectly. Not cheap (¬£60 for two with a few beers) but worth it.

Well cooked and well priced steaks. ¬£5 cocktails were decent and the wine was a decent price considering the location. The restaurant was quite crowded and music quite loud when we went so ambience wasn't quite right and the waiters really need to chill out about re-pouring water-they visited as soon as a glass was emptied.

Hands on staff who keeps customer well informed. Very friendly and welcoming. We enjoyed very tasty meat and lovely sides. All food was tasty and something extraordinary.  We loved it and would go back.
The food was really excellent. We had the All-In option which was recommended for first time visitors and it was really excellent. Great cocktails and beer too. Great time had by all.

Loved the option of being able to share the chop platter, which I felt was much better for 2 people, especially cost wise.

Cocktails could have an explanation for what they are on the menu

My girlfriend and I went to Blacklock for her birthday, and the experience was amazing. We had the porterhouse steak which was simply fantastic, and the service was quite possibly the best we've ever had in London. So much so we went and told the manager about how impressed we were with the waiter, their attention to detail, use of rapport and delivery. It made her birthday very special, the gave her a glass of prosecco on arrival and cheesecake with a candle when we had finished our meal. The waiter and I ended up harmonising when singing happy birthday! All in all quite simply the best restaurant and steakhouse in London.
Food was amazing and so was the atmosphere and the service, would definitely recommend and food is worth the price 100%.

Booked on Festival menu which is 35 each including a drink.
We were told they had run out of salmon which made the choice small.
Steak arrived and was undercooked for 1 person, it was taken back and brought out when all other 3 people had finished.
We were told starters we ordered had run out so had to choose from a limited list again.
Service was very slow.
Air conditioning made the place freezing and most people seemed relieved when turned off.
Toilet had only 2 tiny cubicles for such a big restaurant.

Overall food tasted good but the whole experience was a let down.

So good to be back eating out, it was our first family outing post lockdown & wasn't disappointed. Amazing steaks, great cocktails & wine, sat outside which was so nice on a bright Saturday afternoon. Great to have you back Gaucho !
Visited for our anniversary, as usual everything was spot on, even got a special gift at the endüëç
Great food!
Excellent lunch. Service from Enrico was superb. He was very knowledgeable about the menu and his recommendations were spot on.
Amazing service (thank you Pasquale) and food was incredible! We will definitely be returning.
Excellent roast!!
My party and I was seated right by the door (even though the restaurant wasn't busy) and this didn't make for a great dining experience.

Disappointing.. I had booked this restaurant on Saturday for my partners birthday, we were both looking forward to the evening as we had heard great things about Gaucho! We had to wait 20 minutes for our table as we were told they were setting up ‚Äúa better table for us‚Äù (ended up in the corner right next to a steel column! God knows where the other one would have been) the waiter asked for our drink & food order, he brought the wrong drinks over .. and then disappeared! Someone else brought out our food even though he was still out serving other tables, not one person asked us how the food was, there was no one to ask about replacing our drinks. I also requested the week before, for a special birthday dessert request (something Gauchos usually do) which I had confirmation from the restaurant that this was all okay... my partner didn‚Äôt receive any birthday although the couple sat next to us did... it was a very disappointing evening and spoiled the birthday weekend! Although the food was lovely, it came with bad service and lack of attention to guests.
Excellent restaurant. Great atmosphere and the best steaks!

First of all, drinks were poor (watered out) so re-ordered and got an okey drink. Ordered then medium-raw stake and got medium/well done, and the told the waitress to please have another one, we the got another really well done and did not order a new item and just returned it. It was also another table behind us that were yelling the whole meal and the staff did not tell them anything. A really bad experience as we was looking forward to going there again, since it WAS one of our favourite restaurants in London.
Went for my boyfriends birthday and I wanted them to bring out something nice for him and they didnt, just felt rushed because they wanted to hurry up and close

It was great
However it was rather unfortunate as it coincided with the pride parade and the noise was unbearable
Worth it with an offer for 50% off food but otherwise quite expensive for what it was. I've had a better time at other steak places. Our waiter was lovely though and very attentive

Very good experience. The steaks were perfectly grilled, juicy and super tasty. Starter and sides fairly good. Malbec red wine at good price.

Staff can improve further. A bit unorganised because me and my friends arrived at different times. I was taken to the bar and never notified when my friends came. Was also given wrong direction where our table is. Our waiter was very friendly, polite and quick, their English not very good.

The place very good, nice atmosphere with good taste of decoration.

Expensive, but worth the money.

I would strongly recommend the experience.
Had a super evening at Gaucho Piccadilly with my family of five. Great service and the best meat experience! Going back for sure!
Food is too plain. Not expecting from any restaurant.
Excellent steak and excellent service. Very good value for money and a good buzz in the restaurant.
Great service, lovely food, me and my girlfriend thoroughly enjoyed our visit.

Steak was good, and had a distinctive flavor, in keeping with the restaurant‚Äôs claims.

Service was correct but slightly gruff.

Outdoor seating is pleasant when weather permits.

Great food, staff were all very good and explained the different dishes.
Also making a fuss of the person whose Birthday it was.
Will be returning in the near future well done Piccadilly.
Incredible food. Service was excellent. Will be returning again very soon!

What an experience, getting eye-rolled by a receptionist to start with then taking cocktail order which she is not familiar with. It came back to me with an excuse that she did not take my cocktail order properly.

Food and our waiter was great.

Just be aware with the receptionist because she will judge you as soon as you entre and act accordingly how you appear to her.
Thank you again it was a new experience from Gaucho based on my past experience.

Not sure I will ever visit this branch again,

Literally the best restaurant I've ever dined at, and honestly I have dined at a lot. The service was amazing, they made great recommendations for which steak would suit each person and showed us the difference. Everything I ate tasted good from the bread to start with to my main which I had a lamb shank and the wine. I would definitely recommend it has a lovely interior also and a great atmosphere. Thankyou

We went to Gaucho Piccadilly after a hard day's shopping and to celebrate our daughter's birthday.  From earlier visits we knew that the steaks would be fantastic and we were not disappointed.  The service was friendly and excellent.

Great food and impressive restaurant. I‚Äôve eaten here a few times and always find it a great place to entertain.
A bit disappointed that my fillet steak had a fatty rind and wasn‚Äôt as soft as normal but it was a lunch menu.
Doesn‚Äôt put me off coming back but might avoid the lunch menu.
Good as always
Best steak in town. Try the tiro de ancho, black and blue. You'll never eat steak differently again.

Good, still not as good as Goodman's. Steak
Medallions were ok but goodman's steak is still better. Starter of scallop was delicious. Sides were good as well but still not the same as Goodman's. As usual. Lovely experience (apart from getting kicked out the restaurant because we were taking up the table for too long even though the restaurant was empty). But still not as good as Goodman.

A very good dining experience. The one point I request is that the waiting staff are not required to spray 'cleaning fluid' on a table every time the table becomes clear. The smell of the cleaning fluid passes to the tables in the 6 yards or so nearest and gets in you nose & throat. Surely a simple wipe down would better okay  for hygiene without changing the atmosphere in the restaurant. We did speak to the Front of House about this on departure.
Fantastic meat and good service. We will be back as soon as possible.
Excellent location and brilliant food and service as always!
Great place to enjoy good quality food at a fair price will visit again

This has become a very mass market affair. What used to be a specialist Argentine upmarket offering has become commoditised to an extreme degree. All very slick and professional, but set for volume above everything. As such I am afraid it has lost a lot of its charm and indeed appeal. Everything is aimed at high volume throughput  with tables not only tiny but extremely cramped. Literally 0 sense of privacy as even if you try your hardest you cannot avoid hearing everything your neighbouring table is saying. It is in fact so cramped that waiters have difficulties serving you as the fact that there is 0 space between the tables does not allow them to move. Service is really hit and miss as waiters seem simply overwhelmed. Prices are very high nonetheless. A meal for 2 with 2 starters and 2 main courses with only 1 glass of wine came to in excess of 80 sterling per person, a total of > 160 sterling. When taking into account the fact that this was a medium quality food and ambience as well as service experience this was very expensive even for a city as expensive as London. For this price there is substantially better.

Had a lovely evening with family and friends. Overall it was a great experience although you need a torch where the mood lighting is very dark. We were moved back and forth from bar to table on different floors and although there are plenty of staff wearing their head sets, they don't actually communicate to guests where they are going and so you stand in the door way a little lost hoping you don't embarrass yourself by asking another diner for your table instead of a member of staff.

Overall, food really nice, but being a food fan as I am the fat chips were pretty floppy and not crispy or that appealing‚Ä¶.don't think any light would have improved them! As this was for a special occasion I didn't make a fuss as I didn't want to create a negative atmosphere.

I would still recommend Gauchos as it's a nice experience and a lot of fun with nice company. I think looking at the walls that it's probably best they lights are dimmed because the decor needs cleaning and refreshing‚Ä¶.. and I'm certain that's more costly than adding a few light bulbs :0)

My most favourite restaurant in the UK
Unparalleled service and food to die for

Had a meal prior to rugby semi final. The food was outstanding and well
Presented, the wine ( Patricia ) Malbec was a perfect match. The service was a bit disjointed as if we were there an hour too early but didn't stop is enjoying the meal

We came here for my boyfriend's 50th birthday and loved it so much we came back the following week.  The steak is the best I have ever eaten and cannot recommend it highly enough.  The atmosphere, service, food and drinks are all first class.  Make sure you have a cocktail in the bar before dinner.  We are already looking forward to coming back.
Lovely restaurant, very pretty and classy! Great for any occasion. Lovely staff and do anything to make experience the best. Definitely coming back soon

Gaucho has the perfect service from staffs which is very hard to find nowadays in London. Worth paying for as well the food and atmosphere. Everyone need to experience at least once. I was there for Valentine and the staffs and the food made it more special! Will need to try the Sunday Roast now!!

I booked a table at Gauchos Picadilly on Saturday 13th December for my partners birthday and I can only describe the experience as awful! This was our 6th visit to a Gauchos restaurant, our first at Picadilly.   Our table was booked at 1945, but we weren't sat until 2005. No one offered to take my coat, and we were made to wait just outside the toilets in the entrance area as the bar was so full. Another guest even asked my partner how long his table would be as he thought he was a  member of staff as there was no one around to assist! It was pandemonium!   When we finally sat down, we ordered our food and the first option my parent went for had 'sold out'. Another was recommended so he ordered that, but was told 10 minutes later that was also sold out! He ordered the final recommendation - ¬£13 more in price than the option he originally had asked for. He felt no choice but to just order it as we had been waiting so long!   At the end of our meal, we were rushed out away from our table and made to wait in the cold for the waitress to find a card machine that actually worked!   If this had been our first visit to a gauchos restaurant, then we certainly wouldn't be coming back! We have had such good service at Charlotte St, Canary Wharf and in Leeds, that this birthday meal out was such a let down!   We will certainly not be frequenting gauchos picadilly again and will advise our friends against the restaurant as well.   I just hope that this was a 'one off' experience for us! We felt very let down!

when me and my partner arrived at Gauchos i had booked a table for 7:30. we arrived at 7:25 and was told the table will be 10 min. after i waited 30 min for the table i asked the manager how much long will i have to wait, she went in to see how long it would be and i never saw her again. after waiting in total of 45 min i was offered a table which i had to decline as i had a show to go to at 10:00pm. i think this is a shocking! as people who didnt even book a table were given one! Shocking service!

The food was excellent from start to finish but the waiter rushed us through the meal, forgetting the starters and a drink order. At the end of the meal he then was no where to be found to get the check. The food was good but the service and atmosphere didn't measure up.
Really great food if you love your meat, you can chose your cuts and they cook it how you want it.  I went for a lovely birthday dinner and the non meat eaters had options too.  Lovely.

4 fiends had dinner here. Very pleased with the restaurant, but the table we got was in a dark place in the restaurant. We had to use our mobiles to light up the menu. (Saw other guests who also needed more light to reed the menu).

We attended this venue on Valentines day. Although the place seemed extremely packed (clearly getting the most out of the occasion) we were seated promptly and had the option of drinks at the bar. The scene was set perfectly for the occasion, although would have been nice to have a little more space. The service was second to none and the food was amazing, perfectly cooked. Our bill came to ¬£130 for starters, main, dessert, 2 glasses of wine and tip. Not the cheapest of restaurants, but the food and service was fantastic and I'm sure more space is made available on non occasioned days. Would recommend and go back again.

We had a rather disastrous booking around the corner at the Rancho Grill but got extremely lucky and were able to get a last minute table at Gaucho Piccadilly instead. The restaurant was completely packed so it was a great atmosphere and the food was excellent, as it always is! It took a little while for our table to come ready but considering it was New Years Eve and seeing how busy they were I thought they did really well.
Good food. Good service. To noisy
Both steaks was very chewy, doesn't touch Hawksmoor but is cheaper.
this was yet another outstanding dining experience!

The meal was delicious indeed, but we were very much disappointed by the service.
This was a very special occasion for my partner and I, so we have requested a good table. At the reception we have been told we have been indeed given an excellent table.
WORSE TABLE EVER! My partner was "stuck" between the table and a pilar, he could barely move and on top of that, a bit after we arrived, a large table of noisy men sat right next to us. This was everything but a special table, very disappointed.

We kept a longstanding promise to take our son to Gauchos (Piccadilly) for his 18th birthday on Monday 27/5 and from the moment we arrived he (and we) were made to feel special by the waiting team. Our visit included an opportunity to taste a range of Scottish whiskies and discuss wine in some detail.

As always the food was superb.

Recommended, thanks to the team for helping make a special day for our son
The service was amazing, ambience was fantastic and the food completely amazing.
Everything was overpriced even for London and the service was spotty

Its my fifth time at Gaucho, but the first time in the basement.
Although it's locals without windows the interior was nice and good looking, warm atmosphere.
My best recommendation for this restaurant!

Meat is amazing and steaks are worth the money, however the water, sauces and side veg are overpriced.
Atmosphere is too loud, it has the feel of a factory rather than cosy restaurant....
Great Steak and great atmosphere

The service was great from the moment I showed up for my reservation. I had to wait for my other party to arrive but it was fine as I ordered a drink from hostess & they brought it out to me as a waited in the patio area outside. It was a perfect martini the size of which you can only get in certain kinds of restaurants in London. Perfectly chilled glass & neat with my twist of lemon. When we were seated we didn't bother with starters as we knew we were having full meat menus. Our waiter was informative and really helpful with the wine selection. You basically choose your cut of beef and they have one of four ways in which it can be seasoned. My steak was perfectly medium rare and chips and sauteed spinach & smoked garlic hollandaise.
We Waited 30 min extra at the door even though we had a reservation. Other than that everything was great.
Have dined here many times before. Very busy night on this particular night so service was a little slower than normal, but food still great.
Great venue with really good atmosphere. Wonderful steaks but not cheap!
A huge restaurant - over several floors - but very very dark inside, no natural daylight. Food was good, but pricey. And starters were generally very small portions and disappointing.

Food in the restaurant is always outstanding but in the past I have had some reservations over the service but on this occaision I could not fault it.
I took my wife some with me this time after telling them about it from business trips and it proved an excellent experience overall.
Amazing food and atmosphere - certainly going here again!

My girlfriend and I went to Gaucho in Picadilly for our anniversary and had the most amazing experience. The food was of exceptional quality and the service was prompt and helpful. I would strongly recommend Gaucho to any meat lover!
Fabulously luxe restaurant. Steak very good although not cheap. Attentive service, all in all would return but would have to be for a special occasion!
Superb steaks and good service from an engaging waiter. The restaurant delivers food theatre but in an arena that's over stylised for my tastes. Not the place for a quiet tete-a-tete.
Took some friends as they had never been.they liked the concept. so i'm sure they will in turn make reservations in their own right,

I booked through toptable at the lunch before going in the evening and they had no record of the booking. This is the second time it has happened so I would recommend ringing to confirm. There was however space for us and the food was delicious as ever.

out standing food, great recommendation from friends,great all round... The best steak,out standing food and wine and pudding recommendations from great staff.. small problem with steak quickly put right amazing service,,,Manager put things right with in minutes no complaints great can't wait to go back thanks for a good meal and the kids loved it too...

Gouchos Picaddilly - top marks for a great evening for a party of 10. Excellent food, service and wine.  The cinammon cheesecake was one of the best desserts I have ever tried.  Yummy. Will definitely come again
Excellent steak, wine and service.

Ordered 1 Gaucho sampler, 2 fillets and 1 rib eye. Surprisingly the rib eye tasted the best. Service was good, friendly but not tooooo attentive to make you feel uncomfortable.

The pan fried squid was okay. Loved the sausage platter!

Dessert wise, Dulce de Leche Flan was great, like the texture a lot! Chocolate tart was just so-so, Almendrado & passion fruit tocino were too sweet.

Only less than ¬£70 for each of us, a group of 4. Just ordered one wine though. Recommended.
Was a lovely place went for my boyfriends birthday and it was very romantic and special I will be going back again
The atmosphere is great and the fo one.od is amazing!! Book a table, you shouuld not miss out on this
2nd visit here, and again the steak was fantastic ! Great service too !
Once again the steaks at the Gaucho Picadilly did not disappoint and were fabulous -  the smallest size was ample for lunch. The pastry starters were just "okay", hence the food rating of 8.

Nice ambience and decor, steak was good I'm told(although I'm a veggie and only had 1 option) and very much as expected. Good wine list and nice side dishes. However, let down somewhat by the service - our waiter was a little overkeen to get us to order and came back several times, however at the end of the meal when we wanted the bill, he was nowhere to be seen and it was difficult to get anyone's attention. Bar downstairs was very nice.

Warm welcome and good cloakroom service. Waiter service good to start with but dropped off as the restaurant become busy later (Saturday evening). Plates were cold but we were told this was because the kitchen staff were very busy. Be aware that the dining area is in the "cellars" so no windows. Open plan layout came across as industrial/post-modern rather than intimate. Steaks excellent. Good value for money given the location.

We had an enjoyable meal at Gauchos whilst my husband was on his business trip for a couple of days. It was nice to be able to see the meat before you choose what you want! It was recommended to us by friends/colleagues and it had a good atmosphere. Our mojitos didn't arrive when we ordered them when we sat down before the meal but we didn't mind as we had them when we got to our table.
Tasty food but steak was surprisingly tough. Not the "melt in the mouth" experience I had expected.
Our food was very good but i think the starters are very small for the price.

All four of us agreed, it was the best steak we had ever had, my own favourite was the sirloin spiral. Argentinian wines were very good, and the seating arrangements were well spaced out (I hate sitting too close to other diners). The waiters and waitresses were very friendly and helpful. All in all, it made for a great experience and a wonderful end to our two day visit to London.

Thank You
Michael Mears
Fantastic! The best steak I have ever had, superb atmosphere and surroundings, attentive waitress and a professional service that is often lacking in otehr restaurants. Highly recommended.
Excellent wine & main course -steak :-) Normal but expensive side-dishes and starters.

The food was outstanding. I thought the restaraunt was a bit hectic but that was probably due to the date being the last weekend before Christmas. I also thought the restaurant was very dimly lit and I couldn't read the menu properly.I've been a couple of times to Gaucho Richmond and thoroughly enjoyed that experience.
Food excellent, ambiance good, felt we were rushed out after the meal and told an taxi had been booked and was waiting for us that never turned up.

The reception was efficient and they have a cloakroom (which needs a little organising). A good variety of starters (our selections where very good). All four steaks (all different cuts and sizes) were cooked to perfection and exactly as ordered. The side orders are small but that leaves you free to enjoy the steak all the more. The sauces are dreadfully overpriced and unless you really must have one then just enjoy the unfettered steak you wont be disappointed. There is plenty of deserts to tempt your palate but the prices are top heavy. The restaurant felt quite dark but it was still light enough to read the menu. There was a lady playing a guitar and singing just as back ground which was nice. With drinks it was just over ¬£50 per head.

Booked a table for my boyfriends birthday as was very impressed with Gaucho when I have been before to Gaucho Canary however was disapointed with our evening at Gaucho Picadilly the service was very poor we did not receive our wine until after we had finished our starters, our plates were not taken away and our main meal arrived and had to be taken away again until our table was cleared! Steak was very good as always however it always puts a dampner on the eventing when you receive poor service!
absolutely fantastic. the food was great, service fantastic, great idea re wimbledon, i love gaucho and would recommend it.

The interior was impressive, although way too dark - not sure what they're trying to prove there; the service was ok; the rib eye I ordered was average - way too much fat on it - thought it would taste a lot better; the chips I ordered were good although the serving was the size of a small coffee mug; the bread was excellent; the lamb chops were very nice; the serving of the peppercorn sauce with the rib eye was around 1/3 of the volume of a shot glass, i.e., way too small a serving - this should be included in the cost of the meat.

So in a nutshell, mixed feelings on the place. Given the reputation and cost, I would have expected a little more. I'd probably try a different cut of meat.

We had a very enjoyable meal at the restaurant. As we were meeting up with Spanish friends for the first time in four years, we found the music was a little too loud - however it has to be borne in mind that we are mature adults!
The food was great and the service excellent as with all the Gaucho restaurants but this one was just a little dark - could have done with a few more watts in the lights!!
Really nice restaurant, is suitable for groups, romantic dinners. Food was excellent - service was superb, ambience and decor ticks the romantic box but also for a group i'd definitely choose there
Previously, I've had a great experience at Gaucho. This last time, the service was disorganised and uncaring - and my steak was overdone.
Gaucho was wonderful - lovely atmostphere, knowledgable staff - brilliiant!
Gaucho-Piccadilly ..... Excellent place for entertaining clients.  Food was great, service impeccable - would definitely go back.
Great service, great food, great value

Food is OK. The ambience is a little bit over the top for what it is in reality a steak house. We had to wait 45 minutes for our table. The waiters need better training. Price vs food quality in a scale of 1 to 10 should be a five.
Absolutely Ghastly!
A very enjoyable business lunch. Tables a little close together.
Could not fault anything whatsoever.  The food was absolutely stunning.
Amazing! The workers are lovely and the food is delicious, I have even booked myself in for another time
Excellent quality of food and friendly service. Staff are very attentive.
Lovely environment, wonderful service, good choicedms

We had to wait 15-20 min to seat at the table we had already booked in advance.
Service was really bad and too long, waiters were aggressive.
Breakfast not served after 11:30am during the week-end is a shame... and it's also not very clear on the menu that the pancakes part is also concerned.

Lovely outside seating area with heaters and blankets on the chairs if required
Lovely food
Lovely pleasant helpful staff
Had a thoroughly enjoyable evening would highly recommend

This was my first visit to Bill's and I was pleasantly surprised given that it is a chain restaurant. The food was delicious and the service friendly (under difficult covid conditions). My one gripe is that I was knocked a few times by other diners getting past so maybe the tables are a little too close together in places.

Awful service waited 2.5 hours for food constantly asked where it was tables of 6 were getting their food before us even though we ordered an hour before them. Staff were rude could tell there was tension in the staff, heard them talking about eachother. Will not be going again. Food was cold and there was no point asking for it to be changed because it probably would‚Äôve taken another two hours!! WONT RECOMMEND
Food was excellent,  the waiter on the other hand was awful,  abrupt and verging on being condescending and rude
Great night out, food and service excellent. Would recommend!
A lovely brunch and we‚Äôll looked after by the team. Service was quick and food was delicious
One of the waiters was rude and gave attitude to us and table next to us
Amazing night, great DJ tunes in the background creating a great evening vibe. Super servi.ce and food great as always

Took 35 mins before we got a drink of any kind. Not offered any water at the table. Staff forgetful whenever we asked for anything. They just seemed run off their feet - pleasant but not attentive. Food was okay but really salty or as my partner said - good but tasted like it could have been out of a jar. Would go back to give it another chance as had a great meal there pre lockdown. Just feel like they need to sort their system out.
Very nice food, warms under terrace. Staff very welcoming and made sure we had everything we needed
Fabulous setting - lovely ambience - background music way too loud which meant that one had to shout across the table - which was a pity ...

Wide ranging menu - really is something for everyone - but you cannot beat the Shepherds Pie, it is delicious.  Good selection of wines and relaxing ambience, but 'buzzy'.  In the COVID-19 era even in late October the terrace with heaters was perfectly comfortable to spend a few hours at.  There isn't an Ivy I have visited that I didn't enjoy, but I do particularly like the Soho venue.
Overall a great experience from start to finish, very attentive staff and the food was amazing, the truffle mash I could eat by the bucket!!!! Will 100% be returning

I had my dog with me and they were very accommodating reserving a table in the terrace.
Service was great and so was the food.
Great touch with the little bottle of sanitiser for the table.
Thank you
Service a bit slow and food not hot enough
Nice place, good service and food a little too noisy

Enjoyed brunch very much and will be returning.
Excellent service and the food was very tasty.

The music completely spoilt our evening. We could hardly hear ourselves speak. It wasn‚Äôt even tuneful, just endless loud thumping. If we‚Äôd been told it was happening we‚Äôd have booked elsewhere. The food was good, service ok, but tho we asked for it to be turned down we were told that wasn‚Äôt possible.

Lovely atmosphere. Food was great..
Definitely go again
A Friday in December and it was pretty manic!  However the atmosphere was great and the food was extremely quick considering the amount of people there!
we came here for a special occasion and the staff could not have made more of a fuss of us, treated like royalty!
Breakfast was cooked and delivered very promptly and staff were very attentive
Couldn't fault food and service but the restaurant was unbearably hot - a fault with the a/c apparently.
Wrong wine delivered to us, service charge added but didn‚Äôt tell us.
Everything about The Ivy brasserie was amazing, that simple the food was delicious  and the place was gorgeous

It took over 30 mins for half the party to be served a drink, and when we did they got the wrong order. It was changed, but then we had to chase where the replacement was and they said they forgot to put it through the system. We were then charged for the wrong order (which we sent back). Not the service you‚Äôd normally expect at the ivy, and we were pre-theatre so we didn‚Äôt have lots of time to waste. We had a different server for everything which I think added to the confusion and slow service.
Lovely menu and food, and a great setting. However service could've been faster, considering it was a Tuesday evening and the restaurant was only half full.
had a most enjoyable lunch and will definitely go back

The service and food was excellent and it was nice that we were allowed to remain at our table for longer than 2 hrs. The staff remembered it was my birthday and brought out an extra desert for me which made me feel extra special. This was greatly appreciated.
Excellent meal. Love the 80s music. The nicest olives I have ever had!

I went here for brunch with three. The location and atmosphere are terrific. You certainly feel like you are in a nice place and it is perfect for a slow Sunday morning/afternoon meal. I found it at times difficult to understand what my party was saying though and the service sometimes took a little longer than we liked - forgetting to bring us sauces once as well. We would have liked a little more proactiveness on their part.

All in all, we would come again. It‚Äôs pricey, but the food is gorgeous and the drinks are fantastic.
Hip decor. Great food and service. The upstairs section is particularly loud but the ground level area is slightly quieter.
My food was good (from lunch 2 course) but my guest‚Äôs steak was slightly overdone. Service a little slow (intended on a quick lunch but took 1.5 hours completing). Lovely place but busy lunchtimes.

Not the greatest. Noisy. Poor service, we were often forgotten, drinks.  Given wrong food. Food ok but pretty basic. Drink menu (beer) etc incredibly limited. Dark. Noisy and our table was too close to the bar. The reception/cloakroom was a shambles.
Food was good, waitress helpful, seemed under staffed. The girl at reception had a really poor attitude.
Been here a few times, and although not what you would expect from many of the Ivy chain, it never fails to disappoint.
Great evening at Soho Ivy Brasserie, always packed and a lot of fun with great service and attentive wait staff.

Ivy Brasserie(s) are always a good spot for a nice dinner although we were disappointed to be asked to move to the bar when we had already order our desserts and final drinks for the night.  Would have been nice to be told before ordering if we needed to move!

Lovely atmosphere. The wrong meal was brought to us and they remade the correct meal so we were both eating at the same time. This was great to fix the mistake. However, service continued to be slow: waiting ages for drinks and missed sauce for the meal (the second time the meal arrived). Lots of staff on -  almost too many as it was often different staff each time at our table and therefore there was lack of communication for orders. At the end of the night we were still charged service charge when the meal itself had been disjointed with mistakes and continual long waits. Very surprised the bill did not reflect the fact that we had to wait for our meals to be remade, an offering for a round of complementary drinks would have been nice considering the price for the meal there as a whole.
Great time at the Ivy. Good food and good service - will be returning!

Lovely restaurant fantastic staff waiter was outstanding but oh dear...the noise..it was very busy so the conversation levels were high which is fine but can't see the need for a DJ blasting out loud tuneless NOISE..really bad music found it hard to chat and it spoiled the evening come on it's a lovely restaurant ..sack the DJ
Been three times in a week but this time the service was appalling - so much so we had to leave the table to get our own wine.

Overpriced, overinflated, oversold, overly full of people full of themselves, the only thing that is not full is your belly. The food is nice, of course, but there is not enough to feed a man especially when paying a main ¬£17.

It's not a place I would go back to.

I went to the restaurant with my mum who is very specific where she eats as she wants to feel comfortable - the Soho Ivy was great!
I went on a Friday night the DJ music did make conversation hard but still a good restaurant
Fantastic! Best restaurang I‚Äôve visited in London.
All good apart from the coffee arriving before the desserts

A good venue for a Valentine's night, even if it was awful weather. A good feel about the place with the lighting and pictures making it cosy. Service was really nice with a lovely lady being cheery and helpful. A minor bit of carelessness by one of the managers did not dull the evening particularly, but merely shows how one takes good, pleasant service for granted when it happens.
Very nice food, and wine which was not one of the most expensive all made for a lovely night.

Lovely evening. Our waiter David was excellent.
Only downfall was I requested a booth table and a birthday plate. And I had to remind them about the birthday plate.
We were also sat on a 2 seater table and not a booth and there was plenty more nicer tables vacant
Thank you for a pleasant evening. My partner fully enjoyed his evening and the Happy birthday cake was just perfect! Definitely recommending to our friends and family
The staff were great and the food was outstanding. All four of us really enjoyed it and we will definitely be going back.

New and brilliant
By far the nicest ambiance in Soho.
Great staff. Good food - done well. Sunday brunch was straightforward but a good variety.

I have been to other branches before and I had a great experience but sadly I was very disappointed with this visit.
Food and service was very good but let down by manageress who informed us in very abrupt manner that we have only ten minutes to order dessert pay and leave the table.
I do understand this if restaurant is very busy and people waiting for the table but it was a Monday night and there were plenty empty tables.
It was a shame that our lovely night come to abrupt end and we had to leave and have dessert and more drinks in another place.

Arrived a few minutes early to be greeted by a rude man on reception. Should have left at this point.
Lovely waiter but he got the order wrong.
Someone else gave us dessert menus and didn't come back for an order so I got up and chased it.
Restaurant was dead too......
Asked for bill and came in seconds!
Food was great but this is no "Ivy".

Super cute restaurant with great decoration and ambiance. However, the food was relatively bland and the eggs were off. All 5 members of our party ordered a breakfast dish with eggs and all agreed the flavor was off. Maybe if we had ordered something else we would have liked the food better.
Had a great meal, food was delicious! The atmosphere is artsy cool, lots of fun!
Although we had a lovely lunch, which was also very good value, we are unlikely to return again for food. We have been to The original Ivy on a couple of occasions and grately prefer that restaurant.

I booked this restaurant for my Masters graduation and my family was flying in from the States. We got seated immediately at the 'best table in the house'. Everything was timely, our server was attentive but not overbearing, and the food was DELICIOUS. Not to mention the vibe of the restaurant was incredible. It was a 'happening scene' without the posh price tag. We could have stayed all evening if possible! We recommend 10/10
Delightful evening. Good food and wine. Service excellent.  Light background music not too loud so one could speak.
Great food and service
Excellent restaurant with great service. However pricy for a Chinese restaurant in Soho. ¬£50 for set lunch per person no alcohol is a little high.

Came for a night out with friends to celebrate their engagement. Had to wait for 40mins for the table. Didn‚Äôt receive any prior phone calls or text messages from the restaurant. We were starving by the time when we finally got in. Have waited for another 20mins for someone to bring a glass of water. Understand that the restaurant is busy but don‚Äôt expect that is the service to be Michelin 1 star standard.
I loved the dining experience and would love to visit here again

Yauatcha soho is one of my favourite places to eat when I go to London. The food is outstanding, service is great and they don‚Äôt keep you waiting too long. I‚Äôm vegan And my family are meat eaters and never disappoints.
Well executed dim sum but not notably better than their sister restaurant Duck + Rice and considerably more expensive. At the price they are charging I would like to see a bit more wow factor.

Service was friendly as usual however the kitchen was behind. I had finished my entree before anybody noticed the chef forgot my dim sum. I had to take away the dim sum and dessert as it took so long. Probably understaffed for the lunchtime rush but then why have so many covers? Doing a good job under the circumstances but the number of covers was clearly a strain.

I wasn‚Äôt aware that they would take 50¬£ per person prepayment for a set valentine menu charge.  Set menu was an option and we didn‚Äôt request  for it at booking or any other time. We didn‚Äôt eat the full amount and they let us take away pastries using the balance amount of about 50¬£.   I thought it was rude to charge us the set menu pricing upon booking.

Poor value for money. The scallop dumplings were good, but all of the other dishes we had were extremely greasy - the broccoli so much so that we couldn‚Äôt eat it. Overall the food was ok, but certainly not worth the prices charged. The ambience of the restaurant was great, informal and friendly. The tables and chairs were uncomfortably low, even for me someone of my height (5 feet 4 inches).  I wouldn‚Äôt return.
Awesome food and great vibe. Definitely worth trying for those who hasn‚Äôt .
It s always good but unfortunatly the staff have changed. Nobody Come for give you your coat  when you go on.

Not usually a restaurant I would get to but glad my client suggested it as the food was outstanding and wish I had tried more options. I found it pretty expensive but it is London so not surprising. Would definitely go back for a special occasion. Thanks for having me
A brilliant night out in a stylish restaurant. The food was absolutely superb. We went for dishes we had never tried before, and were not disappointed. Tasty, sophisticated. Definitely coming again
The rib eye stir fry was good, the seafood mix was good as well, the Singaporean noodles was a NO. Very busy, receptionist was very welcoming, waiter was O.K.
Food was so tasty and we'll presented, staff attentive and very polite.  Atmosphere in restaurant very relaxed.

Amazing - we went to Yauatcha Soho before going to Phantom of the Opera, celebrating our wedding anniversary and the experience was fantastic.
Thank you to all the staff

Great stuff!!! Service is amazing! The tea and desert are above excellent! Prefer Hakkasan food by a milestone though, but their deserts are great enough to turn a non sweet tooth person in love‚ù§Ô∏è
Amazing dim-sum! Great stop for theater goers. Very hip and chic decor

that was my third time in this place. I used To eat dim sum and the exp√©rience was great.  this time I opted for th√© 48Gbp menu. there were √† lot of dishes even too much we had  6 diff√©rent dim sum the 4 first were exceptional the 2 mars ordinaire.then an excellent duck salad and after  that many fried stuff not really interestig  and vert heavy To digest.  the dessert looked good but was not my Paris Brest was dry and didn t taste pralin√©..so at the end we felt fat and lighter of 160 for 2.  it is also very noisy.  disappointing! go there for cocktails ans dim sum but forget about the menu.

Just one staff gets order I assume otherwise I just needed to keep asking to other staffs if I may order, like for 30 mins or so.
Music was ok but the level was quite high. The staff who gets order and serves and explain should have had louder voice than music, she was not obviously. I couldn‚Äôt hear when she was explaining or giving me informations of food.
Food was quite salty(for me).
Tables(in downstairs) are quite small and the gap between tables is horribly narrow so the lady who was next to me(next table) touched my table with her hips. Really hard to stand up and pass the gap.

My favourite restaurant in London by far!

The staff are extremely attentive and friendly and the food is amazing! Honestly, the best Dim Sum I've ever eaten! I've been 4 times in less than 1 year and intend on coming back every month!

Everyone who works there is very educated on the ingredients as well, so they will always be able to answer any questions you have. I'm Vegan and they always know exactly what I can and can't eat (There are loads of options no matter what your diet is)

Thank you for always making sure we have a great experience at your restaurant and I'll see you in a few weeks time! :)

Lia x

This place was TERRIBLE! It came highly recommended, and I adore fancy Chinese food, but to me, everything was gummy feeling and tasted pretty much the same. The chairs were uncomfortable, the service was slow and inattentive. I never really knew who to ask for anything. It was never clear who my server was. I did a sake trio, and the only roughy two. To the restaurants credit, the did take the sake and the dessert off my bill. I would personally never go back.
Great place to enjoy good chinse food  the best in London
Everything was perfect as always- love the Prawn and Bean Curd Chung fun, the crispy duck rolls , and the Dim Sum of course

As usual, fabulous dim sum. The service was discreet and efficient. I went for pre shopping lunch with teenage daughter. The place is consistently good and the ambience relaxing and calm (unlike many other soho Chinese restaurants).
Waiter did not seem very happy to look after us. Reservations have me wrong information. Sorted out in the end but was uncalled for.

Good food quality. The set menu is a bit too big and by the time you reach the Duck you can't eat it. Better to order some courses and decide if you want more.

Very nice attentive service.
comme d¬¥habitude un diner  fantastique ! Des plats succilent  et  bonne ambiance .
Have yet to try your restaurant in Waikiki, so I thought to make it special with your Soho location.

The staff serving on the day (Yeon) was excellent. He was pleasant, attentive and gave good recommendation for food. However I was disappointed with the 'manager' (man in suit). He was not attentive. Perhaps it was a bad day for him.
As usual the venison puff is light and delicious. I was very impressed by the prawn and beancurd cheung fun. The thin rice pasta wrapping round a layer of crispy beancurd with well cooked prawns in the centre is a highly technical task to achieve. The plate was finished by Yeon carefully pouring the sauce round the cheung fun without drowning them. It was excellent!
