Restaurant was a bit noisy but the food was amazing!! We had all of Alexander's (our server) suggestions and none disappointed us. Would go back in a heart beat.

Fantastic food, very tasty and high quality.
Great atmosphere all around. Thank you
Will be back for sure!
I love this place. Always deliver the most amazing food, good wine and great service.

Lovely food - felt quite rushed even though we had the table for two hours. You do have someone coming round with a notepad every 10 minutes checking where you are at with your meal. Although you are not disturbed can be quite off putting!

Dim sum is very good , it's not cheap ,we didn't have a very nice table upstairs cause it's had a bad draft .
Staff are very nice , but they where just too busy to give good service
Tasty food although a bit costly
A beautiful restaurant with great food. Can really taste the freshness and flavour of the ingredients. Worth splashing out for a special treat.

Very loud.
To quick tempo between courses. Hard to hear what we got, and too much. We could have reveived better advice for choosing. And last. Personally i prefer to see less skin of waitress body for serving.
It is my fourth, but probably last time.

As someone who likes eating dim sum, it is safe to say that the dim sum here is something special. Along with the fantastic food, the atmosphere was great and the waitress was very attentive. I've already booked to go back!
Good quality food. Special occasion dim sum with high quality ingredients.

Service was awful and slow... and as a result they needed the table back (yes, another one of those apparently in demand places that table turns!) before we could have another drink and dessert after our meal. Instead we got shafted upstairs to the bar, where we had to order our drink and dessert all over again. It seems like the staff here are pretentious and arrogant - attitudes which I feel are unjustified as the food was actually also sub-par and the ambience was pretty much non-existent. For these reasons, we refused to pay service charge, which I have never done before! If you want good dim sum, go to Chinatown or Royal China!

I visited after finding some great recommendations online.
I bought along two work colleagues with me and we had some amazing food.
The Dim Sum is the best I have ever had and the desserts were absolutely awesome

I recommend this to anyone who wants some great food in a funky and unpretentious atmosphere

I will defiantly be going again

The food was absolutely lovely, really exceeded our expectations - delicate dim sum and good recommendations from our waiter. Service, whilst friendly and enthusiastic, was a little slow at times due to it being absolutely packed out - always a good sign.

Was looking forward to a good catch up with my friend but due to the fact the seating was very close together and the sheer volume of people in, the noise levels were quite high, which affected our experience a little bit.

Gorgeous little find in Central London though, from the aquarium set into the bar to the flickering candle light, and would definitely try it again - perhaps not on a Friday night, and seated less centrally. A nice place for a celebration, there were several going on - and child friendly.

This place is an absolute favourite for us as well as the children. Great ambience especially downstairs, impeccable service, delicious food and a wonderful cocktail list. Have never been able to find fault with it. The children never want to go anywhere else!
Delicious food as always.  Went on Saturday afternoon as a birthday treat.  Was quite touristy though.

Me and my friends had wonderful pre dinner dim sum here, first we want to have the afternoon tea dim sum offer but we were late. But, the staffs still manage to get us table even-though we were 1 hour late.
They have many varies dim sum and the taste was super. would like to come here again for afternoon tea dim sum and would like to try the pastry and the macaroon.

My girlfriend and I had a wonderful meal at Yauatcha. We tend to eat out at decent restaurants often so are able to measure this well against the rest.

The food was really good, service for a Michelin starred restaurant was slightly disappointing and I would have expected better than wooden chopsticks.

Would definitely go again - lots more to try on the menu.

Heard a lot of good things about this restaurant however, I hate to say it none of them were true. There waiter was not good, he took the order for my friends however, had I not pointed out I still hadn't ordered I would still be waiting now. Very expensive for a tiny amount of food which was tasteless and dry. I would not recommend this restaurant

Yauatcha is excellent.  The food, ambience and service are all outstanding.  When booking, I had read some adverse reviews about the service, but was impressed by the friendly and attentive service throughout.  Nor was it intrusive at any point.  I really cannot find fault with the experience, though I would love it to be less expensive.  It is a case of you get what you pay for.
Nice food and many choices. Dim sum was excellent. Desserts very good as well. Only downside we were sitting on the basement and the smell from the kicthen was very strong.

Fabulous food, service and surroundings. Our waiter, AJ, was friendly, knowledgeable and made excellent suggestions for things to try. He recommended the prawn cheng fun and the king crab and they were amazing. Every dish was cooked prefectly and presented beautifully. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this restaurant for dim sum or any of their cusine. The restaurant had a really good vibe even when busy. I will definitely be going back. Thanks.

Arrived 5 minutes early and made to wait outside in high winds and rain !
Went down hill after that.......
Awful people and average experience

Never again !

Yauatcha always has fantastic quality food. The service was very good, bar a couple of mistakes, and the waiter sang my wife a happy birthday. The main thing to improve is the atmosphere, as the music can be too loud and too club-like, not quite matching its ultra modern interior. All the dim sum is excellent as usual, although the noodle dish we had was nothing to be excited about, quite simple without any different flavours. Stick to dim sum. Finally, we have always wished the seatin was less crowded. Check our the afternoon set menu for excellent value for money. We will be coming may times in future, and always recommend it to friends.
I recommend this restaurant for lunch.
Like always, the food is excellent, the service very good and the atmosphere vibrant and fun. Great evening out though slightly expensive.
The best Cantonese afternoon tea I have ever had in London! Great food and good service with reasonable prices!
Food is amazing each time - look forward to my next visit.
Would like to the GM , Abhishake, for taking great care of us.

Yauatcha was a good choice for some great food. The venison puffs were one of the nicest things that I have eaten in a while. The only disappointment was that the restaurant wouldn't allow us to change the dressing (not even the whole dish!) on one of the courses in the set menu due to a nut allergy, meaning we had to order a la carte. Good food, good wine and OK service for the evening. A little on the pricey side, but no real complaints!
Absolutely great Asian food. Wide choice. Nice athmosphere. Good service.
Food is lovely but I can get similar tasting food at other lower priced restuarants.
Went for my girlfriends birthday, was absolutely class and the cocktails were great too. Shared the 2 person dim sum menu for ¬£40 each. Well worth it, a lot of food and a lot of variety. was great.

The dim sum was outstanding. The ingredients were fresh and the variety was great. We asked the waitress to create our menu and she gave us a great mix. The restaurant itself is very modern and attractive - particularly the lighting and aquarium. This was my first visit and I will definitely return.
Excellent and varied Dim Sums. High level of Service.
Really pleasantly surprised with the food at Robata! The sushi was so tasty, as were the bao buns! Will be back again

Lovely summer eatery.  Came for a birthday dinner with a friend. Sat in the gazebo outside it was lovely. Service was superb, staff very friendly and nice.  The manager was lovely too. Food is delicious. Sushi was great and you have to try the bao buns and truffle fries.  Next time want to try the skewers too!
My favourite restaurant in London. The food is always so delicious and never disappoints! Great cocktails too

Very poor value, even with the eat out to help out discount. Food was average, portions were small and the squid was chewy and too salty. Restaurant itself had no personality and it had a very pretentious vibe. Wouldn‚Äôt recommend.
Brilliant service all round. Saw that the table I had was near a loud group and offered to move. Outstanding food. Thank you.
But only for pre-theatre menu. Is rather pricey, and portions very small.

Food is ok, but not a typical japanese robata in terms of menu.  Service was fine though not very attentive.  We had to ask 2x for our bill.  Overall it's good, but not a destination and a bit overpriced for what they are serving.
Nice environment, friendly waiters, drinks could be improved.

We travelled from Bristol to celebrate my fianc√©‚Äôs 40th birthday and booked a table at the Old Compton Brasserie. We were instantly excited by the atmosphere and energy of the place, the staff were so accommodating. The food was delicious and the drinks just as good. We can‚Äôt wait to go back again
Great place to socialize in Soho. Food is probably one of the best in Soho. Great and friendly staff as well

Food was lovely and they kindly accommodated me with my vegetarian request even though it wasn‚Äôt part of the deal. Table next to us was very noisy and rowdy but it‚Äôs not the venues job to teach people manners. Will be back soon
Service is always amazing! Will def be retuning for the 4th time soon!

Love this place, the staff are really great, our main waitress was amazing !! At the time we were being partly looked after by a lovely young girl who was training, Who did great btw.. but she just needed to keep an eye on her social distancing... a little bit too close At times.. and a few times I saw staff taking pictures of tables using their phones, normally not a problem but just made me feel a little bit anxious as to wether hands were sanitised Properly after etc, when dealing With other tables.. but over all great time, set menu was a 10/10 COOKED PERFECTLY ! Maybe more vegan options on the set menu.. thanks guys X
We had a great Saturday brunch, lots of fun, great atmosphere and entertainment!

Very poor vegan selection, could have done better. Otherwise good service and value for money, great atmosphere though music a little on the loud side. Would recommend either for a couple or group of friends.

Lovely meal that would have benefited from a little attention to detail from the waiting staff. Forgotten sides that turned up after the main course being the main issue. Silly things that could have been so easily avoided. Aside of that tasty food and drink l.
Great as always!

The perfect Brasserie...great ambience, friendly fun service and a varied menu.
I had the burger which was excellent and my friend had the Ham (Bacon Chop) Egg & Chips.
Only downside was the fact I was facing the stunning mirrored back wall ...as it was quite bright making it hard to see my dining partner.
Very relaxed, wonderful food and exceptional service.

This was a part of the 'soft opening' process so the menu was restricted and as we ate post 8pm our first choice starters had run out.
The atmosphere was good as was food quality. There was a 20 minute wait for cocktails, other than that service was very good without being intrusive.


Our table was not as well lit as others, something one of the staff acknowledged and is already planned to be fixed.
We will go back in the next few months to see how things have settled down.
Great family meal.
We enjoy the pre theatre menu here. It is very good value for money. The restaurant setting is beautiful and the staff are great.
Zedel is a great place which I have been to often.  I now avoid the set menu and enjoy the experience even more.  It is rather noisy but the overall experience is good.

The server was very attentive and informative. The food was lovely. But I am afraid I have give the lower rating because of the poor locations of tables we were offered. Using Open Table to make a reservation far in advance, I would have expected the restaurant would reserve a good table for our party of four, perhaps even a banquet booth. But unfortunately, they showed us to the table right next to the kitchen/clearing station where the traffic from wait staff and noise from the staff gathering glassware and cutlery, clearing plates made it impossible to be heard. I asked for another table and they offered another table but it was effectively the second worst table, next to the stage where the piano player was playing. Thankfully, he stopped playing about ten minutes into our meal and we were able to enjoy conversation the rest of the meal.

Really, this is not the first time I have used Open Table and been offered the worst table in a restaurant. I don't know if I will use the app going forward if this is the treatment we will get as a matter of course.
A favourite! This place is glamorous and great value
Amazing Location with great 1920s Ambiente. Very attentive and friendly staff as well. Was a fantastic evening for us - a couple from Austria.

The staff made us very welcome and even though we did not have time for dessert came with a macaron on a plate with chocolate writing saying "Happy 20th Anniversay" in French. We made it in time for Champagne at the theatre before the musical.

Amazing
Found
Ambience
Service
best restaurant in London by far! best restaurant in London by far!

Good food, nice atmosphere. Great cocktails. Felt the lighting could be a little better as in less bright it‚Äôs a bit too bright. Good service we had a lot of food so wasn‚Äôt too expensive for what we had.
Top notch ambience, service, food, wine selections - all-in-all an excellent find and, it having been my first time, I expect it now to be far from the last.

Wonderful ambience -- vintage glamour meets contemporary function. Staff was efficient and friendly -- upon informing them that we had a show to get to, they were very accommodating of our time preferences. Would definitely recommend!

I come here a lot as service is always top notch , food reliable and wide range of wines available by the glass / pichet at vary reasonable price.  Other restaurants cpould learn a good lesson from Zedel's

Despite asking not to be moved off our table as long as we were continuing to purchase food and drink (as it was a business meal) we were asked to move out of the restaurant at 0830 pm.  Last time we use Zedel for such an event
Great experience again as this is our second dinner at this restaurant. Great service, food and all at a very reasonable price. Well done to Brasserie Zedel

A lovely surprise to find such a varied range of options in a very elegant Art Deco setting. Lovely menu options, food was delicious and surprisingly affordable. Staff were  well trained and mostly very polite staff  which helps make the experience very pleasant.

Fantastic food and even a separate vegetarian menu for my partner. Very pleasantly surprised. Each course as delicious as the last and even better with the gorgeous wine we chose. Busy brasserie ambience surrounded by a beautiful decor. Staff service attentive but not intrusive. Finally, do NOT overlook the bread and butter provided. Freshly baked, it is truly to die for. Incroyable. Nous allons revenir!

I've been here for both dinner and for a business lunch. LOVE the space; it is an authentic French  fine bistro. The people I dined with really enjoyed their food. I'm vegetarian and found the menu a bit lacking in choices, but my complaint lies with the mixed green salad -- it looks like it came out of a salad bag from the grocery store and some bits still needed to be trimmed (they had stems on!). I sent back the salad in one case, but the replacement didn't look too great. For the prices, they should take better care.

This is an unusual and interesting  restaurant. Located deep underneath Piccadilly Circus in what must have been a ballroom of a hotel previously, it is enormous with very ornate decor. The food is French with an Austrian twist and is rich but very tasty. Would definitely visit again.
the service was nice, good and fast but the food wasn't good enough. we took the cod and it was far too salty, the vegetables poor and dry... (except for the desserts: especially the cr√®me br√ªl√©e)
Make sure you book, very hard to get in without a reservation & it can be a little chaotic when busy. Great food & good value wine list.

I keep going back to Zedel, again and again. It is perfect for lunch and for pre-theatre, I love the old-fashioned French menu, executed with style and panache. Great service - very efficient and non fussy, and even the tunes the pianist chose to play added to the ambiance. Faultless.

Second visit in 5 days and this time the food was just as good as previous and I didn't get stung by the wine bill!
Excellent service, atmosphere and food.

I have given a five star rating for outstanding performance in value, ambience, service, food and the overall experience of dining at Z√©del, and every one of them is deserved. Friends only recently introduced me to Z√©del, about which I had heard mixed opinions, but I would have awarded five outstandings for that evening, too. So, it struck me as the perfect post-Lion King restaurant for dinner with my 17-year old grandson. We both enjoyed our three courses, Jack the parfait de foie de volaille, champagne chicken and a lemon tart, while I chose endive and Roquefort salad, duck and vanilla slice. All the staff were delightful, looking after us beautifully, which enhanced an already smashing evening, so smiles earn a sixth outstanding.

A brasserie/restaurant with real style, excellent menu, well discharged. At such reasonable prices, I know of no other in London and, since the fall of the ¬£, Paris equivalents would be prohibitive. .
The whole ambience was amazing. Walking down the stairs to wonderland. Food are french bistro type. All the mains we have are satisfying good.
Authentic French brasserie. Very good value, particularly for its location. Will definitely go back!
Great value, excellent food and a relaxed atmosphere. There really isn't much of a reason not to go. It may not be the best restaurant in the world, but for what it aims to be , this place is great,

This was my first visit to Brasserie Zedel. The service was extremely good, the food good. My companion is vegetarian, and the options are not great for a non-meat eater. Overall, a nice experience and since the location is very convenient for me I am sure I will be back.
Good food and not too expensive, but nothing special. On a par with the Wolesely but not as good as the Delauney

This was 2nd time that I dined at Brasserie Zedel.The reception staff were very helpful to acomodate 4 of us to the table earlyer than we had booked.The restaurant was packed and very buzz atomosphere at the Thursday night.Our waiters were charming and we had totally enjoyable time.my friends were surprised at how reasonably priced the restaurant was.
Everything was spot on
Lovely time - food snd service amazing big! Only downside was very noisy coukd have done without the music being so loud.

Cakes & Bubbles is such a wonderful experience. The staff are excellent, knowledgeable and without fuss. The sweet treats are a wonderful, mind expanding experience filled with so many delicate techniques and knowledge but without being over-empowering or intimidating. Our 10 year old found it slightly challenging but that was because everything isn't as it seems! Our 13 year old found it exciting and thoroughly enjoyed this special treat. One not to be missed!
We visited Cakes&Bubbles with our friend. From the begging to end everything was perfect. Perfect food, perfect service. We will visit again for sure!
Ausgefallene Desserts, die ein Wiederkommen leicht machen

Excellent afternoon at cakes and bubbles, of course you have to try the signiture cheesecake. I personally found this a little too heavy personally and it got a bit sickly towards the end. In my opinion if they advised it is heavy then we could have ordered one to share. But other than that it is a delicious cheesecake that is worth trying at least once. After all they have only recently opened. The hot chocolate they make is honestly one of the best I have ever had. The new York cheesecake is also faultless. I look foward to returning for the air pancake soon. Thanks cakes and bubbles!

Was just OK nothing special which i thought it would be. there are a lot of better places to go and better value in the immediate area. probably wouldn‚Äôt go back. Not very good value for money. Wine was very expensive

Great food. Lovely staff. First day back eating inside since lockdown & they were well prepared!  Good value for money - Tuna tartare to start was exceptional.  Waitresses were attentive & welcoming.  Definitely recommend & will be visiting again.
It‚Äôs was amazing
Thank you so much to the staff taking care of our table, you guys were awesome! So pleased we chose this restaurant, this is a new one to add to the favourites list.

Table for 6 at last minute on a Friday. Very friendly atmosphere, attentive staff. Excellent food, good sized portions - salads enormous.
Only niggle is that the Spanish red shouldn't have been included in the Cote du Rhone section the wine list.

Decidedly average.

Started off with promise, lovely smiley host. Buzzy atmosphere, nice decor. Unfortunately little down hill from there.

Table was right by the door, so I felt like I was in a through fare.

Waitress seemed to want us out from the get go asking if we had decided as soon as she turned from the hostess stand to grab the water jug to fill out water glasses. Hadn‚Äôt even had tome to look at the menu titles.

After that service was slow. My friend managed to get half the way through her Sunday roast before the horseradish she asked for appeared.

Veg on both dishes was delicious, but both the cod & the beef average. Friend said the Yorkshire pudding was underwhelming.

Unlikely to recommend or return, unless you have children, when so many great places nearby, especially for Sunday lunch when there is a Hawksmoor nearly next door.

Children‚Äôs offering was so good, as evidenced by the lady on the next table who ignored her son the whole time in favour of her phone who could fret not, as he was throughly entertained by what looked like a fantastic kids treat box included- so much so neither of the pair seemed to notice he was uncomfortably close to my friend as we tried to catch up.

The Heddon Street Kitchen manages to balance quality without being pretentious! The food standard is good with a varied menu and wine list. The staff are  extremely pleasant and interact well to add to the enjoyment. Would recommend!

My family and I traveled from the states and wanted to visit a GR restaurant. The Confit Duck leg was delicious. The best dish of all was the sticky toffee pudding! It has a great atmosphere and you can create your own budget. Some entrees are around 20 pounds while others are 40+. The only complaint is the lack of beer choices.
The service is really good. Food is awesome and the atmosphere of the restaurant is vibrant, giving a nice feeling to hang out for more drinks!!!

Not quite on par

Having eaten at other Ramsay establishments including Petrus we thought we'd give this one a try pre theatre. Firstly, I should say the level of service is excellent and a tribute to Gordon - staff were polite, gracious and friendly.

My partner had a red pepper and tomato soup that was rather good and I chose the Beef Carpaccio with Barigoule vegetables, quail egg and horseradish - this was a wonderful dish so I was quietly excited about the mains - I should say that starters such as this are easy to get right so it is not an indication of what will follow!

My partner chose the battered cod, chips and peas which was reasonably good. I chose Cornish Cod filet, crushed potatoes, capers, brown shrimps and butter sauce. What I received was cod filet on crushed potatoes with an insipid parsley sauce! Worse still was the fact that it was too salty overall and there were dense patches of saltiness that made my tongue curl! Unusually, I didn't complain because we were pressed for time but I would have expected more.

I wanted to rate this establishment 'good' as opposed to 'very good' because of the errors on the mains but the site doesn't allow this category. Perhaps we were unlucky on this occasion?

We went for the pre-theatre set dinner which was good value. The food was ok, but nothing amazing. I thought the pan fried hake was cooked very well but the sauce was so salty. They charged for a couple of bottles of water even though we thought we had been drinking tap water.  But all in all, the atmosphere was nice and it filled up quite quickly. We stayed for 3.5 hours and wasn't hassled.

We had a booking at 6.30pm on a Saturday and were shown to our table straight away...after perusing the menu for around 15 minutes we were told there was no rump steak and only large 1kg cuts of ribeye and porterhouse steaks left of the ¬£10 per 100g options... I decided on the fillet steak which was ever so slightly overcooked for medium rare how I asked for it however the food was great especially the spicy tuna tartare... was it value for money... sadly no...and the service very attentive...I would agree with other reviews that the music is very loud and you end up shouting at each other to have a conversation and as the tables are quite close together you can hear what other people are saying cause they too are shouting to be heard... all in all a nice experience though

everytime i come to London i dine in one or more GR restaurants. as i did this time. Petrus was as good as ever. however Heddon was extremely dissapointing. service , welcoming, ambiance was good. however the food was inconsistant, running between ok and un edible, with the second being the most. we had the worst wellington ever. served in a wooden plate which didnt look too clean, or was that the darkness of the restaurant?. anyway it was served cold, with cold plates accompaning it, while the little juices were absorbed by the wood (who serves wellington on wood?), and the thick t jelly sauce arriving later, not before we asked. it was thinly sliced, disintagrated and unedible. the manager was very attentive and polite. wanted to compensate us, however we didnt want compensation, we wanted good food. i especially was embaressed since i recommanded the place to the group that was with me.
there were issues with the rest of the food as well, such as cold hard french fries , but nothing as bad as the wellington. the place can ruin the whole GR establishment's reputation if something wont be done urgently with the kitchen.

Have been there 3 times now since it opened, all three occasions for lunch, and has always been satisfactory, congratulations on the Italian manager who is very knowledgeable in wines and has a very friendly attitude.
The food was delicious! Din not expect to get another dessert from the restaurant as they apologise for their late service of dessert. Would definitely recommend people to visit this restaurant

This was my second visit at Heddon Street Kitchen and the food did not disappoint except for the fact that it was not the food we wanted.  Several options on the menu were not available, including the filet and (of course) the Chateaubriand, pork appetizer, etc. In addition, we had to select wine three times as the chosen bottles were not available, including one of only four reds available by the glass, for which they did not even have the decency of at least offering a replacement option to all guests, leaving no full bodied red on the by-the-glass list.  We selected four appetizers and two of the four main courses showed up first before any of the appetizers.  When the proper time for the main courses arrived, the earlier returned two mains were MIA and had to be waited on for a few minutes.  While the manager came to apologize later and graciously offered a plate of desserts (which we would not have ordered as we were not in the mood for dessert any longer, therefore giving us something we were not that excited about), the experience was way below expectations, and we felt the compensation was not in line with the multiple mishaps throughout the evening.
Sommelier was excellent  food and decor excellent. Menu what you'd expect from a Ramsay

Waiting for the next new restaurant he'll open in London...
Super creative dishes, delicate, beutiful and as always, in all his rstaurants - fantastic taste.

Great food, nice employees with knowledge! Entourage very nice.
Have to go there if you like outstanding food!

Great location, nice surroundings and a big name behind it. Unfortunately it fell short on many factors...making it a potential future "Miss" for me?

- Service: The service was average (I felt like our meals were literally thrown down at us).
- Food: After being told that 3 of the "choice" main options were not available due to a busy lunch, I was instantly deflated. Whilst my Tuna Tartar was good, my main (steak) was average. Dessert was better (Chocolate Fondant was very good). Overall, the food was ok but certainly nothing special for the price.
- Wine: Sommelier was not particularly good at her job. Suggesting a wine that was completely inappropriate and not at all what I had asked for. I sent it back.
-Ambience: lovely surroundings and not too loud. Good option for business meetings.

To be fair, I would give it another chance as it is still very new (only open 2 weeks I think?) but it would need to seriously lift its game for me to make it part of my more regular consideration set.
Really intimate setting that focuses on good quality food and wine. Would highly recommend.
Amazing food, calm and cosy atmosphere and lovely staff. Will be back!

Happy with the dining experience, but when I turned up my booking had not been received - the head waiter took a screen grab of the booking on my phone, as he said this had happened before.  Please check this out before someone is disappointed and cross!
It's a rustic venue and quiet compact.  The food and service were good but have been to better.
lovely people - very helpful with our limited time available but service location ambiance were excellent, food was lovely, with good wine selection. Will go back for sure.
Pleasant atmosphere, clean, attentive staff and delicious fresh authentic food - I would recommend it

Had a great time. Lovely service and ambience, and interesting flavours. Everyone loved their meals. Delicious food but portions were on the small side.

The cocktails were lovely but quite small considering the price. Would definitely return.

amazing service, great atmosphere - staff answered any questions to a great length, i was served the wrong drink but the waiter immediately fixed the issue. you could tell the staff enjoyed their job and serving customers. we dined using the eat out to help out deal and it was well worth the money and i would not feel begrudged paying full price.

My first time and here and, apart from the awful Christmassy music played a bit too loud, it was an exceptional dinner: packed with unusual tasty surprises. Nice vibe and very politie and pleasant service. I'll definitely go again, though might sit away from the speakers! Btw, don't let that put you off - it was, all round, very good indeed.
Food was just ok, and the service was all over the place.  Disappointed as the last time we were there it was really great.
This place is great, the environment was calm and service was on point. I highly recommend the Korean fried chicken, Jap chae, dumplings and the special fries! Definitely returning back for more!

Great food. Great service. Great location.
We will definitely come again.

My wife and I had our first Korean meal at this restaurant to celebrate our wedding anniversary. Didn‚Äôt know what to expect but the food was outstanding and we came out full converts. The staff were very helpful in explaining the menu and the ‚Äúform‚Äù and overall it rounded off our very special day. We will certainly be back.

It's definitely the best Korean restaurant ive been too. Had an assortment of starters and one main, they were all very tasty.
So tasty in fact I'm going back for more in a few days.
As always, food was terrific, ambiance and atmosphere wonderful. Service and support staff always helpful and on top of everything.

Very disappointed.
The food was way too salty (Japchae), the rice was hard pretty quickly.
The waiter we had was extremely unpleasant.
Only the ambience was nice thanks to its location.
Would definitely not recommend.

Slightly disappointed because of the cold basement location of our table. However, it warmed up again when more people arrived. The food tasted great, but have to admit this was my first visit to a Korean restaurant so I'm no expert.
Great meal with friends was had at JinJuu. The food was really tasty and our lovely server Robert was the best! Thank you!

I had a girly dinner here last week and had booked ahead having searched online for a restaurant near Oxford Circus. It was perfect for our needs and I was blown away by the service, all the staff did an amazing job and I felt like I was in a 5 star mega expensive restaurant, in fact (although it was 5 star) it was extremely reasonable (we paid ¬£30 each for starter, Mains and non alcoholic cocktails) Korean food is delicious and I hadn't really experienced if before, presentation was beautiful! I have already recommended to a few friends who are now going to visit and I will be back
Thanks

Had a birthday meal here - was keen to try as had seen Judy on lots of TV cookery programmes of late - was slightly worried as some of the reviews had talked about unhealthy fat food but this just wasn't the case. We had a large selection of dishes and all were superb - was not sure what Korean food would entail but very tasty and we would go back - the additional surprise was that it was amazingly good value!!!  For 4 people, 2 bottles of decent red wine and plenty of food at a restaurant of this quality to come in under ¬£200 in my mind is excellent.
Great atmosphere and great food. Staff were very attentive

Food was amazing as ever. The food was quick once ordered but the server was super rushed off his feet so was hard to catch him at times. The manager kept extending the table which was nice but he kept saying it so much like he was doing me a favour not which annoyed me a little.

Serving sizes are a joke - you better have eaten already

Service very slow and inattentive

Great atmosphere, incredibly tasty food, wonderful staff and lovely cocktails/wine selection! Had a lovely time eating here and will definitely be back. Some of the food is a bit more on the expensive side but they definitely made up for it with the flavour! They also play music quite loudly so it might not be suitable for people who prefer a quieter evening - however, I personally enjoyed their music choices and the young, energetic vibe.
The food smelt nasty. Served me the wrong steak . Over priced. Limited menu. However they didn‚Äôt make us pay when we declined the meal because of how disappointed we were.

First impression is great , good music and great atmosphere BUT then the mains ( 3 different kind of steaks) arrived and what a big disappointment.. the Rib Eye and the Porterhouse arrived COLD and the Wagyu beef was absolutely burned ( we ordered medium) .
Waitress took the 2 cold steak to warm in the oven but that didn‚Äôt do justice to the meet and it was without flavor already.
Wagyu was replaced to other and this time arrived not cocked inside .
We didn‚Äôt wanted to complain again and just skip the desert and went .
To be fair we haven‚Äôt got charged for the Wagyu as one of the waitresses so our disappointment.
In my opinion it think that having so many waitresses serving the same table i think we had more then 5 so no one really responsable to bring you the dishes and the dishes waiting to long from the time they cocked to the table .
Such a shame as we had so high expectations from this place .
Hope management will read this and will approve as its a really a great place to spend a nice evening..
Some of the best food ever but my goodness it gets loud, I would also advise booking in advance a little bit as the late tables are awful, probably better at the bar
We had a lovely time. Service was slow but the food made up for it

We sat at the open kitchen and watched as the chefs carved huge hunks of beef as though it was butter.  We had a selection of dishes - all were superb.  Wonderful theatre and atmosphere - an absolutely fabulous experience.
Whilst the fire pit is extremely impressive, the atmosphere was good and service very friendly, the food was disappointingly average despite a great looking menu.
If you want something different Great flavours & fabulous service x

Booked a table 6 weeks before for a special occasion. The waitress gave us a counter seat only, close to where they serve the food. As we didn‚Äôt want this and my girlfriend was pregnant, we asked for a table instead. We were told that we could have one but needed to leave in an hour. We decided to leave, the waitress didn‚Äôt seem to care and didn‚Äôt apologise. Laughably bad service, I couldn‚Äôt believe it. It‚Äôs a shame because the food is good, but I‚Äôm not going there again out of principal.

I have been to Temper before and had good service and food. It took 40 minutes to get served ( even though we had pre booked and had a time of 11/2 before table would need to be vacated). The land was so fatty and this time the potato dish was rather stolid and bland.
Dissapointing when compared to previous visits.

music was awful and way too loud - we had to shout to hear each other. when we asked to turn it down we were told it was not possible.
service was also super slow - drinks came after food arrived.
plates took forever to clear.
Lives up to the hype with great sounding and then equally great tasting food. Buzzy atmosphere but not so bad you can‚Äôt talk...get a booth...and our waitress was just lovely

Amazing food and service. The wine list is also exceptional! We paid an average of ¬£50 per person with two bottles of wines and also shared two desserts. Would definitely recommend and looking forward to trying the menu in their City branch.
You must try the Smoked Goat! We would go back for just that dish alone, time and time again! Amazing!

Great atmosphere and sense of theatre sat at the bar watching the chefs work over the open flames. Food was good, nice concept, however the food was overpriced for what it was. Would recommend to others but wouldn‚Äôt revisit as there are so many other restaurant in London to try out that would offer something more interesting and better value for money
Worst service I've had in a long, long time. Too loud to have a conversation. Food was below average and music too loud to actually have a group conversation. Would not recommend.

Overall very good experience, good food and greatly helpful and friendly staff. A very nice place, super lively on a Saturday evening. Only downside, I find the dishes slightly overpriced for their size.
Great sharing food - a must for meat lovers. Great atmosphere.
Amazing place and really good food! I highly recommend it!

Fantastic service and delicious dessert but underwhelmed by the food.
My partner and I love barbecue food and visited famous London hotspots as well as many traditional Turkish and South American cafes offering this type of food. We enjoyed the restaurant but were disappointed with the meat which tasted like a regular roast meat. The flavours of smoke and coals were not there at all which is disappointing and very surprising, almost bizarre.
The sides lacked wow factor and were fairly small.
We enjoyed a delicious dessert and were taken care of very well by the staff.
Had a great meal with friends - casual environment and the friendliest staff (with great wine recommendations). Would recommend it to friends
We had an amazing time at temper, the food was some of the best we have ever had, with excellent cocktails and top notch service as well! We'll definitely be back!

Buzzing basement which doesn't feel even slightly oppressive. Centre of the well designed large room is the open plan kitchen with wood burning ovens for the roasted delicious meats and stools all around which enhances the fun mood. Simple, well executed menu, tasty starters to fill your 3 small tacos and a choice of 6 roasted meats with interesting sides. Good value, good service...fun, and great 80's music. great place to go with mates for delicious roast.
overall very good but really need to work on the service, especially the junior waiters.
I thought it was quite nice, service was slow though. I thought the vegan üå± Astra dish was pretty great though!
It took a while to get served but the staff were lovely and the food is delicious and good value.

Perfect place for a date night! The staff was lovely the food was even better. There was a lot of people there and we had to wait 10 minutes before taking a seat, we however received complimentary drinks for the delay. Very nice experience.

Excellent will definitely be returning.
Food and staff fantastic

I'll definitely be going back next time I'm in  London! Delicious food, fabulous service and a lovely buzzing atmosphere. Totally loved my meal!!! Started with the mussels and had the lamb for main. Superb!!!!
Love this dog friendly restaurant in the middle of town. Me and my pup were made to feel very welcome.
Excellent staff, attentive, good value, chicken liver reminded me of my mom and grandma‚Äôs cooking I had to ask for extra bread to mop that gravy. Hearty meal , I will be back!!!
Really great buzzy atmosphere. Food was very tasty and service good. Busy, but overall really good.
Great food and great service! I have a number of food allergies and they were very accommodating!

I went for dinner the week before Christmas with some girlfriends. The atmosphere was relaxed and fun, the staff were exceptionally welcoming.  Our table wasn't available when we arrived and they took the trouble to make our  time stood at the bar (in a somewhat crowded spot) easier, taking our bags and coats out of the way.  The food is good and right for the price.  Our bill was  ¬£37 per head for prosecco, starter, main, wine and tea/coffee.  A complimentary limoncello (always welcome!) was given too.  A great place to go for a casual bite to eat with friends.
Super affordable Italian in central London - good food and ideally located for pre/post theatre dining. Quite small but a nice atmosphere and we had a lovely evening!
Fantastic meal in this really friendly restaurant. Brilliant value, great ambience, lovely food. Will definitely be back

food is quite good, very slow service, waited for 20 min for taking orders, and another 30 for our starters to arrive. (we were there around 3pm, not peak hour). nevertheless, the menu options are pretty good , and the food is tasty. small portion, but i still think its good value, 2 courses for 10.90.
Nice meal, good choice and served hot. Only criticism was the service was a little slow.

We visited Forty Dean Street just before Christmas for a quick lunch, unfortunately it was anything but! We waited over 45 minutes for our main although to be fair to the waiting staff they were very apologetic. Having only an hour for my lunch made this was a very stressful experience so only visit if you're not in any rush.

The food was fine and okay for the price.
12.5% service charge although discretionary is considered excessive.
Nice restaurant, very nice waiting staff, food was nice, but not incredible.
40 Dean Street, London, was lovely. Attentive service without being over-bearing, and great food (so much so that we both had 3 courses!).

Forty Dean Street. The perfect after theatre dining place. We were welcome warmly table ready in a nice cosy spot. The staff are very good even when my mother decided to change her order. The food was excellent and we had a mixture of set menu and main menu. The choice on the set menu was more than I expected. So we look forward to visiting again very soon
Food and cocktails were all delicious and beautifully presented, fast service and good value for money. Highly recommended!
Everything was amazing and fresh. Waitstaff was very attentive and accommodating.
Sushi was good as always. Great place to go if you are in central London.
My favourite sushi place in London. Great sushi, professional service and amazing desserts!

Very Tasty - freshly cooked food - particularly recommend the sashimi.
helpful and friendly service
Good quality sushi in a small but bustling environment and quick service.

Incredibly easy place, with a good value for money. Location was sensational, and a relly simple style made the difference.
Sushi is superb, from the miso soup to the innovative uramakis, and good variety of wine.

We had to book an early reservation as that was the only time left and from arriving we had our waiter hovering around us the whole time. The food was very yummy and had a delicious cocktail. But when we tried to order some further food we got told we only had twenty minutes at our table left and whilst eating dessert ,the bill just got put on the table. They said they had a couple waiting yet there were other tables free and we hadn't even been in for the full two hours before being asked to leave! Kind of ruined the whole experience for us.

The food is a bit disappointing. The chef has no idea on flavours from Herbs or Ingredients. If you add seasames to scallops sashimi, the sweetness from the scallops is completely destroyed. It is the same case for adding fish caviar to yellowtail, adding mayonnaise to sushi. It is a waste.

Food was great however they can not accommodate for any allergies or intolerances as they ‚Äúlike to serve the dishes as is‚Äù which is surprising given that everything is made fresh & basically in front of you - they would definitely be able to accommodate however just refuse to. Other than that the tables are slightly too small for the amount of food on the table! But the food and waitress were amazing.
Lovely food, small restaurant in good location. Not amazing  vibe but pretty decent. Recommended for a business lunch.

We chose to eat sushi before heading to the theatre. We had sashimi and nigiri salmon and tune and also some maki rolls (not on the menu).

Tuna in particular was excellent and salmon very good.
Engawa never disappoints!
I've eaten at Engawa twice now and the tasting menu is delicious.  The Wagyu beef is authentic and melt in your mouth. Worth the expense.

The sashimi and sushi was delicious!! There were 2 choices for the Kobe Beef, my husband had the marbled cut which I found quite chewy but I had the other cut which was delicious. The service was excellent and the staff explained each dish to us. It was my brothers Birthday so they brought the desert out on a lovely platter and had written Happy Birthday in green tea chocolate, lovely touch!
Always a pleasure, I love this place!
Amazing food served by attentive and charming staff. Felt very well looked after and made our celebration all the more special. So glad I took up my brothers recommendation and will return!

Food was delicious and the service outstanding
Lots of free tables but took us to a table at the back by the kitchens not ideal so we moved
Exquisite.  Every time.  Every location. Don‚Äôt understand the negatives.

The food was very good here; fresh and well prepared. Very good Mediterranean fare.
UNfortunately, we booked under the London Festival menu and the staff and managers knew nothing of the menu and event!! We got the pre-theatre menu instead which was different to the Festival menu. Shame, I was looking forward to some grilled octopus on the Festival menu!
The staff did their best to rectify the situation and was not their fault. Management's fault.
Great food. Enough said.

If you are going for a pre theatre menu, like we tried, just forget it. I was really looking forward to visiting this place, arrived on time, never seen such an over-staffed restaurant in my life! At the end, I had two seriously delayed meals and storm out without a dessert from a 25% occupied place! Not impressed and rather disappointed.
It is very good restaurant with friendly staff and tasty food of  high quality food.  The greek cuisine is here and the hreek products.

A tourist restaurant masquerading as fine dining. Gimmicky - 'heres the squid you are about to eat', 'let me put some thyme leaves in the oil for your bread' Food is ok cooked, its extortionately expensive - if you want to charge ¬£100/ head without wine it has to be fantastic. Its very average. Strongly advise would be customers to make the 10 min extra walk down to Piccadily and the Wolseley. This is another Gaucho, and will probably go bust in a similar way for similar reasons.
Wonderful spot...everything was perfect for a wonderful birthday celebration. Food was amazing and service was exceptional

Top quality food and service in a beautiful space.

A taste of summer in the middle of winter.
Was underimpressed by almost all aspects- poor service, expensive, poor wine list and fish in salt crust was not as tasty as other restaurants and served cold.
It's great and the staffs are friendly. The food is tasty and the I had the best lobster pasta.
Great, fresh Greek food.  The service is amazing.  In addition, very good location and spectacular ambiance.
Fried calamari and the milos special are not to be missed. The greek salad is amazing. And from the desserts i'd recommend the loukoumades.
Good service / Decent food / Good selection of drinks

Great place - food was fab and great atmosphere.

Service a little slow - maybe a little more attention to detail would be good.
The food was exceptionally good.  Thoroughly enjoyed. Would love to go again.
We had the ladies who lunch menu - 3 courses with a cocktail.  The food was simply delicious.  Service was superior.  Ambience lovely.  Just a fantastic experience.

Absolutely love this food. Delightful meal with exceptional Service.
We had the tasting menu with the premium wine flight which was delicious and expertly described by Pravin.
Can‚Äôt wait to try Atul‚Äôs new Restaurant.

A first visit to a much recommended restaurant will, definitely, not be the last.
From a charming welcome - after a traumatic drive from South West London encountering a plethora of road closures and highway repairs - the attention received from a well informed staff was second to none!
The food and ambience was first class.
All in all, having chosen a central London Venue to meet up with friends visiting from the Channel Islands, we were, all, enchanted with the experience.
Thank you Kanishka.
Celebrated my wife‚Äôs birthday here, delicious food and great service.
Good food, service on the slower side. Starters and dessert excellent.
Good size portions for sharing and very reasonable. Our vegetarian had lots of nice thins to eat

Everything was actually great. However a 1.5 hour slot to eat is wet rushed. Obviously it‚Äôs a difficult time to everyone however give the prices the least amount of time should have been 2 hours per table.
The food was tasty however it did come out cold which did ruin it slightly. The staff was very attentive though and there was a great atmosphere.

Great tapas and lobster rice was fresh and delicious!
Reasonably priced menu.
Excellent food, great service and really good table. The chef even took us through some of the dishes prior to having them made. Would highly recommend this place.
Lovely restaurant with fantastic food. It is pricey but totally worth the $$$!

5pm reservation on Valentine's Day and the place was buzzing! The staff were extremely pleasant especially the guy working upstairs (sorry we didn't get your name) who clocked that my husband was gluten intolerant and checked a few items for us. He was very helpful and friendly.
The food was fresh and tasty. The wine is a tad expensive but we drank a very good red for ¬£28 which was one of the cheapest.
Yes, the tables are close together but it didn't seem to matter - it just added to the atmosphere. We were intrigued with the guy sat at the table next to us paying his Valentine's date the best compliments!
Overall a great start before we went to the theatre.
Love it every time, food is really tasty and the atmosphere is good too
Fantastic food and great staff/service!   I‚Äôd recommend strongly.  Best meal we had in London by far
Food was lovely, staff were great, and we loved the atmosphere
It was a very nice place, quirky and in the heart of soho. a bit pricey but very nice food.
Staff and Service was fantastic very friendly and personable made the occasion very special.
In true tapas style, the menu is full of little dishes to share. All your traditional favourites and some not so traditional to give the menu a bit of a difference. All were tasty!

Aside from neither of us liking our starters of pate (had a slightly weird taste) the main courses were outstanding and the portions very generous. The set menu provides great value and the staff did offer to replace the starters. I wouldn't hesitate to go back, it's a great restaurant, lovely food and drinks choices. The tablets are spaced far apart so it's ideal if looking for something centrally located with good social distancing measures. I can't wait to return.
Beautiful setting , classic pan-European cuisine ( portions more generous than expected !), great vibe

A very enjoyable evening on Christmas Eve, a strangely quiet night in central London! Food was excellent, well presented and perfectly cooked and the service was efficient in the calm, quiet way that demonstrates good management. A tad on the expensive side for me, but I am a northerner and still resent London prices even after living down here for years! Overall, a real treat, we‚Äôll be back.
Good ambience, good food and the set menu is very good value. I would come back for more.

NYE dining..very nice menu!
Wonderful live music !
Fun evening.......
Really enjoyed the food and the wine.  The service was very good
Great time as always food was spot on... its the only perfect atmosphere for a date!

Very nice and the place is amazing
Very cosy
We got some free champagne!

Have been here on a number of occasions but this time bit disappointed with the service. They were busy but when we sat down we said that we had to be gone in a hour. There were only two pool servicing they looked to be struggling for such abyss place to give the normal stars and we get here.

It won't stop us going back as it a hiccup we think.

I had brunch at Refuel with a gf and it was lovely - the venue is colourful and quirky and fabulous, and the food delicious. I had the salmon with avocado, chilli and poached egg - delicious but the portion should be much bigger for the price! I would definitely return though, great place for brunching and lunching!

Have eaten at Refuel before and not been disappointed. It was a busy Friday evening when we arrived so atmosphere was buzzy but not too loud that we couldn't have a conversation. My colleague was cold due to a draft from the front door however, the staff quickly found us a more comfortable table. We both ordered tuna with plum salsa, spinach and fries. Our tuna was delicious but luke warm. Staff said this was due to it being cooked medium/rare and that the salsa on top bought the temperature down. However, they did provide us with another 'hot' tuna with the salsa in a side dish. The meal was delicious and the staff very attentive and accommodating of our needs. Will defiantly return.

This was a Birthday treat for my partner and we experienced attentive service from friendly staff. Smart, cosy ambience. Food was tasty and good value with the 3 course and bellini offer. Wines a little pricey.
At the end of the meal waiter brought out a complimentary plate of choclate with candle and 'Happy Birthday' message which I hadn't asked for.
We had the set menu - excellent value at ¬£24 with a glass of wine. Limited choice as expected but our meals were delicious. Service was excellent. Would definitely go again.

We met early for a delicious cocktail in the bar area, which was very busy which we took to be a good sign. The toptable deal was outstanding value - there was only a choice of house red or white, and the set menu offer a choice of 3 options per course. There was also an option to add another course for an extra ¬£3, or 2 extra glasses of wine for ¬£10 which still represented a saving on the house which was around ¬£7 a glass. We both had the shallot and goats cheese tart which was great, and then the sea bream - if you're hungry I'd recommend getting a side order of potatoes as it only came with a spinach, orange and fennel salad. The staff were very friendly and attentive, and the restaurant full and lively.

On the strength of other reviews my husband and I had the pre-theatre meal before went to the opera. Part of any pre-theatre package should be decent service so you get out in time to get to the theatre. Service was slow and just plain weird. My husband had to wait for a glass of wine until he was almost done with his main and only received it because he complained to the hostess. The main pasta was greasy and bland... cheap ready made pasta (the actual noodle) though it was cooked al dente. I could go on but you get the the idea.

I brought along 2 of my friends visiting from Manchester and they thoroughly enjoyed the lunch. An excellent choice and , at ¬£17.95 for 3 courses, it was exceptional value for money. Put into the mix funky elegant surroundings and the opportunity to star spot, it was an experience that I would be happy to repeat!
Food was absolutely lovely and set menu we got with the offer was very good with a choice of dishes. Atmosphere also very good.

fantastic meal at Refuel in the Soho Hotel London, staff very helpfull and friendly, surroundings lovely. Best meal we had in London. Would definately go back in fact would encourage us to book into the hotel aswell.

I have been to Refuel a number of times over the past few years, and this visit was one of the best.  They have just introduced a new Toptable set menu, which was varied and ofered choices for even the most fussy eater in our party.  The Beetroot carpaccio with pine nuts and parmesan was divine and worth trying.  Service is always good, but there was a new manager and some new faces on the wiating team, all of whom were delightful.  On the Toptable deal, Refuel really can;t be beaten for value.
Refuel hasa good vibe and the food was overall good - great location

Excellent desert with the pancakes but the mains were pretty standard fare, well cooked but not very inspiring.

very expensive wine list

We had a fantastic girly dinner at Refuel in the Soho Hotel. The waiters took great care of us (although one did describe the soup as 'watery' which was a bit off-putting). Lobster chilli bisque to start and my bavette steak was fantastic. Everyone enjoyed the mini ice-cream palate cleansers! Beware the pricey wine list although the meal deal was great value - well worth it.

Refuel - The Soho Hotel, 4 Richmond Mews,
Love this place. Very trendy with great service and food. Amazing deals like the 3 courses with proseco.
Excellent food and service at both bar and restaurant.

We went to Refuel on a rainy Tues night. The room decor is cool/hip and lived up to reviews. Service unrushed. Food was tasty but nothing outstanding - the TT offer made it worthwhile. Go for the lively atmosphere, even midweek.
Very friendly service and the toptable deal was good value. Its a great venue with a buzzy atmosphere. Would definitely go again.

Refuel @ The Soho Hotel
Very good offer from TT for lunch at 3 courses for ¬£22.50 with glass of wine.
Good choices for all 3 courses, food was reasonable,rather bland taste for the chicken dish.Ambience was great, fairly busy on a Monday .Would not hesitate to go again and try another dish for the offer.
Really lovely atmosphere and friendly, welcoming staff. Menu was full of choice. Can‚Äôt recommend the French Onion soup enough!
Great food, friendly service, relaxed atmosphere. Simple and very enjoyable- will definitely return.
Great food and a typically French bistro ambience!
Wonderful french cuisine, definitely love it! Would like to come again!
Another great meal and service. Georgia and Yasin are consummate hosts.
Good food and amazing choice and value when having the set menu.

There were some very very noisy diners in and we could not hear what we were trying to say to each other.  As the alcohol flowed so the decibels increased.  Ruined our reunion lunch.  Food and staff brilliant as ever.  Very sad.
Always been the best bisrot type restaurant in Soho.  Get there soon!! üòÄ
Food and service very good as usual. Excellent choice for pre or post theatre meal.

Was sat downstairs which felt like a spare room next to the kitchen but couldn't fault the food. Good portions and everything had lots of flavour.  Everyone enjoyed what they had ordered and there was enough choice on the menu to please all four of us. The service was a bit slow but other than that it was a lovely evening. Would definitely recommend (but sit upstairs)

We arrived at 7.45 as arranged. The staff member who greeted us said very little, didn't smile,
and left the menus along with the wine list. He returned after about 15 minutes, and we told him which bottle of wine we wanted, and ordered our meal at the same time.
When he returned with the wine he didn't show me the label to ensure it was the correct one, he just opened the bottle and proceeded to pour wine into both glasses without asking if we wished to taste it first. We didn't get a smile out of the guy all night.

Although the food was fair, it was the really slow service that was also a let-down.
As always, very enjoyable but it does get noisy. Good wine and good food, and overall pleasant service.

First of all they tried to squeeze what was meant to be 6 people on a very small table. Luckily one guests pulled out last minute and we could create a decent space to dine. Sec badly the service was ridiculously slow, we had a 3 course meal and it took 3 hours!!! Arrived at 7.15 and left at 10.15pm. The food was really bad, I‚Äôve been to Pierre Victoire quite a few times and it‚Äôs simple but satisfying normally. This time not only I found a hair in my food, the quality and presentation was so disappointing I was embarrassed for proposing this restaurant to my group of friends. What happened?!?
Not to speak about the over cooked awful risotto.
Very unlucky
Interesting menu of french classics at a reasonable price
I took a cordon blue chef with me and they said how good it was. Really nice food and good value
Great friendly service tasty food will come back for sure

The restaurant was very busy as you would expect the week before Christmas. I had booked a table and whilst we didn't get our table straight away we had to wait 20 min's we were offered a seat and a drink. The service we received was brilliant and the food was served quickly and was of excellent quality
Fantastic restaurant, I can't recommend it enough. Great food, great wine and excellent value
This is a lovely little restaurant with very friendly staff and an excellent set lunch menu. The food was outstanding for the price (c¬£20/head inc wine) and I will certainly be going back there.

Shared an early dinner on a Friday evening.  Booked beforehand, so no problems finding a table.  The restaurant has too many tables, it would benefit from removing at least one, maybe two.  We felt a bit jammed in between two tables.  A very noisy place, we couldn't hear ourselves speak across the table.  Food was very good, but portion sizes disappointing.  Our main courses arrived at different times after the waiting staff tried to deliver them to a different table.  Staff are friendly, but a bit disorganised.  I would go again, but probably not on a Friday evening.
The pianist makes the whole experience rather special, celebrated birthday meal here.  Food excellent.

My boyfriend and I booked our table on the morning of new year's eve. the restaurant was very busy but we only had to wait about 10 mins for our table. unfortunately, we were sat right next to the door which was cold and not very private, with other diners constantly walking in and out. This, however, is my  only criticism. the food was prompt and delicious: traditional, simple, french food made very well. The staff were welcoming and kind and the atmosphere was warm and high spirited.  A perfect end to 2014

This was a second meal in a month at Dean Street and both were most enjoyable. Very pleasant staff and relaxed style and, of course, excellent food. We frequently visited Pierre Victoire when it had a restaurant in Bath, many years ago, and loved the style. Dean Street has carried this on.

Food was great with a big menu and the bill was surprisingly low fir what we had. If anything we lacked space at our table as I am sure our table for eight was really a table for six. I will definitely go back though.

I went with my mother for a pre theatre dinner, we both thoroughly enjoyed our meals.
The main reason we tried here was because of the wine prices, which were very low for London.
The staff were sometimes unattentive as they were so busy (the restaurant was full!) but still managed to be accomodating.

I've only given it 4/5 due to the sometimes slow service, and that the food although tasty was unimaginative.

This place is truly good. The menu is extensive, both for the set lunch of 2 courses and the a la carte menu. The service is efficient and friendly and a sure sign of how good it is were the number of French people dining there. Would highly recommend.

Three Finns as guests, and their first visit to London. They were very impressed with this restaurant, one of our regular haunts. The chicken salad was very fresh, and got the thumbs-up from our youngest guest, twelve. Her uncle and grandmother both chose duck - a luxury dish in Finland, and were impressed both with it and the pak-choi on which it was served - a vegetable virtually unobtainable there. Our two bavette steaks were tasty, but the gravy was a little over-salted. Affrogato as a sweet was enjoyed by everyone.
I went there the 4th time with friends. This place never disappointed us. The lunch menus is only 9.9 for two courses. Super value for money

Arrived at the restaurant 15 minutes earlier, was told to come back at the booked time. When back at the restaurant I could see a table for 2 (ideal for me) being joined with another to accommodate a larger group (not booked) which made me wait longer and get a table in a much worse place. Food was good as usual but would have been nice to be at least thanked by staff especially after going to this place several times before... Next time I won't stay and ever go back as Soho is full of great restaurants (e.g. Dean Street Townhouse who treats loyal customers as kings).
service very good if not a little too keen to get on with it!! Think they like a turnround! Set menu very good and the main courses were really large. Very busy/buzzy and actually quite loud
Fantastic food. A real hidden Gem. Will definitely return
I went to Pierre Victoire in Dean Street Soho London with my girlfriend after a night at the theater. The service and the food were very good. The seabass was fantastic.I will return in the future .

Food and wine at Pierre Victoire Soho is good value and very good standard. I had coq au vin which was delicious. I prefer the sister restaurant Prix Fixe just down the street - the menus and prices are virtually identical, but waiting staff at PV are just a bit leobligingly create tables for incoming customers and the constant furniture moving doesn't improve the ambience. The set pre-7pm menu is great value but if you have a sweet tooth then bear in mind that the 2 courses are starter and main

Dined at Pierre Victoire on a Wednesday night with a friend. Apart from having to wait about 10 mins for our table we couldn't fault the experience. Starters (calamari and mussels) were good. My steak was average but my friend's duck was very good. Decent wine list at average prices. Staff were VERY busy throughout but remained helpful, attentive and courteous. A nice find if you want somewhere away from the usual tat of soho. Recommended.
Enjoyable meal at Pierre Victoire, Dean Street, London and free meal with reward points excellent value.

Overall, the food was nice (both reward menu and classic menu), although the dessert (crumble) was (too) sweet. However, "no comment" about the ambience - due to a party of 36 persons in this small restaurant that did not give a really good and peaceful environment (shame..!)
Another delicious meal at Pierre Victoire. Service was a bit all over the place, but to be expected on a very busy Friday evening. Hope to return again soon!

We had falafel and mussel for starter, these were fabulous. Main course bavette steak and swordfish steak were good and generous volume. 2 course set of French and drinks cost less than ¬£20, at such a centre location, we definitely come back!

This is an interesting restaurant. It's a shame that the facade faces the boarding of Crossrail works so the view is blocked. The mushrooms to start with were good, the fish excellent and my husband's pasta good. The only downside is the music is just too loud to have a conversation over  so my husband and I ate and left. For that reason, I'm afraid I wouldn't return. Otherwise a good restaurant.
Pierre Victoir Soho - a real treat. An adventurous menu at a bargain price. Unbelievable. The only criticism could be that the service while good was a little soulless.

Pierre Victoire Restaurant in Dean Street Soho is a great place to enjoy good quality food at modest prices, through in some live piano and you have all the ingredients for a great night out! I will be back soon.

We arrived after the theatre to an empty restaurant and were quite disappointed as it affected the atmosphere. However, we were made very welcome and enjoyed the wonderful Seafood Platter with a lovely Chablis.
We didn‚Äôt feel rushed and enjoyed the experience immensely.
Always a good experience. I have been going for many years and very happy to be going again.
Convenient for the theatre but otherwise acceptable. Cheerful staff

Another lovely meal chez FishWorks - exceptional service yesterday from Portuguese waiter.  Sea Bass was very tasty...although would say perhaps a minute less on the cooking it would have been even better.
I am a frequent guest at Fishworks, however the service was not as good as it used to be - unfriendly waiters.  The food was great but the overall experience was a bit compromised by this.
Excellent as always - a firm favourite for supper with friends
Location is great, but the food tasted blunt and the service was poor.

Good chain to have fish. There are enough good options, and it's reasonably priced. Unfortunately acoustics was not that good, and we were next to a table of drunken girls that were so loud that they completely spoiled the atmosphere.

Always good service and good food. Good option for lunch, not just filled up with business lunchers so for formal business I'd probably go for Bentleys next door but much better value for money for a casual lunch....

Nice place, fresh fish, delicious oystera and tuna. Bad service: They offer us take a table in the back, the excuse was that all free table were booked. It was 6pm, and We booked the table by the app 1 week before, so at the end after insist they let us take a nice table.
great food., lovely fresh fish, friendly efficient staff

Fishworks has very good choices of fish, excellent location, and is perfect for casual and formal business lunches.
with 30% off food, it is also very good value.

If you like seafood you will love this restaurant. The sea bass my wife and I had as a main was delicious as were the crab meat on toast / and whitebait starters.

Service was good.

Was a pre-theatre meal so could not choose all the specials but will go back again when time is not an issue.
Was very impressed with fantastic fish, service and great value with the 50% off but I would now go there without the discount too.
Food and service very good, but honestly I am starting been bored of missing things.. Two meals I chose and were run out. (not sure also that was connected with the 50% off offer :(, hopes not)
Plain and simple or something a little more fancy - Fishworks does it all.

very convenient for the Royal Academy and theatres  in Shaftesbury Avenue. Went on Friday lunchtime. Slow service,especially as we ordered before it got busy. The seafood starter was swamped in sauce. The fish stew was bland but the fritto misto was reasonable. All vegetables were extra. This would be an overpriced restaurant without the 50% offer.

What a lovely experience. The staff were very friendly, courteous and very kniwledgable. Our waiter bought us over a selection of fish from the fresh counter and we had the Monkfish which was lovely...A great restaurant with great staff

FishWorks @ Swallow street serves very good seafood in a nice ambience and with an excellent service. However, it is worth going if and only if you can benefit from the 50%-off offer: otherwise it is far too expensive (around 45 pounds per person for starter, main course, 1/4 bottle of wine and an espresso).
We have a loverly lunch the food was very good great value for money and 50% off made it better. Will be going back again.

Had a lovely dinner at Fishworks in Swallow Street. " courses but left feeling very full! I normally think Fishworks prices are over the top but the Toptable 50% off food offer makes it very reasonable. 2 x bottles of wine + 2 x starters + 2 x mains for ¬£70. The normal tables did not look great as they are quite close together but we had a booth and would recommend you request this for privacy and a bit more quiet. Staff were friendly, service a bit slow, food was nice.

Fish Works is a sophisticated fish restaurant where they know their stuff - although after the initial orders, the staff were not so attentive.  Fried squid starter is the best I've had (in multiple countries!!)
went for a dinner date there, had the platter for two which was really good and massive amount.  Waiter was very enthusiastic. wines were good too.
FishWorks - the food was great and the service was excellent. Nice atmosphere in the restaurant as well. Definitely recommend to seafood lovers!
Good place - some of the serving sizes left something to be desired though
Wine prices a bit high. Food & service good.

We ate at Fishworks on Swallow St using a TopTable 50% off Food voucher.  The restaurant has a great ambiance with the food to back it up.  Wine and extras are very reasonable.  Fresh fish cooked up from there was the highlight.  I recommend the Monk Fish.  Without the voucher it would have been too pricey so look out for deals.  Only criticism was the Lemon Tart base was burnt.  Overall, I would return and recommend others to try this place.

The music was too loud, the service was so poor (had to ask for service every time we needed it and were left sitting for around half an hour waiting for orders to be taken as a result - even for our pay to be taken after asking for the bill. Ruined the experience for me I am afraid to say). The pancetta in my carbonara in my carbonara was mostly fat and the pasta was undercooked. I felt it was very overpriced for what it was and my portion was tiny; I think an accident on the servers‚Äô part as we were eating individual meals rather than sharing. So sad as I really wanted to love it - great location and concept.

A lively restaurant, with good quality food but rather limited menu choice - particular if you need gluten free options.  We enjoyed our time here, but it wasn't quite what we were after on this particular evening.  This is a noisy and bustling restaurant, dark and small seating areas (we were seated in the back corner near the entrance to the washrooms).  On enquiring about gluten free options, I was told I could have a salad.....  According to hubby, the pizza was really tasty though and it looked great!  Drinks list was ok and service average.  Based on the location we thought the value for money was good.  We would probably return, but not when looking for a quite Italian meal with gluten free options :)

Too noise!!!!!
It‚Äôs not a restaurant is a bar with food.
If you want to party go for it.
If you are looking for a restaurant, DONT GO!
Food is good but the noise level with loud music doesn‚Äôt allow you to talk to the people in your party. Entrees and main dishes were brought to the table at the same time.
Fantastic food, will come back.

The restaurant is very nice and the food just to my taste. I got to eat something similar to romanian food, which was lovely. the staff is very friendly and nice. was great to speak romanian with a nice gentleman working there. Lovely place i am happy i went. totally recommend!

Excellent food taste, friendly staff, good menu
Service is patchy, courses served at different time, very noisy clientele
Fun place (although a bit noisy). Great decor. Delicious food and vodka. The waiter was fun and friendly but brought us the wrong main course....thus the 4 instead of 5 stars!

Decided to try this restaurant following a recommendation. Charming interior and service were accompanied by traditional Russian fayre with perhaps a little more panache. I had the special of barley and wild mushroom soup while my companion enjoyed the borscht. We tried eat stuffed buns and then the pelmeni. I felt the broth was a little too salty but it was full of flavour. The price without wine was very reasonable. Great experience.

Unfortunately, that was not a best choice. The main served on the small breakfast plates were not even hot.
There were three of us and nobody happy with a meal :( so we did not take a risk of having desserts there...
Not recommended at all.
Good selection of drinks for happy hour and great prices , very friendly staff
Amazing staff gorgeous food highly recommended 10/10
great place for brunch, wait for food was a bit longer than expected and service seemed a bit disorganised - but overall still a great experience
I love dining at Cafe Boheme and while eating outside is a slightly different experience, the food is absolutely just as delicious as it always has been.
Fantastic service and impeccable service. Thank you for a lovely evening!
Second time visiting here and would highly recommended it. Food, ambience and service were fantastic. My new favourite place when in London.
We had the pre-theatre menu and it was amazing value! House red is push too. Lovely service, great live music and an all round lovely time!
