Back here after a while, and it is still great! Brilliant food, fairly priced, superb drinks, but most of all, the atmosphere in this place is spot on.
My favourite place for drinks and dinner in London, and has been for quite a while.

The perfect place for pre-theatre drinks and bar snacks. Had Mini Angus beef burgers, chicken bites and big fries  between two of us and couldn‚Äôt finish the fries!! All delicious! Cocktails great too! Live music ( keyboard and clarinet/sax -great! Staff AMAZING!
Food was full of flavour, and the service was amazing. Staff were very attentive.
LOVE IT!! Always
Delicious food with unusual combinations. A real culinary delight. Will definitely be back. Every dish was outstanding.

Food was pretty good, we had 5 dishes between us which were all very tasty, the crackling spinach in particular. It's been tricky to get an evening booking here on a Friday so I booked weeks in advance for 6pm and as we were running a little late they reminded us we had the table until 7:30. We did finish by then but noticed there were quite a few tables empty by then which is a bit odd given the lack of availability online.

To start with I cannot fault the service. The waiter was really friendly, efficient and helpful - it‚Äôs the food that really let things down. Starters were fine. They were tasty and did what they said on the tin. The main courses were the real disappointment. The pasta dishes were incredibly bland and very very watery and the pizzas were bland and very doughy. Steak looked like it had been cooked in a fry pan. Overall, 7 fairly unfussy eaters left full but no one said their meal was good. The wines and the cocktails were very nice but ¬£17 for a glass of chianti classico is also a bit on the steep side.

Overall, I would say it‚Äôs a good place to go for a drink and some nibbles but don‚Äôt go for dinner. Italian is supposed to be simple food done really well. This was simple but not great.
I love Mele e Pere! I came to this restaurant twice last week as I love the location, food and atmosphere and the set menu deal is a bargain. Will definitely be going back!
Delicious food. Great ambiance. Authentic modern Italian food.  A tad on the expensive side but its not an everyday occasion.

We were there to celebrate our anniversary but disappointingly there were no special touches from the restaurant even though we'd mentioned that the reservation was for a special celebration. However, the food was delicious and lovely and my first try of vermouth was very positive.

Food was lovely. A couple of us had the ¬£20 menu, which was great value for money. The vegetarian options were limited but the meat and cheese was great. All presented well. Service was ok but a little slow and one of the waiters didn't understand when we asked for 'bread on the side'! But we then got free bread because of the slow service!
It was also a hot day and downstairs was really quite hot! It is a good fun place. The bar seat area looks fun if you just want nibbles and upstairs is lovely.

We thought the choice for a set menu was very ggood and the glass of prosecco was full! Our guest had a birthday which we did not know about when booking. Waitresses were excellent wishing  HB with the drink. and also putting a candle on the desert. The wine list had lots of choice. I had bought a group of Canadians here last year.

We visited Mele e Pere last weekend with friends and we were all really impressed with the restaurant. I struggled to choose as so many of the menu options were so appealing, and they also offered a great value offer menu with three courses for ¬£22.50 which is amazing value. All our meals were cooked to perfection and the ambience at the restaurant was very relaxed. I highly recommend this restaurant if you like honest, good Italian food at reasonable prices. The only small downside is we sometimes had to wait to get attention from the staff, but they were all very friendly and polite when we did.

Brilliant food and the staff were incredibly accommodating. It was quick without compromising on quality. Staff were incredibly friendly. Plenty of people to assist unlike most restaurants in the area. Can't wait to go back!

Overall we enjoyed a fun family dinner. The furniture is "mix and match" with varying table and chair seat heights so check to make sure the set up works for you. Food was good and portions generous. They missed a main course for our party which was unfortunate. Wine list interesting  but we had to switch white wine when they ran out. Staff were attentive and helpful and the manager apologised for the mistake. Atmosphere was lively and fun but not too loud.

I've never been before but booked a big table for dinner at my friend's hen party. It was a success. Sharing starters were on the table shortly after we arrived. We had a Saturday evening booked so it was busy and the atmosphere was great. The only thing, of course because it was busy, was that we had our starters before we even had a chance to order drinks and had to ask twice to order wine. But we were all very pleased with the food and the value! Thanks, will come again!
Second time I've eaten here over the last 2 weeks - last time was perfect and would have taken some beating, almost as good this time! Great menu choices.
The food is amazing, but it was very noisy on a Saturday night. Good for parties, but not for chatting/being romantic.

Its very cute that it is called Mele E Pere - Apples and Pears as it is cockney rhyming slang for 'Stairs' and this restaurant is basically a staircase and a few tables on the street level and the majority of the establishment is underground . Unfortunately i think the atmosphere is underground also and we had a table on the street level . The service was good but at times a bit distracting .The food was very tasty but small portions and some courses were a little garlic reliant for my taste . I think this place would be great for a business lunch or for groups . Its location was great for people watching in the streets of Soho - highlight of the meal was the Tiramisu which was frankly the best I have ever had it was absolutely gorgeous . I

Enjoyed a first visit to this restaurant - lively downstairs dining area with a happy mostly youthful clientele. Good atmosphere and service from friendly staff group. Probably too noisy and bustling for quiet one-to-ones or romantic nights out but plenty of West End buzz in the heart of Soho. Liked the fact that prosecco was served on tap in jugs and the brilliant window display upstairs!

A Soho surprise, especially because there are so many Italian options in this part of town. We opted for the lunch special at a bargain ¬£8.50 per dish and a delicious, generous portion of saffron risotto and a traditional meat lasagne was delivered, piping hot and with a smile. Good desserts and fabulous country wine list to choose from. We went early lunchtime and sat upstairs which was light and comfortable. Never went downstairs to view rest of space. Meanwhile, would highly recommend.

I had walked past Mele E Pere before and was intrigued by the colourful window display, which is presumably the intention. We decided to visit later on, and went for their set menu. This limits the choices obviously, but what we had was excellent. Great service too. But although the exterior is pretty, for dining I think I actually preferred the basement room - we ate on the benches upstairs. Thoroughly recommended.

This was my second visit to Mele e Pere, and once again I had a great evening. My friend and I ate off the TopTable 3 courses and a glass of wine for ¬£17.50, which is extremely good value. They were very accommodating with my gluten allergy, double checking everything was suitable with the chef, even offering alternatives if they were not 100% certain. The food was delicious, and overall we had a very enjoyable evening. My only criticism would be that it can get pretty noisy, but I suppose it adds to the feel of the place. I would definitely return again.

We could not stop laughing all night. It was more like a series of unfortunate events. We pointed to our table instead of shown we had to request to see a menu, our food took forever and to top it all off a waitress spilled a glass of rain water all over my partner and didn‚Äôt bring him any napkins or anything. It was fun but we would only return for drinks. The food was very over priced in comparison to what you actually got.
Amazing food, great atmosphere created by the staff members and other diners. I cannot recommend this place enough, fabulous experience well worth a visit

The place is ok, the tapas are delcious, the waiters are all super nice but overall its a bit too expensive at the end of the day for a simple tapas place! Only the beer is cheaper, everything else has the price of a restaurant and this is definitely not a restaurant. The small tables for 2 are very unconfortable especially next to the entrance and close to the tapas bar where there is insane movement all the time.
Very good food and a fun concept however slightly cheeky to add service charge despite being self service!

The staff were very welcoming and helpful.
There was a large variety of tapas to choose from - and they were very tasty. My only quibble is that many of the tapas were on ciabatta. I missed the kind of tapas I've had in Spain where bread wouldnt come into it much at all.

Food was superb, as were the staff. It's a great little venue and was perfect for our pre-theatre dinner. The tapas is changing with each refresh which is great. Because there's no waiting time, you wander straight up with your plate, it makes it all seem a little robotic - you can of course pace yourself but I think we were in and out in 35mins, which is fine for pre-theatre. Also you only get a table for 90mins, so if you wanted to enjoy the dinner as the feature of the evening, this is not the place. For pre-theatre food though, excellent.
Great atmosphere, tasty food, good value. Staff a little slow to get drinks, but otherwise no complaints.
Excellent food. Very expensive drinks.

Erg lekker eten maar te duur. Bij alle gerechten moeten aparte bijgerechten besteld worden. Bestel je alleen een tonijn dan krijg je ook alleen een tonijn, Niet juist gezien de toch al behoorlijke prijzen. Eten wordt erg snel geserveerd zodat je met drie gangen binnen 1.5 uur weer buiten staat. Wij aten in de kelder. Ik had het idee dat boven gezelliger was. Bediening prima in orde. Mooie wijnkaart.
The atmosphere is good, the team is excellent and the food is fresh and delicious. I do recommend Franco‚Äôs
Great food let down a bit by new staff member that was not as on the ball as they should've been...
Excellent welcome, service, food presentation and all-round experience.
Simply AMAZING
Great food, great service and very trendy
Lovely little restaurant, highly recommend the seabass main dish.
An outstanding venue. The staff do their absolute utmost to meet the needs of their clientele. A great place to do business or just relax!

franco's-Mayfair
Food was decent but they forgot one of the meals which was disapointing-it was removed from the bill

Franco's - London.

Great location, with a nice, buzzing atmosphere inside. Can get noisy due to the fairly small dining room. Friday's has a good jazz band downstairs.

Food is very well cooked and presented, and the waiters know which wine to recommend when asked.

Went to Franco's as wanted an up-market but informal for a business breakfast. Ambience, feel & atmosphere all good and would recommend on this basis. However, it's expensive. Small scrambled egg and (not much) salmon for ¬£8.50 and toast is extra at ¬£2.95 per 1¬Ω slices. The toast also came 2 mins after the egg, which had gone cold. Didn't appreciate my first glass of orange being half full either. Clients' fruit and greek yoghurt looked great and was excellent. So, good, but could do better.

Franco's was definately the right choice to take our group of 24nr client team.  You could not fault the service and we stayed on our table all evening, unlike some restuarnats who give you a 2 hour slot.  Very enjoyable for who attended.

Been there several times but last visit was disappointed. Menu changed. Duck breast was too hard to chew, sauce taste wrong and I requested with chips (so soft). If it is New Management, put more lamb, chicken and beef in menu than Vegetables,we came for French Cuisine.
Great spot in Soho, good value, great food. Nice vibes!
Pre-Ronnie Scott dinner.
2nd time coming here and just as good as the first! Would highly recommend

Really impressed with their pre theatre menu. We booked for a table of 6 and chose 2 courses each. Everyone thoroughly enjoyed their courses and there was a good range to choose from. The portions were sizeable... we were stuffed!
Good food, great value
We usually go to Pierre Victoire but tried this instead and were very pleased with everything.
Prompt , friendly service. Delicious food. Fixed price menu in the early evening makes this affordable.
We always come here for dinner when in Soho. Good standard of French food with great set menu deals. More deals before 6:30pm.
Second time here for a pre-matinee lunch Prix Fixe provides a great value lunch menu served efficiently with a smile. Loved the Tuna Carpaccio starter - just wished there was more of it!

We wanted a basic meal in Soho with no fuss and that was provided. Decent choice of dishes. Staff very friendly and helpful. Little waiting time so it fitted the bill. It was not fine dining but we were not looking for that. Good value for money.

I love Prix Fixe Brasserie and find it to be excellent value for the quality of food, choice and location. The set menus are fantastic value and I enjoyed the wine. It always seems busy and this creates a wonderful ambience: the noise and lighting are just right.

Food was of good quality and staff were attentive but our waitor could of been a little more friendlier. He seemed like he didn't want to be there. Wore his hair in a pony tail with a pen in it. Grumbled and never smiled.

We went again to Prix Fixe before a show and we can always rely on good quality food and a wide range of choices on their fixed price menu. It is always served efficiently but not in a rush so that we have time to enjoy the food before walking to the Theatre. Highly recommended for a pre Theatre meal

Our third time at Prix Fixe in Dean Street, Soho, and the food and service was as good as ever...and amazing value for money. A range of interesting starters was followed by very good pork chop and confit of duck leg. Desserts are particularly tasty. We will return!

We selected the two course special and there was a good selection to choose from. Service and dinner was very good and would recommend a visit, we would certainly go back. Sauces to our meals were very tasty!

Prix Fixe is one of the most friendly and best value restaurants in soho.  The staff were really excellent the service was more than you could ask for.  The ambiance was perfect for a friday night out with friends and the food was not only well priced but really really good and tasty.  Would highly recommend and I'll certainly be going again.
Fabulous service, food and value - will be back!!
Warm and friendly welcome, great service and food. I can highly recommend it!
We went to the Prix Fixe Brasserie last night, food was good service was good but not much atmosphere. It was a pleasant pre theatre meal.
Almost a treat and superb value. Love it.
It was a very pleasant meal.

Prix Fixe Brasserie, London

We had a very nice evening at Prix Fixe, nice quality food in a nice and cosy atmosphere and very friendly staff. I was impressed by this place, good quality/decent food for reasonable price which is rare for London. I would highly recommend the calamari as a starter.

If I had to find a downside it would be the noise. It is a small place and can get noisy but it is a small price to pay. Come late, say at 9:30 pm if you want a more quiet evening.
Goof
Good food, decor not amazing, service OK
Our recommendation for great steak and frites, everytime.

Despite booking our table wasnt ready and there was nowhere to wait so we had to go away and come back half an hour later. The waiter got our starter wrong so had to wait while another came. My friend had fish and chips that was so raw n the middle that it was inedible and had to be sent back. I had pancakes with spinach and ricotta which were 'ok' but there was so much cheese that it was too rich to eat. They did send bottle of wine by way of apology but overall quite disappointing

Great!
Wonderful food and seevice
Delicious food! Simple yet well done! Great classic British food with flare
Fantastic resteraunt  in the heart of Soho. Great atmosphere but very busy would recommend you book. Friendly and efficient staff and reasonable price. Very impressed what a great concept

While the food, service and ambience were all great, I have to say - the seats were VERY uncomfortable. We were seated in one of the booths at the back and  the bench seats are weirdly short and if you're anything other than skinny, your stomach is pushed up against the table and your legs under the table are intertwined with whoever is sitting opposite.. I appreciate they want to pack in as many guests as possible, but this was just awkward and uncomfortable.

It took quite a while to get served as the place was busy and the two ladies serving were rushed off their feet. I must admit the one who did eventually serve us was excellent and had impeccable service skills. The other lady wasn't quite as friendly! However, that said, the food was excellent and absolutely delicious. It's very good value for money too. Oh and the sticky toffee puddings was the best I've ever had!

Food wasn‚Äôt all that, overly priced
No potential desire to to return.

NOT a real Turkish restaurant. Don‚Äôt let the name fool ya. You cannot even get the menu in Turkish. It is an Arab restaurant faking to be Turkish. Foods are fancy looking tasteless and cold imitation. My kebab wasn‚Äôt even cooked enough and served right. And they charge way too much for these failed attempts. Even the tea they served us was prepared ages ago and tasted like agony. I gave 2* just for the good location.

Food was fine. Meat was lovely and the sides were so-so.
Service, however was appalling. It took 20 minutes until we received our drinks, despite ordering them with two separate waitstaff. Then our sides arrived and we still had no plates.
Throughout the evening we had to constantly reorder drinks that were not coming, despite other tables ordering successfully and our second round of side dishes took 40 minutes to arrive and even then was missing items.
It wasn't a particularly busy Monday evening, however there only seemed to be two waitstaff actually taking orders.
Drinks were very mediocre. The sangria was fine, however the caprinha pitcher seemed to be 80% sugar, could barely taste the lime or alcohol.

Oh, and when the bill arrived they had the cheek to add a cover charge!

Sadly, would not recommend, the food was fine but the service really put a dampener on the night.
AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL

Enjoyed my first lockdown meal at Preto - West End. Staff were attentive and explained the new ‚Äúsafety & hygiene‚Äù features, food was great and it was definitely value for money.

Only critique is that staff were the only ones to select your cold buffet items (which is understandable). You were allowed to get up and view the items and make a selection but after my first selection, I didn‚Äôt want to ask a waiter for more cold buffet items - the ‚Äúmeat waiters‚Äù came around to the table very frequently but it would have been nice for the cold buffet waiters to take one more visit to the table to ask if we wanted to anything else. You ARE allowed to ask though so don‚Äôt put this off you.

Overall it was peacefully quiet for a Friday evening and I left very satisfied!

Great place to chill and eat with friends! Hot fresh really tasty meats with lots of variety. Salad bar could have been filled more often as it was often lacking.

Staff are very helpful and friendly and the waiters came to the table quite frequently with all types of meat.

1 strange thing was that you could only take 1 plate and bones (which you would expect with meat) could not be put into a separate plate? So you had to keep them in your own place, therefore reducing the amount of space in your plate, until your plate is full. That kinda made no sense.

Overall though, a good experience! Would definitely recommend to others.
Amazing find with the best burgers we‚Äôve ever had. Definitely recommend this place.
Wanted to try this place for so long and i wasnt disappointed,  thebfoid is amazing will definitely be going back more than once , service was great too .
Had to send my mail back as it was absolutely stone cold very disappointed
Enjoyable atmosphere, good food and a definitely a place to spend with Friends

Red dog saloon, the food is nice, just the size of the meats espically the meat combo and very small for the price at ¬£17 and the odd pence I thought it would of been a bit meaty! There wasn't any music playing which was also weird as you could hear everyone else's conversations, the service is good.
Amazing traditional greek recipes with a modern touch. Very friendly staff as well.
Great menu and fantastic service

The brunch was amazing portion sizes sensible and full of flavour.  The lamb starter, beef kebab and chocolate lava cake I wanted this all over again today.  They are so generous too with the drinks paired with the Brunch menu I had to tell them I had given up and could not have another. Music, service, ambiance and food all 5 star, I will be seeing them again in the not too distance future.  Well done Farzi and team, I am hooked.
Great food and service. Everything was delicious and nice cocktails as well. Highly recommend!
Food was okay, nothing overly special in all fairness. On the pricer side for what it was. Restaurant vibe was lovely as well as the service.
Great food. Great service. Will go back for sure

The food is great. The best lamb chops I've had, perfectly cooked.

The only thing that I was disappointed with was the state of the toilets. They were so bad. Dirty, messy, smelly, too dark. There was water all over the floor, tissue everywhere. It was disgusting and it was not only one toilet but all of them.

Food is only aesthetically pleasing - taste is something they need to work on.
The restaurant is loud and not from customers but because of servers and there is no proper ventilation. Waste of money!
would recommend, except one thing - the family felt very thirsty after the dinner...
Great food and service
Excellent as always, never had a bad meal in Rowley‚Äôs
We shall definitely be returning. The steaks were perfection.
Excellent food and courteous service. Thoroughly recommended.

One of my favourite restaurants in London, we always want to go back to Rowleys time and time again.  The staff at Rowleys are brilliant, so attentive, nothing is too much trouble even though they are run off their feet.  They always make our evening a fun experience.
Always great.

I have visited this place since 1990 when my father in law recommended it.I found it great at the time and while good today I can't quite lay my finger on what has changed.I found the signature Entrecote dish yesterday not as good as in the past with less to eat and the ambience a little less engaging.I won't fault it but I think perhaps it needs a little more of the charm from years gone by.I will return but I hope these comments are noted.

Very disappointed - this was my 3rd time at Rowley's (with my partner and a couple of friends over for the weekend).
The welcome by the main waiter was extremely poor (beckoning us inside 5 meters away from the entrance where we stood to take our table instead of coming up to us and asking us to follow him), staff were tired (booking made for 20:00) and irritable/snapping at us and/or short tempered (in a contained yet demonstrable way).
The food was very good of course but unfortunately the training of the staff was a big let-down. Our waitress was so tired/irritable that she was pouring wine in a very splashy manner without properly ensuring it wasn't splashing us. Worse, rushing, she knocked a glass full off wine over while trying to attend our table - I fortunately avoided any spilt wine on my dress.

While I do appreciate that staff can be tired (as all of us!), I must admit that training at Rowley's is not what I had been expecting from past experiences. The food is amazing but management will need to seriously review training policies to avoid loosing clients.
A perfect Lunch on my birthday. Straightforward, high quality food. Decent wine. Good service. Plenty of space. Good value.
Enjoy the food and the drink here so much. Great for a lunch. Consistently  good food and service in a great location..

Very pleasant atmosphere with an amazing steak. Just how you wish your steak to be served.

Service was great; Very friendly and caring and always making sure that the glass of wine / water was refilled. In general, very attentive!
I have been dining at Rowleys for 30 years. The food is consistently good and value for money and the service is excellent.
Brought back memories from previous business lunches
very pleasant find right in the heart of the West End

Took my 81 year old father for a birthday meal. For a straightforward British menu Rowleys is great...steaks, chicken, chips, salad, and some lovely deserts. Only slight negative is that it's more expensive than it appears what with cover charges, service etc. for four of us with one bottle of wine it came to ¬£70 per head
One of the tastiest steak i think i have ever eaten. The grilled entrecote was amazing it was a great way to spend a birthday treat!
Very attentive service. Prompt appearance of food. Delicious dishes.

We enjoyed eating at Rowleys in Jermyn Street very much. Both food and service were excellent and with the 50% off offer amazing value.  Staff were very friendly and attentive.  We will definitely be returning soon.

We arrived at Rowley's late and rushed ... we were warmly welcomed and assisted in making menu choices that would get us back on track on our schedule. The food was great, and wasn't comprimised by our short time in Rowley's. We loved it and it's a firm favourite ....
Patara was awesome. The waiters were on hand and made sure we had a pleasant experience.
Absolutely lovely food and service. Would love to go back again
Great Service, Great Staff, Superb Food

Excellent authentic Thai cuisine with impeccable service. At ¬£20 for three courses the Pre-theatre early bird menu is still great value but you‚Äôll want to add an extra dish if you‚Äôre hungry as portions are smaller than the standard dinner menu.
Asian staff are very dedicated to a good service and very impressed!

We dined here on Thursday and everything started very well.  We had lovely starters in the scallops and the fish cakes. I then had the sea bass wrapped in a banana leaf and my mum had the lamb massaman curry and the sauce was far too sweet for a main dish. A proper massaman curry should have a coconut based sauce. This tasted like it had coconut and sugar put together for the sauce and was disgusting. I then had the mango cheesecake for afters which tasted very rubbery. Again this could have been so much better. I've had far nicer Thai meals in London and would definitely not return. The bill was over ¬£100 for two of us with wine and we've had far nicer and cheaper meals in London and would not recommend this restaurant. The service left a lot to be desired the busier they got. We waited nearly half an hour after our main courses for pudding and coffee.

This is a really good restaurant in a great location and not badly priced either.  Food was very tasty - although the portions might have been slightly small for male diners.  Service was spot-on: attentive without being fussy.

Me and my wife went for dinner at Patara couple of days ago as we love Thai food. Unfortunately we were disappointed as the service was rushed, poor menu choice  and food and  also overpriced.  Not recommended for Thai food lovers looking for a restaurant at high end of the market.

The food was utterly wonderful. 4 knowledgeable diners were impressed by the excellence if the food and the wonderful presentation. My vegetarian meals were so delicious and every bit as sophisticated and perfectly presented as the meat dishes.

All the diners seemed wonderfully happy with the food
great food and good atmosphere. Place to impress your date or your mum! Been there lots of times and its been consistently good.
One of the best thai restaurants in London, trust me I've tried most of them! Not the cheapest but worth it for the flavours. Very friendly service and amazing food. Will be going back soon.

Patara is a hidden gem in the chaos of Oxford Circus - possibly the best Thai I have had in London. Ingredients are fresh and spot on, including free range chicken, which I have rarely found on Asian menus, and delicious Gressingham duck breast. Braised beef in coconut reduction was so rich and melting that my mouth waters as I remember it. No less attention is given to desserts, with fantastic homemade ice creams and a chocolate pudding to d i e for. Amazing restaurant, a total winner.
lovely food, really enjoyed it - thank you!

A very good restaurant. The atmosphere and decor was good with friendly staff. Being a vegetarian they have a separate vegeatation menu with loads of selection. Overall the food was delicious and I would definitely recommend this restaurant.
My favorite satay in the world.
Really good service, they were quick to serve as we had a show to go after. The service and food was excellent
should their service be at the level of food and ambience, Patara would become one of the top 3 restaurants in London
Great food to have for a family lunch
Wonderful food, drinks and staff!

Great food - we ate way too much! Service was a bit slow when we got there, no one greeted me and I had to go and find someone to help me with our table but after that the staff were fantastic and really helpful.

This place is sort of like a tapas style buffet. We came towards the end of the night so there wasn't many food options left, but what was there was mainly tasty and some interesting dishes, for the size of the portion (more like a taster plate rather than a small plate) I did feel that it was largely overpriced.

We really enjoyed our first trip to Sticks N Sushi. The menu was exciting and vibrant, with a huge choice. The food was delicious, especially the starters (crab croquettes and scallops highly recommended). Surprisingly I preferred these to the "Sticks" - more interesting flavours.
Service was very slow to start with but after I commented to chase our drinks, it improved.
Food and drinks were great! Will definitely be returning.

Food Was Good, the homemade Tomato Ketchup was a no no, Chips were a little Greasy but okay, And Cokes were ¬£4 for 330ml which was shocking but overall very nice.

I‚Äôd Suggest the Mac Burger to try.

Would recommend!

Booked online for a special honeymoon meal at 8pm which was meant to be our highlight, when we walked in we were told we had to book all food and drink by 8:15 as the bar and kitchen was closing, we were then told this again by 2 different people, when the food came out there were missing dishes, these arrived when we finished our food, we felt like we were an inconvenience there and 45 minutes later we were out the door, the visit to the gents wasn‚Äôt much better, it was filthy, such a disappointing visit we were gutted as our expectations were high

I have visited Inamo before and had a much different experience I‚Äôm aware we have visited during a global pandemic so perhaps this should be taken into account. Basically my main Issue is I feel the food is very overpriced, the service was fine however they had many items which were on the website but not on the menu once we got there which was very disappointing and I would have gone elsewhere had I known, however the waitress did mention that this was an issue with suppliers which probably is caused by the pandemic but maybe a message on the website to warn potential diners would have been good.

Decent selection, excellent menu choice and not one bad dish. Highly recommended for value for money and also very attentive waiting staff who keep you topped up for brunch, and even leave the bottle on the table.

First time to Inamo and I would go back again. The food is could to order rather than being a buffet. You choose the food electronically from the table. All very exciting as you dont have to wait for anyone else to finish it. The only downside was the wine. It was absolutely disgusting even adding lemonade made no difference.

Interactive table was a great concept and quite novel when I visited some years ago particularly as the technology was new then. A little outdated now using a touch mouse to trawl through menu which was slow and not too easy

Food was really tasty but expensive compared to surrounding restaurants.

Food came out quickly but interactive request for assistance didn‚Äôt result in anyone coming to help.

I don‚Äôt like a service charge being added to the bill automatically or a planting a tree tax.

Great concept but probably needs a tech refresh given I have better capability on my phone now including touch screen technology

Great restaurant , very nice stuff quick service , technology is for good the interactive table allows you change table cloths, call waiter, ask for bill and place order!! Amazing place and very lovely staff! We had a lady called Wendy Look after me and my fianc√© on valentines excellent service highly recommend this restaurant!!

Nice restaurant. Ordering system and interactive tables are fun. Not the best value for money on food or drinks. You are paying for the the gimmick as opposed to the quality of the food. Not saying the food is bad quality by any stretch. Just expensive for what it is.
Virgin Experience Voucher deal which was fine until a portion of spare ribs, a bottle of sparkling water and 1 dessert cost an extra ¬£38.00? Hmmm?

Great value for money on the Sunday unlimited deal. Delicious food and lovely wine. Service was brilliant! Would have been nice if there were a few more meat dishes on the unlimited deal, having said that there was plenty of sushi and meat free dishes which were all very tasty! All of this without mentioning the awesome interactive tables which add another great element of fun to the meal and atmosphere! Will certainly be returning!

Curious and different restaurant! Nice for children, they had a lot of fun
The food is also nice and the service very pleasant

Had a very nice evening and lot of fun with the interactive tables. My daugther loved it.
Arriving of the various courses was a little bit fast. Not really finished the 1st course and 2nd course arrives.
But overall very good food and ambience.

Great concept...good fun...
The food is great but beware the menu is confusing and although we'd ordered the open table deal we ordered off the wrong menu so got charged a lot more...they don't tell you when you order only when you come to pay.

Ive been a keen Inamo patron since they've opened. I've held more than one birthday party at Soho and the old St James branch and it was great albeit a bit pricey paying for 30 people.

Unfortunately the food quality has deterioted since those days. I hosted a company Christmas dinner in Covent Garden recently for only 6 people and the food was okay but the service was bad.

I really hope that this is only a temporary struggle but to be honest i doubt it is. Extremely disappointed that my last 5 visits have all been worse then the one before. I love the concept and i loved the food but its not as good as it used to be.
The food was amazing and the interactive tables were different. It won't be the last time I go there, that's for certain!
What a fab and funky way to order food and enjoy a completely different dining experience! Definitely recommend this to anyone!!

Had a great lunch here with my family before Christmas. My two boys loved the interactive menu on the table, being able to change the tablecloth and playing games in between courses. The adults thought it great fun too! My husband and I really enjoyed the food, although the boys not so much, but I think there were other things on the menu they would have liked even more. Rather pricey for lunch, but we mistakenly chose from the a la carte menu instead of the weekday lunch menu. Must remember that for next time.

Took my young cousins to this place for dinner, didn't realise they were such fussy eaters, so it was tricky to find something they would eat.

We had to move tables as not everyone's interactive place worked, and the while thing was pretty pricey.

Having said that my cousins really enjoyed the ability to play games on the table and order using it. But overall it was over priced and a bit disappointing.

This was my second visit to the restaurant and had been looking forward to it. The food was poor and pricey and the head hostess acted strange and I got worried that she had written down my  credit card details.... So no recommendations from me.
Went with a friend and really enjoyed my time there! The food was delicious, so I would definitely go again, especially for special occasions.

I was recommended to go to this restaurant by some friends who have children and raved about the interactive tables and games you can play.  I agreed to go, expecting the kids to love it, but that I'd find the food very average as is common with restaurants of this type.  Actually, the food was very good.  An interesting mix of unusual and tasty dishes.  It is expensive, but the entertaiment that the children got out of the tables made up for it.  It's not somewhere I'd go every day but as a special treat it was well worth it.

I booked a table here for a surprise birthday meal as the restaurant's concept really intrigued me, and I was really impressed with how well it worked. The technology worked really well and I was impressed with the innovation. The food arrived promptly and was delicious. The service we received was excellent and I will gladly go back again.

A very unique dining experience that can easy keep you entertained for hours with the games on the tables. The only thing that let the restaurant down was the fact we were made to wait over half an hour for a table despite booking in advance and we were only seated after having made a complaint. The worse part is there were empty tables from the moment we walked in, so a sneaky attempt to increase the bar tab let the restaurant down.

Other then having to chase our table great food, great experience.
The table was fun to play with and the food was nice but it was quite expensive overall.

we came from Switzerland and found the restaurant on Internet. It was for my birthday's son. Everything was perfect! He is 17 and really loved the concept! Food was excellent and staff very nice. We would recommend this place and will return there for our next visit to London. .

Great restaurant for a completely different dining experience. We went for my boyfriend's birthday and were not disappointed! Staff were fantastic, even brought out a free desert for my partner to wish him happy birthday. Couldn't have chosen a better place to dine for the special occasion, lots of fun and a totally unique experience.

Unique dining experience, matched with good food and great service from the most friendliest of waitress. It definitely lived up to my expectations.
Bring a cardie to brave the Artic chill, it was fairly freezing inside.
Will definitely be coming back again.

There are enough good restaurants in London for diners to give this one a miss. The novelty projections are a quick distraction for kids, but don't make up for the a stage good and service. Quality so-so, value so-so.

The experience is so unique. The staff explained very clearly how the 'table' worked and after that it was such good fun. To be in control of what you could order and when, what it looked like, how much the current bill was meant the experience was very relaxing - even to changing the 'tablecloth', playing battleships and watching the chefs cook. On top of all that the food was execllent and the price reasonable for London. A must for my next visit

+ Wide selection of food
+ Most dishes tasted really good
+ Unique table experience
+ Bill was high but compared to other good restaurants with similar quality food is the same so worth it
- Space is small

The concept of inamo is fantastic and works really well, we really enjoyed choosing our meals. The food arrived quickly and was delicious. Only disappointing part of the meal was being rushed out at the end, it was Wednesday night however we hadn't been in the restaurant more than an hour and a half when it was made very clear they wanted us to leave once they'd established we didn't want dessert!

Disappointed that the chef cam was just unusable on both sides of the table, which would have been nice to use, I understand technically it would require more, due to streaming, it was so slow that we couldn't even get past the loading screen.

Games were a good idea, surely given they are only projected, more games could be available.

Given the waiter suggested 2 small dishes and 1 large, and I was dining with my partner, I was surprised to see that there was simply not enough room on the table to supplement those recommendations.

However with slight changes it would be somewhere you could return to and have great fun. You should also consider separate booths, where you can change lighting and music. Now that would make it extra special.

My friend and I decided to try Inamo based on its reviews and were not disappointed. The food was great, the service was friendly and helpful and the unique ordering system made the evening all the more interesting. The only thing that spoiled our enjoyment slightly perhaps was the super noisy neighbouring table (they were enjoying themselves with very loud conversations)...

Inamo, London. Good, tasty food, fun to order everything using the table screen but waiting staff forgot some of our order and also hassled us to leave after 1.5 hours as they wanted the table back! We would have happily sat there longer and spent more money if they hadn't have done that, so... more fool them!
For sure a good quality of food and fun atmosphere. But very overpriced for the type and size of the dishes. Going once for special occasion.

This was our second visit to Inamo and we thoroughly enjoyed it as did our friends who had not been before. The food is amazing and the novelty factor is excellent. I was just slightly disappointed we ended up downstairs rather than upstairs. Apart from that minor thing, a great evening was had by all.

Inamo London is always a favorite of mine. Attending for the first time last year for my birthday with a group of us we returned time again for quick lunches with friends and most recently this booking was dinner for 4. Arriving on time at 9.30pm we were upset not to be seated until 9.50pm having to wait in the cramped bar downstairs for 20 minutes. We were then taken through to an annex of the restaurant lacking in actmosphere. Overall Fantastic food great menu & wonderful modern concept.

most excellent, very busy but we were seated immediately and got straight into some great food and were served drinks very quickly from ordering. we would fefinately go again.. my only complaint is that its too tempting to keeo ordering more..

A very fun, funky and snappy place to come. Obviously for boys with toys, with lovely projection screen tables, but the food was solid to brilliant (the Wild Boar Rolls were amazing). Perfect for lunch and the 50% off deal made it a steal. Would return (with the TopTable offer, anyway!).

Third time eating at Inamo restaurant in London, and getting better every time!  All the food ordered was of the highest quality, particularly the beef carpacio and black cod.  Inamo had a good selection of wine to choose from, but a limited selection of desserts (possibly as it was lunchtime).  Very attentive staff and a great atmosphere as usual.  The interactive dining experience never fails to amuse new diners at this highly recommended restaurant. Very good value with the Toptable offer.

I like coming to Inamo. This is my second time already and next week will be my third time! I like sashimi dish - hamachi? and vegeterian vietnamese spring roll for starter then lamb and cod for mains.  A little too strong on flavour but with a bowl of rice it's fine!

I went for lunch to Inamo as I had read about it in numerous food reviews.  The concept was fun and the idea of ordering via a computer worked well until we needed an explanation of the dishes, when a waiter had to be summoned.  The food itself was fresh and tasty.  We had some small (actually quite large) dishes to share and main course dishes for ourselves.  I think children would enjoy this restaurant.  The only downside was that the aircon (to keep the projectors cool, I suppose) was fierce!

Inamo in London is an awesome restaurant.  It's USP is certainly its amazing food odering system, but the restaurant itself is also really cool with incredible food and friendly staff. Will definitely be going back to try more of the dishes!

Great concept and good food! Portions aren't huge but I guess you are paying for the experience. I prefer a more extensive menu but I can see why they have kept it limited otherwise it would take to long to place an order. Also the restaurant was a little to cold for my liking!
Excellent food and very friendly service. Will be returning for sure.

A brilliant place  to dine at! love the interactive tables but I returned to inamo simply for the food-its absolutely delicious! Definately recommend the prawn starter and the Black cod! The black cod is probably the best I have tasted at any restaurant in London :)

Inamo, Soho, is really worth a visit, if only for the sheer novelty value.  The ¬£10 pre-theatre menu is reasonable value for money, and a good way to try a variety of the dishes on offer.  However, it didn't really fill me up, so next time I would go for the full-sized dishes.  I'd definitely take friends visiting London so they could exeperience something new, but I wouldn't go back there based on food quality alone, considering the price.

The gimmick of the "computer tables" got us interested in Inamo - and it was very cool. Interestingly though, it turned out to be much more than a gimmick! We were completely in control of when our food and drinks came. We controlled when the bill came. It was incredible. The food was very good, and we felt comfortable ordering only exactly what we wanted. The service was extraordinary. We highly recommend Inamo. Just be sure to absorb how the "gimmick" makes the entire experience great.

Limited starters but the tartare was very good
We had rack of lamb which was absolutely delicious
Nice place but let down by bad service and rude staff
quality of food is not up to the standard base on the price.

Absolute shambles! Waited 45mins to be seated, took 25mins to be served and that inly because i called the waiter over! Food came out at different times when i asked for it to be bought out all together. Food was missing. Tried to order something and was told they ran out 15 mins later the chef is making it for someone else who happened to sit 2 tables away from me. Very poor. Disgusted with the service. Food was average! Will never be returning
I went there for a business lunch. Food was great as usual and the service excellent
First time dinner, loved the food and ambience. Service was a little slow had to grab the waiter a few times but the food was amazing.

Aqua Kyoto was good food in a beautiful setting. The outdoor space is very unique in London and is a great place for drinks. The food was good quality, however the staff was a bit abrupt and pushed us to order dessert before we finished our meal. It was clear they were rushing us through our lunch. Otherwise, everything else was very pleasant.

This is the second time I‚Äôve gone to Tendril, both times with non-vegans and we‚Äôve all very much enjoyed the food. Both times I‚Äôve gone for a tasting menu and although each plate is small, they‚Äôre all delicious and we were certainly full by the end. My personal favourites this time we‚Äôre the toastada and the chipotle mushroom.

The staff are very attentive.
Excellent food, lovely atmosphere, kind and efficent service. One of my personal favourite in the area!
Wasn‚Äôt bad, but really want good either. Value for money was extremely poor, food was okay - but only okay.

Exceptional dim sum - go at the weekend for the best dumplings
Poor value / quality mains
Service attentive but not the quickest

Birthday meal with family & amazing pockets of flavour.

Great value for the huge variety of dim sum and Chinese street food dishes that were served. I will definitely be returning and thank Baozilnn for their hospitality.

The only lack is the atmosphere, the vibrant food and flavours doesn't quite match the environment.

Good restaurant, a good alternative around Soho.
The food was delicious, great menu with a good amount of choice . I highly recommend the Dan Dan noodles.
The only let down was that they didn't have our booking and although we got a table the staff were a bit frazzled that our booking didn't show.
A good choice for Chinese restaurant that has a good ambiance too.

Very average dim sum. A review I had read had given me high hopes, but the food was on a par with Ping Pong. The service was friendly, but not very helpful and our basement table didn't have much ambiance.
Really enjoyed this meal, had set meal C, plenty of food and the crispy duck was lovely.
Central position, food excellent and enjoyable. A good evening and would go again.
Good food but the lights are too bright and there isn't any ambiance at all

Fabulous meal.
We always visit the Orient restaurant when in London.
Quality of food outstanding, staff all very pleasant and lovely surroundings
Dined here 3 times in the last 3 months and each time very satisfied with the food and service.
Very quick service! Large portions, very tasty. Reasonable prices for such food and location.
Food was excellent, however the service was terrible. Such a shame as I have been before and didn't have this issue then, I hope this was a one-off occurrence.
Lovely evening.  Staff were very attentive.  Food was lovely and courses weren't rushed. Cant wait to go again.
Lovely! Delicious food, smiley service. Will be back soon.
Great food. Dark interior really good. Service tip top.

Excellent Chinese food. Plenty of options and great taste. Definitely recommend to everyone.
Due to its location and popularity could get quite busy. Booking ahead of time is always advisable
My favourite place to have dim sum in Chinatown, with comfy seating on the ground floor & yummy dim sum. I notice the staff has changed a little & the customer service has got even better.

I would say that Plum Valley stands out a mile in China town as the new 'fine dining' chinese restaurant, with its shiny new front and polished interior. The restaurant itself is comfy, clean and finished to a high standard. The food was amazing, with the set menu A being my top recommendation. Tip - it is ¬£38 but the portions are plentiful and if there is 4 of you - just order 2 set menus and a few side dishes! Unfortunately the meal (my 30th birthday) was slightly spoilt by the service. The servers attitudes were not good, people kept getting the wrong food, waiting for over an hour for mains, then when it did come you almost had it thrown at you. Overall a good experience, but wouldn't return for a special occasion.

Restaurant was quiet on Sunday night. Crispy chicken was very disappointing. It was neither crispy nor hot and also very small portion. I was sick after the meal, probably something to do with the food. I would not go back again.
Excellent food and very good service.

This is the fourth time I have been here and it doesn't disappoint.
Soft shell crab starter is recommended. With friends who had never been before
And they said it was the best they had ever had

Plum Valley definitely serves the best Dim Sum in china town.  We ordered 3 separate times and all meals came in good time and piping hot.  I wouldn't go anywhere else in London for Dim Sum.  Try the paper wrapped prawn!
Outstanding as always

Delicious food and very good service, but quite expensive even with the Top table deal.  Considering the food prices though, the house wine was very reasonably priced and perfect with Chinese food. Would go again for a treat if there was another deal on.

It can be hard to know where to go in China Town, but I thought I'd found a good 'un when I previously went to Plum Valley and had fab dim sum. However, my most recent visit with three friends was a let down. It wasn't terrible, but the food was exceptionally mediocre. My noodles with king prawns were really dry, while one of the other girl's noodle dish was hugely oversaturated with sauce. The wine was sickly sweet and not drinkable. The decor is nice - shame the food doesn't live up to it.

Plum Valley, Soho - an upmarket Chinese, cool decor (soft lighting, shades of grey and brown), excellent food. Not too pricey either if you consider the large portions (and if you take advantage of Top Table discounts!).
Always love the dim sum offer, even if it is incredibly dark inside, which doesn't help with the post-prandial sleepiness!

What a experience, the food was out of this world.
The service was great and the staff very helpful.
The next day we are still talking about the dishes we ordered.
Just want to go back for more. Well done Plum Valley for making are taste buds
reach the next level .
plum valley fine dining at chinatown was by far the best chinese we have all had, it was fantastic.....
A great meal; wonderful atmosphere; can't fault it.

Was put on a table right in the thoroughfare next to the till. Restaurant was pitchblack and uncomfortable and people kept walking into my chair. Walked out and went to Golden Dragon opposite - great food, fantastic value and nice big tables!

This chinese restaurant in china town is quite stylish. We had a dum sim platter to start and it was AMAZING, followed by lovely duck pancakes and then some dishes to share. Plenty of food to go around! Very tasty, I would reccommend. Great value with the 50% off discount.
Very overpriced chinese restaurant who had run out of Ho Fun noodles!
Plum Valley Fine Dining London - Good food tho expensive - would probably not return without 50% offer. The starters were tastier than the main course - lobster noodles were a touch too salty.
Had dinner with 50% off on Friday.  This is one of the better restaurants in Chinatown and with the offer is excellent value.

Plum Valley Dining - London
Great service, wonderful food and relaxing upmarket ambience - all in all a good package when combined with Top Table offers.

4th time eating here this year and well up to the usual fantastic standards. Particularly recommend the prawn/wasabi dumplings which seem to be new to the menu as well as the honey and champagne black cod which adds a refreshing twist to that asian restaurant staple.

We went for dinner last night, it was a lovely meal - the dim sum was outstanding and the setting was lovely - air conditioning on the chilly side.  The food was really good but would definately overpriced had it not been for the 50% off.  Would go again with the 50% off.

Poorly made cocktail (Strawberry daiquiri with salt on the rim of the glass)
Disappointing starter sharer.

Paul the manager was exceptional he made us feel extremely welcomed and he had even took the time to have a great conversation about Australia. Paul had lived there for a while and me and my partner are travelling there in 2021. I am a lifelong fan of forest gump and that visit has just sealed it! Cannot wait to go back!!
Had a fun time up in Leicester Square with a filling and large meal. Pricey for what it is but portions are large and tastes nice.
Would definitely recommend. I enjoyed the food and the atmosphere.

Great dumplings! Bun eggplant options was a little disappointing compared to similar at other venues and could probably have been better with just a serving of 2 or 3 than a larger ‚Äòmake it yourself‚Äô with not enough buns and too many fillings. Sad that one of my fav puffs were sold out the day we visited. All else great!
Poor service, waiters were rushed. Food delivered to table at different times for each guest and coffees came a while after cakes were delivered.
It was a nice surprise had such delicious food with quality and price. The food have been server well presented .  My friend and I will go back again to enjoy others meals.

Tokimeite is our favourite restaurant in London. We love Japanese food and Tokimeite‚Äôs offering is of the upmost quality. The restaurant itself is intimate and the staff are lovely and welcoming, yet achieve a balance with giving you enough privacy. We‚Äôll most certainly be back.
Missing three foods....
The food was amazing , perfect service and the beef tasted like butter. Everyone one should go.

Waiter was very attentive
Thanks
The duck with the cherry was the very best.

Aqua Nueva is a very good yet expensive restaurant - and not sure its justified... I was disappointed that we hadn't been told the outdoor terrace was closed for a private function as we were definitively planning to have a pre-dinner drink there. The lobster gazpacho was interesting but not sure I would have it again. The mains were all very good and well presented. Service was very attentive. The good news is that we could enjoy an after dinner drink in the other terrace.... Would go again but rather for a drink
The food was amazing. Best chinese food I've had in London.

Nice restaurant in Chinatown./Soho. Grabbed a bite pre-theater and wait staff was very accommodating. Good food, generous portions, good cocktails. A bit more upscale than the many restaurants around.
I've been here many times. It is always very good. Consistent and value for money. Very authentic.

Great food in a comfortable environment with great service. Just a little on the pricy side and a little tailored for the European market.

We had aubergine and a large bowl of smacked cucumbers to start with - I could have had two bowls of the cucumbers they were so full of umami flavour. Cold sesame chilli chicken was not spicy but tasty and sat on the most delicious little salad. Kung pao prawns were large, juicy and delicious. Water spinach was fine. The mung bean noodles with cabbage were so good that, if I'd known, I would have had just a big bowl of that. There's a good selection of alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks available,

Tables are comfortable and large enough that you don't have to worry about dishes falling off the ends (not always true in Chinese restaurants). Service was friendly and although they only reserve tables for two hours, at no point did we feel rushed.

Definitely a place I would go back to again.
Food came out very quickly as it was basic and easy to make. Restaurant decor was certainly not in keeping with the prices. Lacklustre ambience.
Lovely spicy food and great service. Moi is the best waitress.
We arrived to a sushi only menu. One of the party is pregnant so we couldn‚Äôt stay to eat. When we asked for any service it‚Äôs like we were bothering them
This was my first time here and I will definitely come again. Great place with great vibe and very friendly, knowledgeable guys. Thank you.

Great ambience , place and fantastic our lovely waitress Roxy !!! She is there best !!!! Thank you Roxy for making my boyfriend‚Äôs birthday memorable!!!! Will definitely come back and want to be served by you üôÇ Anna
Had a wonderful time with live music in the background enjoying wonderful dishes with excellent service .
It was exceptional

My friend and I went there for our birthday lunch on March 8th. Food was great. Especially chocolate fondant was the best ever!! Thank you for the waiter. He was very friendly and smiley! Any time we need, he was there for us. We already decided to go back there in April.
Very nice 3 course lunch. Prosecco at 9.50 per glass was I thought a little over priced.
Just fabulous!!! Quaglinos did not disappoint as usual. Efficient, friendly staff, delicious  cocktails!!!

Just a really good place music food staff
All the boxes were ticked

This was not my first visit to Quaglino's. The bar team as always were exceptional they ensured my clients and myself (6 in total) were seated and taken care of very well (Fantastic Cocktails).

We were taken to our table and our drinks orders were taken very promptly (even with a small confusion of the wine in stock). Everything was running very smooth until the serving of our food and the waiter got both the delivery of the starters & main courses mixed up to at least 3 of us on each course!!!! The only other gripe was the hurried chase from our table "as they needed to set up for the evening " this was a little embarrassing as when I requested to go have a table at the bar we were informed they had none available. So regretfully we left and drinks elsewhere.

There are few restaurants with a bigger history and reputation in London than quaglinos. Thankfully it lived up to it in every way. The service was impeccable, the space itself amazing and the food was superb. We opted for the fixed menu option which was ridiculous value for money and highly recommended. The live band were unexpected and we're the icing on the cake. 5 stars!!
Had a fabulous meal, with impeccable service as always.

This restaurant has a great atmosphere and the food tastes great. The one criticism would be the DJ. Admittedly it was a hard act to fill after the great live music but it was really lacking something. We decided to move on rather stay which was a shame as this was one of the reasons we chose Quaglinos in the first place
Great staff, great food, great value
Would definitely go back, food was excellent, staff were very attentive, it was great value and early evening quite a romantic setting,

From the moment we stepped into Quaglinos, the experience was more like a show than a restaurant. The service was outstanding, the hosts, waiters and even the Head Chef (who kindly showed us the kitchen) were very charming. The inside is stunning, with the decor being consistently decadent throughout. I look forward for an excuse to go back.

We went for a business lunch for the first time since they reopened, and the new d√©cor is very nice and staff friendly and efficient. Only drawback was that we were sat with the kitchen just behind us and staff organising themselves to get the food served. So a lot of clattering and staff orders which was a bit of a shame. Overall though a very good experience, and we will be back for more business lunches for sure.
The service, the food and the atmosphere were excellent. Thank you.
A beautifully designed restaurant with fantastic staff. Our waiter was so attentive right from the moment we walked in. The food was delicious. I'll be back.
Great service and food!

The food was lovely and the staff were wonderful, really accomodating and great fun too. It's a cool venue with a nice vibe to it. We had a business lunch there, but I could have stayed there all afternoon.
My fried Jerk chicken arrived burnt. Our drinks were not made properly. Over the food was very bland.
Yummy food & lovely atmosphere
Went there when it was lovely and quiet kid week! Food looked amazing and tasted great! Service was faultless

I love this place and it is the second time I have been here. I love the food and the atmosphere, however the service really suffers when it is busy. I hope this will improve the longer they trade as they will consider new ways of working but be prepared to wait for your order and wait for your food! I had 1 hour lunch break and it took over 1.5hours to give our order and receive our food (then we had to eat!). We had to ask twice about if we could order and where our food was. Only go if you have time to spare.
Service was very good. Friendly staff. Food was good, wine as nice and dessert was my highlight.
Really great value for money. A very "Business Meal" atmosphere for lunch, quite formal and may not suit a social lunch. Winelist is very expensive, but that comes with the zone.
Great place for lunch while shopping. Very centrally located. Great atmosphere, service and  food.
Excellent weekday dinner. Authentic Italian, fresh flavours and clearly sound ingredients. Brilliant service from restaurant management, Owen in particular, and friendly sommelier.

Table of 4 people for a business lunch - all but one new to Sartoria and the choice proved to be very well received. Food and sevice very good. Particular mention for Michael Simms the sommelier who made a very good eating experience into an excellent and memorable one, for his knowledge, kindness and attention.
Lovely restaurant, great food, friendly staff and a great night. Overall a great experience and I would definitely recommend!
Superb food, service and place.

good lunch, modern surrounding help make it casual.
Clearly the recession has not hit this restaurant or its clients, 95% must have been business lunches.

Special deals for Jo Public and their son having a get together?

I went to Sartoria with a friend on Friday night. The restaurant was empty. The set menu was really basic and weas made of 3 dishes per course so we did not have much choice at all. My fish main course was really bad! Very nice wine and very good service though. I would not recommend it.

Food was very tasty but not to the same standard as the service and the ambience of the restaurant. Waiters were very attentive and sommelier was very friendly with lots of interesting anecdotes to tell.

Sartoria London. Good service and nice atmosphere. seafood and vegetable as starter was very nice and quite filling. Aubergine was tasty but the skewed fish was slightly dry and very small portion without any garnish! if they could add little green or potato on the plate, it would look better. We also ordered the spaghetti with tomato and it was nice flavour but the green leave they added in it was far too bitter. It spoilt the dish. The desert was good but ordinary. Very good service.
We had an excellent meal at Sartoria, London. Service was attentive, wine was excellent and the food was very good quality.

I recently went to Sartoria for a business lunch and was extremely disappointed with the service. We waited for 45 minutes for our food and were ignored by staff when trying to get their attention. After making a complaint about the slow service they tried to placate us with free dessert, which we refused as we were already running late due to the slow service. Lunch for 4 people with no dessert or coffee came to over ¬£100, not value for money.

I had a very lovely evening with my girlfriend at Sartoria in London. The food and service were excellent. When we arrived we were taken to the lovely bar where we served our bellini which was part of the offer.
We had a very delicious early evening dinner at Sartoria Savile Row W1.  The staff were all extremely pleasant and helpful, making it a thoroughly enjoyable experience.
I just cannot help going bavk to Sartoria. Great food and service.
Great food, wine and cocktails.  The menu as a little limited with the TT offer - but everything was very well done.  Expect to be back.

Sartoria was an excellent place for a catch up meal with some friends. Service was attentive and knowledgable, and we were treated to a great 3 course dinner. The TT offer is brilliant, and I would highly recommend this restaurant!

Excellent service, lovely bar and restaurant, however with the set menu offer the portions are quite small and the food only just above average. Off the set menu the portions were more reasonable and good range on the menu.

Sartoria was quiet simply refreshingly clean, crisp and the food was perfectly cooked.
Staff where excellent.
Going back again for sure!

Sartoria was a just what we wanted that evening - a comfortable place where we could chat (and laugh) and have good food and wine.  I would have to say that it was short on atmosphere - it is very large and spacious and only a few other tables were occupied.  That suited us but we weren't in search of a 'buzz' that evening. The service was really excellent - sound advice on wine - and the food was delightful without being drop dead stunning.
Had a delicious meal - very traditional British.  So enjoyed it! Will definitely come again when  visiting London
Phenomenal food, phenomenal staff, simply great.  Thank you.
Wilton's remains true to its traditions. Best Dover sole in London. Impeccable service.
Close friends Christmas meal.
A special occasion. My friend's first trip to London. Had to take him to the famous Wilton's which did not disappoint.
My favorite restaurant in London.  I always plan at least one meal at Wilton's on each visit from the States.

WE WANTED TO FIND THE BEST RESTAURANT OFFERING DOVER SOLE IN LONDON AND INTERNATIONAL REVIEWS INDICATED WILTON'S. WE WERE NOT DISAPPOINTED AND LOOKING AT THE QUALITY AND EXCELLENT MENU WE WILL RETURN.
ATMOSPHERE REFINED BUT VERY FRIENDLY OFFERING A HIGH GRADE OF SERVICE.
I COULDN'T FIND ANY FLAWS. EXCELLENT RAPPORT PRICE/QUALITY.
Everytime I am in Lonon I make it a point to eat at Wiltons and I am never dissapointed.  The food and the staff are the best.  Thank you for the wonderful oysters.
Excellent food and service in a super environment.

This is the classic venue for British food at its very best. Service is outstanding and each course presented superbly. The seafood and game, the latter now in season, are quite delicious. Highly recommended restaurant for the discerning food lover.

Wiltons, London
A delightful find, combining the best of British tradition but very unstuffy. Cosy and lovely old-fashioned decor without the gloom. The service is charming and attentive, but not over the top. We had perfectly cooked plaice from a menu which is dominated by fish, and some slightly overrated strawberries and a very acceptable brulee with rhubarb. The wine list is somewhat expensive - a half bottle at ¬£26, but will definitely return as the dining experience worth it.
The best in Chinatown! Beautiful hand made dumplings & delicious mains - all at a brilliant price,
The food was extremely tasty and the service was excellent. We particularly loved the chicken dumplings and KFC!

We had an amazing experience, the food was amazing. Some of the people serving were not so experienced as they had to keep asking others about questions we were asking about the food or order but the food did absolute justice to the experience.
Love Brindisa. The food is always amazing and this particular branch is fantastic
Food was good but service not great and general ambience decor was so-so
Service unusually slow and felt like it was a real effort.
Excellent service, food was fab definately a place l will go again. Great for meet ups with friends before hitting the town
Tapas are good but I think that overall it‚Äôs expensive for what you get. Quantities are small, prices are high and flavours are mild. If one wants proper tapas, I‚Äôd recommend Lobos instead.
Another great evening with friends at this cosy place, great food, good prices and fantastic helpful staff, looking forward to our next visit.
Really lovely food and staff, would definitely recommend
Very dependable and genuine Italian, friendly service, one of the best in Town!
Another fabulous meal at our favourite Italian Mediterranean restaurant in London. A very warm welcome friendly service and wonderful food! See you again soon xx
Atmosphere was lacking but service & food were good.

I have een coming here for years and I never feel let down - the food, service, location never fails. Even on the rare occasion that something isn't quite right the staff alway respond appropriately. I thoroughly recommend it.
I'm italian and I'm always quite suspicious about italian restaurant abroad. Al Duca changed my idea. Everything was delicious and the service was very dedicated. I definitively recommend it!
reasonable value and fair value for location in london
We were very impressed with the service and the food was very tasty. I would recommend it without hesitation.

Early dinner with family after a matinee; busy without being rammed, boiling or overwhelmed. Very warm and welcoming, the staff showed up when wanted and weren't intrusive while we were getting on with our food, which was well-cooked, well-presented, and just unusual enough to be memorable without being obtrusive. A good selection of wines and a wide enough (but not overwhelming or unrealistic) range of dishes. Nice to see both primi and secondi on the menu -- I'll have to hold off eating for a day before I next go and run through a proper traditional Italian meal.
I like a little more noise. The restaurant wasn't very busy and there seem to be too many waiter/tresses which was a little offputting
Very Good. went pre theatre but had to ask for the pre menu. This was good. Very good wine at very reasonable prices.Certainly we will go again.
As always excellent

Al Duca, London
Good quality food, well presented, attentive staff - always a nice dining experience
Always fab service and quality
From phone reservation, arrival, Jose excellent waiter, to wonderful standard of food it was an outstanding experience.
The food is amazing, the place is really chic and cosy. Would recommend to anyone up for a very tasty afternoon tea

Lovely experience, friendly and attentive staff
But overpriced esp if comparing the cost to a good 3 course meal
I didn‚Äôt expect to have to pay for an additional pot of tea
It was very loud, the food tasted bland, and the table cloth had stains. We paid a similar price for afternoon tea at Claridges and it didn‚Äôt live to the same expectations.

Service was very good but bit slow.
Food was outstanding. crockery was very well worn.

Came back to Fortnum & Mason afternoon tea with my teen daughters, after 20 years or so - it was even better than I remembered, and my daughters loved it!
We had some long waiting for an unexplained reason (we booked a month in advance), and it seems that no one is really following the que. After 2 complains and 30 minutes later (my mistake, I should have done it earlier) I got the attention of the manger who sorted out everything and got us a great corner table and a free glass of non-alcoholic "champagne", along with the assistance of the most helpful SAM.
We had a great time together for the next 2 hours and as many fresh refill as we desired . They also brought a birthday cake to my older one (with a song, surely!) so we had to take home the slices of cake (on top of everything - you get to choose a slice from the trolly).
It was only then we found out that they were so kind to deduct XX% of the bill!
All and all - a great british experience! We will not wait that many years again - we will be back soon!
Relaxed and friendly with staff who were willing to give advice in the choice of teas for our Japanese friends,
A highly recommended experience. Wonderful staff and food.
It was very Nice!! I will visit it over 3 Months again!!
Great service and delicious food. Lovely atmosphere, well worth avidit

Exactly what I wanted for a special occasion. Spot on timing as per booking and we were not rushed all, spending some 2.5 hours enjoying each other's company, the ambience and excellent discreet service as and when was appropriate.
Good selection of finger sandwiches, my Eggs Royale was devine and the cakes simply gorgeous.
And they remembered my request for a small Birthday surprise.
No hesitation recommending and will go again for sure
The F&M Gavi @ ¬£34 was a great 'find'
Enjoy!
Best afternoon tea I have been too, exceptional food and wonderful piano playing in the background. Will be back!

Overall, the Fortnum and Mason tea salon was disappointing on this occasion.  We had looked forward to an excellent afternoon tea experience, based upon a previous time when we were absolutely blown away by the service, the food, and the general atmosphere.  Unfortunately, we weren't left with a similar impression on this occasion.  We were initially escorted to a table in the center of one of the dining rooms, which quickly proved to be quite busy, with staff hastening by every few seconds.  This didn't exactly make for a relaxed ambiance.  We asked to be reseated, and we patiently waited for a new table, which was tucked away out of the bustle and was better.  However, the service was disappointingly slow and disjointed.  When our waitress initially came by, she simply asked if we had decided on anything.  While we were still mulling over the options, she left us without explaining anything about the menu, which we thought was customary to do.   Once we had ordered, only one out of three of us was brought tea (so only one of us was drinking for several minutes), after which we were waiting an uncomfortable amount of time for the first items of food to arrive.  At one point, our tea had run out and we had been waiting a while on a refill of a few sandwiches.  We felt that our waitress could have been more attentive, as she didn't come by to check on us, and consequently, we were left to our own devices when items ran out.  It also didn't help that once we had complained about the service that there was miscommunication between two or three other well-meaning people in terms of what we were missing and had requested.  Double items turned up, while others were still missing.  Overall, our experience wasn't the best, and this occasion was meant to be a special treat for a dear friend, making it even more disappointing.  I wouldn't say we would never return, however, we would probably be inclined to opt for a different afternoon tea venue next time.

Almost perfect except the costs. Almost perfect except the costs. Almost perfect except the costs. Almost perfect except the costs. Almost perfect except the costs. Easy to make an appointment and good environments.
Spectacular food, service and ambiance

Went to have afternoon tea on Saturday, the food was good, however, the services were poor. Difficult to get attention from any waiters or waitresses. Also, we takeaways some desserts and the waiter just put everything in the bag, so it was all messed up and cant really have it at home...
Beautiful surroundings and wonderful service from the staff. Would definitely recommend visiting for afternoon tea.

Service was slow and we did not feel welcoming or friendliness from the waitresses, the wait for refills was very long too, we chased few times before it finally arrived, it was about 20 mins of wait. The place was noisy with loud people talking and overpowered the piano that was playing. The food was alright as best, the sandwiches were very standard. I personally do not think it was worth the price or it was enjoyable.

great!!
I am satisfied very much!!
I t is goooood memories of LONDON!!!
