Amazing service,  decor, and food. They refreshed quickly and often. They helped us choose the right tea for us and checked on us often incase we wanted to change flavors. The whole experience was amazing...but we had a table filled with children a few spots away which brought not only the noise level up but I could hear the parents trying to wrangle them to behave. ( to no avail) while not the restaurants fault, I did have to knock up the noise level.

It's expensive and you do feel like you're being processed as it's so busy and very touristy. We did have a good waiter who looked after us and the food is good, but not mind blowing, which it should be for 55 quid a head.
Good choice of food and teas.  Staff friendly, helpful and very attentive
It was a wonderful way to celebrate a special birthday!

We were the 'unlucky ones I'm afraid'.
I surprised my mom and dad with afternoon tea at F&M. We were received by really kind ladies! But after we were sat down, the 'unlucky part' started. We had to wait 10 minutes for a waiter to come and tell us how everything works, than the waiter didn't see our tea on the counter, so someone else brought it over after 10 minutes. Than we were informed something went wrong in the kitchen and they forgot our order. After waiting for almost 1 hour we finally got our food. It was lovely, but it was hard to get hold of any waiter because they were so busy... I was personally a bit twitchy, because everything was delayed, I was scared we had to give our table away after 1 hour and 30 minutes (they told us at the beginning this was the case...). Luckily this didn't happen, but it would've been nice if someone told us we could take our time.
It's nice that you have the option to take everything home with you (like a doggy bag). But the waiter (I think he was a manager) forget to put our food in a doggy bag and we saw someone else throw away all our food... We told our waiter and he arranged a new doggy bag full of new pastries, which was really nice of him.
Overall, I think it was way too crowded and therefor waiters couldn't follow. It's sad because we didn't really get the whole experience and still had to pay a lot of money. Never the less we did have a nice experience, but I think we might go somewhere else next time...

Service was very poor. Our server took our order and disappeared until we finished the food. She did not come back and offer to refresh or refill anything.  We had to wait an extra 30 minutes after telling her we were done and ready for the check before she came back with it. For the money you spend, service should be perfect.

Lovely Surroundings, very fresh food, as much to eat as one wants, and amazing teas to chose from.  I tried the Vegan Afternoon Tea this time, was apprehensive that the wonderful classic tea I previously had would not be met - full marks for an extremely tasty Vegan option that was as fresh, varied and enjoyable as the conventional afternoon tea.
Un bel endroit pour passer un moment magique pour un afternoon tea typique de la tradition anglaise
Great service, lovely scenery and staff! The food was delicious and my wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our anniversary.

I came here with my mother and a family friend when they visited me from back home in Australia. We had a lovely time. All the food was delicious - excellent vegetarian selection for me, and they were very accommodating of any other dietary restrictions one might have. Our waiter, Christian, was extremely professional and polite, and worked hard to give us a smooth and warm experience. Overall it was a fantastic time and I will recommend it to everyone who asks.
Thank you very much for an, as usual, amasing experience. The vegetarian & vegan options were great. Your staff is so forthcoming and professional. We had a lovely afternoon!!

As always, an excellent choice. Unhurried athmosphere, uncluttered tables for privacy, unobtrusive, quick service. The only dissappointment were the scones - too dry and crumbly and stone cold.

We'll be back. Again and again.

First time visit in London and was so excited to experience High Tea. We selected Fortnum and Mason because it came highly recommend by a friend but we were very disappointed with the service. Our server was rude and he seems annoyed if it took us some time to decide what to get. It should have been easier if he explained or gave us recommendations since this is our first time. We have to call him to ask for refill of the food and tea. Good service for me is that you anticipate what your customers need. Food and teas are ok... nothing special.
Very enjoyable - sandwiches, scotch egg to start. The scones & cakes were delightful.

Unfortunately I found our service to be very poor. Our first waitress disappeared after serving us our initial order.  After that we had to continue to ask other servers to refill our water, tea and to refill our scones, etc... At one time a server that I asked for water handed that duty off to someone who handed to someone else who handed to someone else. Finally our server realized the original server had taken a break and he was relieving her. The ambiance is very nice but not worth the money in my opinion. I felt that we were very much ignored and was quite disappointed.
We were in London for holiday and was really looking forward to high tea. Our waiter was excellent and the food did not disappoint! Highly recommend their rare tea selection.
We came here for Afternoon area and it was absolutely fantastic! The staff were friendly and helpful, the food and tea were delicious and the tea room was so beautiful. Would highly recommend for!
Lovely place to have afternoon tea - would recommend to any one celebrating a special occasion or just ant occasion really.

Having had Afternoon Tea at another establishment in London, the tea at F&M was a disappointing experience. The service was slow, and our server rarely came to check on us and forgot to bring our refill of tea. The food was only alright, and highly sweetened. The scones were rather dry and crumbly‚Äî which was pretty disappointing. I‚Äôm sure this would be a fun afternoon tea with kids‚Äî but if you‚Äôre looking for a serious tea, great service, or even just delicious scones‚Äî look elsewhere.

Thoroughly enjoyed our afternoon tea. Staff were attentive and the food was delicious.  Unable to eat all and brought cake home with us all boxed up beautiful. Would definitely recommend if visiting London
It was such a fun experience

Fabulous afternoon on Saturday enjoying the traditional afternoon tea with my mum and sister. Great relaxed atmosphere but still very special. Great friendly service and of course delicious food - thanks again!

Been coming to F&M for a few years now, food is always great, this time the Coronation Chicken sandwiches were especially tasty. Scones always lovely and warm and cakes a nice little end to the feast. However on this occasion the service was lacking, the attentiveness was there to begin however dissipated after about 30 minutes. we had severable waiters coming to our table i think i counted about 7 different ones in the time we were their and we had to ask a few times for refills of the same items and for more tea, this took a good 15 minutes to come and we received apologies. This was the only down point of the visit, always love a visit but service this time was not up to standard for the price and the service charge they add to the bill.
Una exquisitez. Fuimos a las 12 del mediod√≠a y fue un placer porque hab√≠a poca gente. Una atm√≥sfera perfecta y la comida deliciosa.

I had been before and loved the experience so decided to take my daughter and friend and 2 friends for their birthdays but was very disappointed when we were only given one bag between 5 to take home and was never offered the complementary cake to take home as I had promised so was a bit embarrassing as I had told everyone they would get a little bag to take home as a memory

Second time I've been for afternoon tea. The tea is it's crowning glory here however the service staff didn't know much about the tea or origins which is a shame. Think they need more training. Cakes are great and so are scones, would recommend for special occasion
This was a very special occasion and I felt it was not that great value. Service was slow and our waiter was surly. Food was ok but the sandwiches were not great and the ham was awful

My son and I have afternoon tea here annually and go round the Christmas store, we always have such a lovely time. The service is excellent and sandwiches etc were just wonderful, I'm almost sure it was better this time than last but that's hard to believe because it is always so perfect.

Our experience was ruined waiting for our waitress to attend to us. Our tea and sandwiches had finished and we were waiting to order more. The service was poor in general and had left a bad taste in my mouth.
I have Afternoon Tea at least once a month and this by far was the worst.

On a recent visit to London, Fortnum‚Äôs was on my to do list of places to visit for an afternoon tea experience and it did not disappoint. The food was delicious and in abundance, and the tea, amazing. So much choice but the staff on hand were so attentive and helpful it made our experience that much more enjoyable. Would highly recommend visiting for the ultimate in high tea. And the store itself, delightful. I had to restrain myself from buying just about everything in sight. A lovely spot to get lost in and explore.

Wonderful venue to experience high tea. Compared to other "famous" places, the price here is a bit lower and the experience is fantastic. I did the high tea option, got the Welsh rarebit (yummy!), and asked for an extra scone (and got one). We also did the before tea "tea tutorial" thing where we learned about tea and how it's made and brewed. Totally worth it if you have the time and are interested at all.

Great service, great venue, feels like a special occasion even if it isn't. I will definitely be back next time I'm in London.

We had afternoon tea for my mother's 79th birthday and the entire experience was incredible. From the moment we arrived, the 'meet and greet' through to the service at the table was impeccable and personable. The food served absolutely delicious and the ambience was everything you would expect from such an establishment. As a born and bred Londoner, I have been fortunate enough to have been to many wonderful restaurants and hotels for cocktails or high tea, and Fortnum and Mason's has to be amongst the very best of them. Highly recommended whether you are a tourist to our great city, or a local like me!

A very nice Salon, good atmosphere. We chose here as they do Gluten free afternoon tea and it was delicious and the teas were great too. My only complaint was the service was frustratingly slow eg 30 mins to bring a sandwich which takes 30s to eat. Really annoying have to hunt down waiter to ask for more, makes you feel like you are a nuisance. Only 1 waiter would serve us, others actually ignored us like it is some sort of policy to do so. Again very annoying and took away from what could have been a really great experience.
Just lovely for a special occasion. Wonderful attentive, warm and efficient service. Delicious food.

This was the highlight of our trip to London. The food was excellent, and the tea was fantastic. The service made the whole experience even better. Jose and Jonathan were incredible, very attentive and helpful  in answering questions and making suggestions.

We had a lovely early Easter afternoon tea! The service was impeccable and the food delicious! Our family who has visited many other posh afternoon teas said this one ranks among the best! Nice piano player for mood music! So worth booking early!!

The ambience was delightful - especially with the piano playing in the background. The staff were extremely attentive. Unfortunately I thought there could have been more decaf options (I was given a pot with a teabag and this really came out weak and not very flavourful) and although the sandwiches and scones were delicious and plentiful, the small cakes were not to my taste at all - I am not fond of perfumed flavours nor jellified products, which seemed to make up a good part of the cake selection. However, the chocolate tart was nice and I was provided with another one of these on request.

I prefer more traditional cakes so will probably not go to Fortnums again for afternoon tea.
Stuff were so friendly and helpful! Very relaxing.

I was looking forward to a special afternoon tea experience as Fortnum and Mason is highly rated.

When you arrive, the venue is done up very well, with great ambience which puts you at ease and you can just sit there and relax. The service was also very good from the waiting staff.

Unfortunately, and most importantly, the reason we went to Fortnum and Mason was for the food! I was expecting a top quality food experience, and what we received was nothing close. The sandwiches were fine on the whole, with a good variety and quality was good enough - but I didn't pay ¬£50+ for a decent sandwich. The scones were ok, although the sweet scones were a bit too hard and dry. The cakes were extremely disappointing as they were all dry except the chocolate ganache cake (but that would be difficult to make dry!). The cakes were also very poor in terms of taste as well. The food was just simply not good enough and extremely disappointing as has put me off afternoon tea altogether for now.

As a side note, and this is not a unique problem to Fortnum by any means, but I was looking forward to enjoying some nice teas, but the problem is, once you pour your tea, it gets cold so quickly that you barely get a chance to drink and enjoy your tea as all you are left with is half a cup of cold tea - and what do you do with this? It would be great if these higher-end afternoon tea venues came up with a solution to this, such as a cup warmer of some sort.

Fantastic customer service, amazing food, perfect sense of celebration - we couldn't fault our time at Fortnum & Mason's Diamond Tea Room. The staff were attentive and informative but never over bearing. They made us feel welcome and relaxed as soon as we sat down. The birthday cake for my son was a lovely gesture and the food which was plentiful was superb. We would recommend this highly for afternoon tea.
My husband and I had a wonderful afternoon tes, thank you !
Good food but very slow service and they had run out of cocktail mix we asked for

A lovely traditional afternoon tea in a very lovely setting. Everything about it was quintessentially English with a feeling of ceremony which I love.

The finger sandwiches were delicious, the scones perfecly baked with the most delicious preserves. The little desserts looked spectacular if a little too sweet for me. There is also a table with more cakes to choose from. Everything is replenishable and if you cant eat it all it is boxed up perfectly in a Fortnum & Mason box and bag for you to take home.

I thought it was good value for money and would definitely return.
A really lovely occasiuon to celebrate my retirement and meet up with our daughter
Such a disappointing experience, scones were dry, service creepy from the waiter. Sandwiches also dry. Totally over priced. The manager tried to make it right but it was such a let down.

From the beautiful surroundings and friendly, attentive service to the traditional fortnums China,  gorgeous food (which was replenished without having to ask) plus the additional cakes from the trolley which we couldn't manage so they were parcelled in fortnum & mason boxes for us to take home.  I couldn't fault the afternoon tea and my 70 year old mum was made to feel special. A winner all round.

We thoroughly enjoyed afternoon tea at the Jubilee Tea Salon and the staff were outstanding. We had a minor accident with a spilled glass of champagne and the waiters who came to our assistance were kind, efficient and good humoured.

It is very expensive for some sandwiches...... And a small piece of cake
We were dispointed, it should be half price!
We were 2 persons ordering the savoury afternoon tea
Only one plat with the asperagus..... Was served, so we need to ask another one...it was not fair

So we will not recommend this experience
Fantastic service, quality food and outstanding cakes. Will definitely return!

The decor was very light and tasteful, the staff were well trained, polite and helpful. Unfortunately the tea was luke warm which spoilt the whole experience. The restaurant was very busy and it was hard to attract attention to order more tea. The warm scones came out with the sandwiches so were cold and dry when we ate them. Replacement scones were just as dry. Tea fancies were OK but more like petit fours than cakes. Overall it was very dissapointing. We expected a much better experience from this establishment.

Outstanding service throughout! Lovely, intimate setting. So British! I felt like a queen!
Just surprised that there was a service fee...

My wife and I went for afternoon tea as a birthday treat for her, the food was fantastic, the live pianist was a beautiful accompaniment and the customer service from every single member of staff was beyond excellent. We had a totally fantastic time and we have recommended it to everybody, huge thanks to everyone at F&M, we will definitely be returning.
We were treated to a wonderful experience by attentive staff who made us feel at home. Excellent choice of teas and the food was very good.

We had afternoon tea at Fortnum and Mason as a pre-wedding celebration. The food was good, and the service was fine, but nothing special. We had to go and find someone to get the bill at the end, for example.

There was a "discretionary" 12.5% service charge added to our bill. We left 10% for the server as well as the full cost of the food bill.

We were actually chased down by the waitress as we left for not paying enough of a service charge. As it was supposed to be a nice treat, we didn't fight it at the time. But for a shop that runs on it's reputation, I'm not sure how Fortnum and Mason have theirs.

A great way to feel special. Lived up to its reputation of a fine tea room. The staff were friendly and helpful. It was a special treat for us and provided us with a memory we won't forget. If any criticisms it would be that a little more selection on the cake trolley would be good. I would recommend the smoked Earl Grey tea. In general a lovely afternoon tea for two, though too expensive to do very often.

I booked this for a birthday pre theatre present as I had been here before in 2011 and was delighted with everything.. I was expecting the same this time. Sandwiches were pre plated (no stand!) and you had to ask for seconds as you did the savoury treats (scones etc) didn't like that as you felt greedy (only 1 canap√© of each choice per person for savoury treats) why not 2 we were a party of 2!! Only one piece of cake offered for afters.. Only 1 pot of tea each. Last time I came it was sumptuous and we even took home our little sweet treats we could not manage. This time there was nothing left to take and we came away hungry and disappointed. The only good thing was the food was tasty and the bottle of champagne. (Even that has gone up a lot in price) the service was good but I'd go to another venue next time. Standards are slipping a shame really.

I had been here for my Birthday for afternoon tea. It was so lovely and nice, with excellent food and service.
I decided to take my mum here for a surprise 70th Birthday tea. She had a wonderful time and loved the relaxed atmosphere.

Gorgeous spread. Very good value for money - they top up when it runs out and there's a generous cake selection on top of that.  Perfect English afternoon tea ambience. And great service - the staff organised a nice birthday surprise without us asking!
Relaxing and really nice experience with my friend from oversea. :)

Our daughter and son treated us to afternoon tea at Fortnum and Mason's to celebrate our Ruby Wedding Anniversary. The service was excellent and the food very good, but, as much as we enjoyed it, we felt it was far too expensive for what is essentially sandwiches and cakes! For ¬£90 we could have had a very good three course dinner! Honestly, ¬£90? The fashion for afternoon tea seems a nice little earner nowadays.

The setting of the restaurant is lovely, and of course afterwards Fortunum's is a great place to shop. Quite touristy nowadays though - something I don't recall from the 1970s when I worked nearby and regularly visited, but maybe I'm remembering with rose tinted glasses.

Anyway, overall I would recommend - so long as money is no object. We did enjoy ourselves very much. üòä

What a fabulous place, ambience,food & service were all excellent. We were given 2 free glasses of champagne as we had to wait a little while for them to take our order ( approx 10 mins). Can't wait to return again soon .
The most fantastic experience ever. Worth every penny. There is no other dining experience like it

The Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon at Fortnum and Masons is like stepping back in time and putting on a comfortable coat. The attentive service, from the greeters at the desk to the waiters at the tables, is exemplary. For my daughter and myself, this was a first time experience, something I had wanted to do for years.  It did not disappoint. We enjoyed every part of the afternoon, we were allowed to linger at our table, our teapots were replenished at regular  intervals with fragrant first growth teas and we took full advantage of the ability to refesh the plates full of sandwiches, cakes, scones. Although we can't have this as a first time experience ever again, we can make return visits and we will do.

I booked for 4 adults for an afternoon tea in the Diamond Jubilee Salon to end our long weekend in London.
They all enjoyed it but one of the comments was,thought the water should have been included in the price.
Otherwise an excellent afternoon
I've been to several high teas in different places and i would NOT recommend  Fortnum & Mason at all.

The sandwiches were excellent and the cakes were interesting, however service was a bit slow, especially at the beginning when it took a long time for them to take our drinks order and bring these to us.

Our afternoon tea was a birthday treat and what a treat it was, the whole experience was just fabulous. Food, service, presentation etc was top class and for those of you who think finger food isn't filling, think again because you can have as many helpings as you want. In fact, our waiter actively pointed out we could order extra of anything we wanted plus recommended a trip to the cake trolley!
If you are thinking of going for an afternoon tea then Fort number & Mason must be on top of you list.
Fabulous experience. Service excellent and not rushed. We were there 2 1/2 hours and could have stayed longer if we wished. Left-over food placed in a bag/bog to take home.
A truly wonderful experience with great food in abundance. Lovely staff inform you that you can have as much as you like which is very generous. Fancy and informal at the same time.

Third visit and just as good every time. A friend recommended high tea over afternoon tea which for just ¬£4 more you get hot food instead of finger sandwiches. The atmosphere is lovely and you are not rushed like some other places in London which are also very touristy. The food and tea is delicious and the service is good. It is expensive but you get what you pay for, there were two of us and the bill was ¬£99 (they include 12.5% service charge which I disagree with anywhere but at least the service is good here).

We had a very nice afternoon tea at F&M. Staff was very friendly and attentive, and the food was lovely. Restocking the food was no problem and we got a nice little box with the left overs....
Certainly recommendable. The dining room could have a bit more atmosfere, its rather large and sterile.
Loved the atmosphere! The service was excellent. the staff very helpful and polite. Made me feel very special! A place to relax and feel valued.
sandwiches were great, and so were the scones. The cakes though were simply sweet - no individual flavour, and the eclair was dry. Very disappointing. Service was good - lovely staff.
The Benedict eggs and ham was gorgeous and the scones, jams, cheese cream are perfect as well. We had a wonderful time here.
It was a wonderful afternoon, like in the good old days. Peaceful and quiet.
An excellent relaxed afternoon

We have traditionally gone to the Ritz for high tea when in London but the shine has really gone their product. What a great surprise when my daughter found your establishment mentioned in an article recently and we went along to sample a leisurely afternoon tea.

Service was fantastic right through from arrival to paying the bill. The tea was lively - bought some downstairs to take home.

The waiters were very helpful with guiding us to choose refreshing teas and delicious savouries and cakes from the 'afternoon tea'selection.The atmosphere was warm and friendly. I really appreciated the way we weren't rushed and had plenty of time to catch up with the family.

This venue is light and airy, has decent service and offers quite a nice afternoon tea that did leave us a little uninspired. The food was plentiful, replenished as you would want, sandwiches absoluely did the trick and scones were crisp on the outside and fluffy on the in. The cakes were very disappointing, expecially from the jubilee trolly, we felt we could have done as well if not better with a home bake. There was a very good team menu, and we did indulce in some champagne which we felt was reasonably priced. This is more of an upmarket canteen, if you want amazing food, service and something really special, we love the Goring.
very attentive and freindly staff. Helped make Afternoon tea in this wonderful establishment a very enjoyable and memorable experience.
Amazing food.
Starters were nice. Small venue. Chicken kebabs were over cooked. Amazing lMb kabhib. Probably wouldn't go again s nothing special and other cheaper options.
Phenomenal service and very peaceful, recommended definitely and the food was outstanding WOW!

Very convenient location for theater goers (we were going to see a show at the Queen's Theatre which is directly across the street).

Good food, wasn't very busy.

Really nice, great value value Thai restaurant with really tasty food.  What's not to like.  Great location in centre of London theatreland.  Just about perfect for good value pre-theatre dining.  Can't recommend enough.
really nice food just a shames we had to rush it to go to the theatre

A friend and I went for supper at Thai Tho on Rupert Street the other week and it was absolutely fantastic! The food was wonderful, the service was fast and the venue was very cosy- I definitely recommend this restaurant and can't wait to go back.
We went for my mums birthday, all the staff were lovely and treated us so wonderfully! My mum had the most amazing time!! Food was sensational!! Will definitely be going back!

it was a lunch of a very special kind.
we were the only table but things went very wrong from the start.
the staff did their best to keep us happy, full marks to them.
A Monty Python or Fauwlty Tower experience
Very positive interesting flavours with good service, surprising it is not much busier!

Thoroughly enjoyed our first visit to Petrichor and decided to make a return visit last Monday with other family members.  We took advantage of the special offer of 3 courses for ¬£20.50 - food was artistically presented, cooked to perfection and we felt excellent value for money, particularly as at the end of the meal the waiter surprised us all by producing a beautiful chocolate birthday cake for my mother (94 years young), many thanks Petrichor it really made her day.  We will return.

Firstly, the food was all fantastic. The only problem was with the service - at first we were haughtily told we couldn't sit at our table, as it wasn't time, but when we got in, the restaurant was empty! It was also somewhat haphazard - overly attentive at times (moving us out of the way to brush crumbs away, we're only going to make more - who cares!) and ignoring us when we actually needed them. Our main course was a little cold, and arrived with no cutlery! We waited quite a while before they brought them over (which may be why the food was so cold). Once the maitre d realised what was happening he took care of us after that, and the service was then excellent. If we'd had him the whole time I would've rated the service as excellent!

We enjoyed our meal at this restaurant at The Cavendish in London. We chose the pre theatre menu, however, this was very limited, especially as neither of us like spinach and out of the four mains. 2 had spinach and another was vegetarian. Luckily we like chicken, which was the final option. The wines were quite pricey, even by West End standards. The staff were pleasant and friendly.
Surprsingly delicious though the menu sounded a bit so what.  Petrichor's pre-theatre menu was just the ticket.
David Britton at the Cavendish had brilliant food and was in a great location for a night out in London. Although I felt the price was too high, I had a very enjoyable evening at the Cavendish.
Lacks the atmosphere of the Spitalfields branch but still a great place to catch up with friends.

Ok so this is a proper Italian restaurant. It‚Äôs not cheap but neither is a Dolce snd Gabbana coat-you‚Äôre paying for the quality and the attention to detail. We had the three course theatre  meal and the food was excellent quality, taste and great portions size and for ¬£35 you will not find better. The wine menu is quite expensive so they could do with a few more bottles around the ¬£40 mark. The service was excellent and not too fussy and they had a great live singer. For a moment I felt like I was in an Italian restaurant in New York. It‚Äôs a great restaurant and I‚Äôll be going back. The theatre menu and wine came to about ¬£125 for two so reasonable for this great place.
This was an absolute gem! I cannot recommend highly enough. The food was outstanding, the staff were extremely polite and friendly! Lovely setting,.. a fantastic night. We will be back!
Everything was brilliant! Loved the interior as well
Really enjoyed- very attentive and quick service and lovely food

Unfortunately our order was completely messed up, staff weren‚Äôt very apologetic, some food wasn‚Äôt cooked properly either.
Have been to other 28-50 restaurants and didn‚Äôt get this service so think it was unfortunate
Great laid back ambience and style, perfect for a special dinner or a casual drink & snack. We had a great evening.

Good location, great service and wine list. Vegetarian and Vegan food choice is limited but probably due to Covid. Champagne was good value for money! They kindly allowed us to have our table longer than our allotted slot.
Would definitely go again.
Delicious food but over-priced wine, even by usual restaurant standards.

I had a lovely lunch here with a friend. We had the lunch menu which offered plenty of choice for a great price. The food was amazing and I would really recommend the cod!  The service was excellent and I will definitely come back and hopefully be able to enjoy the sunshine on the terrace!
Absolutely the best food I‚Äôve eaten in London. Beautiful restaurant and the service was spot on too. For the quality and quantity of food, I also felt that the price was very reasonable.
Really beautiful place and the service was greatB
Good food, service and ambience.  And Judita was very helpful in getting us the table we asked for.
I always enjoy this place - can‚Äôt wait to go back
Both starters and mains were fantastic. Food to remember. The service did not let the food down.
Fantastic evening - thank you

Loved it loved it loved it! What a smashing and different place. Food was delicious and I didn‚Äôt feel stuffed afterwards, just comfy as one should be after three courses.
We had cocktails and delicious wine and were happy lingering after lunch until 4pm, which we appreciated enormously.
The staff were delightful, warm and friendly but not obsequious.
LeEscargot is our new favourite place in town.

Very nice French restaurant in a very busy part of London. The food was excellent, the service was fine but it is a bit on the expensive side. They specialize in Escargot and they lived up to the billing. I would recommend it for someone looking for a nice meal in the area.

Obviously a famous restaurant and the food was very good indeed.   There was something rather strange about the service.  It was as though they didn't expect the diners to have any view about what they wanted to have and when and in what order.  Hey ho!
Excellent experience. Luv this place
A beautiful place with good food but not too exciting. 8 out of 10 for quality
Yet another amazing visit. Food, wine, service, cost: all perfect.
Cocktails and white and red wines were ordered and the first arrived with the first course, instead of before. Service was a little muddled!
Fabulous food and a lovely atmosphere, have never not enjoyed this restaurant is a gem

Very good food, les escargot super au Ricard very tasty and well cooked!
The confit de canard a bit too cooked. The furniture is a bit kitsch but the ambience is extremely nice, you don't have to shout like in other restaurants of the area.
The service was very kind and attentive, impeccable!

Took advantage of the special offer at L'Escargot - unbelievable offer.  Fabulous place, great service and excellent food.  Good choice from a set menu. And absolutely love the piano player. Just love this restaurant.

We had a fabulous time at L'Escargot.  Food was amazing in itself; however, it was eclipsed by the service which was so friendly and attentive - and it wouldn't be hyperbole to say it was the best service I've had at any French restaurant in London.

Excellent food and drink. Chocolate souffl√© is worth the 20min wait. Recommend retiring to the upstairs bar afterwards which was a joy - and an opportunity to see a few of the quirky rooms in the building.

My dining companion and I were really pleased to return here after a period of about four years.   The restaurant certainly has a winning formula- good atmosphere from the start, very attentive and unobtrusive service, and excellent food.   I had the snails as I consider it essential to have their signature dish, followed by stone bass, then a tarte.   My companion chose the smoked salmon starter, then the duck dish and finished  with ice cream.   We enjoyed the complimentary champagne, and chose a house wine which was very good.   We will certainly return!!

A charming place and ideal for a romantic dinner a deux.  Food was very good and service excellent.  It has a classic French bistrot menu.  The halibut was particularly good, the scallops a little heavy on the garlic. Would certainly return.
My husband and I have eaten in this restaurant whenever we were in London since the 1990's. I believe It has recently changed hands however the food, service, atmosphere and friendliness continues.

A very pleasant quiet restaurant in the heart of Soho. Superb service led by an extremely polite and courteous young gentleman from the Czech Republic.
Food choice was good, quality excellent and and reasonably priced, wine choice seemed fair also with a good range of French wines at differing price levels.
I would visit again.
Air condition made the room a bit cold as the weather outside was not really warm however when pointed out to staff it was turned off, a part from this great food and excellent wine.
We had a very good evening with good food and outstanding, charming, flexible service in a lovely room. I would not hesitate to go back and would recommend it wholeheartedly.
One diner had an issue with her meal and the staff rectified this immediately although there was no price reduction offered. Food was reasonable - a good place for a pre-theatre meal.

Nice ambience at L'escargot and a lovely wine list. The pre theatre dinner was lovely except the main course has cheap cuts of meat etc
Wine list good and not expensive

What an excelent Restaurant.  Love the neighbourhood, excellent service and greta food.  Only problem is that the ladies toilet is upstairs and though we got our ground floor dining room table our elderly guest had more troubles with the stairs.  As an exampleo of the excellent service they suggested to close off the male toilet and have our guest use that instead!.

Our first visit to L'Escagot and we were certainly not disappointed.  The dining room is particularly attractive with lovely lighting if slightly too warm! We went for the set lunch which was excellent value and the recommended house wine which was, again, very good.  Service was most attentive - all the staff were very friendly and welcoming.  Will definitely go again.

Like going back to an old friend and my guest really enjoyed.
good value and every attempt made to adapt to special dietry requirements

Nice restaurant, if a little formal.  It might be a better venue for a couple rather than a group.  Very good value for the quality of food, not something you would usually associate with a Marco Pierre White restaurant.
L Escargot was superb and Im sorry I didnt getb the chance to go back before Christmas!

This was the first time I had been to L'Escargot for some years. The staff were friendly, we were shown to our table immediately and the service was excellent. The food was absolutely superb - not too simple and not too elaborate - the white peach souffle with rhubarb compote was heavenly! My companion had to have the lamb since it came from St Asaph, where his father lives. All in all, a great evening and not at all expensive.

A

L'escargot is an old friend. I must have been going there for 20 years or so now since I first worked near Oxford Circus. It is a charming restaurant so scores higher for ambience than many newer establishments. My guest and I chose Christmas related courses which were very good. Trying not to boast but my roast potatoes at home are better than theirs but a general Christmas spirit was given by what we ate.

The value for money was good too. Would of course go again.

Arrived 30 min late for 10.30 res, but staff were thoroughly hospitable, even warm! The ambience and decor is fantastic, a fairly large room that still manages to be intimate. Food was a VERY mixed bag though - ravioli starter was skilfull and creative, crab tian was workmanlike. Scallop mains delicious but lacked flair, duck served on potatoes I swear came from a can! Dessert a bizarre creme brulee. Prices for food v. reasonable, no decent wine below ¬£60. I'll give it a 2nd chance someday
Worst cocktail I have ever tasted

Having been recommended this restaurant as a nice place for lunch, we were disappointed to find that it was quite empty and mismatched from an ambience/decor point of view in the context of its enviable location. Generally my hallmark of a good Indian eatery is the masala chai, so despite the intense heat outside that was my choice of drink; unfortunately it tasted like tea-flavoured water and it was clear that it was a teabag chai rather than authentic - unfortunately first impressions make a huge impact because despite the food being reasonable in terms of taste, I wasn‚Äôt wowed overall.

The dahi puri had a tasty filling but the puri itself was a touch stale, the chicken kathi roll wasn‚Äôt much to rave about and this was the limited menu - I was unfortunately fooled by the exuberant, colourful pictures of the food prior to coming here and I think the main items which were showcased on various review sites had been stopped due to COVID (eg. Okra fries, etc.). Big disappointment.

In future, I‚Äôd probably take the time to walk a few more steps towards Carnaby street and just get my Indian fix from Dishoom instead.
Lovely place, delicious meal and soo yummy cake Black Forest, polite personal!!! Thank you everyone for a great service and a cozy atmosphere!!!
Excellent service. The food was fantastic, and great value for money. I would definitely recommend this place fur any fish lover. Will definitely be back.
Wide variety of dishes and well priced. Service was good

We dined on a Monday lunchtime so it was very quiet, maybe some background music would help? We ordered 3 courses each, all different dishes to try as much as possible. Lobster salad was fantastic as was the beef tartare but the seared tuna was a bit uninspiring. Main courses; the lamb was cooked and rested well but the smokey pepper was the dominating flavour of the dish and took away from the lamb/aubergine/tapenade. The dexter beef was cooked well but the borlotti beans were undercooked. The brill with coco beans was the standout dish. Side dishes of tomato salad, green beans and creamed spinach were all fine but the portion of spinach was pitiful. For dessert we had lemon custard tart - lovely pastry but needed more lemon! The salted caramel tart with ice cream was nice but too sweet. I think a milk or yoghurt ice cream/sorbet would have balanced it better. The strawberry sorbet with tea cake was actually raspberry sorbet! And the teacake that was supposed to accompany it didn‚Äôt arrive. We did mention this to the waiter who said he would check with the chef but he didn‚Äôt return. Petit fours of 3 different chocolate shards were tasty albeit a little boring, I was expecting something nicer for a restaurant of this standard in Browns Hotel. Service was friendly enough. It‚Äôs not cheap to dine here and I probably wouldn‚Äôt return as there were a lot of things missing.
Compared to the branch in High Street Kensington I felt that this venue needed some TLC. A little bit dated compared to what I am normally used to going to.
Everything‚Äôs was very nice.
Amazing as always mery our server was lovely . Food great pina colda great service great well done

We came to Heliot on Sunday 6th December for our wedding anniversary / husbands birthday and I have to say it was an absolutely fantastic experience. The food was out of this world! Easily one, if not the best fillet steaks I‚Äôve had. The waiting staff, especially David were fabulous!
One of my biggest peeves is when waiters come and ask you how the food is, every 5 minutes especially when youve got food in your mouth, and there was none of that, which was a very welcomed addition.
The finishing touch was the little note on our desserts wishing us a happy anniversary. We shall definitely be booking in again the next time we are in London
Food was beautiful, and well priced. Would definitely go again
Fantastic meal, really friendly and helpful waitress, had a great evening
Excellence service from Carlos, food was delicious and good value for money. Had a brilliant evening. Just be aware of the service charge as this increased my bill by ¬£20

My friend and I had tickets to Magic Mike Live so had the pre-theatre deal for ¬£20.00 each.  This included a glass of bubbly and a choice of steak and lobster tail with fries or halloumi burger.  We both had the steak and lobster and it was delicious and cooked to perfection.  Pudding was brownie and icecream which was also delicious.  Excellent VFM.

We had a lovely time - thanks so much.
Diet requirements accommodated - everyone was happy :)
We dined before the Magic Mike show and decided to have 2 filet steaks with bottle of Prosecco instead of set pre show menu and was worth every penny..look forward to a return visit soon.

Excellent front of house host warm welcome took us too our table were we were introduced to our waitress who was American excellent waitress talked us through menu and wine list drinks came straight away we got bread for table food took about 15 mins 9 oz fillet steak medium rare was sensational sweet potato fries lovely lobster tail very good.Overall an excellent experience overlooking casino so atmosphere was electric.
Food amazing. Had to wait over 30 mins just to get our drinks
Would highly recommend the Heliot Steak House! Service was exceptional even after arriving late due to traffic. Food was amazing and such good value for money!
Delicious food with great service, just a little disappointed we didn‚Äôt get a view of the casino at our table. Definitely be returning for more steak!
Excellent venue and value for a pre-theatre meal and drink
Great service, excellent value of set menu, very good atmosphere and location. Would highly recommend and will be back
Great spot, location, ambiance, table were ideal. Highly recommended.

I went to the Heliot Steak House for my 3 year anniversary, with my partner who is a massive fan of Steak, and we both agreed, that the Steak was probably the best we have ever had.

This includes some of the more well known steak restaurants in London. The meat was tender, and flavorful, it was cooked beautifully and served, with a good amount of fries and the Lobster tails were absolutely delicious. The wait staff were friendly and attentive, and gave us time to consider our order without being pushy or forceful.

We will definitely be back the only question is when...
Steaks were really good, we enjoyed every mouthful! Would recommend this steak house.
Consistently good highly recommend their steaks always attentive services
Anniversary

Great food in a unique venue. Good value steak & lobster offer with champagne and dessert. Service excellent, our waitress Jennifer was courteous and professional, nothing was too much trouble. Would definitely return.

Service was good, food spot on and a nice place to watch from afar. Servers notified us on special offers and what was recommended. Overall a lovely meal with. I've surroundings. Good value for money, will return.
Amazing food, great atmosphere and a lot of fun! We will definitely be back. Thanks Heliot!

Great fun overlooking the casino, the steak was superb and the service was exceptional. I was on a date where we had dinner first then went to the theatre and afterwards hit the casino. Not a cheap night out by any means but great for something special with good foo and all the entertainment under one roof.
Service was excellent throughout the night, food was great especially the dessert. Nice atmosphere overlooking the gambling floor. Definitely recommend.

Yes, it is the best steak in town.
Food very good quality, service excellent, a little pricey but to be honest I don't mind paying a little more if the quality of the food is to this high standard every time.

We booked a table for two for lunch before going to theatre. We were the only 2 people in the restaurant at 12.30pm, so it lacked a bit of buzz, but the service and food were excellent and with tables overlooking the main gaming floor it was a great view whilst we are.
The menu was very limited which I was initially very disappointed about, but that all disappeared when the steak arrived which was tender and cooked to perfection and good value for Central London
Would highly recommend
Great steak and sides, quick and friendly service, atmosphere was a good pre-theatre experience.

The Heliot Restaurant is part of the Hippodrome Casino. The ambience is not quite as glamorous as it sounds as the casino seems to attract tourists from nearby Leicester Square, but the food can't be faulted: the pork belly is gorgeous and the miniature ice cream cones for dessert are delicious. Service is quick and unobtrusive and a meal is really excellent value with a Toptable offer. We booked for a meal before a show in the casino's Matcham Room (which can't be faulted), an intimate space for a performance, so it was a really good evening out.
The best food one could ask for superb service too
Very good pizzas and food. Wine beautiful but pricey. Great service though.
Above average food with large portions, BUT very over priced for what it is. Wine also very expensive, nearly all wines over ¬£50.  Just caters for rich set but no real frills on the plate.

I honestly felt that they forgot to put any salt or anything on my Artichokes ..it was absolutely bland.

The Carpaccio was awesome as were the other starters.
Couple of the pastas too were not great ( actually no flavour ) .. But the Ragu was excellent and so was the Cheesecake.

The atmosphere is very sophisticated and the service is outstanding,  food is real italian, we loved the scialatielli and linguine con astice , a bit disappointed on focaccia con mozzarella because we were expecting mozzarella and focaccia separately instead it was melted mozzarella on top of the focaccia but it was really nice anyway ! More than recommend,  we did have a great experience:)
Food was terrific. Downstairs is more of a "bar" atmosphere and quite noisy. If you want something quieter and more intimate, sit upstairs. They do take reservations.

Time and again a great restaurant - Simply delicious! They have a wide selection of choice on their menu and staff are very knowledgeable to assist with any questions and helped make an excellent choice, cooked to perfection also. Overall a really superb meal.

On arrival we were told that our sitting was 1hr 45 mins which isn't the most welcoming start. We ordered and our food was all fine and arrived promptly but my wine didn't arrive until we had finished our starter and I had reminded someone that I had ordered it. Best part of the meal was the chocolate fondant dessert.  All in all it's very overpriced for what you get, and actually a little bit tacky.

The food was really overpriced. The aubergine and mozzarella starter was ¬£17 yet it was miniscule! It‚Äôs only aubergine, a bit of tomato and cheese - how expensive is it to make?

We had the seabass on Specials to share for two with green beans and potatoes - really nothing special at ¬£70 and I have tasted better in chain Italian restaurants such as Zizzi‚Äôs.

We were initially going to order seperate seabass which came with potatoes, olives and tomatoes at ¬£22 each but the waiter told us to go for the seabass for two instead. Only later we discovered that it was ¬£70 and had we just ordered what we originally wanted, it would have been ¬£44 all together. I thought that was really poor.

I eat in Mayfair\ Chelsea all the time and don‚Äôt mind shelling out for food - in fact trying out new restaurants is my pass time - but I must also get value for money and not just feel that I have paid in excess for a basic meal and pretty much just funded the restaurants overheads, rent and rates,
Lovely food and atmosphere. Would definitely come here again. Staff very friendly and helpful. Good range of wines.
Great service, great atmosphere, great restaurant. Thanks for our perfect date üòä

A fine experience, with the truffle pizza providing an excellent meal. The space is energetic and quite good for an informal dinner. Desert measured up to a fine dining establishment. Service was friendly and efficient.
Food was really good and good value for money . Service was a little slow from front of house but it didn‚Äôt affect our evening visit to the theatre so no dramas.
Food fine, eat at 6.00pm friday eve pre Theatre and place was empty........

The service at Benares was incredible, we could not have asked for anything more. The food was worth every penny, so delicious and well presented. We would definitely go back and recommend the restaurant and experience to everyone!
Delicious food and excellent service. The bottomless thali was excellent value for such a lovely restaurant.
Another fantastic meal here.  It's really good to have indian food which is a bit different.  Service was spot on - loved the cocktails.
Pricey but well located, delicious food and outstanding service.
The food was fresh, complex, and delicious with flavors that matched perfectly. The wine selection was great as well. The creative dishes are worth a visit.
Okay place. Experience was much lower than expected standard.
Having been there previously with my wife we decided to take our children with us this time around. The service was exemplary and the food exquisite
food and service were mediocre. very overpriced for what it is
Had an amazing experience until got a bad tummy
I would highly recommend Benares, great decor, excellent food and a great wine list

Absolutely stunning food served in an unpretentious and relaxed setting. Let's be honest, this is an expensive and occasional treat for most people, including us, but we had been looking forward to our visit for ages as big fans of Atul Kuchar and Benares still exceeded our expectations. Knowledgeable and informative staff helped to create a great experience, whilst the tasting menu with paired wine flights showed off the full range on the menu to great effect.

6 of the 7 dishes we had were absolutely fantastic, with Lamb Rogan Josh a stand out and elevating the flavours of the one from a local curry house to a whole new level. Even the one dish my partner and I were not totally won over by, Salmon with Crab Croquette, was fantastic in its constituent parts - we just werent convinced it worked together as a cohesive whole dish.

But this was a very minor point in what was an absolutely wonderful evening and one we will remember (and probably bore people about!) for a very long time!

Great service, great food, great place to go,

Class

Thank you we loved it

Really overpriced food, which is not gourmet at all. We are vegetarians so ordered the paneer main dish and some vegetarian side-dishes. We found the bland, very little taste which even needed proper seasoning - i.e. salt. The main dish was 30 pounds and was two chunks of plain tasting paneer on some chole - which was kind of an insult. Vegetable side dishes lacked any care and attention and were simply tossed to make something the chefs thought passable for consumption. We mentioned the issues with the food, and the waiters did bring something that was much better - so that was something. The food was however way overpriced and nothing special at all - even when it was redone. The general impression was that vegetarian food was not really considered a delicacy or something that needed to be done well - which considering India has more vegetarians than the rest of the world combined  -  was absurd
absolutely delicious food again the baby aubergine and mushroom side dishes were superb addition. we just love Benares food!
Everything was perfect, the welcome, the cocktails, the food, the wine and the service. It was buzzing yet we still felt like we had special treatment.
On what was a fantastic food experience, the creme br√ªl√©e really let the place down ..... Sort it out guys or take it off the menu!!
As always Indian dining at its finest can only recommend to anyone and everyone
Food and service amazing! Ambience spoilt by 3 tables of rowdy male diners. A pity!

I have wanted to visit Benares for a long time it was my birthday and we decided to go. We were disappointed . It is very dated we felt the food was good but not exceptional. The service was not what I have experienced before for Michelin star. Staff on the whole not that bothered the only person who showed any interest was our wine waiter. It was very disappointing. The size of the bill did reflect the enjoyment. Very expensive. I am a huge Atul Kochhar fan so it made it all the more disappointing as I said food was nice just not great.
This was unexpectingly perfect. The food was fabulous, the service attentive without being intrusive. The choices were varied. All in all a fantastic first experience, I will be back
Great food (super soft lamb) well presented ,  knowledgeable staff, good ambience . Strongly recommended.
first visit but would not return.  food lovely but over-priced.  shared starter, 2 mains, 1 bottle red and 2 G&T a staggering ¬£180.
The environment and surroundings were very pleasant indeed and overall it was a good experience

Food wasn't too bad tbh. We had the taster menu. Although I would recommend this restaurant, I personally wouldn't come back as I was a bit dissadpointed regarding inside the restaurant . Being an Asian restaurant there wasn't anything in the place that said INDIAN.
As we walked in, the background music was of the 'English kind' I expected something like a sitar to get 'in the mood' Sat down in the quite large dining area upstairs and saw nothing on the walls or any ornamonts that represented an Indian theme. Not even an elephant!! It was almost like he tried his best to hide anything Indian!!

So there u have it!
Namaste!!!!!!

As you enter this Micehlin starred restaurant you feel slightly underwhelmed. Its decor is very understated. You are courteously greeted and taken to the dining area and seated. The staff are attentive and neither rush you or leave you waiting. The choice for the set lunch time menus was just enough. The food was the best Asian food I have every tasted. So flavoursome yet with the right amount if 'kick'.  It was beautifully presented and the staff explained each course. The first course was small - however, by the time you had had the other 2 courses, you realise that it is plenty for lunch. I would recommend it. It was a lovely experience from start to finish. Downside - well the wine is always expensive in restaurants isn't it!

Decided to have the 3 course set menu. Food was v good quality thou the portion for starters was rather small. The ambience is good but nothing 'benares' about it - lacked character. Atul - what is your take on 'Banarsi' paan?
This is a real treat to taste other curry dishes than your normal madras, tandori(s). This is a new modern take on 'curry' e.g. tandori chicken caesar salad, yummy! Definitely will go back.

Over all I am not a fan of Indian food but my husband is.
Having said that-I thought the food was pretty good, my husband really loved it.
I totally loved the chef's cocktail!!!

Amazing restaurant was recommended to me by a friend.. I will be doing the same. Went for the set menu the fish starter excellent, chicken main delicious and the sticky toffee pudding out of this world! Service was also first class :)
Impressed with general sevice and food.
Probably the finest meal I've eaten. It took quality to another level. Only slight criticism would be that while the wines are excellent they're also pricey.

We had tasted Atul Kotchhar's food elsewhere, so had an idea of what to expect. The food was certainly up to expectations, with the signature black daal, and the scallops, being exceptional, as were the cocktails featuring Indian spices. We have to admit to being a little disappointed with the service. Although there appeared to be an abundance of service staff, there were long intervals between being offered and served drinks, then having the food order taken. While a chicken dish for two was being carved at the table, there was no one to serve the other two dishes to the other two diners, leaving a clearly embarassed kitchen brigade member to start serving them himself. Then asking for the bill, then waiting, and waiting...Needs polishing

Very average food for the price. Starters were ok, but nothing amazing.As mains we had 2 of the whole tandoori chicken, which was very overcooked and dry. One of our guest's ate none of it and left it on his plate. The waiter removed his plate without even asking what was wrong... I've had better food in many high street indian restaurants at a fraction of the price.
I havent been to Benares for a couple of years, but it seems the standard has dropped significantly. It all seems a bit tired.

I have eaten before there in a business seting but the food was a special menu and more a mix of small bites than a complete meal. The a la carte option was more complete.

Very nice food.

My initial impression was that Thursday nights were not the best night for 1:1 dining for couples as the majority of clientele were business people, one or two with laptops on display and the volume of noise was very high. Service was very attentive but perhaps a bit over the top. We chose Crispy Soft Shell Crab which was a bit too greasy but rest of dish was nice. He had King Prawn, Scallop & Squid which he enjoyed. I had the chicken which was tasty. We were dis-suaded from over-ordering extras. Desserts were good.
The bill ¬£210 was astronomical - while the food was good, it was not outstanding or indeed the best ever, but you are paying for location and all the personal attention. We vowed this second visit was our last.

I just enjoyed a truly inspiring meal at Benares. The food was excellent. Whilst the portions were not huge by the end of the meal I was satisfied.

It worked out at around ¬£100pp but we drank about ¬£42 of cocktails each. So the meal and the wine pairing set us back around ¬£58pp. Please try the wine pairing it really did make a difference.

If you want to be made to feel special and you want to sample the delights of some seriously quality food and receive quality service do one thing. Go to Benares and treat yourself.

This was my second visit in 2 years. Whilst my clients really liked their food I got very ill from the pigeon (starter) on the set menu.

My first experience was not bad so on balance, I can't say its a bad restaurant. However, I will not be hurrying back to the place.

Benares isi an Indian restaurant in the West End, London.  The restaurant has a lovely look and feel.  The staff were impeccable and service was prompt, friendly and efficent.  We ate from the set menu.  The Beetroot-Mozzarella starter was excellent but the pigeon was tough and chewy.  In terms of mains, the chicken was excellent while the pollock was disappointing and visually unappealing.  The pudding was delicious.  Overall a very pleasant lunch and I would recommend Benares and go back.
Great food. The service was a little overbearing, but generally a good experience.
Amazing light healthy and tasty indian
Beautiful decor, excellent services and great fushion flavours

Very pleasant. Good food. Only criticisms: glasses of wine with the set menu were very small, the  toilets could have been cleaned more regularly the automatic addition of a service charge also annoyed me. This is unfortunate for the staff who, had I not been cajoled in this way, would probably have received more than the 12.5%. I would also note that the dessert, whilst good, was not as outstanding as the other two dishes I sampled. Set menu is good value - hope it changes regularly.

Tried the Diwali offer of 3 courses for ¬£25. Loved the wine pairing with food and my plaice massala was very tasty. The fried rice dessert was a poor choice, but the deserts my friends chose were really good.

I had dinner with my husband at Benares last Saturday. We had thought to go with the fixed price menu but it was very limited, so we had the 4 course Chef's Suggestion menu with wines. The food was delicious and well presented, the wines were well chosen and the service was great. Overall, a bit pricey but nice for a treat.

Wow! Great atmosphere, friendly and attentive staff. Food is delicious! The pear cumin bellini was a great surprise. Was wondering how it would taste and it was actually fantastic! You have to ask to make the food spicy if you are looking at having a nice spicy Indian food.

We went to Benares in London for our wedding anniversary and had a Lovely time. The food was nice although I probably expected better for the price. Still a great evening though and to be honest I can be a fussy eater.

Benares - London

Again an excellant meal, the flavours are just amazing and at ¬£20 for two courses with coffe and a glass of wine, a bargin

Exceptional in all departments, the food was beautifully presented and cooked, with an incredible array of flavours and textures. Excellent wine list, with a unique way of preparing the wine.
The dessert was unbelievably good. Will definitely return.

Benares of Berkely Square London is the best Indian Restaurant I have ever been to. The grazing menu, though pricey, is fantastic - and after 13 courses you do not feel bloated. I shall definitely revisit.
PO Sussex.

Our evening at Benares was amazing.  This was truly an unforgettable dining experience.  We went for the set meal as we were on a bit of a budget, and wanted to enjoy some wine as well, which we did, and I can say that the Sommelier's recommendations were spot on.   Overall...fantastic food, knowledgeable staff and top notch service - nothing was too much trouble and they even printed some material on the wines for us as well.  Stopped for a drink in the bar after and this was delicious as well.
Excellent deal, would definitely recommend.
Benares was fabulous!  The food and service were superb.  All of our party thoroughly enjoyed the evening.  I would highly recommend this restuarant.
Excellent food and service was to be had at Benares.  I would highly recommend it.

Benares is an excellent restaurant. The starter and main course was presented well and each dish had a distinct flavour and taste. The chocolate mousse desert was very complex which I didn%u219t like. I found prices on the high side for my budget.
Overall I would recommend this restaurant especially for a special occasion.
The set lunch menu is fantastic value - the food  and service were both great.  Would highly recommend it!

our dining experience at benares could not be falted.  From the bar staff as we sipped our pre dinner drinks to the fresh vibrent plates of food that were served to us.  I had asked if they could organise a surprise as it was my husbands birthday, and after our meal they arrived out with a plate of petit fours  and a song!.I would highly recommend the restaurant for its flavourful ,unusual indian recipes friendly  service,and relaxing dining room.

Enjoyed our meal but thought it was over priced for what it is. Service was great and ambience excellent - still for a Michelin star restaurant I thibk it has a lot to learn from the likes of Petrus etc.

We had the special 3 courses for ¬£29.99 at Benares. Somehow, with wine and the extra that seemed to have been charged for either bread or poppadoms, we ended up spending twice that.

However, the food was really nice and the service was very good. One advantage of having a restricted set menu is that you get to try things that maybe you wouldn't normally order, which is great. We want to go back and try the full menu sometime soon.

Thought Banares would be a good venue for a client lunch and something different from the usual Italian. The food was OK but the service was to slow, we had to continually ask for services at our table. Don‚Äôt think I would rush back
A feeling of tranquility comes over you when you enter,the service and food of the highest quality, just what you would expect really, would definitely go back for more.

Such a lovely night out. Food was even better than expected and portion sizes were really generous (I think I ate almost a whole aubergine!). Staff were so attentive and helped us to make our show on time that evening. Such a lot of fun.

Truly outstanding food, great service. Can‚Äôt wait to go back again and wish we‚Äôd had room to eat everything on the menu!

Particularly recommend the Japanese buttermilk friend chicken!!

The waitress who served us was absolutely lovely and so sweet, the sashimi, sushi and Korean wings were outstanding and probably my favourite dishes from the menu. For four adults we paid about ¬£40 each for a good amount of food and would definitely come back again, one of my favourite restaurants and the s‚Äômores dessert is always fun to play with
Amazing as always.  Great atmosphere and food with very attentive staff.

Booked a meal with a group of friends for a birthday. All of the food was so delicious and the service was attentive - they even brought the desert plate with a happy birthday message and candle.
The general ambiance was so lovely and we all loved the food and whole experience. It was more of a pricey meal but that was because we wanted to try everything on the menu!
Would definitely come again
Lovely food, particularly the teriyaki Salmon. Never had 'buns' before, so that was interesting and they really 'grew on me' the more I ate!

Food is great and ambient is good. Service wasn't great this time. We asked for the dessert menu and got the check instead. Waiters always insist on us getting more food while we know what we order is the right amount. We would not be able to finish everything if we followed their advice.
The food was great and the atmosph
Lovely food and great atmosphere. Perhaps a bit expensive for what it is but I really enjoyed.
We didn‚Äôt leave anything, every dish was amazing

The overall experience of flesh and buns was absolutely incredible. The food was up there as the best we‚Äôve ever eaten and the service was spot on. Definitely recommend the tasting menu, will 100% be back again.
Good food with varying service. We felt rushed as our table was booked at 9:30 pm, so we ended up being kicked out at one point. Like the restaurant, but I don‚Äôt like being feeling rushed.
The food was amazing, the people there are so nice and sweet ..

We had initially booked for the Sunday brunch but due to one of our friends being pregnant and one being vegetarian and the inflexibility of the brunch menus (we asked for some broccoli as an option to the ¬£39 menu as the only vegetarian small plate was miso soup and our pregnant friend couldn't have most of the seafood small plates and were told this was not possible) we ended up ordering from the normal menu. We suspected our waiter was fairly new as he didn't know the menu well, was unhelpful and pretty inattentive. Due to how busy it is during Sunday brunch areas there is a strict 2 hour turnaround for your table. We struggled to get our waiter's attention to order and just after we finally ordered dessert we were told by three different members of staff that the table was needed back - when the delay isn't your fault, this makes the end of your meal quite stressful. Overall, the food was great as usual but we were all quite disappointed with the service. The atmosphere during the brunch is really buzzy but I would carefully consider going back during that period if ordering from the normal menu.

An amazing restaurant with great food and fabulous service. The decor and atmosphere were are insane. My only criticisms are that:
It was a little bit too loud.
The signage to the toilets were limited (but I'm really being picky now).
But genuinely a really great restaurant and I cannot wait to return.
Amazing food, as always! Service was a little slow and inconsistent that night but other than that my friends and I had a great time and I would definitely recommend/come back!

Overpriced, mediocre food and far too loud!
Flesh & Buns receives rave reviews and I am struggling to see why.

Firstly, it is disappointing that despite booking a table online, you are at no point informed that in fact, if you are a table of 2, you do not get a table, you are made to sit at a very high bar with tall bar stools, cramped and very close next to many people. Needless to say, as the restaurant filled up, it got progressively louder to the point at which my friend and I could not hear each at all! So much for a nice evening 'catch up' with a friend!

We ordered the California roll and Spicy Tuna roll, which, in addition to being over priced was INCREDIBLY bad tasting and disappointing. Tasted as though it was caught from the sea and not washed and wrapped into a roll. By far the worst Sushi roll I've ever had.

Only saving grace was the over priced Flesh and Buns and the Dessert. Needless to say, will never be returning. So disappointing.
Food is always consistently brilliant, especially the small plates. Very noisy but gives it a lively and fun atmosphere!
Enjoyed this meal - only downside was that 2 hours wasn't enough and we were told we couldn't have drinks as they needed the table back.

I went to this place with two friends on a Monday night, which is when the restaurant offers an amazing deal of two buns + meat + a pint for ¬£15. The meat was perfect (we had the  duck, the pork belly and the steak), and the buns make a perfect accompaniment. The service staff struggled to tell us everything about the dishes (including not knowing what some of the veg was on one of the plates), but the food was amazing, and the restaurant itself is impressive and bustling. You will definitely enjoy this place if you like the look of their food from the menu.
Amazing food amazing customer service just amazing. I will defiantly be coming back

This place is definitely one of my new favourite places to go. The sushi is outstanding , the buns and meats pretty good although a little lacking in flavour at times. The service is good but a bit rushed - its the kind of place where they whip the plate out from under you as you're still chewing which annoys me a bit. For the prices they charge which are steep, they should take more care with their customers.

After hearing people rave about this place I decided to give it a go. It sounded like an interesting concept.
Sadly, the fact is, that the concept just doesn't work.
To add to that, the 'buns' (God knows what they're made out of but it ain't bread!) are tasteless and feel like pancakes. The pork I had as my main course was totally bland and had no flavour and was crispier that pork scratchings. Further to this, for the poor food I received I still ended up paying ¬£100 for myself and my girlfriend. For the same money I could have had an exquisite meal at Roka!
The smores at the end were vile as well. Again tasted totally false and manufactured and NOTHING like I expected.
I'm afraid to say I'm quite happily not returning. Don't believe the hype.

Had a fantastic meal at Flesh & Buns. We went on a Monday where the set menu includes a flesh (steak/salmon/pork etc) and 2 buns plus a pint of Asahi for only ¬£15. The food was delicious and we enjoyed the novelty of making up our buns and also making our own s'mores on a mini fire brought to the table (which were also delicious!). I'd definitely return.

I took my partner here for his birthday last sunday and we chose the Sunday Brunch menu. I had booked in advance and was hoping for a table but after waiting for ten minutes to even be acknowledged we were shown to the long table. This is not really ideal for the brunch menu as it was a tight squeeze and when our small plates arrived everything was very cramped. The restaurant is incredibly loud, I had read this in reviews but was still surprised. We went for the more expensive brunch menu as it had more options and the food was all delicious. Our waiter was very nice but he was so busy that we often had long wait times before being able to order or ask for a drink refill. I would return for a group brunch but not for a romantic treat.
Loved the food, but did get a bit noisy to hold a conversation, athough good for socialising probaby! The bill was a bit pricey!
Took some young clients here - had the Soho buzz but retained a focus on quality food presented in a fun manner. Sort of place you can nip into quickly or hang one on and go large - good atmosphere
The food comes quickly, the portions are generous and it's all pretty tasty, The room is incredibly noisy, so be prepared to shout a bit.
The food was great, but they didnt have our booking through Top Table which was weird.
I had a brilliant time, food was served hot and quickly. It was the first time my guest had been to Hakkasan, and they were impressed with d√©cor and service.  I'm sure I will be back again.
Massively overly priced
The best ! Absolutely love this restaurant . The food is delicious . Excellent xx

Lovely atmosphere and prompt service.
Would highly recommend
Fantastic food and service. Great atmosphere and lighting. Noise level was good but may have been due to time of day and during a pandemic
The food and the ambiance was superb as always. The staff was polite and adequate precautionary measures were followed to make sure we felt COVID safe inside the restaurant

Disappointed the waiter who was serving us was rude and have no idea abt the menu when we order the set menu he said we can share but after 5 minutes he came back and said we can‚Äôt share the set menu so I have to order again and than he says to me u have to order quick u less time to sit .he was just rushing us to order and what ever we order he says rude way u can‚Äôt have this one .very disappointed
I really love coming to Hakkasan the food is amazing and the service is great. Also amazing cocktails

Fantastic food, however the service was very rushed and felt as though we were being pushed to finish our meals as quickly as possible so that the next group can occupy our table.

We were very much looking forward to this meal considering it was my daughters 21st birthday

The food was amazing, from the crispy duck salad to the salt and pepper squid. The cocktails are amazing everyone should start off with the Hakka. Great Ambiance. The service could have been better but everything else made up for it. I will definitely be coming back soon.
The waiters didn‚Äôt come to our table fast enough and didn‚Äôt record an order of our drinks a lot of waiting around,. The place was extremely noisy and rowdy

For the first time we found the service poor. We are regular diners here and usually do not have a bad word to voice however on this occasion we found the service extremely slow. We caught our waiter yawning a few times which obviously showed he was tired and didnt really want to be there.  Very one toned when taking our orders and when giving us our dessert menus didn't actually return to take our dessert order u til 35 minutes later...noone really needs 35 minutes to decide on a dessert from an option of 4. Was disappointed with the service this time around.
Very good food , best dim sum I ever had but too noisy and not very attentive service
Food and service excellent! However, we were there on a Saturday and the music level was a too loud, and it was difficult to talk to each other.

The food was really lovely. However the manger was rude and rushed us a lot throughout the evening. We understood that it‚Äôs a two hour booking but the manager was very rude and abrupt and was basically pushing us off the table even though we still had 20 minuets left of the booking. After being forced over to the bar, they did not bring over our full bottle of wine until we requested. The rest of the staff were fine.

Food was not good as I tought. Very noisy.
Service was slow.
Awful service. Unprofessional, sloppy and at times downright rude

The service from the people when i first entered was lovely until we was sat in the bar and not even the restaurant and had to ask to be moved and when we reached the restaurant it was empty anyway. the service we then received from the staff was appalling and we as 3 young ish girls of 18 felt very uncomfortable in a restaurant where we was going to be spending a lot of money. the staff almost looked down at us and was talking about us behind our back and the atmosphere was not nice to be in. i would not come back because of the staff.
Excellent service, fantastic food, never felt rushed

We celebrated our 40th wedding anniversary at the Hakkasan Restaurant in late May.  The reservation process went smoothly.  The team greeted us on arrival and our table was ready. Service was attentive and the meal was excellent.  The staff had crafted two desserts which were decorated with anniversary wishes.
