A beautiful evening, delicious food, romantic environment and attentive service.
Food was average and well overpriced for some of the items such as dim sum.
The price of the wines is extreme expensive. Better a bottle of wine than a glass. The meal and the service are superb

Cool welcome upon arrival, waited 15mins to be asked if we wanted a drink, then another 10mins for our food order to be taken. Given we were pre-theatre, this was a little stressful. Had to wait for about 10mins also to pay the bill.
That said, the food was beautiful. Really lovely.
Excellent restaurant!!! One of my favourites in London!! Best food great service and ambience:)

This was a family and friends get-together.
Food in general was fairly good, although one can‚Äôt help feeling that most of it was pre-prepared many hours prior to our dinner. This was particularly true of the signature dish ‚ÄúPeking Duck‚Äù. When the ‚Äúcrispy‚Äù skin finally arrived, it was already placed on the wrap with the scallions and was quite rubbery and disappointing - certainly not worth the 100 pound price tag.
Otherwise, good ambiance and attentive service, although here too, a bit rushed.

Lovely ambiance in the restaurant and beautiful food. It is expensive but you have to pay for quality. It is not somewhere to eat everyday but for special occasions is it lovely. I do think for the money that you will spend on the food though, the tables are a little too close together. Be warned though, the portions are quite big.
Is a very fashion restaurant and the food is excellent
Amazing; can‚Äôt wait to come back again. The starter was divine , the main was perfectly done, the dessert was just mmmmmm.

Very disappointing experience! I booked for 2 people at 6.30pm on the taste of Hakkasan menu for ¬£32 pp and received my confirmation. On arrival I was told this menu in only avail up to 5pm and therefore I would have to choose a different menu or eat from the a la carte menu (both significantly more expensive). Previously open table has restricted reservations on deals to the tine period the deal is available, totally disappointing and mis sold. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend dining err unless you have a big budget!

Very enjoyable family evening .
Food and service was excellent . It‚Äôs not cheap but worth it for a special occasion .

Surprising dishes.
Exelent Peking duck.
A bit dark. But pritty decoration.
Good service.
Primero nos sentaron en una mesa junto a la cocina y casi nos vamos por el humo .... luego mucho tiempo para que nos atiendan
Went there with friends to celebrate Chinese New Year, the food is top notch as usual with great ambiance, service was attentive and friendly.
Everything very nice, except the vegetable side dishes came AFTER the mains. Can happen but shouldn‚Äôt ....
Fantastic food and great service even with full restaurant. Bravi!
We were late for my table but the restaurant was still able to accommodate us
We had a lovely date night. Great food and service üëå
Fabulous. We had the ¬£78 signature menu. Food was delicious! Would definitely recommend.

Honestly the worst place I been to in Mayfair!! Went on a off peak time so restaurant wasn't busy but to get hold of staff took longer then christmas and food was so over rated I have eaten better in China town!! Honestly a joke
Service? They don't even know how to spell it. The worst Hakkasan - don't bother. Go to the one in Hanway Place... or Doha.

You don't notice it so much on the outside of the restaurant but inside is really dark and loud. Took my boyfriend there for his birthday and he loved the food. We ordered dim sum and duck rolls for starters. The stir fry beef in merlot was delicious and so was the stir fry Peking duck. We're not massively greedy so we definitely couldn't finish our food as well as drink cocktails. So we left the rice and Singapore noodles which I'm not a massive fan of anyway. We ordered the Jivara bomb for desert which was like a cold chocolate moouse ice cream in crunchy Rice Krispies which the waiter poured a chocolate sauce over. Tasted so good! They so kindly piped happy birthday for my boyfriend on the plate and it had a subtle yet classy candle for his birthday. Cocktails were nice, I've always like a hakkatini, it doesn't taste like alcohol so before you know it your tipsy after a few. The atmosphere was ok, really loud in there and a mixture of different people. You don't have to dress up unless you want to. I mean we was because we out after but there's people in there that's just come from shopping in Oxford street to those that go all out glam. It's a good place for sharing food if you like to try different things. Just be warned it really hot in there. The less clothes the better. I would go again but not in a rush. I went to the one in New York while I was there and it was a bit more chilled and not to crammed together. We were sat between two larger groups. One super loud and bit annoying as the women kept getting up for the "loo" and the others were chilled and looked like they just came for the food. But you get that in London.

Celebrating my birthday with my friend who was celebrating her birthday too! We both wanted to have a catch up as well as to celebrate our birthday treat here. Being a Dim sum lover, I suggested we both try this place as I've not been yet. At first we were seated in a wrong area in which they had to seat us to another area, which was fine and just glad that the food wasn't ordered by then. We just wanted din sum which was all wonderful and Delish! The cocktails was dangerous because they were absolutely yummy delicious! The Hakka cocktail was sublime! Overall the service , food and the ambience for lunch was wonderful. I will definitely return for an evening date. Highly recommend this place.

As always the good is very good, the restaurant is let down consistently by the front desk staff. Always extremely rude. Constant issue with the restaurant, you would think the management would resolve it.

I had lunch with friends on a Sunday in November 2016 at Hakkasan Mayfair. We ordered the dim sum lunch - ¬£39 for a selection of dim sum, a main, a dessert & a cocktail. The food was excellent and the set menu offers good value for money. The only criticism I do have is the service was a bit patchy - our waitress was a bit offish and not particularly attentive. For this type of restaurant the service should be more polished & friendly. I would not go back in a rush. In my view, the food at Yauatcha is just as good and the service/atmosphere is better.

When we arrived we were greeted promptly, very modern decor inside. We went downstairs to a table which we weren't happy with and the staff were happy to move us.
We chose the taste of hakkasan menu which we all enjoyed.
Great value for money and even got a free cocktail. Much nicer food and decor than nobu! We enjoyed our visit and will be back!

Great food and drinks as usual
Didn't like the fact they rushed us off our table after the 2 hour time slot. We would have stayed for more drinks there if they hadn't done that
Very nice place to enjoy all day food eating in a good ambience. Great food and great service.
Great set menu which was very good value!otherwise mains would be very over priced.good ambiance and  internal restaurant vibe.thought service was excellent

The food was lovely but music too loud which means you are shouting to others across the table.  The tactic of loud music will result in people leaving quickly but inevitably they will spend less on other items, for instance on drinks, dessert.  Makes it a less enjoyable experience if you feel you can't totally relax and chill. We moved elsewhere to enjoy more drinks and dessert.
A very good place with outstanding service. The food was excellent and highly recommended.
Amazing experience must visit If your in London. X
Awesome as always:)

From the moment you walk in and seated at your table you know this is something special. Staff their are very friendly and nice.

Food was amazing and perfectly timed. Me and my wife was really impressed and will definitely go back there and would recommend this to others.

Well done, D

Great food, ambience and service

Fish (Chilean Sea Bass) and dessert were the highlights
As good as always. The best Hakkasan location. Great food experience!!!!

Hakassan mayfair has been my destination when I want to impress my guests, and it delivers what it promises. In addition that the place looks fab, the staff make the place is more pleasant. Highly recommended...

We went there and ordered the roasted silver cod in champagne and honey sauce, black truffle roast duck and grilled wagyu beef. The food was outstanding, especially the cod. I also had the Souffle for dessert, which was excellent.
However, even though the wagyu beef is good in quality, but it is not a special dish when compared to others.
Overall, a very good Chinese restaurant with a luxurious twist, but the price may be quite pricey.
Was a very good experience, very good food , and excellent service
The cocktails are well over priced.

Every part if the evening I enjoyed, the decor of the restaurant was quirky all the staff very helpful, our waiter went through all our food and told us all about it, and was very friendly and helpful the food itself was out of this world and i would recommend the souffl√© for pudding.

Quite frankly, the whole dining experience at Hakkasan was both excellent and poor at the same time. First of all, is it really necessary to have TWO doormen/security for a restaurant?!! You are then greeted by a myriad of staff into a restaurant that at first appears cosy and intimate but quickly extends to another floor with a 100 diners+. The resemblance to Wagamamas is there but that's where the parallel stops. The service was excellent and the waitress was knowledgeable and not overly helpful. When the food arrived it didn't disappoint, however, I think the postcode reflected the high prices more than the quality of some (but by no means all) of the food. IF it wasn't so packed full of tables resembling a canteen, I would recommend...
The girl who served us was great. Nothing was a problem for her. Her attitude was 'Yes We Can'. Excellent experience, that's why I keep going back.

excellent service
really helpful staff with the food
lovely evening, brilliant for my boyfriends birthday
outstanding entrance
lovely feel
brilliant evening
The service was impeccable/the food tasted like MAGIC! We simply loved! Thank You!
very good experience , however , the lighting can be improved

The menu was interesting, and the food was excellent, with some stunning individual dishes. However, it was expensive, so needed to be good, and was let down somewhat by being rushed off the table at the end to make way for the second sitting - something that hadn't been made clear when booking and was dissappointing, given the cost - neaerly ¬£100 per head with only half bottle each of modest wine! Would definitely go back, but aim for the second sitting next time!
The food, although expensive, was very good as was the service.
All was very organized ... Treated well at the door at the door and throughout the whole meal .. Food was great too :) a must go everytime in london .
Best restaurant in London. Consistantly amazing food. Service always superb.
Amazing staff and beautiful place to dine!! Service is incredible üëèüôåüèº just super duper expensive but wonderful
Amazing food, service and atmosphere- as always!
Birthday but very pricey, ¬£300 for 2 of us! The food is not just 1 meal, you order a few.

Food and drinks were exquisite. So many highlights - caramelised black cod, foie grais gyoza, the sashimi we chose and the Pork Belly skewers were superb. Gorgeous cocktails.
Ambience-wise it was slightly too bling and nouveau riche for my personal taste. I‚Äôm sure younger, flashier people than myself will love it. Not cheap but it‚Äôs that kind of joint.

So disappointed by Sexy Fish, after wanting to go there for so long.
The waiter was passive aggressive, on the up-sell at every opportunity, and then stroppy when we didn‚Äôt oblige. The food was really average for the price. ¬£500 for lunch for 6 people - we just had 1 round of drinks & 1 bottle of wine - and we had to eat 2hrs later as we were starving. It was a 40th celebration so we knew it would be expensive but we left feeling ripped off and disappointed, rather than waxing lyrical about how amazing the food was and what a treat it had been. Sadly the phrase ‚ÄòStyle over substance‚Äô was made for this place.
The other hosts and waiters were really lovely though - we were just unlucky with ours and unfortunately it left a bitter taste.
Such a shame as the setting and decor was really lovely.
Our reservation was at 22:45 but our table wasn‚Äôt ready until 23:20 !!

Good to have sea food in this restaurant for lunch or dinner, however they need to have fish variety since I have just seen Tona and Salmon, no tilapia for example, moreover, the food portions were to small so I had to order one of the dishes twice! Which costed me a lot! Finally they just allow you to have the table for just two hours which isn‚Äôt sufficient for some people!
Nice restaurant, good food and ambiance, but too expensive.

Up there with the best that I‚Äôve visited, every bit of our visit was outstanding, fantastic service and the food was 10/10, from the Wagyu fillet, King crab and the black cod it‚Äôs hard to pick a winner, can‚Äôt wait to visit again
The food was excellent. All dishes were very tasty. Great tempura shrimp, caramelized duck. We also loved the Iberico ribs. The cheesecake is a must have!
Cool place just overpriced for what u get. best dish was the Kimchee fried rice with duck.

The type of Venue you go to be seen.
Great place for a business meeting or work function. I personally would not recommend it for a intimate dinner as the atmosphere is very corporate. Love the attention to detail on the decor.
Staff were superb! Made it but I was hungry when I left!

We went here for my husband's birthday. Due to it being a 'hot' place, we went for Saturday lunch, to try it. We were not that impressed. It was pretty empty, and while the food was good and the staff attentive without being intrusive, it lacked much 'wow' factor. There was a DJ on the decks, and we liked the music, but it felt incongruous in a near-empty restaurant in daylight. Without glittering people or mystique, it just felt a bit bling. It was also expensive - we paid ¬£150+ for a fairly basic lunch for two of us (I think we had a mocktail each).
Might be better on a busy evening, when people watching and bar lounging might make it all come together. But in daylight? Don't bother.
An amazing experience . A must visit to food lovers!
Great meal.  Wonderful flavours and interesting food. A must for anyone who loves Asian inspired cuisine.
I had a wonderful dinner at Sexy Fish and this was the perfect place to celebrate my sister's birthday!

Myself and my girlfriend visited Sexy Fish on a Saturday night for her birthday. Big plus points were the attentive nature of their waiters and waitresses. Always on hand to recommend dishes or wine etc. Food was excellent and no sign of pretentious small portions like in many other high end restaurants. Also a nice touch that they delivered a Happy Birthday dessert to my girlfriend.

Would definitely go again, great for special occasions, and they do a great plum sake.
Nice to have japanese bbq in London. The premium Kalbi short ribs are the best. Delicious!
The food was fantastic! Very attentive service too. Thank you!

The food was outstanding especially for the price it was definitely value for money. Our waitress was a friendly waitress and was always attentive. They also took covid measures very seriously. I would be definitely visiting this restaurant again soon! Thank you !
Servers were very rude and took a long time to serve any of the food which given the two hour time limit made it difficult to eat

Booked this place for a birthday meal, went for the All you can eat on a Sunday - Amazing Value, Amazing Service & we left ready to burst! I honestly couldn't have been happier with the place! defo going back regularly!!
30th birthday meal. Was very nice but not as special as I had hoped for a 30th

We were greeted and served with warmth and enthusiasm. The starters were very tasty and fresh - takoyaki and chicken karaage. The beef sukiyaki bibimbap looked and tasted great in the sizzling hot bowl. We had less luck with the BBQ - the meat did not cook evenly and stuck to the grill. I suspect we needed oil which was not offered. The meats were also too heavily seasoned. The ramen was also too salty. I believe this was just a one-off so I‚Äôd still be interested in returning.

We went for the All you can eat Sunday menu, Silver course, so mainly based on that. Quality and variety of meats were excellent, vegetable selection could have had better variety but was adequate for us. Appetisers and sides were tasty and had good variety but nothing exceptional. Excellently priced happy hour Asahi beer on tap, good variety of other drinks too. Service was good though occasionally difficult to catch passing waiters due to being fairly busy - they were always friendly when serving. Runners very efficient and discreet at clearing away empty plates. The self grill tables seemed to be located only in the basement although the background upbeat pop music and layout made up partly for lack of windows. Free wifi if needed. Great place for a group meal although we noted that 3 people to a grill on our table was comfortable, maximum number per grill seemed to be 4. Despite being busy noise levels were mild, could converse easily without needing to raise our voices. All in all would go back and recommend.
Innovative & delicious

I love the Kintan Holborn. One of my favourites to go to. The service at this Kintan was really slow and  spent have the time looking for our server or asking for someone to help us.  Based on this I'd almost rather go to the Holborn one.
Delicious food and great service - really friendly
Overall good experience. Looking forward to being able to dine inside again and having the whole menu available to order from.
Delicious food for great value. Definitely coming back!
Absolutely incredible.  Food was to die for, service was impeccable. Will definitely be back.
The food was delicious, service could be more attentive (especially greeting at front door).
The service was really bad and slow. It‚Äôs a shame as the food is really good
Amazing food! Great service. Pretty damn loud, but no big deal. The Katso Sando might be the best thing I've ever eaten.
Awful service and very rude. However the food was delicious. Shame about the rude waiter...

Love, love, love this place! All snacks and dishes are just amazing. Cocktails are super refreshing and to end the feast by this beautiful french toast with macha ice cream is the cherry on top of the cake ... Definitely coming back.
Fantastic restaurant, with amazing food and charming service. I will certainly be coming back again and again and again!

This is my 5th visit to Shakfuyu and i was really let down by the service, especially since i took my friend there for desert. it was slow and inpersonal and we were left to fend for ourselves for the most of time. We only ordered 3 things on the menu but we spent close to 2 hours waiting around. I understand if it was busy but other tables were served a lot faster. I definitely think we were forgotten about and when we finally did get our desert (french toast and matcha icecream) it was luke warm, burnt and just not as good as it used to be, i asked for the bill immediatlet because i didnt know how long it would take to be seen again. The staff were friendly and the food always tasty but on this visit the service was a real let down :(

Me and my date opted for the tasting menu. ¬£30 each seemed a bit steep but it was really good. Very filling and such a great variety of dishes. Staff were friendly. Place was busy. It was a great place  for a date. But also saw groups having a great time too.

Some of the nicest food I've ever eaten in London. The pork was incredible and the tasting menu is outstanding value for money. We got so much food. We were stuffed but had enough room for the beautiful French toast and green tea ice cream.
Shackfuyu is very cool, food is beyond expectations again and again. Value is outstanding, was very happy when I realised they were back!
Went there with two friends at around 23:45 on a Saturday night. The clientele in this place is horrendous! Sadly I do not recommend this place at all, though the staff were nice as can be.

Wow what an absolute pleasure it was to experience such a high standard of food, drink, professional staff and ambience.

The service here is 7 Star with no compromise

Friendly Staff, extremely honest and helpful.

A truly amazing vibrant atmosphere amongst like minded clientele.

Wish we had visited sooner.
Will certainly recommend you will absolutely love it on all levels
Very good choice for eating in Covent Garden area before visiting ROH.

I was expecting to be writing a damning review as the experience started really badly.
Arrived a few minutes before 5.45 when our table eas booked for. We were told our table wasn't ready but we could wait at the bar. No problem we said - we'll have a drink while we wait.
You can't we were told - no drinks at the bar as we're too short staffed. (Other couples at the bar had no drinks either except two ladies had glasses of bubbly. When I asked why I was told "this was my colleagues mistake")
I suggested we left and came back later but was assured the wait would only be 5 minutes.
30 minutes later my husband went and complained.
Miraculously within 3 minutes we were taken to a table.
Both feeling pretty irritated but the cocktails and food were delicious and the waiting staff were lovely.
I will go back but the initial handling was very poor. My husband was told diners were "outstaying their welcome". He asked then why weren't they asked to leave? Obviously no answer could be given.
I wonder how long we'd have had to wait if we hadn't complained? We were going to the theatre so had no choice but to do so or leave.
Glad we stayed because we left happy after lovely food.
Amazing food, expensive drinks and a great atmosphere

Excellent choice! Excellent service! Excellent food! I eat out all the time but this restaurant delivers everything & more when dining out!  The staff are very professional, polite and well presented. For those who are not ready to eat inside, they have a beautiful selection of outdoor dining areas. You will not be disappointed!
Service was

We sat on the terrace (4 of us) which was well shaded and rainproof, away from traffic and very pleasant. The staff were most accommodating from the moment we booked. The food was good to excellent and we would be very happy to visit again.
Fantastic food and atmosphere. Great for a special occasion.

Great ambience and service. The tiny birthday cake at the end of the meal was a real touch.
Will be back .
Amazing !!!!!

Food was over cooked in my opinion and we were seated at the side of the restaurant outside where the heaters was not working, I asked to move to the tables near the front of the restaurant but was told it was for customers that booked. (We did book). The apple tart was delicious.
Fantastic friendly service, food was lovely. High recommend.
We went there for a birthday meal and was not disappointed! Food was amazing, drinks brilliant and the staff were very helpful. Would definitely go back!

Food was good but not great value for money. Waiter was nice but welcome staff were quite rude. We were 10 mins late but I had called to explain and apologise, they did hold our table for us though which was good.
Excellent service, food and value for money in a great restaurant.

Service was terrible, table was sticky, everything we wanted, drinks, to order food etc, we had to ask someone over each time. Serving staff were not attentive at all, and restaurant was very tired looking.

I went to The Ivy Market Grill to celebrate my 30th birthday. The food was amazing and the service and atmosphere could not be faulted. I received a lovely little cake for my birthday by the staff and I could not have felt anymore looked after.

Food excellent and price very fair and love the space but think you try To squash way too many covers in - your staff are dancing around each other.

Service is shocking with non mgt not able to communicate or having a clue what one is asking. I am still waiting 3 days later to find out if your have fever Tree Light tonic.

Also your wine list needs updating with the correct years .... do not advertise 2017 and bring 2018 to the table and then have no idea what you have available
Poor service, unimaginative salads. Barman took drinks order then finished shift before giving us drinks.
Dinner was very tasty everyone enjoyed their meal. Service was a bit slow but friendly enough, quick delivery on the food, a buzzing atmosphere. Would go back & recommend.
I would just like to say thank you for taking care of my grandparents. They both said the food was amazing and they was looked after fantastically! Thank you!

Bit disappointing compared to the Marylebone venue where the staff are very friendly and the restaurant is spacious.

Restaurant was very busy and crowded, perhaps because of the season.

I can‚Äôt stand it when front desk staff don‚Äôt greet you with a smile or any warmth, it sets the mood for the whole experience.

Our waitress was nice but seemed very hurried.

Unfortunately my sister in law was ill later that night and we wondered whether it was the food.

Her creme brulee was served cold.

The rest of our food was OK.
Good food and service. Pleasant dining experience, we were not rushed to leave.
Really reliable, fun reasonably priced option.  Food is good enough and service is excellent.
As usual very reliable but the service on the visit was a bit slow with three occasions where I had to gain the attend of staff. Otherwise OK
Past and pre birthday celebrations!

Loved it! Really great atmosphere staff really friendly And food was good !
We were also lucky that we could sit for a couple of hours and enjoy it without being told our slot was up!
Great!!
Sadly it‚Äôs become very average.  The atmosphere is fantastic.  Food very average.
Family of 4 had a great time. Food great service brilliant and good value for money. Best we‚Äôve had for a while.
Birthday lunch. Service was great, as was the food and cocktails, the shortcake with strawberry and chocolate with happy birthday written on it, was a lovely touch. Would recommend.
Great service and food, lovely atmosphere. My friend and I took advantage of the pre theatre menu, 3 courses for ¬£21, absolute bargain for great quality food and service. Will definitely return!
Excellent menu with varied choice. Especially delicious rump of lamb.
Food and service were lovely but restaurant was a bit cramped
Fabulous meal - food, service, table - everything! Thank you. We‚Äôll definitely be back!

Absolutely outstanding meal.  Service incredible, ambience wonderful.  The perfect venue for a celebratory Golden wedding anniversary lunch with my parents who absolutely LOVED it.  We were treated so well and the staff were brilliant.  Will definitely return.  Thank you.
Food was amazing and really good value.  Staff couldn't have been friendly and it was a perfect spot to chill after dinner and soak up the atmosphere.  I will definitely be recommending this place!

Great atmosphere, great service, great food. A very busy place with people queuing for tables but absolutely no pressure  on us to hurry. I had a problem with my vegetarian choice and it was 'comped' - I didn't ask or expect it so this was a very nice surprise. Top class customer service. This is a very well run restaurant and I would definitely recommend.
This was a 70th Birthday for my wife and the staff were most  helpful as we had a young child to cater for. Food was very acceptable and was served in a timely manner.
Wonderful food, attentive staff, lovely ambiance. Attention to detail superb even providing a birthday cake and candle when notified I was there to celebrate a friends birthday

Had olives and they were delicious, so ordered so more. Had the aracini to start, which was delicious too. Then I asked the waiter for his recommendation & so, had the Ivy Shepherds Pie - best I‚Äôve ever tasted. Great recommendation. My wife had salmon & Cod fish cakes and we finished with the creme br√ªl√©e - all washed down with the Cotes de Rhine red wine - simply beautiful.

Lovely place, great ambiance and the staff very attentive to our requirements. Would definitely recommend.
Thank you. Marvellous

Love it, love it, love it. Especially the wide and appetising menu, especially the music, especially the continental vibe. And especially that I booked for Sunday instead of Saturday at pre-theatre time. It was packed but they found us a table for two and saved me a huge embarrassment with an overseas guest.

Was delicious! Fabulous.
Service by Francisco was fantastic and was very attentive.

Good service and always serves good food so great for a family meal and really fab location. Food and service never exceptional though - if you want this, go to the ‚Äòoriginal‚Äô Ivy, it‚Äôs worth it for a special occasion/treat!
Lovely place, great atmosphere and food. We had breakfast here, will definitely come again!
One of our favourite "Ivy" restaurants. Again very good service, food was tasty and well presented. Nice ambience and excellent value for money.
Excellent as always in every way and the waiter was brilliant.

Poor ingredients poorly cooked. Not a patch on other Ivy restaurants in London or the provinces
Constant serving to outside terrace ruined our lunch with outside temperatures of 5c and a wind howling in every 3 minutes meant we had to eat with coats on
A huge waste of time and money

We arrived at 5.30pm and the restaurant was very busy. Would recommend booking. The tables are small and packed in and there are lots of people sitting and eating at the bar. The food was very good and realistically priced. The food came out quickly and I would recommend this restaurant for pre show dining. The location is also good. Although it is noisy in the restaurant you are able to hold a perfectly normal conversation. The music is very much in the background and could do with being a bit louder as you could often only hear a constant drone base line. The service was good but I didn‚Äôt like that staff constantly walked around with iPads noting if you had nearly finished or not, it made us feel like we had to hurry. There was also a lot of staff walking around directing other members of staff to do things, we found it odd that they didn‚Äôt just clear a table or 2 or make the odd Coffee themselves!? Overall though, I would go back again but, as we‚Äôve been there now, there are so many other restaurants for us to try first.
Not many good options for those with good allergies. Very basics options. Average quality food. Prices do not reflect quality!

when visiting London I always book the ivy grill for breakfast which includes champagne and it‚Äôs fab , have visited in the evening the food has been to the same standard but more vibrant , also not over expensive like a lot of the restaurants ,  love this place to eat, hope it always keeps the same standard
A good venue and good food. Service a little slow in regards to initial drinks and the meal felt a little rushed but overall good.
Excellent all round

We had to ask to be served a number of times... from ordering drinks to food to ketchup  & topping up our wine glass. Felt rushed. Food arrived before drinks.  It was ok for pre theatre but not for a special occasion.
Really amazingly attentive staff!! Impressed! Food was delicious and so memorable!! I'm

Went for an anniversary meal before visiting other hotspots in Covent Garden.

Food was divine for the price, and great value for money. The salted caramel espresso martini is something that must be tried if you have a sweet tooth and/or a love of coffee and caramel.

In the evening that we went it was quite "cosy" with many tables being close to one another, and with larger parties nearby the noise can be a bit of a distractor but honestly had a brilliant evening and would look to return again.

Thanks to all at the Ivy.
Family gathering ideal location, lovely food and good service, have been twice now and plan to go again
Overall a very poor experience. Would not return.

Extensive but excellent menu, attentive and friendly staff and right in the heart of Covent Garden, this restaurant is a perfect spot if you want to feel like you're pushing the boat out without the huge price tag. It's extremely reasonable for what it is.

It was my wifes 50th birthday celebration! We had a great time, but I did notify you about her birthday and this was never acknowledged which for me was disapiointing. You had also ran out of my wifes favourate desert 'truffles'!
Overall though it was very good, but could have been exceptional if not for the above.

Regards - Andy Clrements
Fantastic place, ambience was perfect and the food delicious.  Our waiter could not have done anything more, brilliant service.
I‚Äôm a big fan of the Ivy Chain I think you have a great formula you make Customers feel very special and it doesn‚Äôt have to cost the earth ...I think its brilliant

Good restaurant with great food
Waiters are very polite and on the ball
Would recommend

I have been to the Ivy market Grill on many occasions , but this time I was so disappointed , i took my friend there for her birthday, we were sat on a very small table right By the outside door, the staff was constantly in and out , we were absolutely freezing. Also our meal came within 10 minutes of ordering.
Nice atmosphere, although tables very close together don't expect privacy, service good although out waiter was a little robotic. Great comfort food.

Restaurant with good atmosphere, good surroundings, g√≤od service with quality of food fit for any occasion and not over expensive. Have been to this restaurant on several occasions and will return again.

Good Food, Good Drinks, Good Service

Nice location for a night out in London

Great location; busy lively atmosphere. Food and service consistently good and dependable, but don't expect a gourmet event and on this occasion service a little confusing with service team regularly asking for order and trying to take glasses etc. off table before being used / finished with - all very friendly non the less!
Maybe for some side tables small and tight and noisy but for us that adds to the bar /club atmosphere, which we enjoy.
Very good food - a great variety to choose from.  Service very good and staff very friendly.
Fabulous place.  Excellent service and friendly staff.  Food divine.  Go there!

Excellent. My husband needs gluten free menu and from  start to finish his needs were accommodated with great knowledge. We were very impressed. I would fully recommend it. Our waiter was a delight. The food was delicious can't recommend it enough.
First time. Superb food and service. Would highly recommend a few Royales to kick things off & the scallops for starter. We will be coming back soon.
Fantastic service, food and ambiance...will look forward to our next visit.üòÄ
Absolutely fantastic restaurant. Food was amazing and the atmosphere is great. Could not think of one negative thing about this place, already planning the next visit!

We went for a pre retail lunch on my wife's birthday and it was good fun. Interesting decor, lively atmosphere, generally very good service, interesting menu, delicious food, well presented and well spaced, good selection of wines and cocktails, all at a realistic price for the location. Our initial server was having a bad day at the office and managed 3 spills between olives and main - the last of them a glass of champagne - but the evidence was quickly cleared away, a replacement glass of champagne delivered and the price of 2 glasses deducted from the bill - so no complaints. All in all a place to return to and one to recommend.

Door staff were good, but at table service wasn't very attentive. We had to ask to order food, and the order was wrong when it came. Steaks were also overcooked, but as they'd already got the order wrong at first I didn't want to complain twice! Ambience wasn't great as it feels a bit dated. However did have a very nice cocktail. This place is trading off the Ivy name rather than standing on its own two feet.

Having visited the Ivy Chelsea Garden on a number of occasions, we found that the food in the Market Grill was equally as good. The service was also great. The big disappointing factor was the proximity of our table to the door - a very cold draft and the lady next to us requested her coat. The restaurant really need to put in place a better system to cope with people coming in as it is not pleasant for the first three tables to have to suffer a draft every time a new customer arrives. The door was propped open at one point and it became very chilly indeed!
Absolute favorite spot for the last two years!Never disappoints!

This was a first visit with friends over from Australia prior to attending Nutcracker at ROH. The food was excellent quality and great flavours. Pre theatre menu excellent value. Service was very good. I will certainly return.
Amazing food, will definitely be back! Service was fantastic, had a lovely time.
Good food well presented by friendly professional staff - made dining alone a pleasure - not all restaurants treat single diners well

I'm a regular here but am watching it deteriorate - it is no longer 'special' as there are too many 'off the street' diners not really dressed for a highish end place - getting far too casual and most would be better suited to the shake shack opposite. When you make an effort for an occasion and are met with T shirts and leggings it is a little off putting particularly when there are many other options to be taken in the area. No idea what this restaurant can do to deter this drop in standard but I may find myself at Joe Allens or Sheekey's or the Delaunay in future. This was the only downside.

Food good, staff lovely - but ambience lacking.
The Ivy Market Grill is an excellent restaurant which provides good food a good selections of wines and great cocktails The service is professional and effecient

This restaurant has the name IVY and you therefore compare it with the original IVY.  No comparison!  We have been fortunate to dine in THE IVY many times and even though a bit more expensive will continue to do so.
Reasonable value for what is considered a posh popular restaurant. The lamb shoulder was bland and soggy. The duck salad was a good portioned starter.

Very busy and noisy, tables a bit small and close together. Service was good, efficient, not rushed although we were told 3 times that we only had 2 hours.
Food was good not outstanding. Quite expensive, but set menu looked good value.
Once again excellent food and fantastic service!
Helpful staff, table not really big enough and generally cramped, food good. A little pricey.
Try the crunchy fried prawns with wasabi mayonnaise - delicious!

The food was lovely, plenty to choose from as well, and the portions were a good size. It is a little more than I would spend on a meal out usually, but it was a special occasion. It was definitely worth it though. The staff were all really friendly and the atmosphere was buzzing. I will be visiting again.
Good service and relatively good value for Michelin one star. I went to the restaurant with a native HK friend. He said he feels like home. The mooncake is great highly recommended.

Great service.
Very quiet. Ambience is more of a hotel lounge. Food was OK, didn‚Äôt enjoy the main course at all, too much fat on the meats... service was good. But a Chinese not for us

It was an dinner hosted by me after my proposal to my girlfriend. The food was fantastic. But the service was very cold and unprofessional. The gentleman serving us was without ‚Äòpassion‚Äô and quite irresponsive. A bit down for such a happy occasion.

Authentic Chinese food with up market ambience. It‚Äôs about time to have one proper Chinese restaurant like this in London.

Pricing is a bit high compared to other high end restaurants, even those in Mayfair.
Good, simple, food cooked well. Attentive service and good atmosphere.
Fabulous food, attention to detail. Friendly, professional  staff who attended to all our needs. This is our sixth visit and it always excellent.
Absolutely amazing, we didn't expect it would be so good.
The staff is amazing we have been served by the Italians and they have Been great !
Impeccable service, incredible food, fantastic surroundings.

What a great place! I went there with my parents to celebrate my graduation. Was offered free glasses of champagne and a cake to help us celebrate this special day! Amazing service and food make Berners my favourite place!
Phenomenonal!!
We had a very Nice dinner at Berners, enjoyed the food and the service.  I sound recommend it for every one!
Great for business meetings and groups. The food was far from spectacular but service was excellent. Not good at a ll on the vegan offering, which I'd expect to be great in a hotel like this.
One thing set me off - one of our waiters reeked of cigarettes. A little thing but not so nice. Good is good though and portions not huge. Loved our tarte tatin
Very beautiful restaurant and delicious food. Outstanding

Lovely lunch, the set meal is excellent value. Service not quite up to spec for Michelin star restaurant. Had to ask to order our drinks 15 minutes after we had arrived. We then waited another 10 minutes for the wine to arrive and even longer for the other drinks. Would definitely go back again.

Was recommended the Berners Tavern by a friend and the experience certainly did not disappoint. From the moment I walked in, I was pleasantly greeted by two members of their staff who sat me down at our table. The amount of people who looked after us was impressive, yet not over the top. The food was delicious; I had the tuna followed by chicken. The wine menu was extensive and their sommelier was informative but not pushy ( did not just recommend the most expensive wines). The ambience and decor is stunning; feels such a special place. Safe to say I will be returning and recommending Berners Tavern to my friends & colleagues.
Nice place for dining and the staff are very accomodating
Absolutely amazing, food, service and the place itself. Can't recommend highly enough.
Perfect lunch in this stunning venue. Wonderful food and service as always.

This is the 1st time I've felt compelled to write a review as I had such high hopes! The venue and ambience are wonderful, the service great and my friends food was delicious but unfortunately mine wasn't. I had the Chicken schnitzel it had no flavour at all which given that it came with red pepper, anchovy and capers was a massive disappointment. Blandest main course I've ever eaten.

Sadly I don't think I'd risk going back or recommend it.
The food was amazing and the service matched the experience! We will definitely be back.
Lovely atmosphere and polite and friendly service. Would recommend and hope to return in the near future
The service was great and the food was great value.

Visually stunning dining room. The sort of room where in spite of yourself, you're most likely to say "Wow" as you walk in.
The service was polite, attentive and importantly, frequent.
The food was first class ingredients, simply but excellently cooked. I had the dressed crab followed by sirloin steak and thoroughly enjoyed them both.
Our bill came to about ¬£160pp but that included drinks both before and after the meal. Less indulgent people could easily get that down to less than ¬£100pp.
Overall, I would highly recommend this restaurant but book early as it's extremely popular!
An absolutely stunning place to dine! The staffs are friendly. However, I do think the service is slow and can be improved.

Very disappointing, after wanting to go there for so long... service was poor, food was very slow coming from the kitchen and although the setting was lovely we left feeling very let down. We even had to pay for 'complementary' food that had been offered because of the delay in our order...

Excellent location for a business lunch. The service was targeted and the food excellent- this is on my repeat list.

Peter

We went early doors on Sunday evening and had a wide choice of seating but the restaurant soon filled up.  Cocktail choices were excellent with personalized recommendations from the barman.  Food was awesome, and the service was amazing, attentive and friendly but not over the top.  I've been here 3 times before and never been disappointed.

Beautiful room, atmoshphere built as the early evening turned into the popular eating periods. Food was plentiful and well presented. Slight downer which we did not make a big deal of was that the Rare Sirloin was put in front of the only Vegetarian on the table, how ironic. Suggested a bit  of amateur service but   in general it was excellent.

I was totally blown away by the venue, the room is spectacular and the decor and acoustics just as good. The service was friendly, relaxed and attentive, which I personally prefer to the more uptight/ intrusive nature of the service in some more formal dining restaurants. The food was really enjoyable. My partner had the beef wellington special which was great and my duck main course was just right. The wine was a little pricier than I was expecting to pay, but taste-wise was worth it. We also has some cocktails in the bar beforehand which tasted great and were served in fabulous glassware. Would definitely recommend this restaurant.

I was very much looking forward to my breakfast at Berners Tavern but it was one of the poorest breakfasts I've had in a while.  Coffee was dire, managers please can you take a trip to Lantana or Kaffiene and see how real coffee is done.  My latte was like an americano with milk, seriously bad barista skills and coffee tasted like starbucks.  Eggs benedict whilst attractive in composition was cold, if it had been hot I'm sure it would have been very nice.  Service quite bad, chap that brought a juice to the table turned on his heels whilst I was asking for coffee so I had to wait for ages for another staff member to come along - how hard is it to ask the table is everyone ok for drinks?  Also had water poured into my dirty juice glass.  There seemed to be a lot of badly trained staff running around instead of less staff working more efficiently.

Great atmosphere
Very good service
Expensive - hardly any wine options below the ¬£60 mark despite some quite normal items on the food menu
Food was good, but not fantastic or in line with the pricing. We eat out a lot and feel we have a good judgement of this.

Friends of ours told us about Berners Tavern for breakfast so we took them up on their recommendation and we were not disappointed.  The service was great and the breakfast menu is extensive.  We both thoroughly enjoyed our choices (yoghurt with berries and granola and crumpets for me and the pancakes for my husband).  We will definitely return on our next visit to London.

"We loved the d√©cor and the layout of the seating - we sat right next t the kitchen and watched the glorious food come out which made us more hungry. Shared a prawn roll then had the lamb for 2 with the beans and potatoes. It was absolutely sensational and a must for couples to try. Finished off with the √©clair for the sweet tooth that I am. Staff were super friendly and provided sound advice with what sides or dishes were specialties.
Don't miss visiting Berners Tavern it was an awesome experience.
Friendly service and great food......this is one of my favourite lunch venues.
Outstanding dinner (food and service) with friendly ambiance and stunning decor!  A bit pricy - but well worth it for a special occasion.
Visited for a long lunch and really enjoyed the atmosphere. Really buzzy room. Food was great with lots of great wines at varying prices. Will return.

Had a lovely meal, food was good quality and well balanced. Good wine choice and a lovely room. I'm surprised that the place wasn't full considering how long it takes to get a booking. Also when asking to remove the "optional" service charge off an already pricey (yet very nice) meal, they saw it necessary to send the manager over to question this. The service was good, yet I wouldn't say it went above and beyond to warrant an extra 12.5% on a meal where the full experience has already been built into the price.
Love it , one of my favourites . Pricey but worth it. Great place to go with friends , able to hear yourself speak and tables not too close

My friends and I were completely blown away by the beautiful interior! It was just shame the rest of our experience wasn't the same. After being seated at 10.30 we weren't informed until 10.45 that the breakfast menu had finished at 10.30 so needed to order quickly. Our tea was only poured for one of the three of us drinking it, we had to ask for milk and our food was greasy. When we asked for the bill we were left waiting for over 20mins and when we asked the ma√Ætre d' we were told the waiter should have brought it, no apology and got a bit of attitude. Overall we got the unfortunate sense that we weren't welcome and were in strange transition between breakfast and lunch. They definitely don't cater for the brunch market - real shame!

I booked this restaurant for Sunday lunch with a very good friend of mine. I wanted to impress her with the beauty of London as she was flying in from the Far East. Berners Tavern was a great choice. Once you enter the doors you are immediately impressed by the decor. The ambience was great, and there were many group bookings that lunch time, so it was just the right amount of noise. The service was outstanding with the staff being attentive. The variety of food was great and it came hot and beautifully presented. Can't wait to go back, but this time for dinner!

The whole experience was amazing. Our waitress as so good with us. She was so tentative. Food was great best steak I‚Äôve eaten. It was my daughter birthday they fussed her so much. Would recommend to everyone to go there
Great food, great service, was noisy eating outside bit to be expected due to location
Good place with nice staff welcoming was very good
Food was amazing! Their service was great especially Faton who made sure our meal was great too! Wonderful place!

Great experience cooking our own food on a hot stone at the table. Cheerful, friendly staff, but the restaurant felt over crowded with tables, we are glad we had a window table and not in the middle. Highly recommend for food.

Steak was amazing.
Staff very friendly - but obvious that they needed tables and tried to make us go away as quickly as possible. (e.g. bringing us the bill without us asking)
We've only went for a bite before a movie - so we haven't been there for more than an hour..

Food and drinks were great! The waiter was friendly and was able to offer expertise with the food selection choices. Would definitely come back. We had several different tacos and the porterhouse steaks.
Great brunch with lovely food and plenty of drinks, were looking forward to returning next time in London.

Had been here many times before however this time was definitely a huge difference. On arrival we were advised the seating times are now only 1.5 hours for a meal for 6 people (it was very very rushed and being reminded every 30 mins your time was ticking. Doesn‚Äôt help for ambiance). The steak and sides quality has reduced. It was lacking it‚Äôs old charm. Unfortunately, we will be skipping temper as our steak house.
Excellent cuisine, ambiance and service. Thank you!
Ray was an absolute star - I‚Äôd go back just to see him!

We arrived late but did let the restaurant know in advance. Upon arrival we were given a glass of prosecco each for our anniversary, nice touch, although we had to wait about 10 minutes for it. This was a Saturday night and it looked like a reduced menu from the website - I was looking forward to the soft shell crab taco... I never had a starter but my wife had the chicken wings which apparently were great, juicy and plump. I had the porterhouse steak and at ¬£37.00 just for the steak - I don't think it was worth it. It was cooked perfectly but it arrived luke warm and I've had better at other restaurants for cheaper. My wife had the off the bone prime cut which again was cooked perfectly but lacking in warmth. The fries were as they should be and the hispi cabbage side dish was  delicious. I had the bananaramadrama which considering it is a deep fried Mars bar with banana bread, the Mars bar was cold. My wife enjoyed the Nutella cookie. The serving staff were friendly but service was erratic. Would I go again, probably not when a certain Argentinian steak restaurant is much, much better and comparable in price.

Arrived early and were seated outside, as requsted. We were not offered either of the set menu options so believed these were not available on Saturday which was not correct. Long wait for drinks to arrive and we had to remind staff we had ordered them.
The steak was bland, the hake was very tasty if a little over done.
With so much choice in Covent Garden i wouldn't recommend this Temper which is a shame as we hade been looking forward to our visit.
Fish tacos were amazing. Polenta was outstanding. Loved the flavours.
Nice food, good service but very expensive for what it is. There's much better value places to go to first...
Second time visiting after first visit was great. 45 minute delay between starters and main course  and when dinner eventually arrived, it was c
Great location, friendly and relaxed atmosphere. Service and food are second to none. Will be returning soon.
Excellent service and attentive staff. The staff really went out of their way to make to feel welcome and that you had an enjoyable evening.
True gem in the middle of Covent Garden. Posh, sophisticated, beautiful people. Excellent food and service, one of the best restaurants in London!
Another great experience in the Ivy West Street. Such gorgeous food aswell as friendly professional service. Cocktails are fantastic too!!!

Lunch : calf liver are medium cooked and super soft and juicy. No weird smell or taste, just like a tender piece of pork Belly.
Dessert : perfect blackforrest cake chocolate and rum cherry are in well balanced, best ever have been in london.

Because the lunch experience is so good, I returned for dinner in short notice for snowcrab linguine with garlic.
It's fresh snow crab meat and every bite can taste it subtly. Went well with chablis burgundy white wine.
A good selection of foods with amazing service
Just wonderful
It is a good place to go after a show for a very nice dinning experience.
We enjoyed a nice dinner here. The Foie Gras appetizer was delicious. The rib eye steak was average. Good wine list.
Lovely meal made even better with great service. Would definitely go back

I've been wanting to go to the ivy for years and finally got around to it. I expected the ivy to be pretentious as it was a celebrity haunt in the past but I must say that the ivy exceeded my expectations. From the minute that you walk in the door you are made to feel special. The service (always with a smile ) was outstanding, attentive and extremely professional. There is a wide menu with lots of options so there is something for all culinary tastes. I had the mutton curry which was delicious and the portions are generous. There is also an extensive wine menu with reasonably priced wine. The cocktails are expensive but no more than any other London restaurant. Its known as a hangout for celebrities but the staff will make you will feel every bit as special.  I would recommend The Ivy to anyone I would love to visit again.

Third visit to the Ivy, booking made via Open Table earlier that day for a 9:30pm dinner slot, which suited us perfectly. Table wasn't quite ready when we arrived but don't usually mind waiting in bar with a drink - although nobody arrived to offer one despite being given the drinks menu... while we waited I asked for food menu so we could think about our wine choices. Restaurant was busy as expected but service at the table was poor. At least half an hour for wine order, and when our food order was taken 5 minutes later we were told there was a number of items off the menu... Including our choices.  Tuna Tataki starter was beautifully presented and fresh, although I'm not entirely sure the sprinkling of rice cracker snacks would have accompanied it had there not been renovations pending and the kitchen de-stocking ahead of time. Main course of sirloin steak was cooked to our liking but an expensive alternative to our original choices (and second choices) which were both off the menu. That aside the staff were discrete polite and as we were one of the last tables left didn't rush us to leave. We'll be back again to see the newly refurbished Ivy... but there are other favourites we will explore again first.

Very nice restaurant
Food was 10/10 and staff were nice and friendly
Glorious. Fabulous food. The best tzatziki I‚Äôve had outside of Greece. Lovely service. Highly recommended.
Such delicious food, love the Greek beer and the cold cups they come in!! Lovely service.
Great service and food. The mini wraps were particularly tasty.

I was craving Greek food and my flight was coming up. I checked on OpenTable and found suvlaki in the neighborhood SoHo. So attentive and so delicious. You have to have the tasziki it is fresh and creamy and lovely. I also had the mini lamb souvlaki without potatoes they should never put potatoes in it and was delicious by itself the beats were pickled fresh and the lamb was incredibly tender and cooked perfectly. I've had like this before but this was the best I've had in a long time. I also tried to pull pork and orzo starter which was really tasty and interesting. I will definitely be back.

Went here for a pre- theatre meal and wasn't disappointed, service was excellent, menu explained as small plates and suggestions of how many per person. Good selection of dishes all prepared and cooked fresh. Restaurant was only small but that added to the ambience and we were able to order, eat our meal and still not feel rushed to get to the theatre on time, would definitely return to this restaurant.

Missed our booked slot by  just a few minutes (they have a rather strict 5 minute grace period) but Irina was very helpful and wonderfully friendly, we had a table within 15 minutes, and were offered a shot of ouzo to help with the wait. Service overall was slightly shambolic but very friendly, food was good, and we will definitely be returning.

A very warm welcome at the front desk - lovely to be back in the Wolseley with it‚Äôs beautiful architecture and style. We asked for 3 Cream Teas which was confused with champagne teas. It was hard to attract the attention of the waiters to get hot water for the tea and to get the bill. We split the bill and we were surprised that the instant 3-way split option wasn‚Äôt available, neither was contactless. Felt inefficient not quaint. I‚Äôd forgotten how noisy it can be when busy! Overall a good experience but I know it could easily have been great.
Very nice only i felt Money is more Must be a little less
Loved it,  service was impeccable
I adore this place for a special lunch it is perfect.
Wolseley is one of my favorite restaurants in London  for breakfast lunch or dinner / wish you were in nyc

Lovely dinner in a beautiful room.  Nice service for the most part, although the waiter sneered when we ordered the least expensive wine.  The other server was quite friendly.  Sunday night roast beef special was OK, but the accompanying potatoes were terrific.  Did not care for cauliflower au gratin, but my wife liked it and her flank steak was good.  Desserts looked good, but we passed.  By the way, beautiful washrooms, too!
The food and ambience were wonderful and I would highly recommend this place. The staff were also very friendly and attentive; the service was just amazing! I‚Äôm looking forward to going back.

Could have been so much better. Menu and food excellent. Staff and service poor. Despite having a reservation our table wasn‚Äôt ready, we were told to go to the bar to have a drink and we would be called, which was something of a joke. The bar is too small to allow for a pre meal drink. It took some time to get served and there was very limited seating available causing us to stand. We were not called as promised when our table was ready, we had to ask a member of bar staff to chase this for us. Eventually we were seated at a table which we then asked to change. We had requested a table by a wall as two of our party had hearing defects and loud noise caused discomfort and confusion. The staff did oblige eventually, we had to wait for a suitable table to be prepared . The Wolseley is incredibly noisy which maybe fine for some but does make conversation difficult, also understanding the staff is not easy under such noisy conditions.
Having been seated at our new table we were eventually able to order our meal. We were brought bread and butter. Please don‚Äôt expect a side plate, you are left to eat your bread directly off the tablecloth. Very odd and not to our liking. We did ask for side plates but just received a smile.
Our first course arrived which we all enjoyed, the chopped liver was very good and a very generous portion. Our plates were not cleared but our main course arrived. The waiting staff became flustered and apologised for the error. This then caused, for some reason for us to be pretty much ignored for the rest of the meal. We needed to attract the attention of staff for the dessert menu and then again to order, all of which was unnecessary as the restaurant seemed well staffed. The one aspect of service that did appear very promptly was the bill and rather than leave us for a couple of minutes to check our bill the waiter stood at our table with the credit card machine.

Food was nice but then again, it is not difficult not to go wrong with mashed avocado on toast with an egg on top.What surprised me was how poor the service was. I had booked a table. When we arrived, there was a huge queue which I can accept but what I found unacceptable was that not a single member of staff was willing to make eye contact with us, let alone explain why there was such a queue. All we wanted to know was that they had our booking and that we would ( eventually) be seated. Once we were seated, everything took an age to arrive- coffee- food menu and the food. The waiters were clearly overstretched and therefore had an air of panic about them and this came across as surliness towards us, the diners. I even witnessed one waiter swearing to another waiter, when he inadvertently bumped into him as they were rushing around.I have been here many, many times before but admittedly my last visit was a year or two ago. I hope that my recent experience is not a sign of The Wolseley‚Äôs level of service now!

We overall enjoyed the restaurant except they got my daughter‚Äôs order wrong and served another entree ( veal vs. the pork she ordered). Half way through eating it the waiter took her plate away and exclaimed that they got order wrong, and then placed the correct order (pork chop) down in front of her. She was not given the choice to finish what they first gave her, and she did not like the pork they served.
This being said, Wolseley took the her dinner off our bill. We enjoyed the atmosphere and will likely come back again.

The Wolseley is a great favourite and certainly didn't disappoint on this occasion - afternoon tea with some old friends. For the first team we were given a table in one of the balcony areas which was more intimate. I thought this might mean that we might be forgotten by the staff but just the opposite happened and we were given lots of attention, including several times being offered top ups of our sandwiches and cakes. A great experience as always.

Excellent service and good food. Everything is cooked to perfection and beautifully presented.  The Coq au Vin was succulent with delicious sauce , the smoked fish very enjoyable and the Wolsey burger was a'proper' burger.
Busy atmosphere, beautiful decor, service a bit slow and coffee late and cold, unfortunately. Food was amazing, though, and I will definitely give it a second chance.

Very disappointed with lunch at the Wolseley - the service was terrible - we had to ask several times for drinks and the bill and for our table to be cleared when we had finished lunch - the staff were bordering on rude - it was, as expected, packed which lends to a nice atmosphere, vibrant but the food is standard - very disappointing.
Simply fabulous.  I highly recommend this restaurant for brunch!
Late night bit after theater found staff  snooty and dismissive. The room and atmosphere is fantastic.  Food was well prepared.
A very special place..... historical, old world and exceeded expectations.   The ambiance, service & food all first class... üëçüëç
I very much enjoyed my dinner at the Wolseley - buzzing atmosphere and the food delicious
Will definitely go back for breakfast as I've heard is really good too! Loved my dinner and will certainly go back!
Have been many times and sure I will be back many more. Food and service always consistently top notch.

We had a lovely experience here - the atmosphere, superb and the staff, very smart.  I ordered the rosemary chicken and my husband had the venison. Both dishes were simply brilliant!  I would highly recommend this place and we will be back next visit to London!
The Wolseley was a great venue for a quick tea for catching up with old friends.  Delicious tea and great ambience.

Visited on 13 December at 18:00.. Very busy and we arrived 20 minutes early but our table was ready. The food was excellent and even though it was busy, our waitress was very attentive ensuring our glasses were never empty! The reason for 4 stars as opposed to 5 is that it felt very much like a cafe culture as opposed to an intimate dinner for two. I wouldn't recommend as a romantic dinner. Would recommend for casual dining though
Fantastic place for a special experience, top table menu great value

I love this place - you always know what you're getting, the service is excellent, the food is fantastic, and they have a separate vegetarian menu which is a huge plus for someone like me who is usually presented with only one vegetarian "option" in a restaurant.
Have been a few times. This was not as good as the other times. Not all food came out together. Apology was made still....
Had a wonderful time dining for a champagne afternoon tea. Definately recommend.

I booked a table for me and my family for a post-graduation afternoon tea. When the waiters saw me wearing my robe they came to congratulate me which I thought was really nice. We ordered high tea which was impeccably presented and exceptionally good. And then I was presented with a free chocolate and cherry cake to congratulate me on my achievement. I was stunned and very very touched. A wonderful experience!
Everytime we visit London we go to The Wolseley. Beautiful restaurant and amazing food. Truly a British experience.
The service was A1 it really was, the food we ate was just delicious, it's a simple as that brilliant service and brilliant food.
Lovely setting for a client breakfast meeting, great service and food. Will definately be repeating my visit.

Your chef could do with a lesson on the art of making porridge. It is better served hot
and slightly full bodied instead of warm and watery and thin. Coffee very expensive. Fresh
fruit by Sunday morning a little old. Cooked breakfasts very good.

I shared afternoon tea with my Father whilst my Mother had brunch. Both were excellent. Free refills on the afternoon tea sandwiches and cake etc. Gorgeous building, excellent service and fantastic quality.

Very busy on Saturdays and Sundays so it's essential to book. At peak time (around 4pm) the staff were struggling and our table wasn't ready when we arrived. Things improved though with the excellent afternoon tea - beautiful scones and generous servings. Wonderful venue, though probably best enjoyed when not quite so packed.
This is my third time at the Wolseley and I love it, as does my family.This is my best restaurant.

I have been to The Wolseley many times and love it. The food and service were slightly below par on this occasion, with the wine whisked away from the table we were left with empty glasses for most of the main course and eventually had to ask for a refill. My halibut was slightly overlooked and thus dry. I am quite sure that this is unusual but it was a shame. My fellow diners thoroughly enjoyed their fare and all other aspects for me were very good.

Great buzzy ambience.
A little confusion with our order for afternoon tea. Possibly a cultural/language misunderstanding. Overall good service. Staff generally seemed to be enthused with service
Best restaurant in London, nothing else to say

As always the experience of eating at the Wolseley was fantastic, whether it be lunch or dinner.The food, staff and ambiance never fail to amaze I shall certainly be booking again on my next trip to London

We have eaten here for Dim sum Sunday many many times, on this occasion I felt it wasn‚Äôt as great as it used to be, the menu has changed and doesn‚Äôt seem as good value for money, less dim sum no after dinner drink and quite a bland prawn main course.  That said the staff are always outstanding and I still absolutely love this restaurant plus I am prepared to give all restaurants some slack at this difficult time, would still most definitely return.
Fantastic restaurant, we love the ambience, the food is exceptional and brilliant service.
Good service

The food for the weekend signature brunch was excellent - all 4 courses were delicious and so well prepared.  Overall it was a lovely experience an I look forward to visiting for this again in the near future.

The service was very poor. Waiters walked passed us without acknowledging us. They forgot to serve the rest of our dinner. It‚Äôs one of my favourite restaurants and I was surprised by the lack of service.
We had a great time! The food was fabulous, the weekend brunch was fantastic value for money and the service was spot on. Will be back, thank you.
Great food and good service

Service was dreadful
Food was below average
Over priced
Service was below expectations. Rarely saw waiter for follow up drinks, food, check.  Overall excellent tasting food, but experience was sullied by below average attentiveness and service.
Incredible tastes, great service and the atmosphere is so nice!
Great food, superb service and a lovely ambience, will definitely go again
Great food but we were slightly rushed from our table at the end of the meal which was a shame....
Food menu changed and really good things like dick spring rolls and pork ribs removed which isn‚Äôt good! But overall good as always
Superb food and service, we will return for sure to taste another menus
Everything was excellent, except we ordered two main courses and they were served 20 minutes apart. So the side orders were cold when the second came!

This was a bit dissapointing. I booked this for my partners birthday. The staff rushed us a lot when you expect good service for the price you pay. They weren‚Äôt willing to make any kind of exceptions with the menu. They also weren‚Äôt willing to give me a glass of Prosecco when they were selling prosecco bellinis but just wouldn‚Äôt give me a prosecco on its own! They took our plates away too quickly and the whole thing was very rushed. Wouldn‚Äôt really recommend this to a friend as you can get a nicer restaurant in london with nicer staff and probably less money!

Unfortunately we didn't enjoy the great food enough since the restaurant was so noisy. Techno music was constant all evening and made it difficult to talk across the table and also to hear what the waiters were saying about the food and wine. Also a shame when you prefer to talk with your friends while eating instead of listening to the "music".

This was an anniversary treat for myself and my husband. From beginning to end this was a wonderful experience. Staff were attentive but not intrusive. Cocktails were lush. And the food (we had the lower priced Signature menu) was the most delicious we have ever eaten. As we were going to the theatre following our meal staff ensured we were not rushed at all but got the food out to us and kept an eye on the time for us so that we could just relax and enjoy without having to worry about missing our show. We will be back next time we visit London
Excellent food, the service was excellent, can‚Äôt fault it

Had not been for nearly a year, (we live "up North") late running show, that we were at, made us quite late for our table, but no problem. Staff were great, food and drink fantastic, as usual. One of our top five London restaurants.
To loud music. Hard to make a good conversation. Everything goes so fast. We leave the restaurant in 1 hour and 140pounds lighter. Overhyped resto  but with great food.
Second time here and it didn‚Äôt disappoint.  The food really is excellent.  The atmosphere is great, there is a real vibe to the place but it‚Äôs still easy to talk.  Will be coming back.
Food is divine. The presentation and taste are both exceptional. It is a real for people who enjoy good food and appreciate great culinary skills.

We went to Hakkasan for lunch on Sunday and went for the signature Dim Sum menu. This is now our 5th or 6th visit for Dim Sum Sundays.  The food did not disappoint.  The cocktails and champagne (included in the set menu) were excellent - also great to see them adding some new options to the choices. The food menu has stayed the same for a couple of years (some variation to the main course and dessert) but is always delicious and beautifully presented. Good, buzzy atmosphere and attentive service.  Would highly recommend.

Good food
Good atmosphere
Not so good music
Service could have been better

Really excellent pre theatre place so close to Dominion
Service was good BUT when you order your cocktail you expect that to be served first not in the middle of your meal!!
Food continues to impress

Hakkasan never fails to deliver ! The food is beautiful, the service impeccable. The OpenTable deal makes it great value. I had forgotten how good Hakkasan was, will definitely not leave it so long till next time.

Visited Hakkasan many years ago and was blown away by the experience, so we thought we'd redo the experience but it was a disappointment. We went for one of the set signature menus. Most of the dishes were very good, but a few were rather plain, which is maybe to be expected and no cause for complaint. Overall, the staff were rushing us through to have the table set for the next party, which meant that 2 starters were served at the same time and 4 main courses at the same time. So the last main courses were rather cold when we got to them, and the entire meal was stressful. With the last dish came the bill, and when we asked if we could get coffee after dinner, we we're told we could get that at the bar.  I would not recommend this for a special occasion, but it you're just in it for the food and you're willing to pay close to 200 pounds per person for it, this might be the place for you. Be aware also that they add a13,5% service fee on top of the menu price, which would have been OK if it was conditioned to good service, but it's not.

Went there for dinner. Service, ambiance and decoration is amazing. Minute you walk in they treat you like a king. However, the food was overpriced for the experience I had. The food was average and I was not even half full. I ended up paying ¬£40 for 2 dimsum, and a moderate main dish. I would reccomend it if you're willing to spend at least 65¬£ per head on a set menu but if you're a normal person you probably can't afford it. Interesting place and experience though it didn't leave me screaming.

Server named Bertosz was a horrible waiter. Off putting, awkward, unhelpful. His opening line after we waited for 15 mins for him was "Yes?" We asked for help with menu and he said "yes everything is good".

How that kind of service earns a Michelin star Is beyond me.

Great experience!
Not cheap, true, but one does not go to Hakkasan to save money.
The food was amazing, unique yet subtle and the dishes less small than we thought.
Also, the service was very good.

We liked the ambience less. It was very loud and crowded. The restaurant is bigger than we thought and even though the service is very good, it feels like a factory.

Bottom line, very good food and a worthwhile experience if you are willing to spend a little more.

Very disappointing.
Took business clients out for a meal, their first in London from the US, only to be told we ordered too much, the food being average at best and then being rushed off our table with time limit we weren't made aware initially. On the upside, the cocktails were very good.

Food was lovely well presented and cooked to perfection. We had a set menu offer but the staff allowed variation for my daughter who doesnt eat meat. service was great as we had to get to the theatre on time.
Very enjoyable with good wine selection
Great food, great service and a fantastic atmosphere. Cocktails are amazing too.
Always amazing, food, ambience, service
Superb service allied to excellent food

With frequently great reviews, I couldn't wait to celebrate my Birthday here recently - it did not disappoint!

Hidden off Tottenham Court Road in a maze of side streets. The interior is a world away from the bright lights and busy streets of the West End: dark, mysterious, Eastern and romantic.

The service is excellent from the cloakroom to bar. Very attentive waiting staff take care of everything surreptitiously.

There were few vegetarian options on offer, however, the food was delicious! We had a dim sum platter followed by vegetarian chicken and Singapore noodles. The dishes were presented with simplicity but we're colourful and appealing.

We didn't order dessert but the staff surprised me with a delicious mango sorbet nestled on a bed of raspberry crumble, complete with Birthday candle. Simply yummy!

Last but not least, the cocktail menu is highly recommended!!!

It's not difficult to understand the popularity of Hakkasan. Can't wait to go back...

We went for the special "Taste of Hakkasan" menu, incredible value for money, but you do have to go in a non-peak time (OK for us as we like to eat late).
The atmosphere is really special, beautiful decor. The restaurant is hidden away in a little alleyway off Tottenham Court Road.
Service was mostly excellent, all the waiters, servers, coat-check people, etc. were friendly and helpful.
Only complaint is that we had quite a long wait between the starter and the main course (with no apology or explanation either) even though the restaurant was not very busy at the time. We weren't in a hurry so we didn't really mind, but it was a low point in an otherwise impeccable experience.
