Quality of food and ingredients is top notch.

Our visit to Hakkasan was a birthday treat to my husband. He loves good food and as we live in the north west, we took the opportunity to pay a visit while down south for a friends wedding. The food was wonderful. My husband made some very appreciative noises about the duck spring rolls in particular! The waiter was great. He was very friendly and the restaurant obviously runs like a well oiled machine.
My only criticism is that the tables are far too close together. We were sat in between two couples and the man next to me literally had his head in my plate when he went to pick his napkin from under his table. This was a very rare opportunity for us to have some couples time without our young kids. It wouldn't stop us from paying another visit and we had a great time, but it did make the occasion less comfortable.

Although it took over 30 minutes after our booking time to seat us as the restaurant was 'running late' (I think they forgot us after asking us to wait at the bar!), once we were found a table, they were very apologetic and the food, wine and service was all class.  Excellent wine recommendations to accompany the meal.

Was good for late booking. Good food good enough service. Very prompt
Better duck at HKK than here but still valuable

This is one of my favourite ‚Äúspecial occasion‚Äù places.  Although it‚Äôs Michelin starred, you don‚Äôt need a 2nd mortgage to afford it (although I couldn‚Äôt do it every week either!) and the food, service and ambience are everything you‚Äôd expect from a star.  We went on a Monday night and it was pretty busy, but we didn‚Äôt feel too crowded due to the clever layout/ decor.  Feeling too lazy to choose a la carte, we had the ¬£65 set menu for 2 and an extra dish of soft shell crab.  Each dish was excellent but my favourite was undoubtedly the crab.  I also recommend a cocktail aperitif before diving into the food.  Looking forward to my next visit already.
Very freindy staff and excellent service, great cocktails served by expert cocktail barmen. The food as usual was superb, i would highly recommend this restaurant for a special occasion.
Lunch at Hakkasan is the best you can get. Their steamed Dim Sum is probably some of the best food you can eat.
I live just by hakkasan so visit regularly and it's still my favourite restaurant in London!
We've been here for the second time and again, we loved the food and the stuff was very friendly.

I booked Hakkasan as a surprise birthday treat for my boyfriends birthday. I was not disappointed and it over exceeded my expectations. We had the Sunday Dim Sum. The food was exquisite, a great atmosphere and polite staff. Very happy and will definitely go again for a special treat/occasion.
The ambience was good and the service was great. I really enjoyed the food and think it was good value for money. The cocktails were amazing and would go back for these alone.

Staff - Really Polite and Professional, Ladies were amazing.
DJ - Utter rubbish, was not even mixing, just playing long repetitive songs.
Food - AMAZING 10/10
Bar staff - quick and efficient but poor cocktail makers and looked depressed, a smile would be nice.

Our table was 30 mins late, i got told early on a few different stories. we got given 2 flumes of champaign for the wait and an apology, which is real nice. when paying, we were told the champaign was refunded by the manager, not that we ordered it in the first place so was confusing.

All smiles, but while i found it funny, we were treated like clueless children, maybe not the intent, but thats what it felt like. The staff did handle it well so don't take that away. 10/10 still.

Disorganised front reception. Impolite woman at the computer taking names. Great cocktails although we had to wait for a long time before we were even acknowledged.
Great menu, fantastic meal.
Waiters very good but not attentive.
Floor manager not attentive in any way whatsoever, just walking around.
Overall, we came for the food and were satisfied. Higher standard of service expected. Worst part of the evening was when the lady came to take payment, impolite and only wanted payment. Not interested in asking if we had a great evening.
Much improvement needed.
This is a decent chinese, i have been ther maybe 25 time so im not a critic, but its tired, the food is unlikley to warrant any complaints but the world has advanced and they have not
We booked a table at Hakkasan for our wedding anniversary.The cocktails, the wines and the food were all very good, as expected.
its too fushion, not traditional chinese. and too overpriced

Hakkasan obviously has a reputation for being an excellent restaurant brand. I had a number of London locals or expats recommend the restaurant to me. This of course raised my level of expectation. It is very satisfying to be able to say that Hakkasan didn't falter and actually surpassed expectations. The ambience, food and drinks are top notch but as with any great dining experience, it was the staff that were the key. Professional, friendly and engaging. If you want to lock in a good meal in Soho, don't muck around, just go to Hakkasan.

We ordered the ¬£ 70 menu. It took less than 2 hours to serve and get us out. The ambiance is very nice and trendy. The music is smooth and the waitresses are beautifull. But in the end you want the tastes and the plates to be surprisingly good. And it was good, but no surprises. Not as special as we hoped it to be. Not enough value for our money (¬£480 for 4). A little disappointed. I woud suggest Ming Jiang.
Nice place, excellent food and environment.
O.M.G!! This place is out of this world!!! The food was excelent and the staff were great!
Cool but pricey

The setting in a quiet alley was a contrast with the vibrant atmosphere inside. The kumquat mojito was an excellent opening drinks, and the dim sum tasted as heavenly as they look. Our duck salad small eat was very tasty but a bit heavy for appetizer. The lemon tart with pavlova sticks was light and delightful

It was our second time at Hakkasan and we were not disappointed...food was excellent and the service was excellent, would definitely go again.
Love this place.

It's a high standard Chinese restaurant, in a beautiful and chic (but maybe a bit too dark) setting.
Food is very good but slightly too pricey in my opinion.
Service ok, I found funny that the waiter advised us to reduce our order since, in her opinion, we had ordered too much food. At the end she was probably right but the vegetable dim sum we gave up wouldn't have killed us...
Very nice and classy service!
Absolutely wonderful

Great fish/seafood, excellent service, good Covid H&S measures in place.
We sat at the counter and thoroughly enjoyed the evening, lovely for a special occasion.

I might recommend Scott's to a friend, but only with caveats.  It is over priced. Full of Americans on expense accounts.   And for a seafood place, the fish was good but not extraordinary and certainly not for the cost.  Decor is pleasant enough and the tables are reasonably spaced.  Service was mixed but friendly.
Dry poor, food was cold. And undercooked and it was a birthday and no special service whatsoever. Deeply disappointed

Business meal/Birthday meal...great service from waiters and Manager Jessica having more guests than booked for she accommodated us perfectly
The food was amazing as always and all guests left very satisfied
Great for lunch & diner, nice atmosphere, good service, very nice menu, I definitely recommend it
Excellent food, service and atmosphere at whole!!!
Terrific service, setting and good. Great fish and deserts. Highly recommended
The Dover Sole is fabulous .Service impeccable .Truly a special dining experience !
Lovely food. Disappointed in the price of the drinks though. I paid ¬£5 for a lemonade and it arrived and was only half a glass full. Not very good value for money.
Another very good visit to an excellently conceptualized restaurant. A vegan west coast feel that works very well.
The food was delicious and the lucky cat cocktail was great fun.
Really good and consistent as always. The food was served rather quickly, which is why I am giving it 4 and not 5 stars as we finished eating in 1 hour, which for a dinner felt rather short.
Great food and service, would definitely recommend!
Food is not amazing but ambience and service excellent
I‚Äôve been wanting to try this restaurant for a while now and it didn‚Äôt disappoint; beautiful food, great ambiance and love the Pisco Sours button on the table!
Dinner was very good!

Problematic service
Courses were returned 5 or 6 times
Disappointing

The bar staff were amazing, they allowed us to try Sake alcoholic drinks before ordering one as this type of rice alcoholic drink was totally new to us. The food is also very interesting. Would definitely try the beef tongue if you are a foody, as it‚Äôs really tender and tasty...
Down side was slow service, but it was new year‚Äôs eve...
Calamari wasn‚Äôt the best. Not a great cocktail selection or taste. But the food was ok. The seafood pasta was ok

Lovely service and beautifully presented food, relaxed yet chic outdoor ambiance, great cocktails and wine list - had such a great eve.

(Missing the 5th star as sadly the truffle pizza neither tasted nor smelt of truffle which was quite disappointing - despite being able to see evidence truffle shavings all over it. All other food was fantastic).
Great restaurant highly recommended food was decent portions and very good quality. Service was attentive
The vongole is f
We really enjoyed are dining experience at Harry‚Äôs Bar.  Everything was of a high standard.  Great restaurant to go for any occasion.  You won‚Äôt be disappointed.
Simply excellent. Fabulous food, reasonably priced and truly excellent service.   Cannot wait to go back.

We were given a very warm welcome from the moment we arrived. There was a lovely hand written Birthday card on the table and the maitre d wished my husband a happy birthday. The food is inventive, complex and delicious - very fresh and always tasty. We were too full for a pudding but the waiter brought over a scoop of sorbet with a candle - nice touch!
The fish tempura were perfect and the duck and pork rillettes incredibly tasty. Lovely cod and creative blend of sauces - buttery and Asian, showed great skill.
Very lucky to have Clipstone on our doorstep- but it‚Äôs well worth taking the tube!

Really impressed with Clipstone - very friendly and welcoming staff who were knowledgeable and passionate about the food and drink. All of the food was wonderful and they made me an off menu cocktail. We sat outside - covered and with heaters. Loved the experience, will recommend to friends and hopefully return soon.
One of my favorites in London- just never disappoints !
Wonderful local
Food was fantastic, really tasty, well presented, good sizes. Product was high quality. Ambience is relaxed and nicely decorated. A must try in Fitzrovia.

2nd or 3rd time we have just gone to Clipstone for an early evening dinner.  Food is always good and they are dry welcoming.  also choice of wine in half bottle carafes means easy to have bothe white and re wine for two of us.  Staff always helpful nad atmosphere buzzy without being too noisy.  Thanks

Food very plentiful, interesting unusual flavour combinations, service very attentive, one mistake on a request for gluten free, but quickly realised and corrected, the slight hesitation, it was left on the bill, but immediately removed when pointed out, just wish the waiter had looked our bill before presenting it. Definitely would recommend.

We enjoyed our dinner for four and were impressed with the attention to our dietary requirements. Good, efficient and gracious service despite the rustic environment. Quite noisy as restaurant small and busy!
Outstanding!!

Outstanding, creative cuisine from a highly accomplished kitchen.     Not sure about the 'small plates' dimension but there are enough variations to create your own personalised menu.     Small but very well thought out wine list with flexible serving options.     Friendly and relaxed service.    Dining room is a bit cramped and the overall noise level is high (as with parent Portland) so a place for exuberant dining.   I loved it!

Went after Sunday Times A A Gill review and not disappointed. Nice food concept and excellent dishes- exceptionally well prepared. Wine on tap good value. Excellent staff and superb service which really made the evening .

Great service and well presented food s well as great tasting food and great atmosphere would recommend to everyone I know for contemporary cuisine and a great place to eat Been to many other restaurants but palm Court in Covent garden is my favourite so far
Food ok but rude service, specially from the hostess.
Great Service and a lovely atmosphere !
Very lovely evening at Palm Court- the food was excellent and good value, and the service was exemplary (particularly our waiter Peter).

Saw some classic dishes on the menu & the selection is very good for the special offer of ¬£20 for two courses. We had beef stroganoff & salmon, which were both nice. Would come back to try something else.
Had a lovely meal with great but unhurried service.  There was a table with slightly unruly children nearby which was a little off-putting but generally a great experience.
Great food (as always), really friendly waiter  and very accommodating as my parents had to leave early for the theatre. Would recommend!

Second time visiting, first time was outstanding but this time not so much. Food was great like it usually is but the service was lacking. We had to constantly request for our order to be taken (main and dessert along with extra drinks) and no one checked up on us until we requested the bill. Again we were kept waiting a while for this and has to flag a waiter down. Perhaps it was due to visiting at 6 as opposed to last time when it was a lunchtime reservation. Both times were for a birthday but this time it didn't feel like a celebration, instead I felt rather neglected!
We had a really great time with fantastic food  ambience and service. Will definitely visit again.

We received a very warm and courteous welcome. The young lady who served us ( name unknown ) was very friendly and efficient. The voucher for my birthday Prosecco was received warmly an served chilled as we like it. Altogether a very pleasant time spent catching up with friends we do not see very  often.
Fantastic food and extremely friendly, polite service. Would highly recommend.

Great early evening meal (post theatre matinee pefrormance) Arrived slightly early but still seated quickly. Service Good, food very tasty.
Would advise booking as filled up quickly after about 6:45
Great for a pre theatre meal.  Menu has a good choice and you can opt for a restricted theatre menu for a set price if you want to.  Quick service but you do not feel rushed at all

A traditional French Brasserie with good old fashioned French cuisine Unusually quiet with great deals and very reasonable prices Traditional uniformed French style waiters Special pre and post theatre small menus Convenenient for Royal Opera House
Food and service were very good, will certainly revisit

A beautiful restaurant, badly let down by poor service, food, ambience and staffing.

The steak was passable, but the chips on the 'gluten free menu' turned out not to be, leaving my partner with a choice of steak with mash or fried vegetables - distinctly odd.

I ordered a quinoa salad with trout, but asked for the goats cheese to be left off. A simple request the staff managed to get wrong 3 times.

After 40 minutes the rest of the guests had finished their meal and I was presented with a bowl of limp, undressed lettuce with a small amount of flaked fish and no quinoa.

There was no apology from the (very absent) maitre d', and no discount from the bill, but the apologetic waiter gave us vouchers for drinks on a future occasion. Suffice to say, we won't be using them.

Good food but the restaurant is too dark to read the menu. the service is good but not sharp. Experienced the place as quite loud although it was not too busy.  Relaxed and french in flavour. Heavy on decor rather than ambience.

We ate here before going to the theatre. The food was delicious and the staff were very friendly and welcoming.
I would highly recommend eating here, you will not be disappointed.

My first visit with friend for Christmas lunch and enjoyed the occasion very much. The restaurant was packed out and, as a result, very noisy but I guess on a normal day it is quieter and one can hear oneself speak! The food was very enjoyable and the service very efficient.

I hope to return in the New Year.

Overall the experience was good.
Food being very good as an improvement I would recommend that the space could be utilised different.
Quite crowded when the restaurant is full, a bit noisy for a dinner time.

A bit more attention to details will improve the service delivery ( such as setting the table and NOT TO FORGET THE ESPRESSO ON MY PALM COURT DESSERT:)
This restaurant is one of my favourites for good food and no rush, especially when I'm dining alone.

My friend and I dined at Palm Court Monday evening, we chose it because of location to our hotel, and we had a 50% off food voucher.  We arrived for 8.15pm, restaurant was not busy, yet we were not attended to immediately, and then greeted in a rushed manner.  Staff were more concerned with conversations with themselves or with a member of staff that was already dining there, food very bland and tasteless, 50% offer was not explained properly to us so we ended up having to pay FULL PRICE for a very uninspiring sirloin steak..  not a good choice, plenty of others, that are much nicer in lots of ways!
Great Dining experience.  Good food, nice ambience, OK services. Recommend
Very efficient service & food just right for pre-theatre. Very good food & excellent value
Good food, good price, nice staff - never disappoints

Have been several times pre and post theatre. This occasion was after a matinee before going to see another show. Slick service you will never be late and relaxed atomasphere. The food is always great and the special menu is excellent. Highly recommend.
Very nice food, with good portions.  Excellent and friendly staff - would go back again.
Nice food, good service, good Sunday lunch , worth a visit

Three of us went for Monday lunch, thinking there might be no atmosphere, but, on the contrary, the place was buzzing but not noisy.  The service was excellent and the food good as always.  The prices are very reasonable - even the bottle of Champagne we had!  There's a good, varied menu and the set two or three course menus are particularly good value with enough choice.

Really pleasant experience having dinner at the Palm Court. We needed to have a early dinner so we decided to get the pre theatre menu, which is a 3 course meal for ¬£17.95 I think it. Amazing value for money, the food was outstanding!! Every single bite was delicious and mouthwatering. The wine was really nice too. The staff were very attentive and really friendly which made this a really excellent dining experience!
Couldn't get over the value for money..... Food was stunning

We went to the Palm Court pre theatre and was so disappointed with the service or lack of it.
Waited ages for waiter to attend us as clearly we were in invisable to him.
Starters were good, but they forgot to bring the peas during the main course and then forget to bring my tea at the end of the meal. With so many excellent restaurants in the area, we will not be going back. By the way ,we choose A la Carte as the pre theatre menu did not appeal.
So if you want to avoid terrible service leave Palm Court well alone.
The service was attentive and the food was first class at reasonable prices. This was our third visit and we have not been disapointed.
Great value, perfectly cooked food with Formby service and a great atmosphere. Perfect for a few friends going out for dinner
It was our first time at Palm Court. Service was friendly, some dishes better than others, lamb and seabass were our highlights. Overall, with the 50% TT offer, very good value.
Service was great, love the decor, love all the candles, great cocktail

We had a pre theater dinner here before Mamamia. A loud French bistro style restaurant. Roast chicken with fries was tender, a little on the salty side. Roast salmon was very good with hollandaise sauce. Kids were happy with their selections on the children's menu. 14 pounds for 2 course pre theater (limited choice) menu. Service was good. Can get coupon if you got 2 for 1 offer with 7 day pass at rail station, but cannot use on Friday. Offer is for 1 free entreeA

This is a nice restaurant with friendly and attentive staff. Everything we asked for, we received quickly, despite it being extremely busy. The food was presented well and was cooked to our liking. My only criticism is that the tables are too close together and you feel quite squashed in, not great if you're wanting an intimate dinner for 2!!

We had a brilliant time. Ambience great, waiter hilarious but professional, so friendly and funny.
Food excellent for everyone for all courses without exception. Can't fault anything and would go back again.
Thank you!
Great place for food , menu good and great service
Use Palm Court every time we go to London for theatre breaks. Always excellent

Palm court 2 course meal with kir royale wAs not worth ¬£17. Not much to choose from on menu no vegetable were included. Portion sizes were ok. Restaurant was very packed and only about 6inch between some tables.
Another most enjoyable meal with delicious food and good service.

.

Have dined here on many occasions and as usual, was a good experience'

wc

As usual the food was really good - we had the baked brie and the duck salad special for starters, the half chicken and lamb cutlets special for main course. If your're hungry - then go for the chicken (there's enough for 2). Palm Court Brasserie can be quite noisy when it is busy, so not a place for quiet conversation. The service however is excellent. Erica remembered us from a previous visit and was very attentive all evening. I arrived with a musical instrument case, which they found a space for behind the reception. We washed it all down with a bottle of the house red, very good value at ¬£15.50.

Nice place in the iddle of bustling covent garden - i have been ere many times before.
Service was a little on the slow side on this occassion but food was tasty and good value.

Very good service, good food. A pleasant lunch as usual

WC

The Christmas lunch offered by the Palm Court Brasserie proved excellent, very tasty, very filling and I love the atmosphere at this restaurant. The serving staff were great, attentive by not overwhelming. We had a friend join us very late which meant he could only stay for a drink - this was no problem to the staff.
The food was really tasty and was a great start to the Christmas week.

The restaurant was recommended to us and we were not disappointed. The service was great, the atmosphere relaxed and the menu had all food tastes covered. Each course was well timed and although we did not drink considered that wine and beverages were affordable. We are from New Zealand and would definitely dine at this restaurant again.
Palm Court Brasserie was enjoyable but not mind blowing. The food was pretty standard, the staff were attentive and the location was convenient. Nice enough and great value but not overly impressive.

As always at Palm Court, staff are knowlegeable, friendly and efficient, from the initlal greeting onwards. Good atmosphere and food was well cooked although we both found jus, or gravy, in main course overpowered the meat; only negative comment. Booked toptable 50% offer, which was immediately ackowleged and confirmed; this does not always happen in restaurants. Well priced wine list with a good choice. Enjoyable meal before the theatre ( from the a la carte ) and look forward to visiting here again

I admit I'm the all time tricky customer but the waiting staff did everything to counter it - they humoured my 'cheekiness, they brought out the birthday cake for my friend and even gave her a complimentary glass of fizz AND charged my phone for me while I was there terrorising the staff (not literally)

All in all, a great experience - a little dark but definitely had that romantic edge!
The food in the restaurant were really nice and it's an enjoyable experience with great service. The rump of lamb was my favorite. It's great for family and friends.

The  Palm Court Brasserie is an old favourite. Well located in Covent Garden and serving excellent food at good prices. The current special of Lamb Shank is near the best I have ever had and there were four of us who all thought the food and service was excellent. Long may it continue.

Palm Court Brasserie
39 King Street, Covent Garden, London, WC2E 8JS
Special offer 2 courses ¬£17.50
Unfortunately the vegetarian main dish, roquefort risotto, turned out to be too salty and very stodgy. Service was good but the side dish of green beans we asked for didn't arrive, so we had to ask again and wait. We were then charged for two portions. Overall not bad but not brilliant.

Palm Court Brasserie in Covent Garden transports you to France as soon as you step inside. Aside from the brilliant food and exceptional wines, the menu offered great value for money. Although the waiters took a little while to take your order (understandable given the narrow busy restaurant) they were well informed and always had smiles on their faces. I would thoroughly recommend Palm Court Brasserie to any of my friends.
Good location, nice atmosphere

Palm Court Covent Garden.  Have been before and will go again.  TT offer makes for good value.  Only criticism is that the blooms on the table decorations had died and should have been replaced.  That aside, would recommend
We went for the set menu option of 2 courses for ¬£18.50 which was great value for money. there was a surprisingly wide choice of both starters and main courses.

Palm Court Brasserie Convent Garden  was a delightful and a most pleasant dining experience. My party of seven were received and seated with amiable but professional manners. Orders were taken  quickly and the food served in expected time. The food was well turned out, tasty and fresh.They were value for money. If another occasion arises we'll surely dine at Palm Court again

Palm Court Brasserie, Covent Garden. Place was very busy and the tables are very cramped together. Service was adequate, although it felt like the waiters were not looking at you when they talk to you. They were rushing around and when the poured the wine, he was trying to do it so quickly he spilt wine on the table (no apology.) However the food was excellent and it was very good value.

I really enjoy going to the Palm Court Brasserie in Covent Garden, London. It's been awhile since I went and I was so glad to rediscover this gem. The food was lovely and service great. I know my friends will dine there again. I definitely will be back soon.
Palm court brasserie, covent garden is a lovely place to eat. Great food, very attentive service and with 50% off in a restaurant just off the piazza is an absolute bargain. Highly reccommend

Palm Court Brasserie - Covent Garden

Good service, good atmosphere.
Generous portions, did not need extra side orders.
we went to the Palm Court Brasserie in Covent Garden on Friday evening and had lovely evening staff and food were excellent, definately go again

Seond time eating here and certainly won't be the last.
The main this this time was the excellent service we received. This on top of the great food and nice atmosphere made for another nice evening at the Palm Court Brasserie.

From the very first moment, when we arrived a little early, we felt at home. The friendly, convivial atmosphere enjoyed outside in Covent Garden was soon transfered to the intinate surroundings of the restaurant. As we waited for a guest to arrive, we felt no sense of urgency to order and were left to while away the time. Oh yes, the food! Well, the Sea Bass, the Haddock and the Lamb Rump could not be faltered. In short, a very enjoyable evening helped by very helpfull, and engaging, staff.

Have eaten here twice. Lovely little venue, very cosy and intimate with candlelight - good romantic spot for dates. The food was delicious - very large portions so excellent value for money. We went for a dinner, but as it was so relaxed in there, we stayed for another two hours just having a couple of glasses of wine, the staff don't harass you at all - though can occasionally be a bit slow.

Palm Court Brasserie-Covent Garden was a delight from start to finish. The staff were, without exception, friendly and extremely efficient. The food was delicious and the atmosphere perfect.....Highly recommended.

Fantastic Meal - somehow managed to fit in 3 courses but needed a good walk afterwards!
Great food and attentive but not intrusive service
If you're in the area, this restaurant must be tried.
Garlic prawns highly recommended!
Will definitely go back!

Palm Court Brasserie, London was in a good location within the West End an easy walking distance from multiple tube stations.

Food was very good, with plenty of very good options on the offer menu that we opted for.

For service, if you are not asking any questions then I am sure the service would be fine but we asked if a lower price entree could be swapped into the offer menu from the proper menu. It was agreed that the manager would be asked but 15 mins later this had still happened.

Good menu range with helpful service and good ambiance. Would have been rather noisy if a quiet table, as requested, were essential, as larger groups tend to dominate. In the men's toilet, a single cubicle only was available.

The Palm Court Brasserie, Covent Garden is a decent enough place for a spot of light lunch whilst out and about around London.  The menu was as a little on the uninspiring side although the food itself was well executed and nicely presented. Not a place for special occasions but great value and really good service.

Palm court brasserie is a cute little place, with nice service in a good location.  Our pate, brie and steak were great, the muscles weren't amazing, but the wine was good.  Overall great value, and I'll pop in again.
Wonderful meal for four before the theatre, great value with the 50% deal. I would recommend.
Nice humble brasserie. It was very busy on the wednesday night that we went, sot the atmosphere was nice. The tuna steak was lovely. WIth the 50% offer, would recommend.

This lunch time offer was perfect, glass of kir royale and suggestions for our two courses were a good variation of foods.

We all had different starters but then all had the risotto which was fantastic.

Lovely warm ambience but service a bit slow.

Great atmosphere, friendly staff, delicious food. Staff were very welcoming and accomdating when we requested to change tables. We had the special offer menu and were happy with the selection and quality of food. Great value for money!

I visited teh palm Court Brasserie on a Saturday night out with friends. We were seated in the first part of the restaurant, in fornt of the bar area and it was nice and quite. We had the 3 courses & Kir royale deal and it was good. The food was nice and the portions generouse. Convenient location in the Covent Garden area.
Had an excellent evening at Palm Court Brasserie, London.  Food, service and ambience  were all very good. Also good value with the Top Table deal
Good food and good value for money if usuing the 50% off deal .
had a girls lunch on Saturday at the Palm Court Brasserie and stayed there for hours.Absolutely no pressure to leave even though very busy.Food was very good and great value with offer.

As ever, lovely, punctual and very accomodating!
Thanks

palm court brasserie

covent garden

We had the new years menu,food was very nice,but the duck tasted strange, not saying it was`nt meant to taste the way it was cooked but nothing like how we`ve had duck before.staff very good,resturant ambience was perfect.
I do like the Palm Court Brasserie in Covent Garden. The food is always good and the atmosphere relaxed. Great value with 50% off food at the moment

We were very impressed with the level of service and the food at this restaurant. We went here prior to the theatre and the service was quick and the waitress was very attentive. We didn't eat off the theatre menu but for those wanting to it looked fine.  The only bad point if I was to find one is that all the tables are very close together when you are sitting as parties of 2.

Generally a mixed experience.
We had: pear, goats cheese and almond salad - nothing special.
Onion soup - wonderful.
Duck confit cassoulet - wonderful.
Duck breast with dauphinouise potatoes - mediocre, and for me, far too much pepper.

Service was impressive for a "cheap" bistro that was pretty busy, though the compulsory 12.5% service charge on the full price bill made service 20% of our bill which left us wondering whether the staff actually receive it (and a little fleeced).

Palm Court Brasserie, Covent Garden
A lovely little french brasserie, busy and lively atmosphere but had to wait a while for food (on a Wed night). Well worth the wait when it arrived.
Staff and food was good.

we were shown to our table on arrival - good service ONCE we were noticed! plenty of staff busy doing other things, I felt we should have been asked if we would like drinks before we we ordered.  Food was delicious, very good value, chilled white wine and nice presentation. will return.

The Palm Court Brasserie in Covent Garden is a busy, bright, modern restaurant with a varied menu and good value special offers. Food and wine were excellent and service was faultless. Only quibble is that the tables for four are a little on the small side, but otherwise this was a good find.

Palm Court Brasserie in Covent Garden, London, was a friendly and busy restaurant in a great location.  Perfectly lit for a romantic date night.  Only a few tables free, so there was a good atmosphere and the staff were genuinely pleasant and friendly.  We ordered some bread which was forgotten and the people at the next table seemed to have the same problem, but it was no big deal.  Very affordable with the 50% off food deal.  A lovely night out.

Palm Court Brasseries, Covent Garden.

Food was good, service a little slow.

PALM COURT BRASSERIE - Covent Garden (London)

The venue is really nice french style, and the service is extremely good, friendly with a deeper knowledge on wine, menu, and bars surrounding for a cocktail or late drink.
The food was excelent, really rich, tasty, flavoury and the environtment was cool and friendy.
A beautiful French restaurant. I liked averything about this place. The food, service, wine, ambience.... everything was perfect.

My family had an exceleent meal at the Palm Court Brasserie on Saturday 22 may 2010.  The service was attentive, courteous and prompt. We were given tapenade with the bread and ordered wine, coke and olives. We chose to eat off the A La Carte menu and chose French Onion Soup, Mediteranean Fish Soup, terrine and chicken liver parfait; all were excellent.  For the main course we chose duck breast, and pork fillet.  Each came with different vegetables and again were excellent.
Great little french restaurant in covent garden. Highly recommended.

We had a terrific meal at Palm Court!  We'd booked for a small school reunion, and it was the perfect place.  Staff were very friendly, despite the fact that we turned up with seven people rather than six on the day.  Food was lovely.  Service was great.  Highly recommended - I'd definitely go back.
Lovely meal with very attentive staff.  Set menu is good value for money especially with the kir royale.
Palm Court Brasserie. Very busy, with a nice buzz.  Have eaten there before and would go back.

Was really looking forward to this meal, unfortunately a huge let down. Tables cramped in, very noisy. Food was bland and very underwhelming. Service was ok but a little slow.
Cocktails were very good though. Family meal ok but overpriced for what received, paying a lot for location rather than quality
Falsely advertised happy hour times on their website and on signs outside the restaurant! Planned out night around the happy hour only for it to be wrong.
Baileys banana colada‚Äôs are the best things in the world!
Good food, great service , great area to eat in , right in central London
Lovely meal and great service, visited here a few times now and will definitely be back
Lovely food and lovely staff. Great place to eat for before a show as they are very quick. Highly recommend the nachos for 2!

Not the best - alcoholic drinks in cans - no this is a restaurant - it‚Äôs not acceptable. Soft drinks from the pump ....pure syrup .. yuk!!!
I won‚Äôt be returning.
Went for the lunch time special. Amazing value highly recommend they cater for all and service is great.

We went for a pre theatre dinner. All of the food we had was not great. My chicken was dry on the inside but it was smothered in too much bbq sauce, as were the ribs. My mum asked for her steak medium rare, it came medium well and was more gristle than meat. The halloumi fries were soggy and rubbery. The Oreo chocolate ice cream sandwich was probably the best thing about the meal and it wasn‚Äôt that great either. Cocktails were nice. Quite expensive for a not very enjoyable meal. Our waitress was fantastic though.

Always visit with my children and never disappoints ! Luciano was very helpful and attentive, the food was delicious and as usual we still couldn't finish all the nachos ! Thank you for a great experience

Went for Saturday lunch, sat upstairs at the far end with a great view of downstairs and the bar so we got all the atmosphere and could see all the effort that went into the interior design!
Service was friendly, attentive and efficient with staff happy to chat and help!
Impressive Smokey burger that tasted great and was generously filled with quality ingredients, had to squash it down a bit to get a good bite out of it!
We were there for a good three and a half hours and never felt pressured to eat up and get out, a relaxed and enjoyable afternoon all round!

Great evening for my girlfriends birthday. Staff were very friendly and even brought out a freak shake for her which was amazing. Food was excellent and plenty.
Thank you all for helping us celebrate whilst in London.
Depending on how you like your done, you will need to go one level lower, medium well was well well done and well done was charcoal.
The burger went back it was under cooked and I had no notification you had moved
we visted for food before going to a show.the servive was fantastic as was the food
The food was excellent. Best chilli beef nachos ever. The waiter Pedro was very attentive and looked after us well.
Really great fun, good food and service, rather noisy but didn‚Äôt matter
Excellent value for money, good location.  The sharing nachos best ever.

Burgers were pretty good but nothing incredible. The freak shakes however are inventive and as over the top as you would hope. The atmosphere is just pretty standard as it's just like an American diner but over all pretty good and I would go back.

We arrived early and were very pleased to be seated immediately although we then waited quite some time for the waiter to come over to us. We were seated in a nice booth but unfortunately it was next to where the waiters cleared so it was very noisy as they crashed all the dirty glasses and plates away.
The starters were very tasty, some of the main course meats were rather dry. I had a veggie burger which was not as nice as it sounded on the menu although the other items in the burger were nice.
Milk shakes and desserts were good.
Quite expensive for the quality although we had a 25% off voucher which made it more reasonable
All 5 burgers were lukewarm but we ate them.  Chips were cold, inedible- we sent them back and got replacements. This is our second time to this restaurant but don't think we'll return
Having taken my girlfriend to maxwell's we would both be more than happy to go back.
Very nice food, good service and kind staff, the fajitas were top notch also

Went early evening for a pre-theatre meal. We had sharing Fajitas which were superb. Treated ourselves to a cocktail each from a vast selection. The service was very good and speedy. Booking is definitely recommended as this is a very busy area close to Covent Garden and several theaters. Reasonably priced. Would go again.
Haven't been to Maxwells for a few years now. Thought it would be worth a revisit with friends last weekend.  We weren't disappointed. Good food, polite and helpful staff. We will be going back.
Superb meal. Great value for money. Churi Chat was incredible

Absolutely amazing dinner.
Brilliantly clever dishes beautiful executed.
Impeccable service.
Lovely atmosphere, great food and professional staff( Felix ) took care of us.
First time there and most definitely not the last time we loved it, great food great service

Very nice experience
I come again the next time i will be in London
Best regards from Italy
Great food. It was t explained that you share the food you order with the rest of your table and wait for dishes to arrive. Great service.
Service was impeccable. Food was delicious and beautiful to look at.  Plus a cute little slice of cheesecake with a candle was brought out for my partner's birthday.
Great Food and Service, Refurbishment very successful

We did not have a good experience, I was sat facing a pillar and my husband was sat facing the bar. The chicken dishes all had thigh meat, which wasn't clear on the menu. Not happy at all and it certainly did not feel like an exclusive dining experience.
Came for a birthday meal and was really happy with the service and the food. Will definitely be back!
Fabulous food and service and an amazing wine selection. On the pricey side but it's Indian food done right.
Excellent food contemporary version  not very spicy excellent presentation

Great service and superb good although a bit pricey

Perfect place to take your friends to for a treat

Overall I enjoyed the meal at the Tamarind but I felt rushed. The table was booked for 8pm and we were finished on a 2 course dinner by 9:30. For the price of the meal I would have liked to have felt that I was out for the evening rather than feeling I had to be out by 9:30 to accommodate more covers.

We booked the Tamarind because it apparently has a Michelin star and we wanted to experience exceptional Indian Cuisine.
To be honest the veggie menu options were a bit confusing and advice not helpful. We decided to go for the three course vegetarian menu as this seemed to offer some interesting possibilities. We chose a very nice glass of pinot gris to accompany the first course. This comprised a nicely arranged plate of paneer/potato cake/brocolli with a chick pea salad and minty dressing. It seemed like a good start.
For the second course my wife wanted a glass of the Marlborough sauvignon blanc but neither this nor any other Sauvignon was available. Strange for a Michelin starred establishment. It was downhill form there. The second (main) course was a selection of dahl/spinach/fried potatoes/okra/aubergine/naan bread/rice. But this was not appetizingly or artistically arranged on a plate as one might expect from a Michelin starred chef but rather served as dishes from which we had to help ourselves. Rather as if we had bought ready prepared meals from Sainsburys and heated them in the microwave. The main taste experience of these dishes was heat. After one round, rather than savouring the different flavours, my mouth was almost chilied out. This was not what I expected - my disappointment was complete.
The third course of carrot fudge with raisins, Heritage carrot cake and vanilla ice cream was served decoratively and was fine.
We didn't eat all of the main course and had it boxed to take away. We gave it to a homeless lady on Piccadilly.

The food exceeded my expectations in flavour in particular the starters, the kebab was nice and chilli, the tiki was soft and the lamb chop literally was melting in my mouth. All of the dishes were lovely and the service is outstanding- right from the moment we walked in. I would highly recommend this place to friends and family. Being Indian myself it's one of the best restaurants I've been to! The only thing I fault (which is a personal choice; is the seabass which needed more of a kick!)
Had a great meal at Tamarind this weekend with friends, the food was very good and we found the staff really accommodating! Highly recommend it

Issues - we were early so asked to wait at the bar however the bar was very close to other diners and we had to stand - very conspicuous. Food - was very ordinary and in line with a high street restaurant, no wow factor at all for the cost. Service - very hit and miss with some waiters being very attentive but others less so. Overall - will not visit again. Cinnamon Kitchen/Club much better.

Delicious food.
We are both vegetarians and there was a good choice of dishes available.

Another visit to Tamarind which proved just as enjoyable as before. We were celebrating our son's birthday and chose the Sunday set lunch. There was an equally delicious vegetarian menu which my husband opted for. Service was helpful, friendly and quietly efficient. We had a lovely time!

Whilst the food was nice it definately was not outstanding which is what you would expect for the prices that they are charging. The price of the Kebabs is just not worth what you get. The portion is very small - for ¬£22 you would expect more than four pieces of meat. Notwithstanding this they were very nice.
I would recommend giving the restaurant a try but I would not rush to go back there.
Great food and wonderful service. Always a treat.
This is an outstanding restaurant. Modified Indian cooking is superb and service is very friendly.
Food is excellent, and service is fantastic. Seems expensive for Indian food yes, but relative to quality it represents very good value for money.

To be fair we had a very nice lunch, but it just wasn't quite as exciting and different as we had expected. I am glad we gave it a try but I doubt we will be going back as there are other places we would like to try.

I have been to this restaurant several times and the staff are always extremely attentive but not overbearing. The food is very fresh tasting and it is a cut above most Indian restaurants. The house wines are moderately priced at ¬£19 per bottle. These are a French VdP Viognier (white) and a French VdP Syrah (red). Both the wines are very good and compliment the food perfectly. The rest of the wine list is comprised of a good selection of moderate and expensive wines. Currently on Sundays they are doing a 2 for 1 offer on their tasting menu. This therefore costs 28.95 for two people. A great bargain!
The location is good and the menu intersting. However I don't feel ¬£150 for two was justified. We sat down at 9 and had finished dinner by 9.40, the service was far too rushed.
Exquisite food, elegant setting, wonderful service.  Not to be missed.

Tasty & interesting food (desserts were particularly delicious), friendly service & a great location.

Highly recommended

Best brunch we've had in a really long time - delicious food and cocktails. Good coffee. Lovely staff. A really relaxed atmosphere. We were early birds so the only ones seated when we ate, but I can image it would be full of buzz when tables seated. Definitely coming again. Food was next level.
It was good to be back. It was a great lunch, even if somewhat cold... but not complaining. Would be wonderful to go back inside and have the full menu

Really great on every level
The service was lovely
The food was super fresh
Great food cozy vibe service could be quicker but delicious food and lovely escape from the chill to the Mediterranean!

Absolutely amazing food! Will definitely return for the food!!
The service was a little hit & miss, one of the gentlemen was great, but unfortunately his colleagues were busy chatting amongst themselves throughout the evening!

Nice table and initially good service. Ordered freely but felt rushed. Left well within 2 hour time slot but not one of the three staff bid us good bye. Food good but expensive; portions small. The starter 'special' appeared identical to an item on the menu. Could easily have been a very pleasant evening if Delamina worked on making things a bit more special.
Great food, great staff. We will go go again  for a third time for sure !
I love the service
Lovely food, and really nice ambience. Great venue for a weekend brunch but it gets super busy so make sure to reserve!
Delicious and flavoursome food, great menu. Highly recommend.

The guy that greeted us when we arrived did not make us feel welcome and did not make us want to spend our well earned money at the restaurant. The table service from that point forward was lovely however and we really enjoyed our food.
Lovely food, great ambience & very friendly staff
The most friendly staff in any London restaurant from the moment you walk in to the moment you leave. They love children too and are really accommodating.
Food was lovely with an interesting menu.  Staff were exceptional - friendly and attentive. Will definitely go again.
A page of gluten-free menu options. Good food and drink. Very personable and friendly staff.

I booked a table for a business lunch as there were vegan options and I'd really enjoyed the food when I'd been before. My colleagues really enjoyed the meal and ambiance, thanking me for suggesting the restaurant. The menu is very flexible and everything is so delicious! I can't recommend it enough!
One of the best pizzas I have ever eaten. Delicious !

Bills- Covent Garden is great value for money and great food, the staff are very polite friendly and helpful, our vidit to Bills was a starter to our day of shopping, being off the main high street adds to the appeal of Bills nice and quiet and relaxed perfect start to the day, 100% recommend Bills Covent Garden üòÅ
Very nice restaurant with a cosy terrace. Food was amazing and all the staff was very helpful and made sure we were okay during our stay

Waitress was so so rude, slammed our food down in front of us, had a really nasty attitude and took forever to put our order through (we were asked 3 times what we wanted to drink because she kept forgetting). Food itself was very nice, was slightly bitter about the compulsory service charge considering the poor treatment, but Bills itself remains a lovely restaurant.

I was very impressed when I first arrived as it was really quiet. Unfortunately as the morning progressed, I was surprised to see that all tables got filled up and there wasn't the standard distance between chairs which made me uncomfortable. What also made uncomfortable is that some of the waitrons were not wearing their masks correctly, yet serving food.

If these two aspects are corrected, then it's full thumbs up for me as the food was delicious!

Food was ok but could've been warmer and having the front doors wide open in October is not a good plan. On the positive side there was hand gel on every table and we were temperature checked on the way in.

I booked a table but still had to wait 10 minutes before a host came to the entrance, then the table was not ready. The food was fine, the beef ribs were dry. The waiters took a long time to attend to us, we asked 4 different people for water over 20 minutes before someone gave us water.

Very busy steaks mixed up but all tasty!
Out of stock of several things but service good
The only comment I can make is the table for 2 was far too small for 2!
Great meal, the service was very good considering it was a busy Saturday night & all tables were occupied. Food exceptional as always @ Steak & Co.

It is a bit of a shame that J Sheekey have changed the old ways - speaking as fairly frequent visitors, since the refurb, the once buzzy Atlantic bar has lost all ambience - no music at all - leaving a canteen/subdued dining room feel to the area. We ordered the now downgraded bread basket that has lost all of the previous theatre - just standard baguette ( no longer warm ) without any of the crispy crostini, focaccia or brik pastry bread!

The food was as always top notch but service and timings left something to be desired, leaving the fish pie and fish stew to cool somewhat between service. Really not what we expected for a special birthday lunch. I don‚Äôt think I would be visiting again any time soon.

Sorry team Sheekey

An amazing meal in a delightful setting with great service. J.Sheekey strikes the perfect balance of laid back refinement in a very traditional restaurant setting with thoughtful tweaks for social distancing.
The Parmesan truffle souffl√© was genuinely one of the most delicious starters I‚Äôve had in some time and the seafood is some of the best in London.

The prices are expensive but you are paying for the amazing quality of food and great experience.

I wish they would bring back the amazing chocolate sphere dessert that they used to do, but the creme br√ªl√©e almost makes up for that departing the menu.

Very nice meal and one of best fish restaurants I have been, we had the lonster thermidore and an amazing chargrilled turbot for main course.
Would definetly recommend .

One of the most sublime and memorable dining experiences of my life. You will not find better seafood anywhere in the world the dressed crab is a must as are the prawns and the sole do not pass go do not collect 200 just eat here
Very good lunch ,food and service was again outstanding . Will be going back to enjoy a great restaurant

We have been going to J Sheekey for nearly 40 years and I proposed to my wife here 36 years ago this month.

It's now bigger than it was with the addition of the (excellent) Atlantic Bar. The layout is different in parts as a consequence. It is also now owned by Richard Caring as part of his larger restaurant group.

However, the lovely thing is that the ambience is still wonderful and service superb and it retains its quiet glamour and air of effortless luxury. The food still follows the original style and typical range with a few welcome updates. Fish is always well-cooked and fresh and shellfish (particularly oysters and razor clams) superb. Their Fish Pie remains a reliable standard, ditto potted shrimps which are nicely spicy. Welsh rarebit as a savoury to finish is still one of my favourites - beautifully old-fashioned and spicy.

A good wine list too and you don't have to spend a fortune (but you can if you like!). Their Picpoul de Pinet is a good choice with most white fish and shellfish

We come here for the same reason that we go back time and again to the Colombe d'Or in St Paul de Vence: it's not achingly hip or perfect modern cooking but it is good, reliable, luxurious with great service and is simply itself - a constant and comforting rock in a world of change.

Our Italian (and there have always been a lot of excellent Italian waiters) waiter was superb and at the age of only 36 - born in the year I proposed which amused him (!) - he had skills and customer service that most restaurants would kill for.

You will also see the occasional celeb which is nice: we have seen loads over the years (Jonathan Miller, Piers Brosnan, Helen Shapiro amongst many others. Katherine Ryan who is appearing in Glitter Room at the nearby Garrick has been recently and so will many other performers at local theatres like the Wyndham (opposite). It's fun and glamorous.

We will of course keep coming just as long as it remains J Sheekey....

Food was excellent, the wine way over priced for very small portions. Our waitress was very attentive while the restaurant was not overly full, less effective as the restaurant filled up. For a restaurant of this standard, I would expect a little more, service was great for us. A couple near us tried to cancel their delayed meal, but were refused.
Absolutely excellent in every respect.  We love it there.

We enjoyed an excellent lunch with delicious fish and seafood.  I had the Cornish fish stew which I found delicious and the Jerusalem artichoke soup was a perfect starter on a cold day.  The weekend lunch set menu is reasonably priced and  the quality excellent-  some of our party went for this and were not disappointed.  The restaurant has a lovely character and an old-world charm, with wood panelled walls and black & white photos with some of acting's greats.  The staff were attentive,  discrete, and very helpful, guiding us to wines that partnered the dishes well.

I have dined at J Sheekey's many times, which can be dangerous as to be consistently good is very hard. yet again, I was not disappointed. Oyster were lovely and the Dover Sole a thing of beauty. All washed down with a Pouilly Fuisse, served at the right temperature.

If you have never been, GO.
We had a lovely meal and great wine! Very warm welcome and friendly staff all round. The steak was fantastic and I loved my dessert. Looking forward to coming back.
Great little spot with good fine and very pleasant service
It is a nice cosy wine bar, with good lighting and music loud enough but not too loud. Good selection of wines and foods. However, portions are relatively small.

Service was horrible - given we spend around GBP200 for a two person meal, would definitely not recommend - rather go to 28-50's Maddox Street restaurant. Table wasn't ready upon arrival despite reservation. Then our table was located in a place, where each time the entrance door was opened, cold air would stream directly at it (waiters didn't bother about making use of the curtain on the entrance door installed exactly for this purpose). Restaurant was further unusually loud as large group was poorly allocated creating significant noise in one part of the restaurant. Service then took 15min to notice us at our table once we were seated. We ordered cocktails as an aperitif, however they did not arrive until we were in the midst of our starters (with which we intended having wine). Once this delay became obvious, we wanted to cancel the cocktails and go ahead with wine order, however the waitress (who heavily struggled with her english) said this would not be possible as the cocktails were "ready" - they came 5 minutes later or so (please note this was maybe half an hour into the meal with still no drinks served). Our wine then also was delayed and arrived in the midst of our mains. As a cherry on the cake, when finally paying they didn't take Amex (despite having paid at the same place with Amex multiple times). The Marylebone restaurant always was a bit weaker than the one in Maddox street, however with this experience it has become unbearable. Don't get me wrong the food is great, which is why used to visit 28-50 so often, however this visit was so unpleasant that I definitely will not be visiting the Marylebone restaurant again.

Would strongly recommend visiting 28-50 at Maddox Street (different owner, still founder-led/owned), a truly great place offering a significantly better experience as the staff is better trained and the vibes & setting are nicer.

The three of us ordered the special (ribeye) and it was done perfectly. Very generous portion. The red wine,  a Tempranillo was quite good. Service was attentive and very pleasant. We enjoyed our meal. It was not crowded as it was a Monday night so great for our business conversation. We will definitely return.
Great wine list ! Good simple menu , great service , recommended if you are looking for somewhere non -touristy near Oxford St
We enjoyed a wonderfully delicious dinner with very attentive service at 28-50 Marylebone this past New Year's Eve. The set menu offered enough variety to please all 5 of us foodies.

I took my husband for his birthday and we really enjoyed the food and they have a great wine list. It is also great for drinks as they have this great wine bar in the middle of the room. I would definitely recommend this place.

28-50 was a great central place to meet up with old friends. The set lunch was tasty and good value, and nice to have such a great choice of wines by the glass - tho the prices go up pretty sharply after the first few options.
Fabulous night with wonderful staff, food and ambience

Brilliant service, especially from Laura! Everyone was so friendly and attentive. The food was absolutely delicious and served promptly. Great drinks selection. The pricing is a little on the high side but to be expected for the location. We sat outside due to COVID restrictions and were fortunate to get a table under a heater but it was still quite cold - not the restaurant‚Äôs fault, it is December! I would recommend bringing your own blanket. Only downside were some smokers from an indoor table came out a few times to smoke and were stood quite near our table.
Fabulous food and service! Would highly recommend.

Excellent service. I am a coeliac and the waiter went out of his way to ensure my food was safe.
Passion fruit martinis were delicious.
Only downside were the toilets were not clean!
It's a nice place, not too expensive, but I always seem to get a bad table, in the corridor. Not sure what I'm doing wrong! The boeuf bourguignon was delicious.

Lovely place and good value when doing the pre theatre menu. Food was quite good, but my steak was a little chewy and not great quality which is why I gave 4 stars. Then again you are only paying ¬£15 so what do you expect!
Had a fabulous pre theatre meal which was amazing value for brilliant classically French food. Loved the rustic vibes, have already recommended to friends and family!

Our first visit and we sat upstairs. The tables are small and it is quite cramped - but a very pleasant atmosphere and friendly service. My daughter had a mountainous bowl of moules which she somehow finished and I had the Fish of the Day - Sea Bream - and very good it was. The sweets of Tarte au Citron and Creme Brulee were good if unexciting. The Macon Charnay was deemed exceptional by my daughter whilst I enjoyed the Pinot Noir. We were delighted by our meal and will visit again.
Nothing special but good turn around before the theatre.

We were a little underwhelmed on arrival, the restaurant is not terribly smart and it was rather empty.  However we warmed to it as our food arrived, which we were very happy with, and the restaurant began to fill up and have a little more atmosphere.

Rain and cold outside but inside we were welcomed warmly and encouraged to sit and chat and enjoy our meal without any hassle.  Don't often come to London but Le Garrick was a restful oasis in the middle of a superbly busy and interesting area.
Ok restaurant for pre theatre, staff polite and service ok but very cramped downstairs  and food below average. Not expensive but also not necessarily good value given the quality of the food.

Classic French bistro fare in ‚Äòauthentic ‚Äò surroundings. Friendly atmosphere with helpful service. My favourite calamari starter, juicy mussels and plenty of choices of carafe wines. Perfect before La Boheme!
Looked forward to the re-opening and all is well, still quirky, friendly, great French cooking and a firm favourite for pre- theatre dinner.
We chose le Garrick to have a celebration lunch for our twins 21st birthday.i couldn't fault anything .lovely food great service.and the staff sang happy birthday in French.üòÉ

A very pleasant meal. On an exceptionally hot day, the air conditioning was aggressively - in fact unpleasantly - fierce, but the staff kindly turned it down or off without a murmur.

One dish, though delightful, lacked one of the listed ingredients. When we noted this to the waitress, we were given an pleasant amuse-bouche as an apology, despite our having made clear that we were very happy with the dish.

We were downstairs in the cellar-seating, which is atmospheric and pleasantly private. Service was efficient, helpful yet unobtrusive.

A thoroughly good lunch on all fronts.

Le Garrick is all about the ambience, particularly downstairs. The menu has all the bistrot classics that you might expect, served by authentic French staff. Good wine list too, to suit most tastes and budgets, so really can't fault it. Presentation of dishes (particularly the foie gras) was somewhat rudimentary, but for no frills, atmospheric dining, Le Garrick is fantastique.

We regularly return to Le Garrick because we know that we can rely on enjoying a good meal with good, friendly service. On this occasion, everything was up to its usual standard and we were given a nice ground floor table. The food is great value and there's nothing negative to mention. We're hooked!

The ratings are purely to meet the requirements of writing a report and are NOT a true reflection of the restaurant.
We were unable to eat on the evening of our booking due to a fire nearby. This was unfortunate but clearly beyond the control of the restaurant. However it would have been nice to have been emailed before our arrival so that alternatives could have been explored. Was this the fault of the restaurant or OpenTable? do you not pass booking details and contact information onto the restaurant ? If not then this is a criticism of Openatable and not the restaurant.

My friend and I have always commented on this restaurant when we have passed it, saying how lovely it looked inside.  We certainly weren't disappointed.  The service was excellent, the food was delicious and the atmosphere was superb.  I shall definitely be eating here again.  The french onion soup was the best I have ever tasted, even better than a Parisian restaurant famous for its french onion soup!  Highly recommended.
Le Garrick has become something of a favorite for us as a pre-theatre venue. Great location, nice French menu, friendly service and quick enough to get you to the theatre in time! Well recommended.
Good French style food and wine list. We enjoyed lunch there and found that the service was friendly and efficient. Prices are reasonable and good value.

Have now had 3 lovely dinners here. Each time the staff have been friendly and attentive but not overbearing. The food is delicious and well-presented. So love the chocolate pot!!!! If you sit downstairs you really can forget all about the world outside. The restaurant feels homely and is a very relaxing place to eat.
A pleasant lunch with good service and a relaxed atmosphere.
A lovely restaurant in the heart of London, a rare find that covers, brilliant staff, cosy, great food and wine. will try and make a regular visit as the atmosphere that is very French is perfect.

We had a nice business lunch at Le Garrick.  The food was great and the service very good.  I really liked the place.  Probably better suited for lunch with the wife or a business dinner as it is quite cosy.  Thanks very much, I'll be back.
Atmosphere good, staff nice, mains disappointing as not hot enough and had to be sent back. That said we have eaten here on a number of occasions and the food has been fine.

Went to Le Garrick with my Mum for her birthday, as always the food was delicious and the staff were very friendly. It was a bit of a squeeze to get us into the corner seats so don't go after shopping as we did with all our bags!
The Garrick provided value for money with unexciting but substantial food. The house wine was very good.
Le Garrick is a great little French restaurant with fantastic service, good atmosphere and delicious food. It was also very reassuring to see French people eating in there as well.
Really friendly service and great food. Was seated next to Harrison Ford (yes, Mr Indiana Jones) which added to a fun evening.

We were lucky and grateful to be seated outside. It has a good ambience just like all of the other ivy cafes we‚Äôve been to.However, the service was very slow. Drinks came promptly after our orders but starters did not arrive and it was a 30 mins wait. We had to prompt our waiter for desserts which was odd too. The entire meal was 2.5 hours. We had a second server at the end of the night and she was very friendly and kind to use which we appreciate.

We absolutely loved our meal at the Ivy.
Stunning food and great service
We cant wait to go back again
Fabulous well served restaurant with excellent food and drinks served by outstanding staff.
Don‚Äôt order a burger. Everything else seems to be nice. Been a few times and always been nice, but I ordered a burger the other day and was really bad.

Staff very welcoming
Wonderful treatment of my elderly companion
I love the fact it‚Äôs a mixture of all generations happily eating
We thoroughly enjoyed our time sitting outside a the Ivy Cafe Marleybone for an easy, relaxed lunch. The service was so friendly and the food very good as always.

Celebrated a colleague's Birthday at the Ivy Cafe.  The decor is quite beautiful, and the atmosphere very vibrant.  The food was delicious, although my main dish was a little salty for my taste.  Highly recommend this restaurant.  A memorable experience in a very good way!

As always all of the Ivy restaurants are beautiful and have lovely food and service. Cocktails amazing as per usual too for a cheeky tipple at Brunch. Always offers a good variety across the menu and such friendly and attentive staff! If you haven‚Äôt been...go! And if you have... visit again!
Food is good and reasonably priced. But no break between starters and mains which drives me NUTS. And has happened to me in other restaurants in this group before

The staff all seemed to be trainees and did not know the menu.  The starter of crab and salmon came without crab.  When I asked what sauce the Special sole gougons was served with, the waitress did not know so she asked her colleague who just shrugged and said "gravy?"  (!!!!)  We also had t keep on asking for wine to be poured as the bottle was kept a distance from our table.
It was a pleasant experience. The breakfast menu is really good and they cater perfectly for gluten free! Perfect for brunches and cute dates X
Perfect venue for my business breakfast - great service, nice food, easy going

Great food and brunch options. Plenty avail for vegetarians in my opinion. Was extremely busy (Saturday afternoon) and tables are quite cosy and right next to each other so can get difficult to have a normal conversation with someone across the table from you!

The host and wait staff were all very friendly and we were promptly seated. The restaurant was nice and comfortable and very open with a lot of light. Although it was open, the atmosphere was not so loud that you needed to raise your voice for a conversation. The food was good, although the poached egg on the Eggs Benedict was slightly overcooked it still tasted very good.

Fab services and I saw many movie stars! The location is perfect and in the midst of all shopping actions. Then the services was superb. The menu was wonderful but the wine list could be improved. The food was spectacular. Ambiance  was good and I saw Emma Watson and others.
Good food, ambience, service, reasonably priced so good value. We asked for a specific table when we booked and our request was granted.

Unfortantly they were unable to get the simplest dinner correct, cold chips, unrested steak and no garnish. The staff were quick to react and provide fresh chips (took for ever and one portion came out burnt and inedible other portion were perfectly cooked), when we highlighted this to them they were polite and took some money off our bill. Although our steaks weren‚Äôt great the fish cake was delicious!!
Great food, fantastic atmosphere, fish is excellent
Great place to eat. Service was excellent. Atmosphere lovely. Well prepared food. Was there twice within one week. Go.
I love the ivy and this cafe version did not disappoint. The staff were welcoming and attentive  and the food delicious. I'm definitely going to be visiting again.
The place has a nice atmosphrere but service felt a disjointed and could be friendlier. The place is not child friendly as very crammed.
I was pleasantly surprised by the quality and cost of the meal we had.

This is our second visit at Christmas to the Ivy Cafe and it was as fabulous as it was the first time, service, food and ambience is memorable. Will certainly be visiting again soon

x
Good service

Lovely - very hospitable and great food.  My friend was late but this was no problem and the staff were very pleasant. Only complaint that it was a little hot on arrival when the restaurant was full but as the afternoon wore on it was very pleasant.
Food here was great with good brunch and lunch choices - also very good value for money and not super expensive. The restaurant has a very nice ambiance - good place to catch up with friends.
Lovely food and a lovely atmosphere. Good value - highly recommended

Great extension of the Ivy brand. Typically excellent service from friendly and attentive waiters with an interesting and varied cafe-style menu. Great little venue, with an excellent atmosphere...

... However, why do certain chefs think it is necessary and acceptable to overload each dish with a barrow-load of salt? I appreciate salt is a flavor enhancer but only in moderation. The soup (to start) and the chicken escalope and chips (main) were so salty that they were a struggle to eat; in fact we didn't finish. We could have complained but it's difficult to find fault when you're half way through lunch and everything else was faultless.... Plus we are British and not very good at that sort of thing!

Come on Ivy. Go easy on the salt please.
The most delicious food I've tasted at a restaurant. Fantastic service and ambiance.

The restaurant was packed, so clearly very popular, but the staff seemed unable cope. It took nearly 45 minutes to receive our first course.
When the food arrived it was very good, but we couldn't face another wait for dessert, so we left.
Very noisy, so not good for quiet conversation.
Overall, I was disappointed and wouldn't recommend.

A more private venue for lunch with friends near the main shops along Oxford Street. Great choice of food and very friendly service. The tables are not too close together so your conversation doesn't compete with the table next to you. The variety of food from brunch to an evening meal makes a reservation at any time worthwhile. They say that tables for lunch have a booking for two hours but by 2:15 p.m., there were empty tables and we weren't hurried along. A civilized place to eat!

I was quite eager to try the newish addition to Marylebone dining scene, especially having enjoyed the Ivy Restaurant on more than one occasion.
Overall, the experience of the Marylebone Ivy Cafe was so disappointing I will not be rushing back nor recommending it to friends. The service was pleasant enough but somewhat pressured. My guest had scarcely sat down before we were being asked to chose something to drink. We quickly decided on starters and mains and decided to have a little amuse bouche with a glass of wine. We had scarcely started our pre starter before the starters proper arrived and were unceremoniously plonked down on the (small) table. My guest's starter looked rather more exciting than mine and was, I gather, good. My starter which comprised smoked salmon and crab was fine ‚Ä¶ which was about as much enthusiasm as I can muster. Again in a frenzy our main courses arrived almost literally as we finished the last mouthful of our starters and again were plonked down. My slow cooked lamb with polenta was not good. The "slow cooked" lamb wasn't just pink but in places undercooked and very fatty. I don't know what had been done to the polenta but it just wasn't very nice. I should have sent it back. My guest's choice was again more successful than mine but the rushed nature of the service and my frankly substandard main course spoilt the experience beyond repair. I would be sad if the Ivy group with its cafes had gone for volume throughput rather than guaranteed quality but that was the distinct impression on this visit.
Sadly, it would take a lot to persuade me to go back.
Nice restaurant with very good service but food was avwrage
Good food and service but found the final bill to be much higher than I would expect. We chose 3 dishes from the menu to share with no wine and paid well over the odds.
A very good Thai restaurant, the best we've found in London. The food was very good and the ambience was very nice. It was all reasonable priced too.
High end Thai food. Some of the best we have had

Patara never fails to disappoint - the service was fast and first class, made us feel very welcomed; the food was delicious and exquisite; and we had a lovely seating. We will definitely be coming back soon!!

Visited the restaurant after reading good reviews but was pretty disappointed. Ordered starters and mains to all come at the same time and they arrived suspiciously quick (within a couples of minutes). Would be nice if they at least tried to pretend they cooked the food fresh. Restaurant wasn't that busy at the time so maybe that's the reason. Some dishes were verging on cold, especially the duck, although the taste and flavouring was really nice. For the price of the dishes I'd have expected far better. Restaurant was also pretty cold in general and I'm not usually bothered by cold temperatures. Service was good and staff were very polite and attentive. Food is the biggest let down for sure. Overall I wouldn't visit again as it wasn't worth the money.
I lived in BKK and this is by far the closest you‚Äôll ever get to authentic Thai food. Ambiance is ok nothing too funky but fun nonetheless

Food was drenched in sauce (did not order curry), fish was uncooked, taste was overwhelmingly of sweet sauces instead of the actual dish - real disappointment. Later that evening I felt very unwell from the food. Shame, as the atmosphere and service was lovely, and we were hoping to have a great time.
Had a lovely meal with my mum yesterday. Staff were lovely throughout, and the food was great!
Very nice ambiance and excellent service. The food was really good, with a good vegetarian options

It is not the best Thai in town to be honest, food is okay but the service wasn't brilliant considering the service charge we had to pay. The waitress seemed to be fairly new as she didn't even know how to pour the prosecco and other drinks came late. It could have been better as I had a better service before.

Ottimo ristorante thailandese in cui si pu√≥ mangiare fino a tardi. Il servizio √© rapido ed efficiente e il personale √© molto attento a soddisfare le esigenze del cliente. Buona scelta per vegetariani e buona presentazione delle pietanze. Il piccante √© delicato e non offusca gli ottimi aromi della cucina tailandese. I prezzi sono medio-alti. Buona posizione nel centro di Soho a due passi da tutto, perci√≤ facilmente raggiungibile a piedi da molti teatri. L'arredamento √© in stile tailandese moderno perci√≥ senza troppi decori dorati. Abbiamo assaggiato un ottima zuppa di latte di cocco e funghi. Il curry verde alle verdure era deluzioso e anche i noodles di riso con le verdure.
