We went to Patara for a catch up after not seeing each other for years.  As anticipated, the food was excellent (really loved the Thai tacos and the tuna tartar appetisers).  However, it did take quite a bit of time for service - it was very busy for a Wednesday night, and some of the staff weren't able to answer our questions/requests due to language barriers.  That said, I'd go back here in a heartbeat.

Read various reviews about this restaurant and others in soho, glad we picked this one. Great Thai , great service , we were not rushed and enjoyed ourselves so much we forgot time and almost missed our show.

Will be back !

We had the vietnamese spring rolls which were mediocre, but the thai prawn curry, steamed sea bass and stir fried duck were all very tasty. The desserts, chocolate pudding with mango sorbet and rice pudding were fantastic. The service was a little slow and we had to ask for things more than once. They were very busy for a Wednesday night, but I have been to other branches of patara and not had that problem. Their portions were on the small side which was disappointing given that it is not an inexpensive place. Overall a good experience and I would go back for the food.
Great food as always, sleek service but not cheap

I was our first visit to Patara in Greek Street and it was one of the best Thai meals I've had!
The service was efficient but not intrusive and the ambience was really nice.
The presentation of the food was the best I've seen and everything was hot and tasted good - the beef in coconut suace just melted in your mouth!
This restuarant is really well placed for the nearb y theatres. I will definitely return.
Patara, Greek Street, London.  If you don't go to this restaurant you are seriously missing out, great service, fab restaurant and the food is awesome!
Great quality food, but pretty expensive for a Thai restaurant.  Bill came to ¬£150 for lunch (4 mains / 2 starters) and drinks for 4 people.
The food was great. One of the best Thai food I had in London. The service was a bit slow but didn't ruin the experience. Highly recommended

Patara Restaurant in Soho is the best Thai restaurant in London I have been to yet. Very aromatic, 'real' Thai dishes. Absolutely loved tuna tartare, though sounded unusual at first. very attentive, and yet again authentic service. the only downside is the price - would love to come back and back again, but at 40 gbp per person it must stay the luxury, once in a very important occasion venue,

Went to Patara in Greek St last night with friends. The place was really busy all evening - full of atmosphere and clearly very popular. Popularity is well-deserved. We had the best meal we've had for ages.  The food was absolutely delicious and the service was good.

Patara was a welcome surprise. Food was outstanding, if you make sure you go off the beaten track with your order you will be pleasantly surprised.  Service left a lttle to be desired.  The only drawback was the desserts, we had the Lemongrass infused coconut tart which was very strange. Should have gone for the Chocolate Tart! But otherwise would reccommend.
Wonderful food, second visit and I will keep going back"
The lamb shank is the clear winner!

Excellent food, service and ambience. Have been here twice now for pre Xmas dinner. Fairly good value for money. Although Xmas set menu can work out more expensive than choosing from the vast selection off the a la carte menu.

The food at Patara is really good and it is a fantastically different menu from your average Thai. There are so many unusual and interesting dishes it is hard to chose! However it is not cheap but the atmosphere is cosy and it is not too fussy. But the waiters did get our orders wrong a couple of times so they could do with brushing up on this aspect a bit if they want to get away with charging the sort of prices they do. but all in all a really enjoyable evening with food that is pretty amazing.

Excellent food, gets a bit noisy, so not the ideal location for a quiet romantic meal, however good atmos for less romantic occaissions.Service is good considering how busy it was, Dishes are the right size especially considering the prices for each is between ¬£9 and ¬£20.

Booked Patara (Greek St, London) for 7 people. Staff were friendly and attentive. Food tasty, and above standard. Priced a lot above standard as well....

Read in previous reviews to take care and check your bill carefully. Good advice, since we spotted unordered dishes on our bill (not made easy since only Thai names are listed on bill). Dont know if overcharging is deliberate, but appears to happen frequently. Certainly, this bahviour places it bottom for value.
I would recomend Patara to anyone who loves fine Thai food. The food was excellent and service was very good.
I dined here last night with friends and we both loved the food.  There is a separate vegetarian menu so my friend was spoilt for choice.  Would definitely recommend to others

Patara always delivers high quality food and the set lunch menu is good value. The sauce for my starter of chicken satays was spicey and rich. However, my friends do-it-yourself tacos were disappointingly bland. The main courses were excellent - salmon in a tangy sauce, slow braised beef in coconut and green chicken curry - all had bags of flavour. Just a mention for one of my favourite cocktails ever - the watermelon cooler is simply delicious.

As someone fairly new to Thai food, I was amazed at how flavoursome the dishes were, not the hot spice that I'd anticipated.  Even though there was a large office party, noise was at a minimum so my business meeting went well.  The place was only let down by the service.  Our waitress spoke only sporadic English and one main course was not delivered to the table with the rest of the food.  But the biggest surprise was the bill.  Cheaper then I thought it would be.

Patara on greek street was fantastic! The ambience was good, the dimly lit lights made it romantic. Service was good and the tasty food was served quickly. Pricewise wasnt too bad and we would come back here again :)
Amazing food. Trust the chef's recommendations.

Patara has the best Thai food I've ever had in London, bar none. All courses were excellent and that was the real strength of the place. The staff were reasonably attentive, but spoke with broken english. However, 2 eating (2 starters, 2 main courses, 1 shared desert), drinking (bottle water, bottle of mid priced wine and a bottle of desert wine) came to a very reasonable ¬£75 including service. I will be going back and I recommend you give it a try.

Lab and Thirst (Greek st) for pre-drinks.
Excellent
Amazing food, wonderful people all round fantastic experience.

Our second visit to this wonderful restaurant did not disappoint.  This is a proper, old-fashioned (in the best sense of the word) French restaurant, with outstanding food in decent portions, an excellent wine list, polite, friendly and unobtrusive service and what would certainly be a wonderful ambience when full of happy diners.  Sadly, there were very few of there on a recent Friday evening, a consequence of current unhappy circumstances.  This did not detract however, from the excellence of the food and wine and the fine company of the charming owner and staff.  You feel welcome, pampered and extremely well fed after a visit here.  There is nothing trendy or "woke" about this place and it provides a haven from the madness out on our streets and in our confused and confusing daily lives, not to mention in our government.  Do go, enjoy the food and wine and feel nourished in more ways than one.  You can now go for breakfast or lunch if that is more to your taste than dinner.
Great food fantastic service will definitely dine again
Amazing attentive waiters but lacked any atmosphere and the food was very average

Had a wonderful time at S&W. My husband and I are regulars but it was nice to come back after the lockdown and have a chance to celebrate our 5th wedding anniversary. They gave us the best seats, a complimentary glass of champagne each to congratulate us and throughout the meal they were always kind, attentive to our needs and smiling. We always feel welcomed at S&W. We ordered the Tomahawk Steak with lobster and our favourite mac n cheese and creamed spinach sides. I don't need to comment on the ast and quality and all I can say is S&W definitely has the best steak in London. The ambiance, food and staff is awesome and you certainly won't be disappointed.
It was great. Everything was lovely. Would definitely recommend

We were seated at a table right by the toilets even though there were many others free and were the only people at our end of the restaurant.  My husband‚Äôs lobster starter was still slightly frozen.  The manager, who took our order forgot to put my husband‚Äôs main course through.  It was rushed through when she realised which was not until the other main courses arrived.  Consequently the steak which should have been marinated in a chimichurri sauce arrived with the sauce plonked on the top and overpowering with raw garlic and herbs. One of our drinks orders took over 20 minutes to arrive, and they made a mistake with one of the sides too.  Offered the cost of my husband‚Äôs steak off the bill.  Not a good experience when you are coming for a family birthday day out.  Should have been given the meal (or at least drinks) free as the whole experience was spoilt and service charge removed.  Compared to the branch we went to a couple of years ago in Miami which was faultless, this was nothing short of a disaster.

Nice bustling restaurant, waiting staff all very well presented.  We were greeted by a lovely waiter who arrived with complimentary sparkling wine from our hotel, who had suggested the restaurant.  We asked to sample the pea soup.  It seemed to be a difficult request. A manger had to be asked and eventually a sample arrived.  We both disliked this.  We decided to skip starters and order mains.  I had the cod and my plus 1 had lamb. We got 3 sides.  From sitting down to receiving our mains was 1 hours. This was way too long.  All our sides were only warm and simply too cool for eating. My cod was nice. The lamb was dry.  We advised the waiter. He has said that he had been so busy that he was unable to collect out food and said he would send his manger over.  The manager handled the matter very well.  She clearly understood that our experience had not been acceptable. Overall, I think this is a nice restaurant. I loved the decor and really thought the staff were excellent. However, I am not convinced based on the food we ordered and for me if the food isn‚Äôt hot, when it‚Äôs meant to be, then my meal has be ruined. Maybe I‚Äôll try another time and give the benefit of the doubt.
great place, amazing steaks  - service is one of the best i had

We had a wonderful time between shows at Smith and Wollensky last weekend. On arrival we were a bit early so sat at the bar and had a couple of drinks before we went to our table. The bar staff were very friendly and efficient and we did enjoy our time there prior to eating.
We had the pre-theatre menu which was very good value with enough choice. The main menu looked great too to be honest so we will return to try that some day.
Service was swift, professional and friendly - we had no faults at all. I would thoroughly recommend this restaurant and can't wait to return next time I am in the area.
True to form.  Familiar menu. Great room.  Great service.  Pricey, as expected.

Special food, service and wine for a special occasion. An18th,21st and retirement all rolled into one. Cocktails on arrival at the bar spot on (e.g. Fab No3 gin martini). The chilli prawn and the scallop starters were an excellent start. All four of us went on to try different steaks and we all agreed the meat quality, preparation and presentation were 10 out of 10. My T-bone was one of the best if not the best I've had. We went for the house white (Californian sauvignon blanc) and house red (Californian blend) wines. They were both outstanding and befitting the rest of the meal. At ¬£80 a bottle the red is not inexpensive (there were lots of lower cost wines from around the World), but Smith & Wollensky's house red is legendary and has been tried and enjoyed by this reviewer before in New York and Chicago. It simply goes perfectly with the steaks. Whilst we were discussing deserts, our water brought us a huge (and delicious) chocolate cake, complements of the restaurant, as a recognition of our three big dates. We washed this down with some recommended rum believe it or not. A first for all of us and it did go well. Throughout our occasion the service to our table was impeccable. Efficient, thoughtful and never intrusive.

A lovely evening with a great server, engaging and informative.
Food was simply lovely
A wonderful 2 course set lunch ahead of the matinee theatre show at the Adelphi - and a sneaky fabulous cocktail in daylight hours! Will be a regular now - loved the ambience.

I‚Äôve been to Smith & Wollensky restaurants in the US and some have been good and some not so. In short, this was probably the best one I‚Äôve experienced.

Our booking was for 7pm, we arrived early but were immediately shown to our table. The starters were great but were out done (in a good way) by the chateaubriand that followed - cooked to perfection. A good few drinks, and a dessert later, our table left more than happy.

Not only was the food wonderful but the service was wonderfully attentive without being intrusive.

Smith and Wollensky London isn‚Äôt the cheapest restaurant in London by far but you are paying for quality in both the food and service. We will definitely be going back.
Steak was absolutely beautiful. Our waiter was brilliant and helped us chose our steaks with his knowledge. All the sides were lovely and we all thoroughly enjoyed our evening
A stunning location with lovely staff and delicious steaks
Lovely atmosphere and great service. Would defiantly recommend this restaurant .

I had brunch with friends to celebrate my birthday. The food, service and ambience were great and I was given a complimentary piece of cake and a card by the staff. I have never felt more welcome by an establishment. I had a lovely experience and I would absolutely recommend it to anyone.

Great atmosphere, attentive and very friendly service but, ultimately, the best steak I have tasted EVER, and i've had a few.
We went for the pre-theatre set menu and chose the USDA prime dry-aged sirloin which was plenty big enough. We ordered the pepper sauce too, which came separately, as we wanted to taste just the steak in its own juices first. The flavours were sensational and have to admit that the sauce even enhanced the flavour of the steak.
We had the Mendoza Malbec to accompany our meal which was also delicious and went well with the steak.
I'm going to recommend S&W to all my friends and family and look forward to going again myself.
Was just a great dining experience all round. Thoroughly enjoyed it and will be back !

My husband and I absolutely loved our meal at s&w! It's stunning inside, service was outstanding, food presentation was beautiful, and everything tasted divine. The creme brulee was literally the best I have ever had! Highly recommend.
Food was superb and service was excellent. Can't wait to go again

I'm a huge fan of the NYC location, and although I know they're not really affiliated (the NYC location is separately owned), I just had to try out the London location since moving here.

That said, at first I was really skeptical because of the review S&W got in the Guardian, so I ended up trying Goodman (two locations), Hawksmoor, and Cut before I went to S&W.

I've now been here twice, and I can safely say, this is hand's down the best steakhouse in London. Their steak is perfectly cooked, perfectly seasoned, and their service is a million times better than every other steakhouse in London. The ambiance and interior is just amazing, and you're never cramped for room.

The location seems a little deserted right now, but apparently the Adelphi buildings are being redone into a mixed use development, so there'll be a lot more people in the area soon. It's just a few minutes walk from Charing Cross, which is the geographic center of london, so getting there shouldn't be a problem.

I've been to the S&W in NYC many times, so I was looking forward to the S&W experience while in London for business. The restaurant is huge and the decor is wonderful. The staff have been well trained and are very attentive. The food was great and the portions similar to what you would find in NYC.

We went in at lunchtime - the confit duck leg and steamed fish dumplings with sambal were heavenly. The broken lamb meatballs with labneh (not pictured) was amazing as well. Bold/fusion type menu items with extremely fresh, well-balanced flavours and textures. Highly recommend!
Delicious food. Great options for vegans and vegetarians. Divine cocktails. Lovely venue. Warm staff. Great ambience.
Great place with amazing decor and food. Highly recommend üòä

It was the first time I‚Äôd booked to go to Caravan for breakfast and was quite excited by the menu and the venue layout etc.
I wasn‚Äôt so impressed by the waitress who was looking after our table. She was rude and abrupt. She came to us to take our order and barked ‚Äúready??‚Äù ‚ÄúAre you ready?‚Äù No hello, not even a courteous ‚Äúhi are you ready to order?‚Äù

Then she was passive aggressive when we asked her a simple question about the coffee.
The food was lovely and it came out really quickly but when we finished she came back and barked ‚Äúfinished?‚Äù

I was annoyed at her approach with us and it made us feel uncomfortable and unwelcome. She certainly was not like that to other customers.

We won‚Äôt be returning.
Great vegan options üòãüíö
A very stylish and sophisticated place that offers a great selection of food and drink with a warm and attentive service.
Fab! Delicious cocktails and great service!
All very good as always! Will definitely go back again!
Service is. It in point.  Restaurant like this should have experienced waiters not kids
We had a great evening.  The staff were brilliant and we enjoyed the restaurant being quieter than usual.  So pleased you are reopen.
Friendly staff, busy place! Great d√©cor and location
The space between tables is very less , one has to really squeeze to get in /out
There was an issue with my main course, it was dealt with impeccably could not have ask for more. Great staff food and service

We were there for a special birthday.
Welcome excellent. We were served by Sharif who was charming polite. The dishes we selected excellent presentation and enjoyed very much. They had noted we were celebrating a birthday and presented a little cake. The ambience, decor stunning. Fabulous.
Great setting and lovely meal. A bit expensive for what we got but you pay for the setting. Would definitely recommend.
Nice atmosphere food and service:) def getting back:)
Excellent service and food. The restaurant is very intimate and the knowledge of the staff is excellent. Thoroughly recommend the toro

The food was perfect, but very small portions per dish. There were 3 of us, and we shared 1 bottle of the least expensive red wine, and each paid ¬£58. Without the wine, it would have been approximately ¬£45 each. The location, service, and ambiance were all very good.
Real Japanese sushi prepared by a Japanese chef. The variety of different fish was better than expected. Next time, I wish to try "Omakase", relying on Chef's choice.
Exceptional food and service. A great place for a celebration.
Exceptional food, beautifully presented and exquisite flavours.
From the food to the service everything was at the top level thank you the Frog!

The most enjoyable meal I have had in a very long time, tasting menu was packed with visually stunning food, all of which was packed with intense flavours.  The staff and chefs also enhanced the evening with their friendly yet professional service.
Every dish was perfection. The sommelier was knowledgable, fun and attentive to all our needs and desires. The staff were all fantastic. I cannot say anythig negative. I will be back
Great food and a lovely atmosphere. Thoroughly enjoyed ourselves
Delicious. The mushroom course incredible....in fact the whole meal was.

Consistently fabulous. It is a treat for us that we spend many weeks/months looking forward to. It is not inexpensive but it most certainly is worth every penny. The team who work so hard clearly create their dishes with passion and skill.  All staff in front of house are knowledgeable and it is great to try some unusual pairing wines. It remains our most favourite special restaurant. Thank you team.
amazing chefs, superb service, great atmosphere,  look forward to returning

My friend and I were down from Scotland for a few days and chose Frog as we were seeing a show at The Savoy Theatre. We chose the Five course Tasting Menu and both agreed it was the best meal we had ever tasted. Each mouthful was a delight. The bread and pre dessert additional courses were a lovely surprise !! We were looked after very attentively and each dish explained very well - the little touches like providing a floor holder for our handbags all added to the experience. Great to see our food being prepared by Adam himself. Next time we are back in London we will definitely pay another visit !!

Fabulous food and service in the restaurants. Surely a Michelin star soon!

Cocktail bar was a let down due to very poor service (waitress repeatedly forgot we had ordered drinks) and then not very tasty / fairly bland cocktails. A very different experience from the restaurant.

My wife and I went to Frog in Covent Garden on Wednesday evening. From the moment we arrived we were treated very nicely. We opted for the Adam Handling Tasting Menu of 8+ courses where each one was better than the next. Stunning presentation, stunning flavours, stunning quality, exquisite service and even at ¬£95 per head, represented fantastic value. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.
Really great food from start to finish. The bread and butter was outstanding

2nd visit. First time was excellent, the tasting menu was flavoursome and inventive, Adam Handling was in the kitchen. Return visit didn't live up to expectations. Service was slow and disinterested . Portions from the a la carte menu extremely small , more suited to a tasting menu.  Champagne by the glass when finally served was flat . Toilets were not clean. Stairs to the bar and toilets covered in leaves that had blown in from outside and were not cleared. Seemed very much with a new venture opening in Hoxton they had taken their eye off the ball here.

Absolutely superb lunch experience. My friends and I all had the 5 course tasting menu and we impressed with each course. Wine choices were equally impressive and we appreciated the tips and curation  by the sommelier. Per person the price was on the very high end but this was expected somewhat. Would highly recommend.

Note to OpenTable.
When I booked with OpenTable on 5th January, my confirmation showed that I had signed up to a tasting menu at ¬£60 per head.
When the bill came the charge was ¬£65 per head. The restaurant manager said that the new price was shown on the menu, which it was, but I had not noticed it.
I did not ask for any money back and left the optional service charge of ¬£34 intact, but it left a rather slippery impression of the OpenTable/ Frog interface.
We did enjoy the exciting food and the excellent table service by an enthusiastic international team.
The Tasting Menu was a fantastic experience. Everything tasted so good and the wines were a perfect match. Next time I go to London I‚Äôm sure I will visit the Frog again :)
It was great food
Always reliable and good to see that the menu is constantly evolving. A firm favourite!

Portions were small and very overpriced and the food was okay nothing exceptional. Pai Bhai was not served as shown on their website in fact it was a tiny portion with very little vegetables and chicken Makhni had 3-4 small pieces of chicken with so much sauce. Disappointed

It was my third visit and on each occasion both the food and service has been amazing!
Very good vegetarian options, a menu designed with consideration and thought for all culinary palates.
Highly recommended for any occasion.
Fabulous food and service
Nice authentic Indian restaurant.  Delicious food, friendly staffs, good value for money !!!
Outstanding dinner and service. A new hit for people who love Indian food in London. Ahbi the operations director, the wait staff and the entire team were welcoming and helpful. 5stars!
Delicious food, well worth the price. Onion rings are amazing. Excellent service. Super clean bathrooms. Looking forward to returning.
Came here for the 9 dish August Festival Menu and would highly recommend. Food was delicious and plentiful, great balance of spice and heat. Staff were friendly and efficient. We will be back!
The starters were very tasty. I had the paneer which was delicious and a good portion. The mains were okay. The garlic naan could do with some more garlic plus it was cold.
Perfect Indian afternoon tea. Food was full of flavours. Definitely recommend going lovely experience.
Great experience, wonderful staff and food. Highly recommended.

Seated upstairs but service seemed 'distant' to say the least. Almost had to shout for attention. Left alone at the beginning the wine we ordered sat on the counter for nearly 10 minutes until we requested it was provided. Had to request a cooler.
Food arrived slightly tepid and was reasonably flavoursome.
Wont go again.
Amazing food and ambience will visit again. Enjoyed authentic Indian food and bought a tea pot too

Authentic Indian street food of high quality, served innovatively and with a smile. The food choices are an excellent representation of the diverse cuisine and highly recommended for a meal with friends or even a business meal, as the place is relatively quieter than others around for lunch

We arrived early around 6 pm on a Wednesday by 7 pm the place was absolutely full ... and not surprisingly as this is different and delightful. We were pre theatre dining and had very good service with food delivered promptly. This place is more akin to street food than fine dining but what it does it does we‚Äôll Recommended
Lovely food but tiny, overpriced portions. I spent ¬£25 (including a soft drink and a tea, no alcohol) and left very hungry! Staff were friendly but service was slow.

The food was great. The service is fairly slow and they seemed to need reminders to bring some basics stuff out like ice, coffee or tea. The portion sizes are also quite small so if you are really hungry just ensure you order lots of food.
Great modern Indian dining, helpful waiters. A lovely meal!
The food was delicious and the place itself is quite fancy. Very sad that the service was so poor : we got four different waiters : not very responsive and forgetting some of our orders...

We dinned here on Saturday and very disappointed.  We had family dinner booked for birthday celebrations.  This is a very expensive restaurant which is fine if you can deliver food & service to match.  Drinks took over 20 mins to come and that was after we asked again for them.  The waiter i found rude and felt as though he was talking down to you.       Food was ok but most disappointing was service.  For a central London restaurant very poor. Will not be going again.
Nice Indian restaurant in vibrant Covent Garden area. the food was pretty good, different than the standard Indian restaurant fare. But not up to a level of Dishoom, THE indian reference in London.
Lovely food great service, the samosas are to die for!

We really enjoyed our evening at the Cinnamon Bazaar.  We had fantastic service and the food was delicious.  We started with the crab bonda, and then had the rajasthani lamb and kolkata spiced cod and finished with the chocolate and walnut cake.  It was all delicious.  The two mains had great flavour with a good amount of spice (not so that it was overpowering but just so you know you were eating a good Indian curry).  Our server was very friendly and knowledgable and timely.  I will definitely be back as there are many things on the menu I would like to try and I will recommend to it friends as well.

Overall we had an enjoyable evening. The food was lovely and I loved the design of the restaurant.
We booked a table for 8:30, however clearly they were not ready for us so we had to wait until 9:00 before being seated. At 8:50 we were offered a drink at the bar (however this was not complimentary). The drink i ordered was not available and the bat staff hasn't even heard of it, dispite it being on their menu.
When seated, we had to ask for everything (menu, to order, reminder that we ordered drinks and actually would like to have them....).
Food arrived at it was actually very lovely. Although the menu is not clear on how much you need to order so it's worth asking a staff member.
At the end of the evening, (after asking to pay) the toilets has no toilet paper in...
I think this restaurant could be great, just some staff training required...

Lovely lunch yesterday.  First visit to Aubaine but certainly not the last.  Friendly, helpful staff who thankfully didn‚Äôt push for our order, as so often happens at other restaurants.  Lovely menu choices, drinks were fabulous.  Will certainly return.

Great place for breakfast/brunch. Lovely sitting inside or out.
Our favorite place in Mayfair.
Very good meal and excellent service, recommended for a business lunch

I met a client here for a business lunch which turned into a three-hour lunch!
The food was very good, and the time between the courses was perfect.

We dined here before making our way to Mr. Fogg's and it was a good quiet option for a solid dinner before entering a very different scene a few streets away!  Their Summer offer was going on and it's what attracted me to the restaurant online, but when I inquired about it, the server made a meh face and mentioned that the options are plain and small.  We were deterred by that immediately and ended up ordering off the main menu.  Service was very good (12.5% gratuity is included in the bill) and food was pretty good as well.

For ¬£15 for 2 courses and a glass of wine, we didn't expect too much, but the food was very tasty and well served, the wine perfectly acceptable. It's a restricted choice, only 2 for each course, but still excellent value in a pleasant place. I would recommend and return.
great service but too expensive for a casual lunch
A group of us dined here on the set menu offer and thought it was very good value for money. Food was amazing and service was excellent.
Very expensive would recommend for a celebration food good and wine very nice very dark inside needs a more Morden look and feel
Exceeded our high expectations. We'll definitely be back to enjoy the restaurant again.
Excellent food, excellent service. A thoroughly enjoyable visit.
Food and service was excellent but ¬£275 for two people for the tasting menu and one bottle of wine was excessive

Amazing
Incredible
Stunning
Best food we‚Äôve ever had!   Love the ambience.  A must-do experience!

We had a special Sunday lunch for a birthday at the Savoy Grill. We requested the set menu which had a reasonable choice of courses and was very suitable for us. I think the wine list could do with more bottles below the cost of ¬£50, the one we had was fine but expensive.

All in all, it was the first time we had been to SG in about 10 years so it's definitely a good place to eat and I am sure we will be back again.
It is expensive but worth it for a special occasion. The decor and ambiance were lovely and the staff were great, both friendly and efficient.

We were eating here pre-theatre and also as a birthday treat for my mother‚Äôs 90th. Food was delicious and service impeccable. There was no rush for anything and everything was done in a very timely fashion. A really enjoyable and memorable evening.
The food was good but the service need to be improved. I asked olive oil for four times and it took about 20 minutes for them to deliver.

Very disappointed with the tasting menu, can only rate the meal one from ten! We‚Äôve been to many restaurants for fine dining in the UK and in Europe and this was the worst tasting menu yet. We will think twice before visiting the Grill again.
The best dining experience we have ever had, excellent food and service
Excellent service.

Walking into the hushed, civilized and tastefully decorated Savoy Grill (a Gordon Ramsey restaurant) was uplifting in a ‚Äúwe deserve the better things occasionally‚Äù sort of way. The meal was decidedly a step above the average. The fish cake was light and incredibly tasty, the foie-gras terrine one of the best I have had in years, and so silky. my sister thought the beetroot and goats curd was excellent. Her main of Cottage Pie was beautifully presented but if I am honest, only average (we cook a much better one), but my pork steak was perfectly cooked, as were the accompanying vegetables, and we all adored the carrots. the linguini had a perfect egg, the truffle taste was excellent, but the pasta was too thin to be called linguini. Desserts wonderful, pineapple Carpaccio and a light delicious steamed sponge.

We have been to the Savoy Grill several times and always enjoyed it as a very special lunch spot; however, this time there were a couple of small issues that spoiled the experience for us. The hostess  would not honour our booking  request for a specific table and staff did not address our concern about overly-cold temperature in the restaurant. The hotel lobby was warm and comfortable, the restaurant was freezing and A/C needed adjusting, but was not done.  We dine out a lot and there are many restaurants in London that we will now prefer to go to. We are disappointed that the Savoy Grill did not live up to our expectations and our previous experiences. Each time we dined at the Savoy Grill in the past, the restaurant was full and lively. This time, the restaurant was very quiet and less than 1/2 the restaurant was occupied at lunchtime. That, more than anything else, is an indication that something could improve.

Such an elegant restaurant with great service. The waiters had in depth knowledge of all the food and were extremely helpful. The food was absolutely beautiful, however I am glad I ordered a side with my main! We also went to the Theater that night and I can honestly say I preferred the dining part of my evening!
Great meal, comfortable table and wonderful service.

This was our first visit, I must admit the whole experience was very enjoyable. We opted for the 7 course taster menu and it was nice, the majority was very nice although the main (beef Wellington) was only warm - I should have said something and sent it back but I didn't so my fault for this not being the highlight it should have been.
Would certainly go back.
Beautiful place. Excellent service. Good value lunch for an iconic grill.

We had a very pleasant evening in excellent surroundings. The food was very good and the staff were both attentive and friendly . We had a five year old with us and the staff made a fuss of him and made him feel very special.

This was our second visit and we thought the first was better. The service let it down this time. My bread was taken away without the waiter checking I had finished and he leaned across me whilst I was eating to take it away.
The bill was also brought to the table without me requesting it. Disappointing.
Food was nice.

Pre-theatre (Saturday matinee) lunch - generally a good experience. Had pre-lunch oysters and then the 2-course lunch menu, with additional cost for steak option; food was very good. But not great. Service started off as attentive and prompt, but tapered off when restaurant filled up. Then it was slow, no time for desert and almost missed getting to the theatre for 230pm start. Paying the bill was a very cursory matter - felt like waiter couldn't get it over with quickly enough. Wasn't quite the "Gordon Ramsay" experience.

The experience was marred by the rushed service - completed first two courses in 45 minutes - and couldn't care less attitude of one server. Overall the experience was disappointing and completely at odds with the fantastic stay at the Savoy.

Food was excellent  as ever but the service was dreadful.  To begin with  we ordered  some mojitos only to be told they didn't  have any mint. Then my 2 guests  both ordered the fillet steak, once again to be told they had run out (this is 8pm on a Thursday ). From then on every  drink order   (only 3 drinks) either was completely  forgotten came back at different  times or the wrong drinks. Perhaps the fact we had 4 people  servicing us providing the confusion whereas 1 competent waiter /waitress would have been more successful. For a hotel /restaurant of such esteem it was all quite amateurish

Visited for my daughter's 18th. Service was very attentive and the pace was exactly as we like it....fairly quick with starters and then a good gap between starters and mains and allowed to sit and relax as long as you want but never feeling like you have been forgotten. The waiters were friendly without being overly familiar but also not stuffy or haughty (which can sometimes happen in expensive restaurants). They did run out of the foils gras and asparagus was off because end of season, but that just proves to me that they use fresh ingredients and when it is gone, it is gone......so no problem for me. We had the sweetbreads which were delicious and then the Chateaubriand - the girls had the duck. My husband chose a SA Chenin blanc which was reasonably priced and then we drank Gigondas with our main.......the wine menu offered value but also obviously you can go much more expensive, but what we had was good and not ridiculous money. The atmosphere was noisy and busy and fun, which meant we could all have a laugh and talk animatedly without feeling everyone was looking at us. The tables are set at a good distance from each other and we had one of the curved bench/banquettes along the edge so we had a nice view of the restaurant and could feel the atmosphere. The restaurant had a good mix of modern and traditional......keeping the linen table cloths etc but modern feel in terms of flavours and atmosphere.
Of course it wasn't cheap....it's the Savoy and Gordon Ramsay!!!and London.........but for a special occasion (or if someone else is paying!) it is an excellent choice. They also made a little cake on a plate for my 18-year-old with a candle which was sweet.
We went to the Beaufort bar beforehand for a cocktail which was also lovely and overall had a very memorable evening. I probably wouldn't recommend it for a quiet romantic dinner for 2, but for parties of 4 or over and definitely for business dinners.....good choice. Will start saving for the next one!

My only criticism was the hard sell and speed of service, sat down to be met immediately by the Champagne salesman. Appreciate they have a job to do and are probably on a commission but time to breathe and have a conversation with my wife would have been nice.

Our order was taken immediately and arrived promptly. The waiter was very efficient and very pleasant. I was enjoying my starter Omelette Arnold Bennett (delicious) and my steak arrived and was being prepared as I was still eating. I know about 'Turn & Burn' but there were at least 3 empty tables around and to have been given the time to take in the very special place that is the Savoy, would have made a lovely night, a magnificent one.

The Savoy Grill is part of the Ramsay empire but none the worse for that.  Food is traditional, British, pies, puddings and steaks.  My steak and ale pudding was excellent - tasty and light.  My dining companion had the chicken pie, which was equally good.  Service is friendly but not intrusive.  Not a stellar Michelin experience but a solid  performance in an iconic dining room.
Everything was great from the food to services , T-bone is our all time favourite.My boys love savoy . we will be back soon .Thank you

Me and the wife dine here on almost every trip to th UK, but must say that this weekends trip was the least satisfying.

We ordered the Chateubriand steak for two, as ususual with a bottle of red wine.

On this evening though;

* Our waiter, that looked like he was russian, didn't smile once and we had to wait to order for at least five minutes
* When we got the food, the sauce was missing. We had to let them know this and then wait another 3 minutes for the sauce. Then the steak was cold.
* I don't like that they have started with the self imlied tips so that when you get the bank terminal it is all ready added 12,5%. I had to tell the waitor about our experience and then I just gave 5%. That was actually 5% more then they should have had on this night, but we really like the place but it is not the first place we book on our next trip over unfortunately.

Everything was fine, except for the half hour wait to be seated.
The food was excellent and the lobster starter was the best I‚Äôve ever tasted.

Truly an outstanding experience from start to finish.  The Maitre'd, Florian, was a wonderful host for our Thanksgiving celebration.  He even arranged an introduction to Chef Andy Cooks.  Amazing evening. Fantastic dishes matching warm, attentive hospitality.  I look forward to visiting again.

We had a really lovely time and the place was impressive. The service was good and the staff seemed genuinely pleasant and well trained. Although there seemed to be so many waitors that we rarely went 3 minutes without someone checking how we were. This would not however put us off returning.

Service was top notch. Staff were very attentive and seemed genuinely friendly--not a hint of just going through the motions.

The food on the other hand was just good. Our steaks were reasonably flavorful and tender, but were dry. The mashed potatoes were soupy. Broccoli with chilli tasted great, but was white in some places it should have been green. The cauliflower au gratin was excellent.
The plates were well presented.

All in all it is worth going as long as you realize that you're paying for the service and ambience as much as for the food.
We would return.

Me and my partner ate at the savoy grill on Thursday evening and were very disappointed and upset at the quality of the food we received. I visit Gordon's restaurants frequently in Las Vegas when I'm there and knowing how high standard the food normally is we were really excited to experience London.

We ordered the food and wine and the service was very good however we were upset at the quality of the food the chips seemed like they were frozen and had no real taste! The beef fat roast potatoes were really hard and tasteless with little potato in! You could actually hit them with a fork and they sounded hollow!

The steak was average and the greens in garlic just seemed like strips of tasteless cabbage. Would not go back Sorry!

Booked this restaurant for my husbands birthday meal while visiting London for the weekend. Service fantastic,food amazing. Very enjoyable evening rounded off with a surprise dessert for my husbands birthday which I happened to mention when making booking. For a special occasion yes it's worth it.

The Savoy is indeed a grand hotel - a very beautiful setting with lovely ambiance. The fare served was acceptable at this level but the restaurant was stuffy and far too hot to the point we felt distinctly uncomfortable...our butter was melting on the table.


Unfortunately the oppressive heat and our mumbling French waiter distracted from a special experience. Consequently, I have to say Gordon should do better.

Thank you.

We weren't given any explanations about the menu, unlike what (we later realized) happened with other tables. A waiter told us the Specials, however he said that too quickly, and turned immediately away. We asked the Sommelier to repeat the Specials, but he didn't know what the components of the dishes were! We chose the lobster bisque as a starter, which in our opinion, was way too salty. For Main, I chose the Sunday lunch "from the trolley" suggestion: Rump of beef, which was full of fat and that ruined it for me. Sides and desserts were delicious! All in all, it was a nice dining experience, however we did expect much more from a G.Ramsay Restaurant, and for the price we paid.
A great lunch served by friendly, attentive staff who were superbly efficient from the time we entered the restaurant.

The Savoy Grill is already onto a winner with its historic reputation for glamour, and celebrity from the 1930s through the golden age of cinema. I don't thinks it's unfair to say its reputation had faded, but glamour is back at the Savoy Grill. It offers simple classics, beautifully cooked in a buzzing and elegant setting, which still manages to retain privacy and comfort with circular tables and classic sofas. The food was excellent and the service was friendly and efficient. The only possible downside for those seeking to relax is that it that it seemed to be a popular venue for well heeled business meetings. Nevertheless, I really enjoyed my evening meal and would not hesitate to recommend

We took my parents for a weekend in London staying at the savoy as they had never been before and dinner at the savoy grill. The restaurant is very pleasant and looks the part, it's like stepping back in time (in a good way) and the character just makes the occasion more special.

The staff are exceedingly helpful and friendly and the food was excellent, wines are not silly loaded either.

Very pleasant evening had by all
We both had a wonderful evening at the Savoy Grill. The service was superb and the food choice was amazing. We both had the mixed grill which was cooked to perfection.

Beautiful decor and sense of occasion. Quite dark and difficult to ignore noisy office group sitting nearby. Food very good but comes with surprisingly very little side servings which are all extra and expensive. Calves liver was perfect.

I booked The Savoy Grill for my husbands birthday after we had attended the theatre. It was easy to find, and although we had booked a later time, we arrived an hour early and were seated early with no problem. The decor created a great ambience, we had previously looked on the website at menus, but I was pleasantly surprised to find vegetarian options available that I had not previously seen. Overall, our experience was far more than we expected, we would definitely recommend to others, but be prepared to spend! Though it's true what they say 'you get what you pay for' found drinks accounted for a third of our total bill and only my husband was drinking alcohol. Food was mouthwatering and service fast.

Yes unexpected becouse we were almost sure about quality and presentation of the meals but we were really impressed by service and by the kindeness of the waiters. Nice experience. We strongly recommend
Excellent food and service, made to feel really welcome and very well looked after.
Although I mentioned it on the booking there was no acknowledgement whatsoever of the special occasion. Disappointing post theatre treat for 21st birthday.

First off, let me say I never write reviews, but I just had to say something about the Savoy Grill. It was the best experience we had in London!!! We walk 34 minutes to Savoy Grill from our hotel and it was all worth it, sore feet and all it was hands down the best meal I've had in a long time.The food was great. Perfect portions. Lamb Wellington was so succulent. Starters were delicious and the dessert was the perfect way to end the night. The hostess was awesome and our waitress was the best. Her personality was great and she took my awful joke very well. Ha! Please Please start a restaurant in Washington, DC USA. Because us Americans need it, especially me!!! Thank You! My friends thank you as well!!!!
We had a fantastic lunch at the Savoy, wonderful atmosphere good food great service and superb champagne!!! will definatly visit again, in fact can't wait

Excellent all around - The staff at The Savoy are knowledgable, friendly and a pleasure to interact with. The food was of excellent standard and the presentation was of the highest standards. Down to earth eating with an excellent environment. Highly recommended for special occasions, you will not be disappointed

This was our third time to visit the savoy grill. We are from Dublin so every time we visit London we now visit the savoy grill. On this occasion we brought our twin 6 year old boys. Initially when we sat down we thought we may have made a mistake. The elderly couple next to us before even seeing the behaviour of our children summoned the maitre d over and made it obvious to us he was not happy and wished to be moved. This turned out to be wonderful as we could now relax with this couple gone. As usual the service is second to none, anything that could be done for us was. The wine was superb, and food even better. The children loved it too and where complimented as we left on their behaviour which made us feel very good. Thank you

Went there for a birthday celebration but was disappointed as it did not live up to its standards, have had better food and service at places which do not claim to be big.Their chicken had finished which shows how well organised a 5star kitchen is..I would not recommend it to anyone.
They were not friendly at all. I will never go.
We booked this lunch with my friend from moscow, when planned our hoidays in london. It was the first day of our trip, that we started in such a nice and lovely place. Many thanks.
Everything about our night was amazing. The staff, the food, the atmosphere, all were amazing. Would recommend to anyone.
Very good value for pre-theatre but menu very restricted
My wife was not keen about the mussels presentatation i.e in a saucepan. It was a good job the G&T was good if rather pricey!!

The staff were extremely attentive when we arrived and were anxious for us to order quickly. As the restaurant filled up it became more difficult to attract their attention and it took some time to order desserts and coffee. The menu was good and the food presented and cooked well, though the lamb on the trolley was a little cold. The accoustics are not brilliant.

8 of us went to the Savoy for their set lunch which was absolutely great. Excellent choice, excellent service and delicious food beautifully served. The ambience was just perfect, the service and staff were lovely without making you feel uncomfortable and the food delicious. I have been to many local restaurants (in Kent) which have been just about okay but the Savoy was definitely value for money and in such beautiful surroundings. I would recommend for lunch and pre-theatre dinner as I have done both and it is nice to go somewhere special without it breaking the bank! Thoroughly recommend.
A great meal, couldn't fault it one little bit. Perfect!

We had a prawn cocktail and the house-speciality omelette to start. Both were superb. We both had a steak (a Ribeye and a Fillet) for our main course, with sides of chips, mash, creamed spinach and vegetables. The mash in particular deserves a mention - it was simply amazing. The steaks were without a doubt the best I have ever eaten. Not cheap (at least in my eyes!) but worth every single penny. The wine was also superb, but perhaps not the best value (my wife's was ¬£17 for a glass, and not a generous glass at that). The desert of profiteroles was superb and they bought us a special "Anniversary" cake free of charge - nice touch. The service was excellent - attentive but not overbearing. Overall this was the best meal we have ever had.
Friendly helpful staff, great food. Even had a show round of the kitchen after dinner which was a great experience watching the chefs in action.

Good place, great service, excellent attention to detail, had good steak but the side salad very plain and my spinach over season too salty, the snails was best I have eaten, the bread was great, so overall good, recommend that there should be some background music, lived up to Gordon Ramsey reputation, also great that it was in the Savoy
The Savoy Grill was great as it always is. Fantastic food and service. Expensive, but you get what you pay for!

Went for lunch and had a three course meal of which the food was good all be it hardly spectacular looking. Simple food with decent flavours. Surrounding are very classy and clean yet there was plenty of chatter to make it feel comfortable. The service was my biggest issue - they just never left you alone. Every 2 minutes someone different would be at your table doing something fairly unnecessary which broke a lot of the conversations. If you like lots of attention and want to feel posh then this is the place for you. Overall it was definitely worth a try but it's not outstanding.
Had one of the most lovely meals i've ever had here on Sunday the 13th of May. Great Service, Beautiful food and the whole experience of eating here was fantastic.
Good overall but keen to get you out the door on time. They did make it special for my overseas visitors which was really appreciated.
Second visit in the last month, first time for lunch this time for early dinner. Each time the food has been excellent and the service superb. The lunch menu is exceptional value for money.

A very enjoyable meal and a good choice for us to meet friends from Wales who were in London for a few days. Would have expected the Theatre Menu to be more attractive (the only fish main was replaced by a fishcake!)and sure this could have been achieved with a little imagination and not much extra cost. Wine list was quite pricey.

We treated ourselves to a three course lunch at the Savoy Grill for the special rate of ¬£26.  It was absolutely magnificent. Everything was amazing - the service was first class, attentive yet not overbearing - and the food was delicious.  The bill mounted up with drinks and extras like coffee but you expect that.  An invitation to tour the kitchen with the maitre'd was a lovely touch and most enjoyable.  Would thoroughly recommend.  Was worth every penny.
Great interior decor of the hotel but average for restaurant area.  Service fine as expected, but food nothing spectacular.

My husband and I took our friends for a special meal to the Savoy and we had a wonderful time.  The food was out of this world and the service was amazing.  It didnt break the bank but you felt as if you were a star.  What an experience.

Food and Service excellent.Sorry to see the open necked and jeans brigade in abundance as well as the mobile phone picture takers flashing everywhere.No respect for institutions these days and this is certainly one.
The food is exceptional., service is just as good  and the venue is absolutely stunning. We love!
A family run restaurant with plenty of variety. Care taken about the food and the whole experience. Great food!

A really great restaurant.  Not too busy on a Saturday evening (unlike many nearby places) and excellent 'home-prepared' Italian food by a team on native family members.  They are very willing to adapt menu items if necessary (I am allergic to crustaceans) and will also  happily let you share one of the starters (as the portions are often quite substantial).  Also a very reasonable wine list and a good supply of Italian liqueurs to finish your coffee with.  Really pleasant service. I had  used it only once before (as my Club is just across the road) and had decided I must come back soon - a really good decision!  Very fair prices for the quality of the food and drink, given the location.
Looked after a group of six of us very well indeed.
Nice to be back again: v ery civilised but, when full, difficult noise-wise!
Il Vicolo is always nice for lunch with friends or for business. The pasta is delicious and the service perfect! I can definately recommend it!
Execellent service in private dining !!
Great food, great service.  Fun night, will be back soon.
Absolutely great! Staff is extremely friendly, food is amazing, we had vegetarian tasting menu, it did not disappoint
Great little spot, will repeat.

Great vibe. Lovely modern space with retro g-plan chairs. Not starchy, excellent service in casual clothes. Food magnificent. One of the best. Not cheap but definitely worth it for a special occasion.
Lovely lunch time menu with friendly service and delicious food. Good value given the quality.

Portland is my idea of a perfect restaurant.  Nicely relaxed setting but excellent service - attentive, thoughtful and unobtrusive.  We had the set menu and it was absolutely divine - amazing flavours and textures.  Highly, highly recommend!
very cosy settings, nice food, good wine recommendations. very good value for money. Very attentive and warm service!

We had read all the media reviews of Portland and given that they are the recipient of one of Londons new Michelin stars we had high expectations. We booked at Saturday lunch and ate from the A la Carte menu. The food was good but did not reach greatness.

Snacks were interesting but the crab meat was swamped by the pickled kohlrabi and one of the chicken skins was not crispy. The starters (raw scallops and the hens egg & autumn mushrooms were great but we both felt our mains (duck and pork neck) were a bit heavy handed and perhaps a little rustic. Not really a criticism of the food per se but at over ¬£30 for a main alone our expectations were very high.

Wine list is much more sensible than its contempories and one can drink well for ¬£50 per bottle which is about the average price on the list.

In summary good food but not great value. a two course lunch option for around ¬£35 a head would have have left us feeling more positive about our experience.
Amazing food at The Portland, many vegetarian options. Service really nice.

Went for dinner here with my boyfriend for my birthday - and loved it. Gorgeous relaxed atmosphere, amazing waitress who was charming and funny and really added to our night, food which was surprising and delightful, and seriously good wine (and off-menu espresso martinis...).
We had monkfish & deer for our main courses and they were both mouthwateringly good - but also came with a range of flavour which made them special.
We splurged and our bill was pricey but it was also really high quality food & drink in a relaxed, unpretentious atmosphere. Loved it.

The menu is pretty short, but once you've eaten there you realise it's one of those where you'd happily order any of it because it's all delicious. Inventive without being overly experimental, personal and attentive without being intrusive. Highly recommended.
Amazing food and wine. Will certainly return very soon.

From the moment we arrived everything was outstanding, everyone was friendly and so helpful. Service was outstanding. Loved all the little extras, from shots, to bread amd oils, to even blankets and hot water bottles.  Would 100% come back and would recommend. 5*... we had such a nice experience that after receiving bad service from another restaurant we got a taxi back here to enjoy the rest of the night!

Started with cocktails in the bar followed by Champagne Afternoon Tea.
Beautiful hotel with a lovely ambiance.
Staff were friendly and attentive and keen to deliver a great customer experience.
The sandwiches were plentiful and tasted wonderful. Scones tasted fresh and delicious. Selection of cakes, all tasted amazing!
Served by Alex who was brilliant. Nothing was too much for him and all served professionally with finesse.
Our afternoon was enhanced by the lovely piano music coming from the lobby.
We will definitely be retuning.
Outstanding service in a beautiful setting. Perfect balance of savoury and sweet, immaculately presented with a theatrical fare. No better afternoon tea in London.

The most beautiful well thought out experience with the most wonderful customer experience. You‚Äôre made to feel safe and at ease in your surroundings. The staff and friendly, polite and professional and exceptionally attentive. I plan on bringing others to experience the most elegant afternoon tea I have ever experienced.

My partner and I made a reservation for Afternoon Tea at the Corinithia during our short stay in London. It was our first time partaking in this tradition and we enjoyed the service so much. It will be a memory we have for a lifetime. The ambiance of the hotel made us feel relaxed and while sophisticated the staff were very warm and welcoming. Every detail was considered and the presentation was beautiful. Of course, every bite was also delicious and our tea was perfect. Thank you for an exceptional experience!

We had a really lovely experience, the food and setting was amazing. The service and attention to detail was the best and it really was a real treat for my sister who we were celebrating pregnancy and the extra touch of the celebration cake really made the experience extra special. The chicken tikka sandwich was our favourite. The crystal room was beautiful and would recommend whole heartily as an excellent afternoon tea.

Absolutely amazing. Not only was the setting beautiful but everything on the menu was so tasty. Credit to the chef. The waiters etc were superb and always there if you need anything. Will be coming again! 10 stars!!

Polished afternoon tea experience in elegant surroundings. Service is warm, friendly and informative, but greater attention to refreshing the tea regularly (a critical part of the afternoon tea experience!) would have been appreciated.
Will recommend. Great food and atmosphere.
Everything was so great, attentive service and the scones were just amazing, best afternoon tea I have had so far.

My mum and I had a lovely afternoon tea at The Corinithia. All of the sandwiches were delicious and the cakes fantastic, both in terms of taste and presentation. The value for money with the afternoon tea was excellent, we were unable to finish all the cakes and were given a nice little box to take them home in. The tea selection was very varied and the staff were happy to recommend ones.

The service was excellent, couldn't fault it.

The venue itself is very bright and well decorated. Even on a cold winter's day, we felt like we were in a conservatory in a warm country.

Highly recommended.

Lovely venue and attentive staff. We had the afternoon tea wth scones. These ver very nice - however they could have made each scone of a varied variety - however they were all the same - hence the value was only fair. Not sure if I would go back unless there was a deal.

Afternoon tea was very pleasant. Sandwiches and cakes were good. Service very friendly and professional. Maybe because the hotel is relatively new, there were mostly business customers in the hotel, and not many people for afternoon tea/drinks. I think in coming years the ambiance will improve with a more mixed clientelle. It has all the ingredients to be a place to see and be seen.
Everything would have been perfect, however, the distance between tables for two people is far too small, its basically a table for 4 with strangers
Location top, food very good  but waiters not kind at all!!
Very bad service, our order came in after 2 hours, the steak was overcooked and my sister who had lobster after 1 hour got sick. üò´
Just always love the happy positive vibe of this restaurant. Service is always very friendly and the food always meets expectations.
Thanksgiving dinner in London.  34 Mayfair got it right.  Fantastic experience.  Loved the place
Smart New York style restaurant in Mayfair. Not cheap but worth it if you're in the mood.
No nonsense fine fayre in an elegant Mayfair dining room.
Fantastic food and attentive friendly staff. Excellent place to eat. Will return as soon as I get a chance.
Experience etrange

lovely pre-theatre pasta dinner cooked fresh and served promptly on a quiet early evening. Good menu choice, good quality of food, everything clean and well presented. A consistent high quality experience.

Great staff, all of them were fantastic. There was an error with our booking, but they squeezed us in. The food was huge portions and really nice.  The restaurant is an authentic style Italian restaurant. The pizzas were great, with a base to die for.

After being shown to a table awkwardly placed at the top of the steps we asked for a different one. We were offered one in the window which was much larger and obviously being saved for a larger party but we appreciated the extra space. Staff were very helpful.thoroughly enjoyable start to an evening at the theatre. Thank you

This is the 2nd time I've been to Sergios with clients, good food, good service (Cheeky Chappy waiter) and good atmosphere. I had the special, Swordfish and king prawns, really enjoyed it. we asked the waiter to recommend the wine and he didn't go for the most expensive and it was very good. I will go again. well worth a visit!

Had a sociable lunch with a client at Sergio's. They were pleased with the friendly casual atmosphere and genuine Italian staff. I had the king prawn linguine again which was terrific. Wouldn't hesitate to return for a lunch or evening meal. The only point I would say is that it would be nice to be served freshly baked bread, the standard rolls were on the dry side.
Fantastic dinner. Try the artichoke salad, baked tagliolini, and vanilla meringue cake. Highly recommend!

From start to finish it was exceptional.
One of the diners asked for a recommendation from our server and the depth of knowledge and the way it was delivered was excellent. We weren‚Äôt rushed but weren‚Äôt left hanging around. Food quality was outstanding. Every plate was cleared. Can‚Äôt commend the staff enough.

Cipriani best known as C London is by all means the best experience of Italian food you will ever have in London. The chef is from New York's Cipriani, who undoubtedly put his soul into every bit of his marvelous creations.
I won't not write a lot because Cipriani is amazing , but I just want to say one thing- Bellini in this place is a BIG must. And, oh, don't forget their famous Meringue Vanilla cake!

Great Welcome, food and ambiance!
Service went overboard with our water being topped up every 2 minutes - there is excellent & attentive service and there is trying too hard.....

Seemed like a nice atmosphere, seemed inviting. We asked for a 125ml of wine and we‚Äôre served a 175ml (unknowingly) only noticing once the bill had arrived. The starter was disgraceful. What was described as a salad was in fact a bowl of blended fresh tomatoes with a strip of cucumber and a ball of mozzarella which was spreadable (yuk). Then the main came which was the ravioli.. Luke warm, was swimming in a watered down cheap gravy & looked like 3 wet pancakes. Tasted what can only be described as the inside of a Greggs corned beef pasty. And then to top it off added a service charge of almost ¬£9! Wrong serving of wine, didn‚Äôt ask us once if we needed anything/if it was nice during the meal, food was a shambles. The worst place we‚Äôve ever eaten - globally.
Amazing good and service! A firm favourite. Recommend it if you are looking for the personal touch and authentic Venetian food
4 th time here. Twice sufficiently good and twice below average. Unreliable. Will not go again.
Great service and the most fantastic mozzarella aubergine!
As always, food and service were excellent. We will be back again soon!

Our first visit but will certainly go again.
Excellent in every respect and perfect for us pre concert at Wigmore Hall. Extensive menu, all dishes well presented and service quietly efficient and unfussy but helpful.
Very pleasant ambience, we didn't expect to find an oasis so close to Oxford Street but very pleased we did. We were made to feel very welcome.
We will certainly return on our occasional visits to London.
Good value too, quality worth paying for.

Good West End Italian with authentic food and wine. Staff and service excellent. I have been here 3 times since it was recommended to me and it seems to get better and better which is why I suspect it is always full of regulars.
Ideal post-Wigmore Hall recital lunch or dinner venue. Agreeable, fun and attentive service produces excellent food and tenders a good wine list.  And no waiting for the bill - what a change!

An excellent meal and really good service, the food was first rate and i would not hesitate to recommend this restaurant. Due to a family illness i could not return the next day for dinner, however the next time i am in london i will be returning

Our party of four enjoyed dinner at this restaurant. We all managed to find something to eat that was well prepared, nicely present and delicious. Service was friendly, attentive, but unobtrusive, we were able to chat all night without interruption. We enjoyed a good bottle of reasonably priced wine.
very typical high end Italian experience. Knowledgeable staff and good fresh food. Service a little tardy and prices a little too high for lunchtime

Food is upscale northern Italian, but the atmosphere is casual and welcoming.  The owner greets and remembers the guests. Try the lamb ravioli - delicate and flavorful.  I live in NYC where I have my choice of upscale restaurants and I travel often to London.  Every time I am in the UK I dine at 2 Veneti.

We were all pleasantly surprised by our experience at 2 Veneti! The food and the service were top notch... I would go back today! Would I recommend it as a business meal venue? Not necessarily as the ambience seemed more suited to a romantic night out, but we all had a great time! You'd be happy to note that my flatmate has decided to go with her boyfriend for a meal after listening to me go on about it ;-)

It wasn‚Äôt the experience we expected at all!

The starters were nice but the main dishes and the desert weren‚Äôt at the level of a Micheline star restaurant! The chicken was tasteless with a soggy skin on. The prawns weren‚Äôt exceptional. The noodles were bland. The cream br√ªl√©e was very runny, the crunch was soggy and of a poor taste with chocolate powder dumbed onto it.

Sitting in the basement was stuffy and the staff were quite arrogant. The whole experience was unpleasant and not worth the cost associated with it.

We don‚Äôt recommend this restaurant, I am afraid!
Amazing birthday celebrations! Great service and food was yummy

One of the best afternoon teas in London! Food was delicious and imaginative. Great selection of teas. Presentation was impeccable and fun. Highly recommended for an afternoon tea experience different from the traditional scons and sandwiches.

Had a Saturday Brunch here last Saturday. My friend and I enjoyed it a lot. The food was delicious and we got to try a lot of different tastes. The startes were really good, so many different dishes. The main courses were already a little too much because of the so many starters, but still outstanding! We loved the dessert, so yummie and so good!!
Service was really nice and professional, but not too formal which is good, because it feels comfortable instead of too stiff.
Overall a very nice time here, been here already a few times before, but the first time for my friend and she likes it too :)
Best restaurant in London (and I've been to some special restaurants). Must try the Wasabi Prawns.
Both food and service were excellent. Our server was both professional, delightful, knowledgeable and very caring about a food allergy.

The food was seductive, the service was attentive, the food was delicious, the Qi needs a shot but did i mention the food is delightful.
The restaurant on the day was missing the charm of a maitre de however the food was to die for
Having not been to the restaurant since the 90 s i was surprised the decor had not had a makeover even though the texture of the surfaces continue to offer new discoveries the food is still a wondefrfull surprise
We had the lunch menu, the food was okay but I wouldn't say that it was a Michelin star standard. There was nothing special about the dishes.

We went out for fine dining. And booked a table at what we were told was Londons top Asian restaurant.

Have never been so disappointed at a restaurant before.

No service, the wine served after the meal was half eaten.

Go somewhere else.

I took the famiy (six of us) for lunch during the Olympics - the ambience was excellent, service was good althogh we did have to ask for our jasmine tea to be topped up once, food was superb expecially the lobster.

One minor point - service of 12.5% was then followed by an open credit card charge for gratuities. For a Michelin starred restaurant, surely this is uncalled for, after a service charge has been applied? You see this in pretentious Chinatown restaurants, but tihs was unexpected here

Not your traditional Chinese restaurant. Very elegant, novel menu with a contemporary flare. All in all, a delightful, romantic dinner for my wife and myself. Drinks were small and expensive - the only flaw in an otherwise lovely evening.

Great place friendly staff, a few order hiccups but rectified without even the need to complain and also gave us their signature dish free - very good.

Really good lunch menu, great value, quality and selection particularly with accompanying wines. Will definitely return.

Kai Mayfair, London is a great restaurant. I took my husband to Kai on Valentines Day and we had a fantastic time. The ostrich was my favourite dish, it was really tasty. My husband had the Wasabi Prawns as a starter and he really liked this too.

KIA IS THE MOST EXPENSIVE CHINESE RESTAURANT I HAVE BEEN TO IN LONDON. FOOD WAS GOOD BUT NOT SPECIAL, THE SERVICE ATTENTIVE AND THE AMBIENCE FROM OUR TABLE RIGHT IN THE MIDDLE OF RESTAURANT ONLY OK. WINES ARE VERY EXPENSIVE AND THE FIRST 2 I PICKED WERE DIFFERENT YEARS FROM THE LIST.  NOT VALUE FOR MONEY AND WOULDN'T RETURN.

Enjoyed the music and atmosphere however the food was off the mark for us. We love fusion but we felt that there‚Äôs a lot better around the area within the same price bracket.

Would go again but wouldn‚Äôt rush back.
Lovely place to catch up with friends or business. Great bite size sharing food, not a place for a romantic dressed meal.
Fantastic food and great staff - will be visiting again

The food was delicious! The service started with a very pushy waitress that was very off-putting. While we appreciate a recommendation, she came off as pushy, and ordering for us what she thought we wanted. This combined with the fact that the we felt as though she was trying to speed us through the meal, made us all have a negative experience.

The food, which we decided on, was ultimately very good, and the sommelier recommended a delicious and appropriate bottle of wine for our meal!
Grossly overpriced, most dishes anonymous, service keen but amateurish

Highly recommended
Everything was amazing
Would definitely recommend!

Very rude staff, from the beginning to the end.
Would not come back at all.
Great service

Brilliant service
Tasty food
Nice atmosphere
The waiter kojo was very helpful
Great meal service
Food excellent, badly let down by service. Don't mind casual don't like when it becomes sloppy and borderline of arrogant.

The food was generally good but we booked specifically to have a wine match with the tasting menu which we couldn't have. There were lots of extras in the bill which weren't described to us prior .
There was a lack of atmosphere albeit it was an early dinner at 6.30pm.
For the price I think there were other options around Covent Garden that I would have booked
The atmosphere is great with seasonal selection of food choices.
Overrated and overpriced. Nice atmosphere and surroundings but not worth the cost.
Nice location for a pre dinner show with a delicious and well Served main.
Stunning food and beautiful little courtyard that its situated in. Wine was also delicious.

We loved the restaurant and the food.The only thing I would say is the lighting outside,there isn‚Äôt any except a candle on the table.Would be helpful to see what your eating,even if it‚Äôs just subtle.
Just amazing!!! Five of us had traveled from all over the UK to meet up. The whole experience was absolutely wonderful!!!!

We found the Petersham (eventually) in a beautiful courtyard filled with trees draped with Christmas lights. The interior was pleasant, but relatively spartan compared to the very idiosyncratic and busy design of the Petersham Nursery in Richmond. We seemed to be in a slightly draughty area, I was cold. My Scallop Crudo (cold, with Navel orange) was superb. The John Dory was very well cooked and tasty but it, and the accompanying polenta, were bordering on the lukewarm. My Raspberry and Almond Tart with Mascarpone was very nice but fairly standard.  Our main issue was with the service. Our staff were helpful and obliging but underskilled, leaning across people to put cutlery and dishes down, slow to top up drinks, and the worst offence - carrying soup to the table with a thumb over the edge of the bowl, which seemed very amateurish. Our booking was a Monday night so maybe we had the B team, but it's quite an expensive restaurant and I hoped for more.
Disappointing food in great venue. My son  had  a fabulous meal the night before so I might have been unlucky.

Unfortunately our experience wasn‚Äôt great. We had been recommended the Petersham by a chef friend and so had high expectations. The service was dreadful it took 10 minutes to get a menu , the food came out literally 5 minutes after we ordered ( felt like we were in a Mc Donald‚Äôs) and wasn‚Äôt worth the money and the wine list was 100% Italian ( weird for a non regional restaurant) and boring. The saving grace was the male sommelier who was very attentive. We tried to give feedback at the end of the meal but were provided with an obligatory smile and a  sentence ‚Äò I will transfer to my manager!‚Äô For an e pensive restaurant the whole experience was rather disappointing, thankfully a post drink at Kettners Champagne Bar saves the night.
really niceÔºÅcheap and deliciousÔºÅ
Felt rushed. Run out of coke. Missed 3 orders sent over ipad.

I booked the afternoon sushi and while they were very nice, we still had to order some more food as it wasn't enough for 2. Unless you use the deals and offers, I would say the prices are quite high. great atmosphere and fun games at the table while you wait.
Really nice place with friendly atmosphere. Interactive table were fun and enjoyable.  Service was fast and helpful . Our first visit and it was worth it . Definitely back

expensive but definitely worth it. Had few few times meal here and it always nice.The waiters are really friendly and reassuring. We explained it was our first time and they were very informative and polite.
Friendly staff and excellent  sushi and tapas. Can't wait to go back again !!!
such good value for money with ultimate sushi offer .The staff are lovely and accomdating too! Thank you !!!
The service was poor, quite rude. Ordered a variety off their menu and didn‚Äôt like any of it apart from the sushi. Would only recommend the sushi
Good as previous visit !!! Great atmosphere and we will  definitely  back soon
Manager was rude and we waited 45 minutes for one of the items of food to come
Not Impressed!  Ok for a gimmick restaurant, however went there to eat and the food was below average.
