Absolutely brilliant experience! The service is simply fast and helpful.Food was delicious and  interactive table was nice concept. Strongly recommended
The service was good and there were some nice options for vegetarians and vegans. Interactive table were fun and enjoyable.
Simple, elegant and enjoyable
Good friendly atmosphere with nice food .  Location is perfect for hang out with friends.

The food is good and though the menu is not huge, all items are well. I would argue that it is slightly on the expensive side but service is really good . You should expect at least spending ¬£35 per head which is slightly more then average.

Nice atmosphere very good staff, and good sashimi ,Tapas and wonderful cocktails. Enjoyed every bite. Can't wait till I visit again. Tip: make sure you book before you go and ask if you don‚Äôt understand about ordering system. Staff is always there to help you

The food taste wise is great, would highly recommend if you want great sushi and do not mind waiting. The service however is quite bad considering it was not that busy when we were there. We ordered a few plates to share first and then decided if we wanted more we would order more. The food took so long to come out (they give you a limit of an hour and a half there as soon as you are seated at your table to order, eat and then leave within that time frame), there were probably only about 6 other tables as well as ours and we was quite swift at ordering. The way that you order is relatively efficient as it is done on an interactive tablet, so you can call the waiter/waitress from the click of a button and they do arrive swiftly, but nothing can be done for how long it takes your food to arrive.  The interactive table was fun as you could play games to pass the time, but not all of the controllers worked properly. The place itself is very nicely decorated, and you do get service with a bit of a smile. It is very clean and they were quick seating us when we came through the door - no wait for that, but again it was not that busy. Service charge was automatically added onto the bill as expected in London, obviously we paid it as although we did not receive the best customer service, felt too awkward no to pay it. Normally we would of left a tip if the food didn't take so long, and if the waiters/waitresses were a bit more friendly; we felt a bit like we were bothering them when we asked for more water/drinks etc..
The service was very slow and not attentive.  Food was ok but not worth the price unless you book a special offer.

We were told to wait in the bar downstairs until our table was ready, waited 25 minutes and no one came to get us so eventually went upstairs where we had to wait another 10 minutes, even though we‚Äôd booked a table. Service was slow, food had to be sent back as it was cold. Disappointing considering how overpriced the food was. Bathroom facilities were very unclean. Would definitely not recommend this place.
Thank you for my surprise birthday wishes! So lovely and seeing as noone in my family arranged a surprise I was so grateful the staff of the restaurant did :)
Food was dissappointing and expensive for what it was.

The food was lovely BUT we went specifically for the Table Service Technology. Unfortunately it wasnt working properly and even after a request to reset the projection it remained the same. The games were not great and it didnt entertain as anticipated. All in all Inamo we were dissappointed with our experience.
Not as good as previous times. Drinks very slow. Menu seemed to have shrunk.....best way to describe inamo now. Wagamamas with a fancy table. Sorry!

Absolutely fantastic evening! Came here after my partner went a few months ago and wanted to come back for his birthday.Delicious food served by attentive and  very polite Manager. Defeneatlly come back again with friends and family

They lost a few of our orders but enjoyed the food and time we had playing at the table.  We felt the short table time shld be longer for tables of 4 or bigger.  We really enjoyed the eve though - great idea !

The food was good, interactive tables don‚Äôt work very well and to charge service when you order your own food on an iPad and it just gets dumped on your table is a liberty ! Would never go again - better off going to proper Chinese in china town 3 minutes down the road !!

I had a wonderful evening with my bestfriend, for her birthday. The restaurant gave us a birthday promotion for which we received free drinks on arrival and a free dessert of our choice, which was brought in by the staff with sparklers. It was a magical night and we had so much fun with the interactive tables. Also I really like the fact that we can order through ipads and it had an image of the dishes next to it which made it a lot easier deciding what to buy. Additionally, it made calling the waiter a lot easier as you can press a button on the ipad to call them for the bill or for any other reason.
The only downside to the restaurant was that they have a ¬£15 charge for bringing in birthday cakes which I think is unreasonable as most restaurants I've been to in the past are okay with bringing cakes in. I hope that they can change this policy in the future.

Not like the website. Extremely slow service, almost annoyed at our presence. The absolute rudest hostess I have ever met. First person in the restaurant was abrasive, should've known then. Food was small, half the dishes were not available. Prices did not match the quality of tbe food. Not one good thing from this experience. We left and got food elsewhere. Just light your money on fire and starve, and then insult yourself. Same experience.
Cool to have the interactive tables - made the feel fun and entertaining

Staff were rude. Told that we had a time limit on the table after arrival, having made a booking, and also scolded for having an item on the table during a demonstration for the projector. A little pleasantry would do well.
Experience is ok. Food average. Service not great, when you send the order via the tablet it takes 10min to be approved by waiter and then being sent to the kitchen

Having been to the other Inamo, this one is nothing in comparison. Food was good but the restaurant itself is lacking and it's a shame that the same table interactive options are not available here like they are at the other venue.
Staff asked us about 10 times in 30 mins if we wanted more drinks when we had ordered them on the ipad...as is the point of having them in the first place.

I've been to inamo Soho and St James before, and the food is simply outstanding. The sushi is just gorgeous & the fish is always fresh & melts-in-the-mouth. The spicy aubergine is always terrific, baby crispy prawns are a personal favourite and the burgers were incredible too - which for a Asian restaurant is no mean feat. I love the new beef tataki and the spicy edamame was a treat. The negatives - I wasn't wowed by the chicken satay (which I normally am) and I think the hot stone ribeye was good, but our stone went cold quickly and it took quite a long time to bring a new one. However, the staff were lovely although they were busy getting to grips with the new technology. Inamo has changed from ordering through the tables to an tablet based system, and there are a few teething problems but nothing that can't be sorted during their soft launch period - and nothing that a few cocktails couldn't solve (although we did have to wait for one round of cocktails for what felt like quite a long time!).

The restaurant is too opulent and doesn‚Äôt reflect the Spanish food‚Äôs soul.
The cheesecake could improve.
Paella was 10/10.
Beef cheek was 10/10.
Ceviche 10/10.
From start to finish the service from staff was excellent. The restaurant ambience is spot on with a sense of being in a very smart Paris eatery. Food was superb!

Good food, a bit noicy. Not cheap.
Easy access. Good location.
I hosted our Company Holiday dinner for 21! Flawless and delicious! Thank you.
Consistently high quality French cooking in the heart of Mayfair. Staff are professional but friendly.
Every course was served at the proper temperature and time. The leek and potato soup and the sea bass were both memorable.  The lemon tart was very unusual and very tangy. We will definitely return.

Good food, although unexceptional- it is an upmarket brasserie. We asked to be moved from the basement level, as the smell of dampness was overpowering. The staff were very quick and accommodating in moving us to the first floor, which was charming.
We had lunch at the restaurant last Tuesday and it was delicious, second time there and it was as good as the first time.  Highly recommended.
Consistently good and reasonably priced for Mayfair

Have been to Le Boudin Blanc several times now. The food has always been cooked to a good standard. Service has also always been polite and efficient on all visits. The 'Stand Out' feature of this restaurant is the atmosphere. It has a very good buzz to it. It is nearly always full which is testament to peoples liking of this place. On the downside, the tables are a quite small and in some areas you can feel a little squeezed in. It can also be very dark inside and difficult to read the menu (if you are getting on a bit). Overall I rate this place a must visit, for the atmosphere alone.
I went for a business lunch and found the food as gorgeous as the staff is pleasant and attentive to our needs. Would definitely come back again and recommend it.

The night I went (a Wednesday) it was packed to the point that it felt just a little too overcrowded, but that seems to be the nature of this restaurant. The food was okay, nothing special, although the moules and French fries were really good. I found the meat undercooked for my liking, and the tables just a little too close together, so much so that I unfortunately knocked over a jug of water on the next table whilst trying to squeeze to my seat. I should like to return at lunchtime when I am quite certain the restaurant will be more conducive to eating. Also I found the noise level unbearable - not music, just too many people crammed into too small a space.
LM

I cant rate this place highly enough - beautiful decor, impeccable service and a wonderful menu - I wanted to try it all.  The celariac carpaccio was to die for as was the aubergine bacon in the caesar salad - very innovative menu - all delivered immaculately and bursting with flavour.  Very good value for money - would recommend to vegans or carnivores .
Lovely server. Beautiful food. Reasonably priced for great quality.

I went to Christopher‚Äôs on Sunday for brunch I arrived at 3.04pm for my 3pm booking and waiting for 15 mins to be seated. The seating area was not well presented - especially cleanliness. The food was good. French toast was really good (saved my experience). We had to send drinks back as the glasses were dirty. Service was not the best tbh.
Great food, great atmosphere, lovely decor. Affordable. Woman on reception not the friendliest! But staff inside are lovely.
Top notch. Always a delight- never been disappointed
Went To try their French toast which was great! Will go again
Excellent service, ambiance and food - I will definitely be returning!

Food was lovely but the dessert was overcooked. Drinks and burgers were nice. Such a shame that the steaks are no longer halal. It was the main reason we were frequent diners here. Also we miss the superfood salad.

Really enjoyed my pre theatre dinner at Christopher's. Food was absolutely fabulous for the price and the wine our server chose to pair alongside went down treat we found it was pricey vs the the food. Would definitely return.
Really enjoyable food excellent
Lovely restaurant in a superb setting. We had a table with a view. Good service and food.
The whole experience is perfect, every time I visit.
Not worth the money. Service was quite slow and no real atmosphere
Awesome simply awesome one of my favourite treats in London
Amazing place to have a lovely brunch I had gone to celebrate a friends birthday the only downfall was that they spelt her name wrong on the birthday plate

I found it expensive for the food, there wasn't much flavour to what we got , definitely paying for the location but they are nicer places to eat in covent garden, it would be good for a group of people going good for a work dinner, there were two of those groups there, it isn't a place to go if you want to try nice food ....... a poor choice but I just didn't know, it looked nice in the pics but .... shrug .....
Outstanding food, exceptional service and immaculate surroundings. Quite expensive but such a lovely treat especially for a special occasion!
The whole evening was great from first having pre dinner cocktails to drinking  after dinner cocktails the food was spot on and the service from our waitress simply perfect well donebxnd thank you

This is a great venue the bar is brilliant for a nice drink with out too much noise and the ambience is good.  The food is always good whether that be for dinner or for brunch.  the upstairs room is beautiful and the food and service is fantastic

We had an amazing meal. It was a special occasion for my wife's birthday her favourite steak had been taken off menu! Disaster!
Luckily the amazing waiters and chefs sorted out the steak for me.
We always have an exellent meal at Christophers and visit as much as we can.

By a country mile, my favourite restaurant in London. I was there for my girlfriends birthday and we dined on the post-theatre menu having been to see Matilda earlier in the evening. Fantastic service, fantastic value and the food is truly amazing. Go and visit this place!
Amazing food and service. A little smile and thanks from the reception below when we left would have been nice. Otherwise very good

Review would have been better if me and my counterpart did not suffer from a upset stomach after the meal. For what the meal cost would have expected something above average instead of the standard level that you can get in pretty much any average restaurant.

Went for Sunday brunch and loved it immediately: Christopher's dining room is on the first floor of a grand classicist building - and the interior is the perfect combination of minimalism and elegance. The food is absolutely lovely: healthy, creative, wonderful. Ask for the special menu if you have allergies/ intolerances.
Lovely restaurant. Good food - although two people ordered lobster and one got far more fish than the other!

Had dinner for the first time at Christopher's, thoroughly enjoyed the food and the wine menu was excellent!

The restaurant has a nice feel to it, it gives the ambience of an exclusive restaurant in London, without the stuffiness, we were made to feel welcome and the service was great.

I really enjoyed the menu, a nice selection of dishes (including vegetarian!), just enough to choose from without overwhelming you. We had 3 courses, wine and beers, I was surprised by how good value the bill was at the end, I expected it to be higher!

All the courses were delicious and the service was attentive without being obtrusive.

My only moan would be that we were sat at a table by the door into the restaurant. Being a cold winter evening, rainy and windy, every time the main doors on the ground floor were opened a great gust of cold air blew into the restaurant on the first floor. We were there for a good couple of hours and it did become quite annoying. I didn't complain at the time as I was having dinner with a friend I hadn't seen for some time, but it is certainly something that needs addressing, at least for winter!!

Will certainly be returning.

Lunch with 3 friends to celebrate a special occasion & Christopher's was the perfect choice.  Great setting and ambience.  The bar & cocktail menu is brilliant.  The choice of food, from the set menu to a la carte, was comprehensive and the quality was fab.  The staff were all friendly and clearly well trained.  No request was too much trouble and they were attentive, but never intrusive.  Christopher's is a great restaurant and I'd recommend dining there any day.  I'll definitely go back - the desserts were to die for and the presentation was amazing.

Christopher's has very quickly risen up to become my preferred steak eatery, even over Gaucho. The wagu beef is superb and the posh fries to die for! Even the Sunday brunch is one of the best in London. Very much recommended.

Helpful staff both in the bar downstairs and the restaurant. We came for Sunday brunch - surprisingly extensive menu and the scrambled eggs and smoked salmon were fresh and delicious. Will definitely be back for more brunch and would like to try the restaurant at a different time, probably one evening

¬£16 for two courses of high quality food in the heart of the West End is clearly a good deal. Service was slick and friendly and the range of choices for the set menu more than adequate. Wine list is also remarkably reasonable. My only complaint would be that the restaurant was all but empty at 6pm - clearly there is a lot of competition around for the pre-theatre crowd, but Christopher's deserves more custom than this. Give it a try!
Great pre-theatre menu - efficient  and pleasant service - no stress to get to the theatre on time!
Had a very nice meal at Christopher's in Covent Garden.  We chose a pre-theatre menu but everyone was happy with the food.
A wonderf meal, the vegetarian selection was varied and wide. We were served quickly and efficiently. Highly recommend.

Visited Christophers in Covent Garden for lunch. The restaurant had a good atmosphere - mainly business people but had a good lively feel .The food was very good and the staff were friendly - althought not sure that suggesting mash potato as a side dish with risotto was particularly helpful! Will definitely visit again.
Christopher's in London Aldwych was a wonderful restaurant.  The food was wonderful, the staff friendly and professional and the overall effect very relaxing. We would definitely go back.
A great light, airy room, perfect on a sunny day.  The pre-theatre menu was a very good deal, the portions weren't immense but fair enough for the price and a speedy meal.

Christophers, 18 Wellington Street.

As ever the menu was wide ranging and the food excellent. I will always recommend this great restaurant.

Food was nice, although some portions were on the small side such as the figs starter. Dessert option of Panna Cotta was slightly unexpected in the sense that it was not the traditional shape and instead presented as a slice in a more "nouvelle cusine" fashion, but was pleasant nonetheless!

Service was appalling at Christophers despite the restaurant only having 4 tables of diners. We booked for 7pm but were made to wait 20mins by reception for a table whilst the couple behind us went through almost immediately. When our bill arrived they failed to deduct 25% off the bill. We requested the bill to be split 3 ways but our waitress failed to comply. Our waitress was totally disinterested throughout our meal. The food was tasty but the meal was spoilt by the lack of service.

We had the pre theatre menu at Christopher's.  The salad starter was exactly as described and tasted good - although a little boring.  The chicken main was delicious, the steak was very tough but another was bought immediately.  Despite the pre theatre package the cost of the meal was still v expensive, due to a couple of glasses of wine!

I have not visited Christophers since it's refurb.and  I remember it being particularly good with a blackened tuna dish.This time no tuna.The service I found to be too quick.If I was going on somewhere it would have been acceptable but this question was never asked so I had the impression of just moving you as fast as possible so the table could be used again.Not now on my list of retun to restaurants.
Christopher's was lovely, the blackened steak was fantastic and the portion sizes generous.  The toptable deal is great and I would definitely return.
This is my boyfriends favourite restaurant because of the steak - I wasn't dissapointed! Food was amazing and the service perfect. It's a posh steakhouse with all the favourites but done with class!
Good access to station, service was friendly and food was nice.
Excellent menu, lovely food, great service and lovely atmosphere. Will definitely return.
Nice setting and good food. Portions are large so I left rather full but I was probably greedy going for three courses at lunch. Service was good and staff happy and friendly.

Great local Italian in the heart of London. Friendly service, wonderful authentic Italian food and a great location combine to make this the prefect place for a catch up over supper with a girl friend. Definitely recommend. Set meal wonderful value with lots of choice and the specials are wonderful

The pros:
- With the TopTable deal the meal is not bad value
- Delicious Prosecco
- Really generous portions. The avocado,mozzarella and tomato salad was plentiful and tasty
The cons:
- The service was not good. We did not feel welcome here, it might have been different had we been dining a la carte but perhaps as we were on the deal they weren't too fussed.
- A few delusions of grandeur. 'Lemonata' on the menu (¬£2.95) was sprite, which is ok but call it sprite as it sounded like it should've been real lemonade.
- food unexceptional (although big portions)
Lovely atmosphere and food. Would recommend any day.
The Da Paolo was very convenient if you were shopping in the west end or meeting centrally after work.

Da Paolo, London
Very attentive staff. The food was excellent and also the wine. Good ambience, small and cosy with nice decorations in the walls.
Great food and atmosphere
Loved it! We even got given free limoncellos at the end of the meal. :o)
Great host, great staff & great food. Would def recommend the mixed seafood platter

Service appalling , food outrageously priced and mediocre, A wobbly table on a pavement with people almost knocking your drinks over as they walk by is not a terrace !!! Apart from a tiny bottle of hand sanitizer on the table absolutely no social distancing procedures or processes.
Overbooked and left 20 people standing in the cold for 30 minutes

I would recommend Balthazar any other day than Valentine's. It was loud, gaudy, and the musician only got louder until we couldn't hear each other speak. Not a good gimmick - and hopefully next year it is discarded.
Great ambiance, superb food and very good service. Noisy and bustling , just what you need for a festive meal out. Good for families.
Deuxi√®me fois que nous y mangeons,  excellente brasserie,  id√©alement situ√©e √† qq minutes √† peine des com√©dies musicales
The almond waffles are perfect but the eggs florentine are not filling. Still recommend for brunch
Maitre d deserves a great shout out - gave us my favourite table! Staff were brilliant. Food delicious as ever. I‚Äôll keep coming back!

My daughter‚Äôs birthday. Everything was perfect except because the woman who host at the entrance, she bad manners to us, I‚Äôm a regular customer and I‚Äôve always loved to go there and generally the people who work there is very kind.
Warm welcome, reservation perfectly fulfilled ,  friendly and efficient service,  great food, and good value. Five stars all the way.

No fresh flowers anymore?
Restrooms smells :c
Wobbly table
Lamphoods had burn spots or just plain broken.
Waiter and waitresses did their job. No sparkels No empathy no Balthazar flair.

So when I will visit London next time, there‚Äôs no must for dine at Balthazar, for me, anymore.

Halloween decorations outside were amazing üéÉ

Met family for a quick lunch in Covent Garden. The food was good and we enjoyed the busy lunchtime atmosphere.

Wouldn‚Äôt rush back, but would happily visit again if in the area.

It was our wedding anniversary. I had called ahead and asked for something to be done, I was assured that there would be a surprise waiting for us. We had dinner and dessert, the food was lovely. After that however our waitress disappeared and we waited a long time. Finally we asked someone else for the bill. While leaving we ran into her and she avoided us! I think there was something planned but she forgot to do it. Very disappointed. Really liked the food but would probably not go there again because of the service.
Beef Wellington. Done.
Lively buzzy atmosphere, though that makes it pretty loud too. Nice varied menu and reasonable wine list. Great place for pre/post-theatre
great Service. Service staff were fabulous. Food was decent but not up to the standard I‚Äôd expect for the price, however it was an enjoyable visit and the restaurant setting is nice.
Rack of Lamb is delish, but the super helpful and friendly staff makes this place a winner !
The usual lovely food and ambiance I expect when I go there. Never lets me down.

Always a pleasure.  One of the best value restaurants in London as the food is always amazing yet not inexpensive compared to other restaurants of similar quality.  The service is also impeccable.  I have gone back time and time again and will continue to.

Loved it. Nice choices. We all enjoyed our meal.
Wine list a little on pricey side.

Very welcoming and accommodating throughout. Staff all lovely and friendly, we didn't have any requirements but got the feeling that nothing would be too much trouble. Very relaxed environment, didn't feel rushed at all. Service was great and the food was very good. Wasn't wowed but left very satisfied. Will definitely return and recommend to friends.

The restaurant was perfect, great ambience and good menu with authentic french flavour. onion soup is wonderful. Steak cooked to perfection. Service was with a smile and total can do attitude. It was just a perfect venue for my wife's birthday, pre-theatre dinner.
I am a frequent diner whenever I have guests in town. Service is always impeccable and the food never fails to impress. I will be back!!

I asked for a particular dish when booking and on arrival the waiter had the information to hand, confirmed we still wanted the dish and asked how we would like it served.  Brilliant service.  Definitely going again.

We went to have a late dinner on Friday after the theatre as an special occasion. Despite We arrive earlier they seated us after a few minutes. We ordered the fixed menu and It was delicious. The waiter was really helpful and cheerful. It was a birthday party, so We pre-order one of the cakes. The waiter (sorry we don't remember the name) was really kind bringing the cake and wishing my partner happy birtday in our language (spanish).
We'll come back soon.
Great waiter, great food, great atmosphere! Especially appreciated the special touch of a birthday dessert. Thank you
Visited for one course post-theatre.  Warmly welcomed, efficient service, buzzy ambience.  This time the iconic duck shepherd's pie seemed to contain the full Jemima.
Very nice food, great atmosphere and beautiful music. I will come back.
Always enjoy my trips to Balthazar.  Good service - happy to let you take your time or if you need quick turnaround for theatre they can do that too.  Will be back.

This is a popular place most of the time, and Friday lunchtime was buzzing. The food was delicious... my snails meaty and garlicky, and a lovely skate wing to follow, with a delicious accompaniment. Prices are quite high for what is basically a bistro but you are part paying for the atmosphere.

Have been on a few occasions for lunch and have really enjoyed it.  Decided to book for breakfast and just wasn't as impressed.  The service, as always, was great. The staff are really friendly and the atmosphere is really buzzy.  The breakfast menu looks really good and perhaps I just ordered the wrong thing. I got the scrambled eggs on sourdough with crab. The crab was really tasty and so fresh, however, the scrambled eggs were poorly seasoned (or not seasoned) and could have done with a little more cooking as they were very wet, making the bread really soggy. I will not return for breakfast but still love this place for lunch and dinner.

My partner and I regularly dine here for Sunday brunch. We love the food and the restaurant itself, and have lost count of the lovely meals we have enjoyed. A firm favourite with friends when they visit, expect delicious food, a lively atmosphere and a good mimosa.

The avocado with poached eggs is my personal favourite, and my partner enjoys the full english breakfast. We have also had the pancakes which I would definitely recommend! Advise booking as this place is always busy, and if you can't get a table via open table definitely call, they have always accommodated my reservation request. Enjoy!

At 20.30 on a Tuesday we waited 5 minutes for the table. Buzzy atmosphere and dark decor reminiscent of the French bistro many look for but often fail to find in Paris.

Very limited veggie options. Kale, cranberry and nut starter well balanced. Gnocchi main was mixed: gnocchi itself was herbaceous and delicate but veg soggy and bland. Tremendously gooey chocolate fondant. Fellow diners content with snail starter, moules frites for mains.

Service was well executed by friendly front of house, except when they tried to give my new coat to another diner! The food arrived slower than liked.

Overall, we had a very pleasant experience thanks to the atmosphere and staff and the food was solid but did not exceed expectations.

Perhaps a bit unfair but we have been to Balthazar in New York on a couple of occasions and were expecting the same experience. Although the venue is similar in ambience and is very popular the most outstanding point was the great service; our server was fantastic, friendly but unobtrusive and very on the ball with all his tables. Unfortunately what let our experience down was some, not all of the food. Good chicken liver parfait starter and a very good cheeseplate and raspberry souffle. However, the duck confit was unremarkable and the lobster spaghetti was just wrong, very brothy with a distinct lack of flavour, very disappointing. We did not feel we received value for money on this occasion.
I dined hear on Tuesday it was fantastic the service was outstanding and the food was great too. I would recommend this restaurant to everyone travelling to London.
Nice meal. Wasn't busy when we went.

Sophisticated and yet very cozy atmosphere with excellent Japanese quality service (quiet but very attentive). Food is also beautifully refined with sure quality and simplicity of authentic modern Japanese. Kazu would be my favorite restaurant even if it was in the middle of Tokyo. If you want to have a REAL Japanese restaurant experience in London, this is the place!
Amazing food and wine. Went for the top end taster, worth it
A relaxing evening in beautiful surroundings with quietly attentive staff and superb food.
Fantastic food and wonderful service with an intimate setting.

Quirky, which suits us; service a good balance between friendly and professional. Food very good and wine choices appropriate. Weakest course was lamb, and the chosen red wine was not to our taste. But this all added to what was a very enjoyable experience overall.
This restaurant offers great food, beautiful room and excellent service.

We struggled to get to St James Hotel on New Years Day because of the parade but it was worth it. We were made very welcome and enjoyed an excellent lunch which was very good value. The wines were, as usual in London, expensive but we enjoyed their selection by the glass. We were not rushed and the lunch made our day.
food is amazing, service excellent, without being obtrusive, sommelier was great.

Excellent food and very good service. Attentive staff with good knowledge about food and drink. We were not entirely happy with one of the wine recommendations, but this was the only minor thing not meeting our full satisfaction.

I have been lucky enough to visit most of the fine venues in London and I can say hand on heart that this is the best I have visited so far - 100% on absolutely everything - I am amazed at this little gem!
another excellent lunch.the food and service were superb.thoroughly recommend.
We had lunch at Seven Park Place in London yesterday. Amazing food, the lobster risotto was just incredible for starter and really good value for money for the lunch menu. Can not wait to go back
Good food and service

We visited Seven Park Place (London) on Saturday night - we had the tasting menu with matched wines. The atmosphere and service was very good, and we thoroughly enjoyed the food and the wines chosen to compliment it.
I would recommend going to the bar beforehand for a drink if only to try the popcorn which is served with them!

Had a wonderful dinner at Seven Park Place.. Truly spectacular food served in intimate and lavish surroundings... Puddings,  bread and petit fours  were amazing too. Great place to meet foodie  friends as we did. We will definitely return for a romantic dinner... Luscious

An absolutely fantastic meal in beautiful surroundings.  Loved the decor.  The veal was cooked to perfection and the schnapps sorbet was gorgeous.  I would recommend the restaurant highly to anyone.  I just need another special occasion as an excuse to go back now!

Sat outdoors as a family although it was forecasted to rain, the restaurant was well equipped to keep their guests out of the rain with a good awning and side gates that were hung up as it started to rain. On my booking I noted that the reservation was for a birthday and they had prepared everything without me having to say anything apart from tell them who‚Äôs birthday it was! The service was top quality and was truly a fine dining experience. The menu had a large variety of hors d‚Äôouvres and was truly authentically Lebanese with a selection of Armenian dishes too. We ordered many of the small plates and had no space for mains which was a lovely experience to mix and match as well as share with everyone. Portion sizes were excellent. Not too small and very filling.

Food exactly as expected - good but pricey. The reason why I'm bothering to review is because other, earlier, reviewers have complained about the staff being rude, impatient etc. For our part, all the staff were exceptionally polite, friendly and helpful and al-Hamra remains a very pleasant place for lunch.
Loved the authentic cuisine, great location, polite friendly staff.
Lovely food! Atmosphere was nice, though a bit more lovely music or audible (was very quiet) would have been nice. Would absolutely recommend though!
Tasty! The pork and the alfajores were delicious!!
Food was fabulous and I've booked again to bring another friend on Saturday....The table was slightly too small for the number of dishes, but hey that hardly matters!
My first introduction to Peruvian cuisine. Our appetizers were delicious but main courses were Ok. We enjoyed the ambiance and the bar was cosy.
Delicious, beautiful presented, laid back, fun and experimental food! Thoroughly enjoyed every dish and can‚Äôt wait to go back and try more!

Having visited Lima in Dubai I was really disappointed by Lima London.
I called up before and said it was a special occasion for my friend's birthday. I specifically asked if we could also order from a la carte menu as opposed to just the set lunch menu as I was not particularly enamoured by the dishes on the lunch menu. I was told that wouldn't be a problem.
Unfortunately when we arrived at the restaurant we were told we could only order from the set lunch menu. The attempted justification was that there was some confusion among the staff and it wasn't even clear from the website. This is clearly something they need to sort out!
We continued with the food from the set menu. Although tasty, a lot of the dishes were basic and small. Bread, a small ceviche and fried chicken are not my idea of a Michelin star restaurant!
In a nutshell, OK but distinctly underwhelming.

Any restaurant that is packed on a Monday night is doing something right. But the real appeal is that the food here is different. I don't often eat at Chilean restaurants, so maybe that's it, but you're getting a memorable meal here instead of just something trendy.

Went for a birthday dinner and was extremely happy with Lima. We love Peruvian food and tried many restaurants in London before and the food in Lima was imaginative, tasty, beautifully presented. The service was great, with lots of help and recommendations when requested. It is not a swanky restaurant but a foodie heaven.

Food was utterly fantastic. different. Interesting. Flavoursome.

Great spot with great service, food and drinks.

We had dinner at Lima. I have never had Peruvian food before so I didn't know what to expect. The dishes use unusual and interesting ingredients and I am glad I have tried them. The ceviche is amazing, and my main course - duck - was cooked to perfection. Prices are a little high though.

We all really enjoyed the food which was unusual and well-presented.  The waiters were very helpful in their recommendations, and there were some delicious pisco cocktails which are definitely worth trying.

Went to Lima as a small group for a pre theatre meal after reading excellent reviews on the place. Was not disappointed at all - could not fault the restaurant from being greeted, fantastic speciality cocktails, small menu but enough items to satisfy everyones tastes. All the food was delicious, well cooked and well presented. The staff were very friendly and alert but non intrusive. Highly recommended.
Food at Lima was great. Our waitress was really friendly and helpful, too
Amazes everyone i take. The most vibrant and dynamic menu in london

We chose Beso for my daughter‚Äôs 11th birthday meal - she loves Italian food and I don‚Äôt like to slum it! We have Italian family and have holidayed in Italian for many years, so have high expectations when it comes to Italian food. The food at Beso didn‚Äôt disappoint, her Ragu was delicious, my ravioli with shaved truffle was awesome, as was the tiramisu. Other members of our party had pizzas which they really enjoyed. The food was authentic, simple and incredibly tasty.
On top of that the service was great - with energetic and helpful members of staff. We will be back!
Absolutely gorgeous food; freshly cooked pasta, sea bass in ravioli delicious, steaks excellent too!

Fabulous find in Covent Garden
Don‚Äôt be put off by the small menu as the food is excellent all fresh cooked with not a packet or tin in sight
The staff were welcoming and attentive ensuring our visit was a throughly enjoyable experience
Fantastic food and service! We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and would 100% go again soon!
Excellent food and service in a wonderful restaurant. Very attentive staff.
Fantastic food and delicious cocktails, great restaurant.
Fantastic authentic Italian cuisine. Sommelier picked an excellent wine for us. Great for a date night.

Staff is exceptionally nice, food is amazing and lovely atmosphere!
It‚Äôs a bit pricey but a great venue for a special occasion!
Will definitely recommend and come back!
The food was excellent and service very attetive, would definitely recommend
The food was good, in fact the scallop entree was terrific,  but I had crab shell in my ravioli - not the  best especially when just recovering from throat surgery!
The burrata was outstanding. It is a must-try item on Margot‚Äôs menu. The veal was very good, but outshined by the burrata. The service was impeccable.

Excellent service from all members of staff, always topping up our water and checking everything was okay. The crab ravioli and tuna steak were divine! Perfectly accompanied by a choice of bread, of which we had focaccia, flawless! Perfect place to dine pre or post theatre.

Wonderful authentic Italian cuisine presented in a modern, refined way, with impeccable service (friendly but not at all intrusive, knowledgeable and helpful but not patronising or intimidating) in lovely surroundings - relaxed, but upmarket/smart. Would highly recommend and will be returning!
Absolutely beautiful food. Service was a little stuffy.
Really nice food, a little expensive. Friendly attentive service, would go there again.
Simply enjoyable experience and wonderful dining! Server, Barbara, is extremely helpful and knowledgeable. Wonderful personality, great sense of humor! Ask for her!
Took my husband here who was sceptical as he thought it was going to be ‚Äògirls‚Äô food.  He thought it was brilliant - phew!

Once again the restaurant delivered, after meeting one month ago for a business lunch I booked again for a evening dinner. The service and food was really good and our friend from the USA enjoyed the whole experience very much. I look forward to visit again.
Overall very good but wine list over priced. Would revisit and would recommend.
Well happy with everything, the fish ravioli is a delight.

We're disappointed as we had been previously and loved the food.  This time the menu had changed and the food was just average .  Probably wouldn't return.  Starters good but pasta was ordinary as were the Sea bass and osso boucco .  Didn't like the tiramisu.  Loved the sea bass in sat last time
Outstanding on all fronts - we'll definitely be returning.

I was a bit disappointed with the afternoon tea menu..did not like the rice snack
I much prefer the old menu

We went for a pre theatre dinner. I am glad that I chose before I arrived as the menu choices were so complicated. It's great if you love tea! The food was beautifully presented and tasted extraordinary. The service was great and very attentive. They made a special effort as it was also a birthday celebration.

Food was great, ambiance was lovely, but their service was terrible! Waiters kept interrupting our conversation, didn‚Äôt give us a chance to take a picture of their lovely food before mixing / mashing together, shoved themselves into really tight spots close to us to mix our food, and overall had poor covid considerations.

We were excited to visit this restaurant after reading the reviews. However, we were disappointed about the service received.  We had to make the large waiter aware that we were ready to order, he took orders from other tables that arrived after us.  We then noticed that other tables received their food fairly quickly, yet ours took a good 20-25 minutes to arrive. My husband got through almost two pints of beer before our food arrived.  We thought this may have been because I ordered pasta, and perhaps this was made to order, but then another table ordered the same, and theirs arrived within 10 minutes of ordering. Food was OK, service let the visit down
Second visit here and it didn‚Äôt disappoint, great service, great fresh food, the pasta is sublime! Would eat here everyday if I could! The mozzarella was mouth watering!

Food is always good would highly recommend.
Everything on the menu is halal and no cross contamination which is perfect .
Table was warm sitting outside with heaters, but they had ran out of a lot of the food we had ordered

It was absolute chaos! We had a reservation for 3 for 7pm, the restaurant was really busy and they just couldn‚Äôt cope.
Food was bought up from the kitchen, given to the wrong tables, taken away, bought back - no one seemed to know what was going on.
The food itself was pretty good, I‚Äôd been craving prawn tempura and it didn‚Äôt disappoint but the food didn‚Äôt arrive in the same time zone so we couldn‚Äôt enjoy eating together.
Excellent meal - food was delicious. Highly recommend

Went to Cocochan on Tuesday night and wow it was super busy with great energy and awesome ambience... Staff was very polite and well informed. We tried to share all the dishes and so glad we did that. Everything is delicious from the presentation which by the way is marvelous to flavors.. I don't know what dish I liked the most ( I loved them all )! All I have to say that if you are looking for an extraordinary dinner this is the place to go... Make a reservation though!

Ive never been disappointed with the food here - and the service is OK , not the best but then Im used to outstandning service as I spend a lot of time dining out in the Middle East . Its good for London though

The have halal food too
This was my 2nd time here & the food is amazing. Loved all 3 course!

Whilst the food was tasty, my friend found a piece of wire in her chicken. She sent it back. The waiter was apologetic. She then found a second piece of wire after which the food was sent back again. There was no offer of an alternative after that or other complimentary main course. The wire ruined what otherwise would have been a nice meal. The Thai curry was tasty and wire free.
Good food went on the 50% off deal. No one in there though which was a surprise for a lunchtime just off Oxford Street. good size portions on the beef!
Excellent value lunch at Cocochan in London, very good service, nice venue, will go back!

This pan-asian resto is a little gem. As starters I had the prawns wrapped in rice noodles which were gently fried and accompanied by a light mayonnaise ‚Äì delicious!
The sushi although nice and fresh was not special enough to deserve its slightly above average price.
My dessert was a mango and coconut parfait which was very light and refreshing.

Cocktails were delicious and left you wanting for more!
Had dinner at Cocochan yesterday evening. The service and ambience was good as was the food. I would definitely return.

Cocochan - the food was excellent, the waitress was knowledgeable and was able to explain all the dishes we asked about in detail. With the 50% off food offer it was very reasonable, a selection of starters, the two most expensive main courses and two glasses of wine for under ¬£50 ‚Äì definitely recommend and will be returning.

We enjoyed a lovely birthday dinner at Cocochan on 20th October. The food was delicious, interesting mix of ingredients and very tasty. I particulary liked the crab cakes for starters and the pan fried sea bass which had a nice spicy kick to it. The warm sake was perfetct for a cold evening as it was yesterday. It is the first time we ate there and would go back, location is great as St Cristopher Place is a lively buzzing place to go out for a drink or a meal after work.

Cocochan was a Really good find.  Starters/sushi and desserts were the highlights, rendang beef a bit too tangy, too much lime. Spicy tuna sushi and chilli salt squid yum and caramel mousse was wow! Will definitely return

Cocochan is by far the hippest restaurant in St Christopher's place. We came for a late dinner on Friday night, and were really positively surprised of the vibe, the service and the food. Worth checking out. Strong 7/10.

A lovely restaurant that my husband and I visited to celebrate our wedding anniversary. Prosecco and Aperol Spritz deal for ¬£20 pp and set menu of ¬£16 for two courses was perfect. The food was delicious and the service was excellent. We will definitely return.
We had the excellent value set menu, the food was very good, portion sizes good and service very attentive.
Food and service excellent and very good value

We come here fairly regularly and usually really enjoy the experience. The staff is generally very friendly and efficient without being overbearing. Last night was a different story. As we arrived, the waitress / hostess ignored us for a good five minutes, no eye contact, no acknowledgment that there were actually human beings waiting. Once we were seated, service seemed to be given begrudgingly and aloof. The goat's cheese salad (chef's special) appeared to have just been thrown on a plate. The steak was adequate but not up to their usual standard. We were made to feel more like an inconvenient nuisance rather than paying customers and the clearly insincere ' thank you and goodbye' at the end of the evening added even more insult to injury. It's a real shame how one member of staff can ruin a restaurant's good name. I have championed this restaurant to many friends and family over the years, based on last night, I won't be doing that again in any great hurry.
Boulevard Brasserie is a small gem in Covent Garden. The staff and food were both excellent, my friend and I enjpoyed ourselves immensely. Thank you Boulevard Brasserie...
Great location and the restaurant is lovely, a little French bistro style. We were sat upstairs, downstairs seating a little lighter but nice. Food was great, very rich! And lots for vegetarians
Ideally situated for an evening in Covent Garden or surrounding area. Good food at a reasonable price for London. Service  good.
Excellent food and service and compared with similar dining that we experienced in a short London stay, this was the best
We had the 3 course Sunday meal deal, which was spectacular. The portions were reasonable and the food was delicious, especially the carrot cake! Will definitely be returning again
They made me feel special giving me a creme br√ªl√©e with a candle in for my birthday.

Went as a birthday treat (which we notified them with through Open Table), they greeted us straight away with knowing it was a special occasion, allowed us to pick our own table and asked if we would like a glass of prosecco on the house. The food, service and ambience were impeccable and we truly could not have asked for any more from them. Even when they brought out desert they had put candles in!
A delightful place with incredible staff and delicious food. Would visit again and again!
Lovely food served by friendly staff. Salad nicoise was excellent. I can definitely recommend.

I attended in a group of 6 for dinner. I had pre-booked using the open-table app and had made a request to utilize the 50% off food menu with an additional request for a window table.
Our requests were met with no problem.
The service was above and beyond and the food was fantastic.
I have attended the Boulevard Brasserie on numerous occasions now, always taking friends visiting London to the restaurant. We know we always receive great service and yummy well-priced food.

The location of the restaurant is very good for everywhere in west end theatreland. The staff are friendly and efficient. The food is staggeringly boring and mediocre. The ¬£20 deal offered by OpenTable is no deal at all as the restaurant offers a 2 course menu for ¬£17.95 which means that you pay ¬£2.05 for the 'free' cocktail. Admittedly a cocktail would cost you more if you paid full price but, as the Kir Royale drink was a very indifferent Cava with just enough liqueur  to change the colour but not the taste, you'd have been better off paying the full price elsewhere.
We had one of the best meals we've ever had for our Anniversary. It was a fabulous experience, can't wait to go again.

We really enjoyed the set Menu on New Years Eve - the steak was
One of the best I have had in the UK
Wonderful return to visit to this lovely restaurant. Service was outstanding, food really good and good value for money.

Had a lovely pre-theatre meal here on Bank Holiday Monday to celebrate my dad's birthday.

The gentleman who showed us to our table was very solicitous and explained the choices from the offer menu abd thebither prix fixe menu. He also established out timescale o/a theatre.

Our Southern Italian waiter was also lovely - friendly, unobtrusive but observant.

The food was delicious. I had one of the best seafood linguine I'd ever tasted. My mum raved over her Eton Mess an dad loved his pork chops with Chorizo crust.

We were lucky enough to get 50% off food on the Open Table site and they often have various deals

I love this restaurant as do lots of my friend's and I'll definitely be back before long.

Our favourite French brasserie in the West End changed hands and was tarted up appallingly. Even worse, the menu - which we loved - was changed.
Boulevard Brasserie has all the features we like in a restaurant with a great French cuisine so we have now transferred our custom.
Great food, good wine list, nice atmosphere, good service and unpretentious. We will definitely be going back again.

We had an excellent meal before the theatre.   We did not eat from the pre-theatre menu but were very appreciative of the 50% discount off the food.   A very good spot for dining in the Aldwych/Covent Garden area.
Once again  the Boulevard Brasserie was spot on for a pre-dinner high quality meal this time with my wife's sister and husband who both agreed that they would be back to visit again, as we would

Dined here on Saturday evening with friends, everyone's meals were lovely and waitress was very pleasant and helpful, only downside was we waited a long time for drinks each time we ordered. And whilst it was very cosy and romantic could of done with a bit more light. But other then that would definatley visit again.

Usually my favourite place to go with a group of friends but on this occasion was a bit disappointing.  Side orders were forgotten and by the time they arrived, main courses had been finished.  However, they did make a bit of a fuss for the birthdays by adding candles to deserts which was a nice touch. Will be back.

I booked a livingsocial deal for afternoon tea with proseco , for here based on two work colleague's recommendation and also for it's proximity to a theatre show we due to see nearby.

We were actually early for our reservation but the staff could not have been more friendly and accommodating , we were lucky a table was free .
The choices on the menu of teas -from organic rasberry -thoroughly recommend it ! through to the choice of sandwiches (mini smoke salmon bagels, and foccaia bread with mozzeralla , basil leaf , tomato nice change from cucumber!!) was great and plenty of mixture of cakes

The waiter , waitress regularly check on you without being intrusive and were polite to all around us they were serving, it was a busy saturday afternoon

The value for money on the voucher was great - ¬£25.00 for two , and I would come back here again with or without a voucher
friendly staff, nice ambience , central convent garden so near to shops, theatres alike ... makes a refreshing change to all the hotel-afternoon stale scones and limp sandwich deals out there

Very nice venue and close to the Playhouse theatre. Booked in advance  their advertised pre-theatre menu and it offers a good choice for a good price. Missed the very small print of 12.5% optional service charge! Disappointed with the very overpriced wine list. ¬£17 for a 50cl carafe of Pinot Grigio. Lovely staff and friendly atmosphere balanced our feelings.

Very disappointing - but what would you expect when a French restaurant can't make a decent French onion soup? Our expectations went downhill from there.
Maybe it was just a bad night. We went pre-theatre, so we were a bit rushed, and there was a VERY loud group sitting at a nearby table, which didn't help our disposition. But there are soooo many good restaurants in Covent Garden that there is little reason to give this one a second chance. Sorry.

Service was prompt and value overall very good value with 50% off food. We had a crab salad special and deep-fried brie - both very tasty. Duck confit and risotto followed - both well seasoned and good portions. Carafe white wine OK.
A good place to go after the theatre.
Great french inspired food and good service. loved the white table cloths as well.

The first time I dined at this restaurant with my partner, which was about a years ago, we absolutely loved it as food and service were great. However we have been back a couple of times since and each time we have been back it has got significantly worse. This most recent visit was the last straw unfortunately. The service was terrible. The waiter forgot to bring our wine, was generally very slow and forgot to put our opentable special offer discount on the bill. My prawns were very overcooked and the sauce tasted burnt. The experience was also made worse by the table sat next to us, complaining very loudly after waiting over 2 hours for their main course and as a result missing their train. We went to the Palm Court Brasserie (same owners) since this visit, which does a similar menu, and is much better, so would recommend there instead.
We were very well treated and the food was great.  It was tremendously good value and a delightful way to spend tine with a friend.

Service not very good".....had to ask for drink after 10 mins sitting waiting in hope. Wrong drinks then served. Waited an eternity for the food which was at best bland this on a Sunday afternoon when not that busy. Bill then presented all incorrect....would not recommend this establishment at all.
Very tasty, massive portions and with the 50% discount an absolute bargain, Will definitely be back!

I booked on open table and added a note to say my friend can only eat gluten free. When we arrived our waiter was fantastic, already had a list of what she could and couldn't eat...very impressed!

Great value food for pre theater....just once we ordered the service was a bit slow (as in kitchen) so ended up rushing a bit.

But all in a very good little place and would definitely go back!
Good Food. Great value. Great restaurant. Went there again post theatre and was very satisfied indeed.
We went on a Monday night and used the 50% off food deal which proved excellent value. The food was great, as was the service and it had a very nice european feel about it.
Good food, nice atmosphere and very friendly and efficient staff
Very good food! The confit de canard was excellent. Service was impeccable. Set menu gave various choices.
A lot of options, executed well, and super value on a meal deal - we had a great family birthday meal and will go again.

Manager knew nothing of the TopTable deal but honored it anyway.
I ordered the sea bream - no mention of garlic but when I opened it up it contained about 10 cloves. It was exchanged for the only thing on the menu without garlic - fish and chips. I am garlic intolerant but not allergic.the manager told the waitress to tell me that the terrine I had eaten also contained garlic but fortunately I had no ill effects.
I know French food often contains garlic but if you're going to mention seasonings then mention the garlic.
My daughter loved her food.

Had a meal with family and friends on Tuesday 17th, we were seated in the downstairs part called the Cellar. We used the 50% Top Table offer but they also do a good priced 2 course or 3 courses offer. The service was great, attentive but not overbearing. Victor the waiter was lovely. The atmosphere was very good, no loud music blaring, not rushed at all, overall an excellent evening, would certainly go again.

We had a midweek dinner post-theatre matinee. We were seated downstairs, so were not only able to take advantage of the Toptable 50% a la carte offer but also the Cellar Bar happy hour cocktail and wine prices. The lovely meal and excellent, friendly service would alone would make us want to go back, but fact that we were able to enjoy this quality at a very reasonable price was a bonus.

We had the top table Sunday lunch deal, myself and a friend who was visiting London. The Sunday roast was really good, best ive had in a while and excellent chocolate desert. Defiantly left feeling very full. Only disappointment was my friends soup, which she left. Service was good and the ambiance placenta but nothing special.

We had the three course meal with the glass of Kir 'deal'. The Kir was heavy on the cassis, flat and in the smallest thimble. Portion control was achieved. The brandy cured salmon had no flavour at all though it looked like smoke salmon. The creamy dressing laced with honey which came with it was pleasant enough and made the starter patable.
The main course salmon dish was much more satisfactory. The very thin piece of minute steak was wisely not served 'well don'. It would have shrunk rather a lot. I was not asked how well i wanted it cooked probably for this reason. Fortunately there were plenty of delicious fries served on the side. The deserts were unexeceptional. The ambiance is excellent. Handy location for pre-theatre dining.
Great service ... Excellent value for money.
GOOD FRIENDLY SERVICE - NICE FOOD.
been to this resturant multiple times, very good service, outsanding value with the pre theatre deals and always a lovely atmosphere which is missing in many pre theatre places. Highly Recommend it!

I booked the 2 courses and kir royale deal for a group of 4 of us and it was superb value. The service was great - very attentive and friendly. The food was fantastic as well - lots of choice on the set menu and the beef bourguignon was divine!

I booked a table for ten for my son's 21st, but at the last minute three people had to cancel. Didn't seem to cause a problem for the restaurant. Our table consisted of French, Brazillian and Engish guests- all seasoned foodies, and the menu was excellent. Everybody was impressed with the food and the service was impeccable. Will definitely be paying another visit!!
Tasty food. Friendly and attentive staff. Very good value with TT offer. Would definelty go back.

The food was excellent, I ve ordered King Prawns and they tasted delicious, could have been more Prawns in the pan as it is a main course, there were only 6. All the others loved their food and portions were appropriate. Side vegetables came a little cold so they brought new ones and took that off the price. Great service!

I liked the busy feel of Boulevard Brasserie, many people from different backgrounds enjoying good French food. I would return, although their menu is limited for chicken, but what they had was nice! Service was a little hurried but friendly. I would recomend this for small groups and for a quick dinner.

Another pleasant meal at Boulevard Brasserie, which has the ambience of a french bistro. The two courses for ¬£15 option is a good deal for Saturday night in town, with free Kir Royale. Fairly limited but pleasing menu, we had various starters, all quite delicious followed by minute steak and frites. Only recommendation, as no veg, just a few salad leaves or small garnish of watercress as in France would have made the dish better presented. Steak was good however. We paid the extra ¬£3 for the chocolate tart, absolutely delicious and well worth the extra. Service was good without being intrusive. Would highly recommend.

I went for an evening meal with my mum at 6.30 and the restaurant was already almost full which is a good sign - it's popular!

The food on the menu was varied and the beef was particularly good. We were not pressured to leave after the meal and felt relaxed that we could take our time to eat 3 courses (for an extra ¬£3).

Give it a try!
Very good experience overall. We had a booking for 4pm and turned up at 3 and they accommodated us without any fuss.
Excellent ambience and service but the food was disappointing.
Went to Boulevard Brasserie in Covent Garden for dinner on the 50% offer. Food was delicious and staff very friendly. Good value for money.

A good pre-theatre option for theatres around Aldwych but I find the main courses while tasty a little heavy for eating before the theatre (eg. the duck). Service is good and speedy but try to resist being crammed into the basement - particularly if you have made the effort to book. They will let you eat in the bar area - a busy, buzzy place to eat

This was a return visit to Boulevard Brasserie in Covent Garden and it was every bit as good as the first time. We had the pre theatre menu which is excellent value. We really like the ambience here and the attentive service.
Toptable deal made this restaurant good value.

The Boulevard Brasserie was very good value with the top table deal of ¬£15 for 2 courses and a kir royale. With a half carafe of a decent Aussie shiraz the total bill was just over ¬£50. The beef and duck main courses were plentiful and well cooked. Ideal for the prevailing weather conditions. Service was bright and efficient.

Visited the Boulevard Brasserie in Covent Garden last night with the in-laws. We had the set menu for ¬£15 and were not disappointed, there was masses of choice and the quality was good. The service was also good, so we will be visiting again without a doubt.
Had a lovely lunch, 2 courses and kir royal for ¬£15. Excellent value for money, service was a good pace and we didn't feel rushed to leave. Friendly staff. Would definitely return.

Boulevard Brasserie in the heart of London's theatreland is a great place for a pretheatre dinner. The food is as one would expect of a moderately priced restaurant meeting the need. The pate starter was disappointing.
Excellent food and lovely service. They really made our get together special and the food was very reasonable too.

Boulevard Brasserie in Covent Garden London is a cosy atmospheric place to have an elegant girls lunch which is exactly what I did last week. The special offer of ¬£15 for 2 courses and kir royal was a good deal, despite not being warned that the side order and bread were on top. Tables slightly too close together so conversations were overheard all round, but didn't impact too much on us.
Had a fabulous time, the food was lovely and the staff were very friendly. This is our fourth visit to the Boulevaurd Brasserie restaurant and it never disappoints. Can't wait to go back next year.
took 50% off deal which was well worth it, would go again

It was a really good meal, with v nice service. The only question I had was whether the cake was actually 70% Valrhona (as labeled on the menu & reported by the waiter) as it was quite sweet, but other than that, v good. Thank you.

Nice and friendly staff, the food was well cooked and served in a timely fashion.
The music that was being played during our visit was varied, of an appropriate nature and in no way intrusive to our conversations, it actually formed one of the talking points of our visit.

I had previously visited the restaurant, and as with our first visit we thoroughly enjoyed our visit, would recommend the restaurant to others and will be returning.
Good quality, broad range of choices and ideal location
Loved the food and service was great. Really good price with the offer.
The set menu was good value, with an excellent table for our party of 5. The sevice was attentive.
Boulevard Brasserie in Covent Garden is a great restaurant, offering good food, good service and a good location.
Lively brasserie aptmosphere with good food and  excellent service. The top table 3 course meal with kir represented excellent value for money. The menu was varied and I will definitely go again.

I went here with four girl friends on the three courses plus a belini for ¬£20 deal. The food was good value for money but we found the waiter quite snappy. At the end of the meal they added on an 'optional' 12/5% service charge which we paid. However, we miscalculated when we split the bill between us and they chased us for ¬£1 which I wasn't very impressed with as the service charge was supposed to be optional. The food was pretty good though and there was a fair range. I will go there again.
we hade the 15 pound menu at Boulevard Brasserie in covent Garden WC2 sunday 19th june 2011.The food was great good value for monday i would recommend this restaurant .
A good last minute find. The offer was good value, the food was tasty and the service was friendly and efficient. Just what you want really.

Boulevard Brasserie - Covent Garden
We had 2 courses and kir royal for ¬£15. Pretty good choice on the menu considering that it was 2 courses for ¬£15. Service was good and friendly. Also reasonably priced wine. Would definitely book again, especially for pre theatre as they got us fed and out in good time.

Well situated with friendly, attentive staff in a classic bistro setting. Good quality food (there's a decent selection on the set course menu where in other restaurants you can find this menu too restrictive), speedy service, well priced - 3 happy diners! I noticed the other tables around us were also served efficiently and had good looking plates. My sister said it was the best calamari she's ever had. Recommended.

Ate at Boulevard Brasserie on the 2 courses and a kir royale for ¬£15 deal.  A good choice of items on the menu, the food was nice and good value for the cost. Service very pleasant although not the most efficient, but this might have been down to the large hen party at the next table.  Recommended, and I will go again.

We booked Boulevard Brasserie in Covent Garden for a Mother's Day lunch for 6 (3 courses ¬£20) at 1pm. For the main my daughter ordered roasted veg for trout, but they were forgotten; she had finished her meal before there was any sign of them. We had to leave by 3.15pm so we asked for coffee with the desserts - coffees arrived (luke warm) but no desserts. After we finished the coffees, still no desserts, so we paid the bill (no deductions) but excluded the 12.5% service charge.

Boulevard Brasserie - Covent Garden.

Excellent wine list with varied a la carte menu options.

All food was beautifully cooked and presented.

I would happily go back and recommend.

Two friends and I dined at Boulevard Brasserie in Covent Garden, London.  The staff were friendly and attentive and we were served quickly. Food was delicious.  We booked the 50% deal which was good value.

Food and service at The Boulevard Brasserie near Covent Garden was excellent. We had the special menu which was ¬£18 for 3 courses including a Kir Royale which was superb value for money. Will definately be going back
good
Excellent food and service and value for money. Would definitely pay a return visit. Very wide menu choice.
worth the money. welcomed and served with a smile. It's proximity to Covent Garden is a plus

Boulevard Brasserie - London
I have been here a couple of times and have always been impressed with the food. It is great quality and I always enjoy it. The only let down was having foie gras served with thin sliced toasted white bread.
On the last visit though they took an hour to take our order, and another hour to serve us meaning lunch took over three hours. However it was very busy and they were short staffed so on this occassion I will forgive them as they have been great previously.
Bouvelard Brasserie gave us a quick service and very delicious food too. Highly recommend for pre-theatre or a long catch-up with an old friend
very delicious, great service

Boulevard Brasserie, Covent Garden:

Really good service and the food was really good value. Took advantage of the toptable menu offer and was suprised by how good the food was. The ambience wasn't amazing, but overall a very good meal.
Boulevard Brasserie, Covent Garden.  Great meal and fantastic value with 50% off, would recommend.

Took my boyfriend to Boulevard Brasserie - as usual the food and ambience were excellent, he loved the beef bourginon. With the top table 50% offer it's excellent value, the only downside being the slightly abrupt waiter!

service was poor, at no point did anyone ask "is everything was ok with your meal?" which is was not! we found what looked like a piece of wire scourer in the main meal.
the waiter did not listen to us most of the time and seemed to be a little tricky, basically couldnt be bothered!
Would not go back and would not recomend to anyone, sham as could have been nice.
The 3-course plus Kir Royal for ¬£20 is exceptionally good value.
good food, a little bit of a tourist trap, hence the prices. but with the 50% off, it is just worth it.

Four of us ate on a Tuesday night at Boulevard Brasserie. The restaurant was clean and the atmosphere nice, although the group across from us were rather loud. The service was excellent, and the starters all delicious, I especially enjoyed the pate and toasted bread. However, the main courses were rather a mixed bunch, and we weren't overly impressed. The chips were rather disappointing. With the 50% off it was still good value for money, but I expected more from the food

Eight of us dined at the Boulevard Brasserie in Covent Garden on 20 May on the Toptable ¬£20 three course offer.  The service was good and the food was really good from a varied set price menu.  The Boulevard has a great atmosphere, excellent location and we would definitely go back again.

Boulevard has been an old reliable over the years, and though the last time I tired to go there it was shut down for refurbishment, it was a relief to have it available when I'd left it too late to book another choice on top table. God food, nice ambience. The service was a bit slow - we arrived at 7.30pm but didn't have our mains until nearly 9pm - but the food was good.
Excellent in all respects.
Still one of the best Pub in Mayfair. Dinning is imprssive and food is top notch. Good for special occassions and Staff are friendly and service is amazing.

What a wonderful local pub in the middle of Mayfair!
I booked a table at The Footman for my annual meet up with old school friends. We wanted somewhere central as we all lived in different directions, with good food, good ambience but quiet enough to be able to catch up on a year's worth of gossip. So I booked a table upstairs hoping for some quiet.
When we arrived there was a wedding on, so was a bit worried about noise. The wedding party were being catered for upstairs so we were give a large table downstairs. However I needn't have worried about noise as the pub was lovely. There was no loud background music, just the gentle hum of subdued conversations.
The staff welcomed us like old friends. Drinks were brought to our table with a smile. We were encouraged to take our time ordering our meal, and given suggestions about menu items. Everything on the menu sounded fabulous, it was hard to choose.
I had the Sesame seared tuna...it was fantastic. Perfectly seasoned and "cooked". Yum! My friends had the fish& chips and Sea Trout. Both also perfection.
For dessert we had the chocolate fondant and sticky toffee pudding. I wished I didn't have to share my chocolate fondant it was sooo good! If in doubt about which dessert to have I would recommend the chocolate fondant. I don't normally do this, but had to send my compliments the Pedro the chef! I want to come back again and again to try all the other stuff on the menu
The wine list was ok too. A bit of everything to suit all tastes, but not so extensive to be baffling. You go to a pub you just want some good wine or beer to accompany your chat and meal. They have that here at the Footman.
Good location, great food, great staff, good drinks, reasonable prices. What more would you need. Come to the Footman, but keep it a special secret ;)

This is a really fun place and the food is absolutely delicious. There were only about five things on the menu but everything was outstandingly delicious and the portions were large for small bites! On the table next to us was an enormous festive cocktail to be shared by the whole table and it looked beautiful. Great buzzy atmosphere and everyone having fun.
went for the brunch, the menu has variety of dishes, but some dishes might not be as good valued as others.

Food was good but not outstanding as you'd expect for the price you pay. The best things we had were the lamb chops and the squid paella, which were delicious.
The place itself is supercool, but we were sitting on a low coffee table on handchairs.. which again is not what i expect in a high-end restaurant. Overall good but overpriced for the offer.
It may not look much from the inside but what a dining experience. It felt like a very authentic Japanese cuisine to me. I would highly recommend a visit and will definitely be going back.
A wonderful experience and a real treat.  Fantastic sushi and sashimi, all beautifully presented and a delectable choice of sakes.
Wonderful meal, food was amazing and the friendly staff were lovely,  highly recommend

Beautiful food. Simple understated interior with warm colour scheme and exposed brick. Nice service. Ceviche was delicious but very ungenerous. Good wine list. Meats were exceptional. Will certainly return
This is my second visit to Zoilo and both times the food and service has been excellent. The lunch time set menu is really great value and tastes amazing. The staff are really attentive too
Absolutely delightful! met some friends there for drinks after work. Great service, lovely atmosphere and they brought out gazebos for us when it started to rain.
The best hot chocolate I've had in a long time. Great food and extremely friendly staff. Overall excellent experience.
Fantastic service and great atmosphere, wings are the best
Lackluster surroundings and less than great service, a disappointing evening.

Not only was the experience very disappointing, being kept waiting for over half an hour for our table, but when I left a bad review on Tripadvisor, a sarcastic ‚Äúsorry you had to wait an extra 15 minutes for your table‚Äù response was left. It was at least half an hour and their lack of willingness to at least acknowledge their shortcomings demonstrates a complacency I won‚Äôt be funding again.
Great value and great food in a great central London location

Overly attentive waiting staff, asking for orders before I'd say down and we were asked at least 3 times during each course how the food was but didn't acknowledge the response.

Starters and deserts were delicious and I'd recommend them. Mains were disappointing and lacking flavour. I couldn't taste the wasabi in the wasabi leeks.

The set menu was great value for money.
Outstanding food,service and atmosphere.üëåüèºüëçüèº

This was for a birthday treat for my 15year old son who is a big fan of Gordon Ramsay. I let them know in advance and all the staff couldn‚Äôt have been more pleasant and helpful on arrival and throughout the meal. So the staff were all wonderful. No complaints there.
Our sushi and pork cheek lollipop starters were wonderful as was the dry aged sirloin one of my sons ordered. However the rib eye was far too fatty and the chateaubriand which we ordered medium rare arrived chargrilled on the very outside but completely rare otherwise. It had far too much salt on the outer crust and seemed tough for a chateaubriand. It had been sliced in the kitchen and not at the table as is often done in other places so we didn‚Äôt want to send the whole thing back as we‚Äôd have all been eating at different times. Disappointing for an ¬£80 cut of beef and almost ¬£400 meal for 2 kids and two adults.
The staff were great and brought my son a birthday brownie with a lovely message in chocolate writing. Only the food really let us down. Which I‚Äôd be lying to say warranted the price tag, despite the Ramsay tag.
Thanks to everyone there for their kindness but I feel I have to leave a completely honest review here.

Amazing meal from maze grill.  We both ordered steak and it was cooked flawlessly, I seriously almost cried.  The wine was phenomenal.  The wine specialist helped pick the perfect wine to compliment the meal.  Expect to spend some money, but it is worth every penny.
Excellent service and food!!!!!great location easy to find!

Myself, my son and my nephew ate at the Maze Grill Mayfair. My eighteen year old son and nephew are big Gordon Ramsay fans, so when  I told them that we would be travelling to London we decided to eat here. All of us enjoyed eating here. The food was delicious and the service was fantastic. I would recommend this restaurant to everyone.
