Exactly what I expected from a Gordon Ramsay restaurant, incredible food, service, and ambince. Expect a perfect evening from the moment you walk through the door, I will defintely be returning.
5 of us ate here for my birthday and we had a fantastic evening, the staff are warm, friendly and attentive, service is great and the food is wonderful !  ! We'll definitely eat here again,

The waiter was a little too eager to take our orders, and the menus is filled with good stuff so it's not an easy pick. I went with the mini sliders, spicy tuna sushi and sweet potato hand cuts, while my boyfriend had an Aberdeen angus steak with hand cuts chips and  bearnaise. The meal was excellent!  We decided to go for beer, and they did not have a large selection, but a well picked one. Overall the food and the atmosphere is perfect,also not to stiff if you go there for early dinner. Definitely recommend Maze!

My husband and I had dinner at Maze Grill as part of our first visit to London. Dinner on Monday night was excellent. The food was awesome and the experience was superb. The starters, desserts, wine and drinks were fantastic but above all the steaks were absolutely unbelievable!! The staff was extremely attentive, friendly and very knowledgeable. A little bit expensive but totally worth it. We would definitely recommend.

My husband and I visited Maze last Saturday for an birthday meal.
The first thing that struck us was how closely packed in the tables were leaving little or no privacy. Secondly the whole room smelt strongly of charred meat and old cooking fat (not a good combination).
The sommelier came and gave us the wine menu, and left us to make our choice. However, when they returned and were told of our choice they kept trying to make us change our mind telling us that the Italian wine they wanted us to have was the same as the New Zealand wine we wanted. The wine was then served with bad grace all evening.
When the food arrived it was burned on the top ,the chips were not properly cooked and the onion rings were raw. Not good at all!!!
Steak was good, but not great.  I have visited the Maze grill several times, in an attempt to be good (or rush people)  the service was too rushed!

I would rate this as one of the best steak's I've ever had in London. Not cheap, but good value for the quality and quantity of food. Service was a tad OTT for my liking - it was very much overt service rather than discreet (and we were interupted mid conversation a number of times for trivial questions), but we were nonetheless well looked after overall.

I booked this as part of a weekend away for my wife celebrating her 50th birthday. Having blown her away by checking into a 5 star hotel in Leicester Square,she thought that her weekend could not get any better. How wrong she was !

When the taxi pulled up outside the maze grill, she nearly burst into tears as she had always wanted to eat at such a famous place. Needless to say, superb food and attentive staff just made the night unbeatable. My wife chose mussels and I chose chilli prawns for starters. Both tasted exquisite and there were plenty of each. We both had steak - i had a sirloin and my wife had rump, both were as good as any i have eaten in the USA. And the cool vibe and ambience made use feel welcomed and at ease. Excellent !!!!

All a little bit disappointed. Had to ask for the set menu which wasnt available but the manageress did sort this and allowed us to choose from the 3course menu from the previous day. Table was close to the door and a little small for the the party size bearing in mind i had booked for 6 people and there were only 5 of us on the day.
Starter and dessert were great but main course ribs i had were not well enough cooked and not up to standard.

I might go back but overall was a bit of a let down for this group of ladies over from Belfast.

Recently had dinner in a group of 5 ladies. Staff were faultless and friendly. Ambience was good, although they made it a little dark in the resturant (but that's being pedantic). We all had steak which was sublime and pudding which were just delicious. The Somlier was the nicest guy and very good at recommending wines that were in our budget.

We had cocktails, steaks with sides, wine, pudding, dessert wine and it came to around ¬£90 per person.

We also sat in the bar afterwards and all in all it was a superb evening. I'd definitely go again.

I booked the Maze Grill for my husbands 30th birthday.
We were very impressed with the attentive staff and the food was wonderful.
Will definitely be back soon!
Cooked to perfection, the steaks we had were delicious.
My wife and me love the place , the food were delicious an d the surving we get was amazing
Having been to the Maze 3 times in the past on business dinners and been extremely happy with the service and food, i was very disappointed when i took my family for Christmas.
nice place, good food and the service was OK I would come back but only as the name makes people feel special
Had a short lunch at Maze Grill in Mayfair. Service was good, pasta was fine, if unexceptional. Great Bread! Nice to see Gordon Ramsay popping in to check on his restaurant.
Great food, staff and atmosphere. Highly recommended.

I had a lovely lunch at Maze Grill and the set menu offer of 3 courses for ¬£24 was very good value. My starter was Cornish fishcakes with tartare sauce (delicious), main was salmon with new potatoes (nothing special) and then chocolate brownie with salted caramel icecream as dessert (fantastic!) The cocktail list is great, my Bellini was one of the best I've ever had! Service was a bit inconsistent as we had 3 different people waiting our table but overall a great experience, would go back!
Food and service was first class. Amazing.

maze grill was in a great location and the staff were friendly and attentive. We booked the 2 courses for ¬£21 offer and were left somewhat dissapointed with inconsistancy of the quality and the wine prices. The duck starter and steak combo was great however the fish (seabream) would have been better without the fish. Would be worth going for the steak only.

We arrived early and had a glass of champagne in the bar which was a modern setting.  The staff clearly tried to make sure guests comfortable by lowering the window blinds to stop the sun shining on them and were very attentive but not overly so.  The meal was delicious although the Chef behaved a bit like the mad guy from The Muppets but it all added to the experience!  I would go again but not in a hurry.

Visiting Gordon Ramsay's is once in a lifetime experience... The food was delicious, simply presented, but very effective. Before ordering our meal, the different steak types were explained and shown to us. This was very good!
Maze Grill is amazing! Always beautiful food and wonderful service! High;y reccommended.
A lively buzz of people in the restaurant. Attentive staff. Food was very pleasant.

Hello! This was an awesome restaurant - the steak Onglet was sooo yummy and the whole roast garlic was (surprisingly) really good too! For ¬£21 for 3 courses i thought this was really good value - in between our main and pudding the man himself actually came into the restaurant!!!!! SO when the bill came in at ¬£200 for 4 of us (2 bottles of wine came to ¬£80 and service charge was ¬£22) it wasn't such a blow seeing as Gordon made an appearance!
Thoroughly enjoyed the restaurant, food and service.
The food was really nice and the service was second to none, the price was a bit expensive but I expected it! Overall a great experience and got to see Gordon in the flesh too so even better!

we had a very good evening at the maze grill,by the time you add up all the extras and service charge it comes out very exspensive for steak and chips. the soft shell crab did not have a lot of taste and a bit oiley dripped down my shirt when bitting in to it but still had an enjoyable night

Such a great restaurant- the staff are a delight ( wonderful banana daiquiri created despite no blender) and the set menu does not stint on variety, quality and the stunning flavours. We love this place and will be back again soon
Good food and service
Third time we have been here - amazing food and service as always!

Perfect evening.... excellent food and cocktails....superb staff....
Thank you very much

Never ceases to impress. A tiny restaurant. A tiny kitchen. Producing small plates with huge flavour. It isn‚Äôt cheap but it‚Äôs innovative, brilliantly executed food. You won‚Äôt be disappointed. Recommend the tuna tacos, wagyu beef tataki/truffle.

Amazing food, each item on the menu is seriously good!!!
Love staff and nice cozy space
Don‚Äôt miss the Spinach salad, chicken / shrimp gyoza and truffle fries!

This was not an authentic Punjabi restaurant, went with my Punjab partner the menu is made for tourists who know little about the cuisine. The quality of food was average.
There are far better Indian restaurants in London for the same price range. Do not expect authentic Punjabi food, you will be disappointed. Staf was friendly
Great food; one of the best If not THE best Indian in town; attentive service and great location!

We were shown to the best table in the house (I had requested a romantic table) by a smiling member of staff. Generally every waiter, the sommelier etc. were very helpful and made us feel special. We ordered plenty of seafood (the fried crab is very interesting). Cocktails were also delicious. Much recommend Jamavar for a date night!
The food is very delicious
Great for meat eaters, but veggie options could be improved. Disappointed in the masala chai but the cocktails were great

Awesome food - best Indian in London

Ivan the server redefines customer service- excellent
Had a really lovely evening. Service was great as was the food. Would highly recommend

This was the best Indian meal I have ever had anywhere-the food was great the service wonderful. It rivalled the best meal I have ever had of any cuisine We had the large tasting menu with wine, and the stone fish and chicken were to die for
Fabulous food and wine with great service. Couldn't have asked for more. Will go again!
The best service I've seen in mayfair! Everyone so incredibly attentive ! Very cosy and chic.. food was a bit spicy for me but felt very authentic..definitely will go back
Birthday meal
Food was amazing best Italian food in london
Great tasting meal and service for a family meal. The waiters couldn't do enough for you. The cheeseburger spring roll was riddicolous is flavour profile. Amazing time
Great food and great service,  highly recommend , good location too

After a review in GQ Magazine, we went with the expectation of going to a cocktail bar on the second floor called Toots and Hoots....but it no longer exists and is a room for private parties only so very disappointed on that front. Anyway we stayed and got a table on the ground floor, as long as you get a small table for two or a table for four its comfortable ( wouldn't want to be on the centre long sharing table)  As for the restaurant , Staff at bar exceptional and the general table service very good. The food starters very good as well, the mains very expensive whereas you don't get stuck in like you would with a Chinese banquet.

Nice little place, it has the right atmosphere for dates and small get-togethers.
On the menu, a selection of simple but typical Italian dishes from Parma, which include great charcuterie and some high quality pasta of more unusual shape and sauces.
Didn‚Äôt try the dessert but it looked absolutely delicious.
Friendly but professional service and good atmosphere.
Considering the price, food quality and service I really recommend it.

The place is always nice. It's all about the quality of the ingredients and the Lambrusco, served in white bowls. Food consists of amazing cold cuts and cheeses for appetiser, mainly from the Parma region, and mains are simple but well prepared pastas . Enjoyable and fun, in a tiny restaurant, so make sure you book.

Highly recommend. Popped in here last minute on a Saturday night and we were all really pleasantly surprised.  The restaurant space is tiny, but the decor is stylish and comfortable.  Service was friendly but not intrusive.  Food was universally excellent -- fresh, fantastic salads and the special homemade weekly pasta dishes we had stood out. I'd definitely go back.

I went there because toptable.co.uk was recommending it. I wasn't disappointed.
A dinner at In Parma is a little experience in itself.
Don't forget to ask for some Lambrusco!
Very good food. Great service.
Poor service from a couple waitresses and unfortunately non enjoyable cocktails

Amazing meal. Everything was perfect from the moment we walked through the front door of the hotel. We were asked if we wanted to have a drink at the stunning bar upstairs first before having the most amazing yellow tail starter and and usda ribbeye.
Outstanding service, made to feel very welcome, definitely will be back

First night in London on family holiday and our meal got our trip off to a great start. Everything was delicious and the service was excellent. Our son enjoyed his first-ever souffl√© and wants one every night on this vacation.

Was very pleased the first time I visited, but this time our party was greeted with a "you are late, you will have to leave by 2 or 2.30 at the latest", which the receptionist kept on repeating, which was not very welcoming. (Alright, alright) Although we were 15 minutes late, our table still hadn't been set so we had to wait for another 30 minutes (ridiculous). Food was decent and the other waiters were alright, experience spoiled by the poor service by the receptionist.

One of the best if not the best steak I have ever eaten! Brilliant service considering my booking through Toptable was not on their list. They still found us a table and then we discovered that I had booked the table for 8.15 and it should have been 20.15 !!
We were treated like VIP's and the meal was fantastic.
Expensive but worth it.
Fantastic food and excellent service! Will definitely go again
Lovely space, great for groups. Food was delicious, highly recommend.
Good service and great atmosphere
Had the Dover sole, was amazing.  Everything was perfect
Reasonably priced, very attentive service, eat as much as you like, good  atmosphere and location. Recommended

visited Butler's at the Chesterfield on a friday evening with 4 friends. very quiet & not many people dining. surroundings very good but service a bit sloppy. eg ordered a starter of smoked salmon, capers & egg but when it came only got smoked salmon. also ordered a main dish which was supposed to have portobello mushrooms but yet again dish came without them. when i asked informed they had run  out of them. would have been nice if they had advised this when orderring the dish.
Butler's restaurant - great food, attentive staff who were really helpful especially with the children, my 4yr old son included.  Nothing seemed to be too much trouble, as good as our last visit.
Excellent first rate wine bar, Melinda is very knowledgeable and the whole atmosphere is perfect for enjoying a quality bottle of wine.   Extensive wine selection by bottle or glass.

A la carte order.
Starters were good, slight lack of seasoning on the corn fritters and the butterfly prawns
Steamed Seabass was excellent perfectly cooked.
Prawn red curry was very good, would have loved a little more Thai basil to balance the flavour overall.
Loved the coconut ice cream!!‚Äô
The Pad Thai is delicious.  This is my go to restaurant before a show in London.  It never disappoints

Surprisingly good.
Good service -larger servings then expected.
reasonable prices.
Excellent meal served quickly with good choice available on the menu.
Dinner for two before going to a nearby theatre. Lovely decor and polite service, and the dishes we ordered (mixed starter followed by a sea bass each) were delicious.
we can recommend the Thai Square. The food an the service are very good.

Thai Square -Trafalgar Square
This is the second time we've been and some friends joined us and we enjoyed it as much as we did last time.
Very generous portions with food that's delicious . Perfect for a pre theatre dinner.
Would definitely go back! Great food and friendly service.
Booked on a whim and not expecting much from a restaurant so close to Trafalgar Square, but very pleasantly surprised.  Good food, good service and a good value set menu, pre-theatre.
An excellent choice and looking forward to our next visit.  Everything about it was excellent.

Thai Square - Trafalgar Square, london
perfect pre theatre venue, fast and tasty

A very successful first visit which exceeded  high expectations.  The building is most impressive and the interior  matches it, with lovely Thai decor and artefacts.  We had a pre theatre dinner served precisely to time by charming, attentive waitresses.  All our dishes  were delicious and beautifully presented in true Thai style.  The soft crab meat with papaya salad and  the scallops were excellent starters and the sea bass with coconut sauce are all must haves for our next visit. Excellent.
The restaurant did not know I had a reservation. I had to show my booking to be seated. The service thereafter was good. Food was excellent!

Went to Thai Square on Trafalgar Square for a quick lunch with a friend last Thursday... Just love the set lunch menu for ¬£8.95 which I had with green chicken curry (as always!).  Service could have been a bit faster but was good overall.  Didn't have any wine this time so can't comment on that.

Had a great time at the Thai Square, great location as the bus stop home was right outside the restaurant!  The staff were very good and didn't hassle you to order.  The food was good and enough, but there could have been more to choose from on the menu.  Would I go again? Yes!

The ambience was great. My friend and I enjoyed the hospitality of the staff. We took quite some time deciding what to eat but the staff did a good job by recommending what's good to eat. The waiting time was pretty short, so we weren't bored waiting.

We enjoyed our meal at Thai Square - the most succulent king prawns I've had for a long time, and good quality duck. it was packed on a Friday night - lively and fun atmosphere, beautifully decorated with Far Eastern trinkets and design. It was so busy that the cloakroom was full so the only place for soggy umbrellas from the torrent outside was on the floor under the table. They could do with prawn crackers on the menu though - I mean the posh sort!
Nicely placed table for a small party. Well looked after. Children happy.
Thai Square Traf Square was an excellent meal, took abit of time to get actually served, but once they wheeled the food out it was truly excellent.

Thai Square is visually stunning, beautiful interior and great service, but to be honest the food was good but not amazing. None of our party thought it was worth the marked up prices. Also they don't serve prawn crackers or any nibbles, what a disappointment! So, it was a nice evening but the food was a let down after the initial wow of the restaurant appearance.
Superb! Delicious food and that night (although only occassionally in the year) thai dances throughout the evening, including flame throwing . Highly recommended.

Booked a table to catch up with a friend. Staff were welcoming and suggested a cocktail.. huge cocktail menu which they are clearly proud of. Gin cocktail delicious and burger very tasty. Staff attentive but also discreet to allow conversation and privacy. Beautiful venue.
Beautiful food and great service. I left a note on opentable that it was mine and my partners anniversary, and they brought out a dessert- lovely touch and much appreciated
An amazing experience we all enjoyed it v much however my husband did say it was rather expensive!
It's a great place to come for a dinner and the Alaskan King Crab is a highlight, however, not worth the price.
Dered the food and it was too much for two, so I would recommend to measure your impulses to try it all at once and simply make plans to come back amother day.
The food did not taste fresh, some of the desserts tasted quite stale. Not a great overall experience food wise.

Very professional attentive service.
Very good quality of food
I love it
Great food flavours really different, a real little Jem

Wow!
This is my second visit to Foleys & the food was Off the scale AMAZING! I took 4 friends - we were having a Christmas get together. I am vegetarian but my friends are meat and fish eaters and enjoy good food.
Every dish was delicious
The service was good
Very much recommended !!!!
An amazing meal great price great location . Despite restaurant being busy the staff were very attentive and helpful throughout
Perfect place for a pre show dinner, very nice food at good prices.

I would definitely recommend this restaurant. We ate post theatre and were early for our booked table but it wasn‚Äôt a problem and we were seated straight away. Good service, good food and wine, would definitely go back.
A fantastic pre or post theatre venue- superb authentic Italian restaurant and really good food and wine!
Lovely food, friendly service and an Italian atmosphere

II Cucciolo London
Fab meal very friendly staff third time there will be back.
Sally Dublin
Great Service and good Steak
Holidays at London. Lunch before watching a concert

Fantastic experience, great selection of cigars and spirits to choose from and enjoy in a comfortable lounge. First class service. Great place to sit and enjoy a smoke and drink with friends. Would highly recommend.
Excellent service, food and ambience

This was the second time I have been to The Game Bird and it did not disappoint. We went for my dad's birthday, and the food was stunning! Everyone enjoyed every single dish - I highly recommend the risotto! The food was so good that we all ate far more than we needed to but enjoyed every bite!

The staff are very friendly and attentive and the atmosphere was lovely. Its a relatively small dining room and the tables are well spaced so it wasn't too busy and we were able to enjoy our conversations.

I would definitely recommend the Game Bird to anyone and it is great for a special occasion.

The Game Bird delivered a memorable evening. We had drinks in the champagne bar before dinner followed by the al a carte menu. I couldn't fault anything; excellent service, fantastic wine list, superb food, attention to detail from everyon looking after us. A truely wonderful evening and we would certainly eat there again

We have eaten at the Lyttelton several times and the restaurant has a lovely ambience and the service is always warm and friendly. The food was good quality and lunch time offer with a glass of wine was excellent value for money.

Food was excellent, quite large portions. The service was good, although the waitresses needed reminding about things a few times. Overall very nice experience, good ambience and quiet location. The set menu was good value for money
The food was delicious. The staff was amazing very friendly, polite and attentive.
Food was amazing and service was excellent too.  Definitely recommend

yes i go here a lot, and to earn opentable points i m afraid i need to post a review every time. no changes since last time. still good food and friendly service. will keep you updated if anything changes

Booked this restaurant on the on line recommendations and comments for my boyfriend's 50th birthday and certainly was not disappointed. The food was superb and the service couldn't have been better. And even though its right in the heart of Covent Garden, the prices were reasonable. Really would recommend a visit.

Really enjoyed the food here, although the beef in the pho was not as good quality as all of the rest of the food we had. Everything else was absolutely delicious though and the service was great. We were there quite late after the theatre so it was quite quiet but I have been earlier in the evening before and it was much busier and more lively. Will definitely be going again and recommending it to friends.

Very positice introduction to Vietnamise food. As someone with a peanut allergy there where no issues for me as the staff took care of keeping my food prepared away from nuts. Excellent value and considering how busy it was all the staff there were still in good form.

Booked london theatre experience. Booked table for 19:30 and arrived at 19:30. As soon as we arrived we were rushed to order as they told us the whole store closes at 21:00. Thru out the meal we were continuously rushed to hurry up and reminded that they close at 21:00, this really ruined the experience. Closing time is not clear on open table personally I don‚Äôt think they should accept bookings for 19:30.

Most of the food was really good. My main - truffle risotto was really grainy and super salty. When I told staff they just said there is nothing they can do about it.

Overall I think if you book latest 19:00 and avoid the risotto, it would be a lovely experience. Unfortunately my experience wasn‚Äôt great.
Nice atmosphere and good service. Our starters were very good but the mains were a bit disappointing since they didn‚Äôt have a lot of taste. We took risotto and lobster roll.

The menu wasn‚Äôt what we had seen on the website (no brunch menu on offer?) and was very overpriced for what it was.
The burratta wasn‚Äôt creamy, it was just mozzarella.
The ambiance was pretty poor, we were round a corner looking directly on to rooftops, not very glamorous for Selfridges. Wouldn‚Äôt recommend.

Average food, somewhat tasteless, poorly made cocktails and bad service. This included, not bringing enough menus for the people at the table and the worst part was allowing us to order drinks without telling us they were about to close. So with the drinks they brought the bill, and began to rush us out - to the point where we were told to "just gulp it down", fine if you need people to leave at a certain time, but some warning would be welcome!
The food, ambience, location are always great. On this occasion the service was particularly exceptional, one of my favourite locations for lunch.
Staff were great!
Great menu options, lovely staff who are very attentive, and excellent location and atmosphere!!

„Å®„Å¶„ÇÇ„Åä„ÅÑ„Åó„Åã„Å£„ÅüÔºÅ
ÂÜôÁúü„Åå„Å§„ÅÑ„Å¶„Çã„Å®„Ç§„É°„Éº„Ç∏„Åó„ÇÑ„Åô„Åã„Å£„ÅüÔºÅ
The food was a let down and the service was very bad
The food was really good. We ordered the Mayfair chippy classic and it‚Äôs amazing! Best fish & chips so far in London.
Very good fish and chips ! Near Oxford street.. you myst do it !

Quite a disappointing experience, portions were  small compared to our restaurants in Yorkshire/Lincolnshire, the men had the Mayfair Special & found it a very small portion, my friend & I  ordered fish & chips the fish arrived on its own & only after asking the staff twice our chips arrived approximately 10 minutes later by which time the fish was cold, wouldn't go again.

Perfect fish and chips in a modern setting

Fish batter was nice and crispy as it should be , chips are chunky either a crisp outside

Nice assortment of puddings if you have space afterwards

I advise booking if you want to guarantee a table at your desired time
We met a couple and their two tweens for dinner. Possibly the best fish and chips we have had in London. It is a bit pricier but such good quality.....it is worth it.

Overall a very nice experience. Even though there was a bit of a wait for our mains the staff were very good in apologising and offering us a drink on the house which was nice. The salmon tartare was very tasty and the fish and chips was a very good size, good value on the two courses for ¬£16.50. Their daily specials looked good value too, i would go again for sure.
Everything was top notch except for the lack of ventilation in the back room. Am going again one more time and will leave a more accurate description then

Lovely. Service was slow to start. We waited too long for a menu. Waiter did not check my Opentable booking‚Ä¶
Once we got our waiter Ben, it all changed. He was charming and attentive and we enjoyed our evening tremendously.

I'd recommend Oscar, but with reservations.  The room is lovely but the music too loud and too clubby, especially for a Sunday evening when I went.  something more relaxing would have been preferable.  Also the food is a bit, 'meh' and not terribly good value for money.  Oscar's menu needs an upgrade!

Service was fantastic. Food good. Noise level was unbearable. We could hardly hear each other at table. Staff took us to lounge for desert etc. I loved the decor, the food and staff but found noise level too great

We had 4 waiters who kept interrupting our conversation as if in competition to get the tip at the end. It was bizarre. One of them asked us as soon as he handed us our menus if we knew what we wanted to order, so of course we said we needed more time. He then saw his colleague take our order a few minutes later and came over straight away to say to us in a stroppy way "I asked if you were ready and you ordered through someone else" - we didn't realise that guests tips were a free-for-all but having 4 different people popping up throughout a meal to bug you is too much. We weren't overly slow and there were 3 empty tables near us for the entire time we were there, so it couldn't have been because the waiting staff needed our table back. I can't explain it.
Great ambience and good service but the food was poor. I was expecting more.
Really lovely ambience in the brasserie. And delicious food. Would definitely make it a regular trip.

The table was very sticky. I ordered 2 of the same cocktails and got 2 completely different drinks. The food was ok but not worth the price in my opinion. The place seemed understaffed and the service wasn‚Äôt great. There is a very loud karaoke bar through some doors which looks like a great time. I went there afterwards to order a couple of shots and the drinks never came.

My family arrived at exactly the reservation time (6pm, pre-theater). They did not find our reservation in their computer (despite previous written confirmation). The restaurant was 3/4 empty and they pretended they could not find a table for us. When we insisted they gave us the table near the toilet.
Service was very unattentive. We practically had to shout to get their attention.
Food was good. Not fancy, but adequate. When we left at 7 pm the restaurant was still almost empty. Well deserved.
We had a lovely meal at Thai Square - Covent Garden.  The service was good.  Only complaint was portion size was a bit small.
Great venue, delicious food
My partner and I had another enjoyable meal at Thai Square in Covent Garden.

Thai Square - Covent Garden provided a great setting for a quick pre-theatre meal. Charming service and decent food were just the job! Small warning - the 'weeping tiger' dish is not mild as stated in the menu! lovely though!

Thai Square - Shaftesbury Avenue. This is a quite new restaurant so the place is very nice. We went with 9 people which would have been more ideal if they had had a round table, which they didnt. The service and food was very nice and i couldnt fault but generally I though it was a little over priced especially since we paid ¬£89 and that was just for starters. A nice experience but wont go back due to the cost.
Beautiful location in the heart of London. Delicious food, great value for money. Oysters to die for ‚Ä¶ Amazing staff. I will be back, Seasons!!!!
Great decor, attentive staff and amazing  choice of spirits. Only a few people there on the Tuesday evening, so the atmosphere was a little quiet.

We were asked to pay cash on the door to be allowed in even though we had booked a table.

So we left
The tapa's were OK, but not from a great taste. The plates were from plastic. Not really chique.

We have had a marvelus night at Jaz After Dark, with good ambiance, very good service , lovely Jaz. Certenly we shall visit again

Sheida

Jazz After Dark was a cosy,  intimate venue.  Plus points included a quick, friendly service and the food was nice but not fantastic. Bad points were the volume of music when eating and lack of space.
Very pleasant evening, great hotel, good food, great service a nice ambiance
Great place service and breakfast.
The food and ambience was superb. My guest was from New York and I wanted a special place to meet and catch up with him.
This is excellent. Food superb, service brilliant. ¬£100 per head including wine, but an excellent evening.

I always enjoy Bellamy's and they never let me down. Good food, good service. Not a lot of fuss but practical and logical service. When the sommelier remembers the wine you had on your last visit and suggests a similar choice to try then that is impressive!

I can never fault Bellamy's, a sparkling gem in the heart of Mayfair.
The food is good, the portions are a little small
Sad this is not family run anymore. And it shows. Food was nowhere as good as it used to be. Portions smaller too. Very sad. It‚Äôs ok tho but not outstanding as it used to be.
Thoroughly enjoyable experience all round. Nice original menu. Pleasant service

Excellent pre theatre venue. Plenty of varied choice on both reasonably priced pre theatre & main menu  We had delicious charcoal grilled steaks with dauphinois potatoes & veg . We were very impressed with food & drinks

Our third visit to Savoir Faire and another delightful experience. The restaurant is intimate, welcoming and friendly. Their menu includes imaginative choices with good choice for vegetarians and the dishes are tasty and beautifully presented. There are various goid value menus and an excellent wine list.
Always excellent food , ambience , service and value for money. Happy to highly recommend this restuarant
House champagne fantastic value! Try the mussels - l'escargot style...

I found this place by chance after going to the British Museum one day about  years ago.  It is not too expensive and great food.  They have the best sticky toffee pudding on the planet.  The decor is so much fun and quirky like old Paris or can-can days.  It is a more family run place.
Have eaten here many times and it never disappoints. Would highly recommend. Great location of shopping in central London.

We wanted a quick meal before a concert and that's just what we got.  Service was quick and very friendly, couldn't be better.  Food was very good and arrived quickly.  What more can you ask for.  We'll be back.

We visit London several times a year and Savoir Faire is always our first choice of restaurant. The menu always gives plenty of choice, so much so that it's difficult to make a decision on what to eat. The food is well cooked and filling. The house wine is good value. Service is efficient and friendly.
Already looking forward to our next visit!

I've been to Savoir Faire several times, both on my own, and with other people. The food is very good, the staff are friendly and welcoming, and the restaurant is full of quirky character! I've noticed that other people keep returning, as I do, and I would recommend it to anyone.
As ever, this restaurant is consistently great, serving great food at reasonable prices with great ambience. Ideal for the family reunion that we held there.

Following the reviews on trip advisor we decided to try this restaurant and we weren't disappointed. The menu was very good and the hardest part was trying to decide what to eat and the food was delicious which, coupled with great service and brilliant prices, means that we will return.

If you're looking for somewhere off the beaten track of Tottenham court road, with great service and even better food this is the place for you.
We had a last minute booking here and thank goodness we did. I would highly recommend.
Excellent traditional food at very reasonable prices in an unpretentious and old fasioned atmosphere.

Excellent value for money. The food was delicious - variety of choice and good sized portions. i have easily paid double the price in Edinburgh for same meal. I would recommend the starter of mussels which was yum yum. Not a wide choice of wine but all good value. We werent rushed which was a bonus especially given that it was a Saturday night. Overall very impressive. I dont know how they make a profit as their 2 course, good qaultity meal, came in under ¬£20 pp.

Had a lunch at Savoir Faire with a friend. It was a very relaxed restaurant with  a very attendive waiter. The starter was good, though a little salty. Both of us had pork belly for the main. It was not bad, but we found it over cooked... Creme bluee for dessert was not a bad choice, but again a bit too sweet. I'd go back again though I'd hope for a few improvements.
Great food, good dinner deal, awesome in general. And great value!!
Savoir Faire is a real 'find'. A gem of a restaurant serving freshly cooked food at good prices with friendly service.
Food was excellent and good value for money.We were downstairs in the basement where there was a good ambience
Keep on coming again and again - and every friend that has been referred - is coming for more. Great place, Great affordable food.

Savoir Faire (London) is a good spot to know for an informal meal in the Holborn area. Good value, with nice selection on the menu and a decent house red. Staff were friendly though language was a problem for some of the waitresses.
Lovely place, great atmosphere, excellent value, would return again.

Savoir Faire, London
Very good as always!
Excellent food, very good and friendly service, and well priced. Would highly recomment Savoir Faire.

Four of us opted to see if Savoir Faire could keep us happy and relaxed between the highs of Christmas and New Year without breaking the bank. Starters were nothing to write home about, but the mains & wine were good, & substantial; three out of four of us could not think about indulging in pudding. The one who could was disappointed, & felt it over-priced at ¬£5. Service? Nicely laid back, just a bit slow. We enjoyed our evening but I felt Savoir Faire have forgotten some of what they once knew.
On a very busy February evening the staff did strain to keep everyone happy and everything on time but all the food was well worth the wait. Utterly delicious!

Friendly, welcoming and helpful staff got us off to a great start. Food, atmosphere and service were first class. Delighted with our decision to dine with El Pirata and will definitely look to return before too long.
Always great
Our menu choices were excellent  and the wine lovely. We also enjoyed helpful and knowledgeable service from the owner/ manager. I loved this restaurant!
Delicious ragu. Great idea to have Italian tapas. You can experience a variety of dishes. Lovely wine menu. We asked to take some home and the staff obliged. Very impressed and we will be back soon!

Nice cozy restaurant in Covent Garden. Wine list however is a bit standard and not suprising. Dishes are pretty standard but okay. The xextra 12,5 service charge and extra cover charge is not fair! Why double? So almost 19% tax on top of the bill including VAT.
Great fun meal, with such an extensive menu.  Have been once before and really handy for the theatres.

We had a lovely meal in Saturday lunchtime. Had cheesy garlic pizza to start filled by lamb chops in a red wine sauce and a ribeye steak. Food was fabulous, cocktails were delicious. And they brought a desert out with a candle on it for my friend who‚Äôs birthday it was.

Well worth a trip and very reasonable. Staff were friendly and very efficient.

Went for pre theatre dinner. Had a very nice 2 course meal and food came to the table quickly so we at no stage did we feel pushed for time.
Would definitely recommend

Great place to meet friends as it‚Äôs so near to Embankment tube and good for pre or after theatre.
We‚Äôve eaten here numerous times and love it. Food is fabulous.

Recommended by our son and was a good choice. This was my wife's birthday and unknown to her he had arranged a cake. This was delivered with a vesuvius candle and the waitresses singing 'Happy Birthday'.
Food and service was very good on a busy Saturday night.
Just what was needed. Good food in relaxed surroundings

A remarkable find so close to Waterloo and Charing Cross, I must have walked past it so many times. Great atmosphere and impressively quick service, considering how packed it was on Christmas party night.

We had dinner at this restaurant on our wedding anniversary on Saturday 11th April and were very disappointed.  We had booked through Open Table yet there was no record of the booking - fortunately they weren't full.  There was no offer of drinks when we sat down and we had to ask to be served.  Generally, the service was awful. There was minimal crab in the crab starter and the fish was totally overcooked.  The potatoes that accompanied the fish were forgotten and we had to ask for the.  When asked if everything was alright we said it wasn't but no one came to ask what the problem was.  However, when we were paying the bill we were offered a 10% discount which we declined (we weren't complaining to get a price reduction).  We left without leaving a tip, never to return.  I could not recommend this restaurant to anyone and certainly wouldn't try any others in the chain.

We ate at L'ulivo in Villiers Street before visiting a nearby theatre, to which it's a convenient one minute walk. The service is friendly although at times a bit slow, despite the fact that at that time there were more staff members than customers. We ordered pasta, which arrived within very few minutes, so it must have been already prepared. The servings were quite large but nothing out of the ordinary and the prices were a bit steep too; ¬£14 for a middle-of-the road pasta dish in a venue which is not particularly comfortable and with too many tables close together. Better value can be found elsewhere, so I would not return in a hurry.
Truly divine ‚ú®
Social distance tables, good pacing of the dishes. Grilled scallop is good

Absolutely fantastic! We were looked after by a brilliant man called Leboy (almost certainly not the correct spelling). He made our meal magical and gave great advice on the menu. Can‚Äôt wait to go back.

This is a delightful wine bar and restaurant just south of Piccadilly. I had a business lunch here and the service was charming, and the food was very good. It is good value and a great addition to the area.

China Tang is a rather dated restaurant that needs a good refurb. The food was ok but unfortunately nothing worthy of a recommendation to friends. I would go so far as saying the food is no better quality than a good take away.
Lovely food, good atmosphere
Excellent cocktails and wine selection. Great food. Pricey but worth it.
Really good food and excellent service, but quite a price tag and quite a noise level.
very noisy, food is simply average... for the price it is a disgrace really.

We didn‚Äôt miss our booking. We were there on time. We had an appalling reception. Two people (Lucien + a lady) weren‚Äôt interested when we arrived. They just ignored us. The food was excellent. Bartok was a great wine waiter. Rest of the service was excellent.
Great ambience,great service and great food . Value for money
Very average place except for it was in Dorchester hotel.

You would never think this restaurant was in the Dorchester hotel. The decor, seating etc were not up to scratch at all.

The service wasn't the welcoming service you would expect from this venue either.

The sofa seating was uncomfortable - you sink in to it.

Food - was okay, certainly nothing special.

The food was very mediocre. The rice was bland and required salt and sofa sauce. The salt and pepper prawns were over battered with no flavour that I had to send back. My three guests finished there food by the time mine had come out. The staff was however very polite it's just a shame the food and service was a let down!

A wonderful time had by both my wife and I, particularly as it was our 13th Wedding anniversary and her 40th Birthday.

Very attentive in your requirements and needs, fantastic service and a delight to enjoy the ambience and cuisine of China Tang.

Will definitely go back and enjoy more of the menu very soon.

As a lover of Chinese food, I've wanted to go to China Tang for ages, so it was a treat to go last week. We had excellent cocktails in the bar, but it all went downhill at dinner. Total lack of ambience. Tables so close together you can't have a conversation. Laughably overpriced wine list. The table wasn't set properly, no chopsticks or napkins. Food was ok but presentation very poor and unappealing. Lobster lettuce wraps were a pile of mushed lobster with lettuce leaves, tasted ok, but quite bland. Lamb hot plate was tasty. Dim sum was nothing special and poorly presented. It was a very expensive, very mediocre dinner. Definitely won't return. I'll stick to Hakkasan, Chinese Cricket Club, Min Jiang or any of the Royal China restaurants.
Excellent food and service. Very good variety on the menu and wine lists, ideal for special occasions.

For the Dorchester name China Tang was great value for money- was surprised to see the bill at the end was much lower than expected for a three course meal for two people.

The food was delicious, as my friend was vegetarian there were quite a few options to choose from. Service was excellent and overall the restaurant had a great atmosphere.

The delightful decor added to the ambience of the restaurant and I would definitely recommend this restaurant to a friend.
Busy establishmnet with many large tables so not very quiet if that is what you were looking for

Very good quality premium chinese food. excellent cocktails. Service was slightly erratic - got some courses delivered out of order. Expensive. Chef's specials are generally excellent, as is the Duck.
My friend and I had a lunch at China Tang on Sunday. The service was poor,staff unattentive, food was worse than in Soho and we could barely hear each other because of the noise

With its location within the Dorchester Hotel, I expected high quality, fantastic standards and a memorable experience. I'm afraid to say that I left with out any of that feeling, and its unfortunate to say have had better meals and service in smaller venues. Arriving through the main entrance to the Dorchester Hotel, we were quickly and politely helped by the hotels concierge as to the location of the restaurant. Following directions we found what appeared to be a closed door to China Tang, it gave you no invitation to enter but on opening it we eventually found the restaurant. once through though, we felt very separated from the hotel, and also thats where the hotels standards stayed. On the other side of the door...

we were looking forward to our christmas lunch atchina tang at the dorchester when we arrived the hotel looked amazing we were warmly greeted and shown where the restaurant was sadly the rest of the experience did not live up to expectation we were offered an awful table in a corner that we had to refuse the atmosphere was non existant and the food very average, sadly we could not even drink the champagne it was awful

Not impressed with being asked to vacate the table by 9pm when I called to confirm my 7pm table reservation. One of the managers explained that this is China Tang's policy. To be fair to diners the restaurant should raise the request at time of booking not at time of confirmation, as that is generally too short notice to make alternative arrangements. One of our main courses came after we chased 4 members of waiting staff including one of the managers and after we had finished all the other main courses. There was hardly any apology for spoiling our meal. One of the managers sorted out a free bottle of champagne at the bar after we were asked to vacate the table, however, this did not make up for a rather spoiled joint birthday party.

Fantastic afternoon tea.The food was good and the service was excellent.
Would definitely recommend.
Afternoon tea was of very good quality. They were accommodating to our different dietary needs, and adjusted the menu accordingly. Staff were very polite and helpful.

Had a really nice afternoon tea at The Den and it was good value. They accommodated for vegetarians and had lovely tea options. The venue was small but cosy and inviting. The staff were friendly and the service was great, we felt very comfortable.
Delicious food and staff very friendly and attentive.

Lovely experience overall, our waiter was friendly, attentive and gave great recommendations for food. We went straight after work (just before 6.30 on a Thursday) so it was a little busy but not overcrowded.
A mixed crowd as there were families, couples, friends solo diners - younger kids were a little loud but not a huge issue I‚Äôd say as everyone‚Äôs chatting!

Great value for money overall as we had wine, starter and a big main which was all under ¬£25 - would recommend and would go again!üòä
Food was terrific service was even better.  After the meal one of the servers was so nice in talking to us and even wrote us a list of parks to visit while in London.
The restaurant had closed down so don't see the point of bookings being allowed
Enjoyed the meal, service a little slow but it suited as we were a table of 8

Great Lunch, excellent food - the food is really excellent and the lunch menu price super attractive.
Superb wine list
The sushi was incredible and great value for money considering the quality. Staff were excellent and very attentive. Would highly recommend and will be back

My kids really like Parsons and it was nice to see the same staff there and some favourites still on the menu. Starters and the croquettes were the highlight especially the scallops sliders with squid rings that my daughter had great fun with. Turbot was deliciously crispy skinned with a luxurious butter sauce
Very good and fresh fish, it's a good address. It can be noisy as the tables are very close to each other - we were seated next to someone with a loud voice, it wasn't very pleasant.
Never disappoints - outstanding food and service as always. I look forward to eating here again... and again... and again!

We just got home from the restaurant. Food was amazing but we got an email saying we didn‚Äôt attend the booking and for me it feels really awful because I‚Äôm not the one to not cancel when I need to. And we definitely went and enjoyed the food but came home to a very disappointing email. Posting photos to confirm ww have been there today. Can even tell you how much exactly and what we had.
Great Thai food, deserves to be much busier! Friendly service.
Great service
Delicious food, nice setting, definitely recommend!

When you stumble upon a gem sometimes you want to keep it to yourself as to not spoil it with too many people, so much so that you can‚Äôt get a table a year later. But I can not keep this place a secret.

These days thanks to a pandemic the best places need to be exalted, supported, and yelled from the mountaintops so they stay open.

First off this spot is tucked away in a very special part of Mayfair called Shepherds Market. L‚ÄôArtiste Muscle is doing amazing food with amazing ambience.

I personally go for the best mussels and fries in london.

Hands down.

They remind me of the mussels I would get in the best parts of France and even at a special place called the Barnacle in Massachusetts. If you know you know.

The fresh Mussels are bathed in a white wine cream herb sauce and a full portion is close to God.

The staff are all amazing. Habib, George, Sofia and chef, everyone here is friendly, the kind of friendly like you have known them for most of your life.

I haven‚Äôt tried digging deeper into the menu but the offer entrec√¥te steaks, duck, a lamb steak in garlic butter and rosemary, escargot, chicken, and several fish options but I plan to once Im done eating through their amazing mussels. But that Could take a while before I‚Äôm tired of them.

I will say they have a great selection of wines from white to red. I suggest a Demi if your dining solo and they have specials.

Starters l, I had the avocado, blue cheese, and Lardon salad and wow it was amazing. With crispy lardon was like gifts in every bite.

Every time I here is hear tables next to me saying ‚Äúyou gotta try this, it‚Äôs so good‚Äù.

So that‚Äôs a review in itself.

They also offer cheese plates and traditional French sides.

And when you done there are a couple of pubs on the corner to finish your night.

But you might just hang out and keep ordering wine.

Amazing
Love it

Food was nice. But burger was very small! Our friends steaks came out 30 mins before the burgers. So we are separately. Would not go back unless they sort out teething problems. As we were there so long waiting for food we ended up spending a lot of money on drinks (our choice! But wouldn‚Äôt have spent so much of things were on time)

3 of us were seated for lunch. Bit of a faff ordering using their online service, connectivity dipped in and out. Very noisy down there. I resented the level of service charge considering we ordered the food ourselves, they literally only delivered it to our table. I would have collected it myself to save the ¬£15. Food adequate. One of us ordered a steak medium, it arrived well-done. The linguine was bland. None of us were inspired by the dessert menu. Probably won't rush back.
Thoroughly enjoyed our lunch and wine. We were in London for the day with a theatre trip in the afternoon. Made to feel very welcome by staff.  Food was excellent.
This is an atmospheric and convenient setting. Good choice on the menu at reasonable prices. No complaints form a party of 12, so must be good !
Very traditional British food with nice atmosphere and pleasant personal. My partner and I enjoyed a lovely evening.

Visited the Crusting Pipe with a large party, many from overseas, and was disappointed. The meal was generally poor "pub" standard and very slow to be served. The vegetables were noticeable by their absence. Even at the early week price of ¬£15.00 for two courses the meal was fairly poor value.
We were put in a private area and since many people had not met for some time fortunately the disappointing meal did not detract from the occasion too much.

I had been looking forward to visiting Kerridge‚Äôs for a long time, but I have to say I was disappointed.
On arrival they didn‚Äôt have a record of our reservation and even though eventually they handled it, the initial confusion wasn‚Äôt a good start.
We then had a pre-dinner drink in the bar area. My guest‚Äôs drink was served immediately but I had to wait at least 10 minutes for mine.
Then probably the biggest disappointment was the menu. It just didn‚Äôt feel seasonal. As my guest said if it was Autumn then the menu would make sense but not in the middle of the summer.
There were other less important things such as 2 of the 3 cask beers were off and the waitress tried clearing the table when my guest was still eating and then after us asking for a few minutes to decide on a selection she returned within a minute.
Overall a disappointing experience.

Many covid restrictions have now been lifted, so annoying that Menus (drinks and food) are still accessed of an App - it really ruins any ambience, this is supposed to be Wetherspoons. The menu doesn‚Äôt seem to change so why can‚Äôt we have just have a few printed out bit of paper?

I‚Äôve eaten here a number of times and it was a bit chaotic this time. It‚Äôs always been excellent in the past.
When we arrived we were shown our table which was near the door so a bit drafty. On the next table was a very rowdy group who were clearly drunk and swearing loudly. Unfortunately one of the waiting staff seemed to almost be encouraging them.
Our order was taken but after half an hour of waiting it was clear that we had been forgotten. The staff were apologetic and eventually we got our drinks and the food shortly after. We were sharing our starter and pizza and they were brought out together which wasn‚Äôt ideal.
However fortunately the food was very good.
Overall it just seemed the restaurant was struggling to manage the tables outside and inside the restaurant. A shame as it‚Äôs always been really good when I have eaten here in the past.
Absolutely fantastic experience highly recommended. Everything was absolutely excellent. Our waiter Manwel was brilliant. Definitely booking again.
The overall visit to Stringfellows was good under the COVID-19 circumstances. The food was delicious and good atmosphere at the venue.

Booked a table for 10:30pm - received confirmation email.
Restaurant due to close at midnight.

Arrived at restaurant: closed.
Great cocktails great service definitely go back again
Our waitress Gabriel was amazing. Please bring the white truffle hummus  back on the menu.  Thanks

Great entertainment from the singers and belly dancers. Very beautiful atmosphere loved the dimmed lights. The food was average and pricey. The waiters were very friendly and polite however some of the staff at reception were not welcoming.

A great discovery, this comfy restaurant has lovely views of the city and very very tasty food. It's a bit far from where we live but it is definetely worth more visits. Wish we had a place like this one in Paris.

An absolutely lovely afternoon tea in a quiet, secluded drawing room. The tea options were numerous (several menu pages, even more than what is provided online), and the food served was very nice and what we expected for an English afternoon tea. We enjoyed our time very much. We appreciated the reasonable price at such a prestigious location, especially when compared to other, much more expensive afternoon teas. I would highly recommend this lovely find.
Lovely relaxing afternoon tea although a bit lacking in a welcoming atmosphere.

A truly special afternoon tea. The sandwiches were a delight and the pastries were epic - each one was just perfect. What made this extra special for us was how welcoming the staff were and the level of service they offered.

I couldn‚Äôt answer your questions & I can‚Äôt recommend caff√® concerto.
We arrived on time The front of house manager couldn‚Äôt find my booking. I couldn‚Äôt load my confirmation email. So we weren‚Äôt given a table. We went across the road to prezzo we had a fab time
Great food and service as always, you can never go wrong here.

Absolutely no complaint, except that we booked through an agency - I've forgotten who - and the booking hadn't been passed on to you. Fortunately, you were able to accommodate us, so no harm done, but if it had been a larger party than two, or at a different time to 6 pm, this would have been very serious. The agency was called Open Table
A warm welcome, great service, varied and tasty food make this a great choice. The location is excellent overlooking Covent Garden and on a warmer day dining alfresco is an appealing option.

Yes, we were in Covent Garden but there is really no excuse for over priced and under par food. We did complain at the poor burger and were given a free dessert but still didn't feel that was sufficient. It's a shame, we were really looking forward to going but shall not be going back. They are obviously targeting the holiday market who only visit once and hence not relying on returning customers. We live in London and luckily have plenty of other choices.
What a lovely restaurant to celebrate a birthday we sat out in the Piazza. Tuttons is a great place for a celebration meal.
As always Tuttons delievered - its a great venue and so convenient

I took my lovely boss for lunch to Tuttons Brasserie today - the venue we use for business lunches. As usual the place did not disappoint. You get good value for money, food is cooked and presented to high standards. They have re-painted the restaurant recently making it brighter and even more enjoyable.  The only downside was slow service considering it was not that busy. Overall I would highly recommend.

The set menu at Tuttons was fantastic value - the food was excellent. Although you can find set menus for this price in London, you don't get the same quality of ingredients or generous portions. I've been here a few times and we all thought it was great value.
Buzzy atmosphere, and friendly staff.  Food good too.
Rate this place

I recently enjoyed a casual dinner with a couple of friends at Cafe Murano. The food was well executed and well priced. The ¬£2 single-scoop ice cream/gelato was a curiously pleasant surprise - often one wants a small dessert but most restaurants offer them only as another (full-priced) course. Aside from the table behind us having an extremely loud conversation, it was a very pleasant evening.

Liked the ambiance of the restaurant. It was nice and relaxing. The service was very good and friendly.
The wine was perfect! We had the octupus and the ricotta as a starter. Both very nice starters. For the main course we had the risotto and the malfatti. If you have the primi as a main course, it was recommended to order to the big portions, however, these were too big, if you already have a starter.
Overall would recommend this restaurant because we had a good relaxing evening.

An oasis in Piccadilly. Good food at a very good price, served well makes this a destination for the tired shopper or a gallery visitor. Our meal was especially enhanced by our marvellous Sicilian waiter.

Traveling solo for work last week and Cafe Murano in lovely Saint James was recommended for its food and a great spot for a solo traveler.  Booked a spot at the counter ahead of the evening rush.  The food is out of this world and every other dish I saw pass by me looked equally terrific.  I would always return here for the food.  I ordered a starter and a main off the set menu ... a great value at GBP19, with the a la carte menu significantly steeper.  The service was pleasant and gracious.  One slight head-scratcher ... although the counter was empty when I arrived, they mysteriously seated me right in front of the wait staff service station where they all congregated.  That said,  I think I could have requested a better spot.  Not enough of a ding not to return with pleasure in future.

Menu del giorno was good value for 3 courses and service was brisk but we not hurried. The restaurant was full, unsurprising for a Friday lunchtime. But the dessert was a big disappointment. Billed as zabaglione mascarpone there was no evidence that it contained either egg yolks or Marsala. It was a long time since I had zabaglione in Italy so, although I questioned the waiter on the lack of Marsala, his reassurance left me in some doubt. Having checked the recipe at home I realised it was no more than a mascarpone cream. Not good for a restaurant specialising in Italian cuisine.
Food was superb and ambiance was very friendly and relaxed. Will definitely return our next time in London. Service was excellent and wait staff very knowledgeable.
A good location for pre/post theatre. Service good, food average, hard to hear as high ceilings.
Well cooked, good value lunch in peaceful surroundings

Overall good BUT not WOW!  Saturday night was busy and waiting staff were stretched - another waiter/waitress in our section at the back would have been good.  Tables are well spaced and we weren't rushed.  Food was good but definitely not a wow dining experience.  Cod/potatoes and samphire was ok - burrata with red peppers was average - not the best burrato. Overall we left feeling slightly disappointed. We all ordered from the a la carte menu - expect to pay ¬£70 per head with wine.  This was my second visit to cafe Murano but this time not as good as before.
Love Cafe Murano.  Wonderful food, great service and at a very reasonable price.

Cafe Murano is both a treat and a great place to meet for business.  I took a friend recently who lives part of the year in Sicily and he was impressed.  The service is attentive but discreet and they remember my name which is always a nice touch.  The portions are on the smallish side but rich so thats probably a good thing.  I go there at least twice a week!
Taste amazing, beautiful presentation, friendly staff etc... It was a perfect evening. I'll visit again soon!

Upon arrival at restaurant (admittedly 20 minutes early) was told that as the table was not ready and there was no room at the bar, we should go somewhere else for a drink and come back - bad start. Service appeared sporadic - it was good when it happened, but didn't seem to flow. Starters were both good - octopus and beef carpaccio. Main courses of mackerel and vongole were adequate.  However, the vanilla panna cotta was phenomenal. The cloak room was chaotic - bad finish. With all the competition it faces, there was no 'wow' factor to recommend it to others, or to return oneself
Maybe not quite as good this time with up selling of wine a little annoying too.
Loved Murano itself (outstanding) so gave this place a go. Murano Cafe a great addition to the franchise.

Delicious food - Pumpkin and sage gnocchi was divine, main courses were cod and lentils and the pork collar (both were delicious but the pork collar definitely won the day). Hhome-made ice-cream sublime but the pannacotta was hands down the best i've ever tasted. Fantastic friendly and efficient service. Can't wait to go back.

Ok. I am Italian, so a bit biased here. But when the cook is south african and you make spelling mistakes on the menu, yoou shouldn't call yourself "Murano" which is an Italian superbrand... But let's talk about the food: the aperitivo from Torino was not known by my Friend, who is from Torino... The Negroni was very average although well presented. The truffle arancini where good but had absolutely no truffles inside and the rice was too cooked. My beef cheek was very good, but the rabbit and wild boar pasta of my friends was dry and really average. The pannacotta was very good, cheeses and chocolate tart were anonymous.

Overall, not a bad dinner at all, and the atmosphere was pleasent - but really nothing to write home about.

I had booked a table using OpenTable app. Before leaving we thought of calling them to check about reservation, we were told that the restaurant was closing and no longer serving. The restaurant should keep the details updated on apps such as OpenTable to avoid inconvenience for customers. We were lucky that we hadn‚Äôt left from our place and called them but is it really necessary if we have this app.

The food was stellar! The biriyani I ordered was a good level of spicy and the rice was very flavorful! My friends ordered the chicken masala and they both liked it. One of them had had a bad experience before with curry and didn‚Äôt think he would like it be he was very happy with it.

Really great find I have to say as we were walking around looking for an Indian after work. Food was amazing and different from the normal Indian food as it is South Indian, we had a very good waiter who helped us with the menu choices and we were all impressed with the food. Only downside was the limited selection of beverages. Otherwise it's good and the price was ¬£165 for 5 people including drinks so very cheap.
Fantastic meal at Chettinad. Very good food and service. Will be back soon.
Atmosphere at Chettinad in London was nice. Food service was good but taste was average.Fish was not good at all, though the chickn chettinad was good.

I was so disappointed with the food.
For a starter I paid ¬£18 for cold soggy vegetables that were inedible. The main wasn‚Äôt any better - worst sushi I have ever eaten and flavourless tofu.

I
The view was the only nice part of the experience.
Lovely food and wine though very quiet for a Friday night. Nice surroundings and excellent service.
The food abs service was very good

A lovely place with beautiful interior. Food was excellent and the service friendly and attentive.
Great for a pre Jersey boys dinner.
Restaurant is virtually opposite the Trafalgar theatre
The setting is beautiful and we really enjoyed the food and the service was very good.

AVOID AT ALL COSTS - All the things that you would not want to experience you will at this over priced and pretentious restaurant. The food was bland and tasteless, the waitress was condescending and unhelpful and the sommelier was bordering on rude, even though the bottle of white wine was warm! The menu was confusing and when asked for clarification we were made to feel like we were asking a stupid question, customer service out the window. Perfect example of substance over matter!! We were told the menu advertised on open table was incorrect and wasn‚Äôt valid....?

With my wife celebrating our wedding anniversary, although there was no acknowledgement of this. The advertised champagne for all diners was not allowed given we‚Äôd gone for a set menu with BYO. A couple of courses,although tasty, lacked substance. For example, the pork main course looked mean with just a few pieces of charred onion and apple matchsticks. The tiramisu dessert did not resemble nor taste like a tiramisu. Although the restaurant had just regained a Michelin star it still has some way to go in our opinion to justify a return visit. To the restaurant‚Äôs credit, after complaining we were given a couple of glasses of champagne with more if we return, but not sure if the food justifies the potential expense.

I've been wanting to try this place out for a long time, and overall I wasn't disappointed. We had a 4 course taster menu with accompanying wines, which was brilliant, we've never had such moist guinea fowl before. The only slight complaint is for the fish course, overall it was very nice, it's just the fish fillet was slightly overcooked.

The accompanying wines, suited to each course were fantastic, ok they were more than what I would have spent for a bottle but it was worth it.

Will definitely be going back there.

Why have I marked them down? The fish and sometimes the waiting staff were a bit too attentive. If I could give it 4.5 out of 5 then I would.

Went here with my wife for our 10th wedding anniversary. WE went for teh taster menu with wines to go with. It was a real experience with great service, food and wine with a real rapport with the waiting staff and semellier. A true overall experience - will definitely go back.
Great pub food served with a smile and care. Clean, which felt great in the times we are living in now

Great food, friendly service
Had the chilli squid as a starter - out of this world
Cote de bouef was second to none - 70 day aged
And the Apple pie...something to die for
Great meal, the hosts experience, passion & knowledge was superb

Had drinks and snacks inside the Coral Room, and the decor is quite impressive, although not quite as spectacular as images make it seem. The cocktail list is super short and they weren‚Äôt great tbh - we switched to wine after one cocktail, and would recommend people to do that. Bar snacks were good and generous. They have nice outdoor seating too, which I would prefer next time I come back.

The food was excellent - I had the baked cod, which unfortunately was lacking any carbs. My partner had the lamb, also excellent, but unfortunately lacking any greens. For a meal costing ¬£18-24 per main dish I was slightly disappointed.

However the service was definitely lacking somewhat - we were outside thinking it would be safer in these COVID-times having booked an "outdoor terrace" - it turned out that in the Brasserie Max this actually means the pavement, on tables too small to have a meal on. We asked to be moved inside and were accommodated. However we did have to order drinks twice before any arrived, the waitress did not write our order down and had to come back to ask what it was, we ordered creme brulee and received a fruit crumble, and had to flag down a passing waiter whenever we had to correct something they had gotten wrong. All in all a rather underwhelming meal.

The restaurant itself was fairly COVID-safe, I felt comfortable at all times and did not feel at risk in any way. Restaurants have had a battering this year and I would be happy to give the Brasserie Max another try!
Great for pre theatre drinks - meal would recommend for that 100%
Not the best cooked food. Had to send the main course back as it was over cooked. The set menu as ¬£25 which is reasonable given its central London

My mum and I booked the brasserie for after a matinee show. We had a post theatre set menu. The hotel looks gorgeous and the brasserie was lovely - a good ambience, nice decor and attentive staff. The meal was nice - we had the chicken followed by the chocolate brownie for me and lemon tart for Mum. Mum said the tart wasn't that lemony but my chocolate brownie was lovely. I'd say the meal was nice but not outstanding. However, the brasserie /hotel is situated in a gorgeous part of London. It felt like we could have been abroad as Monmouth street is very cosmopolitan and chic. We would go back.
Excellent service. Very friendly staff. Really nice food. Will definitely visit again

Booked a reservation for Brasserie Max after reading a review on another website and took a chance. We were really pleased we did. Arriving early, we were ushered into the brasseries where we were invited to take a seat in the bar whilst our table was prepared. The cocktail menu was presented to us and whilst the prices looked quite steep, the drinks were delicious. A perfect way to start the evening! Having finished our drinks, we were then shown to our table. We were choosing off the set menu which was basically a choice of four starters, four mains, four desserts and a glass of house wine. My partner is non-meat eating and was pleased to see there were choices from each course which were suitable. The food was supurb. The waiting staff were attentive at exactly the right times. will definitely recommend to friends and family!
We had 3 courses and glass of wine for 25. Portions were very good, and menu was varied enough. Food was tasty, and service was attentive. Would certainly recommend.

we wanted somewhere for a pre theatre supper but when we saw the delicious menu (and the high prices!) decided to turn it into a special occasion meal. The ambience and food were wonderful, very fresh salad ingredients and beautifuly coooked mushroom and chestnut soup to start followed by veal and duck. All mouth watering though the the mashed potato could have been a little creamier. We had the pinotage to drink and it was beautifully smooth. Good attention was paid to my need for gluten free fare and I was served gorgeous gluten free bread with oil and balsamic. We loved this place and our only criticism was the high prices. We will definitely come back but only if we plan for a special occasion.
A wonderful evening - the food was great but the atmosphere was especially good, really buzzing. Also the service was superb - quite exceptional!
Very pleasant meal with excellent service . Need to book early as will miss the opportunity of eating here .

It was our first experience of the national coliseum and we thoroughly enjoyed it.The menu choices were okay but good value for money even when drinks were added. We loved being able to come back and have our desert in the interval. Would definitely recommend to friends.
First-rate cuisine reflected in the 2-course set-menu, in the service of all staff and the ambiance. Only reservation was the relative price of extras, 2 glasses of wine, 1 salad, 1 potatoes.
Pleasant atmosphere, great food and the Maitre d was very pleasant and knowledgeable
My second visit and just as good as the first time. Going again in April.

Interesting decor with good food
Very successful as pre-ballet venue with great option of coming back in the interval for a drink and pudding/cheese
Our pre theatre dinner at the (ENO) American Bar was excellent,. The food and service was very good. Thoroughly enjoyable evening.

Brilliant experience all round. Great decor and ambience. Lovely, friendly, helpful service from staff. Super yummy, interesting food and cocktails. We tried crocodile, camel, ostrich, kangaroo and bugs! (There are some more mainstream and veggie options as well for the less adventurous.) Don't regret a penny of cost. Well worth it. Will be back.

I've been to Archipelago a number of times and it never fails to put a smile on my face, the decor, ambiance and service really make this place a fun and interesting dining experience.  The menu has a good mix of the unusual, the exotic and more "normal" things for the less adventurous diner. The staff are courteous, attentive and knowledgeable and the decor really adds to the overall atmosphere of the restaurant.  Bring back the chocolate covered scorpions though!
Outstanding quality and a unique culinary experience down to the very unusual menu which we took full advantage of and enjoyed every mouthful. Highly recommend the Gnu (wildebeest).

From the smell of incense and the feel of peebles at the door to the decor inside, Archipelago makes you feel that your on holiday. I ordered the lunch sharing menu and was satisfied. There are a number rare dishes on the menu that I haven't encountered anywhere else. Worth checking out.

All the reviews that we had read of Archipelago had been positive but I am not sure that anything can prepare you for a restaurant that - "invites you on a sensory dinnig journey".

The food was unusual in description although perhaps not so unusual in taste. Having said that the dishes were cooked extrememely well - particularly the crocodile starter and gnu main course.

The atmosphere was intimate and the staff attentive, without being intrusive.

Would I go again? Definitely

This branch of Noura feels more like a cafe and in the evening we were pretty much the only people there. However, same good food, friendly and efficient staff so good overall if a little lacking in ambience.

I would recommend Noura Mayfair for a enjoyable group dinner: the food is very tasty and fairly priced, the ambience is relaxed and the personnel friendly, although not always attentive to the needs of the customers.

It was a birthday gift to me from last year. We had a booking we had to cancel because of Covid-19. So we booked again same restaurant when restrictions were lifted.
The restaurant looked nice with the chandeliers and blossom. The staff were very friendly and respectful. The food was nice.Thank you.
They are still closed as they do not have outside space. They let me know 1 day before arrival after having it booked for 3 weeks+ was fuming
We thoroughly enjoyed our ore theatre meal and excellent service thank you

On the lobby level of the beautiful St. James Hotel and Club in the Mayfair section of London, this is a lovely, elegant bistro, serving fine cocktails and excellent wines, by the bottle or by the glass.  It is a perfect gathering spot for post-work socializing, or a lovely dinner for two.  Service is utterly perfect.
Beautiful food as always. Although it is usually quiet, it only adds to the exceptional quality of service and care! Absolutely love this branch of Spaghetti House and will be returning soon!
Five stars on the food. The wait staff were good, but not outstanding. They did honor my request of no cilantro (coriander) with no problem.

This booking did not happen. Purely by chance, one of our party stopped by the restaurant on his way to meet the rest of us in a local pub, and was told the restaurant was closed due to a shortage of staff.
