It would seem this might have had something to do with the Spain - Italy Euro semi-final. We had to make a last-minute reservation with a different restaurant. Anyway, no explanation or apology from the restaurant - very disappointing to say the least.

Straightforward, good quality Italian food with plenty of choice, including a variety of vegetarian and fish dishes, A simple setting that makes the most of the limited space without feeling crowded. Pleasant, friendly service and reasonable prices (we did not take up the fixed-price offer).
Amazing experience !!!
I can't recommend this. Food was poor and flavourless. Ambience matched the food
Lovely meal

I arrived and asked for the table under my name and they did not have our reservation. I showed them my confirmation on the app, and they still did not know we had a reservation. We then had to wait over 20 mins for a table. It was very disappointing. The service was not quick at all once we sat down, and we needed to be somewhere by 9:30pm. Several of our dishes came out nearly cold from the kitchen. Overall, not a great experience and would not go back.
Perfect location for a girls Christmas day out. Food and drinks were great value, however the service was a little slow.

It is the attention to detail that makes eating at the Strand such a pleasure. The staff can't do enough for you. I have now been to this venue twice for pre theatre lunch and both times have been impressed. I would recommend this venue to anyone.

Having a Central London reasonably-priced carvery buffet meal in lovely rooms with neighbouring rooms for further relaxation and conversation - it's fabulous in this day and age. For us as a grown-up family, or as individuals meeting up with other people, it is a safe haven in the West End, close to the City and Thames. It is where quality is expected to be very good to excellent, friendly and cost-effective - booking is easy online. A real asset to the Strand!
Central London location. Friendly staff, good food and reasonably priced
A very nice welcome despite the fact that we were half an hour early, nice drinks and meal and friendly service.
First class, our 2nd time for afternoon tea and as great as ever.
We all loved it! Great food and service
Amazing waiter and bar staff, made us classic cocktails which were no longer on the menu. The waiter absolutely went above and beyond which made me very happy!
Was a pleasant experience. Came here for mine and my partners 3rd year anniversary and we throughly enjoyed ourselves! Thank you for an epic time!
I like the hard rock cafe, the food is great but expensive and lots of cool items in their collection to look at. I love it. I love rock, hard and cafe. I love hard rock cafe.

My experience at the Hard Rock Cafe was amazing. The food was so tasty! The service was amazing and the staff were so lovely and helpful. I will definitely be returning here. It‚Äôs 100% a place i would recommend to everyone!

I had booked a table for my son's 18th birthday and specified this on the booking.  I arrived at 6 pm to be told my table wasn't ready and given a buzzer.  After 25 mins of waiting, I approached the check-in to be told that my table had been given to someone else.  I was then taken to a table and waited around 35 mins after I had my drinks for the food to appear and no mention of the special occasion we had booked in for.  The food was nice but lack of deserts.
What a fantastic place to have Dinner we will definitely be back
Lovely lunch! And loved our waitress ‚ú® we had a great timers will be back!

We visited Hard Rock due to our love for cocktails and collecting glasses!

The food was decent, with a limited menu there wasn‚Äôt really much choice compared to other restaurants I‚Äôve visited.

The menu was a QR code but we had to ask for the WiFi password as there was no phone service - for a lower-level restaurant this should be considered and maybe password put on QR code cards?

The service was so slow, not the food/drink but our wait to leave. After 20 mins of being finished I asked someone nearby for the bill - which didn‚Äôt come. I then had to ask a further 2 times before someone even appeared with the bill - really dragging out our visit and making us irritable.

We would visit again as we love exploring the decor. Unfortunately although Pina Colada was on the menu, it wasn‚Äôt available at the bar. With such a limited menu anyway it would help to have what you are saying you‚Äôve got.

Would wait for the full menu before returning or we may visit a sister restaurant in London.

Family meal out, first since lock down.
We had to wait a long time for our food but the really made up for it by giving us free drinks.
Eat out to help out made our bill very pleasing and the food was great!

Considering the current conditions the staff did a great job of making it feel like normal.
The Hurricane as always was perfect

Although our waiter was very kind, it took some time before we were noticed and helped. The food was good, when I asked for no tomatoe they asked me if it was because of allergies and if I would like some bacon instead.
The New York Cheesecake was amazing, but WAY too much. They could half the portion and lower the price for this one, couldn't even eat half and I LOOOVE Cheesecake. So that was a waste of a good 5 quid.

I went to Hard Rock Cafe of Piccadilly Circus and I did not find anything special. I booked a table, and honestly the table was not nice. I saw all the waitress passing in a rush to the kitchen etc. The atmosphere very simple, I was expecting better. I have visited Hard Rock Cafe in Colombia, Madrid and Edinburgh and them were great but in London Piccadilly, I felt that it was not Hard Rock Cafe. Probably Hard Rock Cafe  in Green Park is better but is going to take long time to get back.
Daughters 4th birthday.... and the staff invited all the other guests  at the place to join in singing happy birthday üëçüèªüëçüèªüòÅ

I want to start the review by saying this is probably my favourite type of restaurant. I love going to all of the Hard Rock Cafe. The food was great and the service was equally great, however, it was quite expensive but that was expected. It was worth it for the music environment and the entertaining and friendly staff. One problem that we had was that I booked the wrong Hard Rock Cafe because they are both so close to each other. Maybe this could be made more clear on the website as to which one is which. Overall great experience although I didn‚Äôt get to hold Slash‚Äôs guitar in the vault. :(
Great atmosphere, server was  very attentive, food  was delicious and reasonably priced
Amazing restaurant, made my husbands 40th birthday meal so special!! They sang  to him and brought him a lovely dessert too!! Great experience overall
delicious food, delicious drinks, friendly staff.  100% fun!
Need to offer Vegan choices there were vegetarian but not vegan which was a surprise .

Had a fantastic visit !!! My friends and myself had  a superb late afternoon meal we had a great table  the food was excellent we had 2x double cheese burgers and ribs !!! And 2x apple cobblers and chocolate brownie !!! Great but what made our meal so enjoyable was the fantastic service we had from "ANETE " she is the best really she is brilliant and a real credit to hard rock !! Please pass on our thanks for making our visit special , will visit again soon and highly recommed you STUART , Veronika & korenila the v&k Superstars üåüüåü

Mixed review, service was very slow, half an hour to get a drink. Food very salty.
Lovely ambience and brilliant theme but preferred the overall experience at the Old Park Lane restaurant.
Great food great place!! To music lobera is the best place to go!!

This Hard Rock had only been open for a week so they could do with some tuning up on the service. Also some key hard rock menu options you'd expect weren't on there but overall you cant beat a hard rock.  You pretty much know what you're gonna get. A bit lame that they had Noel Gallagher 's guitar on the wall with 2 photos of Noel being blocked by Liam out front tho!
Staff were very welcoming and funny very good service
Absolutely great vibrant place. Most definitely would recommend for anyone with a taste for fine cuisine and good vibes
Amazing place. Food was lovely and so were the staff. Greg was the best! We enjoyed ourselves.
A Birthday celebration. Everything was perfect and we  will be going back again. Excellent service and great food!
Taste is good however quantity of the food is very less for the amount
It was lovely my hubby enjoyed it and so did i, definitely going again!
Booked restaurant for a birthday celebration, all involved had a fantastic time. Will definitely return
Birthday lunch for my friend and was great fun and food was tasty.
Our chef was amazing and had a laugh with us the whole time

Worth every penny, I do not provide this recommendation lightly. The experience and the quality of the food makes it worth it. We sent ¬£200 between three people and that was for a 7-course meal with drinks on the side. If you fail to enjoy Benihana at Piccadilly - you did something wrong!

Fabulous atmosphere, service, and food all added up to an unforgettable experience. This was our first visit and will definitely not be our last, I cant wait to dine here again and neither can my family.

The chef was slightly bummed out; put on a show but it seemed more forced than him actually enjoying it.
1. Soup: very salty
2. Crab appetizer: good! Best one
3. Steak: overcooked when clearly asked medium rare
4. Seafood diablo: not that flavorful
Overall: had high expectations
Enjoyed the evening, staff and chef very friendly, tasty food if a little pricey
Over priced and very small portions, entertainment by the chef is good tho

Lovely food and chef cooking was very entertaining! Overall we enjoyed our dinner!
Small let down was missing umbrella at the end of the night (we were told to leave it by the entrance together with other umbrellas). Perhaps its not entirely restaurant fault and good that it wasnt raining anymore when we left!

I visited on Saturday for the first time. The whole experience was amazing. If you are ever in London travel to Picadilly and try this out.......you won't be disappointed !
Huge thanks to Greg our chef....you were phenomenal üòÅ

Ever since he read about Benihana in a management case study, he has been wanting to eat here. But somehow we hadn't got around to it.
Finally, booked this place for his birthday. Good sushi, very good teppenyaki. Since I have a prawn allergy, they cooked my food separately in the kitchen, vs the communal cooking for everyone at the table.
Benihana waits for the whole table (8-9 places) to fill up before they start serving the food, so you may either have to wait a tad bit too long to get your food, or not have enough time for your drinks & starters before the food starts arriving.
That said, the food was delicious.

It was a fun experience watching the chef cooking in front of you and the service was very good. Food was yummy (steak or cod is highly recommended) with decent portion. It won't come with a cheap price tag but it's definitely a must try! :)

Good fun watching the chefs cook everything in front of you - they certainly put on a show! We went for the 6 course menu for ¬£29 which gave us a variety of dishes. However, I wouldn't say the portions were huge.

I think we were the only table in the restaurant to not have had a birthday celebration!

Nous avons tr√®s bien mang√© et la mise en sc√®ne est amusante .
Quand nous avons r√©serv√© avec vous, vous nous avez mis au courant d'un prix promotionnel valable jusqu'au 30 novembre . Nous avons obtenu ce prix ( ¬£29 par personne pour un menu de 6 plats-excellent prix rapport/ qualit√©) mais il fallait qu'on le demande - on n'allait pas nous le proposer. C'est donc gr√¢ce √† Open Table que nous avons √©t√© mis au courant de ce prix promotionnel

This time was not so good like i expected
No particolary attention for children
Better for dinner

Enjoyed a lovely lunch with our son. Great experience for kids and enjoyable food.
Overall a bit pricey, but good for a special treat.
Great food. Great fun. Great service.  Can't go wrong going here
This place is great. Give it a try, you won't be disappointed;)

My wife and I took some good friends here on Sunday night. Althouth it was early (6pm) the staff wre ready to accomosate us.
The chef, Charley, was excellent in both preparing the food and also being the evening's entertainment.
It is important to be prepared to be a little participative or interactive with the chef's ways. in the end it heightens the reward of the evening.
I have been to this restaurant quite a number of times with firends, relatives, staff and clients, and never once have I or my guests been disappointed.

My first time at Benihana was a good experience. The set price 8 course menu at ¬£25 plus sides (not many really needed) was good value. Great cocktails and fairly priced.

Our teppanyaki chef was entertaining and the food was well cooked, well flavoured and speedily and charmingly served. The place was largely full of Japanese customers which is a good sign in my view. A well laid out interior with cleverly spaced teppanyaki tables that sit up to 9 around the hot top and two can be used together for big parties. Clever.

¬£163 for three people inc service and two cocktails each is not bad value in my opinion, with entertainment thrown in too!
You can trust Benihana to provide a good meal at a decent price. The chef did his usual spectacular performance. Specially good for kids. The staff was very friendly and efficient. I recommend it!

The atmosphere and ambience of the restaurant was live and buzzing.  Our chef was fantastic, friendly & entertaining & the food was delicious, can‚Äôt get enough of that ginger sauce.  The food & drinks are quiet pricey so if you don‚Äôt want to pay over the odds go when there‚Äôs a deal on, its so worth it.  Only thing that spoiled it was the loved up couple who kept eating each others faces off-not something you want to see while you're trying to eat.  All in all had a wonderful experience.
Food average but entertaining chefs
Great for a celebration with a group of friends.
Excellent entertainment and value for money.
Good food, Resturant a little tired

great place to go for a great show, food was good not great, however service and atmosphere great! would recommend if you are thinking of going, however there was no special toptable offer, the offer available through toptable was also available on the menu...

another fun experience at Benihana. Took my Autsrlian cousins who loved it as well!

Thursdays, Friday's, Satrudays have the most atmosphere but still lively in the week.

Food was fresh, but the taste is a bit bland. What I could not tolerate is that when the chef served the grilled food to us, his spatula  touched everyone's used plate and hence left over sauce, etc, and in my opinion, successfully spreading germs among the two parties at the table. Unlikely to go again for that particular reason, even though the children liked it and the price offered thru Toptable was fair compared with other Teppanyaki restaurants in town.
Had lunch with a friend and our five teenagers. The food and service were excellent and they did not rush us away when we had finished.

Went for Sunday lunch with friends and were impressed by the quality of service, the humour of the staff and, of course, the beautiful food. A really lovely meal with a very reasonable bill at the end!
We enjoyed a very pleasant evening at Benihana, The service was efficient and friendly reflecting the easy ambience.

The offer is brilliant value for money and would recommend to anyone.  The food, service and atmosphere is great, however if there are only two of you and you're there to catch-up it could prove slightly difficult.  Would definitely book again.
Decent food, decent venue, it is what it is. Rather dated now, hasnt changed in 20 years. Average to good but there are better places to go!

Benihana Piccadilly delivered an entertaining meal as usual.  We had a Japanese family at our table which somewhat dented the chef's antics as he could hardly pretend to be Japanese!  The ¬£19 set menu is still good value for money, but the portions of fish we had (black cod and seabass) were very small.  They also forgot to give us the California roll sushi course.  We couldn't have eaten it at the end of the meal as we were full, so they gave it to us to take away - nice for lunch today!
Benihana in Piccadilly is a great place and excellent value for money. Good fun and different to have chef cook the food in front of us.

Benihana in Picadilly was great! We had 7 courses for ¬£19.00 and every one of them tasted great. The service was brilliant, our waiter Tom was the only gay in Japan! Would definitely go there again whether there is an offer or not.

Took my mum and dad here for their 40th wedding anniversary.  Between all of us, we chose the range of meat/fish options.  All were lovely but the salmon and prawns were particularly good.  Our Eastern European chef was very skilled and highly entertaining throughout.  Would recommend and the food is great.

Seven courses for ¬£19 provides excellent value. Was the perfect amount of food. The food itself was solid, not special. Benihana has lost the dazzle but it is consisently good. Our chef was much duller than other surrounding ones, and drinks are dear. Still an enjoyable if predictable meal. Great deal for big groups.

We enjoyed the ¬£19 for 7 courses offer at Benihana Piccaddilly which was very good value for money. Perhaps not so much 7 courses as a 7 accompanyments but the food was very fresh and tasty and plentiful. We did not get as much of an elaborate show on our table of 3 as perhaps some of the larger tables but the chef was very friendly and professional, and being quite early on in the evening the atmosphere was relaxed and amiable.

Benihana's food is fantastic. What really makes it are the sauces, even the salad dressing is amazing. The service is excellent, the staff are lovely, and the preparation of food is entertaining. We went here as a celebration and it wasn't disappointing in the least. Definitely recommend. The sushi is amazing as well, though the portions are small - but probably just in comparison to lower end sushi places that pack it with rice to make it look bigger!

We went to Benihana - Piccadilly for my 30th Birthday.  The Party menu worked out as good value for money at ¬£44 per head for 3 courses and wine.  The party menu options were restrictive - Salmon & Chicken or Prawn and Steak.  Our chef was good fun as he set fire to things, threw food to us and chopped and slid the food around!  A good night out with a fun atmosphere and good quality food - pricey - but good for a one off or celebration and better value on the Party or Top Table offers.

Benihana was every bit as good as the other reviews suggested. Value for money is great because the ¬£18 for 7 course meal really does fill you up, and for good reason! Starter soup, salad, sushi, 2 choices of meat/fish/prawns egg fried rice. What's not to like?

Depending on the chef you get you may be fed food, see the chef throw his saltshaker into his hat, and always, the fabulous flame grill!

worth it!! A winner!

My partner and I went to Benihana on a Thursday night. It was very busy but we were shown to our seats quickly. Our table of 8 soon filled up and we got chatting to our dinner companions. The waitress was...how can I put it...slow. VERY slow. We ordered drinks that took a good 30 mins to come but we couldn't see her anywhere to get her attention. We had booked for the ¬£18 a head menu and ordered a side of beef steak which was lovely. In fact, all the food was amazing. Great venue, good food. :)

It was my third time here and once again we had a great night at Benihanas! As there was 10 of us we had our own pod - the chef was excellent and got everyone involved! We had the set menu, so it was superb value for money and overall a thoroughly enjoyable night! We be back again soon!
Reaaly had a great meal. Chef was brilliant as the cooking was done in front of us and served. Waiters were helpful and took pride in serving. Highly recommended.
Amazing - a real experience, we will definately be back!

We had a good night out at Benihana.  Had the ¬£16.50 menu - we all managed to eat it all - it was plenty and was very nice, but calling it 7 courses may be a little misleading! Other reviews have said the decor needs updating and that is very true - it looks a bit tired.  A good night out overall and the ¬£16.50 menu is reasonable value for money
food taste is not bad, but slightly less  a deal than Matsuri on their 50% off promotion

Benihana was like watching a show and eating - we really enjoyed it! The 7 course deal is actually just 7 dishes, so your main counts as 4 (veg, rice and 2 meat). The portions were quite small so we ended up getting some extras. Drinks and sides/deserts were expensive, so overall we spent a lot more than we planned, but I would go back for a special occasion as the food was delicious.

Good value for the 7 course special offer, chef was entertaining, food average. If you want a meal which is different and fun. Then go to benihana, if you looking for a romantic meal for two, then this isn't the place to go.

Benihana

The food arrived promptly, which was great as we used the restaurant for a client lunch and it is often quite difficult to fit one into an hour! Food tasted fresh and well cooked, was really impressed and will definitely use again!

Benihana gave a very pleasant experience to myself and my party of 7. The 7 course meal was good value but note that it does sound slightly better than it turns out. One of the 'courses' is a bowl of rice.

The deal is basically each person recieves 5 small dishes: soup, salad, californian roll (sushi), rice and veg and then chooses 2 types of meat. From salmon, chicken, beef, prawns, and some other fish I forget.

The best is probably the prawns with the fish and beef also pretty good.
Our tepenyaki cheif was really boring didn't even attempt to entertain us, no tricks up his sleeves, he didn't even speak with us, the most boring tepenyaki we've been too.

Benihana is good fun - enjoyable atmosphere. However wouldn't have been great value if not for top table deal we had and we felt a little rushed as i think they wanted to get a second lunchtime sitting. Would like to try again, perhaps for dinner with larger group.
Good food and polite helpful staff however, we felt that they were a bit cheeky with the alcohol bill.  We had the ¬£15 toptable offer menu but the two glasses of wine we had each doubled the bill.
Took my boyfriend there for his birthday and he absolutely loved it.  How could he not? The chef was throwing shrimps across the table into his mouth!
Fabulous! Great ambiance exceptional service
Amazing restaurant as always. This is our favourite restaurant in London.

I had a late lunch with my friend here on Sunday. We always get a mix of ‚Äúthings‚Äù and share. The food and service was excellent. The Burrata always tastes like the food of Gods and the prawns in chilli sauce were to die for. Everything is so fresh and tasty.
Second visit to the restaurant. Last time we sat at the bar which is a great place to people watch and very ‚Äúbuzzy‚Äù. This time we had a table. I think I‚Äôd recommend the bar seating.
Staff are efficient and so friendly whilst keeping safety in mind.
A great place to eat after a browse in Fortnums or visiting the RA.
Fabulous food, service and atmosphere once again from this legendary restaurant- one of my favourite Italian restaurants in the world
This restaurant has managed to keep its quality over many many years and it is always a pleasure to visit. The only problem is getting a reservation! Book ahead it‚Äôs really popular.

Very slow service, waited 45 minutes for our order to be taken. Pasta dishes were excellent. Beef carpaccio was good but a bit mean with the beef and way too much oil.
Very pleasant and lively restaurant just a shame that the service was poor on this occasion.
Dreadful and largely inedible food, and poor service - but the place does look fantastic. Maybe go just for a coffee.

I've booked a few times now for work breakfasts and have decided to stop. Every time I'm given a strict time slot and when I try to move it 15 minutes later or earlier I'm told it's just not possible, but each time the restaurant is 3/4 empty when I get there so I just lost precious time in my meetings because I was lied to. The service is not great, several times we had to stop and try to get the server's attention. The food is ok, it's a convenient location for breakfasts but you're made to feel like it's your privilege to be allowed to dine there.
Poor service and average food

Absolutely delicious Parma and Bolognese! Boston friend recommended it.
Wish I lived in London!

I love everything about this place, the staff the atmosphere and the food is very affordable! And if you like people spotting this is definately the place to be. Last time I went it was my birthday and the staff suprised me with this gorgeous plate with various pastries and fruits. They also had written "happy birthday Sandra '' with melted chocolate, truly amazing!

i specifically asked for a table not at the entrance and i had the first one at the entrance !
good food

I had perfect Eggs Benedict at Cecconi's, and the pink grapefruit was cut to perfection. The place was a bit empty though, despite having to go there quite early because apparently there was no more availability at a later time.

Very enjoyable, again! We were placed at a table for 4 instead of 2 which was not ideal. Originally we were placed at the table by the door which was very, very cold. However, the staff were very accomodating when we asked to move and the whole meal was a real treat.

I'm already looking forward to our next weekend lunch in Cecconis!

We went to Cecconi's in Mayfair, London on 25th February 2012 for brunch. We were both very pleased with the selection and taste of the food and drink. We would recommend it to other diners and we will be booking to go back here again soon!
Had a lovely time. Food was served quickly and was to a high standard.

Restaurant telephoned me two hours before to say we had to vacate the table by 2.30pm (our booking was for 1pm). I do not want to be clock watching on a Sunday at lunchtime, so was not very pleased.  I am not sure why they did this as they were plenty of empty tables when we left at 2.45pm !!
Waitress Aliena was incredibly kind and made our experience truly unique

My sister's and I really enjoyed the experience. Everything single staff was so attentive and caring . All very friendly and smiling all the time . What a wonderful setting ! The food was so tasty and beautifully presented. We enjoyed every bit of our experience. Even the bill came in a little pineapple box so cute and clever . Well done ! We will definitely be back .
Food was amazing - great portions too! It‚Äôs a vibe! One of my favourite restaurants - oh and love the interiors in the women‚Äôs toilet üòç
Birthday treat and first day out in 18 months without the kids!!!
The table was 15 mins late so had to wait outside in the cold, they offered mulled wine on the house but the cup was very very small.  Food was amazing.

Disappointing food overall. When you order a fritto starter they give you one stuffed olive! You should get at least 2 or 3 per portion. The downstairs feels quite tight, no windows, quite suffocating. Food was just average. Orecchiette were ok, parmigiana disappointing, carne battuta was nice but again nothing special. wine list is good but I was expecting something much better. There are many Italian restaurants in London a lot better, cheaper and more authentic .
Given the Covid circumstances, the menu choice was very good. Overall the meal was superb.
Lovely team!

Good, authentic Italian cooking, 'trattoria' style, which means 'not fine food', which is not necessarily a bad thing. The deep-fried courgette flowers were very nice, as well as the fried calamari and prawns (very fresh) and the roast suckling pig (very tasty). However the roast potatoes that came with the suckling pig were vile (yes, I mean it). They were completely burnt and therefore inedible. As to the restaurant, it is quite outdated, with no vibe. It is also extremely noisy and expensive. ¬£135 for two people. We only had a small starter, a small main and we shared the suckling pig with potatoes. No dessert. Wine: only a carafe of white wine shared by the two of us. I would recommend this restaurant for the food, but I find it too noisy and expensive, so no value for money.  The service was average. I also noticed that the restaurant manager was so focused on serving the people sitting in the table next to hours and totally ignored us. We were clearly not as important as them! For all these reasons, I don't think I will visit this restaurant again in the future.
Delicious regional Italian cooking. Loved that you could order everything in small or large plates to share. Perfect for a special occasion.

Is not good restaurant, expensive and small dishes and not so delicious
Not value for money
Fabulous all Italian wine list with vintage gems at reasonable prices.Food was good and not mucked around.

Had a really nice time at this restaurant. Was pleasantly surprised to know someone else with same surname as me!

Reviews stated this place was cosy, casual and good atmosphere. When we arrived I instantly felt under dressed for the occasion and it gave off romantic vibes.
I was with my friend just for a catch up so at times it did seem a little too romantic.

Food quality was excellent but would say price paid is a little steep for amount of food you get.
Service was great and we tipped our own percentage against how meal went.
Would come back with my partner or family.

Still the best Italian kitchen in London, and the small dish options let you try a wide variety. We tried the Roman ghetto snacks, duck pappardelle, liver with crisp polenta and unusual sausages with sides of pumpkin and Italian-spinach. Good service even as they became busier. Highly recommended

Really good quality small dishes. Pasta cooked to perfection. Both Lamb and chicken were superb.
Were seated opposite the flame grill which was to hot but staff happy to move us when requested.
Overall an excellent pre theatre meal and will definitely be going again.

Food was good, nothing made me need to return, the butternut squash side dish was notable and the sea bream tartare. We had the also had the starter salad (ok), brisket (tough), a fish pasta dish (pleasant), ox Cheek (can't comment to that). Our waiter was pushy - pushing us to order initially then stating while we were half way through our starters that our main course would arrive in 5 mins time which is just bazaar. He kept leaning over us to pick up plates or water, it was just really annoying. I hadn't been here for some years and sorry to say I was disappointed.
This is a little gem in the heart of Soho! Delicious food and great ambience.
Fabulous food, service and atmosphere, will return for a more leisurely meal when not rushing off to the theatre.
Casual business lunch, great food and atmosphere, would definitely come back with friends!

If your sitting at the "bar" or at a table the ambience is great.  The waiter's & waitresses are knowledgeable about the food and wine, eager to give you advise.  This is not cheap dining but in our opinion well worth the extra the trio of raw seafood to start was incredible as was my pork tagliatelle - outstanding.

We went there for Sunday lunch and, being Italian, I can say that the starters, especially the "fritti romani" were very nice and homemade and the pasta too was amazing. I would have expected more from the mussels (like in a deep plate with some of their cooking liquid, instead they were a bit dry) and the squids, which were nice but a bit burnt. The chili bruschetta with pork neck steak was very juicy and tasteful, so was the dessert "le palle del nonno". I would definitely recommend it, even though the service was pretty average and the waiter was not really professional for the standard of the restaurant (serving men before women, serving wine in the wrong way and he did not recognize that the wine was corked).

I've been coming to Boca di Lupo for several years now. The food is still very good but I think it's suffering a little from it's own success. The restaurant is always filled to absolute capacity and there's not quite enough room for all the waiting staff which means chairs are frequently knocked. Also the two hour dining window is just too short as main courses take a while to be served due to the sheer number of diners. As a result it often feels rather rushed.
My wife and I dined here on the occasion of her birthday. It is a wonderfull experience and one we will remember fondly

The food is generally always very good and sometimes outstanding . Service has been consistently bad on nearly every visit and occasionally like on this last visit some ingredients are not well sourced - in this case the Suckling Pig was of poor quality and almost tasteless despite the dish being perfectly executed.

My first two choices of white wines were either not available because no cooled bottles were ready or out of stock. Italy has so many fine craft beer producers it is very sad to see 'Peroni and Moretti as the only choices on the menu.

The weaknesses mentioned above are easy to correct. The kitchen continues to produce very well executed dishes from many regions in Italy and some of the best Italian cooking in London.

Had such a great pre-theatre visit. We ate tapas-style and the dishes were delicious, imaginitive and came out quickly. Only suggestion would be for slightly more vegetarian options. I didn't starve, but the hot food options were fairly limited.

Fantastic, attentive service and wonderful wine list. I loved the food and atmosphere here. When the restaurant is full, it certainly is cosy, but that didn't ruin the experience.

Would love to go back - when I can next afford it!
Brilliant - simply the best Italian food in London

Had a great meal at Bocca Di Lupo - all of the courses were beautifully presented, thoughtfully combined flavors and we really enjoyed it! The sommelier was kind and quick to suggest a by-the-glass option according to our tastes. Our waiter was a little absent and short with us, which was frustrating. Hard to get a hold of (didn't stop by very often so we were often thirsty for more wine or water).

The atmosphere of the restaurant was lovely. Very warm and cozy with gorgeous lighting and a nice, lively noise level. There were several groups celebrating various occasions.

Overall I would recommend Bocca Di Lupo

We had lunch on Sunday for 4 people.
It was first time to have lunch hire for us but we really loved the foods!
I had squid ink pasta and that was absolutely delicious.
enjoyable, different Italian. Lots of fun.

Fabulous food. Great service - attentive, knowledgeable & helpful with complementary choices & portion sizes. Having previously enjoyed Tamarind Mayfair, we were delighted to come across this restaurant by chance on a birthday weekend trip & were so pleased we did! The surprise treat at the end was much appreciated. Highly recommended and we will certainly be back!
Amazing food a bit pricey but delish
The food was excellent and the atmosphere was great.  It was pricey given the size of entrees / tapas but would definitely recommend it.

Second time I've visited Tamarind. The food is delicous and the service was fantastic. Our server took great care of me and my partner who was running very late. She ensured our food arrived quickly so we could still get to the theatre on time and made me feel really welcome and that nothing was too much bother.  Highly recommend.

We were seated and it took our server 10 minutes to come over and then he literally did not even say hello offer anything about the menu nothing and then we were ignored for the rest of the evening by hand. Awful.
Not very accommodating
It was a lovely place. Amazing food and friendly staff.

We had a lovely evening at The Tamarind Kitchen.
The waiter Aliston was exceptional, very attentive and offered other suggestions from the menu to help with our choices.
All the staff were very good and we were pleased to see that they seemed happy with a healthy sense of humour.

Beautiful interior, attentive, friendly service and excellent food. We had a few familiar classics like Saag Paneer and kulfi, but also some creative things like an excellent soft shell crab.  All were delicious and fresh.

The ambience and service is great but two main issues:

1) while the starters (tempura prawns and mushroom truffles) were v good, the quality of our mains was nowhere near what you get in this part of London. The risotto was too heavy on the cheese and the seared cod lacked flavour.

2) i asked for a virgin old fashion (as i dont drink alcohol) but wad charged the going rate of ¬£12 for an actual old fashion. When i queried, i was told they are charging me for some in house syrup which honestly didnt make any sense but by that point i wanted to get out of there.

The service, music and ambience is great but definitely improve on food.
Food was amazing but the service was outstanding!!!
Very tasteful food and excellent service. Perfect wine choises.

Very cosy atmosphere,  with excellent service staff. Had the best lobster tagliolini ever and not forgetting the 100 year old receipe lasagna! A bit expensive but what you pay is what you get. Unforgettable birthday evening with the husband. Will definitely return!
Nice restaurant. Friendly staff and a friendly ambience. Expensive
A great night had celebrating our wedding anniversary!!
Love their small plate so we can try more things..lamb is a must try and the grilled asparagus. Loved it. Went their twice.. prefer to go there in the evening

Value for money, food and drinks flowed for the allotted time. God to experience everything on the menu. Our waiter was very accommodating and tipped him extra. In a smaller room to other brunches I‚Äôve been to but still a vibe
Two birthdays. Food was excellent. Drinks excellent. Service was really good. Would go again.
Really lovely food, with friendly staff and great atmosphere. Definitely worth a visit!
Delicious food, incredible atmosphere and service as usual. Kate looked after us so well and even a mask couldn‚Äôt hide her warm friendly nature. Always a go-to in soho and stokey! üíö

As a family, we are loyal The Good Egg fans but unfortunately this time didn't cut it! In the 12 months, 4 out of 5 times we had to go to Soho just because it is impossible to book/walk in at Stoke Newington. But unfortunately the service at Soho is always lacking! Other than the manager lady, most the waiters are impossible to get attention of! I even had to get up and literally find one to be able to order at one point. We always try to oversee the service as we love the food but this time food wasn't up to scratch either. Everything was lukewarm other than the ZFC Burger, the aubergines were burnt while being fried. To finish it off, our table wasn't cleared for 15 mins and took us ages to pay! (not even mentioning the prices! ¬£100 for 4 people brunch!) Unfortunately we won't be returning to Soho, Stokey? Maybe...
Great food - service is a little slow, but food definitely makes up for it!  Would definitely recommend to a friend
Amazing food in a great central location. Would always recommend
Piano music was loud if you are placed too near to it. Food was good but waitress a little forgetful. Never the less, a nice experience.

An amazing experience. Yes a little pricey but totally worth it. Sandwiches were topped up twice and had a huge selection of teas!! We spent 2.5 hours just soaking it all in. As a special treat it‚Äôs absolutely perfect!!!
Most delicious, most wonderful and enjoyable afternoon. We all liked it immensely and the food and presentation, including the service was exceptional. Will come again! No doubt
Must fo for a full London experience!
It was an excellent afternoon tea. I will visit the cafe again.

This has become my go-to spot for high tea when I visit London because the prices are reasonable, the service is outstanding, the offerings are yummy, and, honestly, the location is quite convenient to my everyday activities while in London.
Lovely venue, service was fantastic. A very enjoyable afternoon for Mum‚Äôs birthday.
Great service,  gorgeous setting,  lovely and plentiful food.  And the Lychee and Rose tea was delicious.
Wonderful and the best service !

Afternoon Tea here was a real treat. The Oscar Wilde room has a real wow factor; it's well worth a visit for the decor, let alone the outstanding service and food.  Food was plentiful, with offers of seconds, and was thoughtfully tailored to our dietary needs, to the point of serving food separately to avoid cross-contamination.  Although advertised as a traditional tea there were special touches that set it apart, such as the amuse-bouche of a goats cheese muffin with a syringe of apple juice, and a palate cleanser of flavoured iced tea. The cakes were stunning, and the scones possibly the fluffiest and nicest we've had.  Everything was fresh and beautifully presented. Service was kind, attentive and unrushed, and the music (live pianist) was pitched at the ideal background level to allow private conversation but not be too intrusive.  I would highly recommend this; it was excellent value and compares very well to the other top Afternoon Tea venues in London.
Excellent service and ambience! My only little complaint is that the seats were a bit too low and uncomfortable! Didn‚Äôt detract from the overall experience though !

Second time I have had afternoon tea here, still excellent, though at full price it is a tad expensive.  Previously I had an offer of tea for two for ¬£65.  This time it was ¬£55 each.  Perhaps ¬£45 to ¬£50 would be more appropriate.  However, that would not prevent me from booking again, we enjoyed the experience thoroughly!

We had a wonderful champagne afternoon tea to mark a special occasion.  Food was delicious and there was plenty of it!  The staff were very friendly and attentive, gave us information about the teas before helping us to select one but never intrusive.

Thursday 24th March, afternoon tea at 4pm
Service was superb, nothing too much trouble. Oscar Wilde bar is a fantastic venue and the accompanying pianist was great.
Food was absolutely fantastic, from the sandwiches and savouries through to the cakes and scones. My gorgeous wife and I enjoyed every minute.

The food was delicious, well presented and imaginative. It was nice to get a palette cleanser between savoury and sweet courses.

The room (Oscar Wilde) was a little dark in terms of lighting but very comfortable and had a calm and relaxing ambience.

In terms of price it was expensive (¬£62 each which included a glass of champagne, and a service charge) but I expected it to be so. Happy to pay it for a special occasion.

Another very enjoyable afternoon at Hotel Cafe Royal, with such a variety of savoury and sweet delights we could hardly finish it, especially as we sampled the wonderful fruit cake too.  Stunning decor, good service and great value with champagne Tea for two offer.
I did not realise it‚Äôs now completely vegan as did not check on website prior to booking.

An outstanding meal. Couldn't fault it . We had the red taster menu and every dish was superb. The restaurant had clearly gone to great efforts to minimise covid risks  with well spaced out tables and drapes hanging from the ceiling to provide  additional protection. It all felt very safe. Excellent attentive service. A wonderful place to go for a special meal.
This was our second visit to gauthier and the food didn‚Äôt disappoint, you couldn‚Äôt fault it. Unfortunately service wasn‚Äôt as good and we preferred the first floor seating area.
Amazing. Every part of the tasting menu was fantastic!!

outstanding from start to finish, impeccable service, superb food, now in my top 3 London restaurants. The Vegan tasting menu was awesome and one I will have again even though I am not vegetarian or vegan. You won't leave hungry!
It was lovely.  We did a pairing menu but one guest not drinking it was a pity that there wasn‚Äôt a pairing with non alcoholic drinks.  That side of three meal was a little disappointing.

We had an absolutely delicious dinner, remarkable for inventive and successful combinations of ingredients and flavours, and interspersed with several inter-course amuses bouches. A real treat!
My only quibble was the expensive wine list. There was nothing under ¬£30. The inclusion of a couple of house wines at a lower price would have put my overall score up to 5* throughout.

Overall very disappointing. We chose this restaurant for the vegan tasting menu. It was a lazy and thoughtless menu... and extremely overpriced. The service was pretentious and stuffy.. and we were not once offered a top up of our drinks... even though I clearly mentioned that we would be wanting to take a bottle after our initial drinks...

Absolutely awful experience.

Yet again absolute and total satisfaction with the food, the service and the ambiance. It is a gem of a restaurant where all the dishes never fail to please first the eyes and then the taste-buds. Our lunch visit was perfectly paced, the wines chosen to accompany starters and mains were, as always, superb and in terms of portion size one felt perfectly satisfied bearing in mind all the extras in-between. The double magnum cognac kept on the mantelpiece in the upstairs dinning room reminded me to end the meal with a small taste of its golden content and the two of us left feeling very lucky for being able to regularly visit this establishment. Thank you all very much and we are looking forward to our September visit.

Londons best kept secret,it appeared that most people there visited regularly.Value for money second to none.the wine is matched with the food by the glass and it's the only place I have visited where the wines match

The place is lovely, in an appartement like setting, with candles and white table clothes. The staff is friendly, helpful and professional.
I chose Gauthier because they offer a vegan tasting menu (8 dishes). Admittedly, I‚Äôve had better vegan food (some dishes could have been more refined, lovely desserts though) but just delighted with the fact that I can eat a whole vegan menu in a fine dining restaurant.
Knowledgable waiters, first class food and an unhurried pace. The tasting menu and wine were spot on. A really enjoyable experience, one we hope to repeat.

It was difficult to choose from several parts of the menu, so appealing did many of the dishes sound. The structure of the menu is  very sensible and it is well priced; you know exactly how much you will  be paying. Each course was delicious, with subtle but intense flavours. Service was outstanding. We were particularly impressed by the skill with which the sommelier judged when to top up our wine while ensuring the bottle lasted until the end of the meal,

Gauthier Soho is a firm favourite of mine and it certainly didn't disappoint this time.  The food is always exceptional, and with service to match.  I would recommend this restaurant to anyone.  For a special occasion the private dining rooms are lovely, and the tasting menus are incredible.

Lovely setting - calm, elegant and welcoming. Went for a birthday lunch as a treat and was not disappointed. A great selection of choices with good options for my dining companion, who is vegetarian. All the courses and the added extras were delicious and beautifully presented. The accompanying wines were well chosen and the sommelier charming. As were all the staff. Even with an extra dessert wine the bill was ¬£120 all in which is excellent value given the level of service, location and quality of the meal. I'd absolutely recommend Gauthier and will be returning soon
Excellent as always. Food, service and ambiance. Another wonderful anniversary well spent and will be back soon!

Originally booked for 5 friends for sat 1.30pm lunch but had to change to 3, I rang that morning but could only leave a message on arrival the message hadn't been received however this wasn't a problem & we were shown to a private room at the top of beautiful building where the room was quickly & professionally rearranged!
The food & service were outstanding..we opted for the set lunch menu which offers a good choice & exceptional value, we opted to include the champagne & wine, we asked just for white wine the quality of which was very good.
The food presentation was beautiful, the tastes were amazing we enjoyed amuse Bouche & pre desserts which were lovely bonuses. My friends starter wasn't as she imagined but this was dealt with very nicely & she was offered an alternative which she enjoyed, gluten free for me was well catered too. We enjoyed a wonderful afternoon & will be back when I'm next travelling to London.
The loin of venison form the recent autumn menu was absolutely fantastic!
Wine marks up are hefty and portions are a little small
Excellent food and service. We did enjoy their tasting menu. The risotto is always a classic and the rest still excellent.  Price in line with expectation for this level of quality.

I had visited Gauthier previously and had been impressed, however this time, our experience was decidedly average. A series of poor service elements really detracted from the excellent food. From the lack of wine list when we were given the menus, to having to ask twice before it was brought over, to being told the champagne we wanted was not on the menu, and the under sommelier couldn't describe the replacement because he it had only just arrived that morning and he "did not know the words in English". The waitress missed my glass and poured water all over my hand and the table and finally, when my husband tried to order some wine, he was told by the waiter he was "too busy"! Overall, the service was quite farcical but food quite nice.

beguiling small rooms that never cease to make you feel relaxed and happy to be there. Add excellent serious food, proper service, smart well chosen wine list at all price levels and not over the top prices

We have been here now in a large private room and just the two of us. This place exudes class. The menu options are a tasting menu, including a separate vegetarian menu, or a la carte. The food is beautiful to look at and tastes perfect. They don't over season the food and they change any dish you order to match allergies or intolerances. Leave the wine selection to the sommelier, he knows his stuff.

The whole experience is well crafted and the service is impeccable - no one looms near your table, but your glass and plates are never left empty. On the province to value ratio this place isn't cheap but it is worth every penny and pound for the food, wine and service.

We love this place, a real jewel in the back streets of Soho.
Great food, great service, excellent pacing between dishes! Perfect for dinners that communication matters (business, romantic etc)

What a wonderful dinner. The entire experience was superb. The service was attentive and unobtrusive. Presentation, good. Excellent wine list.
A special evening.

This was the best restaurant I've been to in a long while. Myself and a friend had the eight course tasting menu with the full wine pairing. It was a wonderful experience. We sat in the front room by the fire overlooking the street, it was an oasis of calm.

The food; wonderful. Inventive without being prissy with a sublime mix of tastes and textures.

Next the wine; beautifully paired with the food with some really interesting suggestions from the sommelier some of which sounded a little off-the-wall but all worked really well.

Lastly the service; the staff were really enthusiastic about what they were doing and it was a pleasure to be involved in what was for us, a great experience.
Just brilliant,one of the best lunches we have ever had.

Gauthier was outstanding for its food and service. I chose from the lunchtime menu and had fried fois gras, onglet and cheese. These came with 3 intermediate nibbles. .With one glass each of sparking, red and white wines the price came to a value price of 40pounds

Took my mum for her birthday. The service was second to none. Every need was catered for. Food was out of this world. We had the Deluxe 3 course lunch ¬£40 with champagne and half a bottle of wine each. Started with apparatifs, then each course was delicious. Between courses we had amuse bouche x 2 and a palate cleanser before desert. At the end we had a choice of fine teas or coffee with little sweet apparatifs. Couldn't recomend it more. Perfect for a special occasion.
Excellent food and wine from start to finish with first rate staff and a great atmosphere just before Christmas. Cannot wait to return.
Gauthier Soho is a perfect take on honest high quality modern French cooking with polished service, a good but slightly expensive wine list, and an intimate lovely room.

Gauthier is a quiet little gem at the southern end of Soho. Ring the doorbell to enter and you are led into a somewhat austere but minimalist room with quiet, attentive staff who never intrude into dining. I have been going to Gauthier since they first opened, having discovered it accidentally, and have been on many occasions since. Food is always first class (as you would expect from a One Star establishment earned in the first 10 months) and the second star can't be far away.

The Truffle Risotto is equisite with brown butter and the Crispy Piglet is melt in the mouth with a herb crackling. Wine list has some gems on and Roberto the sommelier is excellent. Fabulous and highly recommended.

Probably one of the best Michelin one star in London ...
The second star will come soon.

Truly excellent. Modern up-to-date cuisine of the highest standard. My taster menu didn't miss a beat - a real gastronomic experience. A couple of dishes didn't hit the mark with my wife & son but the overall intent, style and preparation was unquestionable. A special place (for special occasions?).
Style, setting and service are outstanding and prices surprisingly reasonable for a restaurant of this class in London. Food portions are small but pefrectly prepared
took my friend who is a lovely french lady for lunch on her birthday and she loved it! enough said!

Fantastic Place - Quaint, love the door bell it's like your a guest for dinner at someones beautiful home. Service is briliant, they are so friendly and for such a place not at all snobish. The food is gorgeous, tasting menu brilliant even for vegitarians. Definatly recomended - go and try it for yourself.

I was cynical about the high marks until I visited this classy venue. The service was slow (the bread had to be requested and the frequent serving of "amuse bouches" indicated a backlog in the kitchen). Dinner, overall, took four hours! But the food when it eventually arrived was stunning. The ingredients are top quality and the flavour combinations just magical and never overdone. This has to be a contender for London's top restaurant.

Terrible service. It was towards the end of the evening, and it was as though they‚Äôd forgotten that we‚Äôd come in. They had also run out of things that we wanted to order. There was only two of us, and both of us had to change our order.

Had a long wait even after booking., service slow, food bordering on inedible (I‚Äôm not a fussy eater) and the whole place felt grubby and tired. The kids enjoyed seeing the animals but soon got upset because the food took forever to arrive and when it did it was not even up to fair ground levels.

No bar service

Very limited drink selection

App based menu lacks any detail, no photos or description. Awful to use

Fact waitress was nee (not her fault) didn‚Äôt help, service extremely slow

45 mins before any food arrived from table reservation time. Starter and main only 2hr 30 min duration

Beyond poor and way below what you expect for this type of restaurant and price.
Lovely experience for the kids! Would definitely return! Good size portions as well!
Food was really bad! Kids ordered mac n cheese it was absolutely with no flavors! I ordered a steak sandwich the lean was full of FAT! We left it as is!
Great setting, shame about the service. And the food isn‚Äôt as good as the price would suggest
Kazim was an excellent host, went above and beyond what was expected and definitely made the whole experience better than what it would of been without them.
Poor slow service, overpriced food- probably microwaved!
The restaurant looks old and tired. Service was slow and disorganised.

Absolutely fine just incredibly slow. My husband and I took the children as we have been to the one in Florida and unfortunately i realised pretty quickly that the waiters/ waitresses made the experience for us in Florida. There is no creating a story about the animals in this restaurant, they didn‚Äôt even point them out to the kids as we walked to the table, they might as well had not been there tbh. So next time I would go somewhere else to create memories for the kids! But food was good. Toilets clean.

I was very disappointed to see that the jungle animals were very run down and the jungle itself tired and dusty up close. It looked like nothing had been cleaned or wiped over for years. On our day the toilets were disgusting with 1 being blocked with toilet roll, 2 having no toilet roll and the general stench of not being cleaned. However, saying that the best thing was the attentive staff. They made sure our boys were happy and we did have one of the better tables by the elephants. My son wanted to look at the jungle tails in the shop so our waitress took him up and radioed ahead to let her colleague know. We also had a water spill that was quickly mopped up.  The food was very overpriced for what we received but it was tasty.  Unfortunately I don‚Äôt think I will be recommending to any friends as very overpriced for the experience!
Food isn‚Äôt great for the price.  I suppose your paying for the rainforest theme of the cafe.

Restaurant had no record of my booking. Made to wait in the bar for thirty minutes, despite there being dozens of empty tables. This stalling is obviously a tactic as it happened to at least 4 other groups that were waiting in the bar area with us.

The staff gave us a lovely table indoors where we could sit very comfortably near the window and with our quiet dog away from others. The food and service were excellent as always and they even brought out a classy little dessert with the Danish flag for my partner‚Äôs birthday. Class act!
Amazing place to go for a luxurious lunch !

Overall, the experience was good. I liked my starter (herring), but didn't like the main that much (meatball). My wife liked both starter (smoked salmon) and main (whole boned trout). Service and atmosphere were also perfect.

However, on the day we visited, unfortunately half of main menu and some of starter and others were not available, which is actually quite odd considering that it is Michelin starred restaurant.
Good ingredients simply prepared (in a Scandanavian style), well priced. Interesting cocktails. Good buzz, not quiet, but not so loud as to drown conversation.
Loved the smorgasbord, mains were also very good. Food paired well with what was an extremely hot day in London! Would recommend highly and for Michelin star very reasonable.

Fantastic food and gorgeous space but absolutely terrible server. Rushed us to order. Pushed us to order way more food than we wanted. Took forever to receive our food and wouldn‚Äôt bring the bill even when it was requested. When we said thank you after we paid he just walked away. Love coming here for drinks but don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll be back for a meal.

This was my first visit to Aquavit and it did not disappoint.   We ate exclusively from the Smorgasbord menu, which consisted essentially of scandinavian tapas - mainly fish and vegetable dishes.  The portions are not big, and for sharing this can mean you need many dishes, but the flavours were excellent, and all accompanied by the most amazing bread basket, with each type of bread being more delicious than the last.  Definitely worth a return visit.

Excellent food and service in a beautiful new setting. Really impressed with the attention to detail in the design; it is elegant, yet more informal than the New York Aquavit. Those familiar with the NYC setting should be prepared for a different experience but just as wonderful in its own way.
Never write reviews but in love with this place. New favourite restaurant in London. Food and service was great. Beautiful interior. Get the arctic nest desert.
Healthy and delicious food, including herring and 'blood pudding', with excellent dry Riesling.   Busy, but quiet enough to chat easily.

A Taste of Scandinavia - gorgeous appetizers especially the cured fish dishes, beautiful midcentury modernist interior. Mains were good but the starters and sides were even better. Overall a very appealing restaurant and a pleasurable meal.

We had a really nice time at Sola and thought the staff were friendly and the food was excellent! It‚Äôs expensive but the menu is really good and there is a lot of food. I would warn anyone who is dining there that they have a very strict cancellation policy so if you or your guests get pinged or test positive for Covid you will be charged quite a chunky amount per person.

We had a lovely pre-theatre meal on the terrace. Service was 5* - originally seated outside but they moved us outside on request with no fuss. Delicious pizza, great Sauvignon blanc, table of 4 was less than ¬£30pp for pizza and wine in a great setting. Would recommend!
Very ambient atmosphere. Love the decor. Food is okay but not great. But will definitely recommend to anyone for a first time

Staff looked after us incredibly well when we had a bit of an issue on the bill. Can‚Äôt thank them enough for resolving in a sensible manner a rather embarrassing situation. My clients were very happy.

The portion of food (both had cod) relative to its cost, was way off the mark. Good thing I had a light meal before going (mum's advice to always eat something just in case) else, I'd have starved all evening. Noticing each meal was over ¬£35, we turned down the offer of a selection of sides at an extra cost as we assumed the meals would be of a good size portion.

I wished we hadn't after noticing the serving an amazingly well presented snack size cod on the plates and we'd have made both disappear in about 4 mouthfuls. I opted for the ‚Äúeat as slow as possible‚Äù technique to make the special dining moment last a little longer.

It was a tasty cod and well-presented but only good for a bar snack not a meal. Steak next time.

The music was chilled during dinner as expected but when the full band came on, it became a real full on party exactly what we wanted. Great music new and old which made every one jump on their feet, sing along and shake what they were given. The DJ added to the same fun when it was his turn. An Amazing dance outing until the small hours.

We'll be back for more...

Lovely place, great service both upstairs in the bar & downstairs in the restaurant. I‚Äôm gluten free & they helped with my choices we had the see menu which had a varied choice.
The cocktails were really good & the waiter suggested some to try.
Absolutely great! Great service!! Amazing music! Will be back very soon!
The very good service, not feeling rushed. The food was good and the band was also good.
Amazing food, I‚Äôm coming back for sure üíú
Lovely experience

Don‚Äôt go when they are busy , we waited for an hour for our table , the manager was hopeless .that means u spend extra money at the expensive bar
We got a glass of Prosecco I think that was to say sorry .( no one explained or apologized ) I think they were stressed and couldn‚Äôt manage the numbers , don‚Äôt bother unless u want to wait ages .
Border line good!
Warm and welcoming place, staff made us feel very confortable from the moment we stepped in. Great food reasonably priced and an outstanding service. 100% recommended.

Went here for a light dinner and after-work drinks. Vibey atmosphere and relatively cool. Stayed on the top floor so don't know what the club restaurant was like. Food was a little lacklustre but the manager was kind about knocking off something we complained about. I would go back but not for the food.
Everything was amazing. The beef ribs were absolutely divine!
Went for afternoon tea with an eastern twist. Lovely food, beautifully prepared and presented. Excellent service and friendly staff.

Fantastic decor and concept, really does feel special, unfortunately service has some catching up to do. I‚Äôve never seen that many people standing around observing the restaurant and that little attention to guests. We were three sat at a tiny corner table, some of our food had been taken before it was finished (happened so quickly I didn‚Äôt realise!!), and at the end we sat empty handed waiting to be offered dessert / coffee / more wine for 20 minutes (we were only offered at the point of asking for the bill). Food was lovely, the lamb tagine was really to die for, some dishes quite small, but I can get over that. Overall glad I checked it out but unlikely to return.
The chef was super amazing and he came to our table and was the reason for our successful night. Thank you.

Great venue, service & ambience of Morocco but the price paid is equally great. Good for a special occasion but not really worth it just for a simple meal out when you can get the same food for half the price elsewhere.
First timme at this restaurant upon. Lovely atmosphere, food and attentive staff. The outsider area where you can take coffee and shisha is a nice bonus
Excellent food and service, Only problem was that the ladies toilets are so tiny that there was always a quue into the hallway!

Momo Regent St one of the happening middle eastern restaurants in town.  This may be a bit noisy for some but a great vibe.  Good middle eastern food and great decor.  Toilets are inconveniently located and DARK - a bit spooky really.

Absolutely beautiful restaurant - without any of the tired naffness of other 'themed' venues. Gorgeous cocktails, fabulous food, the only thing that let it down was we were extremely packed in, touching elbows with the tables left and right of us. This, coupled with it being very loud (other diners, not music - my parents struggled to hear) would make me question how 'romantic' this place would be. Atmospheric yes, place for a quite, intimate date - no.
Good food, great atmosphere, but over-priced and over-attentive staff
Great food, awesome service

Had a group booking at Pho & Bun and even though we were slightly late (possibly 10 minutes) they were very accommodating and showed us to our table. The service was fine and the food was good as expected. We all enjoyed ourselves, especially the food.
It felt very run down- a shadow of it‚Äôs former self
Good food (different types of ceviche and plenty of mouth watering starters), nice atmosphere and friendly staff. Not sure banana chips should be sold as plantain though... !
Ceviche was delicious but the serving is a tad on the small side

The location was fabulous. I've walked down Carnaby St a thousand times but didn't realise the restaurant or food court was there! The cocktails and food were both uniquely delicious and interesting. The restaurant has a fabulous vibe and I personally thought it represented an honest price. I visited for my wife's birthday and will definitely be going back. I would recommend the venue to everybody and anybody who enjoys having a good time. The other bars in the area made for a great post-dinner epilogue üòÑ

The chicken skewers were amazing! tender and very well marinated! The crisp on the chicken + the sauce was just divine. In general, all dishes were very very good, and the tempura + pickled jalapenos mayo, ribs and flat iron chimichurri were other standout dishes!

Service was prompt and the waitresses were very friendly

We will be back!
Great ambience, cool decor and really great service. The food was delicious and portions were relatively generous. Great cocktails too and try to go for happy hour 5-7pm for best value.
Great evening, food was fabulous and service was impeccable as always.
Excellent lunch in good old-fashioned surroundings.  Would have been better still without the music.
Food was excellent and the service outstanding. We‚Äôll definitely be back.
First small pot of tea lukewarm. Extra pots of tea incurs an extra ¬£4 charge
Lovely food and ambience, buzzy and loud

Great feeling to the venue, with varied menu and charming staff. Quality of the food was great, although the portion size of the eggs benedict and orange juice was a little on the small size. That being said, would go back.

We enjoyed a very nice brunch. The food is what you would expect for a brunch. Well prepared and good. The bacon makes it worth the trip. Nice juice selection. The ambiance is really nice. Don‚Äôt be irritated, however, over slow service. The staff is nice but sloooowwww

Really buzzy atmosphere and perfect spot for pre theatre dinner. We chose the 3 course set menu and returned after the show for our dessert with complementary glass of Prosecco which is a great idea. The service was outstanding and we would definitely return.
Great service despite it being a very busy bar & restaurant
Sophisticated atmosphere.  Attentive service.  Central soho.
picked at random, delicious food and a great atmosphere. Service was faultless...

Honestly speaking, I was quite disappointed. Their scones used to be my must-eat and each time I visited London, I needed to go there. But the scones this time were not tasty anymore, I don't know if they changed the recipe...
A treat in London, a must do restaurant! We will always pop in on our trips to London

Fantastic Service & Quality.
Would definitely recommend anybody to enjoy the experience.

Another delicious meal but this time accompanied by my 8 month old son.  The staff could not have been more accommodating, from giving us a larger table with plenty of room for the highchair, to entertaining my son and even offering to watch him if I wanted to go to the toilet on my own! The meal itself was delicious and I would not hesitate to return here.

From our welcome at the door until it was time to leave, the service was excellent. There is a definite buzz in the restaurant that creates a great atmosphere. Although, the table was time limited, we were not rushed in any way and were offered extra coffees long after the time had expired. We will be back!

I went to the Dean Street Townhouse for a meal with my siblings before the Christmas period. The Venison Hotpot was simply sublime, vey filling and flavoursome. If that weren't enough I had the Toffee Cake with whiskey ice cream for dessert, I shall definitely be visiting again!

Booked for 7.45 hoping for a pre-meal drink at the long bar, but all seats taken. However, a table was available at 7.20 so that was fine and we weren't pressured to order our meal at that time. Menu slightly limited, but our son, who recommended the place, also suggested we try the mince and potatoes dish, which was delicious (and reasonably priced!).
Not a place for a quiet romantic meal - like so many restaurants it's noisy - but great for people watching and good 'buzzy' atmosphere.

While we had to wait for our table we were served by an extremely unfriendly and arrogant barkeeper, who either hates what he is doing and is not meant to be doing this job, or he thought we were nobodies and we have deserved his attitude. The girl who served us at the table was really great then, but not even 5 min after we had paid we were asked by the supervisor or similar  to leave if we don't want to order anything more. We thought this was really rude, because we did not intend to stay there after having payed  (and the restaurant was not full at the time) but were just finishing telling a story... The main courses we ordered were ok, the desserts were very good, the wine was average. All in all its a place we will not go to a second time.

We had a fantastic post theatre meal here last Friday. I loved the ambience,the very comfortable armchairs,the lighting and music.
I had the sea bass and borlotti beans while my husband had the rib eye steak-both dishes were delicious. I finished the meal with a lovely espresso martini!

I will definitely come back again!

I went there for afternoon tea with two ex work friends after reading positive reviews, and a very enjoyable afternoon tea it was. Excellent scones with strawberry and cherry jam and a fantastic selection of cakes which included battenberg. Now, you don't se that very often these days, and I just love Battenberg!

The sandwiches were very good as well. However, one of us is vegetarian. When we ordered, we asked for one veg option. The three fillings were egg, salmon and ham. Our waiter said the only way to do it was for the two of us to give our egg sandwich for the veggie and we would have her ham and salmon. We then requested a veggie option of egg only and the two of us would have the three fillings. Three mixed sandwiches arrived but we then asked another waiter who said there would be no problem in doing a veggie option of egg, avocado cheese and cucumber. All was well!

The only other gripe was that we were charged for a second fresh pot of tea (there were still a couple of cakes to be consumed).

Because of this and the veggie problem, I haven't given five stars in a couple of categories, but I would recommend this for a very good value, jolly scrummy afternoon tea. Just love the Battenberg!
Took my mother & hard working huzzband for afternoon tea. It's was lovely, great value. The service deserves a special mention - fab! Def going back...
Great atmosphere and service, a special place. Good vibe.
Had Sunday brunch there with friends. Food and service was good, atmosphere is great. Only thing is that the brunch menu is pretty limited, I would prefer more choice.

The 3 choices per course on the pre theatre menu were from the a la carte so at ¬£19.50 for 3 courses it was amazing value.
The dishes were all well cooked and portion sizes good - not always the case with pre theatre dinners. Starters included a leek & cheese tart - outstanding. Sea bass with samphire was beautiful, 'mince and potatoes' doesn't sound very enticing but it was yummy. The cocktails were fantastic and the wine list offered something for everyone in terms of price and range. Our waiter overheard reference to one of our diners as 'the birthday girl' and a choccie confection on an inscribed plate with a candle in it duly appeared - a really thoughtful touch.
Warm atmosphere, great service, delicious food, totally affordable, a must go!
Proper food, buzzy atmosphere, attentive service, great wine choice, super glass of gin - will definitely be returning. Thank you.
Food was delicious!!! Service as well !! ü•∞ü•∞ü•∞ love it I really recommend this place , the waiter the lady just one was fantastic !

This was a slightly odd setting, you enter and go straight down some stairs so on a sunny day it wouldn't be great. The staff are really friendly and helpful but I'm afraid the food was a little bit of a let down. We only had a snack so ordered garlic bread, aubergine, patatas bravas and croquettes. I love  croquettes but I was so disappointed, they just tasted of uncooked bechemel sauce.... I definitely wouldn't order these again.

Chosen as nearby the Harold Pinter Theatre (almost next door). Good idea to book as got very busy. Quick, friendly service. Good choice of full meals, a 3 course meal at bargain price, or large selection of Tapas. Good vegetarian selection.
Highly recommended.

The set menu is such a bargain AND they have a loyalty points card! I have been going for some years now went in by chance when Stock Pot opposite closed down and have been going ever since! It has all the atmosphere of those little restaurants that were dotted around and sadly no longer in London (due to the high rents I suppose) I didn't realise there was a downstairs so always gave it a miss as it looked full. Bit loather to right a revue of this great place as it will become too popular and I won't be able to get in! The staff are always charming and the 3 course ¬£10 set menu is great and always enough!

Give it a go, you will become a regular!
Great to be back at 45 Jermyn Street.  Always a great treat for special occasions
Superb food, however the service was not quite up the level I would expect.

Overall, I was happy with the restaurant, but just felt the prices were a bit ridiculous in part..¬£17 for a medium glass of wine is shocking! Also upset not be told about the pre theatre menu which wasn‚Äôt time indicated on the website or suggested as an option in the confirmation call from the restaurant!
Superb meal, well served. Attentive but not hovering staff. Good wines but a limited cognac list.
Lovely service and excellent food. Have bee walking by for a while, wanting to try it - was not disappointed. Will definitely go again.

Conveniently located yet far from the hectic scene of Piccadilly. Comfortable seating and for once this is a place where one can actually converse. Food though is hit and miss. Some dishes were too salty, the gnocchi and a tough pork belly served with teeny weeny strips of crackling. The management was very courteous and offered their apologies. The Welsh rarebit is top notch!

Feel like a madman evening of old school glamour?  This is the place, starting with the hostess who was poised, polite and attentive.  She got the rhythm of how a great evening begins and set the tone for the evening.  I especially appreciated as she addressed me (female) and not the male amongst the group which often happens when I take out people to entertain.  Voila - madmen in 2018!  Everything was very good.  I'm a foodie so I have a hard time giving food outstanding but it was really delicious.  Go!  It's a wonderful evening to remember.

I hate restaurants that add a ‚Äòservice charge‚Äô to the bill ... 12.5% in this case !! It should be illegal in this day and age ...  and the response that you always ask for it to be removed is patronising and pathetic ....
Great old-fashioned service in an iconic restaurant.  Expensive but a real treat on Christmas Eve with my family and the new man in my life - memories are priceless!

Elegant dining and a delicious menu are the highlights of 45 Jermyn Street. The dining room is very attractive with good lighting and acoustics. The menu is interesting and imaginative and the service is attentive and efficient. The wine list is also good and offers a number of wines by the carafe.  I was dining pre-theatre and the waiting staff were aware of this and we left the restaurant in good time. It is my third time of eating here in the last year and will definitely go again.
Superb breakfast venue.  Great service and the food was fantastic.  A bit of a hidden gem.

Set lunch menu for Sunday was 3 courses for ¬£30. For the more adventurous they sell caviar and alba truffles.
