Cheapest white wine on the menu was ¬£18, some were priced at over ¬£200. Reds started at ¬£26.
We bought a relatively expensive bottle of white wine and it was at room temperature when served. Big mistake for a place like this, they should know better.
Not impressed.

We have been to Sunflower many times, and does not disappoint. A great meal at a reasonable price with charming staff to tend you.
Look forward to our next visit üòä

Sotheby‚Äôs Restaurant is my current favourite place to go for an afternoon treat. The service is excellent. The food is delicious. The atmosphere is relaxed. And the fact that it‚Äôs located in Sotheby‚Äôs New Bond Street Auction House makes it the perfect place to go for any art and luxury lover - or for anyone looking for a high quality place to eat and drink in Central London.
Best dumplings in London. The Xiao Long Bao are delicious and try the XL soup dumpling. So good.
It is a quaint hidden gem. The fresh pasta was absolutely gorgeous. The house wine was fabulous and the Tiramisu well it was all fab! I would definitely recommend and will definitely be going again!

Food good quality and well cooked. Value - abysmal. 3 small chops, a few tiny roast potatoes and 3 sprigs of broccoli. Dessert - 1 banana, sugar on top. flamed with a blow-torch with a dollop of ice cream.

All very simple and very quick to cook.

Price - ¬£38.
A most pleasant experience, definitely will repeat on next visit
Overall very good - both food quality and friendly service, and an agreeable experience. The only downside was the feeling of being crammed in with the tables and seats so close together.

As always the food is freshly cooked and interesting.
Good friendly service, and good choice
Food choice always excellent: right mix of fish and meat and vegetarian. Friendly staff and great service. Restaurant small and intimate. Been 5-6 times before and always excellent.
As always, the welcome, service and food were excellent. I have been dining at Vasco's for 26 years.
An Italian lunch like you find in Italy. Good set lunch menu, very tasty, quality ingredients, pleasant and efficient service. Will come again..
Great food, great service, great environment & great location. Highly recommend!

This is a small but peaceful restaurant in Soho . The menu wasn't long but offered a lot of choice, we would have happily eaten most on offer. Portions are restrained rather than hearty.Food was good quality and well cooked. Service was good but lacked warmth. Toilets are at the bottom of a steep and surprisingly scruffy staircase. We would return if we were in the area but its not a destination restaurant.

The second time I had been to Vasco & Piero's in a month, following an enjoyable business dinner.  The atmosphere was again excellent but compared to the previous visit, the service and food were OK but only OK.  The food was tasty but unless you ordered side orders you got a very plain meal.  Calamari with cannelini beans was literally just that.  Service was too quick, with starter and main course being eaten within an hour or so of arrival.  Vasco's is good but to order your veg and eat slow!
Fillet steak was amazing in flavour, Lake District quality meat .  Mac and cheese with truffle is a must !! And great wine by the glass .
Table of 4 given for party of 5. Made it uncomfortable. Called and asked if 5 was possible after initial booking of 4. They said yes but accommodated in a way that wasn't really good enough.

I absolutely love goodmans in maddox Street its my favourite restaurant. The food and service is second to none. I've never had a steak in England that even comes close definitely not in Hawksmoor that's for sure!!

Pricey but one of our favourites. Excellent food and wine. Evening was somewhat spoilt by one rude member of the waiting staff but this was soon rectified by the wonderful manager and we had an enjoyable evening.

The bad experience started with the phone call from the restaurant to confirm our reservation. She was very abrupt and even I asked her if something is wrong, that's when she tried to be nicer. Then we made it to the restaurant. The reception was very nice, but then we got a waiter who seemed rushed and we ended up with a kilo of a very old piece of meat that had more than half of it was a bone and large amount of fat. In his explanation of the types of meat choices I guess he missed to say that mature meat means old fatty and chewy meat. We realized later that he was ending his shift and couldn't wait to get out of the place. I got eventually a free desert for my BD and also a huge bill. My family and I been to Goodman several times before, but this will be our last.

Loved our meal here! We booked the table at 5:30 and were still there at 9pm on a Saturday night without being rushed or made to feel we weren't welcome once. The staff were brilliant, just the right amount of attention and kept our drinks topped up all evening.
And then there is the food, or rather the steaks. Just beautiful! We were given an education on cuts and flavours. The steaks were cooked exactly as we'd all asked.
We went to celebrate my 40th birthday and the team decorated the dessert plate and give you your pudding for free if celebrating - very nice touch.
We will definitely visit here again....

I booked a table for my Wife's birthday , before seeing a show . I asked for a table with lots of room . We arrive earlier than scheduled , no problem whatsoever . Greeted with a smile and shown to our table by the window . Great table , with privacy and watch the world go by .
The staff are friendly , informative , attentive , polite you could not ask for more .
Complimentary breads arrived , the steaks explained to us , drinks arrived all very quickly .
Once our decision was made , we sat back expecting the normal wait . The food arrived so quickly , cooked to perfection . It was beyond our expectations - The Steaks both exactly as requested , mine actually larger . Sides were also superb , very tasty indeed and generous in the portion size . Free sauces also were brought - nothing is too much trouble here , the staff really made our experience one to remember . Before going we were presented with a complimentary desert with a candle in it for my wife's birthday - WOW . The desert was the best we have ever tasted . This is a place I would love to eat at every week if I could . We will most certainly be coming back . Its not cheap , but you really get what you pay for and I would do it time and time again .
if you want to spoil yourself then this is definitely one of those places to visit .
Once again many many thanks to the Staff here , they really did make out evening one to remember - thank you all so much .

Good food and excellent service
The staff are very well trained and knowledgeable on the product

THE FRIENDLY & HIGHLY KNOWLEDGEABLE STAFF MADE CHOOSING WHAT POSSIBLY WAS THE BEST STEAK IN LONDON A BEEFEATER'S DREAM. THE FOOD WAS SIMPLY DELICIOUS, THE AMBIENCE GREAT & THE ACCOMPANYING WINE MADE OUR BIRTHDAY CELEBRATION COMPLETE.
Great Food and Service. Consistently good. Steaks cooked to perfection, good wine selection and service first class. Best steak restaurant in London.
My meal caused my tastebuds to tingle. The tantalising tastes, what a marvellous meal!

Outstanding. Visited for our wedding anniversary and the restaurant made every effort to make the evening extraordinarily special. We both had a wonderful meal, centred around a supurb porterhouse steak, cooked to perfection. An excellent wine list as well. We will definitely return.
Goodman is the best steak in London i have no doubt. I eat out all over the place , hawksmoor, sophies, Gaucho etc, and this is the best discernibly - treat yourself

I definetely would recommend this restaurant.
The food is fantastic and the service is very punctual and gentle.

Took a few clients along, as had heard alot about Goodmans. No one was disapointed we all had a great evening and managed to get a tour of the kitchen. We will all be going back and I have already booked again.
We were going to London for a day out as a special day for our daughter's 16th Birthday we had a wonderful meal at Goodmans, it's our second visit we cannot wait untill our third!

Although not geared towards families, in my opinion, a children's menu would be welcome. Goodmans is our favorite dining venue when in London for business, we were with our children for the first time and found limited choices for them short of a full adult-portion meal, or a starter.
Steaks are out of this world expensive but well worth it
Wow what a fabulous night again at Goodman, faultless on all fronts, food service and atmosphere. It was our wedding anniversary and we were treated like VIP's - wonderful!

Usually go to Gaucho and Hawkesmore. The overall atmosphere at Goodman is more like a traditional busy restaurant as compared to a more glitzy pretentious service experience at Gaucho. Alsoless hurried. Steak, side orders and dessert were all excellent - would have preferred thin french fries rather than chips! Cocktail list did not inspire. A Manahattan with Canadian Club and not a decent bourbon - come on guys, I expect better. Overall, I think its very good and would go back.

Our second visit and it was as good as before. A busy Friday lunchtime caused the service to be not as slick as previously but the rib-eye steaks were spot-on! Still think this outranks Gaucho and is very similar price-wise. We'll be back!

Awesome steak joint! excellent service, enormous steaks & not bad value.
I'll be back!
AMAZING steak, best we've had in London. Service friendly & informed. Great wine list, we were recommended a fantastic American red which was delicious. Mac & cheese to die for!!!
If you want a great steak with first class service this is the place in London. Never dissapoints.

Steaks were excellent, informative and knowledgeable staff but not intrusive. Ideal for special occasion, it was our 30th wedding anniversary, and would definately return and recommend to others who enjoy excellent quality steaks.

We usually go to Gauchos restaurants. But Goodmans has now become my fave steak restaurant in London. From great wine list to steaks served on hot plates(well flavoured steaks, we both had ribeye medium rare) to the devine Tempura tiger prawns as a starter.service was top notch and all the staff worked together not just one server managing your table.Hope to join you for dinner very soon when next in London,

I took my husband to Goodmans for his birthday. We thorougly enjoyed our dinner there. The restaurant treated us to champagne in celebration of his birthday. The service was one of the best I've experienced in London - attentive but not overly done. The food was great.My husband had the sirloin on bone which he rated as the best he's ever had. I had the lobster bisque and roasted breast of chicken for my main. Both were lovely. I will definitely go back. One of the best restaurants I've been to. Thank you.
Exceptional food...good service...a very pleasant lunch if not a tad expensive but then no more than similar West End establishments. Will certainly go back again.
excellent steaks .

I have visited Goodman regularly since it opened and am always impressed by the food and service. If you want a good honest steak then it is hard to beat. The set lunch is great value for a business lunch.

afternoon tea - baking & chocolate work was on point mini desserts were yummy & varied, (scones where awful!) & I have to say the service was extremely poor. Disinterested,‚Äô staff, didn‚Äôt bring cutlery, sat on phone, very do it your self atmosphere. It‚Äôs a shame they don‚Äôt deliver that luxury afternoon tea experience.

For the price, and additional cost of the chocolate tree, the work that goes into the desserts can be seen, but it‚Äôs clear they are trying to cost save, and not deliver a luxury experience. So it‚Äôs a bit of a let down. Looks pretty, but doesn‚Äôt follow through
Cibo e birra ottimi, servizio cordiale. Bella la location üëç

Had an enjoyable lunch in this old quaint pub, ideally situated for the theatre.
Food and service very good. There are quite a few steps to restaurant so probably would not be
good for people with walking difficulties.

Very tasty, home-made food, and delicious complimentary vodka infusions at the start of the meal.  It is clear from the conduct of the staff that they love Ukrainian cuisine, and they put their own creative touches that make traditional home recipes even more exciting. I cannot wait for the permanent restaurant to open.
Turned up to be told we had no booking after showing confirmation. Dinner plans ruined will not  be booking here again.
Great coffee, great food. My advice is arrive hungry so you can have both a sweet and savoury dish!
Great food and a wonderful setting. Just a slight shame that the chicken kebab for the main course was a bit dry but the rest of the food was delicious.
Had a fabulous meal , all was good but omg the squid ink risotto with octopus was to die for- want the recipe
Great authentic Italian Cuisine. Food could have been hotter as was served warm. Also they had ran out of wine. Another plus would be to offer kids activity such as coloring, word-search etc.

Not a bad place to spend an afternoon, the staff were attentive and nice. Food was of a reasonable quality but the portion was tiny for the price. we paid ¬£115 for 6 cocktails and a small burgle and something else. That was my only gripe. Id find somewhere cheaper normally but we were essentially railroaded by the Covid conditions around drinking and meals etc.
We have ordered course and shall wait for a long time after ate the appetizer. Overall is good.
Hasn‚Äôt changed in years and we don‚Äôt want it to!  A tasty, friendly, privately owned restaurant that we always enjoy visiting.

Lovely atmosphere in this cosy Mediterranean themed eatery. The service and ambience are good The menu has an extensive range of opitions with perhaps a littl too much choice. Unfortunately the food is mediocre and on a par with an average home cooked meal.

Cosy and very friendly service at the Mediterranean Cafe, Soho, London. All the waiters have a wry sense of humour and we enjoyed the banter. The food was good and great value for money. We'll go back if in the area.
Nice and different a little gem that not everyone knows.
Went to Princi in Milan, which was fantastic. While this was good it didn‚Äôt meet those levels, unfortunately.
Always great quality food and now with nice outdoor seating
Relatable food for the cost. Great service although we weren‚Äôt shown the full wine menu but just ordered another instead

The cafe did not have our booking so when we arrived for our afternoon tea there was no food left!

The first waitress just laughed in our face which rude and I was not impressed at all. The second one was much nicer and offered to give us a drink and some small nibbles for free as compensation.

The overall experience continued to be a disappointment (due to the fact that it was Valentine's Day) and the waitress that laughed when she found out they didn't have our booking on the system started singing really loudly, completely ruining the atmosphere.
Unfortunately, this restaurant no longer exists. It has been replaced by a vegan restaurant. We were looking to have a Chinese meal, but everywhere else was busy or booked, so we were disappointed.

This business lunch booking was made well in advance as would be expected for such a special and sought after dining experience in this Mayfair corner.  The guests were absolutely delighted and thrilled with the culinary creativity and taste sensations, not to mention the exemplary wine menu.  Simply outstanding on all counts.
Sketch London we chose the tasting menu overall good but there were some interesting combinations worth trying.

The Sketch offers a first-class gastronomic experience, in one of London's most amazing restaurant design. Nothing classical, so be prepared for some surprises! The meal was amazing, from the higly creative appetizers to the sweeties accompanying coffee. A special mention for the creative textures, mousses, chantilly, jellies, all beauiful and full of flavours.

Sketch isn't just a restaurant, it's a dining experience. We were greeted by the Maitre d' like we were old friends. He briefly showed us around 'the house' then took us to our table. The decor was lovely, however the restaurant was quite subdued (hence score for ambience) and not as lively as downstairs. Waiting staff were very attentive - we had the 8 course tasting menu which was superb. With two bottles of wine, 2 glasses of champagne & 12.5% service added had little change from ¬£400.
Sketch Lecture Room and Library was really special. We were welcomed warmly,  received great service and delicious food. The venue was special too.
Excellent food, but mediocre ambiance. The lights were flickering throughout the evening and the music was too loud for a restaurant. Would recommend it though!
Daughter‚Äôs Birthday. It was her choice to go to PH great staff very helpful. Great food and service. 5*
Packed Saturday night, arrived early but able to sit in the bar for a few drinks. Food was good with big portion sizes as you would expect! Overall a good night and better than expected.

Food was of a reasonable standard although the children meals were very overdone.  Great atmosphere for kids and teens, we visited early evening on a Friday and wasn't too busy.  Price was reasonable but we did use a 20% off voucher - less than ¬£100 for 2 children and 4 adults including mandatory 12.5% service charge.
Loud , but efficient service - Has moved from it's original location & does not have the same wow factor - but the kids will love it

booked lunch for a work meeting. was expecting a set lunch menu (which i had seen on their website prior to booking)

food was great nonetheless. service was excellent and attentive.
Outstanding in every respect.  It takes years and exceptional skill to develop a team and performance this good.  Quo Vadis a wonderful place for good conversation over a delicious meal

We have been trying to get to Quo Vadis for a long time and finally made it on Saturday evening. Things started well with excellent Margaritas. The first signs of the poor service that would afflict our evening came when, after being told our table was ready, we were made to stand in the entrance to the restaurant for nearly 5 minutes. A lack of attention to stated food allergies was followed by copious apologies. Unacceptable. The food was OK but didn't live up to expectations. The person who appeared to be responsible for the restaurant did intervene when she saw what was happening and tried to put things back on track, but too many staff were not up to scratch. If I go back to QV it will probably be for the bar and cocktails rather than the restaurant.

Waiters are friendly in general. Not all of them.
Foods are ok. Nothing more than that. Choices are limited.
Not really well located. Clouded area, with too many pubs around.
You need membership to visit The bar upstairs, even after taking dinner here.
A very elegant restaurant with excellence food and service. Will definitely return for a special occasion.

My meal was a huge disappointment. With a good reputation, I was expecting quality from a chef that judges others on tv. He would have been embarrased at the lack of quality on this occasion.

Our meal was unimaginative both in taste and certainly presentation and, worse still, was poorly cooked. We received a whole mackerel, requiring filleting by the customer on the plate to find the flesh inadequately cooked through. We had greens / cabbage that was firm enough to use as a football and fries that tasted as if they came from the freezer - if they hadn't, the chefs were wasting their time, given the end product. Add to this, the waitress didn't take the order properly

The only positive was the attitude of the management when I complained

We were a group of 6 for Saturday lunch. I had heard very good reviews of the set-menu value, so was disappointed that there were only 2 options in each section. You definitely need to be a 'foodie' to read the menu, not a problem, as the staff happily explained what things were to us. Overall everyone really enjoyed what they had, I wasn't as impressed as I thought I would be - but that could be expectation and my choice of Skate with Capers which was very salty. The restaurant is beautiful, with stunning Stained Glass windows, the only let-down was the service, it was very pleasant but both waitresses were unbelievably slow and kept forgetting drink requests etc, we weren't in a hurry but if you were, this could have been very annoying.
Jeremy Lee's flavours are crisp, clean and in season. Quo Vadis is not cheap, but the food is simply amazing.

Well sourced and seasonal menu, showing finesse and creativity. Great focus on concentration of flavour, a thankfully short well selected menu. Food skillfully cooked. A real delight. Wine list included some unusual but well matched choices

Quirky menu
Nice windows
Herring starter and Mutton main were excellent
Menu did not wholly cater for pregnancy
Friendly staff

Picked Quo Vadis due to rating, proximity to the the theatre and an excellent early dining offer. They turned us round comfortably in time for our show without ever feeling rushed and the cooking was of a very high standard. We left feeling we had  been "out to dinner" rather than the usual pre - theatre compromised dining experience. Well worth a try if you are looking for a calm and relaxed venue amidst the bustle of Soho.

We dined in Quo Vadis on a Friday evening.  The food was mediocre and the service was debatable. We were sold extra wine we did not want. We complained and got the refund but they kept the 12.5% service charge of the wine we did not want. Naturally, we wouldn't recommend this restaurant to anyone. There are many other decent restaurants in the vicinity, particularly in St. James Street.

The Quo Vadis pretheatre (ie Toptable) offer was good value but had only 2 choices for starters and mains (3 for dessert). Luckily these were delicious. BUT beware something has to pay for the seemingly hundreds of attentive waiting staff and decoration. The sides, drinks and extras can soon mount up - ie our 4 x ¬£20 set 3 course meals initially came back with a bill for ¬£188. That came down after 2 drinks we had not had were removed (vodka at ¬£9.50 a shot!). Good food,great service,watch extras

Quo Vadis. A symphony behind closed doors.  Wonderful food and calm adjacent to the general mayhem of the West End.  Offer menu was great, nettle soup, lamb rack and the most fabulous bitter chocolate mouse; and the recommended wine a treat. I would go again and pay full whack for a special occasion.

We went to Quo Vadis last night and had a perfect evening. The food was delicious- I had the mackerel starter and ox cheeks for main, both scrumptious - and the deserts (bitter chocolate mousse, mango sorbet) were out of this world. With the TT offer it's very good value. Service was of a v high standard thoughout the evening. We felt a little rushed to leave the table as the end of our 2 hr slot approached, but this was to be expected. I have been before, but felt everything had improved since.

Quo Vadis in London Soho, good location, very  convenience for the theatre  in west end, they do very good value pre-theatre menu,.went for the very good value Sunday lunch, will go again, food is more traditional English, with a high standard.
Quo Vadis is one of the best top-end-of-informal restaurants we've visited for a long time and well deserving of the 9-score across the board that we've rated it. We'll definately visit again.
Goan chicken vindaloo was absolutely delicious

I went with my friend and we had afternoon tea. Obviously the tea was amazing. The service was perfect (which I was quite worried about after seeing other reviews ). The staff could not be more helpful and polite. The setting is beautiful and great location. Afternoon tea was okay, not the best I've had but quite nice. macaroons were really nice.
Good food from a limited selection for the theatre express set menu. Loved the live music, very quirky and memorable meal
Brilliant food as always and made to feel very welcome.

I visited the Delhi Brasserie in Soho a couple of nights ago on the back of TT's "¬£15.95 plus drinks" offer. Situated a couple of doors along from Ronnie Scott's, it's surprising that I had never visited this restaurant before. The special menu was a bit limited but was certainly nice enough and I particularly enjoyed the dessert having never ordered a dessert in an Indian restaurant before. I must also add that the service was exemplary, the waiters were attentive, friendly and efficient.
Good atmosphere and friendly staff willing to help

Only one piece of tofu in a Tofu Pad Thai and poor service on this occasion (had to ask for water twice and order was wrong with the bill then not corrected). Unfortunate as we've eaten at other Busaba restaurants in Stratford and Bird Street which have both been excellent.
Handy and quick place pre theatre

I go to this restaurant a lot and it rarely fails please.

The food is consistently tasty and well presented and really quite reasonable for a good standard like this. I will continue to return, as long as they continue to provide.

If you're on a first date, an anniversary, having dinner with friends or taking out clients, I'd highly recommend a visit to Ember Yard.
Very nice mezze dishes. Very nice service.
The customer service is amazing therr the people are so nice and patient I would recommend this restaurant to everyone

Fantastic restaurant! It was a lovely layout. Amazing staff which where all very attentive and had great recommendations. The food was outstanding, best steak I have ever had. Will be coming back for sure. Thank you
Great food. Steaks are best around. Desserts even better. Will be back!
Birthday meal! The server was  Very knowledgeable about the menu and would come round at the perfect times.

Amazing roast as reviews suggest.

Service was brilliant and we had a lovely evening. A lovely birthday desert was organised for my partner.

Having been going to Hawksmoor for a number of years now it was a bittersweet experience- lovely to be back in the restaurant but sad that it was not the bustling atmosphere of the past. My only complaint is that the thrice cooked chips looked and tasted like normal chips. All else was as divine as usual. Well done to all the staff for their exceptional level of service as usual.
Service was amazing and the food matched it!!
It was a nice Sunday roast! The staff were kind and nice. I went there by myself but I didn't feel uncomfortable.
Incredibly prepared steaks. Perfect Medium-Rare. And the atmosphere almost felt like pre-Covid.
An awesome return for one of the best steak joints in London. Great food, class service and buzzy ambience as always.
Great service, great food, great time. The atmosphere was just right, a good buzz but not so loud you couldn't hear anything. Will definitely recommend.

They gave us a burnt steak. Yes they wrote it off the check - but we still came in there for the good food. the Mac & Cheese was with too much salt.
the service was very good though.

Late Saturday afternoon lunch. Started with a cocktail in the bar area. Taken through to the dining room when we asked. Chose items from the lunch fixed menu. Food was superb, huge portions, friendly service and great value. The only negative were screaming children from a larger table.

I did have a problem with my steak however it was dealt with immediately when I raised this with one of the servers/manager.  I had ordered a sirloin steak however it was extremely fatty and gristly and not what I would have described as a sirloin, more a rib eye or perhaps rump.  My colleague with me had a rib eye and other than marbling of fat she had nothing like my ‚Äòsirloin‚Äô.  The server told me that some sirloins were very fatty and I responded that had I known this then I would not have selected this particular cut.  As I say, it was dealt with immediately and the steak was removed from the bill.  Other than that we had a very pleasant lunch.

+: very good food (bravo for the triple cooked fries and the wonderful carot salad).
-: Not enough light in the restaurant and very very noisy..
Great food. Great atmosphere. Great staff. Would highly recommend and will definitely be visiting again.
always delicious food and great service. their lunchtime set menu is a great deal - highly recommend
Service as good as the steaks

I‚Äôve eaten at all the Hawksmoor restaurants in London and this is the second time I‚Äôve been to seven dials. As with all the restaurants the food is superb and so are the staff. They make you feel special without crowding you. I had taken my beat friend and her daughter for their 50th and 21st birthdays. We were given some
Complimentary Prosecco and when their desserts arrived ‚ÄòHappy Birthday‚Äô was written around the edge of the plate in chocolate sauce. The steaks are wonderful and we opted for a 950g TBone that we shared. It was plenty of meat so although the one steak was ¬£80, for 3 people that was great

We love to eat at Hawksmoor, but this was the first time we had been to the restaurant in Seven Dials. As usual the whole experience was wonderful. Top marks for all who work at Hawksmoor, top quality as usual.
P.S. they were also happy to give me a doggy bag to give to my daughter for the lovely steak I could not finish, this made her very happy as Hawksmoor is also a favourite of hers.
Reservation was honored at the correct time. restaurant was energetic but not too loud. The server had some great recommendations, and of course the food was Devine
Great service. Boris was amazing. The food was fabulous and we had a great night

Best steak in London - this is a regular spot for a family get together. One thing we can all agree on is steak, is this place does great-tasting meat (plus a good array of sides, starters and cocktails). The Seven Dials branch also has more flexible opening hours, which is great if you are trying to get late lunch on a Saturday afternoon, say. (Having been before, I would say the service this time was especially attentive, with staff being at pains to offer and organise options for one of our party who avoid gluten.)

The food was excellent. Steaks etc. were cooked to perfection.  Choice of food excellent. Very busy but the service was really good. We felt the whole experience was rushed but would dine again here and recommend.
Attentive staff and helpful staff but not overbearing and the best cooked fillet around!

Great venue for lunchtime get-together for three old friends. Food very very good and wines were to match. Looked after by first rate staff who really knew the food choices, wine list and how to be attentive whilst not intrusive. Not cheap, but fairly priced and so that's not going to put me off a return visit with my family.

great starter ( carpaccio) and deserts ( sticky toffee pudding and warm chocolate tart).

sirloin steak was fine , chips also fine.

Lobster bearly warm . mash dish was hot but the contents only warm. No hammer to crack the claws of the lobster only ineffectual pliers. complained to the waitress, but nothing happened except the lobster came back sans shell and hardly meat from the claw was retained and agin delivered cold. very poor. will not go back again
Atmosphere and waiting staff were great but my meal was over cooked.

Great steak as always however other people in our group were disappointed by the fish, requested it filleted as offered by the waitress but it literally came with the head removed and still full of bones. Not filleted!

Service was lacking unfortunately, we were made to feel rushed initially when the waitress asked to take our order a minute after we sat down. Then were left waiting for an hour for food. It was a nice gesture that she brought a glass of champagne at the end of the meal for my birthday however maybe a little thoughtless as I don't drink and half the party also were only having soft drinks.

Overall good food, however quite amateur service which let it down.

The popular roast beef which I've had a few times before, and usually enjoy was disappointingly tough and the whole meal felt like it was rushed and just not up to the normal standard I usually receive at Hawksmoor.
Really good restaurant, great staff and the food was amazing.

A wonderful lunch experience. The express menu is such good value for money. We all enjoyed every course and my steak in particular was fantastic. Service was great too. Will definitely be visiting again in the not to distant future.
Really enjoyed it. The food and service were excellent. Had to wait a bit for our table but we were well looked after while waiting.
As always it delivers!!! Warm and friendly greeting, great staff and amazing food.
The steaks were excellent as were the sides except the beef dripping fries which were disappointing.  Would have expected hand cut chips to compliment such lovely steaks.

Top stuff
The restaurant is the clear go-to if you have a need for beef, lots of it, and well cooked. The locale is relaxed, and works on so many levels. A winner.
We ha d an excellent meal and our waiter Joao was brilliant! Would recommend the Opentable set menu.
A lovely evening, great food and brilliant service.

I wanted to take my wife to a restaurant with great food for her 40th birthday before visiting MOTOWN musical and Hawksmoor Seven Dials was recommended by a friend and I then read reviews online and it was all positive so I used Open Table to book a table.

The restaurant has a wonderful feel from the time you approach the large door and it has an eligance to it. You walk down the stairs to see a cool bar and a restaurant with a rustic feel with nice cosy lighting.

We were seated at our table the waiter then came over and gave us recommendations asked what we were doing after to make sure we had enough time to enjoy the experience. The waiter was well equipt with good knowledge of the menu and was really friendly and professional.

We both had a Rib-eye steak with bone marrow gravy, cream spinach and triple cooked chips and I must say this was by far the best steak I had ever eaten. The meat was well prepared and with the bone marrow gravy this just melted in my mouth it was a fantastic experience. If you are in Convant Garden and you are up for a great meal with great service and top quality food, then look no further this is the place for you.
Food was excellent.  We had a beautiful steak and the sides were lovely too.  Cooked to perfection.

Had the pre theatre meal, good choice, ample portions and a steak cooked like it should be. The mini cocktail thrown in was a nice addition, staff helpful and attentive, courses nicely timed. Not sure about the 'optional' 12.5% tip included on the bill - getting a bit like the American model - it's either a tip or a service charge, keep it simple! Would definitely recommend and will go back.

We had a lovely waitress, who served us. I normally like my meat well done but this was too much. Medium was better which my friend had. The portion of meat, potatoes, onions and huge Yorkshire Pudding is gigantic. Not enough gravy so don't know if we could have asked for more.  We were treated really nicely and even though they gave us 2.5 hours we stayed longer and they were fine with it. Really lovely venue ¬£130 for three of us Sunday roast, with two red wines, a desert wine, a Collins and a virgin mocktail.
Had a very good evening and lots of atmosphere that's about all
Wonderful service but sub par food....across all 5 people in our party.

A fantastic dinner. Restaurant definitely gets quite noisy at busy times but the food is most worth it. Wine list is fantastic, and overall experience is worth the extra money. This is my 3rd visit and I'll be back again very soon for my fourth!
What a relaxing Sunday roast. A real relaxing treat. Will definitely return. There was a relaxed atmosphere which was more welcoming than air street perhaps.

I try to find defects in my meals out, (I can't help it - a part of my job)
I tried as hard as humanly possible but you guys were flawless.
Thank you.
We had lovely evening for my wife's 30th,the service was exceptional and our waitress made it special for my wife.
The food is amazing as usual and the service is impeccable. Perfect for a date/get-together/celebration. Recommended.

Located in a quiet side street and a descent to the dining area a very pleasant meal was enjoyed.
The staff were informative and attentive to all our requests, making this an experience to remember.
You've not been to Hawksmoor if you don't have a Shaky Pete's!
Great burgers and steaks they did get one of the orders wrong and as it meant a wait for that person they deducted her meal, so dealt with well.

Really enjoyed our first visit to Hawksmoor. Went before going to theatre, booked for 12.30 and out ( without a rush) by 2.30, just perfect!
Food was really good and was enjoyed, but the service made it memorable it was fantastic. Would definitely recommend, if you like steak you will love it here.

Nice atmosphere fantastic service and really good meat, you can order from the menu or instead the special  meat cuts which are available they write these on a board although these are sometimes quite big but really good for sharing.

Revisited this restaurant with another relative, having been treated to a meal here previously by our son. Seated on time, service friendly but discreet, steaks cooked to perfection and accompanied by very tasty, crispy chips cooked in beef dripping and an excellent salad bowl - all added up to an excellent meal.

We got served by the nicest bearded Canadian who introduced us to the variety of choices we could make. He was engaging and couldn't do enough to help if needed.  The steak was stunning-best i've ever had. Look forward to returning to try out the rest of the menu

We came to celebrate in group of 5 our Birthday. Some of us Steak virgins..never had it before, so we needed help. We had a great waiter Owen, explaining everything and beeing very helpful and so attentive..he even gave us a special Birthday present..just so lovely, Thank you ever so much. It made our day. The food was great and wine out of heaven {try the Malbec}. Just great day out and we would love to do it again. Thank you very much.
Martin D

Lively atmosphere on a Friday evening. Attentive , friendly service throughout.

Fantastic pork ribs starter, rib eye steak was very good, not outstanding.

Three of us enjoyed a great evening.
Will definitely go back. Great selection of drinks, food was fabulous and locally sourced.  Loved the relaxed atmosphere and the salted caramel rolos are to die for.

Saturday night booking felt like a bit of a conveyor belt experience with the courses appearing one after the other.
Almost all the cuts with the exception of the large 850g to 1kg weights had sold out by 20:30.
We had a large 850g t-bone to share between two, the meat was good quality but not particularly well handled. Didn't look like it had been rested at all in a rush to get it out of the kitchen, was cold in the centre (med/rare) and was pre sliced so was devoid of any juices.

Service was friendly, but had to ask for water and at no point did anyone top up a wine glass or show any attentitiveness.

Overall an average experience. We've done much better for the money elsewhere.

I have been to hawksmoor a few times and I feel it is slipping - Goodman is better by a distance at the moment. My bone-in sirloin and my colleagues fillet were not rare enough (we asked for Blue and rare). The meat was good quality but not the highest. The side dishes are too small and not tasty enough at the price - the service is excellent.  I'm looking for better cooked meat to go back - Goodmans and Sophie's knocking

This was not my first trip to Hawksmoor and it wont be my last.

I am huge lover of Steak and when I find a placer that does it well then I keep goign back and this time did not disappoint.

We had a little bit of wait for the servers to take our drinks orders and bring our drinks but bar that it was excellent.
The customer service is amazing therr the people are so nice and patient I would recommend this restaurant to everyone

Fantastic restaurant! It was a lovely layout. Amazing staff which where all very attentive and had great recommendations. The food was outstanding, best steak I have ever had. Will be coming back for sure. Thank you
Great food. Steaks are best around. Desserts even better. Will be back!
Birthday meal! The server was  Very knowledgeable about the menu and would come round at the perfect times.

Amazing roast as reviews suggest.

Service was brilliant and we had a lovely evening. A lovely birthday desert was organised for my partner.

Having been going to Hawksmoor for a number of years now it was a bittersweet experience- lovely to be back in the restaurant but sad that it was not the bustling atmosphere of the past. My only complaint is that the thrice cooked chips looked and tasted like normal chips. All else was as divine as usual. Well done to all the staff for their exceptional level of service as usual.
Service was amazing and the food matched it!!
It was a nice Sunday roast! The staff were kind and nice. I went there by myself but I didn't feel uncomfortable.
Incredibly prepared steaks. Perfect Medium-Rare. And the atmosphere almost felt like pre-Covid.
An awesome return for one of the best steak joints in London. Great food, class service and buzzy ambience as always.
Great service, great food, great time. The atmosphere was just right, a good buzz but not so loud you couldn't hear anything. Will definitely recommend.

They gave us a burnt steak. Yes they wrote it off the check - but we still came in there for the good food. the Mac & Cheese was with too much salt.
the service was very good though.

As I say, it was dealt with immediately and the steak was removed from the bill.  Other than that we had a very pleasant lunch.

+: very good food (bravo for the triple cooked fries and the wonderful carot salad).
-: Not enough light in the restaurant and very very noisy..
Great food. Great atmosphere. Great staff. Would highly recommend and will definitely be visiting again.
always delicious food and great service. their lunchtime set menu is a great deal - highly recommend

Three of us enjoyed a great evening.
Will definitely go back. Great selection of drinks, food was fabulous and locally sourced.  Loved the relaxed atmosphere and the salted caramel rolos are to die for.

I have been to hawksmoor a few times and I feel it is slipping - Goodman is better by a distance at the moment.
