The side dishes are too small and not tasty enough at the price - the service is excellent.  I'm looking for better cooked meat to go back - Goodmans and Sophie's knocking

This was not my first trip to Hawksmoor and it wont be my last.

I am huge lover of Steak and when I find a placer that does it well then I keep goign back and this time did not disappoint.

We had a little bit of wait for the servers to take our drinks orders and bring our drinks but bar that it was excellent.
We went for a special occasion meal here and everyone's food was fantastic. Service was excellent and the restaurant was suitably atmospheric for the occasion.

We had wanted to have a meal at Hawksmoor for ages and recently took advantage of their early bird express menu. Great value on the 2 or 3 course meals, including their renowned steak, along with starters, sides and dessert. The atmosphere was more laidback than we had expected - contemporary rather than stuffy. The chairs and booths are designed for lingering and we didn't feel rushed, despite being on an 'express menu'. No hard sell on drinks or extras, and the bar is very nice for a drink or dining, with a wide range of cocktails and spirits at fairly on-par prices. The service was of a higher standard than many central London restaurants - attentive, friendly, sincere and swift. We are planning to return for another special occasion!
Fantastic meal with very good quality steak and cooked perfectly (ordered porterhouse to share). great location, would recommend.

I'm not sure I can really write further superlatives about the food, ambiance, general buzz and quality of this restaurant. It really has the best meat available - impeccably cooked, rested and served. Everything we had was perfect: the freshest crab on toast, a giant 'to share' rib-eye and fab salted chocolate caramel tart (do of course add chips - superb).

I'm not usually that concerned about sommeliers but the guy who advised on the wine was incredibly knowledgeable and thanks to him had one of the best reds I've ever drunk at a restaurant that was just wonderful with the meat.

'Tis not cheap, but for a special night (or every night were I a banker) I would eat here as often as I could afford: outstanding ...

We had a very pleasant dining experience. The booking process had no glitches, we were expected and our table was ready for us though we were early. The staff were attentive, particularly those waiting tables. We chose the Express Menu as we were going to the theatre and the food was served speedily but with no loss of quality. The restaurant was casual, not at all formal, something we like. The setting, in an old brewery, made interesting viewing.
What an amazing experience. Everything about this place is fantastic!
You just have to try once and you will come back because it will be the best steak you ever had.
The food was a delight, and our waiter CA went out of his way to give us a perfect evening.

For starters we had prawns on toast and potted mackerel ( the mackerel was the better of the two ). For main meal we talked it over with our waiter who explained all the cuts to us and decided on a 850g chatubriand. My wife doesn't like pink steak but I like medium so the waiter advised us to go medium well as the ends of the chatubriand would be cooked more than the center. We also went with the triple cooked chips , mash, bone marrow gravy and anchovie hollandaise.
The meat was lovely and flavoursome but it was very very pink in the middle cuts and medium on the ends. The chips were amazing and the bone marrow gravy is the best I've tasted.
Overall I'd say a great meal but not for light of pocket ( ¬£110 for the chatubriand alone)

We had a meal here on Friday 27th September. Overall we were disappointed with our meal. The steak was too expensive for what you got but it was cooked ok, everything else was only average. Our sides were bordering on the cold side, including mash and side sauces. Also it is a bit much to expect customers to pay for all extras... Including sides, sauces. The staff are far too casual. It would be nicer if all staff had to dress similarly as at times it was hard to even tell who was working or just socialising in the restaurant.

I have been a fan of Hawksmoor restaurants for a number of years, and still am. Still great service and very good food, but I just wonder if a peak has been reached. Maybe there is a difference between the different restaurants but on this occasion the Seven Dials fillet steak was very good, but not sensational like the ones that I have had at their Guildhall branch. Maybe I am being a bit picky, so will have to try again to confirm my fears of otherwise. I think this is till my favourite group of restaurants and I hope that they will stay this way.

Great service, great food, good atmosphere. I visited here to take clients on a work lunch and I will definitely come back. I would also recommend it for evening drinks / dinner or for a special occasion. The service is great ‚Äì very attentive serving staff but also not too intrusive.
Great attentive service in at reveption and in the bar area. Good food as usual, quite slow service once in the restaurant, less slick than what we've experienced there in the past

Sunday lunch. Utterly incredible. Portions are very large but did not detract from the quality of the meal. I asked for no potatoes (in an attempt to stick to my 'carb-free' diet) and they gave me extra portions of veg, which was fantastic. Would definately recommend. Only ¬£19.50 for the full roast - unbeatable.
This restaurant is in the basement but make no mistake. Service is amazing and quality of food.
Our pre Theatre meal at Hawkesmoor was good, excellent food, good wine list and attentive but not fussy service. pleasant surroundings and will happily revisit
best steak and superb lobster in London!

My partner and myself when on our first date on the 11th January 2013 to the Hawksmoor Seven Dials in London...

The staff were amazing especially our waiteress (I believe her name was Natalie) - who made the night so special, the food was amazing... I would recommend the restaurant to anyone who wants to enjoy good food, good wine and a really friendly amblience and amazing staff...
Tasty food, tasty cocktails, lovely staff, lovely atmosphere. I could spend all my days in here if I could afford to.

The service was warm and freindly and the ambiance lively for a Tuesday evening. The fillet steak came recommended and did not disappoint. Coupled with the triple fried chips I can say it was an excellent combination.

I wouldn't say that Hawksmoor met my expectations. The description of my starter was quite fancy but i ended up with what tasted like beetroot out of a vacuum pack! My husband had oysters, which were fine, but then again it's not like you have to do anything apart from open them, it's hardly cooking. The menu waxed lyrical about Chateaubriand but even at 6.30pm on a Friday evening they had already run out of pieces small enough for 2 people - they recommended 600g but had nothing smaller than 750g and at ¬£12+ per 100g, that's a pricey steak! The fillet we ordered was good, but so it should be for the price. If i were going to spend that money on steak again i'd go to Gaucho's. At least they give you a little basket of fancy bread!

Lovely Sunday lunch, didn't really "need" pudding but still had one.
Service was excellent, friendly & helpful when asking for drinks/pudding recommendations . Steaks & burgers looked good but as we were there for Sunday Lunch we had to choose the Roast Beef option which did not disappoint.
Looking forward to returning

Wow! what a fantastic meal. As steak lovers we were recommended this restaurant. We were not disappointed. The leather upholstery, and warm macho feel to the industrial type decor made us feel as if we'd walked onto a top gear set. Staff were wonderful , patiently explaining the options. Wonderful cocktails and superbly matched wine choices. So glad we didn't eat starters; the chateaubriand with chips and creamed spinach hit the spot and left us so full! Absolutely by delicious. Would we come again? Yes, try stopping us; bringing our menfolk next time! My daughter and I , as two women diners, were not unusual, the clientele was a broad mix but you really do need to love red meat!

We arrived at 2.30pm (after waiting for a member of our party to arrive) the service seemed rather rushed, our waiter forgot a portion of our chips and one rib-eye was more medium/well done than medium rare as I had requested. My friend's fillet however was absolutely superb so I would order that next time.
Would still recommend

I greatly enjoyed the excellent meat, and our waitress couldn't have been more charming or helpful - but it's a VERY noisy room which doesn't make for a relaxed meal. On a Sarurday night the clientele is less urban smart and more chavvy "Bridge and Tunnel' - in fact Hawksmoor could usefully open a pop-up in Basildon and save them all the journey.

Expensive and good but not great is the overall experience. Next time, I'll go back to Goodmans.

Very good food. Excellent wine and cocktails. And the biggest shock of all was the veggie menu - absolutely delicious. Service was very fast ... perhaps a bit too fast for a romantic dinner but our waitress was very attentive. The noise was the only downside. Far too noisy but not sure what can be done about that.
Good all round experience. Steak lover's choice with plenty to choose from. Essentially Very Nice...
Great steaks, good informed server, well priced
Massive and tasty Sunday lunch. Mishap with the timing on the starter, but happily adjusted by the waitress. Would go again.
Seven Dials restaurant: Great service and great atmosphere. However the fillet was dry even though we it medium rare which was disappointing.

I took my boyfriend for lunch on his birthday, because I had enjoyed
a meal here with my daughter a short while before, unfortunately
my steak was over cooked this time, but it was absolutely no trouble
at all they cooked me another and even replaced the side orders
Very good service
Great restaurant, great steak, great service. You can't go wrong here.
Great atmosphere with nice food, drinks and service.
Cracking spot. Great food. Hearing was nice. Service was quality. Can‚Äôt ask for more during outdoor seated meals in a buzzing area!
great restaurant, good food, but really excellent service.
Great food and service
Had the set menu lunch. Excellent selection & brilliant value. Staff were amazing. Attentive & professional. Will definitely recommend & will be visiting again soon.
Yummy food, great staff and ambiance, catering for all ages.  We will definitely be back!
Excellent food but delay in serving the third round of tapas meant we had to cancel the dessert as we were going to the theatre
The food was lovely - different to anything we've eaten before.  The restaurant atmosphere was buzzing and we had a great night.
The meal was really good packed full of flavour but as a small plate menu the cost doesn't reflect that.
Food was incredible and staff were good. It was a little lacking in atmosphere as it was a Sunday afternoon but I‚Äôll definitely be back on a weekend evening to fully appreciate the cocktails!

We went for the first time recently and we will definitely be back, in fact we have already rebooked for our next trip into London - why it was fantastic, the food, the service, the cost,  just everything was great.

Staff were very welcoming and food was lovely, not had Peruvian before but would again after this , portions generous , we had the pre theatre menu and was good value for money, would definitely recommend.
Tapas style dinner.  We started with the guava Bellini which was fantastic an average piscina sour!  The tacos were 2 bites each and delicious.  Loved the spiceyness of the food.  Will return!
Good food, average service, very busy, not enough waiting staff, very loud music.
Ideal location away from the hustle and bustle, great breakfast.
The Raspberry Soda was delicious. The food was tasty and good portions.
Nice restaurant to go out with friends or for couples! Food was nice but not super great.
Loved the place, the service and the food!
1h30 was too short but everything else was very good
Very enjoyable and wonderful service.
The place itself was lovely, and the service was great. Yet the it was unbearably loud and when our food arrived, my toast was burnt and very hard to cut and the scrambled eggs were very salty

Really lovely good, veggie choices were great. Service was friendly and professional.
Atmosphere was buzzy. Found it a little noisy, only issue really. Look forward to returning.
2nd time I've been here and both times, the food was good, the bar staff really friendly and funny and the bill isn't crazy expensive.  Great place to meet a friend and catch up on the goss

The staff were very friendly and the food was very tasty. However, it was extremely busy (Sunday midday) and we had to wait 50 minutes for our food to arrive. Additionally, we also ordered pancakes but were told after an hour that the batter was not good enough to be served. We were given complementary french toast however which was great!

Tasty food, good central location but really dire service, I'm afraid!  Our deserts took over half an hour to arrive and when we asked a waiter (ours was nowhere to be seen) what had happened he simply said 'I don't know,  this isn't my table' and walked off.

I came here for the first time to celebrate a special occasion (as the restaurant was aware) and was disappointed by the service provided.
We had great food - Mac n cheese, artichoke dip, burger and enjoyed the cool vibes of the restaurant, but again just disappointed with the service we received.
We would like to try it again as the food was good and hope the service will be better this time around.

Been here loads of times but today the food let it down, for what ever reason the chef was very heavy on the salt and we twice had to send back dishes that we couldn't eat. The waiter dealt with it professionally and we were not charged but it was disapointing

Sunday evening, early dinner.
4 items (smoothies and desserts) that we ordered were not available and the server had to come back to let us know. Totally not his fault, but definetely the place needs to step up the internal communication, since the servers and kitchen porters are those that actually are in contact with the Guests.

Otherwise the selection of meals and desserts is pretty neat and the drinks list is nice as well. Average to good wine list, their German Traminer is lovely and not to sharp if you don't like super dry wines.

The servers and porters were all very good and engaging with us.

Food was great, clean. Great choice of food but way too expensive for just a breakfast. Nice but won't be back. ¬£15 for a full breakfast and I had no eggs(I'm allergic to them) still full price a bit rude.

Service was extremely slow, even taking into account how busy they were. The food was only OK and too costly given the quality and size of portions even by London prices.  There are too many people in the restaurant meaning it is very loud and difficult to hear anybody at your table.

Third or fourth time here for brunch.  I keep being disappointed so won't go back again. Service was slow, had to ask for things repeatedly. My bacon was so fatty I had to cut half of it away. My friend had to send her eggs benedict back because it was cold. The whole thing feels overpriced for the poor quality of food and service.
Enjoyed a cozy dinner here in a nice corner booth. Soft lighting, buzzy atmosphere, relatively unobtrusive service. Food was nice, not mind blowing, but well done. Menu has something for everyone.
Lovely space. Friendly staff. Great fir a working lunch.

The atmosphere, ambience and d√©cor all make you feel like the coolest kids in town. This visit was no exception and we were not the only people to have the bright idea of Sunday brunch as the place was packed. As a result service was slower than usual, but we were informed the kitchen was backed up with orders by two different waiters, which was very informative.

Food was good and service was excellent. Make for an great start to a Sunday.

Had dinner here last weekend and left feeling a little underwhelmed. Food was very average and quite pricey for what it was. We had the lobster lasagne and longhorn burger, both of which were okay but nothing special. We also ordered a side order of autumn greens, it was just some kale in butter and a dash of chilli, very disappointing. Otherwise the service was good, staff were friendly and the ambience was nice.

Exceptionally warm and friendly service and good food at reasonable prices. Great-looking dining room and nice touches such as the breakfast smoothie served in a milk bottle. Would definitely recommend and will be back.

I thought the atmosphere was good, and service was also great. I would come back, but was very disappointed with my meal. I ordered the Lobster Benedict which was ¬£17 with no sides. The lobster came on the dish with hardly any lobster at all (about 7 little tiny pea sized pieces), the regular eggs Benedict was ¬£9, I thought it was a total rip off and would not recommend that dish to anyone. I think if you are going to sell a Lobster Benedict at ¬£17 you need to have some actual lobster on it.

Food was delicious, but the service was quite poor. There was only one waitress for the entire room. First ordered coffee and by the time she got around to take my food order, my beverage was already cold.

This restaurant was so welcoming and cosy , the food was amazing as we're the cocktails , we went as a couple in a nice cosy corner but would take my two girls back as they would love the large sharing table .
The smoothies are amazing and I love that you can get a half order of eggs benedict! That means you can have something yummy and (combined with a smoothie) filling, but not quite as sinful :)
This place is great for casual and semi-formal dining and if you live in the area, it must be a godsend... don't know if I'd cross town for it though.

I had booked a table for 6 for brunch far in advance for a special family occasion but we were seated kind of round the corner away from the buzz or the restaurant and next to the door which was very drafty. As we'd booked well in advance I had expected a better table which I found a big disappointment, but luckily the food made up for it. If you're just 2, ask to sit at the bar, there's a great atmosphere there.
buzzy, lively ambience combined with attentive yet casual service and delicious food make for a winning combination! refreshing change from the chains that dot Oxford Street.

I have often gone on a Sunday for lunch and thought it was great. This week I went during the week to meet up with friends. Table bookings were limited - in spite of many open tables during the entire period I was there and the food was not terribly good. My burger was overcooked and the fries limp and lukewarm - all for ¬£17.50. Not good value.

Amazing ambience and reasonably good service (although they did try to bring the tea before the pudding...) at The Riding House Cafe but the main course food was very average.  It's got a great vibe and if they could just improve on the quality and appearance of the food, it would be fantastic!

A truly great restaurant with amazing food and service. The only two things I disliked about The Riding house was that the soundlevel was very, very high from the bar in the next room (this was a Friday) and the fact that they automatically charge 12,5% servicefee. A fee I have to actively take away from the bill if I don't want it there. Irritating to say the least.

Brilliant and relaxing lunch at The Riding House Cafe near Oxford Circus. Service was great and didn't make us feel rushed at all. Highlight was eating nearby Heston Blumenthal - we expected the food to be really good and it was! Will definitely be returning.

Riding House Cafe continues to impress. The evening menu is the same as the lunch menu, which makes an evening out very good value. The menu is enticing and varied. The staff are excellent - a friend dropped a fork on the floor and the waitress reacted, presenting a new one on a silver tray, before we even had time to summon her. The decor is fun and tasteful. The only downside was that we had a 2 hour table slot. We could have stayed much longer, enjoying the ambience.
Great food, good drinks, friendly service, we had a very enjoyable evening. JT

We loved the Riding House, especially on the 50% deal, although I would return and happily pay full price as it really was a faultless dining experince.  Service was brisk and thorough, food delivered what the delicious descriptions promised.  Particularly tasty was the pork belly, steak tartare and Titchfield burger.  The decor of the restaurant is very pleasing with comfortable leather armchairs surrounding circular tables. Just writing this makes me feel like I want to go again.

Wonderful service and food, great atmosphere in the courtyard.

Would definitely go again.
Lovely experience. Great service And food. Very healthy and seasonal. Highly recommended!

Delightful, friendly, helpful service
Lovely setting, inside & out. Delicious food!
Been twice now & v. yummy both times.

Excellent ambience outdoors and attentive service without being fussy . The courtyard setting has artmosphere but without the busy footfall on soem of teh restarants on the main streets  I chose a Rose which was good value and perfect for the sunny lunchtime. Selection of different courses chosen provided a good variety. This was our second visit and we will be going back .
Amazing food and very nice decor inside, we enjoyed the ambiance and the service. The pulled pork ragu tagliatelle are particularly delicious!
Delicious food with lovely atmosphere and good service.
Excellent!
Not enough staff, portion sizes tiny, overpriced. Apart from that, a nice evening.
Staff were very friendly and helpful, portions very small for the price. It stated free mock tail or glass of wine with table booked in January but I was charged for mine.. not too pleased
We had a lovely lunch with excellent food and service, slightly let down by the temporary absence of my ordered glass of red wine. Will come again

After visiting The Petersham earlier in the year, I was excited about trying out La Goccia. The food certainly didn‚Äôt disappoint. Gorgeous plates of delicious-ness. Fresh, quality ingredients - particularly enjoyed the salt-baked pollock.
However - as with a number of reviews - the service is not a patch on The Petersham. The staff are friendly but not attentive. And certainly not interested in catching your eye! We waited 20mins for someone to even acknowledge we were there ... only one glass brought over for the water (there was 2 of us!) and then had to ask twice if we could order. Then we waited a further 15 mins for someone to come over. The restaurant wasn‚Äôt under-staffed or overly busy. It seemed other diners experienced the same problems - couple next to us having to ask for plates for starters, cutlery and glasses. The female toilets were a mess with litter and broken taps. Seems they need to find a good front of house manager ....

Hopefully this is still down to early day teething problems. I will go back again ...
The plates are small and perfect for sharing.  The flavours were amazing and we re-ordered a few dishes. Really enjoyed it.  We sat inside, which was nice, but the court yard also looked amazing.

A bit hit and miss. I really wanted to like it, but the burger just didn‚Äôt taste of truffle. I asked for no onion, without realising that the fried onion does most of the heavy lifting in terms of appearance, so it came out looking very little and flat. If you didn‚Äôt think of the truffle, you‚Äôd say it was a pretty good burger.

Chips tasted good, but came out slightly on the cool side and therefore a bit rubbery. We also got croquetas, which were fried perfectly.

It was hardest to peg in terms of value. If it had tasted of truffle, and the chips crispy, it would have been absolutely phenomenal value. But for a standard, small burger‚Ä¶ let‚Äôs put it this way, my dining companion said ‚ÄúI could‚Äôve gone to McDonald‚Äôs for a fraction of this amount‚Äù. And truthfully, you can get consistently excellent standard burgers and fries at Honest for the same price.

Service was good though - friendly, attentive staff. Maybe they just had an off night in the kitchen‚Ä¶ I hope so, because I really wanted to love Truffle!
Great service and really nice simple vibe. The Truffle signature burger was out of this world and the chicken burger was 10/10
Great service. Lovely food and drinks. A very enjoyable dinner and drinks. Would recommend.

Lovely evening at May Fair Kitchen. Food was outstanding with lots to choose from. Service from Kristiana and team was exceptional - felt very well looked after.

Terrace area had a lively atmosphere - we were there as a group so this wasn‚Äôt an issue, but might be too loud if you were there as a couple or smaller group.

Overall had a lovely evening, and will be back soon!
food was lovely - service was great, even though they mixed up a dish it was quickly rectified. Would recommend you ask what is in the dish if vegetarian :-)
Amazing food on the lunch deal. And all for a very good price, the portions were a good size and every dish was delicious. Will definitely be coming again!
Last minute booking and a great find. Great food and service, at times I did feel like we were forgotten about between dishes coming out but that wasn't really the case.
Great food for a family meal. Full family fully enjoyed all the courses
Service was a bit slow but overall the place is lovely and the greatest food
Lovely food, and very fast service. Slightly overpriced for the portion sizes. Convenient location. However, the toilets were absolutely filthy. I came out gagging.
Good food and service but tables are very close together considering the pandemic and all were occupied.
This is my second visit and once again everything was amazing, I have recommended it to all of my friends
Great food but small portions. Guests noise is worse with the loud music played but other than that great location and great place would

The lady at the door to check you in is very rude! No respect!

They had no A/C which was annoying as it was one of the hottest day.

Door lady sat us away from the main eating area and right next to the ugly kitchen even though the resteraunt was practically empty where it looked nice(dont know what her problem was). Food was overpriced and the quality of the food didnt justify the spend. Dont get the noodles #nasty. Prawns were nice and serving staff were polite and entertaining. Wouldnt go again. Hankies in Marble arch is a place I would recommend.
Thank me later.

Tried from a recommendation. Travelled from South Hampshire and was not disappointed. Loved the signature Dynamite prawns and melt in the mouth Mongolian Beef and Kung Pao chicken. So tasty and will be back!
The best food every time we come to London. Will always recommend to others visiting
Portions could be much larger, the main servings were very small

Snugly located in the narrower streets off Leicester Square my friend was a bit hesitant. Our uncertainty changed into ecstasy once we passed the door and into the restaurant. The place was humming with activity and looked a lot more spacious than the impression you get from outside.

At about 2pm on a weekday it was not very busy and we had no problem in getting a table.

To me PF Chang is like a treasure trove. Each time you visit there is another new item you want to taste. This time was no different. I started off with my regular, tried and tested vegetable spring roles followed by the must have PF Chang's signature dish the Dynamite Shrimps. A dish that to me has set a bench mark for what a shrimp/ prawn dish should be like. Most other tables had it!

We followed it with a lettuce Chicken wrap. Another usual for me.

This time I noticed a very enticing dish being served at another table. My waiter informed me it was 'chicken Deli' Looked very inviting on its own but was served with white creamy rice. It was simply out of this world. Try it next time you visit PF Chang.

Of course NOT everything was perfect. The waiters, service, ambience and most importantly the food were great but......Definitely rather expensive. I was glad I only hand one guest. More than that, I would have ended up washing dishes to pay my bill!
Great food, must have the dynamite shrimp
My best friend picked out the restaurant and believe me it was the best, yes it was a tad pricey but its definitely very filling and delicious. Will be going again soon
Second time here, amazing food and service was much better. Last time we went quite late at night. Would suggest an afternoon booking for the future
Food was amazing, one of the best Asian food I‚Äôve had! Quickness of the food was good, however tables were too close together
The food was delicious. I‚Äôll be dreaming about the shrimp until next time.

Great venue, tasty food. The only downside was that we were told upon entering the restaurant that we could only have our table for 1.5 hours - as this had not been said to us when booking this was a surprise and very disappointing and we were hoping to have a nice evening with plenty drinks, courses (including dessert).
Food was beautiful and the service was super, only thing is the portion size are really small

The emphasis as soon as we walked in is that we only have the table for a hour and a half and mentioned even whilst ordering. The menu has changed with smaller portions with the starters and mains being served together on a tiny table, a very rushed experience.

The food was lovely, it was just a shame to wait almost 40 mins for my starter. My friend who has been a couple of times said this is not the restaurant s usual service, maybe it was exceptionally busy the day I went. But the food was gorgouse, the restaurant is beautiful. One advice- do not have a jumper in, the restaurant is incredibly warm!
Food was lovely, place was lovely, waiters were lovely. Only negative was that they gave my starters with my main course.

Great to finally find a PFC in the UK. Please open more outside of London too.
Food and service very good. Due to it being very busy it was very noisy and loud but overall we enjoyed our visit.
Shocking service. Had to chase a waiter down multiple times in order to get served. I‚Äôve had better Chinese food at my local takeaway.

The most delicious food, well done and a good price for Leicester Square.
Shame you ran out of beer.
Amazing food. Really enjoyed it. The service was amazingly quick and I will definitely visit again.
All our expectations were met.  Will definitely return.
loved it, tiny bit on the expensive side given the size of the portions but I would def come back!! thanks!!

The level of service and quality of food is fantastic. You‚Äôd never know this was a hotel/chain (I usually avoid at all costs). Great central location, yet not to big or busy. Not my first time here and it won‚Äôt be my last.

Tasty food and excellent service. Perhaps very slightly pricey even on the ¬£22 deal, but would go again. Loved the ravioli and the risotto - which weren't the Peruvian dishes, but those were good too.
One of the tastiest lunches I‚Äôve had in London!

Stylish bar and restaurant in the heart of Seven dials. Creative food and fantastic service combine to make dining here feel like a treat in an unpretentious, inclusive fashion! A bit on the pricey side, but it felt worth it.
Great experience. Lovely venue and location. Just very small portions and therefore not value for money as advertised with two ¬£¬£ signs. Overall lovely though
Great atmosphere, well looked after and super selection of food

Really good early evening venue - lively at that time - after a family member's matinee theatre trip for birthday.

Food combination of one side Italian, one side Peruvian really works. Both were good.

Service from Lara also great.

Not sure why so many places don't get through details of the OpenTable booking but once that was sorted all else fell into place.
The food was delicious, the wine was fabulous, the service was excellent. All in all a terrific pre-theatre dining experience for a bunch of Western Australians.

We came for a Saturday lunch catch up. The food and service were great!
Only downside was that it was absolutely freezing and while the waiter said that the air-con has been turned down i spent lunch wrapped in my scarf.
But not stopping me going there tonight for dinner!

What an ambience and a beautiful setting to fine dine in. We were treated to a 6 course taster menu of the highest order by the most courteous of waiters/waitresses. Every detail was covered to make the whole experience one to never forget. We‚Äôd highly recommend indulging in the exquisite surroundings that are Mere. Faultless service and quality.

We had the tasting menu with the wine pairing. It was a wonderful experience - exceptional food and fantastic wine. The service was brilliant - attentive and very friendly.  We had a truly memorable night
A fantastic dinning experience. Food excellent and staff friendly, courteous and knowledgeable. Would definitely recommend and will visit again.

We had an amazing meal with delightful canap√©s to start.  The atmosphere was so warm and welcoming and it felt very comfortable.  The staff were so attentive but not intrusive and were happy to make suggestions for wine pairing based upon what we were eating.  The icing on the cake was to see Monica saying hello to all of the diners.  She was so warm and genuine, my husband and I were thrilled to meet her.
I have been to this restaurant several times and it keeps getting better.

Went to Mere to celebrate my fiancee's birthday. It was our first time in a fine dining restaurant, and also being huge Master Chef fans we were very excited to be there! The ambience, the service, the food - everything is just outstanding. Monica was chatting with all the tables and she came to say hi to us as well! Hope next time we can take a selfie :D we ordered the tasting menu and everything was just lovely. My favourite dish - cheese mousse with figs and croutons - absolutely divine!
Overall, this was an amazing experience, I recommend this restaurant to everyone who want to eat delicious food and spend an evening in an amazing atmosphere being taken care of well by the staff :) thank you, Mere Team!
Lovely bar to have drink before great barman . Restaurant buzzy great service and fabulous food . Will be back

Truly amazing. Was so excited to come here after hearing great things (and of course watching Monica on Masterchef) and it didn't disappoint! Went for the tasting menu with wine pairings and could not fault it - every course was amazing and the wines were delicious. The service was great; the staff were warm and friendly without being overly formal, setting just the right tone. The restaurant itself is decorated nicely and creates a nice atmosphere, feeling not too formal whilst still having that feeling that it's somewhere a bit upmarket and great for a special occasion. Will definitely be back!

Fabulous setting , lovely staff with great personalities and the host visiting each table was very impressive and appreciated
Can‚Äôt wait to go again
we had a lovely evening, excellent food, good wines, no hurry, time and space to talk with each other.
Sadly the restaurant did not live up to my expectations. Food was very average and very expensive!

Perfect in every way. This was our second visit and it won‚Äôt be the last. Fabulous flavours, expert cooking and wonderful knowledge staff who don‚Äôt intrude but who appear at just the right time. Just a really, really great restaurant. Long may it thrive.
Wonderful experience! Attentive staff provides excellent service. Absolutely delicious food with beautiful presentation. Gorgeous setting and ambiance. The lemon flamb√© dessert is a must!
The pairing of wines to  food was first class great food and service.

Had the tasting Menu.
Excellent food,well presented and very flavoursome.
The cod and the rose veal were outstanding
A great experioence

Booked Mere for my friend‚Äôs birthday and had a lovely time. The food was fantastic - we had the tasting menu and every course was unique and delicious. We enjoyed a couple of cocktails and some carafes of wine with our meal, and to top it off the service was impeccable. My friend was surprised at the end of the meal with a note from the Team wishing her a happy birthday. She (and I) had the most wonderful time - thank you to all at Mere!

Beautiful new restaurant. Great bar with attractive dining room downstairs. The room quickly filled up and had a real buzz as the team chatted with customers. The team were really friendly and attentive. Asking about dietary requirements and then guiding us accordingly, recommending changes to meet those requirements in great detail. Tasting menu was very tasty, if a little small. Great wine list and the Sommelier did a fantastic job of describing the wines and recommending something interesting that met our tastes.

Superb experience all round. Amazing flavours and food, superb service and we got to meet the chef who worked her way around all of the tables at a very casual pace.
Highly recommended. Take the tasting menu and wine pairing for the full experience

Quite simply, a fantastic experience.  The restaurant, the staff, the food were all amazing.  We eat in many fine dining places and Monica's is the best we have experienced. Only a matter of time before it get's a Michelin Star or two!

An excellent meal, each course well cooked and beautifully presented. We were there for lunch on my husbands birthday and we had the tasting menu. The dishes were just the right size so you didn't get too full, but you felt that you had had a good meal. Free refills of coffee too. The staff were very attentive and helpful. We were also given a 'Happy Birthday' note from Monica, David and the team (very subtle, so not advertised to the whole restaurant, which was good - I had mentioned it was his birthday when I booked). Monica also went round every table to chat to the patrons. A brilliant experience and one that I am sure we will repeat.
Fantastic!
An incredible dinning experience.. sensational food and service. We will definitely be back to this wonderful restaurant.

Had an enjoyable evening with my partner, which I had arranged for his birthday. the staff and service was faultless and runs smoothly. Had pre-dinner cocktails which we both enjoyed.

The menu choices is not extensive, but has something for everyone. My only slightly negative feedback, was some of the food had a bit too much seasoning - dessert was fabulous!

I informed the restaurant it was my partner's birthday and he was given a handwritten card from Monica Galetti, which was a really nice touch.

Mother's day gift. Needless to say my aunts loved it!
And Monica made it even more special by popping down and taking selfies with us :)
Fantastic meal and excellent service in a beautiful setting. Would highly recommend

Fabulous dining experience.  Only wish we had known to request to sit in the back area where the ambience looked beautiful. Our table was located at the end of the bar and a little wobbly. We could see into the gorgeous back dining area, just wished we had been seated there! Fabulous food and such attentive friendly staff.  Really special lunch and enjoyed it thoroughly

First time back post covid as xmas cancelled and been patrons for 13 plus years. new staff new chef.
Took friends and felt let down a little. starter watercress soup just not hitting the mark lacked substance. The old Fungi cream soup was superb so why change it. The mains sirloin super, Lamb ok, Artichoke just not sure what was going on here just no where near a main course.

Kir royal proseco lush

Sides not as extensive as normal and prices just do not equate sorry,truffle mash just super.

Deserts sorbet ok cheeses were great and plenty of condiments. No pastry cakes or wow factors.

wine choice Graywacke and crossings superb Sauvignon from New Zealand. Sommelier and manager on form. Staff attentive just need to up knowledge.

Had to wait longer for main course no issues but do think this affected the night as then had to rush a little towards the end.

Overall I found prices just too high for what we had,I don't knowing that's a covid or life effect but they need to redress. The pre theatre menu is good.

I hope they pick it up and look at pricing because as good as it is and we love it you still have to have a modicum of vfm at the high end.
A lovely place for a romantic lunch. Food excellent & service very attentive.

Wonderful meal in a wonderful restaurant.
The staff were very friendly and attentive. Overall first class experience and my colleague booked to return there and then.
We were celebrating a birthday.The lunch menu was fantastic value?The service was excellent and the staff were knowledgeable and friendly.

Had their set lunch menu-as good as I remembered from previous visits.
The Xmas ambience was lovely with a quiet buzz.
However a black mark for the (head waiter) who asked if we‚Äôd like coffee &
at the same time looked at his watch! He obviously wanted us to leave to set up
for the next customers.
What has been a special place was instantly ruined by this split second action.
Also another waiter could not speak or understand English very well.
I truly hope this is not the start of going downhill.

As always a delicious lunch! Clos Maggiore  never fails to impress.  However, I was looking forward to having venison  for my main course as suggested on the website. None was available. Clos Maggiore needs to keep their website menus up to date

I booked a table for two for a date with my partner, unfortunately it was a very late reservation so we did not get to be in the conservatory. Nothing to object though as the ambient was lovely and the service outstanding. The food was a treat for the eyes, but what we both happily agreed on was that, contrary to many "fancy" expensive other places, at Clos Maggiore portions are enough to not make you go away hungry and the taste is absolutely sublime!

We had a lovely evening at Clos Maggiore. Though we did not have a reservation in the conservatory, the ambience was still lovely where we were seated. The food was exceptional, and the service amazing. I was very impressed that we received a special dessert treat for our anniversary, which showed the extra care and attention.

Amazing food, we had the seasonal tasting menu with wine which complimented the food.
We were lucky enough to sit in the conservatory and wow the atmosphere is gorgeous. Would definitely recommend and we shall be returning.
Propose to my girlfriend on Friday night staff were outstanding and helpful in everyway

A beautiful setting for a romantic date with very good quality food and wine. My only criticism was around the service which didn‚Äôt reflect what I was expecting. I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôs probably a rare occurance but something that would make me think twice about booking again. I also found the ‚Äòambiance‚Äô far to quite and felt quite awkward at times - a little bit of background music would have solved this.

The most wonderful dining experience I‚Äôve had.  Staff was attentive and warm.  Food was beyond delicious.  The restaurant itself is absolutely lovely.  I highly recommend you reserve a table as soon as you possibly can!

I would easily recommend Clos Maggiore to a friend. Good food, friendly staff, efficient service and outstanding decor. One of the most romantic restaurants we've been in London. Perfect for a special occasion.

Great ambiance and extremely good service. Had a wonderful french waiter.
The food was tasty but a little bland. Hoped for a little extra twist, but left a little disappointed. Wine was better than food.
Fantastic scene, we had the most romantic table of the restaurant. The service was perfect, professional and charming at the same time. Excellent food as you can expect. Wonderful time.

Faultless food and service as always
Also such amazing value
Love this place
Lovely and delicious dinner, beautiful place, perfect for our anniversary. Thanks to the staff for the welcoming. We definitely recommend this place.

Beautiful restaurant & food.
However would have liked to be seated in the conservatory. Where all the atmosphere is.
Excellent food and amazing ambience. Not all staff are professional and the common space is very limited (understandable in Covent Garden). Will come back to the conservatory!
We dine at Close Maggiore every time we visit London and it's always an amazing experience.
It's a stunning restaurant, and I can't thank enough for the service provided

Beautiful decor and a very romantic feel about the restaurant. The food was amazing, we had the pre theatre menu,the choice was limited but varied and delicious. The venison for our main meal was cooked to perfection. All the staff where very attentive and very professional. I would recommend this restaurant to anybody who is wanting to mark an occasion or treat a loved one!
We celebrated a birthday there; the food was amazing, together with the atmosphere, service and drinks selection. It's great for special occasions, we hope to be seated in the conservatory next time!

A wholesome and enriching experience.
We (two) discovered Clio Maggiore on a previous visit to London nearly twelve months ago, and recognised that it was the ideal venue for this, a birthday celebration.
We look forward to further visits in the future.
Romantic restaurant (conservatory) and outstanding food, from the tiny, tasty breads to their opulent desserts.

The Prix Fixe lunch menu including wine must be one of the best value lunches in Covent Garden
Great food, presentation and service, will return

Birthday meal with my partner which did not disappoint. Beautiful seating in the conservatory, wonderful service from friendly staff and delicious food. Amazing value for money with the pre theatre menu  and a good variety of options to pick from. I would definitely return and will be recommending to anyone who is visiting London!
An excellent restaurant right in the heart of Covent Garden . Staff exceptional and always a very special time when we visist

They were great there and looked after us but unfortunately our day didn't go according to plan as we were put close to the door. I wouldn't have minded spending the amount of money I did if I sat where it was advertised and where I thought we'd be but sitting by the door spoilt what should have been a fantastic occasion. Great restaurant but feel cheated as it was both mine and my wife's birthday as well as our 21st wedding anniversary. We were so looking forward to sitting in the side of the restaurant which received the award of most romantic restaurant 2015 but unfortunately this did not happen even though I asked and could see there was space.

A lovely looking restaurant with a wonderful shrub lined ground floorseating area.
All the food was fantastic and served by very friendly and helpful staff.
We will certainly enjoy another visit as soon as we can.
We experienced another beautiful evening at Clos Maggiore our favorite restaurant on visiting London. As is always food and service impeccable. Very romantic restaurant but expensive...

I took my partner here for a birthday meal and we simply fell in love with the place. The conservatory was magical; the service was prompt and friendly; and the food was fantastic.  I would strongly recommend the black truffle ice cream for dessert in particular. I would highly recommend Clos Maggiore for couples and for a post-theatre meal.

In the heart of Covent Garden is Clos Maggiore. It is very beautiful and very French. We had very good service and food. Please go and find out for yourself.
Pre theatre supper is good value.
Maureen
Simply a lovely place in which to share  a romantic evening. Perhaps a little cramped, but then intimate and delightful.
Lovely table in the conservatory. Friendly, attentive staff and lovely food. We were even given a special treat for our anniversary. Another great experience here.
Staff went out of there way to make it a fabulous evening for us, very attentive but discreet, food was sublime, conservatory so pretty, a delightful evening....
Delicious food. Excellent service. Reasonably priced.

I booked after seeing the fab reviews on trip advisor and wasn't disappointed overall. Happy Birthday on my boyfriend's desert plate was a special touch. The tasting menu and wine pairing went very well and was good value for money. My only complaint is that the upstairs room we were in didn't feel like part of the restaurant and didn't have much of an atmosphere as only 2 other tables were taken. So I don't feel that we got the full restaurant experience. But I did only book a month ago so was happy to get a table. Service and food were great. Atmosphere not so much.

It was a lovely restaurant but nothing outstanding about it! It  is decently romantic if you are in the conservatory but not so in the upstairs dining section. There was a wood fire on the day I went for lunch which was a nice touch, service was normal but the waiter did not engage us in a conversation and was very mechanical about his duties. Seemed lacking in passion and genuineness.

Clos Maggiore - just a superb experience from the moment one arrives to leaving and in fact that amazing feeling stays with well after departing.

We have been half a dozen times - never a single thing wrong - a rare find these days.

Went to for a lovely early Valentines lunch the day before. Beautiful surrounds, lovely food and great service. The lunch time set menu is excellent value although a somewhat limited choice. We found the portion sizes to be surprisingly filling and couldn't fit dessert in! We will definitely go back.

This was our first visit and love being close to the shops and everything happening in and around Covent Garden I would find it very difficult to find a better restaurant for the more discerning that the Clos Maggiore. The service from entry to departure was perfection, not overbearing or fake over familiarity, just happy polite, well mannered and attentive. Perfect time was left between courses, neither rush nor omission. The wine list is extensive and again caters from humble to sommelier tastes. The menu was exquisite and matched by the effusion of tastes. The Clos is very much on the ascendance and we shall return again and again. Don't tell anyone, we want to be able to get in.
Our first visit to Clos Maggiore produced some excellent food in a warm atmosphere and at great value.

Perfect for an intimate evening.
The staff were all very helpful and welcoming.
Food and cocktails exquisite!
The occasion was my birthday and the subtle effort made was much appreciated with a plate wishing me ' Happy Birthday' with petit fours and candle.

Well done, credit to all!
THE PLACE TO BE FOR A HIGH QUALITY DINER. !
We had a lovely meal for two. The service was very attentive, the food was delicious and there was a peaceful and romantic ambiance. Highly recommended.
This is the second time I have visited in a week and both times were most enjoyable. the food, service and ambiance are just perfect for a lovely memorable meal.

Sadly didn't end up in the conservatory despite being 20mins early on reservation but front of restaurant has very good ambiance too.
Food (vegetarian) excellent taste and appropriate portions. Tagliatelle / Mushrooms / Truffle a tad too heavy and creamy.
Four of us went for a family Sunday lunch. The set meal with wine is excellent value.
As always just a delight but on a very cold Mar Fri lunchtime it was as good as it gets with the lunchtime Prix fixe menu offspring great value for money
Great value and choice of menu. Excellent service. Atmosphere was lovely. Perfect for couples or 2 friends but wouldn't recommend for groups.
Un restaurat vraiment merveilleux et magnifique. the food was very very good and the service : impeccable.

We had lunch at Clos Maggiore on King Street in London. The restaurant was very lovely. The food was delicious and very reasonably priced (we had the two-courses for ¬£15.50 fixe prix meal). The staff were very attentive but not too attentive. All in all a great meal and fantastic venue. I'll definitely being going back.
Service/ambiance/food was excellent. :D
outstanding services meal ambience just the whole package will for sure be back
Another great meal at Clos Maggiore. Good food, great ambiance and excellent value for money. Superb wine list and extremely good advice.

The restaurant is beautifully decorated, it is such a tiny place they have been very clever with mirrors and lights etc. The food was presented very well and the flavours and combinations were excellent. Enjoyed every minute of our time there, appreciated that we booked by email from Australia, just dropped in when we arrived in London and confirmed it and everything went to plan. Some restaurants in Stockholm & Paris could learn from this. It shouldn't have to be complicated and in this restaurant it wasn't thank goodness.

The most romantic dining experience in London!

I would highly recommend the taster menu. ‚Äì Worth every penny

The staff were all truly wonderful and extremely accommodating.

I would eat here every night if I could!
`No romance, no spark, no interior to speak of... highly unremarkable and un-recommended
Clos Maggiore is unique and charming
Superb food, brilliant service and very romantic. Difficult to fault but easy to praise.

Whether it be for a solo lunch, a dinner for two or a group Clos Maggiore always delivers on all fronts, even when in my most recent meal there circumstances meant I was the only one of four that turned up for the meal. Rather than make me feel guilty or self conscious the staff were delightful and I enjoyed a great night dining alone!

I went here to Clos Maggiore for dinner on a Friday evening to celebrate our anniversary. We were not disappointed. The service was warm and friendly. We were shown to a beautiful corner table in the indoor garden lit by fairy lights; very romantic. The menu was divine and the wine list was more than comprehensive! (Thank goodness they had a sommelier on stand by to make recommendations). At ¬£100 per head for 3 courses and a bottle of wine, it is pricy, but absolutely worth the experience.
An excellent find amongst the hustle and bustle of Covent garden.Very quiet, romantic, and excellent food and service that is difficult to find these days.Will definately return!AB

A brilliant experience at Clos Maggiore as always. From the excellent service on the door, to exquisite food (at incredible good value prices) and waiting staff who were impeccable, and had just the right amount of presence, I want to come here time and time again, and happily recommend it to all my friends.
Great location, service and food
The set lunch is a bargain especially for food of this quality. You will almost certainly need advice on the wine list and the advice that I received was impeccable.
Nice place but very limited choice on the 2 or 3 course offers.

I have been to CM many times and I am a fan. However, yesterday was substandard. The set menu had three choices - veal, polenta or brill. Brill carried a ¬£5 supplement.  I wouldn't really call that a broad enough set menu. The soup was tasty, but absolutely loaded with chestnuts. The dessert was fine. The service yesterday felt abrupt. I'd still say give it a go - I'll go back - but yesterday was anything but impressive.
We visited Clos Maggiore for a pre-theatre dinner and thoroughly enjoyed the occasion. ,  The greeting ,ambience and quality of our meal were pleasing and we will undoubtedly visit again.

The best-value restaurant of its kind in London? Covent Garden's Clos Maggiore must certainly be a strong contender with its TT offer.  Food and service are exemplary and two courses for ¬£15.50 means that you won't break the bank by becoming (as I am) a regular. The menu changes regularly and offers a variety of appettising dishes from the ubiquitous confit of duck, whiting with thick-cut chips, feather-light gnocchi and irresistible desserts. This fine restaurant deserves its hard-earned succes
Food for the Prix Fixed menu was quite good and nice value. I actually think the ambiance is a bit tacky.
A lovely setting accompanied by excellent food and wine. The staff were very professional, friendly and courteous. I would definitely recommend this restaurant.

Went to Clos Maggiore for the set menu lunch with half a bottle of wine, the entire experience was amazing, we were sat right in the middle of the conservatory and the service was incredibly friendly and sincere.  The oxtail starter was sublime so was the wild mushroom with leek mains.  Very impressive from start to finish and cannot recommend highly enough.  Red wine was very good quality.
Clos Maggiore once again delivered the highest quality food and excellent service at a good price.

This was my third visit. It is voted the most Romantic Restaurant in London and feels like it when you are there. The staff are so friendly and attentive and extremely knowledgeable about the dishes and the wine. The whole atmosphere feels so calm after entering from the busy streets of Covent Garden. A quality restaurant with first class staff and service, who made this a perfect evening. Now looking forward to booking another lovely evening very soon.
Excellent tasting menu, smart yet comfortable surroundings, beautiful restaurant with beautiful food. Very happy!
good as always!

Clos Maggiore - bloody fantastic! I emailed them a few weeks before to request for a table at the conservatory, but was told they could not guarantee this. However, we were given a lovely table at the conservatory when we arrived. They even gave us complimentary petit fours for my boyfriend's birthday although I'd only briefly mentioned it in my email!

Food was excellent. Service - impeccable. Sommelier's recommendation of wine was brilliant. We will definitely be returning.

I went to Clos Maggiore for a special occasion, the venue is very cute and pretty romantic!  THe food was fantastic and the wine list would blow you away!  The only downside would be that the place wasn't really full, yet service was not very attentive, we had to ask for hte bill twice, something you shouldn't have  to do in such a restaurant.

Incredible. For my girlfriends birthday they made a wonderful meal for us at comparatively low prices. The wine list was a book of some of the most gorgeous wines you can find. I cannot fault anything with this restaurant. Michellin starred for a reason in my opinion.
A charming restaurant on the edge of covent garden.  The service was excellent and the food is delicious
This is a great little spot - food amazing and at reasonable prices.  The service was also great!  Would recommend to anyone looking for a nice quiet evening out.
Wonderful food and service. The set menu is very good deal. Will definitely go back there.

A favourite restaurant of mine and yesterday's visit reminded me why. Service (sommelier in particular), ambience and food all of the very highest standard.  Foie gras and confit duck starter was sublime. Lamb main equally good. All in all, a wonderful experience and lunch deal makes it possible to enjoy the very high standard of food and service for a reasonable sum. Would definitely recommend.

Clos Maggiore - Prix Fixe ¬£19.50 for 3 courses or 2 courses and 1/2 bottle of wine. Veggies thinking of this offer - don't. Brocolli soup (tasty) then a bizarre pea, broad bean and asparagus "casserole" (not tasty) made me feel very green and longing for once for .... a risotto!!! Nice selection of cheeses - made me feel a bit less green all over.
Grossly overpriced, food was lack-lustre for the most part.

Have been to Clos Maggiore Covent Garden many times now and it never fails to please.  It really is a lovely restaurant and I can understand why it was voted the most romantic restaurant in London.  The quatlity of food and service is also very good.  Great venue for a special occassion.

We enjoyed our pre theatre meal - good value and liked the courtyard-garden ambience.
Surprised that we were not allowed a jug of tap water on our table, but we were well supplied by the glass by the waiters
Excellent setting and service. Detailed wine list, not bad prices for Covent Garden.

Had the 2 course menu with half bottle of wine. The service and food was excellent. This is my 2nd visit to the restaurant and I would go back again. Lovely to have a bit of sanity and get away from the bustle of Covent Garden for a couple of hours!

It's essential to book a table in the Conservatory when going to Clos Maggiore. With very few tables, loads of mirrors and clouds of extremely realistic cherry blossom the atmosphere is magical.
The food is always excellent and the wine list long and exciting. There is plenty of choice on the set lunch menu, and everything is attactively presented. The staff are most helpful and very friendly.

Clos Maggiore, London

good value for money and nice flavors with good service....

Second time I'd been here and just as intimate and romantic as I recalled - although the company did help of course. Fixed price menu good value and wonderful quality - especially the grouse and pheasant pie as a starter. Attentive service witout being obstrusive. Comprehensive and slightly overwhelming wine menu stretching to nearly 100 pages - need to know your stuff before reading (which sadly I don't). And 10 grand is slightly stretching my bottle of red budget.... Overall a wonderful place.

Very nice food, very cosy ambience, service a little slow towards the end of the meal as it seemed like the staff were winding down but would definitely revisit! Excellent value for money on top table offer!

I had lunch at Clos Maggiore Covent Garden with a friend from overseas, the service and food were amazing!  We had the Toptable set menu which included two courses with wine, plenty of food and a bottle of wine to share - really good value! Highly recommend requesting a table in the conservatory, but make sure you book in advance to avoid missing out!

Booked a table for 3 people but Clos Maggiore had on its record for 2 people and unable to provide us a table at the original booking time and the conservatory area.
Service was so so. The food overall was good though. For the ¬£19.50 menu, the main course selection is a bit limited. But overall, not bad.
Great service, amazing food - Definitely recommend it

Menu didn‚Äôt have allergens indicated
Allergy was mentioned to the waitress, but not much guidance was offered

Went with a foodie friend to check out restaurant because I liked Lima . Planning to organize a dinner for my university Alumni soon.
We chose the 3 course lunch set menu.
Starters Duck Tiradito was well cooked With Japanese salsa , hint of yuzu , love the purple potato crisp light and elegantly presented . The quinoa was interesting with avocado but it needs more texture otherwise it‚Äôs too much like baby food.
I like my choice of sea bass but regretted not choosing the raw cerviche which is Lima‚Äôs forte. Though the warm sauce tiger milk was flavourful . The pork belly was good but lacked the wow factor . Needed something crunchy to lift it in terms of texture ..
My guest loves the rice pudding because of the mix of vanilla fragrance and not overly sweet . Pans cotta was as expected but would have like a stronger mango punch ..
Good ambience , attentive staff . Noise level was conducive to chatting and catching up with visiting friend.
The portions were fine for ladies who lunch but not sure if guys would find them a little too small.
Wonderful, fresh and flavorful food.
Arresting fusion of Peruvian and Japanese flavours. Set menus are diverse, tasty and filling. Great pre-theatre option
Delicious food, good service, and nice temperature on the hottest day of the year.

Having been a fan of Lima Fitzrovia since it opened, I was expecting something similar but was actually blown away by the offering at Lima Floral, which is different but more tapas in style.  However, what made the real difference for me was the huge flavour hits which were provided by a well considered and beautifully prepared menu.  It started well with some amazing yucca crisps with a home made salsa which was exquisite and mopped up so fast that theAn octopus tiradito dish with a very light tapenade style olive flavouring was exquisite - and my guest, who had generally steered well clear of octopus throughout their life was persuaded to indulge and persuaded to change their mind.  The sea bream ceviche was also top notch.  Other stand outs were the beef loin anticucho, squid jalea and a decent mixed tempura.  As someone who is not big on desserts, I was also hugely impressed with the guava mousse.  With drinks (a beer and a Pisco sour) the whole lunch came in at under ¬£85 before service).  For the quality of the food and service I was expecting to pay significantly more!   Will definitely be back

From great cocktails (best pisco) to gourmet food
Dishes not only look but taste amazing
Friendly and efficient staff

Food was rather outstanding, but we sat down and waited 10 mins before getting a menu or being asked about drinks despite the menu being empty. After this excellent start we got our starters which were delicious but then we were left waiting 40 mins for our mains, despite telling them we had theatre tickets resulting in us having to eat our mains (which are not cheap) in 5 mins before rushing out the door. We were given an apology and drinks on the house but I still have little desire to return - truly bad service

great to have a different experience with Peruvian food...it is really good and the service is outstanding. however, how it is possible to have such a noisy restaurant. ?you can barely hear the guests at your table. they urgently need to fix this problem as the dinner has been much less enjoyable with the very noisy atmosphere
Fantastic service from the staff and the food was outstanding. Lovely atmoshere

Wonderful experience & Afternoon Tea at The Savoy in Thames Foyer. The sandwiches & pastries were delicious & bursting with flavour. Nothing was limited! Sweets are stunning & immaculately presented. Pianist is a lovely touch & not over bearing.

We had a Coeliac & Vegetarian on our table. Coeliac details & intolerances were given at time of booking & confirmed again with Waiter. There are Vegetarian & Vegan menus. Lift access for mobility/wheelchair users.

Beautiful ambiance, not rushed & little boxes given with anything you‚Äôre too full to finish! Wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to return. A wonderful birthday/anniversary treat.
It was a wonderful experience. Friendly staff and the piano player was brilliant.
The Savoy was just an amazing experience ,can‚Äôt wait to return

This was a very special treat which we totally and utterly loved.... the food and service is so good it is difficult to find words the perfect mix of elegance personable service and responding to our individual needs... i cannot really express how amazing the experience is and i would highly highly recommemd The Savoy for famillies and friends it is a very special place....

We've not ticked the above question as to whether we would recommend the tea to friends as we had mixed reviews. Whilst the waiters were very pleasant, there were a few disappointments as below;

- Upon sitting at the table, a couple of the chairs were dirty with crumbs from previous sittings which we had to clean off the seat ourselves!
- Whilst the tea is described as being Christmas festive, there isn't much festivity in the food. A couple of small cakes but this was it along with the pianist playing a couple of carols. Yet, we paid more for a "festive" tea, it did not feel festive!
- Considering it was Christmas, I was surprised there were no Christmas decorations in the tea room which was disappointing as we were hoping to see some.
- The waiters were pleasant and upon knowing it was my parent's anniversary, they provided a personalised cake to them which was very sweet.
Overall, I feel we paid a lot of money (GBP100 per person) and yet I really do not feel it was worth that much. It felt very much like a money making machine (which it is), whereby you are cramming tables in on a factory line, getting the money and then that is it and having been wanting to do a tea for several years, we were left slightly disappointed.

However, thankfully my parents enjoyed it which was key given it was for their anniversary and I hope this feedback helps for you to improve the experience for future customers.
A very lovely and relaxing afternoon - delightful service , excellent and attentive staff and delicious food

I was with a friend celebrating her birthday. The service was second to none and the food was delicious. Ideal for any celebration
Lovely tea in lovely surroundings.
Such a wonderful experience! High tea selections were lovely! Our delightful servers, Brighita and Francesca, were friendly and made us feel welcome! Thank you!
Everything you‚Äôd imagine high tea to be plus 100.
Stunning ambiance, delicious 3 course meal for afternoon tea, loved the piano music.

The ambience was wonderfull and i loved that the waiters came over to you and said hello and ask you how you were doingüòÅüòä.  I was amazed already in the entrance. It was like bring in a castleüëçü§©
My favourite afternoon tea in London. The setting is beautiful the service is excellent and the food is outstanding.

We had a very enjoyable afternoon tea , pianist was superb and the hotel was extra special as it was the xmas week

We would definitely recommend to others
Thankyou thankyou thankyou the perfect pre show treat for my 2 daughters and myself.wecame all the way from yorkshire for 2 days in London ,we will remember our afternoon tea for years

Afternoon tea - treat for my daughter's 18th birthday.
Lovely environment - very special and bright but relaxing. The pianist was excellent and live music far better than the jazz played afterwards. Welcome was a little slow and servce not as attentive as I would have expectedhere. The sandwiches were delightful and we were able to have more as needed. The cakes / pastries were unusual flavours and all looked beautiful when presented to the table.
Would recommend for a special occasion but they need to ensure the staff are more attentive for each table not just a few.

Excellent service and atmosphere. Great cocktails in the American bar and nothing was too much trouble. Piano was well played and presented a good variety of music. Sandwiches and scones excellent, cakes a little ordinary.

Nice enough- but for ¬£210 for 2 people I would expect the sandwiches to be a little more than bread and egg mayo/ dry ham.

Service was appalling- had to wait nearly an hour for our Tea to arrive when we had the sandwiches on the table all that time...

The birthday surprise for my niece was a lovely gesture but apart from that- I honestly can't add anything else positive...
First class as usual . A British tradition in a lovely setting
Our afternoon tea was absolutely delightful. The food was great and the service was exemplary, as always. A very special location ideally suited for a little bit of pampering! We will be going again!
One off special for mother‚Äôs 80th with family and friends

This was our first visit to the Savoy for afternoon tea - a gift from our daughter for a notable Wedding Anniversary.  A wonderful gift and memorable afternoon. The service was excellent (we had a trainee waitress who was extremely attentive and will make a good member of your team!)

Overall the experience was acceptable.  However the service was TERRIBLE. We were told not to pour our own teas and then we wouldn't see people for 15 to 20 minutes at a time. We would ask for water and someone will come by after 15 to 20 minutes. If it was a ¬£20 or less tea service, I would see say that would be a great deal. However this was very expensive! For the price I was expecting much MUCH better service. Don't waste your money and go elsewhere.

This was an afternoon tea treat for my sisters 50th. We had a fabulous time & the lady who showed us to our seats was 10/10. I didn't take her name but she originated from Crete. She was lovely.  The other staff were all very nice  & polite. Nothing was too much trouble. A very memorable day for us all but the cake with Happy Birthday on was a lovely touch whilst the pianist played happy birthday.
We had a wonderful afternoon tea. The food was great but what made it so special was the fantastic service. The ambience is fabulous.

Very friendly service.
Food was delicious, scones not how they're supposed to be.. Felt more like bread..Great selection of tea it you're a tea lover.
Little sandwiches are great and the patisseries plateau also amazing! Overall great experience, the atmosphere is very very pretty as well.

I loved every bit of the bar and restaurant at Savoy.
I met my friend at the bar for some wine and then we moved to our table where we had lovely food and the price was surprisingly affordable. Our dinner was enlightened with beautiful jazz music. The water was very caring and the Reception lady managed to gives a table in the Gazeebo.
I will definitely go back.
Excellent service in a beautiful setting. Great for that special occasion.

Was a little upset that we could not take the cakes we couldn't eat away with us - every other venue I have had afternoon tea at we have always been offered to take the cakes away - I ended up leaving 3 cakes and then the signature cake at the end, my daughter also left the same - such a shame as a few hours later we would really have enjoyed them.

Also, when we asked if we could change some of the sandwiches the waiter make quite a fuss about it - I had phoned to make sure this would be possible due to egg allergy, and also a dislike of mustard - eventually it was sorted but felt a little awkward about it.
Excellent service from very professional staff. I would highly recommend the afternoon tea.
Afternoon Tea here is special! üòÄ

I took a friend to The Savoy for her breakfast and I chose afternoon tea as she had never been for afternoon tea in London before. I requested a nice table, so they gave us a table in the pagoda in the middle of the room. From start to finish, everything was wonderful. The sandwiches were some of the tastiest I have had in an afternoon tea - they were also halal, which was wonderful. The scones, the pastries, the teas, everything was just perfect. The service, which I had been told was hit and miss, was actually lovely. Every waiter could not do enough for us. Even when I asked a waiter to take a few pics of my friend and I, he actually suggested us taking pics in an alternative part of the hotel and kindly accompanied us to take our pics there. I can't wait to bring more of my international friends here who I know will also love it.

It was a fantastic stay in Savoy. When we first arrived, the happy doormen dressed up like oldie times and very hospitalistic. The afternoon tea was set up just like what we have seen on the web and imagined. Everyone enjoyed a lot. Will defenately go again.

Our waiter was obviously in a terrible mood which he didn't bother to hide from us! Luckily we had been to the savoy for afternoon tea before so instead of him spoiling our afternoon we find it very funny,but not very professional especially in the savoy! Very dissatisfied customer.!!
üòÅ

The afternoon tea at the Savoy is impeccable.  The setting is gorgeous, the grand piano music playing recognisable things was lovely and the service was wonderful.  They made me a whole afternoon tea gluten, dairy and egg free which was delicious but my mum could enjoy the regular selection at the same time.  There were so many options you could really go to town or have a nice selection of everything without going crazy, it's up to you.  Can't fault it for a special treat!

A great experience had at the savoy in the way of a champagne afternoon tea ! We were bought a gift card for my husbands 50 th by friends and what a lovely gift it was .....the tea started with champagne then a selection of sandwiches and scones with festive tea . After this we had a selection of fantastic cakes , more tea and a taste of the two speciality loaf cakes baked freshly that morning .After 90 mins of eating and drinking we sadly had to leave the beauty of the hotel and return to the train station feeling very very full and satisfied with our unique experience .
Had a great time, lovely food and good service. They asked if we had any dietary requirements and made our sandwiches to our order of brown bread and no mayo

Aside from having Afternoon Tea in an iconic London hotel, the experience from the moment you walked through the door was sublime.  The level of service is second to none and the food, well it's more than afternoon tea, it's breakfast, lunch and dinner!  Great value.

We took afternoon tea after our daughter had visited St. James's Palace to received her Duke Of Edinburgh Award from the Duke himself.. As this was such an important occasion we wanted to ensure that we made the day special, and the Savoy certainly did that. The service and atmosphere was just right, and although the sandwiches weren't anything very special, the overall experience was just right and there was enough tea and cakes to feed a lot more people! It made a special morning into a special day....one to cherish for many years.
Good attentive service is hard to find these days - guess you get what you pay for I suppose.
Recommended.
We had a lovely afternoon tea our waiter was very pleasant and very accommodating. The pianist played happy birthday and my friend was brought a cake and candle in all an afternoon to remember

My brother and I took our mum there for a surprise birthday treat. The whole experience was fantastic and the service couldn't have been better. We were made to feel so welcome and nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff looking after us. It was made extra special when a small cake with a candle on it was brought out and the pianist played Happy Birthday for my mum. Thank you so much for an unforgettable experience.

I booked the Savoy Afternoon Tea for my wifes 60th Birthday. We were greeted by a young lady who wished my wife a happy birthday before we were taken to our table. The staff were very attentive and made us feel at ease. The tea was wonderful. A selection of finger sandwiches, followed by scones with cream and jam or homemade lemon curd, followed by a beautiful selection of pastries, followed by a choice of cake. After each course we were asked if we would like more. A truly wonderful experience which was thoroughly enjoyed.

The food, the lovely range of sandwiches, the salmon/scrabled egg & the crumpets with the high teas and the scones & selection of pastries with the afternoon teas were very all superb. Our initial waitress was excellent but the waiter who eventually served us with fresh teas & cakes was far from courteous. After a superb three quarters of an experience, in superb surroundings with superb food we decided the finale was quite disappointing.
