It will not however stop us sampling the wares of Savoy's competition.
Enjoyed a lovely experience at The Savoy for afternoon tea. the only downfall was that our server kept changing and service tailed off towards the end.

I attended The Savoy having just been awarded an MBE at Buckingham Palace and myself and my family went for afternoon tea. I will remember the whole experience for the rest of my life. The staff were superb and afternoon tea was excellent. My family were thrilled and my son aged nine was extremely impressed. I cannot recommend this experience that one has to try particularly to end a special day. Absolutely fantastic.
I went to the Ritz for afternoon tea last year, loved it but very different to Savoy. I felt the Savoy was a far more relaxing atmosphere. Will definately go again.
All in all very good. The food, while excellently prepared, was more westernised than I had hoped for.
Great food, flavoursome and innovative!

We enjoyed everything about our dinner here, especially the slow cooked lamb which was absolutely delicious. Beautiful room, decor, atmosphere, friendly and very good food. Thank you very much for a lovely evening..
The food and service was very good but the wine expensive

Very little atmosphere, likely due to the time of year (just after christmas). Service was excellent. Very attentative. Food was good although I don‚Äôt think the signature wild honey ice cream is good value for money.

The most excting Menu
Superbly executed.
Charming Service.
Great value .
Beautifully presented delicious food. All the flavours were identifiable, which is a rare thing to be savoured. Set lunch unbelievably good value.
Excellent food, superb service, fantastic setting, we will be back
Upscale ambiance, excellent service, creative top quality cuisine, and the fixed price menu is an excellent value.
Tr√®s bon restaurant

Our evening at The Balcon was really great.  The staff were so friendly and professional and really made the evening special for us.  We had booked the set menu (3 courses for ¬£25) and as the main courses were different from what had been advertised, we asked if we could order from the main menu and pay the difference and they were very accommodating.  The cocktails were fantastic, deserts amazing (raspberry souffle was superb) and we had a wonderful night.  I'd recommend for a dinner with friends, or a romantic date.  The bars had a lovely atmosphere too, but we stayed in the restaurant because the ambience was so nice.
Excellent evening friends get together- outstanding service and for once a restaurant which has soft lighting

We had such a great time, food was delicious the ambiance was beautiful and the service was great kind and helpful , highly recommend!
Tip: look for a deal and it makes it even more worthwhile

5 of us went there post theatre. The place is very pretty but we were unfortunately put next to a large table full of very loud noisy people although the restuarant was 80% empty. The waiting staff were pleasant but the food standard was that of a pub and not a good one.

Great deal on the food (3 courses for ¬£25) and food was lovely and a good variety. Wine was lovely, but watch out for the pricing as it's priced for the carafe on the paper menu not the bottle.

St James' Bar is a lovely place to meet friends before eating or just as a location in itself. We had a good evening.

Although the food was quite good it was not as good as it has been in the past. However, I can forgive an off day. The wine waitress was very pushy and this interfered with our conversation several times. However, we will return.

We chose the 2 course fixed price menu that was good value and offered a wide choice of dishes. The food was well cooked and well presented and the staff were very friendly and attentive. We liked the theatrical style surroundings of the restaurant which gave it an upmarket image. A good place to dwell over lunch with friends in a great location

The Balcon is wonderful. Exceptionally good food, and very attentive service. The set menu is exceptional value. Definitely worth a visit. We were not rushed in anyway. A great place to take your time and catch up with friends.  .

We love this delightful dining room. The saddle of lamb is good quality and well cooked. Some of the wine is more reasonably priced than the online list suggests. As always, the service is thoughtful and attentive. We have been before and will go again.

Balcon has a very nice dining room in the Sofitel Hotel. Two of our party of 5 had the set dinner menu which included coffee and a glass of wine so good value but such limited choices on the Market menu. I had Guinea fowl which was tough and my husband had perch which were 2 of the 3 choices on offer. I believe  if the choices are so limited they need to be of top quality otherwise the dining experience falls short. The Eton mess was awful. Maceroons mashed into a raspberry cream concoction. Far too heavy but my husbands strawberry sorbet was good as was the chocolate souffl√© and profiteroles. May be I just made bad choices that night!

Firstly, the service was fantastic and cannot be faulted.

Weekend brunch menu offer is poorly put together. The small plates (which you have as a starter) are not brunch related at all and jar with the 'brunch' section (which you have as a main). Admittedly you can have a dessert instead. Classic brunch cocktails are very expensive (¬£18 for a Bloody Mary), and whilst entirely adequate, were nothing special and are overpriced considering the venue and location. The weekend brunch offer (¬£24) with 2 Bloody Mary‚Äôs and service came to ¬£66. I found this very poor value for money. All in all, quite a disappointing experience (based on my previous visits)

The Balcon is located in an elegant part of London, far enough away from, yet within walking distance of, Piccadilly Circus and the West End. The main room provides a beautiful and charming setting, well-lit and spacious yet cosy and intimate. Staff were effortlessly friendly and knowledgeable. Service was attentive without being overbearing. The food was delicious. We shared a very tasty (and unexpectedly generous!) charcuterie, and my wife had a Roasted Lamb Saddle and I the Lobster with Coquillettes Pasta, both of which had sensational flavours, followed by a Floating Island desert (ridiculously naughty) and a Whisky & Cream Baba (ridiculously nice). All washed down with a wonderful Sancerre.

We dined there on the occasion of my wife's 50th birthday and the staff utterly spoiled us. And the bill was surprisingly reasonable for such an excellent experience. A jewel of a restaurant.

Beautiful dining room and great service. Had a post theatre offer which was great value . Hadn't know about the St James' and the hotel is tucked away in Pall Mall, unassuming from the outside. but the bar and the dining room are little gems i
Food was delicious and served by lovely staff.  Good choice of reasonably priced wine.

We wanted a special meal for my daughter's 27th birthday and were not disappointed.  Consistently good and interesting food and an attentive waiter  who seemed genuinely interested to ensure we had a good time.
Excellent service and food in a wonderful setting.HIghly recommended.

Tried the pre-theatre menu. The menu read well but the food was bland and uninteresting.
Lacked flavour and balance. Can't be compared to the previous Roux restaurant. Just disappointing.

My twin sister and I booked the Balcon for birthday dinner after a day of being pampered. We went for the Xmas menu and we were not disappointed. Beautiful setting, excellent service and a delicious meal. We recommend this restaurant and will be going back again.

I took a colleague from New York to The Balcon because I have heard good things about t. I was so embarressed! The service was really terrible - it appeared it was the waitress's first day. it too ages to order and then our starters came before our wine. finally 30 mins and 3 complaints later the wine was served. the food was OK but I am not sure it was good value. The meal and wine for 3 was over ¬£100 and my colleague missed her appointment because the service was so slow. i wouldn't return, even for an offer.
Very nice meal with my friend @Balcon. Great food, smooth wine, smiling staff :). Perfect!

We went for the top table special offer and thoroughly enjoyed the evening. It took a while to seat us ( not sure what the problem was) but once we were seated everything moved along nicely. The food was very good, and the glass of champagne with the special offer was good quality, not cheap cava or prosecco passed off as champagne. I would definitely go back.

I met up with a friend I'd not seen for a year. We talked non-stop for 2 and a half hours, and the staff took orders, served dishes , drinks etc without ever interrupting the flow of conversation - very impressive.
We had the set 2 course lunch. The food was very good, but I would have liked a lighter choice to be included at lunchtime.

Excellent choice.
We had the 3 course with a glass of wine and coffee menu for ¬£25 each.
This was good value and good quality.

The dessert was slightly disappointing but every thing else was spot on.

We had another 2 glasses of wine each and the bill came to ¬£81.50 including a 12 1/2% service charge.
This is good value for somewhere as good as this in the West End and we noticed the afternoon tea in one of the lounges looked nice( Harpist playing).
Bar was excellent too.

My girlfriend and i went to The Balcon pre theatre. firstly the setting is fabulous (ornate fittings), atmosphere is relaxed and the service is very attentive without being overbearing. We opted for the 3 course market menu experience which comes in at ¬£25 per head with a glass of champagne or wine. The options were limited for each course but good quality (pork, fresh mackerel). We didn't understand combining a creamy risotto with mackerel for one of the mains - it didn't quite work. Overall we would go back, maybe for the charcuterie experience they offer,
Nice venue. Friendly and efficient service.

We booked a table at the Balcon via Top Table last minute on a Saturday night as a pre-theatre dinner. We were running late because the tube was down and we only had one hour. Not only did they honour our reservation the staff made every effort to speed through our meal to ensure we left on time. The food, wine and service was excellent and the deal (2 courses for ¬£15.99) completely transparent. The wine is expensive but they do a deal inclusive of wine if you want that, we wanted to treat ourselves. We will be going again with friends and family as the decor and location of the restaurant was perfect for a quiet but atmospheric meal in the heart of busy London at the weekend.
I liked it very much it's a very ellegant place and the food is delicious, the service is outstanding very nice and friendly. I higly recommentd it. :)

We were a party of four and booked for an early evening meal. The service was polite and friendly - it was lovely and warm inside the restaurant - none of that horrible air con making a draught. Although menu choice for our fixed price meal was limited, the food itself was absolutely delicious and the portion were more than adequate - huge bowl of soup for starters.
Food on the TT deal was outstanding value, but we didn't have wine which I am sure would have bumped the price up considerably. The service was great. Will go back asap!
Being ideally located to one of the Olympic venues we made our fifth visit to The Balcon for lunch on Saturday. Once again the menu choice was excellent and great value for money. We will return.

We booked the ¬£30 3 course and glass of champagne offer and were very pleased. Close to Piccadilly Circus (but the nice end), good sized portions, really good food and even free coffees included on the offer. Great 1920s style decor, a good buzz around the place (it didn't feel like a hotel restaurant). The staff were the right level of attentive but laid back. For the price we paid, I can't fault it. Would recommend and will return.

The ambiance and decor of The Balcon is excellent. We are an American couple and were there for our first afternoon tea experience. It was delicious, worth our money, and we left very full and satisfied.

This place has gone down hill badly. My main course, a Bavette was very poor. Unevenly cooked and served with the woody end of the Aspargus. The sauce felt like it was straight from a packet and the whole thing was little chef standard.

The waiters spent the whole evening trying to get you to buy bottled water. When we recieved the bill and saw it was ¬£5 per small bottle we realised why. This place has lost its focus. Avoid.
Great value pre-theatre menu,  attentive service and the best chocolate tart.
In central London you would be forgiven for thinking you are in Paris. This is a classic brasserie serving good, if not too exciting food.

The Balcon London
Beautiful restaurant in the St James Hotel in the converted brasserie. Wow! Amazing decor and lovely atmosphere. Waiting staff were exceptionally eager to please. Food delicious - restricted menu, 2 courses for ¬£15 but good value. Wine rather expensive but good quality. Just loved the place. Will definitely return.

We visited The balcon before going to the theatre. We took advantage of the 3 course special menu for ¬£25.00 including a glass of wine and coffee. The food, staff and service was excellent and good value for money - we will back and have already recommended to friends.

Fantastic atmosphere, decor and location. Service was impeccable; asked for dietary information at time of booking, and got this in detail when the menu was given, without prompting. Food was delicious and the portions are just right. Perfect for a date, dinner with the parents or long sit down with friends.

It was first time at The Balcon in Piccadilly, and was a pleasant evening. The level of service was exemplary and the food was generous on the 3 course for ¬£20 menu. Tasted fantastic. The only downside was a very noisy and drunk table of 4 seated next to us, but wouldn't put me off returning.

Only go if you don't drink alcohol. The alcohol price list was ridiculous. The cheapest bottle of wine available was ¬£35 and not even great wine. (The cheapest dink, a sherry was ¬£10) Good food and service and nice surroundings and a good TT food deal. What a shame.  Wouldn't go back with or without a deal

We dined at the recently opened Balcon in the early evening and had the 3 course set menu. The food was delicious and the service impeccable, attentive and unhurried. The revamped restaurant decor is very impressive. Their ' house wine' is now served in 500ml carafes, and the 3 course menu  comes with complimentary coffee.
The food was amazing! The staff were attentive. It was worth every penny!!!
Staff were a let down, not attentive or helpful. Disappointing
Fantastic service. Highly recommend a staff called Aaron. Excellent services and advise. Will back again.

Had to wait for table. It was So noisy you couldnt hear each other talk. Had to ask 3 times each time we ordered or asked for anything. The food was good but totally overpriced. Won't be going back. And wouldn't recommend..:/
Great food but service was very slow & bill took 40 minutes to sort out due to broken systems
The front of house staff were so lovely and the food was delicious. Absolutely loved our time at Mon Plaisir and would love to return.
Great lunch and service as always, hope to return soon. Thank you
Food and service excellent as always

Nice cosy restaurant, much larger inside than it appears on the street. The food was quite good, very French. I had the onion soup and duck confit which were both really good, my partner had the blue cheese salad and moules frites, which were ok. Desserts were nothing special. The food was maybe a bit expensive for what it was, but I think that's because of the location. Service was ok, but again probably not worth the price. It was an enjoyable time but I'll probably not return. I would recommend not having dessert here and instead going to one of the chocolate shops etc on the same street.
Great food and exceptional service. A diamond find!

We thoroughly enjoyed our pretheatre meal. The food was exceptional as was the wine.
We have eaten here before and will definitely be returning.

A recommendation from a bon viveur pal who eats in London very frequently - we wanted a pre-theatre dinner and I would have so loved to stay longer and carry on enjoying the whole experience but Tina Turner was waiting!

Delightful French staff and a really great ambiance - clearly very popular so book in advance.

Enfin, somewhere that understands how to serve cheese. God Bless Mon Plaisir - it is the first time in years that (without ordering cheese the morning of booking a table in the evening) I could savour the tastes and textures of a huge range of cheeses.

Chapeau chapeau! et A+
It was a brilliant dining experience . Staff were friendly , efficient and helpful on menu choices. Cheeseboard was fantastic !! Coming back for that alone üëç
Excellent, attentive service. Authentic French cuisine - delicious.  Unpretentious ambiance yet full of charm and style.
Wonderful authentic French cuisine in a cozy, quiet setting.  Friendly, efficient service.   Fine onion soup, fish and seafood dishes, and excellent steak tartare.
Loved the food, interesting menu, great service and friendly buzzy atmosphere.  Will definitely make a return visit.
Perfect, very French, excellent wines, but best of all is the cheese - properly presented on a tray for choosing and all top quality.
Low quality food. Overpriced for what it is. I also didn't feel as though there was any care whatsoever in presentation
Quality throughout.  Excellent food beautifully cooked and presented.  Super wine list.  Fabulous service. A must visit.
Feels like France! Delicious set menu options, good value.

I love the ambience and service. Most of all I love that they cook to order. I have been going to mon plaisir for 11 years now. It's always special. I always recommend this restaurant. You will not be dissapointed

First went to Mon Plaisir as a student for a "special celebration" in 1968 and return occasionally when I am back in London. It is still recognisable as the place I first visited and still retains both its French ambience and the certainty of a very good meal served by pleasant staff. Good to know some things do not change in an otherwise very changed city

We arrived a little early and were disappointed to be told to come back nearer the time of our booking at 17.45 when we would have been happy to share a bottle of wine in a corner for a while. However when we returned the whole event was excellent. The food was memorable and the ambiance spot on. Made me get the french cuisine cookery book out and consider booking a weekend in Paris. Will return.
completed a wonderful day in London including a matinee at the Royal Opera House. We'll definitely come again and recommend it to others. Beautifully presented and tasting food!!
I used to eat in this place a lot. Staff are still attentive but the food is now overpriced and pretty mediocre.

VERY French in all aspects in this brasserie style venue - decor, attitude, wine list, presentation, banter between staff, the gallic shrug. Select but good choice of dishes suiting all tastes. The partridge was particularly tasty and you just have to have the gratin dauphinoise. I skipped dessert as I had my eye on the enormous cheese board with cheeses that could practically walk themselves to your table. Fantastic. Excellent wine list - French, of course. Good and efficient service. Eclectic mix of interconnecting rooms from the tight-fitting area I was in to a more relaxed room next door and a further space at the back - it all added to the convivial and relaxed atmosphere. I'll definitely go back and try more dishes.
And as a result it was rather tepid on arrival. The partridge was good.

A delight to return to Mon Plaisir.  Food and service were both very good, despite being a busy Saturday lunchtime just before Christmas.  The lunchtime menu is especially good value but the a la carte experience is just that bit more special.

Mon Plaisir London WC2 following early evening cinema visit.
Excellent entrecote, frites and bearnaise.
Bizarre paintings in back room. Prefer front rooms.
The usual high standard for food, service and anbience continues.

Mon Plaisir is always a great after theatre spot. The food is delicious, very traditional and typical French bistro, and the funky ambience is enjoyable. This time, the service was very slow, in spite of the restaurant not being full. This will not preclude me from returning to the restaurant. The toilets need to be updated as they are quite archaic and cramped, but again somewhat typical of an old French bistro.

MON PLAISIR. MONMOUTH ST LONDON. PRE-THEATRE DINNER. VERY AMIABLE AND EFFICIENT SERVICE. REALLY NICE ATMOSPHERE. GREAT VALUE. THOUGH PORTIONS AREN'T HUGE THEY ARE TASTY AND SATISFYING. A GLASS OF WINE WAS INCLUDED IN THE SET MENU AND THEY ALSO BROUGHT US A FREE GLASS OF FIZZY AS WE HAD BOOKED ONLINE. UNDER ¬£16PP FOR THREE COURSES AND AND THE DRINKS MENTIONED ABOVE.

Our first time at Mon Plaisir. Welcome was friendly, the restaurant is a little cramped but we were comfy once seated.
The food was ok, atmosphere was fairly buzzy.
Would I go again though?? For the money I think there are better places.
Mon Plaisir in Monmouth Street WC2 doesn't change and is still the reliable French bistro it has always been.  Nice to go back after a few years absence.

Mon Plaisir is a Parisian gem transplanted to London. Great food in a lovely setting. The cheese board is just fantastic. Rather more pricey than the sample menus suggested e.g. house wine at ¬£16 not ¬£12.50. Take some good company and it's worth it.
Mon Plaisir is a French pleasure in London. Short simple menu but very tasty classics! Good wine list too. Excellent.
Excellent value pre-theatre menu. Traditional brasserie fare.
Perhaps it was the fact that it wsa the end of a very long day but Mon Plaisir (an old favourite) was disappointing, bland food and the brusque service.

I hate to comment negatively on any restaurant knowing the terrible situation the sector is in. Particularly when service was friendly and pleasant even it not entirely prompt. Some food was good (the steak, fresh salads, bread) other nowhere near a Jason Atherton standard (fish and oysters did not smell or taste fresh). There seemed to be a problem with temperature as oysters arrived lukewarm and butter was melting. Finally, our first two choices from the theoretically extensive wine list were not available and the sommelier's reccomendation was average (although at a decent price). Hope things improve as the place deserves to succeed.
The most incredible service I have ever received, I was provided with hot water bottles and blankets as it was a chilly evening. Will go back in a heartbeat!

Lovely food and ambiance but unfortunately service was disappointing. The first time the waiter showed up it was to immediately ask for our order. We asked for the wine list first and had to chase twice to order something. Basically ignored the entire evening. Not what was expected for a place of this calibre.

Food excellent. Cold on the terrace and no heaters. Food service good. Sadly no drink list to go with the menu.

Not so good as previous visits

The food was excellent as always and it was really wonderful to eat out again. However it was absolutely freezing and although that‚Äôs not the fault of the restaurant it certainly detracted from the experience.
Excellent food and good value with the OT deal! Friendly service. Very enjoyable!

Lovely dinner. Excellent produce, well-made and expertly presented, high quality service (albeit a little pensive at times). Very special atmosphere, beautiful lighting & ambience. A bit steep but worth it for the special occasion. Will definitely be back to sample more of the vegetarian options  - there were a surprising amount on and off menu!
My favourite spot to meet with a client or have a family event. Consistently great food and service.

We had a lovely birthday dinner here on New year's Eve, selected as they were allowing a la carte dining in the early evening. This is not a 'treat' restaurant for sure, both in cost and atmosphere. The food was excellently prepared, and the cocktails we had were delicious too.

There are very good deals on which would have made this much more affordable, but the price was worth it for the date. The food was all excellent and we all left very happy!

Service was attentive and they were flexible with the menu, but at times there were long delays between courses, meaning we were rushed a little at the end as they needed the table back.

The one thing I dislike about this restaurant is the layout, with only one toilet in easy reach of the dining room, (I'm told there are more toilets in the basement but we were not directed to those when we asked) and the one way exit which wasn't indicated to us meaning we had to walk through the dining room twice to exit!

The service was terrible! Booked a table at 11 pm and was not ready when I got there. I was offered to sit on the sushiman bar even having booked a table. When we sat at the sushi bar no one came and offered us drinks or gave us the menu to choose. Even tho I paid the 13% of service. I am definitely never coming back.

OK food - too overpriced and the service was poor. Staff were standing talking to each other. We were asked 4 times have we ordered or would we like to order - they were rushing us. Then when it came time to asking for the bill - the staff were no where and not attentive. Poor service which was a shame. Staff downstairs were nice and very friendly however on the floor were poorly trained and were not passionate at all.
Amazing dining experience. We enjoyed this lunch more than expected - incredible service, perfect food and good atmosphere. The sushi Saturday menu was creative and tasted so good. We will be back.
The open table set menu with glass of prosecco for ¬£32 was great value and the staff were excellent

Highly recommmended. We had the Saturday Umami - 7 courses with a cocktail and bottle of champagne between two. Wonderful food and friendly and informal staff. Good value for money and s truly special lunch.
Beautiful room, nice food, tiny portions, big prices. Service a bit brusque.  Overall, not a very friendly place, but pretty.
they do their best to make the bill highest as possible !!! perhaps because we were French tourist !! we never go back again in this restaurant .
The food was not up to standard. I have been to many fine dinings and in comparison it's not as good. Far too expensive and still feeling hungry.
Ya nice place !

This was my second visit to the restaurant.  The food is exceptional, however the service is dreadful.  The hostesses that take you to your table are very snooty and give you the impression that you should be serving them.  This ocassion was a business lunch and the waiter was incredbly rude and inflexible.   We had the tasting offer, which is excellent value, but they refuse to swap any of the courses (even if you are willing to pay extra!).  My guest has various allergies, which they made her feel incredibly self concious about.  The service was poor the last time that I went, but it appears to be even worse now!

Excellent food and great service as per ny last visit. Offer makes it viable for us, but the not inconsiderable service charge is a bit disappointing.. Food is great, but the menu (apart from the desert) hadn't varied much from our last visit in July. Otherwise fully recommended.
Will be back again - great value, good cooking, and service efficient, friendly and good as always.
Very good service and a lovely meal! Our anniversary was noted and the staff did a special plate for our dessert!

Sake no Hana is a beautifully designed restaurant by Japanese Architect Kengo Kuma. The setting is beautiful, the food is delicious and nicely presented. The sushi we had was amazing, but the chiken sukiyaki will probably be the most memorable dish. Good value with the 35¬£ 5 courses + Belini. Otherwise it would be too expensive.

I have taken advantage of the Top table special offer to return to Sake No Hana. The restaurant always meets my expectations in terms of quality of the food and service. Like any fusion / Japanese restaurant, it doesn't come cheap... but I would recommend it.

Slightly underwhelming experience in Saka No Hana, food was good, sushi was very good and the cocktails were lovely, but service was poor, we had to request our drinks (a beer and glass of red) three times and were delivered well into the third course of serving, the ambience is okay, but not really for special occasions. Pricing is also strange and doesn't really reflect the portion size.

We had the Taste of Sake No Hana which was excellent value for money and provided a brilliant selection. The mains (beef & seafood) were slightly overcooked but it didn't ruin our overall experience. The dessert was one of the best ever!
Excellent food, wine and service.
The service is great, the food is amazing! the black cod was beautiful and the tuna salad was so nice. the tuna was fresh and tasted amazing.
I had a lovely night with friend. This place has a great ambience as well as great food. I would not hesitate to recommend Sake Hana.

The scallop and white asparagus starter was not the best in the world but the sushi and the chicken wings were great to start the meal off. The Sukiyaki Beef and the Prawn Tempura were great! Biggest downfall and only reason not to go back is the service as they seem completely uninterested and moody, our waitor even refusd to take our photo!
Love this restaurant. it's very pricey but with the half price offer you definitely can't complain. will return

Very creative starters.  Sushi chef could be more animated.  Manager could be more sensitive to everything happening around him.  He seemed busy helping his staff but he did not seem to have control over everything.  Waitress did not do the standard one walk by post food being served to see if everything was alright.  Bus boy - guy who delivered the food was actually the most attentive.  He asked how the food was. While delivering food to another table, he noticed that I wanted the bill.

Went to Sake No Hana in London and was the best Japanese rstaurant I've been to in London. Great Service, nice venue and the food was splendid and very authentic - the sea bass sashimi was out of this world.
Sake No Hanna in st james road, london. We had a great meal, especially enjoying the quail starter and the lemon grass and vanilla cocktail.

excellent as ever!
¬£630 for 10 and sea bass is delightful.
fabulous food - a little pricey so worth booking with tt discount. Lovely chic decor and nice atmosphere but service a little slow. Try the fatty tuna and spring onion rolls - yum!

Sake No Hana - London
Unobtrusive yet efficient service as always. Food was good and the Miso Chilean Seabass and Seasonal Mixed Tempura in particular were delicious. The only (minor) complaint was that food wasn't hot by the time it got to the table. We went with family who had not tried Japanese food before and they really enjoyed the meal. Definitely one of our favourite London restaurants for great food in relaxed surroundings.
excellent food - wonderful fresh sushi, great vibe and wonderful looking restaurant, with the 40% off it was great value and i cant wait to go back.

A fantastic experience - the quality of food, service and ambience was fantastic. Anyone booking for a special occasion should seriously consider Sake No Hana.

Thank you to the staff for excellent service and good recommendation on Sake!

Dinner for 7 on a quite Tuesday night.  Great venue, although as everyone else has remarked; the elevators are rather bizarre.  Food was very good and remarkably priced.  Unnecessarily long drinks list and ridiculous sake menu.  Drinks only really average considering price.  Overall a great place to eat but nowhere near the standards of a certain Japanese competitor which sets the bench mark ‚Äì Nobu

I have recently visited this restaurant for the 1st time with some friends. The deco was simple but a little too trendy for a japanese restaurant.Knowing very well japanese food, I thought the food was very good (well presented and each ingredients were thoughfully chosen)but the portion was relatively small and the menu quite short. If we did not have the 40% discount, the entire meal would have been pricey. I recommend to go there!

with the 40% off it is very good value for money. Its the first time i've been to Sake No Hana or a proper Japanese restaurant for that matter. The staff were very very friendly the only downfall is that it lacks a bit of atmosphere as is quiet, but as I went with just went with my girlfriend I found it fairly romantic and also perfect for a good catch up. Would definately go back again the sake marinated chicken was a very nice dish

The meal was good but I'm not sure I would be inclined to pay full price if it hadn't been for the 40% Toptable discount. Service was good also but the ambience of the restaurant is a bit cold. It doesn't really feel special enough considering the price of the food. I wouldn't rush back
Sake No Hana london a very enjoyable meal. Service was of particular note. Will go back.
Great venue, but we dined early so it was empty when we arrived.  Was getting livelier by the timer we left.

Sake No hana, reasanobale value with toptable 40% discount. relative medium to small portion sizes and not an exceptional taste but good quality and enjoyable nevertheless. decor is excellent with an ambience that i belive has created popularity
we had a dinner at Sake no hana at St James street. the ambience and services were very good.  the foods were not bad but not so special. recommended for special occation.
Great japanese tatami setting with high quality food. Toptable offer of 40% make the otherwise quite expensive prices more acceptable.

Not a bad meal - but better could be had for less (in Mayfair/St. James) and much less outside the west end.  Even with the TT discount found it very expensive for lunch.  Nice atmosphere and space.  Worth checking out on expense account.
Great food and value with the 50% discount otherwise as a student it's too expensive. Cant wait to go again.
Second time I have been and it is consistently brilliant!

We went to Sake no Hana at 9:30 Wednesday evening. The service was awful. Although the restaurant wasn't full nor we were the last one there, the waiter cleared everything out except the last bowl whilst I was still eating so we felt like we were being harassed to leave. Also the only way to get to the toilet is a single lift - I had to wait for the lift for more than 5 minutes.  The food is worth it with 50% off.
Food was delicious, the fish was fresh and everything was great.  Would definately dine again at this restaurant and is highly recommended to others aswell.
Lovely meal and good toptable deal
Stunning decor, fabulous service, and excellent food

We took advantage of the offer of 50% off to have our Christmas Dinner at Sake no Hana. Actually I would have put 10 on Value for money for that occasion, but without a special offer it would have been quite expensive. The food was excellent even for my Japanese guests, who are usually suspicious about non-Japanese owned Japanese restaurants. The food was authentic yet quite innovative. I would certainly go back there if I am entertaining some people.

Very nice atmosphere, very lively ambience. Excellent service (although a bit too quick as we finished our dinner with many dishes, wine and dessert in around 1 hr!). Very nice japanese cuisine with some different highlights than the usual japanese dishes.
I would surely go back...

My boyfriend and I felt a bit imtimadated with the entrance and the receptionists. But as soon as we're handover to the waiting staff it's a different game. They're informative and friendly. I do strongly advised to visit Sake No Hana now as they have invited a Sushi Master from New York, wonderful skill. Do try Tempura fig with yuzu salt and seared sushi selection. Extensive sake list, try Dessui 50. Good value for money but the standard is high and so are the price. Alan Yau have done it again

Great dining experience. The menu was very diverse, presenting something for everyone. However, this might be disconcerting to some diners as it is not possible to try everything! The sesame aubergine starter was very good - one of the highlights of the meal. The nigiri I ordered (Tuna, Fatty Tuna, Yellowtail, Seabass, Urchin) were all top quality - similar to what you'd find at Nobu. The Chilean sea bass was also very good. I would definitely recommend with the 50% offer as it's great value!

The portions at Sake no Hana was tiny, but we got to order more than usual with the TT offer. There were interesting combinations and it was tasty. Would recommend in choosing to be seated at the Japanese tables.
Amazing service
Simply the best sushi and sashimi I have ever eaten. Sublime food in a lovely light space. Great service. Will be back!
service poor, food was ok but i just wouldnt go back

We were really disappointed. No atmosphere at all, and unattentive service. We came with high expectations and were immediately let down by the total lack of vibe nor charm. Food was good (although not reflective of the cost), everything else was a big let down
Beautiful food, lovely place to celebrate at special occasion
Food was excellent as was the service.   We will be back again!

The food was excellent as expect it. We did the tiradito the spicy salmon the miso cod. My friend order the fried rice with salmon it took a some time to figure it out.
The spinach salad with prawns was superb. Really recommended if you are into keeping your calorie count.
For dessert the chocolate Bento box was Paradise for my friend and as I am on a diet they have this really amazing yogurt with berries under 90 calories so there you go if u need this info. Service was super nice.
And we try a new drink. Forgot the name but is like a Margarita but with sake. I loved it!!!
Ieder keer weer weergaloos.. niet goedkoop maar oh zo lekker

The waitress was very pushy, constantly interrupting our meal for more drinks and food.

Over priced - for people with more money than sense!!

Wonderful food, awful table shoved in next to a wall, mediocre service although staff knowledgeable when you got their attention. Fabulous wine once we were able to get it ordered. Shame really, looked forward to visiting Nobu for a long time.

a little disappointed with nobu.  The ambiance was not able to be totally enjoyed due to (1) the volume of the room (and it was not full) and (2) the abrupt attitude of the majority of staff.   There is also no particular view from the restaurant, which was a bit disappointing compared with Malibu's setting and vibe.  It was also offputting to see a staff member in the toilets walk out and not wash their hands.  That has to be a minimum at training.  Gross. Despite all of that,  the food was delicious!

Sadly, my waiter thought it was funny to see people with colored skin. Although he was a man of colour too, he seemed to judge us. It's unfortunate when waiter's think you're idiot and all you want to do is have a good time. I left a good tip too and I was familiar with the menu as I like going there. The waiter I met last time was really disrespectful.

Thoroughly enjoyable experience. Waiting staff really engaging and helpful. Food great. Cool ambience and really buzzy atmosphere.
Thank you we will definitely be back. üòÄüëçüèº

Food was excellent but the poor handling at the reception spoilt the mood and left a bad taste. Despite reservation, the table was provided with delay. On compliant, the person attending showed lack of courtesy and was disrespectful. Not acceptable from  a restaurant of such repute.

We were visiting London from the North West and had booked Nobu 2 months in advance to guarantee a table as we knew of its reputation, and we had a special celebration to mark, therefore we had high expectations.  We were not disappointed!! We only had 1 member of our party who was familiar with Japanese food, so the menu looked a bit daunting, our waiter soon eased our minds and suggested he bring out some samples of the most popular dishes - we went with it.  The food was amazing, the service was flawless and we definitely felt we sampled the "Nobu Experience".  When presented with the "dreaded bill" we expected the worst but it was no where near as bad as we thought it was going to be considering the standard of excellence we experienced.  It would be well worth a trip back to London just to experience it all over again.  We couldn't recommend it more.
Had a great meal!

We went to this restaurant for dinner and decided to order Omakase menu priced GBP85.- per head.   The contents of this menu is almost the same as Omakase at lunch time which was GBP65.-     Just because it is dinner do they think they can charge more?   On the top of this the waitress got our wine order wrong and instead of a rose a white wine was served, which was rectified when we pointed out the mistake.  The table and d√©cor hasn't changed since the opening and look a bit dated now.    Overall the price we paid does not seem to be justified.

We have chosen the 80 pounds menu
Nice but not very creative and does not worrh the value
Very expensive wine white at around 40 pounds for basic french wine
√Ä total of 250 pounds
At that rate you Will find star Michelin restaurant ..

Nobu is one of my favourite London restaurants. This time I took a couple friends with me who haven't experienced it yet. They both loved it, and I could not have been more pleased. I have some faithful menu choices, and it inspires confidence that I can expect the same great quality each time.
Place is great fun if you dine as a group - with just the right amount of fun, dedicated service and lovely food time and again. Scallops - are a must!

This was a surprisingly ordinary looking venue despite its reputation. Service was good but I was genuinely surprised at how uncomfortable the seat was. I also found the place very noisy and according to the waitress this was a quiet evening. This is certainly not the place for quiet intimate dinner. I would definitely return but would want to try the other Nobu venue on Berkley Street. Without doubt some of the best sushi I have ever eaten and a menu which I'd like to return to, however the venue decor, comfortability and acoustics seriously let it down and left me feeling like it really wasn't worth the money I paid.

The Nobu experience was very good. I was more than impressed with the booking system, especially the follow up to confirm the reservation 24 hours before the event. The welcome was also designed to add to the experience. We arrived half an hour early, but were seated immediately, without fuss.
The staff were more than attentive, spending time to explain the extensive menu to non-connoisseurs. The food, itself, was an enjoyable experience - the chef's selection providing an extensive opportunity to try a range of tastes and textures. Very good for vegetarians and others.
food, service, venue, all outstanding. Not much food for the money.

I had a tasting menu and its a very good value because the portion is quite big. But overall each dish is delicious. Bit dissapointed in the black cod miso because the sauce is too sweet even when I put lemon over it. But overall its amazing

Had the tasting menu, was expecting something really special but was just ok for the price. Service was very slow and even though many waiters hard to catch their attention. Expensive 2 tasting menus plus wine for 2 people ¬£250.

Nobu London provides a unique dining experience. The food is of the top Japanese food- among the best outside of Japan itself. The open atmosphere is refreshing but not necessarily romantic. It's a fun place to eat.
Sushi was only adequate, but other items such as the blackened cod, or the quality of miso raise it to very good. Expensive due to the location. Desserts quirky but interesting.
excellent food , servive was good but way too noisy and the table next to ours was just a shame in terms of noise and nobody dared to tell the people to reduce the noise level...
It was a fantastic start to the evening. Felt very at home and enjoyed every minute. Can¬¥t wait to go again and savour more flavours.
Outstanding restaurant in every way!

Had a great time. Food was superb and service was impeccable. I noted on my booking form that it was my boyfriends birthday and was impressed when they presented a Happy Birthday dessery to my boyfriend and we sang happy birthday (quietly and tastefully!) particularly as I hadnt followed up.
Really good food, service was great too. Would highly recommend this place.
The restaurant was recommended to us and it didn't disappoint! We had the thali and every mouthful was delicious too. Plenty for two!

It was an absolute delight, sampling all the tasty menu options at the Tandoor Chop House. We dined at 17.00 and the place was filling up fast. We rather felt that we were being rushed through our meal, even though the restaurant website said that we would have our table for 2 hours. Portions were on the small side, but actually, I rather liked that. We were insure as to what some of the dishes were, so had to ask for guidance from our very friendly waiter, however, I did wonder whether it might have saved them a bit of time if the dishes listed had a description next to them. Considering that the portions were on the small side, it was a little expensive especially as you really needed a side dish or two to make your meal complete. Very tasty though!
Fantastic food, the full table was delighted, we took a full second room of Mains.  It was that good

I will definitely return for the food, the service was good, not outstanding, but the noice was really loud. It sounded like there was a really loud air conditioning unit or something, really loud background noise.
Great food on numerous occasions. Friendly staff and lovely atmosphere!
Great dinner with a new spin on typical Indian fare

The Sunday thali is fantastic value, we ate like kings and it was delicious. The Tandoori cauliflower and lamb chops are off the scale, and the black dahl was like nothing I've tasted before. Highly recommend.
Really good meats - especially the ribeye and the chicken. Dal and roti v authentic too! Nice and relaxed ambience. Will definitely return!

We had Deli Mix and a butternut tikka as appetizers. Wonderfully flavorful mildly spicy. The gin and tonics were delicious complements to the appetizers. Crispy lamb chops and buttered naan completed a fantastic meal. We're hoping to find them in the USA soon.
Music choice(80s&90s pop) was a bit unnatural to the place and the ambiance. Other than that, everything was PERFECT!
Love this place , amazing !

This s my 5th visit. Worked in the West End for nearly 30 years. Only discovered this place a couple of years back. Absolutely love it.
Great service, great wine, great food.
Ignore the Chippie above it. Go down the spiral staircase and enjoy.
We were having a night out at the theatre and the Cork & Bottle was the perfect choice for dinner, delicious food with tremendous selection of wine.
Went here for my boyfriend's birthday and it was great.
Lovely wines - a great atmosphere - helpful and friendly staff - great selection of cheeses and dessert wines
Fab little wine bar out of the hustle of leciester square.  Great choice of wine by the bottle and some by the glass.
Simple Fair done very well, with a fabulous wine list. The only place to go pre theatre.

just off main road to Leicester square.A little bolt hole.Down the old stair case to a cosy bar- an oasis from madness of the main square 2 mins away.

Old style, small, warm, comfortable old style wine bar/with wooden tables chairs.

Few little alcoves, old wine bottles around.
Good staff,quick service.Can sit at bar for drink,wait for people to turn up.
Good for theatres and Cinemas a short walk away.
Fantastic experience. Great service and fab food.

Services was lovely, decor was cute but I would not return‚Ä¶not because it was freezing outside but the food was such a let down and overpriced. Oysters delicious the rest wouldn‚Äôt bother way overpriced and not good at all had lobster roll OMG if I was a chef I would be embarrassed to serve it and scallop ceviche bland and who decided to add passion fruit seeds (facepalm emoji)

Sadly this was a very underwhelming experience.  The chicken makhani was a nice dish but was too spicy.  The wood portions were very small and there wasn‚Äôt an option to select pani Puri and samosa chaat their own, which made the menu very limited for my dietary requirements.  Would not be revisiting.

Firstly I want to say that the staff were so lovely at the restaurant and that it‚Äôs location is so lovely and fantastic.

The food was served promptly, and the food was sensational, as a vegetarian I was spoilt for choice and the veggie options were so flavourful and tasty!!

I would recommend anyone to go!

Fantastic restaurant, fantastic food and great service. Me and my wife came here for a pre theatre meal and absolutely loved it. The shaking beef and mr chang rolls were amazing and the wine overlooking Charlotte Street created a very nice atmosphere in a cosy candle lit room. The building was fascinating as having a Chinese restaurant in such an old British building was quite the experience. Would most definitely recommend The House of Ho to anyone.
Decent night out

Really good experience for my bday- good vibes and good music
Was very pricey though- my friend ordered a g&t and the waiter got her the most expensive one... but apart from that we had a great time
Amazing food, super polite and quick service. One of my new favorite restaurants in London!
Lovely place , amazing food
Great food and good service
Fantastic!
We love Coya. What else is there to say - except the Chilean sea bass iron pot is a must try.....
It was an excellent experience . Incredible food and incredible staff.
Great vibe and service, nice chevice and excellently cooked ribeye it was a very live Saturday night out.
The table was in a very bad place.
Very good service, value for money. My husband and I had a very good time over dinner!
Too loud and dark but the food was fantastic.
Great food and music! The desserts and the Ceviche were the highlights, along with the great tropical music

We ordered the tasting menu. Food was outstanding. However, we were rushed as each table booking is only for 2 hours.  On at least 3 occasions we were asked to eat faster so that the table could be turned over at the end of our two hour slot. Indeed, my drink was removed before I had even finished drinking it!  My advice would be do not order the tasting menu or a lot of food if you are a slow eater.

I cannot speak highly enough of our recent experience at Coya. We opted for the tasting menu in order to try as many items as possible. The ceviche dishes were second to none - and we have eaten a lot of ceviche! We were also very impressed with the grilled items coming off the charcoal barbecue - the spicy beef fillet was bordering on tartare and just melted in the mouth and the broccoli took on the smoky flavours of the coals and raised broccoli to another level. We were convinced that nothing could beat the beef fillet - until we tried the sea bass. It was slightly caramelised and hands down some of the best sea bass I have ever had. Dessert was a pure indulgence with chocolate and passion fruit options on the same plate. Don't forget to wash everything down with a few pisco sours.

Fantastic service and great, upscale atmosphere to match the food.

The venue is really cool and with a great hippe. Service is friendly but extremely slow for the amount of people running around. Good was good even when the grilled a Corvina could welcome some more flavorful. Coming from somebody who barely eats salt. Founded it a bit overpriced for the portions. However Seems that the place is absolutely the place to be!

This was my first visit to Coya and I just loved it! The food was fantastic and the waiter made some excellent recommendations.
The staff was incredibly helpful and the whole flair of the restaurant / bar was amazing!
I also loved the live music and I really cannot wait for my next visit

I have eaten in Coya twice before now. I booked with friends for 6pm. I was unfortunately a few minutes late but by the time I arrived my friends had almost been forced to order! Not quite with a gun at their heads but not far behind! There was no mention of the 2 hour window on booking or on reconfirming my reservation. The service was rushed and the wrong side of efficient i.e. rude.

Restaurants who treat paying customers like this do not deserve their success. But Coya was packed with young things paying handsomely for their dates. My friends well have the means to eat in Coya every night if they so wish but I doing that they will after this experience. To be fair the manager did make amends and was courteous and helpful.

An excellent atmospheric lounge bar serving a wide range of drinks and cocktails. The table service was efficient and attentive. As a lounge bar it serves a selection of bar snacks, but is an ideal location for a pre-dinner drink.
A beautiful bar, but pricey. The cocktails are very "experimental" and maybe we choose badly but neither of us was wowed by the ones we had (2 each).
Excellent Restaurant and great service

Spent the last night of a two week trip across Europe having dinner here while in London and this was easily the best meal of our vacation - even better than a few Michelin star rated restaurants we had visited previously on our trip.   We ordered the tasting menu with the prestige wine pairing and my party of three was unanimous that everything was excellent - not a single misstep.  I rarely give 5 star ratings on here but the night I was there I just could not find a fault with this restaurant, probably my best dining experience this year so far.  I will say that the service is more towards the formal end of the spectrum rather than casual but it's not stuffy or pretentious; more of a Gallic precision and correctness while still understanding that the customer comes first.  The only puzzling thing was how I was able to get a reservation on such short notice - are Londoners really that spoiled for choice?

Great food and love the concept of the wine pairing suggestion! The wines were all delicious and the food very well cooked.  It's a bit on the quieter side in the restaurant, but a generally positive vibe!
Lovely food with a great ambiance

Good value for location and quality. Excellent service.
I‚Äôll come back

Visited here before Magic Mike Live. The location made it perfect for pre drinks with someone who was in a wheelchair.

The staff couldn‚Äôt have been more helpful.
Overpriced for what it is. Okay venue. Good for pre casino or show only
Great location and good food. Relaxing environment
Very good Italian food, not too pricey. Nice service and relaxed atmosphere
The pizza was fantastic! By far the best i've had in London! The staff was amazing! Super friendly and helpful
authentic delicious pizzas, would go there every day if i could. but i probably shouldnt. yet to try the pastas and salads, but with pizzas that good, its tough to deviate. go there hungry.
Good pizza. Slightly surly staff. But good value for money given the Mayfair location.

Delfinos is the only restaurant in London which has served me a main course I just couldn't fit in. This time, I was pleased to see the portions still pack a punch - I just scraped a finish this time - but not at the expense of taste. Considering how busy the place always gets, a few extra waiting staff would help but overall we had a fantastic time and will always recommend this place. ¬£120 for 4 people with wine too - can't complain.

Everything was just amazing
Absolutely loved it..Best Sunday lunch we have had..the staff were just the best

expensive.
the haddock and eggs looked a little lonely on the plate. presentation was not great.

We had the pre-theater and post-theater set menu, which is really excellent. The ingredients were presenting the best of the season, well crafted and delicately executed. Food was served at the right temperature, with just right portion and elegantly presented. Despite it being a set menu, service was right on-pointe and we were made to feel very welcomed and importantly hosted. The team who served us were friendly, attentive and well-polished. It was a very pleasant and posh experience.

An excellent venue for a pre-Christmas reunion.  Staff were super.  Attentive but not intrusive.  Lunch was delicious (we chose the set menu), great portion size although I had Hake which could have been served with more vegetables.  Overall great value for money.

Fantastic as usual.
Great food.
Amazing service.
Good value set lunch.
This was my 3rd visit and will definately return again.

Wonderful ambiance, good food, nice service, competitively priced. Opulent surrounds, in a well located and tasteful restaurant. Nice choice of restaurant bars for a pre/post dinner drink too. All round excellent evening.

A lovely experience lunching at Northall at the Corinthia. The two (¬£25) or three course (¬£29) lunch was very good value. Food was delicious and the service to a very high standard. It was a lovely daytime treat.

Myself and my partner endugle in the ritual of date night and we chose this restaurant... And i must say we had the most splendid time. The service from everyone was on top form and the meal itself was done so well. We went for the pre theatre menu and was very much impressed. The atmosphere of the dining room added to the romantic feel. It's definitely on our list to visit again. Thank you for a beautiful evening.
Highly recommend all of the restaurants at the Corinthia. Sufficient variety on menu. The ambience is fabulous.
Have dined several times always treated very well.Our table was not ready.We were offered a complimentary drink at the bar.l;lovely food as usual

We've dined here a few times now and have never been disappointed . The food is excellent - with the Oysters being some of the best in town. Service has always been good with friendly staff. It's one of our "go to" restaurants when you want some excellent food at a reasonable price in a fine location. Post dinner drinks in the bar afterwards is an added bonus.

Super expensive. They sure do try had. Attentive staff and striving to be original. However giving foods what my Nana used to call "fency schmency" does not a great meal make. Calling a small scottish mushroom a girolle when a morel actually would have made the dish tthat much better - well - I nevah!
Excellent venue for a special occasion, great choice of food and amazing service. Will be back again.
Great lunch at Northall - Food and service was exceptional as usual. Very good toptable offer three courses with a glass of champagne

Dined at the Northall after purchased a Travelzoo voucher for ¬£28 which was a cocktail and some delicious canapes, followed by a start (beef carpaccio mmm), Reggi Johnson chicken escalope, and a lovely vanilla parfait with morello cherries for dessert. Was a lovely ambiance and our server, Alessio, was fantastic. Will definitely return and recommend!

A delightful,delicious post River Pageant dining experience.Staff coped admirably considering
the high diner volume;including swiftly removing items of food left under our table by previous
occupants.Pre dinner drinks service very slow,expected better at ¬£22 per glass of champagne.
Dinner was perfection,delicate cod brandade followed by robust venison-exciting contrast in flavour,
colour and texture.Superb cheese selection.
All this in an exquisite setting,architecture and decor to please the eye.

The northall at the corinthea hotel, London was a brilliant venue. The bar and dining room were beautiful with high ceilings. 3 courses and a glass of champagne was a great deal and the food was delicious. I would definitely recommend it and would go back again. The service was very good also.

We were extremely excited to celebrate my girlfriend's special Birthday at this wonderful location. We started the celebrations with champagne in the bar area before moving to our table for 5 in the restaraunt. The food was delicious, a simple menu but served beautifully. However we had a big problem in that the time between starter and main course was extremely long. The waiter apologised 3 times and offered extra glasses of champagne although by that time we were champagnes out. There must have been a major problem in the kitchen. I would like to think that this was a one-off and we were just unlucky, although it did take the edge of a wonderful venue serving delicious food. I would give it a second chance though.
Northall Corinthia Hotel London. Booked an early meal on a saturday evening food and service was good but all felt a bit rushed.

A great venue for a meal out for my daughter's 18th birthday - the light airy feel and high ceilings give a sense of occasion in central London, without being precious or daunting in any way. Service is very good and the three course set lunch is good value at ¬£25 - good range of choices for a set menu. Inevitably drinks and extras are quite pricey. The food is great although probably not absolutely top class cooking if that's waht you;re looking for.

The Northall at Corinthia Hotel was our venue for a Friday lunch. It has a very nice dining room and the set menu is very reasonably priced at ¬£25 but the food just isn't up to standard. The starter and dessert looked as if they had been prepared the night before and kept in the fridge. My pear dessert just didn't taste of anything and starter not much better; the mains was good but a tiny portion of fish and nothing to go with it. Disappointing. Won't go back
Second time at the Northall, great food, venue, service and people! Highly  recommend this place!
Went early (5.30pm) so were the first table in the restaurant, and filled up slowly so ambience not great but other than that lovely surroundings, service and food were excellent.
Very nice setting and the food was excellent. The service left a bit to be desired as we were going to the theatre and we told the staff this but the ordering and food was very slow to materilise

The Norhall is a spectacularly beautiful restaurant in a really beautifully restored hotel.   The food was very good value and the glass of Laurent Perrier with the Top Table offer added to the experience!   The ambience is really gorgeous and this has all the ingredients to be one of the best places to eat in London.   Very sadly it is badly let down by appalling service both in and out of the restaurant and the hotel would do well to invest in some serious staff training.

We were very impressed at the Northall, Corinthia Hotel.  Very pleasant bar, charming, helpful and thoughtful staff, delicious food and very good deal with enough choice for us all.  The hotel is tastefully decorated and in a good location.  Will definitely go again.

The Northall, Corinthia Hotel, London

The Hotel Lobby Lounge is beautiful.

The Restaurant has an extravagant bar and a very good 3-course set menu.

The Northall was a great choice.Went on a Saturday night,quiet at first but soon livened up.TToffer ¬£25 including a glass of champagne is a good deal.Steak for main was very good ,and the cheese for desert was superb.Staff very attentive and friendly.The room has been refurbished and looks brilliant.Will definitely return.
Excellent food but service was sporadic.

We enjoyed the TT offer 3 course dinner and glass of champagne at The Northall last night.  The venue is fabulous, beautiful decor, very good service and the food was absolutely delicious. It is a secret at the moment, we were the only people there at first but it gradually filled up. It will not keep a secret very long.  Will definately be going back. I

The food was absolutely fantastic. The flavours and textures complemented each other. Each dish blew me away.
The service was perfect.
I was extremely impressed with it all.
It could have been slightly better with some background music as it was slightly quiet.
Absolutely wonderful in every way
Amazing food and great service. Really great design in the restaurant to create a brilliant dining experience. Would highly recommend.

Amazing food, atmosphere and service! sommelier is very good and knowledgeable.

Absolutely top quality food and service.

Excellent service as ever.  I went with a friend, a return visit.  The food offers small portions but it is fabulous and was fine for us.  The souffl√© is to die for.  Staff are charming and thoughtful.  We will return.

J‚Äôai d√©couvert ce restaurant cot√© parmis les meilleurs de Londres.
Avons d√Æn√© pour une occasion sp√©ciale.
Personnels tr√®s agr√©ables, √† l‚Äôecoute Et aux petits soins.
Avons eu la chance d‚Äôetre Servi et conseill√© par un serveur fran√ßais.
Repas et vins d√©licieux. Service parfait.
M√©rite amplement le d√©tour et sa place au sein des plus belles adresses de la City

We thought the bar area pre dinner was delightful, with areas for privacy but with an inclusive feel. The staff were without exception engaging, attentive and extremely helpful. We love to eat fish and seafood and the choice on the menu was extensive and very fresh (superb crab and lobster) and appealing. The wine list is sensible in that it is possible to get good wines at a sensible price. It was expensive in total but we felt very much worth it, and will definitely be going again

the food was excellent but the ambience was poor with tables too close together and waiters rushing around the table. as a consequence we were quite please to be hurried through our dinner and get out

booked it for a birthday dinner, one person vegan and had a overall very pleasant experience. Beautiful dining room, very attentive and friendly staff, fantastic food and good wines. Would alway come again, a few more vegan choices would be nice.
Love love love this place! Our third visit and it just keeps getting better. A proper gem in a touristy part of London. Definitely try everything on the menu!!
A great find after a london walk.  Very organised and good vibe
The vegan menu!! & the views ü§© AMAZING. Coming back there for sure!

The food was very average and didn‚Äôt live up to expectations. The restaurant felt dirty, and toilets in particular were reminiscent of a dingy club. Service was however great all staff were polite and attentive.

I booked this because it looked like a fun noisy venue for a group bday booking... What I wasn't expecting was really really good food!  It looks and feels like what it is - a big touristy restaurant off Leicester Square -  but our entire group of 12 foodies agreed it serves some of the best tapas in London.
We had a lovely pre-theatre meal at S&A, the first time for any of us. Great ambience. Fun vibe. Good food -- all of it! We'll be back.

We really enjoyed our meal in Salvador and Amanda. It was really close to Covent Garden and Leicester Square stations, but despite this was not crammed full of tourists. The food was very nice, and reasonably priced for the location. Service was good. The only bad thing I can say is that it seemed quiet and therefore seemed to lack a bit of atmosphere. Despite this I would definietely go back.

Some friends and I went to Salvador and Amanda last night to take advantage of their Paella Tuesday and we wasn't dissappointed.  Even though the paelle took 45mins to cook it was worth the wait and we all enjoyed it, the service was great and the sangrea is some of the best I've tasted in London.  Would cerntainly recommend.  It would be an ideal place for a first date!

We had a very enjoyable tapas dinner at Salvador and Amanda before going to a show.  We emailed ahead with our order to save time and we were very well accomodated and nothing was too difficult for the staff.  Our whole group of 8 want to go back when we have more time.  Thank you.

I honestly was so excited to come here because looking at the food / drinks menu on site it sounded amazing arrived 10 minutes before and had to wait but that was fine as we were still sat 5 minutes before our booking but after that it went completely downhill. First round of drinks came missing 1 drink. then we order food and got told there was no chicken so we had to order something else. Then we order another round of drinks and we‚Äôre missing 2 drinks we then waited 20 minutes for 1 of the drinks and then another 5 minutes for another drink. When our starters were brought to the table we were then told that one of the starters we had ordered they didn‚Äôt have so we were sat there with 3 out of 4 starters. Then once we had finished starters nothing was cleared the mains were brought out and just dropped on the table we ordered 2 of the mains with normal chips and one with cheesy chips. When the mains were delivered 2 came with sweet potatoes and one came without any potatoes at all nothing was mentioned or discussed with us. When we questioned the waiter he said it‚Äôs because they had run out of chips so instead of discussing it with us they just decided to just change it themselves but the chefs forgot 1 portion. These sweet pots were cold but after all this I couldn‚Äôt be bothered to mention any more. And then we tried to order another round of drinks and both cocktails we tried to order yet again they didn‚Äôt have. At this point even the server was embarrassed, I work in the hospitality industries and know the struggles of supply chains but the service and communication with the table was horrendous. I would like to speak to someone to discuss a part refund I understand not giving a full refund but i would like some sort of gesture of good will for this terrible experience we had. Look forward to hearing of you
Ashley
Great atmosphere good food
I had my birthday dinner here we all loved the food and the drinks was nice too. I got 3  ice cream tubs with a candle in each one  that was so nice of them. Will eat here again.

Overall an OK experience. When we arrived we already felt like we were being rushed through service as we were told we only had the table for 1.5hrs in comparison to the 2hrs stated when booking. Tables were a bit close to each other, so was difficult to get in and out without disrupting other people dining. But food was good, good music and good experience overall. Would go back, but not in a hurry.

Every visit is such a great experience, It's a feast for the eyes and the lobster is as ever so tasty.
I look forward to book again.

Let me start by saying this place looks amazing when you walk in, has a great feel too it and the staff were very friendly..... that's where that ended!!

After being sat down by our "server" and told he would be looking after us tonight and told all about menus, drinks and specials etc and then we never see him again the whole night ü§¶üèº‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

The food was 5 stars! Absolutely amazing and the portions were absolutely ridiculous, but I love that!

Food was left on our table and we had too remove it ourselves to the adjoining table, we had to call the waiter ourselves if we wanted refills or next orders etc, was never asked if we was ok or if food was up too stretch, and when we tried too pay the bill it took nearly half an hour for the guy too return with it....we removed the service charge because we had literally no service

Food- outstanding
Service- disgusting

The atmosphere is lively, friendly and attentive service. Our food was both under and over cooked and we found some of the prices a little excessive. However our waiter took care of all issues to our satisfaction.
Very good food in a very nice place. I recommend it !!
Great place, good service. We went with two children age 9 & 6 who loved it. Food was great !

I took my 6 year old daughter for lunch before the theatre. I had the fixed cost menu for ¬£20 which included a cocktail. They suggested I order a starter too so then my daughter could eat for free. It worked out good value, although ¬£4 for a kids apple juice is a little steep, considering how well priced the rest of it generally is. I used to go to the original restaurant in Kings Road a lot in my pre-children days, and I think that restaurant has more charm, but there was quite a buzzy vibe and it was busy. Was a shame I wasn‚Äôt child-free as I would have taken advantage of the Boozy Brunch deal which most people appeared to be having as it looked fab.
Fun fun fun
Limitless bbq in their boozy brunch is absolutely amazing and the frozen minuto pitchers are perfect. Definitely the place to go if you want to stuff your face with delicious ribs!!!!!
Great Food and Service. We were seated promptly. My friend visited for the first time and loved it - she wants to visit again!

The service was awful. We waited 30 mins for our starter. We waited 20mins for drinks.
We waited a further 45 minutes for our main course.
I had to go and find a server to ask for drinks. The lobster was over cooked the mac and cheese was runningnin oil and the ribs where full of fat.
When I pointed this out to a manager he said he couldn‚Äôt do anything and took ¬£20 off rye bill. Awful.
Never again

I  went before seeing a west end show was great food and would recommend to anyone it was quite busy but service was pretty good once was able to grab a waiter (but that is to be expected I suppose on a Saturday night ) A later table was even held for me  when I informed them I was unable to make original booking time which was great !
The most insane pork Ive ever had. Would 100% recommend the Boozy bottomless brunch!
Good food and happy hour was great! Service a little inattentive but it was very busy!

Booked us in early so had a drink at the bar then forgot about us.
Service was not up to scratch then was over charged but that was sorted out.
Too hot and cramped downstairs
Food was very good

Loved the whole experience!
Will definitely go again!!!
I have a sever allergy to onions, the sever went out his way to make sure no onions was in any food I ordered

The decor of this place is great. The music was good but too loud to actually hear people talking. Food was good. Service was appalling. 30 minutes for a waiter to show his face and take the drink order is bad. For that same waiter to forget half the order is just ridiculous.
Got up to get drinks from the bar twice. Not even an attempt at a dessert menu, as a matter of fact got the bill when we asked for the menu! Service sucked!
Train your staff or get rid of the one that can't do the job.

Good atmosphere. Speedy friendly service. Food was a bit disappointing. Main pulled pork burger tasty and large portions. The starters calamari and chicken tendons were not up to scratch. We left them after only eating a couple.
Bottomless brunch fantastic
Had a fab meal, good service,  great price, could not fault it, will return in the future.

Please do not dine in this restaurant until they  close it down and deal with the rats that are skipping and jumping around downstairs. I went here last night (15th September) and was absolutely mortified to see multiple rats running around. When I told the waitress it was clear that both the staff and management are aware of them but have chosen to keep the restaurant open and take diners' money. I was offered a full refund but I will not be silenced as I don't think this is acceptable for a restaurant of this calibre.

Disappointed with the table location, under a speaker! Given we were catching up with friends from overseas it was difficult to chat. Food and service superb, shame they'd run out of basic essentials (wet wipes) and also a number of items from the dessert menu.
We always have a Great time at the Big Easy! Great value for the money. Try the Vodoo wings, the taste very authentic American
Great food, excellent service and great value for money when selecting from the set menu. Can't fault the food, calamari batter was light and crispy not heavy and greasy, and the chilli was delicious

This Big Easy location has a fantastic lunch offer with very flexible times, meaning this post-work meet up was perfectly timed. Waiting for our table at the bar with an incredible ambience meant our early arrival wasn‚Äôt an inconvenience but a pleasure. Staff were friendly and helpful and the food was rich and delicious.

Sadly, it appears that you can no longet choose lobster by weight, and was thus only able to eat a small 1.5lb individul. The tables were small and with a live band it was difficult to hold a conversation. The house beer was very poor and the happy hour cocktail weak.
A very lively venue serving large portions of American food - ribs, shrimp, lobster etc. The ribs are a bit dry for my taste but the fried shrimp are very good as is the beer selection.
Hi food great as ever service not a patch on Canary Wharf restaurant

nice and busy atmosphere. good music.
we will definitely come back.

Went there to celebrate my 30th birthday while staying in London with my wife. We both enjoyed the happy hour and the whole themeing of the restaurant was amazing. The waiter was very friendly and helpful and the food was so nice and we enjoyed wearing the bibs will definitely be going back

I have previously been to the Chelsea location and was much more impressed then. This time I paid around ¬£20 for lobster mac and cheese, a side salad and a pina colada daiquri. The food arrived before the drinks- not a great start- and I counted 3 small pieces of lobster in my mac and cheese- much less than what I would have got had I ordered the other lobster dishes (all at the same price). Considering how cheap and easy it is to make mac and cheese I don't think they should be skimping on the lobster. My side salad was barely a salad- limp lettuce and 2 cherry tomatoes. Does that count as a salad? My drink, when it arrived, barely tasted of anything close to a pina colada- strong, unidentifiable alcohol was the prominent flavour. My companions had the BBQ plates which, while offering more food, didn't resemble the quality found in other BBQ restaurants at similar price points. There are a lot of BBQ restaurants in London at the moment, which means more choice. At this point in time I think I'll have to scratch Big Easy off my list, their central location has ruined their food and turned it into a tourist trap where food doesn't match the price. It's time to explore London's other BBQ offerings I think...
Great customer service and delicious food.  Would definitely recommend others to dine at The Big Easy.
Great quality food, highly recommend lobster mac n cheese. Only complaint was that portion sizes were too big, two of us could have shared one meal.
Very delicious. it is worth the money.

The whole experience was far too rushed. The lighting was poor I could barley read the menu as the text was too small to read. Most importantly the burger I had was over cooked couldn't finish it. Very disappointed!
