Food, margaritas and the music was great. Service was fine. Was all a bit squashed though and would have liked a bit more space between our table and the others around us.
Cannot go wrong with this place! Large portions, great drinks and lively atmosphere.

After a great first meal my second visit to The Big Easy was disappointing. The service was shocking, it started well with a prompt strawberry slushie being delivered to me however by the time my friend arrived our waiter had lost interest and she had to seek him out to order her drink. We spent the rest of the time trying in vain to catch the waiter's attention to order our food, request a bib, which he decided not to give us despite everyone else around being given one, clear our plates (which never happened) and finally request our bill.
The lobster was okay however the fact that there was green gunge in the middle of it, which we could only assume was its innards, was totally gross! Obviously, we couldn't find our waiter to ask.
All in all it was disappointing, the one saving grace was that it was a reasonably priced meal but not reasonable enough for me to return with such poor service.

Ok so I ate the best steak I've had since the hand and flowers in Marlow but the price for a meal for two was about the same as you would pay at a two Michelin star restaurant. Not getting chips with your steak and having to order them as a side is a bit much. Most restaurants always give you chips as a rule with your steak. That being said I would go again and would recommend but would suggest taking out a small mortgage first........
Excellent food, great atmosphere, would recomend to anyone.

I throughly enjoyed eating here, great place with good face, large portions which are definitely worth your monkey, the only bad thing I'd say is that it's a very popular place so it's hard to get a table so you need to book well in advance because turning up in the door could mean you'd have to wait a while for a table. Also, I was at a table for two which was quite small, could barely fit our food on it and not enough space to move around. Other than lovely place and would definitely recommend to a friend!

Got the pre-theatre deal which is fantastic value for money. Our waitress was very attentive and accommodating as some members of our party arrived late. Drinks and food were good although it took quite a while for the main course to arrive (which we didn't mind).

Food was amazing, generous portions, great atmosphere helped by the attentive staff and the music. Perfect afternoon for fun dinning and this restaurant was perfect for my sons 18th, especially the location, Covent Garden where there is plenty to do. Perfect!

We had the voodoo chicken wings and the limitless shrimp, and the food, as always, was amazing. The only problem I have with this venue is that the band are so loud - I've never understood the appeal of having to bellow at the person opposite me over dinner.

After reading outstanding reviews from other diners I was very much looking forward to my dinner here. However, on arrival and during the course of the meal the waitress had an attitude (make sure your waitress isn't Kasia), constant eye rolling, spilt water down the back of one of the diners jackets without an apology. When the starter arrived I politely asked if I could change my main meal but according to Kasia it was already 'maded' despite then having to wait a good 10 minutes for it to arrive to the table. My chips were cold!
When given the bill I asked to speak with the manager. I explained everything to him and his response was 'you should have asked for the manager when this happened' to which I said no I shouldn't have to though.

Big Easy has a ¬£20 value for money deal every day of the week, ranging from BBQ on the Tuesday to Lobster any day. Worth going to if you are stuck for pans and don't want to spend a lot of money ona good meal.
Not as rustic as the kings road version and just felt a little bit rushed throughout

We went on a Thursday as it was 'steak and lobster' night. We started with the Grand Appetiser for 2. It was huge! It had everything you could want from a starters. It had wings marinaded in 2 different sauces, crispy calamari, delicious hush puppies and the most succulent prawns I've ever eaten. On to the mains. My partner had the steak and lobster dish whereas I opted for Big Easy Smokehouse Burger. Which was lovely. The waitress forgot to give my partner a nutcracker to break the lobster claws and forgot several of the drinks we had ordered. When we'd finished it took her 30mins to bring the check after having to ask her a second time for it. I would definitely go back as the food was plentiful, delicious and good value for money.

They couldn't have been more accommodating for the baby - they got him a great high chair so he could sit at the table with us. Within minutes he had a drink and a side of mac n' cheese so was a very happy chappy. The rest of us tucked into delish slushie cocktails and Big Easy lagers. Starters were the highlight, with beautifully cooked calamari and popcorn shrimp, as well as hot chicken wings. Mains were excellent. My only criticism is that they were just too big. Luckily a doggy bag was available to take half of it home to enjoy later. I would suggest sharing mains if you have starters.
Great (in every sense of the word) food. Great staff and service. Great atmosphere, really picking up by the time we left at 6.30pm.
Fantastic food, value for money and great atmosphere! Not to mention the HUGE American style serving --- everything I want in a restaurant. Will definitely be back!!!
It was absolutely lovely, wonderful service, wonderful food, we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and didn‚Äôt want to leave!

We were seated it took a while for anyone to come over and offer us a drink; we had to try and get someone's attention. When I ordered my food, they were kind enough to swap out the chicken shawarma with lamb shish for me, which was the only up side of the experience.  The food came out very quickly which gave me the impression that it was not freshly cooked. There is not much value in the food you receive and the lamb shish was bland and chewy and chicken shawarma, which my partner ordered, was dry. Overall it seemed like the average overpriced tourist trap you get in central London. I would not return. There are much better local Lebanese style restaurants around greater London.
Lovely food
Really lovely small plates, great decor and atmosphere - I will definitely come again

Excellent stop for dinner after a show. We arrived after 10:30 pm and the place was lively and kitchen open. A good choice late in the evening, small plates were divine (exquisite seafood carpaccios, hand cut beef tartare, and two plates each quite enough)! Just expect it to be a little noisy, with quite loud music. We will definitely come again.

The Madeleines incredible as usual !
Thanks !
Excellent food and great ambiance, staff  were friendly and attentive.
Beautiful restaurant and the food was delicious! Great vibe for a business lunch

Our family of 4 with 2 daughters aged 6 & 11 had a lovely weekend lunch at Avenue. Avenue has used COVID social distancing rules in their favour by replacing some chairs with little sofas along the walls, thus creating a lounge atmosphere which was further enhanced by live music. These two improvements gave the place the vibe which is hardly possible recreate at home and really delivers the "go out" factor. Very enjoyable and positive experience

As ever Avenue delivered a great evening - relaxed dining with a group of friends - service is impeccable, ambience great - the tables are well spaced so no trouble with overhearing - the food on the fixed price menu was excellent.
Lunch at the Avenue on a Saturday is a bit noisy.   It was packed but service was quick and the bottomless bubbles was good
Had an absolutely delicious steak at Avenue.  Cooked to perfection, well seasoned and tender.  Very pleased with the meal overall.

Avenue Restaurant was absolutely beautiful. The menu itself was small, but I was surprised at how good the food was. In this case, simple was better. The staff was incredibly solicitous and helpful and made the experience that much more lovely.
Service excellent, food very nice and good value for ¬£19.

The two course lunch during the week with wine is excellent value and food was very good. Had a perfectly cooked steak.  Loved the new decor. Service was very attentive but without being intrusive.  Well done.
Absolutely perfect from entrance to departure - which is what one comes to expect from Zebrano

I would die for Korean bbq. We ordered their meat bbq selection with seafood, for a seafood lover, octopus was a no. However the Bulgogi was amazing! It was probably my favorite. There are a things we can improve here when it comes to value and money but overall its okay.
Very nice little korean restaurant in the heart of London. Great quality food for a fair price. Definitely worth a visit!
Very nice experience. The food was very good and you have the pace of delivery in your own hands as BBQ.  I will come back.
Nice food - would come back again

I have to be honest, I had much higher expectations due to the pricing and having seen it in Time Out.
I went there for an anniversary and knew we'd be spending much but here goes the experience:
We ordered two starters, fried calamari and a squid salad. Both were relatively small amounts but nothing super irrational, apart from the fact that there was very few pieces of squid in the salad and the calamari was made up of the batter mainly. Can't say I disliked it but wasn't blown away either. A waitress who we later found out was new, took away one of them before we were done and had said so twice...
I think we got some noodles too which were decent and shareable.
We also got spicy pork belly and prawns. The pork belly was actually great and skimpy in amount. Not super spicy either, which is not a problem just something to note if you're looking for major heat. The prawns arrived last, which was a bit strange considering everyone else was getting all the food at the same time and lets be honest, its not like they have to cook it first... So those prawns cost about ¬£13 they came with no sauce on them and theres literally just 5, which makes it impossible to split (since most tables are for 2 people) also 5 prawns, really??? They should at least mention piece amounts for the BBQ stuff...
Lastly the same new waitress went to offer us desert but then came back to apologise because she didn't know the kitchen was closing as I was about to order something.
So, considering there is also around ¬£8 service charge, I can't say I left happy.
Don't get me wrong, I know a lot of restaurants with high prices/small portions but since in most cases they live up to great quality food and good service this was a pretty sad hit and miss.
We enjoyed the Koba experience, friendly staff, yummy authentic food.
Very good food and excellent service. Starters were amazing. Recommend the port buns
Great value with lunch deals, which usually comes with soup and three sides (banchan). Excellent tofu and kimchi.

Had a good meal there, including the selection of BBQ meats. Attentive service, at one point I think 3 members of staff had flipped one piece of meat. However still felt on the whole that it was quite pricey, and that charging for the lettuce and the bean paste was a bit much, especially given the price for the relatively small quantity.
Great, fresh, clean Korean BBQ
Best Korean restaurant I have tried so far in London, very good Bibimbap.

For the first time since I've been going to Koba in London the starters did not match up to the standard of the main bbq course. The chilli chicken wasn't crispy and was look warm, the dumpling filling was underseasoned and while the prawns where tasty they were smaller than usual. The service seemed a little lax as well and did most of the cooking ourselves though the bbq was as ever of a a high standard and very tasty.

Koba Tottenham Court Road is another proper Korean restaurant in London. The price was a little bit too expensive, but the food overall tasted very good. The restaurant was very clean and well decorated.

Brilliant food and excellent service!
Definitely worth a visit

Koba is a good place to go to experience good Korean barbecue-style eating. Marinated meats, seafood and veg are brought to your table, cut up with scissors, and cooked on a hot grill-pan in the middle of the table. More experienced diners can get involved with the cooking bit, but the waiters will do it for you if you're feeling lazy. Don't expect anything too flourishing, but the cooking service is effective. Staff were very helpful and attentive, and atmosphere was fine.
It was a great experience in every respect, we are looking forward to visit again
Fabulous!!
Excellent services and super yummy food. From starter, main course and dessert are perfectly mixing with tastes and presentation

Have visited this restaurant every year for the last 5 years when we go to London. This time the food was delicious but the service left a lot to be desired beginning with the welcome and how we were seated.
My wife wanted to order from the A-La-Cart list but was given a set menu and told to pick whatever she wanted. naturally, a set menu does NOT show individual prices.

We ate the delicious food, paid whatever was charged for the ONE selection from the A=La=Cart menu and left.

We will not go back again.
By the way, not a good idea to replace the chocolates provided at the end of the meal with some spongy marshmallows.
Food was excellent but service was a bit "pushy" trying to get us to have additional items. And the dessert plates should not have been removed whilst one of the party was still eating!

We had lunch here on 28th May 2019 to celebrate my wife's birthday.  We have visited for lunch many times and have never been disappointed.  A drink in the bar before the meal is a must with the spectacular views over London.  The staff are very friendly and nothing is too much trouble. We had the set menu with wine the onion soup was especially tasty followed by sea bream and as it was my wife's birthday a small cake with a candle on a plate with Happy Birthday written on was greatly appreciated. It's a great setting very relaxing and if possible on request you may have a window table.  The marshmallows after coffee are fantastic.

I was booking dinner for my 40th birthday but did not get anything or any special service for my birthday at all, not have a seat next to the Window a little bit disappointed also not even have a little message or a dessert play to say happy birthday make it more dissapoinyed for me.
I spend ¬£270 for meal and drinks for my big birthday in 5 stars hotel but got treat as normal date.
food is good and the service is just okay
Outstanding food, with excellent service and a view to match. Will be returning, and I highly recommend if looking for somewhere special to enjoy Michelin starred food.

Impeccable service, beautiful food, stunning views, perfectly served cocktails, lovely wine, what more could you want?! Nice touches like postcards to send from your table, and you really get made to feel valued as a customer. Thank you to Emmeric and team, we had a lovely experience.
Very good food . Service excellent. Great views . All round great afternoon

In a restaurant chaotic as a Friday night pub, (with drunk women walking around barefoot!!!) we were accommodated at a table in a sort of hallway, despite the whole restaurant was half empty, where my chair was in the middle of the stair connecting the podium area with the lower one.
Served by arrogant waiters who should, before learning by heart courses name without having any idea of what is within, possibly learn good manner, we decided for degustation menu with wine.
Strangely almost all wines were so young that their taste completely disappeared against food taste, which was good, well cooked and well presented as a one start Michelin restaurant food should be.
Unfortunately what you are looking for when you choose a Michelin star restaurant is not only good food, but you claim and pay even for high level service and high level ambience and this was absolutely not the case.
For different reason, from business to private, I have been so lucky to eat at around thirty Michelin star restaurant around the world and I could say that this is the worst ever, where what you pay is three time the value of what you get.
After this so unlucky test my question is how it could be possible that a place like this obtain a Michelin star, when the Michelin restaurants level is so high in France or UAE for example and I am sure Messrs Galvin know exactly what I mean.
Never, never again!!!

The service and attitude of the staff was absolutely outstanding.  They literally could not have been better.  Food was great but there was only one option for vegetarian.  Great place for a special date.
Great service, amazing food and they made it a special night.
Amazing setting. Excellent service and lovely food.

Wonderful friendly staff. Very chilled and relaxed ambience.
Andrew is a great host...witty and made you feel at home.
Food
Parfait was very good
Cod the same
Duck not so good
Walnut cake extremely denseü§î

We had a fabulous lunch ! 6 ladies that met and gelled at a charity lunch . The restaurant team were superb and we were looked after very well .
The food was delicious I started with scallops ceviche (delicious)
The a fillet steak with fois gras! Sublime .
üç∏üç∏üç∏üç∏üç∏üç∏üç¥üç¥üç¥üç¥üç¥üç¥

I had the most wonderful time at Galvin at Windows, not only was the food divine, the service was second to none. We went for mine and my partners birthday, we are a day apart and when booking the table, I had requested we have a window seat if possible for this reason. Upon arrival they ask you to leave your coats in the cloakroom and you quickly realise what a beautiful scene the restaurant is set in, we then were welcomed and escorted to our table (not by the window unfortunately) and sat down with the option of water and olives, bread was quickly put down, to which I mentioned I was gluten free and they quickly went and brought out the most tasty gluten free bread. We were given the wine list and a Bellini each and assumed that as soon as they have a table available they would move us to the window, which was within 10 minutes. Our wine glass was never more than a quarter full, and we were treated like royalty. They remembered throughout I was gluten free and made sure to tell me about the menu before I had a chance to ask. At the end we were both given a birthday cake with happy birthday written on each plate. It was a very special evening for both of us and if I could award 10 stars to this amazing place then I definitely would.
I will reserve here again when I have an important occasion.

Everything was brilliant. Only negative was, they said Hake had finished, so we could go for mackerel) I had phoned earlier from a long drive away,and confirmed the set fish menu.so was disappointed to hear the main dish fish was unavailable. I was about to agree to get mackerel, but luckily remembered husband hates it..I explained to waiter and he said he can see what he can do, and not to worry. He went to see if it can be arranged for hake, and did manage to get us both original menu for both of us.happy customer, after initial heart attack.
Food was good however the service was really really poor !

Extremely disappointed. I can't believe a fine dining restaurant of this standard would have the audacity to serve a Pork Pie as their main course on their set menu. It is a complete insult to foodies. If that is all the chef is capable of serving up, then he should be sacked. I took 10 people with me and I was highly embarrassed when every one of them complained. I don't eat pork so I had their alternative which was a couple of different onions and a few peas and beans on a square of pastry, again very disappointing.

It is a beautiful restaurant, with incredible views across London but it's just a shame that their food doesn't match up.

Go to Galvin at Windows you will not be dissapointed. The perfect place for a special treat and the set lunch menu is gorgeous and good value. The food is superb as is the friendly service. Do check out the bar too on your visit. Will definetely be going again.

I'd heard so many great reviews about the restaurant and have wanted to go for quite some time but now that I finally have, I was a little disappointed. The ambience was excellent, amazing views across west London and felt a sense of luxury. However, the food was below the exceptional standard I was expecting. The flavours just didn't suit my pallet. I would consider coming again simply for drinks and the view.

Fantastic time, the degustation menu was great and they were happy to substitute where necessary. All the wine was nice, and the cocktail a great starter. The views are superb, and lovely at sunset over Hyde park, and looking west from the top of the Hilton means no real high rises in sight, so the world opens up in front of your eyes. It was pricey, but worth it as a package.

I was extremely pleased with our visit and the 3 courses for ¬£30 at lunchtime was great value for money. Food was delicious and the recommended wine went great with the food. My only disappointment was that I had requested to be sat by a window to be able to enjoy the view and we were given a table in the middle of the restaurant.

I honestly can't describe how great this restaurant is. From the moment you step out of the lift you are greeted by friendly but bit overwhelming staff. We were shown to the bar for a pre dinner cocktail from their long list. When it was time to sit we were collected and shown to our table by the window with a beautiful view out over London. The menu is outstanding. Personal hits were the salmon starter and the sliced apple and milk chocolate souffl√© with bay leaf ice cream. We were there for my wife's birthday and it was a lovely surprise when at the end of the meal a small cake was brought over with the words "Happy birthday" drawn on the plate in chocolate. Every member of staff that had served us made a point of coming over to us and wishing my wife a happy birthday. It was a small extra touch that meant a great deal.
Overall I can not fault the place. The food is exquisite without being so small you can hardly see it (in fact we both left stuffed) and the staff are a real delight. Highly recommended.
Went for my partner's birthday dinner. They did a little surprise for him without asking me. Was brilliant. The staff were spectacular.

We chose Galvin at Windows to celebrate our 2 year wedding anniversary, and we had a lovely evening. The food was very good, service attentive, and I liked the additional touches such as being given post cards to send anywhere in the world. I had also mentioned it was our anniversary on my open table booking and they brought us a post-desert plate with happy anniversary written on it, which I thought was very considerate.We weren't sitting by a window, and if you are sitting in the centre bit the ambiance is not that special (I imagine it is different if you get a window seat). The building is a bit tired looking. I am glad we went once, but I am not sure if it is return-worthy.
The service is excellent. The food is devine and the location and views outstanding. Highly recommended.

I have eaten at Windows before and at La Chapelle. Different ambience but both wonderful both for the food and the service. On this occasion my friend and i enjoyed the great view, the food was wonderfully prepared, wiith great tastes, and cooked to perfection. I also took a bottle with me and paid corkage, which i had checked the price of beforehand. I'm not sure however why it is twice that in La Chapelle.
The view is breathtaking, food excellent and service impeccable. Wonderful venue for any celebration, with food more than matching the view.
Went for the set lunch on a Thursday. Super location and good food. Service from a mix of waiters was good though one or two could be better trained. Overall very good value.
The food and service were excellent, just as we'd remembered. We look forward to our next visit!

From the start with amazing cocktails overlooking the sights of London, to the most magnificent meal.
It really is difficult to find fault with Galvin @ Windows.
The most common fault in Michelin starred venues is th over servility of the
waiters, not here all the staff were immensely knowlegeable
really chatty making us both feel really welcome.
Food just awesome probably never had better and I've eaten at some pretty cool places.
Gained lots of Brownie points from she who must be obeyed.
Wow!!!!!!

I had wanted to go to this restaurant on the 28th Floor of the Park Lane Hilton for some time and was not disappointed with it when I got there.

The service was fantastic as was the food and ambience. I want to go again!

I booked Galvin for my girlfriends birthday, very nice food but unfortunately we both felt very rushed to sit down and eat, this pressure to turn our table was felt throughout our meal, which did spoiled our evening.

I went to Galvins with a friend, we were lucky enough to have a table overlooking Buckingham palace gardens the view was delightful. We opted for the three course set lunch for ¬£29. The menu choice was perfect for me (I'd checked on line prior to our visit). The dietary requirements I added to the on line booking were well observed which really impressed me. I had the rabbit rilette, followed by plaice, and finished with a trio of ice cream that I'd requested-nothing was to much trouble. I would strongly recommend this restaurant which in my opinion is suitable for all occasions ie celebration, lunch with friends,business lunch etc.

This restaurant gave us an unforgettable evening. Delicious food and personal service that exceeded all expectations. We celebrated our engagement and could not be more pleased with our special evening. We had the lobstersoup for starter, seabass for maincourse and finished off with white choclate mousse. Highly recommended!

Sunday Lunch at Galwin at Windows: Apart from the excellent friendly service, Michelin quality food and pretty good value, (if you don‚Äôt go ‚Äúoff piste‚Äù) you will be having lunch on the 28th floor of the Hilton Park Lane and taking in one of the best eating views in London.
I think the best value is the 3 course set lunch (lots of choice) with a half bottle of wine (from a very decent selection), water and coffee all at ¬£45 plus service. But for drivers and non drinkers the same menu is available without the wine or just two small glasses for less.
If they are busy you may have to take your coffee in the bar, but we did not have to and in any case you get the same view.
This restaurant is lovely, the food is excellent and the service is great.

Having had drinks on a few occasions it seemed rude not to try the food. It was a treat for my best friends birthday and we're always looking for new places to try, this being my surprise. It was faultless. Ok the wines were a little excess but something for everyone and you only get what you pay for!
An early dinner at 6pm did feel a tad lonely to start but soon it was buzzing and we has a window view. Fabulous time with a fabulous friend. Certainly recommend.

Our dinner was not the "dining experience with a view" that we were expecting. Although I had requested for a table with a view for our triple celebration, we were disappointingly given one of the only two tables in the restaurant without any view whatsoever - tucked away in a corner behind heavy drapes. As a result it was uncomfortably stifling, definitely NOT 'Galvin at Windows' as the name promised. However, the restaurant redeemed itself with outstanding service across the entire staff and the totally unprompted surprise three platters of 'birthday' and 'congratulation' desserts. Three prix fixe menus offer great choice and value. Would go again.
My husband and I went to Galvin at Windows for lunch on Sunday 22nd April. The whole expereince was wonderful. The food was the best I have tasted and the views were amazing.

Galvin has the most amazing views of London.  However, this isn't the only thing it's got going for it.  The service is impeccable, polite but non intrusive.  I had the Scallops for starters and the Brill for main course.  Both were amazing.  Would definately go back.  Highly recommended.

This has always been a great destination - the views of London as good as ever.  But Windows was always a bit of a let down - a turgid lunch buffet and dancefloor spring to mind.  But Chris Galvin has transformed it into an elegant space with food that well deserves its Michelin star.  All of which makes the cost of the set lunch fantastic value.  Two of us had the set lunch and one had the Menu Prestige.  Empty plates left the table, as did happy and contented people who will be back.

My family spent a memorable evening here last December. The views were amazing at night. The service was impeccable and food was heavenly. I very highly recommended this restaurant and am looking forward to dining here again!

Service with genuine smiles , couldn't fault the whole experience for perfect service at Galvin at Windows , London.
The food we had was truly wonderful , but fine dining always seems to be rather small portions , a little more vegetable to fill the plate would have been welcome.
We were made to feel very special , especially because it was my Daughter's birthday , surprise mouthwatering chocolates were given at the end of our meal .
I'll return again , lovely experience.

We had a nice evening at Galvin at Windows. Shame that we were not seated at a window table but the food tasted wonderful nonetheless. Champagne and wine were good but be mindful of the price! Service was slightly too obtrusive for my taste but then again you would expect that from that kind of place. Overall a nice experience for a special occasion but do make sure it is a special occasion as you won't have anything for less than ¬£80 per head, even if the food itself is only half of that.
We had a wonderful meal. The view was amazing and well worth the visit.

I cannot praise the service and food at Galvin at Windows highly enough.  The chef's three course special was supberb and the apricot dessert was one of the best taste experiences I have ever had.  We were looked after wonderfully by all the staff we dealt with.  Will definitely go back

The staff were friendly and extremely accommodating - doing everything they could to make my party's afternoon a really enjoyable one. The views are stunning and the food is also very good. I'd definitely recommend Galvin at Windows to anyone.
The degustation menu (with wine) is definitely worth the visit.

We enjoyed a lovely evening at Galvin at Windows in the London Hilton, in Park Lane. We were given a window table, as requested, so had a spectacular view of London, at night. We opted for the menu of 3 courses for ¬£39 which was excellent value. The staff were polite and efficient, making the whole experience memorable.

Galvin at Windows at London Hilton is a fabulous venue with great food and service. The ¬£39 set dinner menu was definitely value for money. Fish (salmon) starter was superb, although the pork pate could be made a bit more elegant. The fish main course was very delicious and well presetned as well, just that there wasn't enough sauce added to the dish, so it dried up before the fish was finished. The roast pork filet was absolutely delicious. Wine was fab although a bit on the expensive side.
Galvin at Windows in London. Very nice staff and the view is amazing. Value for the food is also very good. Would go here again and recommend it to everyone!

Galvin at Windows in Park Lane, London is an exceptional place to eat with a breathtaking view of London. This meal could not have been bettered in any way the service was 10, the food was 10, the view and setting was 10.
I have eaten is many London restaurants this is the best so far.

Galvin at Windows, London

The service was beyond stellar, the meal was great (I can see why it has a Michelin star) and the view of Hyde Park was quite romantic. A table by the window is an absolute must.
My boyfriend took me here for my 30th Birthday. It was a very special experience! I would def recomend this to those who wish a special evening!

galvin at windows, london.
nice venue and staff are friendly. food on the special is well worth it and if you search thro wine list you can find some at reasonable price. Also use bar afterwards for view.
Wonderful food and lovely location - highly recommend.
Good service. Pretty good food, but quite restricted in choice. Great location.

This was my first time at Galvin at Windows at the Hilton on Park Lane, although I know and like Galvin Bistrot on Baker Street. The food was very good, if not particularly imaginative. We went on a toptable offer so had to choose from a limited menu. We had a bottle of Fleurie which was excellent and good value for somewhere of this nature. The views over the London night from the restaurant are spectacular.

Went to Galvin at Windows on the toptable lunch offer. Lovely setting, and great food as usual. Although the service was generally very good, they did manage to overcharge for drinks. Possibly an honest mistake, but I can't remember the last time anyone accidentally undercharged me, so I'm going to be sceptical.
Excellent value - 3 courses, glass of champagne and coffee. Fantastic view - straight into Buck palace gardens and well beyond!
Having dinner at Galvin at Windows is a good experince the food was well presented on the plate and were very good size the service super you can not ask more then that.
Galvin at Windows - As fantastic cuisine, romantic value and atmosphere as promised. Will definitely return.

Galvin at Windows was a very pleasent surprise. I am generally dubious of restaurants in chain hotels but this one was worth the visit. The food was very good (not exceptional), it was a great menu and well prepared and finished with an excellently balanced cheeseboard. The views were great and there was a lively atmosphere. With ¬£30 off per head due to the toptable offer, I will certainly be recommending this to friends.

Dinner at Galvin at Windows delivers everything it promises.
Fantastic food, wine and atmosphere, and of course the views over London are spectacular.
The food was good without beinh exceptional.The ambience was ok in the restaurant and the bar before was very buzzy.An ok experience but think theres a lot of room for improvement

I took my work colleagues for lunch to Galvin at Windows and they all raved about what a great restaurant it was.  We were very lucky as the weather was great which meant the views were fantastic.  The Top Table offer was excellent value.

Food at Galvin at Windows was good - with a reasoanble selection for the Top Table deal - and the service was very attentive.  What lets it down slightly is the ambience - it all looks a little dated and seems to struggle to get beyond being a hotel.  Having to share the lavatories with the Friday night crowd from the busy bar was also far from ideal.
Galvin at Windows - 10/10 - as wonderful as ever and the best deal in town with the TT offer.

Galvin at Windows has great views and my request for a window table was accommodated this time.  Very attentive and friendly staff. Bit disappointed with three course menu which was limited (only 2 choices) especially as pork was a starter option as well as a main dish. Delicious desserts and a nice touch to have accompanying chocolates with the coffee.
BRILLIANT!! Amazing food, amazing service and amazing view!! With the top table deal, it is one of the BEST restaurants i've tried in London! Will definitely come back again!

Great venue with superb views.  Waiters were attentive but the sommelier unhelpful.  The food was delicious and well presented.  Only dissappointment was the cheese option for dessert.  Wine, water, coffee and service charge inevitably knocks the price per person up but still an enjoyable night out and one I would recommend.
Excellent food, great service, lovely ambience. I would highly recommend Galvin at Windows for any special occasion.
Great, great views and wonderfully attentive and friendly service. Spot on.

I booked for a birthday party if two, staff upon arrival asked for my voucher and took it, we were ushered to a congested table despite lots of vacancies and i specifically asked for a separate table far from crowd due to compromised immune system but when i asked the waiter responded, ‚Äúdoes it matter‚Äù they have forgotten that we are still having a pandemic! The restaurant was Not full.lots of free table and numerous staff who seemed unsure and confused.I arrived 10 minutes before my booking but my order arrived 1 hour after. When i asked what on the menu, the rather sweet waitress said, she will come back cause she was new to the restaurant but she was apologetic. When i asked for the bill, i was given and charged for the afternoon tea and Only corrected when i said, i had a voucher, why it wasn‚Äôt deducted. the tea service was rusted and i need to point it to the lady serving. She came back with numerous choices around 5x uncleaned tea strainers saying the stain doesn‚Äôt go away but after i asked for top up she came back with a polished one and she pointed it up to me that ‚ÄúNow, its cleaned and polished ‚Äúü§™i have tea service and strainers at home so I know it can be cleaned if done properly. It was awkward and unpleasant experience, food was mediocre, nothing special. In my reservation, i asked for no mayonnaise because of allergies but they didn‚Äôt bothered checking., i have to asked many times which ones has mayonnaise on it, overall, nit very impressed, food could be good but service was very substandard. I dont think i shall recommend it to my friends who are regular afternoon tea goers. I came to try the carbonnel et walker chocolate menu but i was very disappointed and embarrassed to my guest who has a very discerning taste as a restauranteur. Bad experience, poor service, staff arguing in front of customers. I wont recommend it to people with discerning 0r particular taste at all.
Afternoon tea was disappointing.  Sandwiches were thick and dry
Hidden costs and way too expensive. Food is very foo foo (as you‚Äôd imagine for a 3 star) and very delicious, but it cost double what I was estimated. ¬£1,100 for 2 people.

We spent an unforgettable and unique experience for the palate and for our eyes.
The food and the service were both excellent. And the wine paired with each creation... incredible.
Thank you very much.
Option for food was flexible . U can choose whatever u like . Service was good
Very nice 2 star Michelin Restaurant, my friend and I celebrate friendship each year in Europe;  this dinner was our first choice of London..good starting of vacation.

Innovative cuisine, and superb and flawless service combine to make a wonderful evening with my spouse of 45 years. Second time there in the least 6 months, the prior time being for a business dinner. Both occasions were memorable. Look forward to going back on my next trip to London.

Excellent and outstanding service and food.
Everything was amaxing and the wine chosen by the sommelier was excellent.
Couldn't fault a thing!!
Will be back!

Thoroughly enjoyed our lunch here. As one would expect, marvellously executed food. Enjoyed every course. Delightful staff. The only negative was the limited set menu - I wouldn't normally choose to have smoked eel but at least it made me more adventurous in my selection. Would definitely return.

Connaught
Enjoyed - food was perfect.
Service - attentive .
Nice canapes .
We will go again.

Unfortunately experience wasn‚Äôt as good as I remembered. The food quality seems to have declined. Ie using processed chicken for the katsu. Glad we got some options on the happy hour menu wouldn‚Äôt have been happy to pay full. Other items not worth it in my opinion. Very nice staff however!
Truly outstanding
Excellent food, service was impeccable, they come to retrieve you from the bar when they are ready. Couldn't fault. Only gave four stars for it being quite expensive but well worth the splash.
Wonderful food served by lovely knowledgable staff
Good theatre food.

Spaghetti House just off Leicester Sq was very good and excellent value especially in Central London.  New menu is very good.  We shared Caprese and Deep Fried Courgette followed by Spaghetti Meatballs and Spaghetti Vongole.I then had the Chocolate desert with cherries which was gorgeous.  We both had coffe, John had a grappa.  We had a half litre of house red and tap water.  Total cost ¬£52 and Tesco deals taken as well!

Disappointed. Had booked here for a birthday meal for my partner. Arrived and they hadn't even prepared a table for us. Taken to an empty dining room with nothing set up for customers & what looked like family running around inside. Asked to sit outside where there was an atmosphere, where there were messy surroundings bad service and an overcharged bill. Food was good but overall not the birthday treat I'd anticipated and felt embarrassed to have booked here for his birthday.
I did enjoy atmosphere and prices
Claridge‚Äôs is the epitome of excellence, style and magic from any hotel. There is nothing to fault here. Just drink it all in!

Wonderful location, excellent service. The vegetarian options are fairly limited but the food was so good that wasn't an issue. The carnivore whose birthday we were celebrating was very happy with the choices. Not cheap, but you don't go to Claridges for that, and we were certainly very happy with the quality of the experience. Made someone's birthday very special.
Had a most civilised and delicious breakfast at Claridge's on New Years day.  I shall be doing that  more often!
Good service, food was excellant, we were not rushed and the staff were very helpful.
Experience from start to end was flawless. My fianc√© had a brilliant birthday.
We celebrated my son‚Äôs birthday here.  The food was fantastic and staff were lovely.  A great selection of amazing dishes and wonderful wines/Sherry. We all had a great time.

Warm Heritage Tomato Salad. Disappointing, bowl of tomatoes basically. Ordered with the grilled chicken breast which was needed to compliment the dish. The food I have eaten here previously has been exceptionally good.
Really nice location, tasty dumplings and good service

Comparing it to other experiences I have had. I was not impressed. ¬£40 per person for a few cakes, cucumber, salmon sandwiches and a glass of procceco. The cakes were fine. But next time I will  just stop for coff√© or tea and cakes.

Very pretty place. Afternoon tea was a lovely variety of sandwiches,  pastries and cakes. Staff happily packed the scones to go as we couldn't eat them at the time. We weren't rushed despite pressure on staff for tables. This was a real treat in a lovely little bakery. Well worth the money as a treat.

I was pleased to see that BB Bakery had read my request to have vegetarian afternoon tea. There was no waiting time and the girl who served us was very polite and friendly :)
Happy overall - I would maybe say that the environment feels a bit less girlie and a bit more minimalistic! We had a very nice time and would recommend it.

Food was fantastic, very nice selection of bottle of wines and cheese.
I definitely repeat this restaurant!!
Food was great but steak was slightly over cooked

From the first step into the restaurant everyone is super attentive and eager to provide best experience possible.
Food was good, atmosphere great and staff exceptional.

First the marinaded steak was bland and not cooked medium as I asked, it came more rare than anything. We was only seen by our waiting about twice during the night , so didn‚Äôt get a chance to give my feedback on the food. Considering I went for my birthday, no effort was made to make this night special in anyways. I received a happy birthday from the receptionist on my way or and that‚Äôs it. Considering I was asked when booking, if it was a special occasion, there was no effort made.
The cocktail zombie , similar to the rude boy served at rum kitchen, was watered down and barely contained any alcohol.
We had a fantastic waitress - she is a credit to your organisation
Setting is great- but steak was not cooked as requested. Service is a bit pushy and not always there!

We felt valued as customers. Friendly, interactive and knowledgeble staff.
Food was first class.

The service was very polished and attentive without being overbearing.  The waiter was very knowledgable if a little difficult to understand through a thick accent.  One order came up incorrectly so they redid the whole tables order to ensure it all came out at the same time.  The food was very good and drinks were good.  It is a little pricey I think so will only go there as a special occasion.

I ate at the Charlotte Street restaurant with my sister Thursday night and it was a lovely relaxed meal and the best steak I've had yet. All the staff made a fuss over us and all customers near to us as far as we could tell. The venue itself is modern with low lighting which suited us but if you really have bad eye sight, you might want to take a little key ring light or something for when you look at the menu. My sister and I managed fine reading the menu and someone brought out the steaks to talk us through them and couldn't do enough to serve us which is always appreciated. My sister was very particular about the kind of wine she wanted and again the staff were very helpful. A lovely evening. Thank you to all the staff.

Gaucho Charlotte Street is located in a charming location in London, so the setting/ambience of the restaurant had something to live up to, which it certainly did. Service, Food and the overall restaurant experience made this somewhere I would return to, and recommend. Take friends, family and partners.
Great place, great staff, great service, great food. Just great really.

Generally very good if it weren't for the price. My steak wasn't warm enough, however the others were excellent. I like the modern d√©cor but I found it a bit difficult to see in the darkness. The service whilst being prompt was a bit poncey and not very informative.

We visited on a Sunday lunchtime and were the only diners! Was very concerned that we would feel very awkward about being the only ones there, but we had a fab time! We were looked after really well, the food (as always was amazing) and the wine flowed. We were there for about 4 hours. It was a really lovely, relaxing afternoon.

One of the best steaks i have ever had. Really nice atmosphere. Very unique and quirky.

Great service too!
Gaucho Charlotte Street as excellent as always!
Great food and service. Will be going back again

A returning diner to the Charlotte Street branch of Gaucho, I booked a table for myself and two friends, one of whom had never dined at the chain before.

The service was great at ever; each member of staff were smiley and attentive but never in a patronising and annoying way.

My steak was beautiful; I didn't expect anything less. We ordered three sides to share and accompany our steaks - garlic spinach, potato puree and sauteed mushrooms; all fab.

Looking forward to my next meal there.
The best steak in town. Plus always order the humitas! The cocktails are quite good also!
as always this place delivers!!

Wow visited with a friend - in London for a shopping trip. Food was very good, service also to a high standard. Only niggle - music was at times a little loud. Stayed there all evening - did not feel hurried - all round great experience.

Great kitchen staff as the food was outstanding but not so great serving staff as the service was just OK. When I pay above average for food, I expect better service. Food and the wine list is ab fab. Will go back because of the food and the ambiance.

I normally love the Gaucho but was disappointed by this meal. Our waiter introduced himself but never brought out the tray of meat, they forgot our wine, my steak sauce and water on separate occasions (and had to be reminded). They also didn't have their famous cheese bread and despite promising to bring us some from the next batch (proving these are cooked on the premises), they had to be asked halfway through our main if we were getting any.

Such a shame because I took a client on the hope of impressing him (after talking the place up) and it just wasn't up to it's usual par.
Tasty food, good atmosphere,  great sevice. We had two crepes service was very fast with a smile.

We had a lunch for two, the set menu; focaccia  with figs, olives and pumpkin, then a cheese and pepper pasta, then sea bass for me and parmagiana for my wife, then granita and tiramisu for dessert. The ambience was nice, perhaps a little quiet, and the service was good. The room was nicely decorated. The meal was good, but at about ¬£105 with no alcohol or coffee, it may be a while before we return.

Great place for a quiet business breakfast. Service was great with friendly staff. Scrambled eggs and smoked salmon were excellent.

Much quieter than the old days of Asia de Cuba, but not an issue when there for breakfast!!

Great experience. Staff were friendly and helpful. We had a good wine recommendation.
It‚Äôs also dog friendly and the staff took great care of our dog.

The service was very good. We had quite a few questions about the menu, ingredients and so forth, and these were answered very knowledgeably, also made good recommendations. The food itself was good but a little on the small side, especially the mains, even when having to pay extra for the vegetables.
There was a 12.5% service charge added to the bill. Whilst this is not a problem on a small amount it can add up to a hefty amount on a larger bill. It would be nice to see this reduced to say 10% over ¬£200 spent.
Had a lovely lunch here with family. Including my 4 year old and it was perfect for her! Plenty of choice, friendly attentive staff. Will definitely be back.

Some things eg antipasto and coffee were very good at Cafe Murano but let down by the mediocre main courses. The chicken cacciatore was very bland and uninspiring topped off by a lukewarm splodge of spinach.
The staff and service was excellent but this cafe is going to have to work harder amongst stiff competition locally. Convent garden is stuffed with restaurants.
Great food and brilliant service - I would also highly recommend the Aperol tasting menu!

We were sat in the front table, even though it was obvious ot was a special occasion.
Anyone else who entered was sat pass the bar where the ambiance seemed a bit better.
The host was super helpful to other tables, not geri friendly to my wife and I. He could have gathered her jacket like he did with other guest.
The waitress and food were the best parts of the evening
Lovely staff and great food, had the white wine recommended by Angela, a very good choice

Staff were very helpful. Food was fine but nothing exceptional. Table for 6 was a little cramped and the room was very noisy so it was difficult to hear people on the other side - despite it being small.

I would summarise it as a reliable venue with very good staff.
Thoroughly enjoyed the food, wine, vibe and service! Very reasonably priced! Have recommended and will return!
Been a few times now. Quality of food is great and staff are always polite and friendly. Recommended.
Good location. Service excellent. Set menu good value. Can be noisy when large groups there so ask for a table near the entrance if you want to chat.
The food & service were impeccable. We had a pre-theatre supper which was delicious & quick. It was a pity we couldn‚Äôt stay longer & enjoy it all mor slowly.

The food and service at Cafe Murano were excellent. My only reservation was that the restaurant decor needs updating, it's a bit worn round the edges. The friend who I ate with commented that the Cafe Murano at St James restaurant, has better decor.

Our first booked visit was half business, half pleasure. Declined the offer of a table in front of the door - it was a chilly day. Upstairs we were looked after by a pleasant lady who offered to answer any questions we might have, and who gave us the work time we needed at the end of the meal.

Sadly, there was a problem with our food. But a good test of a restaurant is how they deal with any problem, and the restaurant came up trumps. Offers of re-cooking food declined as we were half way through already; pleasant and genuine apologies offered. And then offending item subtracted from bill. As a result, we will definitely return and also recommend this place: mistakes happen, and these were dealt with well. Other food offerings excellent. Staff charming.
Fabulous food and a lovely ambience.  The veal Milanese was delicious!
Great authentic Italian restaurant. Food is delicious. All staff wonderfully helpful and friendly. Would definitely recommend trying it out.
Really lovely dinner great service we really enjoyed will come again

Very good. Lunch on New Years Eve. Ate quite early so was not very busy and staff very attentive. Food was superb. Fairly small portions which we all like. Prix fixe menu good value. Tasty polenta was a first.  I will definitely go again.

Everything about CafeMurano is just superb. The food is exquisite, even the dishes on the set menu (which is wonderful value); the tables are well spaced out, the decor understated and stylish. Service is attentive. Bravo!

This was a great choice for dinner after the Matinee, not too overcrowded, excellent and knowledgeable waiting staff that could take us through the menu, and the wine list with relative ease, and also recommend a good wine for individual deserts, the food was served quickly, and piping hot, I've seen better presentation at this price point, but rarely tasted better.

The most delicious stone-bass - faultlessly cooked.   My companion's partridge was equally good.  The service was exemplary and we would not fault any aspect of our luncheon.   Will definitely return and recommend.

Thanks for a great evening at Cafe Murano - albeit different  from its signature restaurant, it has a good varied menu suitable for all tastes & palettes that equals any fine dinning experience - we will definitely be returning.

The restaurant is in a good position for the Savoy Theatre.  The service was good but the food was only average.  We had a antipasto of meat which was not very appetising.  The pasta as mentioned in other reviews was not home made.  The sauce was not great.  It served a purpose.

Unfortunately this didn't work for us. We went there on a Saturday for a pre-theatre meal because it's a stone's throw from the theatre and they offer a competitively-priced prix fixe menu (3 choices for main course). However, they were overwhelmed with business, with the result that service was very slow and in fact we didn't have time for our second course. Constantly looking at one's watch doesn't make for a relaxed dinner. When it did come, the food was OK but not much more than that. Maybe everything is different on weekdays.
Quaint and old fashioned Italian,good for the quick lunch time meal we required with good food, if somewhat pricey for what we had

I booked this restaurant at short notice for 16 people for a work's meal.  Even though I did not attend personally, had great reviews back from the people that did.  Food and service was excellent and they would definitely recommend Salieri.  I will definitely be booking again.
A great place to grab a bite before heading to see a musical.

Salieri in London is a restaurant I am unlikely to return to. The staff were not friendly, and repeatedly left the front door open while it was cool outside though customers mentioned they preferred it closed. A staff member also first said we could not swap the included glass of wine for a soft drink. Another staff member would yell questions instead of speaking at a reasonable level. The food quality was decent, but based on the staff, I do not recommend this restaurant.

when we first arrived, I was a little worried as the waiter actually seemed disappointed that we showed up. But they did have a table for us and the rest of the evening was pleasant. The music was sometimes a bit overwhelming, but I guess it is part of the atmosphere they want to achieve. All in all it was a nice evening with tasty food, prompt service and good value for money.

We wen to Salieri Restaurant on The Strand for a pre theatre meal.  The 2 set menus had a lovely range of food and very affordable.  The staff were friendly and fun and the service was very quick but we did not feel rushed.  Highly recommend this restaurant!
Very limited menu, it‚Äôs essentially a cafe. Friendly staff. Very over priced for pizza and pasta. Wine was nice, and authentically Italian.

We decide to booking a table at Bateaux London after a cruise on Thames in that day. All staff is verry polite and makes you feel like a special guest. For us was a big surprise when the boat start to move, wow, is a crise too. Yes! Is a moving restaurant üòÅ
A soloist maintained the atmosphere on the guitar
Food was great!
5* Bateaux London, i will reapeat the experience when i come back to London

Four of us ate last Friday evening and as a consequence of current events there was only one other party on the bus. The service was very good and dietary requirements were accommodated for. The set up to stop drinks falling over and cutlery rolling away is very impressive. The route through London was thoroughly enjoyable. Some of the flavours/combinations on the menu were unusual but the quality of the food and overall menu was very good, especially considering it is prepared in a moving kitchen. This is not a cheap night out, however it is also not your average eating experience and I would go again and recommend it. One piece of advice - check the Bustronome website for the actual menu as the one on Opentable is out of date.

Ushers dinner for a wedding. The area was perfect. The space allowed for us to distance as much as was needed but still feel intimate and a group. The food was fantastic. Simple but exceptional quality and great potions. The wine list was a reasonable range at reasonable value. The staff were friendly, efficient and made our evening perfect. Very relaxed and enjoyable time.

I heard this place is good to enjoy afternoon tea with small pay. As I heard, it was true, staff was really nice and cream with scone was especially good. Some people said english breakfast tea isn‚Äôt that good but to me it was lovely with a little bit of milk. I definitely recommend this place to my friend who visit london.

Location was fabulous, sheltered yet able to see the sights. Food was great service was a bit hit and miss due to lack of staff not poor staff. Overall we had a good night with good food that suited all tastes
Great service, always available and very attentive.
This was a gift for my in-laws and they had an amazing time, and they could not stop talking about how attentive the staff was weed and how excellent the quality of the food was.

I had booked for my mum's birthday on a Saturday and everything was perfect - beautiful room with everything rose themed, attentive service and they even brought a surprise birthday friand collection for mum, cosy and quiet and not too crowded on a Saturday. I was most impressed by the delicious scones, but the sweets were amazing too - passionfruit cheesecake was refreshing, raspberry macaron was too pretty to eat, the bitterness of matcha cake was perfect to balance the sweetness and the opera cake was to die for, we finished the sweets in one bite! There was a harp in the room so we kept waiting for someone to come and play it but it didn't happen so that was a shame but otherwise a very enjoyable delightful experience.

I looked at a lot of reviews before picking the Rose Lounge. I must say that I made the right choice. The room is absolutely lovely and the service was impeccable. The sandwiches were fresh and they accommodated my vegetarian friend. There was plenty of food and my friends barely touched their dessert because they were so full. I, of course, ate everything. I actually considered the Ritz but it was booked. And I'm glad because the Rose Lounge was warm, welcoming and more intimate.

Took a friend to The Rose Lounge for afternoon tea and was not disappointed!  Afternoon tea is all about the surroundings for me (and the cake!!) and The Rose Lounge was just beautiful - lounged there for over two hours, catching up and eating delicious french pastries and scones, whilst a harpist played behind us.  Perfect way to drown out the hectic christmas shoppers outside!  Would definitely return.

Great Indian restaurant near to Leicester Square tube station.  They have a very good menu and wine list and friendly waiters.  I would highly recommend this place to anyone who likes very good Indian food.
I would whole heartedly recommend this restaurant and the tasting menu in particular. Everything was absolutely delicious and the staff were amazing.

I think the place is well meaning but definitely over hyped. I booked Lucknow49 for a much anticipated team dinner with great expectations. We were sadly let down. A first look at the restaurant with 3 garbage bags bang outside the so called fine dining restaurant spoilt the image for us. Once inside,  the place was quite small, though ambience was ok. The food was of mixed quality. The chicken starter and galouti kebab were good but the vegetarian dahi bhalla starter was disappointing with the bhalla being hard and probably not fresh. The curry portions in the mains were ridiculously small and in general portion sizes were smaller than average given that the restaurant is not cheap. Food overall was ok but nothing exceptional. Our bill was messed up with the waitress charging wrong amount on card which then had to be corrected. Overall a very average dining experience and in my view there are far better restaurants for the price they charge.

Amazing quality fish! The best cod I can remember having...
Not cheap, but the price that I would expect in the area.
Would definitely recommend...

Nice staff but afternoon tea okay but ordinary.  Staff pleasant but had to ask for the drinkable tea as it didn't arrive and the food was already on the table.  Was a "champagne afternoon tea" but also had to ask again for this , it was delivered after the food and the teas. Tiny teapots with no offer of a top up. Alright but not as we had hoped.
A wide variety of delicious food, beautifully presented.  Excellent service by attentive staff.

Great staff, convenient location and surroundings were pleasant if rather uninspiring.  Half of the food was good or delicious, a quarter was alright and a quarter was poor. For example the cucumber sandwich, bread seemed frozen in one place and overall sandwiches did not seem freshly made. However the scallops were delicious as was the rhubarb and custard dessert. Scones were reasonable. Staff couldn‚Äôt be more helpful.

Had such a lovely tea here. It is kind of difficult to find, but the room is quiet with ample seating. The service was great and they had plenty of gluten free options. Great place to go for an afternoon tea!
Enjoyable afternoon tea. Very good choice of food items. Would have liked to have been offered a top-up of tea and service could have been better but still acceptable. Will happily visit again.
My only request would be that the scones are much bigger rather than the small ones we were served.

The interior is not that fancy but the service was fantastic and the afternoon tea is very good with a lot of choice and very tasty. We booked online and received a free bottle of prosecco which was a great surprise.  Lovely for meeting up with my mum.

Went for a friends birthday and had a great time. The aranchini balls were my fave and would definitely visit again. The atmosphere was lovely and very comfortable. We booked online which included a free bottle of procesco which was a plus, so look out for that every now and again.
Good service, nice decor and good food. A very nice afternoon tea with friends.

I went to the restaurant with friends and the overall experience was average. The staff were not attentive and we had to get up to get their attention to place each order, whether it be for drinks, the main and then the dessert. For the location I would have expected more. I have been to the restaurant several times and the experience has been mixed.
not to have dinner, only to dance and enjoy the music
Great for pre theatre food. The service was great , plenty of attentive staff if we needed them. We are at the pace we wanted, and had several tapas I‚Äôve Ethel evening. Nothing was a problem!
it was an amazing dinning experience the staff made the visit brilliant.
Ian the barman was exceptional

Bar and waiters very friendly excellent service good value for money. Not intimidating by being a celebrity haunt. Loved it is will go again.
Decor amazing very 1920's elegance

Generous size piece of fish in sushi rolls.
Reasonable price. Very nice people and services.
I recommend this place for all who are looking for place to enjoy sushi casually.
Excellent service, good value  pre theatre menu. Our waitress was great and made it really special for my mum‚Äôs birthday. Thank you!

Very much a meal of two halves. We had a booking for two at 7pm and were rather surprisingly seated at a table set for four. Hardly an issue but not what you'd expect at Browns in St Martin's Lane. We then waited for 15 minutes before even being offered a copy of the menu - they were tidying up after the pre-theatre rush apparently. Good food (apart from a derisory 'side salad' consisting of some huge slices of tasteless tomato and some sad looking leaves); the fish pie was terrific. My chocolate bomb sadly didn't melt when the sauce was poured on it - rather spoiled the 'theatre' of the dish, but it tasted delicious. Overall, rather pricey for what was an average meal out and a disappointment considering we were celebrating ten years since our first dinner date at the very venue (and we both remembered it being considerably better in 2008!).
Great value set menu for pre-theatre dining. Fun lively ambiance. Would recommend the haddock fishcakes!

First off, the food was really good, although I forgot to specify a "well done" poached egg and had to contend with almost translucent eggwhite - a personal taste thing but I wasn't expecting it to be quite so 'rare'! All the adaptations we did ask for came as requested, and the hot chocolate was fantastic. Place was nearly empty when we arrived and I worried it felt a bit quiet for the special occasion we were celebrating, but it filled up really fast and then our waiter was a bit rushed. Was easy enough to ask for more drinks etc though. Overall would recommend.
Great food, service and ambience. Great for theater pre and post.

Menu looked good but in reality, food was awful. My order was messed up, and to begin with they tried to convince me that was what I ordered but then later acknowledged their error. When I eventually got my food, I was completely underwhelmed. My friend ordered the pork belly mac and cheese and it was not anything like she expected either.

Service was also pretty bad - felt like we were interrupting the bar staff to order food, and the food took a long time to come.

I used a taste card, so it was 50% off, but even with such a massive discount, I can‚Äôt say the food was worth the price we paid. Wouldn‚Äôt recommend eating here unless you had no other choice and don‚Äôt care about the quality of the food or service.
Loop is also a club and the music flows into the restaurant so you really can't avoid that vibe, but it's a fun place for a group night out and the 50% deal meant it was also good value.

Loop - London W1
Very busy in the bar area as they were offering happy hour half price drinks until 8pm so very popular with the after work crowd! Restaurant fairly quiet but foo was good and due to happy hour and top table deal it was very cheap indeed!
Excellent for a very quick cheap meal before going to a show.

Restaurant is what you would expect of an establishment that is also a bar and a night club. Little bit cramped, but comfortable enough.

Table was nicely set out.

Food was a good standard, well presented and reasonably priced.

Wine list was satisfactory, if a little over priced.

Got the feeling the staff wanted rid of us asap. They were also quite surly and lacked a sense of humour. They did their basic job though.

Would go again because of location and value for money.
I went to The Loop in london with a few friends and really enjoyed it. The food was really good and the place had a great atmosphere. We had a really good night out!
Excellent value for money.

We went on a thursday night, was quite busy but not overwhelmingly so...food was better than i expected! As we were a large group, the toptable offer+happy hour definitely came very handy. overall recommended.

Back to Loop again, have been many times. Ended up with the 50% deal, which I didnt know I was entitled to, so we both ordered starters and Surf and Turf. Food was lovely, as usual. Took advantage of Happy Hour of course. Was disappointed with the music and crowd in the bars and basement club. Lots of Hen and Stag parties. Loop is much better as an after work drink venue to be honest. Would only go again on a saturday for dinner and head to a different club.
The Loop is your typical Bar, Club, Restaurant knid of place.. quick nice food.

Although the food was tasty and good value for money, we had real trouble in ordering wine as most types had sold out! Service was a bit slow despite the fact we were originally one of the only occupied tables in the restaurant and there were confusions about people's orders. This was dealt with in a friendly way by staff though. Have been to this restaurant before and service was much better, so maybe just had bad luck last night.

I enjoyed a fun evening at The Loop with a friend on a Thursday night. It is quite noisy with the club/bar being next to the restaurant, and so maybe not ideal for a romantic meal but it was great for a lively evening with friends. We both really enjoyed our food as well which was very well presented and so reasonable with the Toptable deal of 50% off!

The Loop has a nice bar on the ground level, a club on the lower level which leads into the restaurant. It's fairly light, but a bit of a dungeon. Happy hour is from 5-8 so our wine also qualified for 25% off.  The food at 50% off was good value and tasty but at full price you may feel a bit hungry. The club next to the restaurant was noisy and with no separating doors by 9pm it was loud! Not the best for a one-on-one catch up but would be great  to feed a crowd and then get drunk.

A great atmosphere early evening and the happy hour between 5pm to 7pm was good value --lots of young people enjoying themselves --might get a bit too busy later --big queues to get in when we left at 9.30pm

My friends and I had dinner at The Loop on Friday night.  We had a couple of cocktails at the bar before eating in the restaurant (it's happy hour 5 - 7pm!). The food was delicious and excellent value with the 50% off offer.  The restaurant was very buzzy and perfect for a night out with friends, although it may have been a bit too loud for a romantic dinner.  After dinner we hit the dancefloor which was downstairs from the restaurant... a perfect Friday night out with the girls!

Fantastic value for money with the toptable offer.
Multiple rooms with varied atmospheres make it an ideal venue for dining or drinking.
Perfect as always
Shortish but excellent menu with interesting specials. The quality of the food was very good and the service was excellent.
We had a really good meal, steaks were fab as were the burgers !  You did not feel rushed at all which was very relaxing. The building was interesting and well designed .
Loved the venue, it's in the basement and is charming. No phone signal though so bear in mind if you're meeting up with people! Service was lovely, food was lovely, drinks were lovely. Will go again.

went with friends on a Tuesday night. attentive staff and busy atmosphere. however main veg on menue was Mushrooms and they did not have any which all of us had ordered. only 7 pm so a shame. spoiled it a bit but overall enjoyed it and it was good value.
Fab night at Jerusalem, great food, good value wine and a great atmosphere as well as brilliant and friendly service. We will definitely come back !

Went for lunch to Cote brasserie with a friend.  The food was great, the service was good and there was not anything really to complain about.  Its always a good choice.  The atmosphere is warm and cosy and comfortable.

It wasn‚Äôt until we left Le Roche Patisserie that we realised we should have been in their restaurant next door. I did tell the staff upon arrival that we had booked a table but they didn‚Äôt say that maybe we should be next door. I wondered why it felt like a cafe rather than restaurant. We both had the same to eat spinach and cheese omelettes which were fine and very filling. The service was OK but what we really annoying was that the staff kept wedging the front door open, in February! My friend and I got up on two separate occasions to close it .
wonderful experience, delicious food and very nice welcoming from the team

I had been to Pisqu a few times and I love the food, being Peruvian, I found the food just like at home so I am definitely coming back again; however they need to sort out their service, as the food took too long to arrive between courses last time that I was there but it is something that can be improved so keep providing tasty food.

We were at Pisqu on a Saturday and although it was quiet when we arrived it was very busy when we left.  Our starters and main courses were lovely, however desserts were very disappointing - we waited 30mins for them to arrive (and out of the 4 of us 3 had ordered ice-cream) and when they did arrive it looked as though the ice-cream had been just taken out of the freezer and was too hard to scoop.  We basically had ice-cream shavings on a plate with a garnish - totally not worth the money or the wait and we got the impression they'd forgotten about the order and then put it together in a hurry.  If we went to Pisqu again we would not have dessert as it could have spoilt what was otherwise a lovely meal.

Delicious Charbonnel et Walker Afternoon Tea. Sandwiches were tasty with quirky flavours. Particularly enjoyed Smoked Salmon on Sour Cherry Bread. Scones were fresh from the oven and still warm when we ate them. Light, fluffy and perfect. Cakes and desserts were delicious. Truffles were a lovely touch.
Service was great. Staff checked we were enjoying our food and regularly topped up our hot drinks.
Will definitely return!
Cosy atmosphere; outstanding service; good food and beverages; a nice place to enjoy an afternoon tea.
Absolutely brilliant.  Great food, good house red, lovely helpful staff ( Giorgio will be missed)! Excellent entertainment, danced till 2am. What's not to like.

Ghassan on the mezzanine level is a wonderful, engaging host. We have been to other Maroush branches but not previously to this one. We were greeted as if long-time regulars. Typical Lebanese fare top notch. Ghassan also made sure to bring the proper vintage (1999) of the cabernet we ordered. Highest marks for service and food.

Went to Maroush V after reading the reviews on here. They couldn't find my booking but there was plenty of space and we had a nice table on the mezzanine.
Food was very tasty and enormous portions! We only had mezze and couldn't finish it. Falafel were particularly good. We also got a free drink and free baklava and tea at the end.
Service was good but occasionally vague, though always polite. I would definitely go back
very nice restaurant. but watch out, there is a brzilian flag outside so dont be mislead by it. the food is amazing and the service is very good. real value for money
Excellent food and service as usual.  Our third visit and we were not disappointed
Perfect from start to finish! what else can i say?!

Had a terrible experience at this place. Firstly, the restaurant did not have my booking as I had booked through OpenTable. Secondly, I was seated in the worst possible table next to kitchen even though there were other tables available as I decided not to go with the Valentine‚Äôs set menu. Thirdly, the most disappointing of all, my wife was served a dish with meat when we had specifically ordered for a vegetarian dish. We had double checked with the waitress while placing the order, but they still messed up the order. My wife had never eaten meat in her life, but took a bite from the meal she got served. That ruined the evening for us.

To top it all off, the drinks order was messed up too and we were served the wrong drinks. When they did serve the daiquiri that I had ordered, it was the worst I‚Äôve had in my life. It was nothing but juice + rum served in a glass meant for drinking water. It was a joke!

Never returning to this place again.

Quiet oasis but very central right on Charing Cross station good all day menu food good quality ideal for our four generation family meal
Shame our order got confused and they were not busy otherwise service very good
Will return and recommend
Good quality food and very excellent service. The Pain Perdu was absolutely delicious.

Everything from start to finish was delicious and the service was very good. The rabbit lasagne and aubergine were especially delicious and the rosemary ice cream with the tarte tatin to die for. Highly recommended.

Everything that I had hoped for. The great reviews I read were correct and the food was fabulous. I had the lunch small plates as did my dinning partner, and what a great choice of food.
If any complaint was that 3 plates/each was a bit much for 2 even for us hungry & greedy eaters - but that didn't stop us from ordering a pain perdu to share. This dish is correctly put on a pedestal. What a brilliant place. The staff were lovely without being overbearing.
The ossobuco tortellini and the french toast are, in my opinion, two of the most memorable dishes of all time. Plus, they do BYOB with no corkage fee on Mondays. What's not to love?
Great service and food. Ambience was a little lacking initially, but got better as the restaurant filled up around 10.45pm
A very quiet restaurant with really good selection of vegetarian meals. Great drinks, and friendly service!
Hey, I‚Äôm visiting from out of town, I made a same day  reservation, you were CLOED! What gives?
Always excellent food and service in a buzzy atmosphere.

Amazing food, not your typical Indian
lovely setting, nice atmosphere

We enjoyed lunch here celebrating my daughter‚Äôs new job! We received a warm greeting being seated with a great view of the kitchen.
The service was friendly and efficient.
The food was nicely presented and flavoursome.

I would highly recommend

Once again an excellent lunch. Very good value. The food was fantastic, the best risotto I have ever had!
The service was perfect.
Thank you.
