My second visit to Murano in Mayfair & it didn't disappoint.This was a birthday dinner for my husband & his first visit & he also thoroughly enjoyed both the food & the restaurant & the all the members of staff were friendly, efficient,polite &'helpful. Will certainly return

It was amazing ,food perfect.Excellent staff.
Beautiful decor.
To be highly recommended.

Great food once again. The wine list is surprisingly reasonable with a great selection of Italian reds - we had a 2015 Sardinian wine for about ¬£50 and it was lovely. The noise level was unnoticeable (although one suspects our neighbouring tables might have a different view). This place never disappoints.

The restaurant was exceptional with regards to ambience and comfort. The service was just as it should be.
However I am not a fan of the style of the menu which seems to be a choice of "taster" dishes 2,3 or 4 and then a desert if required. Although the quality of the food was excellent I thought the price was too high.

The food was outstanding, my highlights was the pork main course and Pasticho souffl√©

The service was friendly without being stuffy or making guests feel intimidated... overall an exceptional experience, I will be back again soon!
Amazing experience - lovely food and superb staff.
Delicious meal celebrating a new job - service was attentive but discreet and food was delicious without leaving us feeling too full. Deserving of its Michelin star!

The food was excellent, the cheese cart was out of this world with a very wide selection. hard to find a bottle of wine under ¬£50 but we had an excellent Montepulciano from Abruzzo that was delicious. The staff were all very welcoming, accommodating and happy to have a bit of a laugh at the same time, so it wasn't too stuffy at all.
My wife and I have been visiting this restaurant for several years and each time is a new experience. Today's lunch time meal was the best yet.

It's been a year or so since my last visit to Murano and I'm sad to say that the restaurant has gone badly downhill since then. Difficult to see how it now merits a Michelin star.

Problems start with the menu, which has to be explained to you. Five sections, with four dishes per section, and you choose anything you like, in any order, and portion sizes will be adjusted (apparently). What's the point?

Then there's the food, relatively small portions of very ordinary fair, lacking any clear connection to Italy. My beef fillet could not have been more than 100gm, rather greasy (soue vide?) and lacking any originality. You would be better off going to a place like Picture for comparable food at less than half the price.

The wine list is full of wines I've never heard of, with little under ¬£60 per bottle, making it difficult to do anything other than guess or take advice.

Finally the service is intrusive, the waiting staff interrupting conversation at the table, rather obviously wanting to move things along quickly.

My advice: revert to a conventional, Italian style menu; reduce the number of dishes on offer and make then worth eating; train the staff to "wait" at table and sack the wine buyer.
Murano is constantly brilliant with outstanding service and eye for detail. Nothing is too much for the staff they are there to enhance your experience.

A wonderful dining experiance welcoming inclusive staff out of this workd food
Discreet congrats on our anniversary all so special

It was one of my daughters' birthday so to fit in with her calendar, lunch was required.
Can't recommend it highly enough. We had the set lunch which was excellent both quality and value. The drinks can get away pretty quick if you're not careful, but that applies pretty much everywhere.
We all said we would go back
Better recommendation ?

Delicious food, great wine and attentive service. The dining room is quiet and formal but the staff are friendly and unpretentious, which makes you feel at home. We agreed we would go again but order fewer courses! We were both so full by the end of our 5 course tasting menu that we couldn't manage dessert or cheese, both of which looked really good.

Mrs KevGull and I booked for lunch on Saturday 10/07/15 as part of our semi-regular grand days out in The Smoke.

Despite the location not being great for our itinerary, I chose Murano because Mrs KG a) loves Italian food / Italy and b) is a big fan of Angela as a personality. I must admit that I was not hugely convinced by the menu, but thought that it'd be good to try a new destination.

Oh how right I was - service was attentive but not overbearing, or stuffy, atmosphere was relaxed, dining room was full but tables are well-spaced to ensure privacy, sommeliers knew their stuff, food was gorgeous and the freebies at either end of the meal were of great quality. That coppa- wow!

Favourite bit? When the waitress brought me some more of the top-notch bread to mop up the sauces on my near-empty plate of lamb neck and then explained that the Italians have a word for that (I forgot what it is, but shall be looking it up!).

¬£33 plus service per cover for 3 excellent courses is a bargain. We lingered and spent a lot more than that on wine etc but v happy.
Thanks to all at Murano - top stuff. :-)

Food is amazing, between 2 of us we had 9 separate dishes (tasting menu) and 9 empty plates at the end. Rabbit, pheasant, monkfish, sole and souffl√© (desert) were the star dishes. Restaurant is relaxed and not over fancy and is very comfortable. We were there for 4 hours and time flew by!

Staff are attentive, friendly and knowledgeable.

Went there for a birthday lunch treat and it was excellent. Service very professional. Set lunch may seem pricey but good choice and perfect light lunch. Very small dishes but extremely tasty and beautifully prepared. Only faults were that veal carpaccio lacked flavour, and wines very expensive, though very good indeed. Superb prosciutto and bread as amuse-guele and very generous portion. Panna Cotta dessert was brilliant and perfectly balanced. Even made up a birthday dessert surprise - very slick. Definitely consider going for Dinner now.  That's what a set lunch should be all about - good enough to convince you to come back for dinner - so many places forget that, but not here. We both thoroughly enjoyed it.

The food was really excellent and I really enjoyed  the choices available, it was difficult to decide what to eat as it all sounded great. For me the restaurant itself let it down. It seemed very dated and a little tired in places. It lacked ambiance, which in part may have been because it was lunchtime, but the decor felt quite late 80's business lunch rather than the decadent look I assume they were trying to achieve.Certainly I didn't feel it matched the style of food being served. In summary, excellent food but dated interior.

What a great evening! We were a group of 6 friends celebrating my husbands 40th Birthday. The food was superb, the atmosphere great and the service top notch, What was really super was the sommelier.She was so well informed about the different wine choices and clearly had a great passion for all things related to wine and champagne, sharing the history of the wine and the vinyards, lots of stories and answering our many questions!
We were the last to leave the restaurant after being treated to a kitchen tour and my husband receiving a special complimentary Birthday dessert. A wonderful evening which we will definitely repeat.

After working in London for 30 years+ and dining in some of its more acclaimed establishments, I'm calling it a day as far as 5* restaurants are concerned. Murano was no worse nor better than most, but fine dining in London is rapidly becoming a case of the Emperor's clothes. Last night we were a party of four and spent nearly ¬£800 including some expensive but middling wines. The only vegetable to rear it's head was a chewy undercooked tender stem broccoli and the whole experience was simply underwhelming. Sorry Murano for the negative feedback but there will always be obscenely overpaid hedgies happy to splash the corporate cash....

My wife's cooking tastes better with every such visit....
Quite relaxing atmosphere, the food is good and size is bigger than average cafe, very casual.

good new take on old favourites
fantastic sunday roast
food almost perfect
nice fit out of an old tired lady in to a refreshed, revamped, could be new favourite.
Service is very shambolic , and the food not great my garlic naan must have brushed past the garlic and it was cold . Could not be bothered to send it back . Will never return

For ¬£30 I expected the food to be a lot better. It was ok, but not great. Sandwiches had very minimal filling and bread dried out really quickly. When I asked for 1 extra mini scone, I was brought 4 and charged an additional ¬£11 for a cream tea without being told there was an additional cost. It‚Äôs a typical hotel lobby restaurant so there‚Äôs no atmosphere to speak of. I wouldn‚Äôt go again or recommend it, but it was a convenient location on the day.

The Pizza base was NOT the correct dough base to make a Pizza, try a trip to Italy then you will understand how to make a Pizza. The ambiance was sterile and more like a railway waiting room but perhaps that‚Äôs what people like.
Will not go back
Perfect pre theatre - literally 2 mins to Adelphi theatre. Great food nice drinks good service.

If you love pizza, you‚Äôll love Fire and Stone.

These are not your average pizzas, here you‚Äôll a fry up, or chilli prawn and noodles on a pizza. It‚Äôs amazing. They do pasta and salads too.

Good value, great food. Try it for yourself!
Great meal at Fire and Stone. Loads of choice, even for vegetarians - one of the best pizza places in London.
Always good for something a bit different than your usual bog standard pizzas. I'd recommend the Montego Bay and the Canberra pizzas!
Good food, quite loud, younger crowd and they haven't quite mastered the art of air conditioning.
Fantastic, quick service at fire and stone. Very yummy pizzas.
Pizza was nice and fresh. They have lots of offers usually so it's a good idea to keep an eye out for these.

Fire and Stone, Covent Garden London was great. We were seated on time and they were able to accomodate a last minute change to the number of people on the booking. The service staff were extremely busy but attentive and meals came quickly. The pizza's were great and the offer made it a very cheap meal out for four people, plus dessert and extra drinks.
Ate at Fire & Stone on a Friday night. Lots of buzz - and good atmosphere. Food good - enjoyed the pizza and the healthy superfoods salad was excellent.

Fire and Stone - Covent Garden - London
Very easy to find. The food was delicious and came out very quickly. The place was full and obviously well liked by others.

Great Pizza, pleasant service and a pleasant ambience.

Its quick, modern and ideal for a casual lunch
Went to the Fire and Stone in Covent Garden, London. Very impressed with the food - pizzas with a difference. Service good and atmosphere lively but not too noisy. would definitely go again.

Decent food but not brilliant. The deal wasn't really a deal, only saved us about ¬£1 each and we had to have house wine. Waiter added 12.5% service to the bill and when we asked him to remove it (so that we could pay 10% in cash) he asked why. Good atmosphere in the restaurant, probably better suited for dinner than lunch.
Great range of pizza's with interesting and different from the run of the mill toppings.  Nice decor, friendly staff and quick service.
Great meal.

Fire and Stone, what a brilliant place. Great atmosphere, lovely decor, fantastic value for money, and such an interesting selection of pizzas! There‚Äôs a lot on offer, so give yourself a good amount of time to go through it all.

On the whole a great night out.  The initial greeting at the door was not too friendly but the guys serving in the restaurant more than made up for it!  Loads of choice and great value for money.  As a girls night out, my friends and I had a great time.  WOud definately go again.

My friend and I dined at Fire and Stone intending to have the special TopTable offer (¬£10 for pizza and side salad). But we read the menu and changed our minds! The starters looked too good to pass up, so we had king prawns and falafels to start - both were fantastic. The pizzas were also gorgeous! The waiting staff were really attentive up until we wanted to pay, when they disappeared! But overall, a lovely place, really reasonably priced, with a great white zinfandel!

Fire & Stone in Covent Garden - Funky setting and great pizza. There was almost too much choice and the menu had some really interesting dishes on it. Service wasn't great - everytime the waiter came over, h made it seem like he was far too busy to get us anything else and that we should really appreciate his time. But the menu and atmosphere made it worth it anyway. Great wine list too.
Such a great deal at Fire and Stone. Love the Pekking pizza!!!
Brilliant.
Felt the cocktails were over priced compared to the food costs.
fire and stone is a great place to eat, great atmosphere and good food at a good price for the location. service is a little hit and miss.

Went to Fire and Stone with a group of friends, excellent venu, caters well for large groups. Really great selection of pizza for something a little different. Not the best pizza base but overall really tasty. Try the dessert too - icecream was really good. Good value for money.

Fire & Stone - excellent choice of food - really good for when you go in a big group as there really is something to please everyone. Service is good - price is very suitable and location is ideal. Have been to this place 3 times and not been disappointed.
The waiter was pushing as we had a large table and ordering took a few minutes longer than a small table. Otherwise the product, location etc cant be faulted for a nice meal with friends.
Fire and Stone was a good place for a relaxed Saturday lunch; good food, nice selection on the menu, and good value for money.
Excellent as always, the pizza are different but fab and a meal here is great value.
An excellent selection of pizzas, a nice ambiance and friendly staff
Fire and Stone has amazing pizza, very good service, and a great atmosphere. Would definitely recommend for a catch up with friends.
Fire & Stone; ambience great, food great, service absolutely shocking it took 1 hour before we got our pizzas they are extremely understaffed. Worth going if you are in no rush.

Fire and Stone has a nice atmosphere and the starters were really nice. The pizzas were really disappointing - with all manner of strange topping combinations. The deal was good value for money and the service was OK. The place generally has little character but if you want something to eat quickly that's a bit nicer than fast food then it's OK.

The food was excellent, so tasty and perfectly cooked! Koh Samui pizza is DELICIOUS!!!! The service was excellent too! The toptable offer is fab and very inviting and well worth it - would be worth it without the offer too (although don't stop the offer Toptable as everybody likes a bargain!!) :-) We will go back again and again and recommend you try it out!
Fire and Stone - great choice of exotic pizzas at reasonable prices.  Fantastic fast and friendly service - good eat!
Fire and Stone is a great restaurant and takes pizza to a whole new level! The smoothies are delicious too and even better if you're cashing in some Toptable points.
Fire and Stone Covent Garden.  Really nice venue, I like the high ceiling.  Food OK, not amazing.  I would have liked a thinner crispier pizza base.  Friendly staff.

Disappointing - pizzas like "frozen" pizza, with unusual & clashing tastes. All 10 guests I took with me commented that the pizzas were not authentic & did not taste good!!  Desserts on pizza bases? NO!!
Unusual pizzas but tasty. Excellent value with toptable offer - ¬£10 pizza and dessert. Lemon tart was ace!
This is not a normal pizza restaurant. The recipes and ingredients are original and full of taste. The service was a bit slow, but very hospitable and accomodating. Would definitely recommend it!
Excellent food, great location, impressive decor, good value for money and a menu to die for as there are so many dishes that you want to try. I'm already planning my next visit now, can't wait!!
I expected the pizzas to be very different and exiting but the base was thick and doughy. Toppings were very unusual though.
Lovely decoration and delicious food
Very nice experience with lovely staff and very well executed food ... definately will try the restaurant as well based on this
I don‚Äôt often write reviews but this place was outstanding in every way. The food and drink were fantastic and the staff warm without being too intrusive. Highly recommended.

Really enjoyed the Christmas menu. The staff were very efficient & friendly & they also gave us a voucher for free bottle of wine in January with a meal.
We are hoping to visit again for sure.
Store bought nachos - all I have to say! Tacos were ok, everything else was bad, service was too fussy. Don't go. El Pastor does great tacos if you want them, and even Wahaca is better.

We have been to this establishment a number of times. although the service is very good , they had forgotten it was our Anniversary , although mentioned on the booking form.
The place was very quite and looking very tired. food was acceptable but not exciting.

A lovely restaurant, great people watching, fab location for a walk through the park afterwards. The food was lovely, we chose a limited menu, but it didn't disappoint. The service was fantastic and the antomsphere was fab. Have returned since.
Lovely place, quite plush. The set 3 course menu is excellent value (we had special deal which included glass of bubbly). Nice staff - attentive but not over attentive!
Fancy afternoon tea, sandwiches were a bit bland, biscuits and cakes were excellent. Host was very accommodating with us changing the time of reservation on short notice.

Very quaint a boutique hotel. Nice afternoon tea considering the price. Unfortunately my wife fell ill so couldn‚Äôt eat anything, but staff were friendly and brought it up to the room for me instead.
Love this restaurant. Food never disappoints
A lovely breakfast...
Great place just soak up the atmosphere, enjoy great food and great service , we wee here for Thanksgiving FANTASTIC
I can recommend it
Staff very rude, to much trouble to service our group

Excellent meal from start to finish.

Dover Sole was excellent and filleted well.

Staff were all welcoming and we thoroughly enjoyed
Amazing atmosphere fantastic food and th waiting staff were lovely and very helpful

Wonderful food and fabulous service. Great ambience and surrounding.
Sommelier was very helpful when choosing the drinks for the evening.

Absolutely brilliant l !

Food is amazing ! Unbelievable !

Venue is excellent !

Only negative ... price of a bottle of wine ! 500% mark up on a bottle is simply extortionate !
All seemed like a wonderful dream. You made a lovely fuss of my 88 year old Mum. Made her feel very special, indeed. Thank you.
Friendly service, delicious food, great atmosphere - thank you Kaspar‚Äôs!

I celebrated my birthday and Jacob who was my waiter for the evening was so lovely and funny. Kaspars sent a glass of champagne to my table and a happy birthday chocolate lollipop and they made such a fuss over me. Definitely made my birthday one to remember. Thank you so much Kaspars.
Beautiful food in a really lovely setting. The service was first class and as a couple we thoroughly enjoyed our meal booked for a special occasion . Would highly recommend !
Lovely location and wonderful interior, great food and excellent service
A very pleasant evening. Our second visit and a very enjoyable meal in beautiful surroundings.

My partner and I dined here before a visit to the Savoy theatre. This time we were visiting as a party of five,with our 20 something children. Everyone chose from the set menu which is excellent value for money, it does add up with drinks and extras but it was a celebration meal and we all felt that it had been just that, service is excellent and a5,45 booking gave us sufficient time to walk to the queens theatre afterwards.
Definitely recommend it for pre theatre or a special dinner

We went for a Business Dinner on the OpenTable special. The menu was fine, and also some accommodation had been made. The starter was nice, but could have been a bit more exciting and it was cold, we expected it to be hot. My colleague had the Fish, which was apparently very nice. I chose the Vegetarian mains option, which was visually very interesting, but eating was not bad, but felt a bit random in tastes combinations.
Dessert choice was fine however all included chocolate in some form and my colleague cannot eat it, so the only option was Ice cream for her, which where nice, but on such a cold day not the choice of the day. But overall service and ambience was very nice and I would come back there for Afternoon Tea I think next.
I absolutely love dining at Kaspers, the food is outstanding with first class service and the ambience sets the mood for the evening.
We booked for a pre-theatre meal.  The service was excellent - they couldn't have been more helpful and friendly and the food delicious.  I'd highly recommend a visit.

Kaspars has evolved since it opened and is less seafood orientated.  Every item of food is superbly cooked and presented.  It is a great place with a super ambience.  Staff work hard and are attentive but nt stuffy. o

We had a very enjoyable dinner at Kapsars. We had a beautiful table and the food was delicious.
Excellent service too

Booked for 4 people for7.15pm.

Good food. Good service. Good selection of wines. Meal cost over ¬£400 and have no complaints but told by a member of staff we have to give up our table at 9.15pm. We left at 10pm and ignored such poor public relations request.

Some would not come back when told what time to stop eating.
Very special place but expensive and extras expensive eg veg with meal.

Pretty much everything is right.
A beautiful location, Kaspers has amazing seafood.

This is our last night to stay in London for our trip and would like to have some seafood before leaving. After searching, we found that Kaspar's restaurant was suitable to have a beautiful memory before leaving London. I have excellence experience when having dinner on Jan 2 in Kaspar. Service, environment and food quality are wonderful.

Open Table's special relation between its subscribers and Kaspar's at The Savoy continues to delight with  (not quite) complimentary Bellini and under ¬£30 3-course dinner menu combined with the Savoy's exquisite service never disappoints.   Our first choice favourite for a pre-theatre performance.  Bravo.
delicious food, great service. Beautiful surroundings.
Good food and service in a lovely setting. We will return.

We arrived early for a cocktail before dinner and were seated in the lounge area outside the restaurant. It took several attempts at attracting the attention of a waiter before we were served and the same again when a further guest arrived. Shortly after our drinks were served, one of our group bumped the table when adjusting their seat and my cocktail was completely knocked over, swamping the table and two of our party. A waiter, who was stationed nearby, did eventually bring some napkins but we were pretty much left to clear up ourselves.
I had recommended the venue for the evening to the friends I was with and so was particularly disappointed with the lukewarm service level throughout the evening.

I wanted to treat my wife to a memorable evening to celebrate her 40th Birthday and chose Kaspar's at The Savoy due to it's iconic reputation. We were not dissapointed! Everything about the evening was superb from the footman escorting us from our taxi, to the breathtaking entrance hall into the Savoy with glittering wisteria. The ambience in Kaspar's was as superb as the luxurious art deco decor. Our meal was amazing and the service was excellent and attentive. Following our meal we decided to round the evening off wiith some superb cocktails in the legendary American Bar. Overall the evening was amazing and we would have no reservation in recommending Kaspar's and the Savoy for your special occasion.

We always know that we are having a great time when we are once of the last to leave! The whole place is decadent, the food was just perfect, I love seafood and we have oysters to start and scallops delicious! Our main was lamb cutlets which were also delicious, so tasty tender and well seasoned. The broccoli on the side was great too, a little bit of chilli made all the difference.

As it was our Anniversary, we were give a large chocolate disc with Happy Anniversary on and two chocolate lollipops.

We loved it, and would love to go back. Delicious and memorable.

I was nervous about this restaurant, as being in the Savoy I thought it may be pretentious portions of very overpriced food. This was definitely not the case, and I will be going there again.

The location is great and the service was some of the best I have had - which is saying something as I dine out a lot!

I would highly recommend the seafood here - it is outstanding

I loved the atmosphere and the relaxed feel of the restaurant - we had a window seat and the view was lovely.
The food and service was excellent - where the waiter/ waitress were plesant and attentative.
I was celebrating my birthday with friends and it was nice to relax in their company with good food and wine.
The sea bass was certainly the best dish for me!

What can be said, excellent all round. Obviously more expensive than 'normal' plcaes but worth every penny. Jazz group outstanding. Food and service outstanding. We enjoyed it so much we stayed on for the evening in the coctail bar.
There are no live jazz music. They should have mention on the reservation booking.

Great food, great service though the atmosphere was a little on the quite side though fairly busy. Would definitely suggest to others to go and try it out for themselves. Thank you for a great evening.

This is a bustling restaurant with a busy atmosphere, so not the place for a quiet meal for two. We didn't look at or try the main menu - we just had the steak and a half bottle of wine for ¬£14 deal. The food and service were both good.

A real find - very interesting menu - think I could become addicted to their duck scotch egg with black pudding and their fantastic puddings (and I mean the puddings rather than the desserts). With the toptable special of steak and wine in the middle it was fantastic value all round
We had a great time at deVille - service, food, and atmosphere all good.

DeVille's is really close to the buzz of Marylebone & Oxford St but felt a bit flat even tho Friday evening - only table when we arrived at 7
Having said that food was excellent. Limited three choices per course on the ¬£15 set meal - ordered salmon and steak both good plus a vegetarian option. Impressed menu said ingredients were organic and sourced 'locally' Beautifully presented desserts but the strawberry cheesecake a little disappointing. Overall good value for money

De Ville was excellent :quiet / great design & good food too.
Simple wine menu but good quality.
Highly recommend it!

The food selection and quality has continued to improve with each visit over the past year.  The portions are not large, but 3 small plates/person makes a very nice meal.  This time the meal was the best yet.
Cracking food and friendly staff. Nice atmosphere and great selection of dishes.

The hotel did not receive our reservation from Open Table, perhaps because we booked just the night before.  However, they had plenty of room on Sunday at 12:15pm and kindly got us a table anyway.  The service was excellent - attentive, friendly, and very patient and sweet with our 1-year-old who was not terribly well behaved.  The sandwiches weren't anything special, but the tea and dessert portions were excellent.  Overall highly recommend!
They had no record of booking but luckily there was space. I‚Äôd even emailed the day before to check (I tried to call but no reply). There was no chef in so could only have cold meats /cheese.

If you're not going to drink alcohol, this is a very good option. The food is excellent, with a wide variety of options including tasty and unusual cheeses.

If you are going to drink alcohol, you're going to need to save your pennies. I think there may have been beer available, but there was no still wine when I visited. The cheapest champagne-based drink was ¬£9 a glass (for house champagne or a kir royale.) Most of the bottles of champagne were over ¬£50.

When we visited, we also had poor service: the waitress seemed much more involved in an argument about feminism with diners at another table than in seeing whether we needed anything, so we needed to attract the attention of the other waiter to order desserts and to get the bill.

Food came out quickly but was cold ‚Ä¶ Nothing worse than cold eggs‚Ä¶ Champagne never came out until after we paid the bill.
I made the reservation, I was a little embarrassed

This is very much a pre-theatre dinner venue so very busy when we arrived at 18:30 and then empty around 19:00; we weren't going to the theatre so enjoyed the buzz on arrival but also the space and quiet after 19:00! Good value food and friendly service.

Since we were staying at the Hilton Park Lane where the restaurant is we decided to try it out.   Food was mediocre at best.  Menu advertises crisp calamari and it was greasy, soft and flimsy.  Service was also very poor.  Won‚Äôt be back

Absolutely brilliant for cheese lovers! They selected the cheeses and were happy to provide more bread and drinks etc. Attentive staff without hovering or interrupting us. The only thing we didn‚Äôt get offered was tea, but we were fine with the champagne and then tap water. I felt it was good value for money. Would completely recommend.
Amazing food
Lovely and reliable as usual, never gets wrong with Cote
The food was amazing! Had the lobster linguine and the tiramisu was out of this world!!
Really enjoyed coming back as one of my first outing post Covid. Small highly focused menu, great attentive service, good value impressive wine list .
Very attentive service, wonderful menu, beautiful dining room

Sadly it was a big disappointment, I was sat next to a door all night and it was open more than it was closed. Starters were nice, husband had Veal Chop for main but there was hardly any meat and it was all mostly breadcrumbs so it just tasted like butter. I ordered lobster chilli spaghetti but it was way too spicy. Husband said the wine was fantastic. The service wasn‚Äôt great at all - except for the Lady I didn‚Äôt get her name but she was the wine expert and she was fantastic. A credit to them.
The service was the best, me and my partner enjoyed a dinner celebrating a special occasion and the staff certainly made it special. Food was fantastic!
We liked the delicious food, the cosy decoration and the friendly personel!! We shall come again!!

Ristorante Frescobaldi is a sensual delight.  Visually stunning, the service, the ambiance, the food and wine choices are outstanding.  We had arrived in London in the morning from Chicago and were a bit travel fatigued, but our Frescobaldi visit made all of our senses "pop."  What a treat.  We thoroughly loved all aspects and will absolutely return when next in London.  Now, if only the Frescobaldi family would open a Chicago restaurant...
L‚ÄôEntrecote always delivers for good steak frites and a glass of good value french wine
Fantastic. Great recommendation. Will be back. Food outstanding
Everything about the restaurant was excellent. The staff couldn't have been more friendly. Al in all a great experiemce.
The service was very bad. The waitress actitud was very poor. The food was nothing spectacular.
I went following a Time Out review but found it underwhelming...The service was excellent, food was average, no ambiance, a bit too touristy. I wouldn't return.
Second visit. Great if you like good steak and chips!!

The set menu meal was delicious and very well executed. Food came quickly and fresh. Good location and house wine. I would recommend it for sure.

I was a bit disappointed with the initial service - we arrived with a booking but had trouble getting anyone's attention so we were waiting to be seated for 5-10 minutes.
Rushed but good. Not epicurean's dream just a typical Frenchy steak and fr√Ætes.

Food was amazing. Beautifully presented and set my taste buds alight! The fallow deer, hot/cold oyster (oyster ice cream was SO delicious) and partridge were a few of the memorable dishes on the tater menu. Our evening was topped off with a chat with Jason Atherton at our table.  Will definitely be back!
An outstanding restaurant on every Level. A very special evening.

My first proper meal out since before lockdown and what a treat! Wonderful to see Pollen Street open again and so much thought and care has gone into this reopening. Jason Atherton was busy cooking at the chef‚Äôs table and all the staff were welcoming, friendly and professional. The new 4 course menu concept was superb in every way and the addition of canap√©s and other treats between courses were delicious and creative. Noteworthy dishes were the John Dory fish course and both the desserts we tried - a hazelnut financier and a zingy lemon dessert.
Very enjoyable with excellent service

I was disappointed with our meal here.  For a very expensive restaurant, I was frankly disappointed with the service which felt more Nandos than Michelin star.  There was no attentiveness or warmth from our waiter, who although visibly busy, did not take any time to explain the dishes, and put the plates and cutlery down with force and at one point I had to stop a knife rolling off the table.  A smashed wine glass (it happens), and too many dessert courses on the tasting (4 in total with petit fours), where an additional savoury dish would have been warranted, left us feeling underwhelmed.  I am surprised this has a Michelin star with such service on offer.  Would not recommend or return.
Excellent experience throughout. Fine dining at its best
Excellent experience - loved the cheese & tea trolleys! Would recommend a price list with the champagnes on offer

Absolutely amazing food! My friend and I went for lunch. We took the set menu with accompanying wine, it was superb. Many little appetisers and petit-fours are added, which make the whole experience very pleasurable. Can only highly recommend this restaurant.
Excellent food, drink and service. Innovative presentation.

Fabulous food, attentive but not over stuffy service and lovely little extras. The amuse bouche was so impressive; a take on the british afternoon tea and a wonderful palate cleanser before dessert. My Ox Cheek main was spectacular as was my mum's Lemon Sole. This place is great for a special occasion and a real treat!
The tasting menu was worth the money given the number of dishes. Having tried their lunch previously, felt that the tasting menu had a slight lack of variety (many dishes uses ice).

I think the phrase 'pretentious,moi?' applies perfectly here.  Think nouvelle cuisine and loadsamoney and you will get what I mean.  Food was good but worth the money? Not so sure. Portions small. Wine expensive. Waiters obsequious. Just no.

This is my favourite restaurant.  The food, as you would expect, is always beautifully presented with some really complex and interesting flavours.  Favourite this time was the scallops with jalape√±o granita (cool and refreshing with just the right amount of heat at the end) we chose the tasting menu which was kindly adapted to suit pescatarian diet.  Each course was delicious and you really should try the oyster ice cream (even if you don‚Äôt like oysters) it delivers a true taste of the sea.  The team at Pollen Street are professional and discrete but also delivered a really fun evening - interacting with us and sharing some laughter where appropriate.  They are extremely knowledgeable about the food and always ready to answer questions.  The sommelier was an absolute star - happily guiding our wine choice around price point and tastes.  We had a truly wonderful evening and will certainly be returning soon.  I wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to recommend this restaurant (or others in the ‚Äúsocial‚Äù family)
It was great. Staff was super nice and helpful. Food was good too

I visited Pollen street Social after my son recommended it to me and my wife. Lovely atmosphere and really nice food. There was however a very long wait for the dessert which was fundamentally just ice cream but the waiter deducted this from the bill because of the inconvenience.
Enjoyable experience, in a simple but stylish decor and the food won‚Äôt disappoint!

Absolutely outstanding food, service & ambience. I dined here for lunch, it was lovely. Extremely good value if you have the set menu but the a la carte is reasonably priced. The food was superb and I very much look forward to returning.

I had high expectations, having been to Maze when Jason Atherton was head chef there. My expectations weren't met. It wasn't terrible, but wasn't great either, to be honest.

Our table was booked for 9.30pm, which was quite late, of course. Despite that, we didn't get to our table until closer to 10pm, which wasn't a big issue, but I expected a bit more attention from the waiting staff as a result, perhaps.

We ordered two bottles of wine to go with the 9 course tasting menu. The first was white and I said to the wine waiter that we'd drink that with the first part of the menu as it was mostly fish. I wanted to move on to the red when the meat courses started arriving. Despite this, our glasses were not refilled very often and I even had to ask for a passing waitress to find my wine for me - which, of course, wasn't on my table, so we couldn't help ourselves.

The food was ok, but again didn't meet our high expectations. Something called fish and chips was a fishy tasting mouse inside a puffed up bit of potato starch. It looked impressive and different, but didn't taste great and the puffed up potato starch stuck to my teeth.

The lamb dish was was really good. The rabbit was good too. Some of the fish dishes were not really my thing, but were ok. We enjoyed the ice cream course which was a number of blobs of ice cream presented in a box with lids and you had to guess the flavour. That was fun and the flavours were very nice.

Finally, the restaurant was very noisy. We couldn't hold a conversation without leaning in constantly.

I'd like to visit again one day, but perhaps in a different season.
This is an outstanding restaurant with creative modern cuisine in an informal setting. Food was incredible and the service spot on!
Delicious food. For a lunch the service was a little slow and chaotic, different waiters back and forth etc, nicer to have a point man and quicker courses. Food itself was first class however.

They tried to redeem themselves when clear going off the the rails. Beef spectacular but initial service bad - 30 minutes wait for a drink and to give order. My husband's lamb was indifferent and the replacement fish dish was so salty it was virtually inedible. Offers of cheese and some free drinks still didn't make up for the overall experience being poor at a birthday meal for my daughter. Wouldn't go back.

Pollen St Social did not disappoint. I am a long term fan of Jason Atherton having followed him since the Maze days. This is a great night out. Outstanding food presented beautifully. Great service, friendly and unstuffy - but 'on it'. Inevitably, for Mayfair it is expensive - but you get what you pay for.

Wine/drinks are very expensive - I always wish restaurants at this level would cut us a bit of slack. It might encourage customers back on a more regular basis - and also encourage diners who would love to experience the food - but are priced out of the experience by the drinks mark up.
Great food and ambience with a superb wine list. Highly recommend for lunch or dinner

My lunch at Pollen Street was outstanding in every way.  The food was exquisite, as was the service.  (Waitstaff composed trays of food at breakneck speed and managed to shift gears before reaching the table and make the serving calm and gracious.  I take my hat off to them.  And, of course, to the chef!  This is far and above my favorite part of my trip to London.
We went on a Fridya night for a special occasion and had a fantastic experience, expensive but worth it.

We had a drink at the bar to start and I would definitely recommend the PJB cocktail.  The bar staff were really friendly and attentive.  We were then shown to our table and greeted by the matre de who gave us his recommendations and explained everything to us.  He suggested we finish our meal at the desert bar where we could watch them being made.  The ambience of the whole restaurant was busy but very well serviced and every person from waiters to chefs could not do enough for us.  The food was exceptional and ending the meal sitting at the bar talking to the desert chef and finding out about the food and watching how they prepared it was a perfect ending. We would definitely go back and had a wonderful time.
Excellent choise

The food is good but terribly expensive, and fails to provide that "WOW" moment you would expect from such an institution.

Service is fine but the waiters seem so obsessed about abiding by the highest standards of etiquette that they forget the simple things, like a friendly smile.

The positives remain the overall presentation, restaurant decor, and the high quality of ingredients used.

Briefly, Pollen St. Social is overrated and would not a recommend to a friend.

Second time at this restaurant.  First time I felt too formal but this time just hit the right balance.   Amazing combinations of flavours and everything worked.   Love the experience and also worth sitting at the dessert bar for desserts and you can get a good view into the main kitchen then also.
Probably the best choclate dessert I have eaten. Great food, wonderful staff and a great experience overall.

Great meal, somewhat slow service (for the speed we wanted) but high quality knowledge by staff when they arrived. We moved to the dessert bar and had a fantastic view of the kitchen whilst eating sumptious "mini ice creams". Observing the care and attention the staff took preparing the dishes; rejecting lamb cutlets that were not perfect, care in the final presentation turned it for me. The boss was there too, "managing by wandering around". Try it, you won't regret it.
This meal was incredible - so many surprises! It was my birthday and even in a busy restaurant they made me feel special
Had a wonderful meal at the restaurant, very good and innovative food. Service good but a bit slow.

This restaurant is centrally located & easy to find. We had an 8-course tasting menu & the portion sizes were just right so we didn't leave feeling completely stuffed. The food was inventive, creative & delicious. The only issue we had was that it took a very long time for our main course to come and we were forgotten at the end of the meal & had to flag a waiter down ask for coffee. Overall a great restaurant.

My wife and I ate here for dinner last weekend. Overall experience was very good but the place is trying too hard to compete with other places that are similarly priced (but better: Ledbury comes to mind). Venison starter was very good, scallop sashimi was fine (have had better at ordinary NY sushi places). Filet very good, pigeon very good, but neither that much more special than what you can get for almost half the price at places like Hereford Road (etc) for a bit less ambience. Wine list extensive but very overpriced, even for the area. I buy a lot of wine for my cellar and dine out with clients but this list was absurd. Saving grace is the bar, super cocktails and very friendly bartenders! We will be back, but to the bar not to eat...

Amazing experience! We ate at the kitchen counter and had a great time, eating lovely food with perfect wine pairing. The sommelier, the waiter and the chef were really available and we spent almost 4 hours over there. I highly recommend this place!
Lovely service throughout, good value set lunch menu.
Absolutely stunning menu, fantastic food and great service!
Good food, very nicely presented. Service is excellent.
Fantastic service and food was outstanding - only slightly negative to the meal was the restaurant was very warm and uncomfortable at times but not a distraction from the meal itself
Slow service but delicious menu.

Food was very good but the service was so bad from start to finish it almost ruined the night.
I was phoned several times to confirm the booking and when I called to confirm I asked to change the time and was assured this was possible and changes had been made. Arrived with my guests to be told no changes had been made and there was no table but we could be seated at the bar. We were then forgotten about. Waited ages for our wine, food came without the sauce, food was pretty cold by the time sauce came, side dish was ordered but never arrived (but was still on the bill!) coffees also half forgotten and went cold while waiting for rest of party to be served. They also gave us someone else's coats and couldn't find ours- we had to go searching for them. No apologies for any of this and, as is often the case, it would seem they were doing us a favour by serving us at all.Really embarrassing as I had taken friends who live abroad, are used to the best restaurants, and I hardly ever see- bar seats made conversation almost impossible.
The food was very good and the restaurant looked good, but the mix-up over the table, and poor service meant the whole experience was really disappointing.
We really enjoyed ourselves and would recommend to anyone.

The service was impeccable and made the evening. Friendly, helpful staff, and a very knowledgeable sommelier. We went for the tasting menu, which was delicious, and surprisingly substantial. A lovely evening.

Fantastic lunch!
Staff were very attentive, with topping drinks up and descriptions of food when placed on table.
Very affordable set lunch menu.
Would highly recommend.

Food was very good, but the whole experience was rushed. To the point that we declined any dessert because the waitress told us we needed to hurry up. The 2 hour table slot is ridiculous if you want to enjoy your dinner and not be rushed.

The lighting was very bad with a bright spot light right above us. We were asked by 3 separate staff members if we want to place our order in the space of 5 minutes or less. Then later on we had to pour our own wine because the service all but disappeared.

The wine, for ¬£70 for a bottle was average when it should have been much better for that price. Won‚Äôt hurry back.

Only plus was the food which was very good so well done kitchen staff.

You can always rely on this place for fantastic food in a relaxed atmosphere.  I took someone who had never been before (and eats out a lot) and he exclaimed that the octopus starter was the best he'd ever eaten.  I agree, it was sublime.

Very rare to have your taste buds having an adventure outside Asian and Latin American cuisines.   The chefs here really understand flavour and have managed to create fireworks w/o resorting to powerful Eastern spices. Truly wonderful culinary experience and the setting is inviting too. Cut above all

We went on a Monday for a quick lunch, we sat down asked for some water but it never came. When it get to our food, the starters were great however the main (pork) it was just okay, the favours were too heavy for our taste. There weren't so many people there on a Monday, I guess that's why they only had 2 staffs there, the service was horrible, nobody came to collect our bill for 15 minutes. I would not go back there or recommend you unless you have a whole afternoon to be wasted and like being ignored.

All dishes were very inventive and extremely tasty. That however got to a point where the taste and all the saltiness were a little bit too much. One of the dishes ordered was the 60day aged steak. While again every ingredient was prepared to perfection, the steak was unfortunately completely indigestible and left my partner knocked out for the next day. Otherwise very funky and airy venue with very attentive service.

I have been fortunate to have eaten in some superb establishments including all of Jason Atherton's London restaurants and this is my favourite. It is right in every way, ambiance, food, service and price. You MUST try the mushrooms in a bag... I could eat that every day!
A great time had by all, thank you.

Good and Refreshing place to go--dinner or lunch


Menu can be a bit quirky but the flavourings are impressive. Wine list is good and service is attentive yet not intrusive.

Have been there a few times. I prefer its ambience to Pollen Street Social

The room is all dark tones - sets the stage for a certain feeling.   Pet peeve - the tables are close together so if you are seated next to other diners - well, prepare to eaves drop.   However - we went late so had the table on either side empty.   The wine list is plentiful - a bit shy on new world Reds but we found one that was great.   The server pointed out some favorites and all were either interesting or delish.   Not sure I'd rush back - but glad I went.
One of the best places to eat and drink (fabulous cocktails and great wine list) in London.
A fantastic evening, food, service, venue, staff ... just wonderful.
The food was fabulous attentive waiting staff and a great atmospher, really can't complain
We had a great meal - very buzzy atmosphere and the food was sublime. The best meal we have had in London for ages. Would recommend this highly restaurant!

The friendly, speakeasy welcome worked for me and the faux clandestine suspension of belief fitted very well with a post theatre visit dinner after watching the very enjoyable 'curious incident of the dog in the night' which I found out later had been played by the understudy in the role of Christopher the 15 year old asperges maths genius....it was brilliant.

....so was dinner....like the play our original server started unconvincingly but improved when the supporting actors entered stage left to lift the performance...Lewis the sommelier turned out to be an ex-colleague of my superior palleted dining date and after a lesson on Armenian vineyard slopes (which I loved) sold us a nice bottle of Italian rose of Sangiovese grape

Great dinner
Great lunch on the last day of the restaurant
Outstanding restaurant! I‚Äôve never had one complaint, I choose this place to take most of my clients, I‚Äôve had Birthday celebrations, Christmas Lunches in here! Just great place!

This is not our first visit to Foxlow Soho. Service was friendly and efficient - the one lady being particularly charming. Thankfully a loud table was just finishing as we arrived so we were spared any annoyance from that, and so the ambience was perfect.
Flat-iron steak ordered all round were excellent - with just one maybe a little over-salted - cooked to our likings. Short list of dessert options all looked great, although they didn't have all available. Sticky toffee pudding was nice but not the best apparently, and the Elvis sundae (with bacon bits) sounded intriguing enough to try but would be an acquired taste!
Overall great and recommended but could have been even better!
Went for a quick catch up with a mate. Great Rib-eye and a decent wine selection. The service was really attentive and freindly and overall a good meal experience.

Overpriced, under managed, chaotic but empty. Asked for a rare sirloin, came well done. Chips over salted & cold. Calamari was good shame about the rest. Malbec slightly corked. No uniform for staff so no idea who to ask for help. Would never book again.
Very reliable meal with delicious vegetarians options

Not impressed with open table. Turned up to a restaurant that wasn‚Äôt even open anymore!

Not happy and ruined my client evening.
Incredible! Steak and Wine at its very best!

Been to MASH over 50 times over the years and usually it is excellent. However on Saturday the service was dreadful. We waited 45 minutes for our table (despite it being a reservation) and were only seated after we chased the server twice. The server then took us to the table without bringing our drinks over. The waiter we had failed to tell us about the specials and overall the service was slow and inattentive. The waiter then had the audacity to complain when we asked for the ¬£45 service charge to be removed due to how poorly they looked after us.

Lovely setting and great ambience. Service very good and attentive although a little quick - perhaps because we arrived at opening time and it was fairly quiet. Cannot fault the good one of the best steaks I‚Äôve ever had albeit quite expensive.
Stumbled across MASH, via Timeout, for a pre-theatre meal and was not disappointed. Incredible food, great value and a stunning venue.
Fabulous food , wine and service in an amazing setting. Very much worth the visit

Food ok but not as good as it should have been for the price. Staff were diffident and service generally poor.
Won't be coming back in a hurry
Excellent food and wonderful service.  A busy Sat night, great atmosphere and we thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience
The place is really great. From the outside you would never know how big the restaurant is below and it's a stunning room. Great place for steak.

Very unique London Steak place.  Offers beef from 4 continents.  Menu varies from ultra premium steaks to gourmet hamburger as well as non steak and meat options.  Service was extraordinary and the atmosphere has a cool sort of hip vibe.

This is the fourth time I've been to MASH and as usual the food didn't disappoint. I shared the porterhouse with a friend which was nicely cooked and presented. The 50% off steaks deal was also welcome as it made it much better value for money - MASH is on the pricey side but I would still put it as one of my top 3 steak houses in London. It also has a very well stocked bar for pre/post dinner drinks, including a good cocktail menu!
The only negative I would point out from this visit was the service which didn't seem up to their usual standard. Service by our waiter was very rushed and he seemed almost put out when we asked for things such as extra water etc.
Aside from that it was an enjoyable meal and I would certainly recommend to steak lovers!

Service was fantastic. We had tartare and meat board to start, both great, followed by the tomahawk to share with fries and corn with bacon. Will skip the corn and bacon next time but everything was delicious. Had a few beers and an amazing key lime pie with a sherry for dessert. Very cool on the inside but was a bit quiet. Didn't feel rushed at all and was overall a great experience.
Outstanding food, service and scenery. Love this place!

My steak was served cold on a hot plate and the chips tasted as if they were cooked in yesterday's oil. For a premiere steak house this was very poor indeed. Watch out Harvester you have competition!

Such a shame. A wonderful bar but that does not make up for the very poor food. In future I'll stick to Goodmans or The Hawksmoor. Both are far superior without having to try too hard.
Excellent steak and attentive service. Sumptuous interior.

This is not a complaint....it was brilliant beef ! I only eat beef occasionally but when I do I want it to be the best....the fillet steak was quite delicious and long with the wine recommendation. I would never have chosen the house red zinfandel....but after tasting it....it paired beautifully. The chunky chips were some of the best I had ever eaten.
The pepper corn sauce was great too but I was expecting a creamier version with green pepper corns.

celebrating a birthday, Mash was something different.
Food good, atmosphere great.
Felt there could have been more staff, had to wait for attention a couple of times.
Enjoyable but quite expensive
We had pre theatre meal excellent value and delicious

Service impeccable. Ambiance excellent. Set menu sounded wonderful but food was disappointing. Artichoke soup very thin and not quite hot enough. Cod had delicious flavours but the fish itself was over cooked. Good puddings and coffee.
Service was really slow albeit very polite. Food was okay. Been to several HIX restaurants, this one may have just been having a bad day.
Delicious meal! Quite different selection of food - we had to ask what quite a few items were üòÇ very attentive waiter. Loved the gurnard!
2 prawn cocktail starters and 1 squid. Good start! 2 of us shared the Porthouse and found that excellent. Staff very friendly and not at all stuffy!  Bar downstairs buzzy and nicely lit.
Perfect lovely beautiful great, coming back for MY birthday
Great restaurant and food. Service was rather sporadic. Worst thing is the pesky calls you get from opentable if you book through them

My food was excellent. My wife's food was very poor - prawn cocktail was very basic and average at best. Her main course of some kind of breaded chicken was extremely dry. We asked for gravy but this never came. The staff recognised this and gave us free coffee. Most disappointing. The ambience was nice but we felt crammed in between tables of other couples so it was not a very private meal. It certainly felt like our personal space was invaded. Sorry, but we won't be back.

I would highly recommend Hix Soho, our food was incredible, the service was excellent and the meal was brilliant value. We took advantage of the pre theatre menu before a train home up north and we weren't disappointed. There was a limited selection of only 3 choices for each course but can honestly say was some of the best food I have ever eaten. The bar downstairs was also a great experience, it had a really nice vibe and was quirky, serving  great cocktails. The only negative about the experience was that the tables were a bit close together which I found a bit awkward when you are dinning as a couple and have another couple so close but it didn't dampen the overall experience
We booked a post theatre dinner for 4 people.  The staff were friendly and attentive and didn't hurry us.  The food was unusual and very good.  I would recommend Hix.

Our evening started in the downstairs bar - all good, a great space, and delicious Old Fashioned. A hit.
The evening started to go a miss when I discovered the female toilets were out of order. I was told to queue outside the only toilet in the entire establishment and which opened directly into the dining area. A miss.
The food was really very nice, although I must admit to being fairly perplexed to find a chicken and hen fat dish at the top of the vegetarian menu......
The service and ambience was not quite hitting the spot, I guess it should be all about the food, but the result was actually an uncomfortable experience.

We have eaten at several other HIX restaurants - but this was by far the best experience.
Yes, the wine is very expensive but the food is of excellent! You do not have to buy whole bottles, so the carafes may be a better choice.
The tables are very close together, so if you are sitting next to another a couple - you may be able to hear everything they are saying!!
I would recommend the Barnesly chop - fabulous and tasty!

If you haven't eaten a Mark Hix roast chicken, then the best chicken of your life is just one reservation away. It's their signature dish, and apparently what made them famous in a challenging restaurant scene. Order it before you hand in your coats, as it takes 50 minutes to prepare. The rest of the menu is good to great, and the ambience has buzz in spite of being somewhat industrial. Downstairs bar is worth a visit and serves cocktails made to centuries' old British recipes. I had to wait half an hour for a reserved table, but this only happened once of the many reservations I have made.

Really enjoyed lunch at Hix, Soho. Even at noon the atmosphere was interesting and buzzy providing a great backdrop to the various conversations. Menu offered great choices and we sampled several starters as well as enjoy maincourse; of particular note was the curried parsnip soup - just the right amount of heat; smoked salmon delicious (only small criticism not offered any lemon/freshly ground black pepper and meagre bread); prawn cocktail was raved about; and the pork scratchings (you have to like them!) were apparently divine! Lamb was also tried and said to be very well cooked, flavoursome and good portion size. service bit hit and miss but overall very good restaurant with great atmosphere.

The food was very good with the exception of my fish fingers, which had less taste or character than the Birdseye fish fingers I used to give to my kids. Shame on you! The ambient noise level was so great that conversation was difficult to the point of being painful (it was a great relief to move on to the Criterion). But my cold pea and borage soup was superb.
Could not believe how bad the food was given the price. The wine was nice but that has little to do with them. Definitely not going back.
this is a great place to come for lunch as you can go healthy (even Dukan friendly due to the lovely selection of fish and meat) or comfort food. It was quick and has a great atmosphere.
The service was fantastic, the staff were really attentive and quick. The bar and cocktails are superb as well. Only downside is the food is fairly average for the price
Amazing value for money- amazing service.
Yes, good restaurant for Sunday lunch. Fresh tasting food. Could do with a greater selection of cheaper wine.
Wonderful food and great service.
A perfect dining experience. The flavors and the service were impeccable.
Very enjoyable. The food was very yummy! Washrooms were a touch scary.
Great service, extremely friendly staff, a bit too noisy for my personal liking, only tried some starters which were good, and dessert which was great.
The food and service were really excellent. We'll probably come again next time we are in London.
Amazing food and such good service highly recommend
Looking for an unpretentious fresh food treat backed by great service and good wine matching advice? Look no further.

My husband and I are aficionados of Ottolenghi's cookbooks and decided to make a reservation during our visit to London. The meal was spectacular. We ordered one "main" and a number of small plates, and the server came up with a sequence that made the meal multi-dimensional. Each dish was just packed with interesting flavors (we had aubergine with pomegranate, courgette fritters, a chickpea pancake, prawns with feta, and beef short ribs). The dessert was exquisite. All in all, one of the great meals of a lifetime, and one of the best things was that we did not feel heavy afterwards. Truly memorable!
We didn't like the menu not a lot of choice and it was very over priced for what you got.  Place was nice inside but very noisy.  Sorry wont be going again.
True Ottolenghi experience with amazing flavours and surprising combinations using only vegetables.
Delicious food as always. Exiting combination of flavours - every dish was special!

It was a fantastic experience with very nice and passionate staff, great service and excellent food.
Coming from Belgium, having looked forward to Nopi, it absolutely exceeded even my expectations.

We booked in advance , slight delay in getting our table, great communication, very polite and friendly staff. We were given a free round of drinks. The food and service was amazing, all the dishes we ordered were delicious, cannot recommend this restaurant enough. Especially the polenta chips and beetroot cheesecake . Only slight issue was the toilets are badly designed,  awkward and confusing.
Fabulous food, fabulous service. Wonderful place. I will definitely go back and would recommend highly
Again, a good lunch experience. Tasty food, nice service, value for money. Unfortunately extremely loud.
Our trip to NOPI far exceded our expectations! The food was fabulous, the staff were warm, friendly, knowledgeable and attentive. We WILL be back!

A unique sensory overload ... in the most wonderful way!
We came from Melbourne Australia & it was my partner‚Äôs birthday!
The waitress was excellent too!
Good food and service but some dishes a little pricey, ¬£6 for half a little gem lettuce!

As Ottolenghi fans (from the cookbooks), we had high expectations. The food met them all - it was truly excellent!  It was unfortunate that the restaurant was rather noisy and that the music, which didn't seem to have much added value, only caused people to talk even more loudly. The dishes followed one another in a bit too rapid of a tempo, as if the waiters were instructed to get everyone seated and out again within a strict time frame. The hustle and bustle made it hard to relax and really enjoy, and robbed us of the opportunity to give the food the conversational credit it deserved, before the next dish appeared on the table.  I'd definitely recommend NOPI because of the food, but if you want relaxed dining, it may not be your thing.

When we arrived at NOPI, I was expecting big things. On the website it made it seem that upstairs NOPI was a formal restaurant, however it was just like any other restaurant but so crammed that we were closer to other tables than to each other and so couldn‚Äôt hear.

We were given the lunch menu and were told it was also the dinner menu, however we were surprised at the lack of options and also the price for a cold tapas plate that the waiters served up.

The food was tasty, but basic. The waiters were great however.

Unfortunately we were really disappointed, especially as we are big followers of Ottolenghi, we expected more.

While my guest was not overwhelmed by the menu, he loved everything they served!  The use of spices and herbs make each dish unique and tasty -- and the ability to order several dishes for the table provides a great range of flavors.  Can't wait to return.
Always a great experience. The food is all about flavour above everything else. And the service is human and friendly.
Lovely afternoon at Nopi, great for afternoon tea with the ladies.
Had expected a better experience of the food but it's still a beautiful restaurant with great staff.

Whilst the food was very good, interesting mixes of flavours and textures, I'm afraid the service let it down.
We were seated swiftly but then the receptionist hadn't informed the waitress so we were left without menu's or tap water for a good 10 minutes.
Our waitress was a little distracted throughout our service and questions we had about the menu were met with rudeness.
This is not a cheap place to eat and whilst I am happy to pay for such good food I really think the service also needs to be at the same level, especially as the service charge is automatically added to the bill.
Spicy hamachi rolls were very small, chuck norris roll was tasty but small for its $16 price tag. Cold noodles were something anyone could have made.

First impressions do count and on entering the restaurant one is immediately impressed by the layout and decor. The front of house staff are courteous, friendly and very efficient.
We chose to select a number of the smaller dishes and I would suggest 5-6 is ample (especially for lunch).
Each dish was delicious, the fish was cooked superbly, as was the pork belly and the accompanying vegetables/pulses etc more than complimented the food experience.
The service was just right too. Our waiter gave good suggestions and was very attentive.
this was our second visit and, unusually for us with any restaurant, we would go back a third time!

I am loath to write anything critical about NOPI, as it is a great restaurant serving great food in a very pleasant, West End location. We've been before and will go again. But, this week the service was not quite as good as it has been - we had to wait 20 minutes for a booked 2.00pm table, no-one asked us in that time if we wanted a drink; and then they forgot to bring one of the drinks (after we swapped the oddly cloudy prosecco for clear champagne). The situation was well-retrieved (and we didn't have to pay for our drinks, which was kind) but it set an apologetic tone that altered the staff/customer relationship. Just a Christmas glitch, hopefully.

That said, the food was - as ever - quite excellent. Delicate flavours, not too much nor too little, served in an order determined by the knowledgable waiter, no rush; lovely. The sea bream, twice-roasted chicken, the mix of beans, augerbines, all spectacular! The polenta chips were not to our taste (and bit bland and pappy) but one 'miss' isn't bad!

We'll be back.

The menu is similar to the eponymous Ottolenghi in Islington, to my taste the most interesting food in London, Mediterranean fusion, super fresh.  I didn't like the groovy techno music added at Nopi, but the stylish bathrooms are amazing!
Popped in for brunch date before some Sunday shopping. Service was great; attentive without being intrusive.
Excellent food and service. Exotic, yet familiar. Key to Nopi is a blend of charm and relaxed waiting combined with exceptionally well prepared, luxery food. Highly recommended!

we went to Nopi for sunday lunch. the food was delicious. the aircondition in the restaurant was to cold so we were freezing which made our stay not so comfortable. sorry for my english... kind regards natalie, switzerland

Nopi isn't cheap but if you keep to the sharing veggie dishes then it's a wonderful dining experience at an affordable price. This was my third lunch time visit and it never disappoints. Anything with aubergine is worth having in my book! SoMe dishes need lots of  seasoning, particularly the burrata. House white wine is lovely.   It's always busy so the ambience is lively and a little noisy. I'm a big fan of all the Ottolenghi eateries (and the cookbooks) so maybe I'm a bit biased.

Totally overrated. Canteen style restaurant that looks like a fast food place. food is unspectacular and you wouldn't even talk about it without all the hype around the guys who run the place. even the Jerusalem and nopi cookbooks are only ok but not more than this. just forget about all this.
Fine dining in lively Soho. Outstanding service and superb food. Great staff.
Beautiful food as you expect from Ottolenghi, The downside was that you felt like being on a conveyor belt. This is clearly a business to make money and not one to allow the costumer to relax.

A group of four of us had lunch at Nopi last Friday.  The food was all delicious.  The sweets were all good.  The staff were helpful and the best thing was that we didn't feel hurried at all as the restaurant doesn't appear to close in the afternoon.  I would definitely return.

I took my veggie friend to Nopi, to see what was all the fuss about.

Venue was great. Wonderful decor. But we forgot to check the bathrooms. :-) We ordered the first 6 veggie small plates, that were more than enough for both of us. It was a bit of a hit and miss. 2-3 plates were outstanding. The others were average. I will not go into details.

The service was good. But nothing to tell home about. She delivered the first cold starter and then she forgot about us, which was nice because we wanted to have a great time on our own. When the waitress returned, she returned with 5 dishes in a row, so we asked her to deliver them in two stages to make the most of the rather small table space. :-)

At ¬£70 + wine for 6 small veggie dishes, I am not sure this is good value for money, but it was a nice experience, nevertheless.

The menu isn't in the traditional format but the staff are more than happy to explain how you order. Loved the food, in particular the smokey flavoured stuff such as the smoked aubergine. Also got to try yuzu for the first time and it was worth the wait. Overall it wasn't heavy on the carbs which for me is a good thing. Also not heavy on meat dishes, which I think is Ottolenghi's style, but you really will appreciate the flavour in your vegetables.
A stylishly decorated restaurant. White and clean looking. A relaxed atmosphere. Didn't notice the obligatory talking loud in restaurants tables as I was enjoying my food too much. At least until you get up to leave.
A quick note for the ladies. Informed by my girlfriend the ladies toilet is full of angled mirrors and you can't avoid views of your own backside. The gents is also full of mirrors of different angles but it's not the same. Ladies be prepared!
I took my girlfriend here on a Sunday afternoon. It's was sensational and the interior  is absolutely stunning yet simple.
Great tasting food with interesting range of flavours. Top class dessert and service to match.

I took my Wife here for her Birthday as she loves to eat Tapas style .... The food was GREAT; every dish was mouth-wateringly flavoursome and we couldn't pick a favourite. A great atmosphere too....This place has just jumped into my top 5 of all time only just behind some top-end Michelin star restaurants! Cannot recommend it enough....
A magnificent feast of colour taste and flavour which we enjoyed very much. We tried food we had never had before and it was delicious.

We have been to Nopi a few times and have always had a great time. The food is incredible so we were looking forward to another Ottolenghi experience BUT..... the music was completely inappropriate to the ambience. It would have been fine if we were heading off afterwards to a club but looking around at the demographic I cant imagine anyone would have been checking out the nearest hotspot. Then the service was officious, totally impersonal and it seemed they couldn't wait until we had put our forks down for them to whip away our plates - no such opportunity to mop up the last bits of amazingness with your bread!! Sadly the fantastic food was overshadowed by the craziness of the music and waiting staff.
Normally faultless, but poor service this time. Shame. Shakshuka was still excellent.

Only disappointing thing about our experience at NOPI was expecting a pre-theatre dinner and being told they don't do them on a Saturday. In all honesty though this did us a favour as my boyfriend and I were able to try more dishes and it was definitely worth the additional cost. I didn't expect the food to be as good as it was so it was a really nice surprise. The dinner was not cheap but I don't mind paying more for a good quality dinner.

The service was good and as I have a nut allergy the waitress was brilliant at checking with the chefs.

All in all I would recommend this restaurant!

Really enjoyed the evening meal we had upstairs at NOPI....we were a party of three and we had a whole bunch of sharing plates (note - not very big!). Loved the ball like things, the green beans with mushrooms thing, and enjoyed the eel. The desserts were pretty good too - my financier was a generous portion with gorgeous Grand Marnier cream thing. Good service, friendly welcome, no fuss or bother. Three of us and one bottle of wine came to ¬£131. Note the wine list is very expensive!
Great tapas-style dishes - every dish a celebration of flavours. Friendly atmosphere and attentive waiters. Go if you love food and can afford to.

I was looking forward to taking my wife to NOPI, having heard so much about Ottolenghi. The food and wine were very good as we expected, but we were let down by poor service. After our waitress took our desert order she simply vanished, and we were left waiting for over half an hour before I was able to request the bill from her. Even at this stage she was rather sluggish in making this happen. I should add that the restaurant at this stage (10.30pm on Saturday) was by no means full. As we had another engagement to attend we were left rather frustrated by this holdup at the end of the meal. We were left with the feeling that our waitress had not really completed her job on our table, and as such I wont be recommending this restaurant
It was the third time I'd had dinner there and the food was exquisite. The service was excellent and dining upstairs has the perfect balance between buzz and space.

We had a 2pm booking for lunch so the service was beginning to flag a little HOWEVER the food is so good it doesn't matter a bit! Wonderful fresh seasonal ingredients prepared with imagination and panache. It is noisy because of all the hard surfaces and the 'ladies' is just bizarre... what ever happened to function over form in design? I regularly eat here and at the original Ottolenghi and I hope the appearance of "main courses" on the menu doesnt herald a change in the approach.
Do try the savoury cheesecake,the duck, the pea and bean fritters and the stuffed courgette flowers, just sublime.

The food is fantastic, but there seems to be a problem with the coffees, they are always served warm, so they go cold really quickly! This is the 4th time I go and I have had warm (not hot) coffees over and over again.

I have been to Nopi on several occasions- business lunch, supper with my son and drop in with a friend. It perfectly fits all the bills. The staff are very friendly and efficient and the food is delicious. Would love some soup on the menu?
Outstanding food and a special treat.

As fan of Ottolenghi style of cooking. This is the best way to enjoy his cooking in the best way. Presentation is excellent & portions are perfect. Sharing your meal with all is the only way of dining. I will be back!

Absolutely fantastic. The food is truly out of this world - my second time but can't wait to return. Ladies loos are brilliant! Well done to whoever designed them, just wish other restaurants would follow suit.
I had lunch with 2 friends. I really liked the buffet-stle approach of ordering a number of dishes which then appeared in batches. All delicious and not over-filling.
Food was excellent. I enjoyed the tomatoes, tofu, pig's cheeks, scallops and crab. I was slightly disappointed with the quail which was not very interesting.

Fabulous atmosphere - love the white and gold combo - very clean, fresh and trendy. Friendly staff, who managed to talk us into an amazing dessert (the chocolate peanut brittle). The hummus/bread on arrival was to die for, and the dishes were unique and exciting. Be prepared to share food!

Ottolenghi in Islington is a favourite London restaurant so was very much looking forward to trying out this new venture. It was perfect for an evening out with a tourist friend. The food was wonderful, we particularly enjoyed the lamb belly, the service was attentive, enthusaistic and friendly, the wine good and the room light and airy. We ate upstairs but I'll be back in a group to dine round the big tables downstairs in view of the kitchen. My only quibble, and it might have been a mistake, was that despite the fact that a not insubstantial service charge had been added to the bill, we were asked if we wanted change when we paid. (We were due ¬£17 worth of change.)

We had a lovely time at Nopi for Saturday lunch. They were very accommodating as we brought our 9 month old baby and they gave us a table with plenty of space for the pram. Food was lovely-- churros for dessert was a definite highlight.
Excellent food, and the service was top notch!
