Fantastic food, very welcoming service. Slightly cramped downstairs - should have booked upstairs!

Beautyful Experience,

We had a very nice table around de kitchen between the stock, de Lamb was very full and rich of taste and had a nice crunchy crest.
And the braised chicory was a little sweet en had a nice bite.
It looked all beautiful and it was a very special occasion, the celebration of my husbands birhtday ( who passed away last year) with my three teenage kids.
So it was all extra special.

Thank you!

Sincerlery

Elles Bemelman
Holland

Elles Bemelman
Excellent dining experience. Staff superb nothing too much trouble

A great place for eating out. Could not be better. The only thing we did not like that much is the acoustic situation. Like in many other restaurants sound-damping was not an issue during the planning process. But the food is so extra-ordinary and the staff so friendly that the lack of good acoustics is a minor problem.

I came from Italy with my 17 years old nieces all the way to eat Ottolenghi's food. It was outstanding! a great experience! I hope to come back soon!
the waiters very friendly and helpful.
Mostly recommend!!!!
Fantastic service and great food. A memorable meal and oh the wines! They put us in the basement but it turned out to be great anyway.

I've been excited to visit one of ottolenghi restaurants for a while. Food was amazing and definitely worth the visit.
Website does say downstairs is informal.... I personally don't like sitting at one big table right next to others. Lovely restaurant though!

A data tactic meal. Creative and full of flavor. You can't go wrong at an ottolenghi restaurant. Lovely informal ambience in the downstairs able to see the kitchen and enjoy. Rebekah was an excellent server personable helpful and engaged it making our experience great. Can't wait to go back

We (Dutch and food lovers) were visiting London for a long weekend and were lucky to book a table downstairs at 6 p.m. on a saturday night. So we were permitted to stay till 8.
we started with a glas of champagne and a nice conversation with our neighbour guests, but were several times interupted by the (friendly) waitress for ordering our meals. We took about 3 to be shared dishes pro person and two starters. These starters were already taken away before we were able to finish it, and as it was very nice, we kindly asked to leave it on the table.
After 10 minutes or so everything was served all in one time exept for out meat, which was served 10 minutes after our first dish. WIthin 35 minutes after arriving everyting was finished exept for our deserts. As we like to enjoy our meals and conversations we asked if we could wait ordering our deserts which was said to be no problem, but after another 10 minutes we had all the stuff on the table again. In about 1,5 hour we were outside again, feeling that there was a constant rush in eating and ordering. The food was really good, but as we like to take our time for it I doubt if we ever come back here. It felt more like a tapas bar than a restaurant. So when you are in a hurry or like 'fast food' this is the right place to be.

Outstandingly creative and inventive cuisine with especially delicious vegetable dishes and rich desserts offering unique taste sensations. Extensive wine list. Impeccable service. Awful acidic espresso.
One downside is that the communal table isn't really communal, as every group tries hard to ignore the other diners at the table. What we found extremely uncomfortable was the arctic temperature in the basement dining area. Outside, it was a beautiful summer's day, but at NOPI Downstairs we had to put on pullovers, scarves and jackets in order not to end up frozen stiff.
Great ambience and the food was excellent. Loved that all the ingredients were stacked around us.

Another outstanding night of high quality food and service.  I took two friends from Oz who had only read about Ottolenghi but now they've tasted it for themselves.  Overwhelmingly lived up to all expectations.  Thank you, thank you, thank you to all at NOPI - again...!
The food was amazing. A taste explosion from the fresh herbs and combination. We enjoyed all the vegetarian dishes we ordered. We will come back for sure.

just the best food & service - ottolenghi at his finest. less formal downstairs, 2x communal tables, and great atmosphere with the kitchen in the background. everyone was interested in everyone else's plates of food! foodie heaven.
Ideally situated for a pre theatre nippy nosh, NOPI is just as freshly delicious and quirky as the main Ottolengi restaurant. Buzzy & fun with charmingly efficient staff.
It just doesn't get any better. Perfect tastes, wonderful service. Shhhhhh don't tell anyone!
I don't like the outstanding box lightly. I'm very picky. Right up my street. Fabulous food. Charming, informed service.

We went for afternoon tea and despite a couple of lovely sandwiches (tuna, caper and watercress was delicious) it was all a bit of a let down. They only gave us one scone to share between two, the "trifle" was a ramekin of cream with a strawberry on, and the mystery caramel tarts on tap tasted vaguely like coronation chicken. All a bit odd. They were very liberal with their prosecco which meant that we still felt like we had a nice time but gastronomically a let down.
I have been here before and great to see it is still the same. Great fresh food, love the service, lots to choose from. Nice ambiance and clean toilets. Great price.

We love the food at SO and this was no exception. Our favourite are the octopus, soft shell crab tempura and the aubergine.  We were tucked in a corner and the restaurant was busy so service was less attentive than usual. Food was up to its usual high standard, the overall ambience less so. But it won't stop us returning.

We have been to So for many years now. It is one of our favourite restaurant in town.
We love the food - excellent sashimi, and their hot food are so delicious as well.
Try the agetofu, and the Iberia pork which melts in your mouth, and their tempura is light and crispy.

This place serves up authentic Japanese cuisine with fresh ingredients! I absolutely adore the foie gras ju - I can't find it anywhere else and the flavours in the rice are absolutely delicious! The foie gras has a melt in mouth texture and the portions are quite generous! All the dishes I have tried have been maintained at a high standard and the service was decent!
SO restaurant is very much what we expected from a Japanese restaurant in Soho. The food was inventive and delicious, but the service was a little slow. Would go again.
Consistently excellent food at superb value

SO Restaurant, London: This is a very good Japanese restaurant. Friendly and efficient service. Very good and fresh food. Nice atmosphere. Pre-theater sushi menu is great and reasonably priced (¬£19.95 for miso soup, edamame, sushi and tempura). Don't go for sashimi menu if you're hungry. The desert was amazing! Black sesame ice cream and green tea cake. We will definitely go again.
Fantastic food, sake and ambience. My only comment would be that the tables were far too close together.
SO London serves some great sushi. Sit by the bar to watch the Japanese chefs mixing and cooling the rice and preparing dishes.
SO restaurant is centrally located and great value with TT 35% offer.  We had the cheapest and tastiest sushi for dinner last night.  Will definately go back.

The food, very innovative yet very authentic.
The serice, very efficient and friendly.
We took advantage of 25% off on a la carte menue and the moment the waiter brings the menu, he explained thoroughly how it works, which saved me embarrasment of having to ask for it. There were 3 of us, Japanese, English & Swiss, and all of us enjoyed the evening very much!

SO restaurant provided delicious Japanese cuisine at a good price.  Sadly the restaurant lacked atmosphere and we felt we were too noisy for the other diners which isnt as relaxing as we had hoped.  Quiet bite to eat for 2 and its perfect but not for groups.

I just loved the place! Food was just exquisite with lots of original ideas. I will definitely be back to try the others!
Atmosphere was relaxed - can be either casual jeans fashion to smart suits. Staff was attentive and although seem nervous was very polite.
I ordered a course which was delicious & good in volume and even without the 50% offer, it would have been work it for overall goodness of the place.
Our drinks were always being filled up which was great as bottomless brunch but not many options for food

Unfortunately it was a catalogue of errors at this restaurant - we arrived and they hadn't reserved enough seats for our group, so as a result we had to wait for them to reseat people in order for us to fit at the table.

From the menu, they had run out of all but one option - and that one and only meal available was a salad. This is unacceptable. We came out for dinner with friends ahead of Christmas and we ended up with only the option of ordering sandwiches.

As there was a limited number of staff (who often stood nearby texting on their phones or chatting instead of taking orders or bringing cutlery, sauces, food...) we had to wait a long time for our order to be taken, a long time for the food to arrive, and we had no other table service other than this - nothing.

One person in our group received their food after everyone else had finished, despite us ordering sandwiches and having chased the staff numerous times. When it arrived the order was incorrect and missing key ingredients as listed for the item on the menu. As a result we were told the sandwich would be removed from the bill, only we found that it hadn't been and we had to make a further complaint in order to have it removed.

Despite the above, when our bill arrived we found that a service charge had been added to our bill. I complained and said that we would not pay this in full considering the experience, but there was no apology. Instead the waiter laughed and said he completely understood why we wouldn't want to pay it. Completely inappropriate.

As we left we discovered that the least helpful and rudest waitress was in fact the "manager". She approached us to say we could have a free bottle of prosecco next time we visited. I won't be going back, but even if we did, they'll never fulfil this offer on a say so. It was pathetic. Too little, too late.

I'll be sending a complaint to the brewery that own this pub too. Shocking. What an embarrassment.
Favourite restaurant in Soho - everything is so delicious, setting is cosy and intimate, the service is friendly and attentive. You must go!

We were a party of 4 and were able to try most of the menu. Very distinctive tastes for each dish served. Incredibly delicious. An interesting interpretation of Turkish cuisine, not a remodeling of what exists but reinvention of combinations and styles.

The beer selection, the cocktails and the Turkish wine selection is also remarkable.

Very chilled atmosphere with the right volume of music.
Service was very efficient and friendly. The chef visited our table to greet us.

And the value for quality is fantastic! Very affordable prices.

Definitely recommend!
Really wonderful food and atmosphere. Excellent service. Beef ribs is one of the best dishes I have ever had. We will definitely come back next time we are in London.
Good enough but not special.

Since we are fans of Jamie Oliver we had a high expectation, but unfortunately the restaurant did not meet our expectation.
the appetizer was good, but the main dishes were not.

Food was really good, nice wine, shame about the poor service. Had to keep asking for cutlery, salt/pepper, took along time before we were even asked for a drink. Italian couple next to us were not happy about their service.
Food was only average- if at all.... Highly disappointed by the performance in terms of food.
Great food, great service, great location to get away from the maddening crowds of central London.

I loved the laid back feel the restaurant had, a perfect place for a catch up with friends or an easy quick dinner. Great value for money for good quality food, will be going back as there are things I didn't get to try on the menu. Service was amazing and no request was too much for them, although I am a meat eater, I thought the vegetarian platter was soooo good! I could go back for that alone, It feels like a grown up, well oiled nandos with the quarter, half and whole chicken options but that's where the similarities end. I will be recommending this place to others and I will be going back to try some more.

Lovely food, unique courses (10 of them, + 'snacks' and sweets). Great service in an opulent and glamorous (*but intimate) mirrored room.

Great for a special occasion, if you can get a booking before is closes (it's a pop-up only open for a few weeks).

When I booked this place I was hoping to have something to eat as well, but only stayed for drinks. I was not sure if we were expected for dinner. Anyway, we were not offered to move to a dining table after two hours so had drinks and left to find another restaurant.

While our waitress was fantastic- the food was very tasteless- the skin gravy tasted awful and I would not recommend it. The pulled chicken was tasty however but I found the food arrived very lack luster.

Paneer and pork kebabs are both delicious. Cocktails were also good. I was disappointed with the chicken liver donut. There was not enough chicken liver filling.
Overall a great tasty, satisfying meal.

Tea was amazing. 30+ selection and unlimited tea refills/ change. It was a Saturday with a pianist playing live. The ambiance was definitely nice. Our server, Marty, was very attentive and considerate. Great service.
The only problem I would say was the FOOD. For an afternoon tea set with 65 pounds per person, I was expecting better food than what they presented to us. We each had the queen classic set. The game pie was extremely dry. The toast for the 'unlimited' sandwiches was so dry. Though I would say they really did put some thought into the fillings. Was creative. Then, let's talk about pastries. Terrible colors was used due to the 'holiday theme'. Weird green frosting to represent a Christmas tree, and weird hot pink to decorate the cherry. The texture of it wasn't even close to what I pay for. The scones were amazing. Enjoy them while hot. Scones were probably the highlight of the entire set.

Overall, the value is pretty low but the experience was worthwhile. It really depends on what you're looking for I guess. But I think 65 pounds with what they presented was definitely a ripoff.
Took my granddaughter aged fourteen. She thought it was one of the most amazing things she has ever done.  The chocolate and toppings were to die for!
Amazing food and amazing restaurant! Definitely recommend a visit to 5 Social!

Saturday afternoon lunch away from the crowds. Great, chilled atmosphere with immaculate service and high quality food.
Fabulous

Been there for a lunch for 2,
It‚Äôs been a huge disappointment, i know that because of the area everything is overpriced but i was expecting something more than the experience we had.
Ordered the chicken(breast) uninspired
, slightly undercooked (some parts were pink), the mashed potatoes was allright, i can make better at home, my friend ordered a (tiny) cheeseburger, the waiter didnt asked if she wanted it rare medium rare etc, so the steak was all dry, poor quality of bun, average burger, only the cheese made the difference kind off... chips were frozen one, white as the ones from macdonalds, salad was the best point of the lunch, really fresh, usual vinaigrette, yes!
The decor is nice, half parisian/newyorker style, staff was polite and effective.
Save your money and go somewhere else.

Excellent food. Sister eatery to the more formal Social across the road but with a simpler, slightly lighter menu. Ate from the A La Carte menu -not cheap but well worth it. They also offer a Table d'Hote / fixed price menu. So nice to find an independent, high quality, restaurant right in the middle of the West End.

Extensive, interesting, wine list; sadly mostly quite expensive but there are a few good value options (eg the Spanish white Albarino) if you look carefully.

Attentive, friendly service; you never felt hurried.

We'll be back.

Little Social holds a very special place in my heart.  It's my favorite restaurant in all of London, and that's saying a lot!  It's warm and welcoming - the perfect neighborhood spot. Not too upscale, just perfectly comfortable.  And the food is wonderful - fresh, inventive and delicious.  The staff is professional and friendly.  Can't wait til my next meal there!

Great food and very good service in a super location just off regent street.
The only downside is that it ican be extremely noisy on busy evenings.
Not a place for a romantic dinner but still for the food alone highly recommended.

Really lovely place, wish we could have stayed longer, we were only in for a quick pre-theatre meal. Food was good if a little plain (my grilled mackerel was just that - a whole grilled fish). Service OK given our tight timetable. Will return for a proper meal soon

Great lunch, we had the Prix Fixe. They helped us pair a white wine perfectly. Generous portions and accommodated allergies easily. The crowd was a bit loud, mostly business people on a working lunch it seemed.

Try the doughnuts, they were incredible!

Overall we had an excellent dinner.

I had asked beforehand that we were served swiftly so we would be in plenty of time for the theatre and all the waiting staff pulled out the stops to ensure we were served quickly. The staff were both knowledgeable and knew the wines and menu to make suggestions and were attentive without being intrusive.

The starter of smoked eel and beetroot was an exquisite blend of flavours and well presented, whilst the ox cheeks with marrow bone was well presented and was rich and tasty.

If I had any criticism it was a little on the pricey side.

I will definitely go back to this cosy Mayfair restaurant.
Superb resturant with attentive an friendly staff. Menu has excellent choice for all tastes and doesn't disappoint in any way. My wife and I would have no hesitation in recommending.

Visited on Saturday lunchtime at 1pm with my wife as an impromptu anniversary meal.Staff very pleasant and welcoming without being overbearing.The atmosphere was "buzzy" and gave a good imitation of a Parisian brasserie.The only minor criticism would be that the service was slightly quicker than we would have liked.

Booked at short notice after reading the good reviews. We ate from the lunch set menu which was excellent value. The service throughout was fantastic and we were made to feel very welcome. I look forward to coming back again soon
Great food, staff very attentive. Only negative thing tables little too close to each other.
Very cool venue, great service, great food.

Very disappointing. When we arrived at 1pm on a Saturday the place was empty. The menu was very limited & wasn't the same as we'd looked at online so we decided to go elsewhere. Other restaurants in the area were very busy which says a lot about Jewel....

All the meat dishes were very good but all the vegetable dishes were awful so good luck if you're a non-meat eater. The service was a bit ropey - seemed like an issue in the kitchen but the waiting staff were under a lot of pressure.

The quality of foot was outstanding!

The Chataeubriand was amazing

A lovely big restaurant!  Tables are nicely spaced.  You do not feel on top of one another.  Really friendly staff, lovely food and great atmosphere.  A lovely mix of business, friends getting together and date nights!  Perfect
Partners birthday before theatre visit

Really disappointed to see no cooking on the fire. I ordered from the fire menu and still saw no action. You pay the price for the novelty yet get no novelty. It's the first time I've been to a restaurant where they've not acknowledged a birthday. Had the tip not already been included, I wonder if the waiter would have made more effort.

I‚Äôve been a regular at Yoobi for over five years. Upon this visit, having not visited for a few months, we faced really poor service.

The waitress put ginger on the table next to my plate and didn‚Äôt bother picking it up. Our food was sat on the counter of the open kitchen for good ten minutes, together with other customers‚Äô meals, while chefs kept repeating, ‚Äúservice please‚Äù multiple times before getting attention of waiters, who were just chatting at the till. We subsequently waited for ages to be given the bill and ended up coming up to the counter to pay instead.

Over ¬£5 that we had to pay in pre-calculated service were an immense generosity. We aren‚Äôt going to be back
Our lunch at El Camion was lovely- great food, great service, very covid-safe, it was a bit quiet but that's to be expected under the current restrictions...

Best thing about the place is the location and ambience. Worst thing is the service. The food was too salty. The margaritas weren't that good either.

They were rigid in preparing the food according to our preferences.

Will probably not go again.
Great food, great service,  great value, great atmosphere. Simple!

Very fast service, half the drinks menu was not availablea saturday night!
Food was bland and tasteless. Beef options very dry.
Ordered, tasted only and paid for foid we did not eat.
If you are looking for spice and heat, not thepkace to go to. You have to add
hot sauces (choice of 2) at each table to flavour your food.

Service was really good; the waiter was helpful, patient and informative! The food was decent and prices were as you‚Äôd expect for central London! Restaurant was much smaller than I expected - but it wasn‚Äôt very busy due to coronavirus so was comfortable in terms of space.
Booked a table but the restaurant was closed - extremely irritat

Set in trendy Heddon Street, this intimate restaurant punches above its weight for the price one pays.

The kitchen is open so you can see the chefs at work. The service is attentive and accommodating. The ambiance is low-key smart casual - perfect for a catch up between a group of friends.

Please please try the burrata, truffled celariac and roasted cabbage main. Magpie has an interesting British take on all of them.

(Note: The toilets aren't in the best condition at the moment, but that's forgiven because they do acknowledge and apologise for it.)

Had a really lovely meal here recently on a Sunday afternoon. We were offered a booth instead of a smaller table for 2 which was nice, and the staff were super friendly and helpful.
Food was fresh, innovative and tasty. We enjoyed the wine and relaxed atmosphere. Didn‚Äôt feel rushed. Would definitely recommend to others. Only downside was that the loos were unisex and a little ‚Äúindustrial‚Äù but this is just me nitpicking.

I‚Äôve been here a few times with groups and I like the outside tables and the location generally. The food is fine but we had to send back a main chicken dish and the main crab salad as they were very small portions and not value for money compared to other dishes. The chicken Milanese was conversely enormous. The zucchini fries were all fat and no courgette this time as opposed to being normal chip size. Waiters tried their best but did tip the starter platter all over the table.
Disappointing. Food was overlooked and dry. Server was good, though.

Had a business lunch with 4 other people. Everybody liked the food, no one was disappointed which doesn't happen very often given that tastes are usually very different. Had my favourite Spinach & Ricotta ravioli with Sage butter. Always good. Recommended red wine was very nice and smooth. Would I go back? The answer is very easy. Yes!

Piccolino, Heddon Street London

Enjoyed the meal at Piccolino's, the menu choice is wider than some other Italian chains. Food and service were good. Only minor complaints were that the temperature in the restaurant was very high and music a little over-powering but other than that, would recommend
Piccolino in Heddon Street, always a great atmosphere. Food impeccable and Waiters helpful and extremely attentive. Favourite restaurant in London!

Had a good experience , only thing that I didn‚Äôt like was when they cleaned the tables , they used cillet bang (however spelt) and if your sat having food next to that table it really smelt whilst you tried to enjoy your food.

We were a party of 6 ladies (family) varying in ages - we attended the Aladdin Cave afternoon tea prior to seeing the show later that day - the cave is smaller than it seems on the pictures we saw via a Facebook advert feed but cosy and quite personal, though probably not as magical as the video looked (but hard to create in reality). The lady serving was very polite and explained the menu and took our tea order - food was delivered very soon after, mainly sweet things (personally I would have preferred the option to have more savoury) we had a 2 hour slot which was plenty of time - tea refills were offered and we had a bottle of fizz - all in all a pleasant afternoon, we had food left over and it was boxed up so we could take it with us.

All in all a nice afternoon tea, probably a little too expensive compared to others we have been to,.

Booked the Genie' cave afternoon tea. It was delicious. The staff were very friendly and the setting is great.
Great value for money.

I recently went with a group of friends for afternoon tea at Cutter & Squidge. Each of us had a separate dietary requirement (ranging from pescatarian, vegan, vegetarian) and they catered for us all really well . totally impressed with the range of food options, presentation and ambience of the place! In particular the vegan option was outstanding and included a variety of savouries and sweets.

The Hello Kitty tea was enjoyable- especially for my friend's toddler daughter. I was a bit frustrated by the lack of service, at the end there were five small teapots stacked on our (very small for three!) because nothing had been taken away. A member of staff who wasn't even waiting our table eventually noticed and came to clear up, but there was so much stuff to take away that she dropped a teapot on the toddler- luckily it was totally cold tea by that point, and she apologised profusely but really it wouldn't have happened if the table had been looked after properly.

The food was very good and well thought out, and the tea was nice, although we weren't given or offered any milk or sugar. The children's menu was just right for a toddler's palate, but I think she was happy enough with eating the chocolate for the strawberries! The decoration was cute, the best table is by far the one for four people at the back, but the tree and light up Kitty as you come in are very cool.

Merchandise was pretty expensive but that's to be expected. Once we got home I looked at the menu again and realised there were a few items we didn't receive , which is disappointing for having paid so much to be honest.
Excellent location close to Regent St, lovely service team, delicious french cuisine.
Nice venue with great staff. The fish in the boulabaise was great. Quiet so could chat easily.

Had a delightful lunch here on their special menu, after visiting the Royal Academy.  The food was fresh, attractively served and delicious.  The Pork Terrine as a starter tasted subtle and a little spicy, the salad starter was very fresh and attractively arranged.  The main course fish was delicious.  The wine was well priced and the service friendly and attentive without being intrusive.  My first vist but not my last.

I am known to be a picky person when it comes to food and service but this restaurant meets all my criteria. It has well cooked moules, great selection of wines, lovely chefs special salmon and amazing deserts. I was there twice already and will go next time for sure. The only problem that its a bit pricey. But i guess good location has its price.

Heddon st is a lovely quiet little spot just like St Christophers place was years ago. We had the top table deal for the lunch and were delighted. We had the roquefort salad to start and the sea bass as a main course. Delicious bread and excellent service made for a lovely girlie lunch - shame about the old tart that sat nearby and conducted a private conversation at the top of her voice - no wonder he left her!
If shes not there then we will be back!

The food was tasty but nothing special, particularly for the price, which was disappointing as it was a special occasion. The ambiance and service were fine but again nothing to write home about, and a 12.5% tip was automatically added to the bill, which I always find irritating, especially when the experience doesn't necessarily merit it. I would be unlikely to go back.

A shocking experience! I booked a table for four on a special occasion and when we arrived, the place was full of drunks and the noise was deafening and we were told they don't take online bookings! Strange, as I had my online booking confirmed....won't be going back there.

Loved it from the min we arrived. Happy Hour so got to sample all their Mocktails among others and had a lovely private leather booth with waitress service for no charge! We then made our way to the Terrace Restaurant and had a lovely young waiter who we could not fault. The food was half price thanks to our Taste card and presented beautifully. Can't wait to go back!
great value generous portions for 50% off deal. service not as good as could be but we did arrive at end of lunch time 2pm.
This is always a great venue for a girlie evening. Happy Hour is brilliant value and the food is very good. No complaints.
Grace was a good night out. The salmon with cous cous was excellent and the half price cocktails fantastic. We had a really good evening here.
A good value for money place in Piccadilly - good service and value for money

Appalling service, bog standard food and thinking it was a night club rather than a restaurant sums up Grace in London's Soho. This was a dreadful experience. The food took ages to order, then arrived 5 minutes after (not a good sign) and still no drinks. I had to chase three separate waiters for our drinks which in the end resulted in me physically having to get up and chase them around the restaurant. Not a good sign and not worth the effort -even with the 25% discount. Would never go again.
Very Lively But Pleasant Restaurant, Happy Hour well worth a Visit!!

Myself and three friends had dinner at Grace on the 50% deal which was very good value for money, and with the added bonus of happy hour occurring during our visit we had two bottles of wine for the price of one! The food we had was very tasty although the service was a little slow and on more than one occasion we had to try and gain the waiter's attention despite being sat in a prominent place. I will return to Grace on another occasion but may steer clear of visiting on a Friday night.
I am a regular at Grace and it was my birthday, food is always AMAZING had camembert for starter and a lovely steak afterwards, can't say anything bad about this place amazing value with offer
A nice little find in a pretty busy part of town - the restaurant is joined to the bar so a little bit noisy but more than made up for it with the food. The deal is great value...

We went Grace in Soho for a 21st Birthday meal and the place was perfect for what we wanted. Our waitress was very nice and informative with our questions. The food was lovely and great value, i would visit Grace again.

Grace Bar - Great Windmill Street London.
Food was good value - had 2 courses for ¬£10. Friendly efficient staff & service. We went on to the cocoa bar after the meal, good atmosphere, music. Milk bar was ok but had to wait ages to get served. Good night in all, would go again.

Only major downside was the toilets you could smell them as you entered and
no toilet roll in the restaurant & Cocoa bar toilets all night even though there was a attendant. If they sort the toilets all will be good!

Absolutely amazing deal. The food was superb and the choice was really good for a set menu.

Service a little slow but polite and friendly.

Really superb choice for a pre-theatre meal.
Booked for 12 people on open table and when we arrived were told that our reservation didnt exist. Manager of the bar was very rude

Dispite the contrary on the internet and the booking app and despite being able to make a booking with no comeback, the restaurant was closed. Spent a great time and meal at Amazonico! Amazing food and great service!
Love the ambience, sadly prices have gone up quite a lot lately - wine excessively expensive which is a shame.  Always love the oysters.
Great food as always, nothing too much trouble. It‚Äôs actually pretty good value for money - although over ¬£5 for black coffee does seem excessive!
We love this place. Our favourite seafood place in London. Best soda bread ever.

This was a lovely restaurant. The tables are very close together and its only a small room however the ambiance was lovely and the sea food  was wonderful. We went to anther sea food restaurant the following evening and it didn't even come close to caparison to Bentleys. Service was perfect. The gentleman was very friendly, funny and engaging. Would happily go back.

arrived earlier than booked table but it was no problem, the dilemma was whether to eat inside or outside a rare treat in central london,we ate inside and the staff/service were very helpful ,we chose bentleys because we wanted eat fish/shellfish and we were not disappointed ,all was superb.

We were initially disappointed as we were seated downstairs in the bar (no option to specify online where you want to sit), which was a nice space if you want a lively and noisy atmosphere, but has a different kitchen apparently and we wanted to be able to speak to each other - plus a draught from the door was cold.  It took some negotiation with the very polite waiting staff to get a table upstairs, and after that, we had a very nice time.  Native oysters and dover sole was delicious (although too much lemon sauce on the sole- maybe ask waitress to leave some in the jug), and creme brulee also really good.  Overall a lovely experience.

Enjoyed it immensely, 4 of us had lunch the main stoke the show Hereford beef x
All the staff were on hand every time

Our entrees (Seafood) were excellent!
The Manager, Diego was extremely helpful with our menu selections and he was very attentive to the guests seated outside.
Service was very poor and food was very expensive, ¬£8 for one scallop that arrived ten minutes before my husband' raw oysters!

First time at Bentley's and we will definitely return for more! The food was amazing, the wine list extensive and the service attentive and professional. The oysters are what Bentley's is known for and they definitely lived up to our expectations. However, the main course was equally tasty, well seasoned and beautifully cooked. This is an expensive, traditional restaurant but one definitely worth visiting!

Downstairs area indoors is a lot more atmospheric than upstairs where we were. Food was  excellent but service was not particularly attentive such as wine glasses being empty but waiters/waitresses not topping up with the wine placed in an ice bucket across the room. Temperature fluctuated between too hot/stuffy and a bit chilly. Food and wine well priced for quality which was very good.
Splendid! Food was very tasty. Waiters were warm and friendly

We ate here twice over the 2 weeks, firstly upstairs with a slightly highe price tag and menu and again in the outer street area. Both experiences were very good, the Dorset oysters are magnificent . The fish pie upstairs has lobster as an ingredient and is definitely worth trying, we felt the best fish pie ever.  However, do try downer sirs it is still good. Stop in the middle of the day and watch the world go by and enjoy great seafood.

We were greeted at the door to find our name wasn't on the system ! Strange though as I had received phone calls , emails etc.. Confirming the booking .
Considering we only had the table for 2 hours we didn't go up to the grill for at least 20 minutes !!
Food was very good , though very expensive .

We visited with friends for my wife's birthday. A great location, with a lovely fine dining room. All started very well with great service and some fastastic oysters (some of the best we have had), but the quality of the rest of the meal was a little mixed: the roast boar was cold, some of the meat on the mixed grill overdone and seasoning issues on other items. It didn't quite ruin our night but it was disappointing considering the reputation of the restaurant. It was then topped off with a slight disagreement over a bottle of red wine, which was attempted to be served chilled...which we didn't appreciate and sent back. I would certainly return for the oysters and alborino wine and hope the rest can be written off to a one-off bad night!
This was a great start to the evening. Great atmosphere at the bar and very friendly knowledgable staff. Had a great time.

The restaurant is very pleasant and gives a good impression as soon as one enters the door. The staff are efficient and friendly all in all one develops a sense of enjoyment and anticipation as they sit at there table. But then the catch the menu includes that dreadful statement "Market Price" and what a price ¬£48.00 for a grilled Dover Sole. Yes I know one should ask but this is not always convenient in company especially if one is a guest and surely the staff should be more forthcoming.

Good atmosphere and efficient service. Food very good presentation and quality.
As ever with these places, tables too close together for private conversation. Why do they never learn!

This was really surprising. The bread pre meal was nice and the fish pie was okay but other than this everything else was very poor. Service was terrible and we weren't the only ones in the restaurant unhappy. Seeing as this is a very expensive restaurant I'm stunned at the level of service and the quality of food. The starter was maybe the worst piece of food I've ever tasted. Scallops drenched in some sort of lime mixture. Very poor. Avoid.

We were celebrating an engagement and the range of oyster dishes allowed our party of seven to share and sample some really delicious variations on the oyster theme. The Vietnamese and the Hot Rocks were favourites. The waiters were fantastic and really friendly. This was a return visit and we love the atmosphere in the Oyster Bar.

I took my husband there fore his 60th and we sat at the Oyster bar and enjoyed a delicious dinner. I made the mistake of not specifying that I wanted specifically to sit downstairs but the lady who directed us upstairs found 2 seats at the actual bar. The difference in energy between the two parts of the restaurant is marked and I would not have enjoyed the experience as much had i been forced to sit upstairs which felt like i was sitting in a hotel dining room. In the end we had a great night and I would definitely come again.
The food was delicious. However, for the prices it really needs to be. It was a bit pricy and therefore I would only go back for a special occation.
My experince in Bentley's Oyster Bar & Grill was excellent. The quality of the food was amazing. It is quite pricy but it worths it.

My first time at Bentleys.  Very welcoming staff and great ambience.  I went for the fish pie, which was disappointing - too much sauce.  I should have gone for a straight fish - I saw loads of other fish being served and immediately regretted the fish pie decision.  I would go back, but not have the fish pie!
Good overall. Good Oysters, specially the Maldon.
Went for a birthday. Very nice setting and would definately recommend the shellfish platter.

We went to celebrate my wife's birthday. She did not know where she was going; she loves seafood and she was not disappointed. My wife had Prawns and chick peas and I had potted salmon and shrimps. The main courses of lemon sole and cod were excellent. Overall, it was quite expensive but we will definitely return.
there are 4 of us and I sent back my main course as its smell a bit funny. no question ask and not even taken away from the bill.
I'm a great fan of Richard Corrigan's restaurants.  Will go anytime I get the chance.  Top experience!!!!!

We dined at Bentleys on the four course deal on a Thursday evening. Our table was at 7 and by 8 o'clock the place was almost full. It is a very traditional restaurant and there were lots of older business types dining. The food and service were great and it was definitely worth an extra ¬£6 for the oysters.

We had a wonderful mean at Bentley's.  We needed to eat quickly to get to the theatre and they made sure that the service was swift and smooth without hovering on our shoulders.  The food was good, superb for the price and the ambience is just right.  IN this price range it would be hard to beat.
A little noisy, which was a problem for three people around a fairly large round table having a conversation, but overall excellent.

I reserved a table at Yuu Kitchen on Saturday 19 October, for my wife‚Äôs birthday. We attended the restaurant with our 5yo and 2yo children.

The concept sounded exciting to us: Taiwanese/ Asian cuisine situated next to an Ice Bar where you can take the kids for some fun afterwards, we were let down by the quality of food and service.

Here‚Äôs the summary:

- there is no children‚Äôs menu and the adult menu is limited for choice. I would NOT recommend this place for families with young children.

- service was extremely slow. The restaurant was not particularly busy - despite being a Saturday afternoon - but everything from ordering food, drinks and even the bill - which we had to request three times - was a drag.

- food is a mediocre. The bao buns seemed stale and stodgy, and the rice was extremely dry. Plain rice is a winner with kids generally, but we all were unable to finish even the small bowl that was served to us.

- the icing on the cake was that, despite the restaurant being listed on TasteCard with a ‚Äú50% off‚Äù offer, the restaurant claimed this was an error but agreed to give us a 25% discount as a gesture of goodwill. Five days later, it still appears on Tastecard....

In summary, the concept and location has huge potential but falls short of good service and food: bare minimum expectations for a mid-market restaurant in central London.
For a special treat away from the busy crowded bars this is an oasis.

Been going here as a pre-Xmas treat for years and it never disappoints. Pricey, but oh so, so good. Bar snacks excellent. Especially love the rarebits. Smoked salmon trio is sublime. Wines are splendid. Fernandez barman is a great fun character, but service was slow because they were very busy - as they're always busy in the run up to Xmas it's caused by understaffing.

Popped into the wine bar after an exhibition at the RA. Had boked for later bit they happily accomodated us. Great service, super ambience and good food.
Wine list excellent -of course !
Had to ask the waiter 3 times for some more bread then the  waitress  made  a hash settling the bill

Pleasant wine bar - best aspect you can choose any wine from the Fortnum's wine stock and pay ¬£10 for corkage over and above the cost of the wine. Food was good but not exceptional a good place for a tapas style snack with a nice wine selection post shopping.
Food was great with a good choice of wines. Bar staff were very flexible in tailoring a Wine Flight to our taste.

Sadly the wine bar was short of staff on the day we visited Friday 20th June, so the service did not measure up to previous experience. The food was memorable and we enjoyed the occasion. It was fairly quiet, unlike other visits which have been vibrant/noisy.
We often visit on Sunday afternoons & take advantage of the discounts offered by the Zebrano app & also happy hour!

I took my wife to momos for afternoon tea for her birthday. The welcome we received was very warm and the lady found us a nice side table. The afternoon tea with sandwiches and cakes was amazing plentiful very tasty and not too sweet. When we finished more cake and scones were brought out with their amazing home made prickly pair jam which I could have eaten on its own it was so good. I would recommend to anyone for a special treat.

Terrace on Piccadilly was a delight to eat at! Good portioned food at decent prices for London (especially the West End!). All staff were extremely lovely and helpful and professional. Happened to mention when I booked the reservation that it was my girlfriend's birthday, and they gave a little extra starter (mushroom & cheese bite-thingy) AND a little dessert plate with 3 little types of desserts with 'Happy Birthday!' written on the plate in a chocolate sauce, both of these ON THE HOUSE (free of charge)! Will definitely be going here again, regardless of birthdays or not!
Meal was okay, and the service was very good.
Went with 2 friends, had a lovely meal from Market menu, very nice, surprisingly filling! Not my first time at Terrace, and it won't be my last. My friends loved it too.

The Terrace Restaurant, London

Very good food, excellent service and reasonably good value for money. Main negative is there is no atmosphere at all at this venue. Probably best to go midweek and in the evening for that

La Terrasse is a very nice restaurant inside Le Meridien Hotel. Food is great and with the Top table offer, it does worth it by war.
BUT, the service is really, really not at the standard of the place (including the adress) and the food. Waiter are strangely dressed in a chef/cook pyjama which for some of them was not very clean. it is really shame as it would be a really great place if the service was not like that.

Terrace is an elegant&classy restaurant but the experience was disappointing. It was half full on Wed night and the staff already struggled to keep the service up, definitely understaffed. They couldn't find my booking, waited 10 mins to be shown to the table, wine arrived 5 mins after the glass was brought to the table, then they forgot to 50% discount to the bill, waited another 10 mins for the card machine to pay...Food is ok but portion is small, only worth going with the 50% offer.

Really enjoyed the Terrace Restaurant in Le Meridien Piccadilly. The food was very good, portions were good and the service was great. The only let-down was that we decided to have the chocolate experience (coffee + 3 Godiva chocolates) instead of a dessert: the coffee was very watery & the truffles we chose were not traditionnal (since when is a truffle hard??!). To be fair on them, they did not make them. Will definitely go back for the melting-in-the-mouth guinea fowl!

The venue was a little on the quiet side, with only a few tables full (despite it being a Fri night), and the terrance is closed for refurbishment which was disappointing. Service was excellent. Food met expectations but didn't wow. My halibut main was fresh and light. Drinks were expensive (cheapest wine was ¬£26, bottle of water was ¬£5). Food was good value with the offer but I wouldn't pay full price. If I went again it would be just for coffee on the terrace when it opens!

Really nice central Venue, tastefully decorated. It was quite quiet when we were there on a Monday evening, but it still had a nice feel and the staff were very helpful. They even found me our table some off menu chips for a pregnancy craving ! The warm duck egg was delicious as was the pudding. The steak as main was OK but not outstanding. Was excellent value with the toptabole deal
Solid menu with good choice. Food cooked well and service attentive, happily go back but little atmosphere

Visited The Terrace at Le Merdien on Piccadilly last night for a throughly enjoyable meal. Good food and service only marginally let down by the lack of atmosphere due to the huge dining room and lack of diners. Great value with the TT offer.

The Terrace Restaurant has great ambience, being on the the enclosed terrace of the Meridien Piccadilly. The service is good, with prompt attention. The food is solid, but falls a bit short of expectations for this type of location and price ranges.
The Terrace Restaurant: the food was lovely and the service good. Unfortunately it was absolutely freezing in the restaurant and we were shivering throughout the meal.

The Terrace Restaurant offers an incredible dining experience. Situated in a landmark building, the conservatory style dining room is among the nicest in London. The staff is friendly and very professional and the food is of high quality. Together it is the perfect recipe for success.

The Terrace was a great experience for fine dining and has a stunning interior to match. Although the food is quite pricey with the top table offer it made it great value and with the offer i would certainly return. Really worth keeping an eye for when it is available to take a loved one or a group of friends for a fantastic evening out.

the terrace restaurant set inside Le Meridian hotel in Picadilly is such a great central London place to eat, the conservatory style restaurant is on the 2nd floor and is very light and airy, staff very pleasant and friendly.
We were given several complimentary tasters which were a lovely bonus, and the food we ordered was full of flavour and beautifully presented. My only critisism would be that vegetables were all listed as side orders, which would push the price a bit O.T.T.
Excellent all round

To simply sum up the evening 'Fabulous food, Poor service ' On our arrival we have asked for the coctail list twice and that took good 20 minutes to arrive. Considering there were only 4 tables occupied during the whole of the evening the service was too slow and waiters were hardly seen except for the two times they came to aks how happy we were with our food. Reasonable wine list but we had to keep filling up our own glasses. However would give another go only on 50% off the food bill again.

Great food good ambience. Slightly chilly in winter, sitting in a large glass terrace. Service was very obliging - fixed a slightly shaky table and accommodated a table change request. Largely work crowd on a Tue evening but nice enough for a quiet romantic or social dinner

The terrace was a magnificent venue, food was quite good but pricey for for the quality of it, waiters tried their best but lacked professionalism, they tried to bring us coffe after the first course!!

Encouraged by the previous reviews and the top table offer we decided to dine at The Terrace. But don‚Äôt expect anything WOW, as it is a hotel restaurant that during a week night has no atmosphere at all.
On the other hand the service was poor, the staff had no idea what they were serving and were not well informed of the ingredients for most of the dishes. Even that there we only 4 tables occupied in the restaurant the food arrived late and it was really cold.
Not impressed!!!
Excellent food, discount with Toptable was certainly worth it. Singer and pianist on a Sat night uplifted the atmosphere in this quiet restaurant. Be warned though, the discount doesn't cover drinks!

The shortest diner in my life.
Not friendly with children, they show you that you are not welcome with the Italian hypocrisy song.

When we turned up the restaurant can not find our reservation. They claim that they stopped using opentable six months ago.
Though it wasn‚Äôt that busy so they found a table for us. The food was good. So was some of the waiters.
It could‚Äôve been better if our reservation actually meant something!
Lovely authentic place. Great food and drinks and truly lovely and outstanding service. Remarkably good!

As ever, Cafe Monico was excellent - the food, service and value for money.

It was a bizarre situation as my friend and I visited just before the Government imposed the various coronavirus restrictions and I think we were the only customers. It was extremely quiet.

I hope for the sake of Cafe Monico and all the staff normality returns soon - I will certainly be heading back as soon as I can!

We went on a Saturday afternoon.  It was quiet and most of the clientele were tourists rather than regulars.   staff were very welcoming and the service was good throughout.  the food was fine.  So why I am not ecstatic about this restaurant.  I don't know, I can't quite put my finger on it.
A classic and timeless aesthetic coupled with great food.

A very good pre show dinner venue right on Shaftberry Avenue next door to the Queens Theatre. Good service and while the food was not exceptional it was very good at the price.
Would be happy to recommend it

What a fabulous place, now to put in order of food quality, service, cost, ambience...it‚Äôs so difficult because you cannot fault this restaurant. Smack bang in the heart of the west end theatre district, my wife and I ate here prior to watching a show.
Food delicious, beautifully presented, served amazingly quickly, and with a smile from our waitress, just the perfect place, I would recommend to anyone.

It has a lovely ambience and l like that it has a bar on the ground floor and then the restaurant on the first floor. It also has tables all round the edges with a gallery effect, which creates a feeling of space.

Service was slow,  got starter way before they serve drinks, had to remind .  Missed on part of the order. Steak was luke warm and very chewy. May be worth to get drinks at the bar, or try after the theatre goes gone.
We went for a pre-theatre meal and were extremely pleased with the food and the service with very friendly staff.  Would definitely return.
Walter our waiter was outstanding! Great location, lovely food, good cocktails and wine!

We went for a pre-theatre meal. The staff are friendly and the food was tasty and nicely presented. We sat down quite early but the place quickly filled up and is clearly popular for both after work and with theatre goers due to its excellent location. I would certainly recommend it to others for the cocktails and the food!

My partner and I throughly enjoyed our visit to Cafe Monico. Everything about the restaurant was perfect, staff, atmosphere. Sadly my partner had to send his steak back because it was over cooked, but it was not questioned and was served another steak cooked perfectly in a short time. We would recommend it to anyone and hopefully when in London again will dine there again.

Not disappointed. What a find. We booked less than 24hours before visiting for the ¬£20 pre theatre meal. Although there is only 3 choices per course they of good quality and  enjoyable. Staff attentive and polite. Our request not to sit near toilets was  honoured and we had a balcony table with good ambience.
Great service and friendly staff. Delicious crab linguine.
Excellent late lunch - food and wine just right for the occasion.  Good eclectic mix of diners. I will definitely return.
This is the 4th visit for me. Very buzzy , excellent menu and service. A firm favourite.

A lot of effort has gone into the design,  very grand brasserie but with a clubby feel that works well. Staff were efficient and friendly. Food was good but these are simple, classic dishes so they shouldn't be quite so hit and miss. Octopus salad had tender octopus but the dressing was way too salty (and i can deal with more salt than most). On the other hand steak tartare was very well done, just the right size of chunks, not too finely diced and with well judged seasoning. Friends were both happy with their crab ravioli. So right now it gets a good, but a bit more attention in the kitchen and it'll happily move up a notch.
The service was great (amazing!), but the food let them down. Was literally sick on the way home from it :-(
Love the food, great veggie and gluten free options, great prices.
The food was great, with some nice variety on the menu and even though the service was friendly it was painfully slow. I would be happy to go again but will manage my expectations accordingly.
great service, tasty food and overall worth the price - shame about the churros sandwich was not served here.
Enjoyed Shotgun for post theatre supper.  Food very good and interesting. Helpful, friendly service. Room too dark and chilly near the door.

Having walked past it twice, (at night) I was delighted as I enterd the restaurant to find the stylish warm simple ambience.
I was unsure whether 2 of the waiting staff suggested we ordered the combo plate (¬£24) to share, plus a mains as a way of them making a bit more. But as they said it did give us a chance to try several different things. Unfortunately I lost out as I would have ordered the Brisket as my main, and it turned out to be the best thing on the plate, it is fantastic as are the Boston beans.
What was such a shame was that despite booking ahead we got taken to a table downstairs where the ambience is poor. I had to face the open kitchen, brightly lit, looking at pots and pans not pretty or stylish, it spoilt my experience. I would only go back if I could be assured I could sit upstairs and eat the brisket!

Good food, at rather small but appropriate portions. Excellent wine list, but most of the more interesting bottles are kept in a display stand at the entrance, good for showing off but in suboptimal (too warm/too bright) conditions. This didn't affect the bottle we opened however.

My real issue is with their business practices. An "optional" 12,5% service charge was added to my bill without informing me or asking my permission. The bill arrived wrapped around their business card with the lettering on the inside. Not ever before having had an "optional" charge added without being asked about this I paid without questions. I only found out about this once I arranged my things at home.

I emailed the restaurant about this but haven't yet had a reply. I look forward to this being addressed.

Location and ambience good. Slightly disappointed with portion size (particularly starter as part of set lunch menu). Being 'ladies' we appreciated the subtle taste of the ingredients but both of us were glad our male partners were not with us to for satisfaction of appetite! Thank goodness for the Bread.

Looking around other tables and the outside al fresco area, I think the sharing platters would have be a better option. Both of us enjoyed the main course - again not large portions but satisfying for us.

We opted not to have dessert or coffees.

we dined here for my recent birthday and have a lovely evening.  would reccomend the tasting menu - ¬£40 for 4 courses and only an additional ¬£30 for the witn pairing.  Setting was lovely and staff were attentive and could not do enough for us.  Food was amazing and we will be back!

The experience was great, although the place was empty. Perhaps that was why!

Whoever decided to change the name to "The Two Sportsmen" made a big error; I suspect that's why there weren't any people in the place.
It was a truly special and pleasant experience. The stuff is attentive and the food is lovely. Great atmosphere.
Fantastic setting. Amazing food. Even with two people, you get to try a majority of the small plates. Can‚Äôt wait to go back!

A great intimate venue for watching excellent food be prepared in front of you
A decent house white wine and Denis Hopa on tap (from the upstairs bar)
Friendly chefs more than happy to explain ingredients and methods used

Absolutely horrible - waiters are horribly trained, restaurant manager is outside smoking the whole time, we stayed for 1 hour and still didnt even get served. Worst restaurant experience in London by far.
Food was good but the team was overwhelmed when we first arrived so no one welcomed us for 10min .
Went for breakfast on a lazy Sunday and it was exceptional value - ¬£7 for juice, coffee and a hot breakfast. Excellent place!
Very friendly staff, nice finger food, strong cocktails. I will visit it again!

The are two reasons why we are not very happy about the place, first of all, the table wasn t ready at the booking time and this gave us a very short time to enjoy the dinner because we have supposed to be seated at 10.30pm and not 11 PM.
Second, but very important, we all felt sick after dinner.... Nothing else to say!!! Too bad because the ambience was nice and the menu is good as well, but I Don t think I wanna feel sick again!
Delicious food and a vibrant, lively atmosphere. Very friendly and helpful staff made it an excellent experience,  nothing was too much trouble. Food on the expensive side though.

It was a very quiet night , service was very slow .  We had an unfortunate event when a drunk came in and started singing and annoying people . The staff tried to evict him but had to call the police . It spoilt what may have been a better experience as we no longer felt like eating a main course and left promptly .

Four of us had a very pleasant weekday lunch here.  It was very quiet on arriving at 1.30 but very quickly became busier therefore improving the atmosphere. Our waiter was very helpful  & as we were unsure of what & how much to order he gave us lots of advice & guidance. The meat eaters very much enjoyed the pig & two of us loved the prawns with the bread that came with tomato, salt & oil. We would return.
doesn't excist anymore! There's now another restaurant....
Authentic Chinese cuisine in London !

We thoroughly enjoyed the Keepers House relaxed atmosphere and cosy interior in deep red with architectural carvings on the walls. A real haven from the hustle and bustle of the West End. The small edited menu showed good imagination and ingredients and the service was discrete and on the ball. A good experience that we will repeat again soon.

Could not get through to this restaurant for 4 days previous to visiting, they called me the day before to ask if i still wanted the table & left me a voicemail. I tried 5 times to get back to them to no avail???!!! Very odd! So decided to get a back up plan & went to a different place! You need to man your phones!!!

Left pretty underwhelmed, the food was not bad, but not good either. They seemed severely understaffed, but all things considered it, the service was ok. It felt like a run of the mill chicken and chip shop, really didnt feel like a proper meal out.

Wonderful food from the ¬£25pp for two courses and a glass of wine.
We were given the normal menu and could order any starter and main course. Good value when the fillet steak is ¬£24.95 on its own! Delicious food, good sized portions and not rushed through our meal.
Would definitely recommend and will also be back.
Thank you Pizza Toscana

We chose to eat here after reading good reviews on trip advisor and it being in such a good location for where we are staying, the staff here are fantastic, the food was lovely only didn't give it a 5* as i have had better italian food BUT that doesn't take away from the fact that it was still a great evening with great food,staff,wine and atmosphere would absolutley return here when in London

checked all reviews as wanted to be near the theatre as we had my elderly mother with us . Great location staff fantastic , food glorious, thoroughly enjoyable evening. Certainly lived up to all other reviews. Must must visit.

Occasionally on an evening out everything comes together to make it perfect. From the time we walked into the restaurant to the time we left we honestly have no negative comments to make. We regularly review restaurants on top table and this is the first time we have given five stars across the board. A massive well done to the La Scala team, thank you.

Interesting menu but poor quality was our experience - do not recommend a visit for dinner as the restaurant staff appear keen to go home after 8pm! The fish and chips were overcooked and inedible with liitle interest from the management when we complained - disappointing
Had an amazing atmosphere on Wednesday lunch. Staff were brilliant. Will def be going back!
We are at the one by St Paul‚Äôs and we can‚Äôt fault it. Our waiter was fantastic a small the service was amazing. Would go back tomorrow if we only lived  nearer

We had a table of ten for a business dinner.  The food was excellent, served promptly and well coordinated.  It's always a concern with large groups that the food will arrive separately, but ours arrived simultaneously. The waitstaff were good, and the setting is lovely in the restaurant. I was left wanting water every now and again, but overall the service was very good.

We had afternoon tea at the Barbecoa to celebrate a birthday. We were 8 people and when we arrived the table was prepared and ready for us. The location is very nice, the ambiance has a very elegant feel to it.
The afternoon tea was fine overall. However, instead of the pastries mentioned on the menu, they only served a selection, not enough for everyone to have one of everything. When we asked about this, she said there were only 4 pastries per person and they had made a selection. This was not at all indicated on the menu - the menu made it look like everyone would get one piece of the pastries listed there. When we expressed our disappointment about this, the waitress was very unfriendly.
Had we known about this we would have gone to the Delauney, where the staff have always been friendly when we were there and the menu is not misleading.
Amazing, would repeat it without any doubt :) The waiters are really nice and the food is delivious!
Service and quality of food was compromised due to "kitchen too busy". There are plenty of competition in soho and I would go somewhere else next time.

Quite a relief not to have to second-guess the menu, if you can't have gluten, and to know that you can eat absolutely EVERYTHING!  And 'everything' is a lot, and very tasty!  Service was congenial, and the atmosphere extremely agreeable.  I will definitely come again.

When I arrived, despite a booking confirmation from open table, I was told that they were unaware of our booking and that only a 45min table was available. Only after a group downsized did they offer us a proper table.

The restaurant seemed busier than staff were able to handle.

Both my wife and I found the portions small and the food lacking in taste and freshness. We quickly left so as to not throw good money after bad.
The beer was warm they took forever to bring us the food and the place had so much noice
It was just bad. Go somewhere else for hot pot.. so overpriced and barely any vegetables were fresh.
Food was excellent have no idea why this place is not busier maybe it's the location but every dish from starter through to dessert was exceptional.
Food is tasty, portion size is huge! It is a little pricey though :)
The food was amazing and the service and atmosphere was equally great.
Excellent scotch eggs

After a small mix up with our table, which the staff fixed immediately, we were well-looked after and the waiter was brilliant; he was fun, funny, informative, and attentive. We had a great time, with delicious food.

"This was a surprise meal for my mum and she loved every moment. From being shown to the table and deciding on her order, which was helped by the friendly and helpful waitress.  There was no rush  and we all enjoyed the delicious main meal and drinks."

Relaxed atmosphere overlooking the colourful ground floor. Food choices were good  but the only flaw was that we had our food delivered before the Champagne arrived and had to ask twice before it finally arrived.

I had a booking for 1800 and I reached at 1757 only to be told that the kitchen closes at 1800!!!
Why do you have options for reservations 1730 onwards if the kitchen closes!!
Not a great experience at the start of the dinning and To too this up I get an email for open table to tell me that i didn‚Äôt keep my reservation - really is this a joke?!!
Lovely space just behind the main sales floor. Beautiful food and friendly service
Very busy but that was to be expected at Christmas time. Food served quickly and staff friendly. An excellent place for meeting old friends.
We should have been told when booking that the kitchen closed at 6.00.  Our table was booked for 6.00 and although they did take our orders, we felt under pressure.  It was a pity.
Rather meagre portions and haphazard service make this poor value for money - and it‚Äôs VERY expensive.

Great location on the mezzanie overlooking the Fortnum's main floor. Exemplary service.

Another reviewer has said this restaurant offers the most expensive Welsh Rarebit on the planet. That is true. But it is also arguably the best Welsh Rarebit on the planet. Tha gets what tha pays fer, lad.

Contrastingly, though, the breaded fish of the day (pollock if I'm not mistaken) and chips (oven chips!!!) were of the distinctly uninspiring variety.

Lunch for 2, with a bottle of Portuguese plonk and no dessert nor coffee, came in at a shade over ¬£100. Hard to recommend for this quality at that price.

A classic British Institution with a great history and many great food items for sale. The food was excellent, but the staff was very stuffy and seemed not to be helpful at all. Our waitress perhaps was new, but she made mistakes with our order, disappeared after it was taken and never checked on us after our food was delivered. I waited for over 15 minute to get our bill as the family went to shop in the main store. I had told the waitress before the family left that we were ready for the bill as she was clearing our plates. After ten minutes wait, I tried to get the attention of several passing waiters dressed in suits and they all seemed too busy to acknowledge me. Finally I had to nearly yell at the top of my voice to get the Head Waiter's attention (I assume he was in position since it seemed he was directing other staff). He brought the bill right away and when I told him I wanted to take the optional service charge off the bill, corrected it right away. As I left, I saw him animatedly talking to our waitress so perhaps the message got across. That being said, there are far too many other options to enjoy in London and I would avoid this place.
Staff need some training. Not quite as good as they should be for a restaurant of this standard. Our waitress dribbled the wine all around the glass and they tried to rush our ordering
I love The Gallery at any time of day.  Great food, service wonderful and staff very friendly and helpful.
A great place to enjoy a meal with family or friends. We always choose F & M's for a family celebration and we're never disappointed.

I think this restaurant is excellent for people who are shopping, or who wish to meet up in London and have an unhurried lunch.  The restaurant is pleasant and light with oak floors, oak tables and oak chairs with padded seats.   The restaurant was only a third full so despite the lack of soft furnishings was reasonably quiet and it was easy to hold a conversation. There are paper table mats.  It is more a shopping eatery than a fine dining restaurant by way of atmosphere. Portions were a reasonable size and the food well cooked and presented. Should you purchase only a main course you would probably need to buy extra vegetables and /or carbohydrate. There were plenty of staff.

We always use fortnums for lunch when we are in London. On this occasion we were booked in later than normal but I rang to to check to see if they would be serving hot food which they said they would be. the soup was very bland and only just warm, the table was cleared of 2 dishes the rest were left we had to ask for the rest of the table to be cleared, the main arrived 3 of us had xmas lunch my husband had steak and all of them were only just warm I went to see the head waiter who came and took them all away when they returned they werea little better except my husband s steak it was the same piece just turned over, majority was left desert came snd for me the xmas pudding tasted very stale. All in all a very disappointing meal.

The service on this occasion was very very slow - taking 3 and a half hours to serve 2 courses and coffees!! We were not in a rush however but were a little annoyed to be told that we had to vacate our table at 4.30 because of another booking. I politely advised that the reason we had taken so long was because of the very slow service! I think that the Fountain restaurant which we usually attend was better.
Overall good experience on every level.
We were very pleased with the whole experience. The staff were friendly and attentive, the food was superb. We will be returning to the Gallery restaurant very soon!

The food was good but the service was slow because they seemed to be understaffed. Our waitress was very nice and apologized which made it better but getting her attention was difficult. We were there on a Friday night and it seemed like a young crowd drinking upstairs and going outside a lot to smoke.
Had a lovely evening with friends. The ambience was great as was the service.
Very good value for money.   Tasty food. Will be booking again. Staff very good.
Great food, great atmosphere and good service. Massively recommend and will be going back.
Great food, good service. Nothing bad about the experience, love this place!
We had such a fantastic night. We sat downstairs- the food was amazing, great music and service. Will definitely go again.

The place was completely empty when we arrived with only one other diner . The cocktails we found were good value for money and quite tasty . However there was no ambience . The menu was limited for such a large restaurant . The food that we did ordered felt that it was frozen food . Part
Of the squid was a bit cold when I did have it which is why we thought it was frozen before . The rest of the food was ok but definitely not fresh at all. Won‚Äôt be coming back and a shame as the cocktails were nice . It would be a better bar!
The restaurant had closed for renovations but had not communicated with Open Table so accepted the reservation but was otherwise unavailable for communication.
It was just amazing! The atmosphere was full of energy and charisma, the food was delicious and everyone enjoyed themselves.
Great value with the 50% discount - great for pre theatre even though we did not have the set menu, service fast and efficient.

I booked a 50% off deal and was very happy with the food and service. I had chicken wings, sirloin steak and chocolate brownie with ice cream. Absolutely no complaints. It was delicious, the staff were very nice and at 50% off, was a great deal. I would have no qualms about going back and paying full price next time. They also had a 50% off all drinks while I was there, from 5 to 8pm.... Very happy with the restaurant and very happy with toptable!!

50% off, very good deal, spent less on our dinner and drinks in Central London than we would have in our local pub in Eastbourne. Menu is fairly basic but tasty food and what we were expecting. Service was excellent.

The dinner in Tiger Tiger was nice. Service was excellent. Food was good. It couldn't be better for ordered ordered salad and chicken and fries as the main course. It was packed and noisy, as it should be in a night club on Friday evening. The overall was very good.
Great food.. Excellent service

The restaurant on a Friday night was fairly busy but it was very noisy with the disco music in the background.  Food was pretty good and we all had a good time.  However, the TT deal had not been applied and we had to send it back.
Very good place, been there second time and want to come back.
TigerTiger had a great atmosphere. Good value for money and very much enjoyed the happy hour drinks.

This was the 2nd time I have visited Tiger Tiger London, and I wasn't dissapointed on either occassion.
We were seated immediatley on arrival, although they couldn't accomodate my request for a booth.
The staff were friendly & helpfull, if a little rushed. They explained the menu in detail. The food was good. I opted for the tiger prawns in sweet chilli sauce, and I have to say they were delicious, although a finger bowl was needed. The venue & dancing is great. A brilliant evening.

I went with 5 others and we had a lovely big table in the restaurant, all of our meals were very nice. They had 2-4-1 offers on food and happy hours on drinks so we were all happy! It is a huge place with different bars and a 'club', and gets packed in the evening. Bit of a meat market but fine for a few drinks!
Reasonable food for a club venue & great value when you use an offer - Tiger Tiger
Myself and my gf went  Tiger Tiger last night prior to a show. The deal on TT was excellent value with food being good for the price that we paid.
Food was fab in Tiger Tiger. Would definately return.
Portions are, as ever, generous.  Value for money.

Tiger Tiger on a Friday night is full of fun, but be aware also extremely busy!  The organisation is not great but staff are very helpull and always polite. Take your booking confirmation with you as your bill never seems to be discounted correctly and you may need to prove your offer. Would definately go again.
The food was good, but poorly timed, I'd almost finished my meal by the time my friends arrived.  Given the restaurant wasn't busy (likely due to bombings that day) it was hard to understand why.

We were welcomed by a most friendly and attentive waitress (Ana Maria) who was very patient  whilst we deliberated. The food was excellent and so was the wine. We enjoyed the attention of the restaurant manager as well. It was a very unusual setting and an intimate atmosphere made it a unique dining experience, as was the bar after the meal.  It comes highly recommended particularly if you want something very good but unusual.
Good Service, Nice location.
EXCELLENT food. Very expensive beer. Staff were extremely efficient and hospitable.
Smaller (cozy) than expected, nice setting, very decent food. Would recommend (with 2 for 1 offer) - other wise definitely on the upper/pricey side.
A thoroughly enjoyable meal in a lovely setting at Silk

Set inside an old courtroom with many of its original features giving it a quirky ambience. You get a short history lesson as the waiter seats you. Helpful but unintrusive staff.Excellent, well presented food. Price would have been a bit too much were it not for the 2 for 1 deal. I would definitely come again.

I had never heard of Silk before and as i was taking my family out i was a little apprehensive however, this restaurant is definately one to remeber!  The waiters were fantastic with a great knowledge of the history of the court room and the menu and the food was delicious with every piece melting in your mouth.  You would be hard pushed not to try your guests dishes also.  One of the best restaurants i have been to in London i would highly recommend this exquiste dining experience.

Silk is a fabulous venue located in an old magistrates court with the original wood panelling. Staff seemed very pleased to see us and were very attentive and polite. Food is divine, somewhat pricey but with this offer worth going to check it out. It's all about quality not quantity; portions are fairly small but exquisite. Really appreciated the extra touches such as the taste offerings in between courses.Would reccomend if in the area just for the experience.
I went to Silk with my girlfriend on a Friday night. Food was terrific as was the service. Price was a bit punchy.
