With promise of African influences, the menu unfortunately did not match. With the exception of scotch bonnet in every course except dessert, it could have been part of a menu from any part of the world. The spices sometimes did don‚Äôt work with the delicate salmon. My beef was over cooked through through a water bath and the fat left congealed on the side. My sweetbread too was over cooked and very stringy and chewy. London has many nice restaurants- go elsewhere. The wine list was the best thing about the experience, some lovely and unusual wines.

The food was truly terrific, and the blind tasting menu idea is top notch. The place is very well designed, too. However, the service is mediocre at best - our waiter mumbled to a point where we couldn't understand her, and kept leaning on me while taking orders. Also, while the place was quiet and empty at 6pm when we started the dinner, the noise level before 8pm was just insane. Think of a popular pub on a Friday evening, with music blasting from loudspeakers, and you'll get the idea. My ears literally hurt when we were leaving - it's not something I've ever experienced at a restaurant with that sort of reputation.
Another great lunch at Ikoyi - amazing flavours, beautifully presented dishes, top service.
This place has the best jamon! We love Spanish tapas. The cheese was phenomenal as well. The service was great. We will definitely be back when in London!

Amazingly yummy!! We ordered mains and sides and it was ALL delicious. Best Jerusalem Artichoke Ravioli I have ever eaten. Very current menu and the decor is beautiful, great atmophere quite setting and around the corner from the noisy area of Piccadilly. Super friendly staff. Will be back soon..
Excellent food, service a tad slow and the waiter forgot to order/ process my drink.
Food and drinks all excellent. Service was a touch slow getting started but was kind and attentive.
Terrible service

This was unfortunately not a good experience, very poor service and food which was disappointing, not worth a visit as there are so many great restaurant close by. Very slow service, ordered and received food before drinks arrived, no check back on food, which is pretty uninspired, DO NOT ORDER BBQ duck tongues, really cannot understand how these made it on the menu, about 90% cartilage, very unpleasant.

My third time here and this time with my boss and colleagues. Everyone was very impressed. Service second to none and food was delicious. Got to have the foie gras br√ªl√©e again....so imaginative, different and sooo good!!
Very average. Staff can't speak English very well, which makes for awkward ordering and missed items from our order.
My family and I had a wonderful time at the Parlour. The staff were fabulous and really made the day special for my 2 young children. Thank you.
Really enjoyable visit celebrating my friends 50th birthday. She was really pleased with the surprise piece of cake that was brought out which made the visit more special.

The food was lovely. We had coronation chicken on toast which was delicious, scones and chocolate cake. It was very busy and we had to wait to be seated despite having a reservation for 12pm. Once we were seated we were then ignored for 15 minutes until I asked for someone to take our order. There were quite a few mothers with bored children playing up and lying in the middle of the floor. The meal was pleasant overall but I would avoid busy times if you want to hear each other talk! It was quite expensive for what it is and the additional service charge makes it even more so. I probably shouldn‚Äôt have paid it considering the service was poor.
Lovely make your own sundae menu - good fun and delicious ice cream
The staff really made it - so helpful and friendly. And the food was delicious.
Absolutely wonderful dining experience. A great place for family or friends. Food was exceptional, very tasty and worth the price. Would definitely return to the Parlour!
The room could have been a little warmer, the air conditioning is directly above some of the tables which gives you a chill.

We bought our family here for my daughter's 7th birthday tea, with the idea of having a light bite for supper followed by a giant sundae for desert. The staff were lovely and made a fuss of us and bought some balloons for her, but the parlour lacked atmosphere. It was very chilly and we had to keep our coats on. The savoury food was simple and delicious, but very expensive for the tiny portions. There were only 3-4 sundaes on offer and I really felt like the menu was unappealing. Although there were lots of ice cream flavours it would have been great if you could combine them into a " make your own sundae" to add cream/fruit/toppings to make them a bit more interesting. The two of us who ordered sundaes were very happy, then two that ordered ice cream were just a bit disappointed.
Delicious ice cream at The Parlour. Will certainly return.

Nice afternoon tea with children. Excellent ice cream selection, will be back for more. Wish the food options had been a little more varied, though, as I hadn't eaten lunch and didn't just want something sweet. Very casual atmosphere for such a pricey place, but relaxing. Tea service was elegant, it would be nice if they would use nicer dishes to match as it is Fortnum and Mason after all.

Had a table booked at 4.45pm, arrived and told to join the queue even though we had a table pre booked. Waited 40 mins in this queue, still not table and left. Booked for my birthday so very disappointed.

I was so disapointed about the whole experience! I booked this for my friend's Birthday and it was such a shame as the service was awful! It took ages to order and then they messed up the order and gave ours to someone else - in the end we had to chase the waiter again and he finally got our order - by which time our drinks were cold!! I would not go there again!

Ginger beer float was delicious as were ini austrian strudels and black forest gateau....only complaint was we felt slightly rushed..Fortnum and mason is not a place a frequent and generally when going for cake with a friend I am going to have a talk and catch up so perhaps would have been EVEN MORE enjoyable had I not felt so pressured to hurry up
Creative, delicious and perfectly cooked food, friendly and attentive staff and amazing atmosphere....and.....i just can't get enough of the egg-shaped restroom.
Decor is an experience just by itself. The service is freindly. The mix of savor could be scarring but it will be suprisingly excellent . Don't leave without going to the toilet.

Sketch Gallery is a really funky restaurant with 2 bars. From the moment you enter the doors, you can tell that the restaraunt is where the hip people of London eat! Steak was cooked well, crab bisque was a bit too heavy for a starter, though ravioli was cooked to perfection. Make sure to check out the toilets and have a drink in one of the bars.
This was excellent and of relatively good value.  Amazing bathrooms..

My date and I really enjoyed Sketch last week. Very courteous service, great theatre-like experience, fantastic crusty bread. I had the pigeon and foie gras, ordered cooked blue, while my veggie pal had the soba noodles...all delivered spot on. Service was by very cool French people, who were a bit disorganised (an extra glass of champers was carried over from the bar), but they corrected it quickly and made us feel like rock stars. BTW, the toilet pods either work for you or they don't)

Sketch is a fantastic restaurant for atmosphere, decor and ambience, but my husband and I both felt that the food did not live up to our expectations and did not represent good value for money.  We felt like they were trying too hard to be different with the food, but the over complicated variety of ingedients did not really work for us.  We will not be returning to the restaurant, but the bars are fab!!
More of an all round experience rather than just for the food which to my palate was a little too fussy.  Toilets alone were worth the trip though!
The appetizers were quite good, but the udon main was really lacking in anything good that I hope for for udon.
After confirmation of table on Friday 30th August 19 for the following day Saturday 31st August 19, turned up at 9pm as arranged to find it had been shut down for over a week !! üò°üò°üò°
Feels very run down

This place is fantastic. The mussels and clams were a particular highlight, and was the oxtail cannellones. Portions are generous for tapas  and it‚Äôs excellent value. We ate until we were fit to burst, shared a bottle and a half of wine between two and the bill was 40 quid each.

Crowded but such a warm welcome...
First time but treated like a regular.
Food perfect and reasonable prices.

Found on arrival that our electronic booking was not recorded : A table was found, however, warm sea food was served in the sea food salad - defrosted ?  Main courses (one hour after arrival) ; very salty rice with nothing else visible (supposed to be risotto), and chicken which was dried out and turned up at the edges. We couldn‚Äôt eat either. Very disappointing.  Probably fine though, just for happy hour drinks.

We booked to visit on New Years Eve, and when trying to order drinks that were on the menu, we were then told that they actually didn't have any left or do not serve them anyway including a popular brand of beer.

The tandoori mixed starter was okay, small in size for the price you pay but was probably the highlight of the meal.

We ordered 3 different curries between 4 people, a lamb, chicken and prawn dish. All of which tasted exactly the same. It was like someone had cooked the meat, and decided to pour heinz tomato soup with some added cream all over.

Very disappointed for spending over ¬£50 per head

This is my go to Indian place when I have out of town guests or newbies to the city. Service was attentive and very accommodating . Love the sample menu as it allows you to taste many wonderful dishes at one seating . Location is perfect as it on Wardour street and right in the middle of the action.  Check it out !
Being Indian, I obviously compared this to the quality of what I could get at home. It was not close. The atmosphere and service are okay.

The CTM is really one of the best I have had in London so far! Great place to have that fix if you are craving for it. The stand concept feels like a combination of Afternoon tea + indian food, which am not 100% sure as yet. Seeing the food served at afternoon teas are mainly finger food, it would seem appropriate to just pick it off the level of plates; however with the indian curry, it does feel like a different ball game as I found relatively awkward manoeuvring my spoon around the metal bar that acts as the stand. Despite that, the dishes are really delicious, in particular the CTM!

Everyone I went with loved the food and said they would go back there. They have a massive selection on the menu and everything we had was delicious.
My only complaint was the service, our waiter was very nice and tried very hard but was really quite useless - maybe it was his first day?
He didn't seem familiar with anything on the menu and we all had to repeat our orders 3 or 4 times before he understood them. When we got our food half of it was missing and he didn't seem to have any recollection of us ordering it, we finally got it after we'd finished eating everything else.
Service charge was automatically added to our bill ¬£10, which we paid because the food was good.
Very good value for food, portions were large and couldn't finish it all.
Not all that great for a Michelin restuarant in my opinion I am afraid....
Used to be a good place to eat but service, food and ambience have fallen through. Definitely would not recommend.

Imli restaurant - wardour street.    Went there with two other friends.  Had booked a table in advance which was good as place was quite busy on thursday evening.  As promised, the starters (tapas style) were good and enjoyable.  The main course dishes, although of good quality, could have been bigger.  Service was good, although was surprised that they didnt swap plates after first coruse was over.  all in all tho a pleasant experience.

My boyfriend and I had a great meal at Imli in Wardour Street. Our pre theatre menu was served and cleared very promptly, our 3 courses were finished within 80 minutes. Tap water was served without having to ask for it. The pistachio ice cream is very delicious. My only negative would be the portion sizes, a little bit on the small side but all in all a great restaurant  =)

We sampled the pre-theatre menu at Imli, London.  Although the selection was a bit limited, the portion sizes were satisfactory and the dishes very tasty. The staff were attentive and friendly.  We left pleasantly sated and would certainly return.

Imli, Soho. The pre-theatre meal was great choice for us on a Friday evening after work. Although portions were small as most people mentioned but it was perfectly filling enough with the added vegetable curry on the side and a cocktail. Will go back for the standard menu next time. Great friendly reception and general overall service on a busy night.

imli restaurant. not as impressed on this second visit. the dishes were average and the service a little slow, as our drinks orders were not taken for 15mins and we were ready to order at that point. maybe an off day for them.

Imli was a good choice for dinner. We had a free meal via toptable and we felt that it was really nice. Service was very friendly and the staff even gave us a complimentary dish. The food itself was pretty average although the squid which we ordered as extra was tasty.
good food , excellent friendly service . decent size portions.interesting combinations of spice and food
Imli restaurant. Decor was good. Food was Ok not fantastic but very good for the price.
Imli in Soho is tasty Indian tapas, portions aren't huge but they are not on stingy either. Service is friendly and speedy and the atmosphere is buzzy, a good place for a qucik catch up with friends.
Imli on Wardour street serves tasty food and does good cocktails.  All for a very reasonable price.
Imli was a good dining experience for a Monday night - vast amount of food on the set menu, with tasty options and twists on familiar favourites. Service v attentive and swift.

This was the first time I have taken Reward points and did not expect too much. However, the experience was much better than then expectation, mainly thsnks to the attentiveness and personability of the staff. The food was good, too.

A very different concept for Indian Food TAPAS. We had the all you can eat for 19.95 excellent value and a good range of quality food. The staff where knowledgable and attentive without being in your face. we will be back when in london again. a busy and popular restaurant and you can see why when you dine there.
Superb! Great vibes, good food.
Imli - helpful friendy staff, beautifully presented food.  Excellent for lunch or meeting with friends

Really tasty, good quality food and a really fun idea to offer it tapas-style. You get to try a lot of different flavours you wouldnt normally order and all complimented each other well. Ice cream was amazing!

We had a great meal at Imli, it's got quite a chic, trendy feel, far from your average curry house. The food was tasty and well presented and for two girls with reasonable appetites, we found the portions large. We ordered 4 tapas and it would have been enough for at least 3 hungry people. As it was, the staff, who were lovely, were happy to pack us a doggy bag. The location very handy for us as we often go clubbing in the area; we'll definitely be back.
Food was average. Different. Not your traditional Indian restaurant but worth a visit.
I have been to Imli several times and it has always been fantastic.  Indian tapas is a great concept and at Imli it has always been incredibly flavoursome!
very good food would go back
The food and service at Imli is always fantastic, and the 2 for 1 offers they always have make it fantastic value. Definitely worth a visit.

Went to Imli 14th August for dinner with friends. Service was a bit on the slow side, but friendly and helpful, and the food was just great. Lots of variety, really good value, and will definitely go again.

The service at Imli, Wardour street was first class. The food was great, the aloo chaat and the mango and basil ice-cream in particular were amazing.
It was good value for money and i definitely wouldn't hesitate to go again!

Imli a firm favourite - never lets us down, and we love the little touches of the welcome mini lassis, little joss stick as you leave... all the staff are so courteous and helpful...nevermind the food being DELICIOUS!!! LOVE IT!!!!!!
Some of the dishes at Imli were not served hot enough and had to be reheated.

We took the 2-for-1 menu, which is like a selection of Indian 'tapas' style dishes, including some delicious curries. The atmosphere was 'buzzing' but relaxed, and the service was really friendly. We'll definitely be going back.

Great value for money especially with the 2 for 1 offer.  We had a farewell dinner with our colleagues, and had the tasting menu.  Friendly and efficient service. We had a great time! Recommended for groups.

I've been here several times over the past two years, and it's become my "go-to" restaurant for taking out-of-towners.  They serve creative and modern "fusion" Indian...it's not another curry house.  The food has been consistently excellent and the service has been consistently attentive and accomodating.  The set menus are very filling and are particularly good value for money.
Food at Imli was very good. The service might be a little slow but it was definitely worth a wait.

IMLI restaurant, Wardour Street, London
Tasty and light indiian food served tapas style. Not the usual dishes found in a regular curry house - more fragrant and authentic

All in all I was a little disappointed by Imli.  The venue was OK but nothing special - the positon of our table by the door and lack of other diners didn't help.  The service was attentive but not as friendly as it might have been, though they coped well with our group of eight.  My biggest complaint was that the food wasn't as exciting as I'd hoped.  The dishes just weren't distinctive enough from each other.

The food at Imli is nice, but a little pricey. We booked on the 50% off special menu deal which was ¬£15 but decided this was too expensive for what we would get. We had the set lunch instead which was around ¬£7 each.

confusing menu, not allowed to order what we wanted. when i reminded them i had reserved through top table they gave us a completetly different menu that was pre set and with no price on it. i felt i was made a 2nd class diner. however the food did make up for the way we were treated. be ware top table diners if you use the offer you lose your choice of food. Manager was not helpful and infact refused to come to table to discuss our dietary requirements. especially as one of my guests was an oap
Definitely worth going on the 50% off menu as food was very fresh, tasty and plentiful.  Would seem a bit pricey otherwise.

We booked the tasting menu which offered a good selection of the dishes on offer. Service was friendly and accomodating although a little hap hazard at times, one of our party was gluten and dairy intolerant and while we tucked in they had to watch and wait for a good 15 mins before any food arrived. I thought the portions were just the right size and the flavours and textures were great. I don't think it offers great value at full price but with the toptable offer it makes for a good night out

Imli is perfect for cheap eats (on the TT 50% off deal) with mates after a few drinks in soho. It was very busy, even on a tuesday night, so we were kept waiting for our table but there was good atmosphere and decent service. Would go back.
Imli is a contemprary indian restaurant with speedy service, Indian tapas style menu and pleasent modern decor.  Worth a trip particularly if on special offer.

Tried to call to make a booking, no answer. Tried at least 5 times. Made a booking through open table but then saw a four day old review that someone else had made a booking but when they arrived they were closed for renovations. Tried to call again and the line was constantly engaged. Booked somewhere else instead but not impressed with their shoddy communication, nothing on their website either
Kelis was there in the flesh and she can put some serious food together complimented with the amazing Le Bun, two set menus, had both and it was amazing! American+French & South American!

Loved the food and atmosphere. Ambience great upstairs and each dish was better than the the next. The volcano makiu was out of this world!
And for dessert, make sure you have the chocolate garden as one of your options!
Will be going back to try more off the menu for sure. Great place to take someone special and the waiters were awesome with their recommendations as well.
I need their playlist as the music was just perfect for listening and having a conversation as well.
Amazing food (including deserts!) and quick service. Nice atmosphere as well - the only small (-) being the music, a bit too intense to my taste.
New place with excellent food and one of the mojitos I have ever had. It's a kind of tapas approach to a menu so you need to order 3-4 plates each.

Good staff
Good food
Good alcohol selection!

Thanks!

There is no Red Fort - it is closed. Why can‚Äôt Opentable inform customers about closures? We booked this for a Saturday night on a trip to London - the busiest night of the week. We couldn‚Äôt find anywhere else at 7.30, Thanks Opentable - great evening üò†
We expected a lot and were very disappointed. The food was lukewarm and the service quite aloof, for quite an expensive meal.

We went to the Red Fort for a family birthday celebration. We chose the chef's menu. The food was superb. Wonderful flavours. The service was charming. We know they were busy and we felt no time was left between the starters and main course. Even so, we would go again. The only downside is that it is a bit pricey.

I booked here for my colleagues visiting from Dallas, they don't get a lot of good authentic Indian food in their town so this was a real treat for them. They enjoyed their meal here immensly and will go back next time they are in town.

Two of us dined on the pre-theatre set menu in mid-August. A far less enjoyable experience than previously, due largely to the significant reduction in quantity offered by this deal, compared with three months earlier (no side dishes, breads, coffee or papadums included in the offer any longer, but at the same price). The Red Fort website still advertised the previous deal that day, but on arrival we were presented with the new offer. Still hungry after two courses, we went for the dessert. This appeared to have been bought-in, which I would not expect from a restaurant of this standard. Service was slow and staff bickered with each other about my booking on arrival. The least enjoyable experience I've had through Toptable so far.
great food. a bit pretentious and quite pricey. good location

We actually had to complain about the service - wait staff didn't even acknowledge we were real live people, didn't speak english (an ongoing issue in London that needs to be dealt with - I'm all for people working hard and learning a language but when you can't communicate in an expensive restaurant in the home language my support is gone). Red Fort needs to up its game -  if it wasn't for the food being pretty good and the bar downstairs being quite excellent, I'd say pack it in and go home.

Contemporary look and feel. Prawn starters very tasty. Main course lamb biryani was overly dry and a bit tasteless, but the chicken main was very fine indeed.  In my opinion, a little expensive however.

A fantastic experience. Service at Red Fort is unequalled and the food is out of this world. A true feel of India, the ingredients are carefully sleected an dthe flavours well balanced. I would have liked some clear indication as to how spicy the dishes were, but apart from that there's nothing to fault.

We arrived at 5.30pm as we were going to the theatre. Not sure what happened but at 6.45 we had to chase the waiter for our mains as they still had not arrived. In the end half of us had to leave our mains to get to the theatre in time for the show. Food was really good, and have been several times before, so not sure what went wrong.

A fantastic place for ramen, small menu but they offer top quality. Felt a bit uncomfortable with the service, the venue is extremely small and the staff was therefore standing at our table watching us. Drinks we ordered never  came but they provided water as soon as we were seated which was very kind.
Alex was very helpful and his attention to detail, friendliness and care for our wellbeing was excellent - a lovely meal and fantastic view and a great way to celebrate a birthday!
The property address revealed that the restaurant does not exist! The location was an empty shell with no notice as to where the restaurant may have relocated! A wasted trip.
The staff were very attentive and the food was very good! Loved the vibe and luckily was not overcrowded! Hidden gem from the chaos of Piccadilly Circus!
It was wonderful just what a pizza should be like. Plenty of toppings and lots of cheese with ample flavour. Yum
Great tasting pizza, was back for 2nd time, will be back again
The pizza was so tasty! The service was quick and efficient
We went for my wifes 30th birthday and she had a fantastic meal so couldn't ask for anything more.
Lovey evening meal, good range of food though not amazing for vegetarians. Food came out fairly quickly, some of it got cold quite quickly.

I booked this restaurant for a meal for my daughters 18th birthday , it was an absolute disgrace the meals were cold they didn't have a clue what they were doing . When you ordered the meal you would get the meal but have to wait 20minutes for the rice to go with it .we came to london from liverpool and I chose this restaurant because it had descent reviews it was one of the worst I have ever been to ,my daughter ended up in tears and we walked out of the restaurant it ruined what should have been a special occasion . I wouldn't recommend this restaurant to anyone it is a disgrace.
Service was not very friendly and hard to get waiters‚Äô attention. Relatively high priced for what it was
Hot and spicy! Best and authentic! It's like my canteen and always the choice for my Chinatown visit.
We booked on OpenTable only to arrive and have the restaurant tell us they weren't accepting bookings.

I was extremely disappointed with both Rextail Restaurant and OpenTable as I booked a table for 2 for the 31st October and received a confirmation from OpenTable, only to turn up to the restaurant with my wife and find that it is closed for renovation!!  I do not understand why reservations are being made and confirmed when the restaurant is not even operating.  Since this has happened, I am not sure I can trust OpenTable for future reservations.

Not sure if this was issue with restaurant or OpenTable, but had a reservation confirmed for Saturday night only to be told on arrival that they had a private function.
Needless to say, finding a table on a Saturday night without a booking isn‚Äôt exactly fun.
Fantastic fresh dishes. Excellent service. Original ambiance. Will definitely be returning
Great food, great atmosphere. I‚Äôm a sucker for Asian food and Scott the chef director looked after us amazingly well. Get the pork belly wrapped in lettuce!
A really special place. Amazing flavours. Lovely people. Edgy, innovative, energetic, interesting. Love it. Love it.

Every dish was truly delicious! Service was attentive but not imposing.
Our only complaint was that we didn‚Äôt have room in our tummies to try everything on the menu!
Quick service, yummy fresh food. Very good location and have photo menu that easy to order
I was contacted via text 4 hours before my booking  that the restaurant was permanently closed

I visited this restaurant on Saturday (27/10/18) for brunch with my partner. We were very excited as the reviews were quite good. Overall the food was ok, but not amazing, and there were barely any options for people who do not like spicy food. The real problem came when I ordered a coffee and found a hair, floating in it. This was incredibly off putting.  I realise that things like this happen but, although, the staff were apologetic, I was given a replacement coffee which I then still had to pay for. I think that good customer service would have taken the coffee off the bill or would have at least offered to do so. There are too many brunch places in London to risk going to this one and not being offered proper customer service. I have had lesser issues at other venues and have been treated much better. Not worth the money.
Went to celebrate a friends exam results. Delicious, fresh Mexican food and great cocktails! Would definitely recommend. Excellent gluten free options and knowledgeable waitstaff.
Really good for a quick pre theatre meal. The food was really nice and the drinks deals made it very reasonable. Would definitely go again.

The food was good. It is mainly full of groups so it is buzzy atmosphere. The staffare efficient, more efficient than the first time we went. We waitied so long for our deinks that my boyfriend went and collected them off the bar. Overall all totally worth it with toptable.
very friendly waiters. drinks took a while though. very friendly atmosphere.
Excellent value, great food, would especially recommend  chilli lamb rump, it is lovely.

Arrived Ruby Blue 7.pm Place buzzing but got very noisy with arrival of 2 large parties. Table in middle row . Felt we were in Piccadilly circus!  Many waiters and people passing did not make meal very restful.Our waiter was wonderful. Food was great but steak ordered as rare was medium.Pork ribs were fantastic.  Large portions- could only eat 2 courses. Very very good value for money with 50% off food( and wine in happy hour. ) Had to use torch to read menu. A good evening but too loud

Ruby Blue in Leicester Square is a great venue for a pre-theatre meal. The set menu was great and good quality. The chocolate fudge cake/chocolate brownie (they told us they were the same thing)was a bit dry and neither fudge cake or a brownie, but the mains were great. We realise after we had left that we had been totally overcharge. 3 meals at ¬£10.95 and a ¬£16.00 bottle of wine and the bill came to ¬£63. Not to impressed but guess it was also our error. Would go back again.
Ruby Blue - London.  Great atmosphere, good service and quick if doing pre theatre.  Food nice.
Great Food, great atmosphere as usual, will go back. The lamb rump is especially yummy. Great price with 50% offer, as well as happy hour drinks.
Ruby Blue, another successfull night with family, much enjoyed and good value. Nice price, nice food, nice staff, nice venue, nice location....... what more do you want?

Excellent value for money with 50% off food 7-9pm and 50% off drinks during happy hour 5-8pm.  Food was lovely.  Recommend the seabass.  Great ambience with piano player who was fabulous, if not ever so slightly too loud.  All in all a great meal and will definitely be back.
My visit to Ruby Blue this time was very good only marred by some inconsiderate women on the table behind who make a lot of noise.

The food was inexpensive at Ruby Blue which was great...but it tasted so. More like a slap up dish rather than a well created one. Nevertheless it was only ¬£15 a head which for a starter plus main plus wine - excellent value.

Ruby blue-Lovely venue, very close to tube and waiters were all very helpful. Had the 'fantastic  menu' 2 courses for ¬£10, but only one veggie option which according to my friend was overcooked and a little bland. Also, they must like it cold in there as the air con was freezing!
Nice food, great location.  With TT offer is a very reasonable night out - we had lots of fun!

My husband and I went to Ruby Blue last night and had a really fun night.  A wonderful pianist was playing - started with more mellow music, but as the night progressed got the restaurant going and all were singing together.  The fun mood was complimented by great dishes, the food was delicious and the service was quite good as well.  Our whole experience was great and just a really fun evening.  We will definitely be back.

Ruby Blue on Thursday was well worthy of 9's across the board ( I didn't go to the loo...). Service very attentive but not "in your face", 3 course (with 50% off) meal was delicious, ambience was great. The pianist was very good! and all for just ¬£30 including drinks, for TWO!! Bargain!! An excellent evening out.

I really enjoyed my meal here - with the 50% off it made for a really nice evening in (usually very expensive) Leicester Sq.  The piano playing live in the background was a nice touch too.  Friendly staff.

Once again Ruby Blue met my expectations of delivering quality food at next to nothing (three courses for ¬£14.95). The cocktails were yummy and the wine was reasonablly priced at ¬£14.95 per bottle. And to top it off, the attractive piano man kept us entertained throughout the night with easy listening and popular tunes. I wouldn't recommend the venue for a romantic dinner on a Sat night, but it suited the occasion. I've been other times ealry in the week with my partner and it was perfect.

Disappointed with Ruby Blues. We had booked a table for dinner after the theatre but also decided to have pre-theatre drinks. Upon arriving the placed is old, worn and tattered. No-one was on reception. The Bar- seats have cigerette burns , the bar menus where damp and dirty and the toilets had no paper in them. I decided to check out the resturant only to find a group of ladies leaving because service was poor and they were dissaponted in the food. I cancelled our reservation on the spot.
Went on a thursday after work with a friend, the food was ok abit bland, but the service was very good and friendly which is as important as the food!!!!
Fab deal of 50% off and a free jug of cocktail! Restaurant was great for a relaxed night out, the food was great and really good value for money.
Fantastic value - great food!
The changed menu wasn't that good the chicken should not be called a salad 2 bits of frilly lettuce and 4 thin strips of chicken.

Been many times and can't fault it. Outstanding value, varied menu with lots of choices, excellent  service. Lovely colourful d√©cor and cosy. There is also limited outside pavement area for dining. A gem in the heart of London.
I have been here a few times great location, great food and great value for money
They care. It shows in the results.

I have used the Frith St branch and the one that used to be in covent garden several times. They offer a no nonsense set menu for about ¬£11 with a mix of turkish and mediterranean food. The choice is good and I have never had a problem bringing guests here. The meze starter is great and portion size is huge. My favourite is probably the kofte meat balls but it is all good and I would have no hesitation in going back or recommending it. Sometimes it is deserted at lunchtime. I don't know what it is like in evenings, but there is plenty of space.

Bistro 1 on Frith Street is a nice little restaurant close to Piccadilly, with a pleasant atmosphere. The staff are very friendly and the service was good. The food was OK, but not amazing. Given how cheap it is I'm not surprised. I would go back to try the grilled meat options as I think these may be better than the fish I had (it was full of bones).

It's a very cheap menu, with very quick service which makes it a safe option for pre-theatre (and why we chose it). The quality of the food is ok, but don't expect more than you pay for. There are plenty of good options on Frith Street, so I probably wouldn't go here again unless other nearby options were unavailable.

I've dined at the Covent Garden part of the chain a few times before but this was the first at this one...the venue/menu/atmosphere is exactly the same and from that perspective I'd recommend it. We were in a rush for the theatre on Valentines Day (only 1 hour to eat and leave really) and when our steak arrived it was cold...we couldn't wait for a new one or we'd have missed the show so really the quality of the meal was very disappointing and I'm not sure if I'd go there again when in such a rush/such a special occasion as it was like they couldn't cope with the number of people there at once.
This restaurant is pretty casual but the food and value are outstanding. Great find!
Bistro 1 was good value food, not fussy and quick before the cinema.
Green's was wonderful as ever, look forward to seeing you when you have new premises :-)

This was our first visit to a test kitchen and to be fair we both really enjoyed it.

The ingredients used really did compliment each other to make for a really enjoyable tasting experience.

As always with this type of cooking - there is never enough :-)

Great food and venue. Only problem was that they set a limit on the table for the next booking and so we were rushed. To be fair they did inform us beforehand but it was very clear they were rushing us and so was hard to fully enjoy it.
Lovely evening and the service was exceptional!
Really exciting and innovative food. Insanely expensive but hey
Wonderful dining experience, must try octopus and tostitadas
Visit to London from Montreal, Canada

Food was very good. while our waitress was good, the restaurant's ability to cater for allergies on the set menu was rather unhelpful, even when we spoke to the floor manager. Quiet a few stag and hen groups early evening and was initially noisy but got better later as the groups left. The Coat check and front desk needs some review - long queues with 4 or 5 staff chatting - chaotic and not very clear who was incharge. Shame as the food was quite nice. Cocktails were okay.
The food was decent but the service was very slow and inattentive
the brunch was excellent value for money, very good food

Service was awful! Really disappointed to even have to be writing a review, however, our waiter was inattentive, rude, and slow! I had to waive at him to get his attention or ask for our waiter multiple times. Our food came at awkward times (he did not inform us that food would se served as it comes) and clearly forgot about our last two dishes and put the order in late (I saw him walk over to the area and ask). After the sushi came 45 min late I told him to cancel it and he argued that it‚Äôs been ordered and would not. Later he came back and said he took it off the bill, but it was still there. I was entertaining business clients so it was a difficult situation to argue and also uncomfortable for them to have such a poor experience.
Really enjoyable and excellent food, a lot of choice of dishes

Extremely pricey in compare to the food that you get .
The portion size is small and taste is awfull
The food is amazing but the only bad point is the music that is too loud ... it‚Äôs a pitty because we can‚Äôt even speak with people at our table...

The pre-theatre bento box was very tasty and good portion sizes. Considering the quality of the dishes and that a glass of prosecco was included, ¬£27 seemed quite reasonable.  The service was good to begin with but became quite slow when we needed the bill to get to the theatre in time. We were then given a bill with a 13.5% service charge added onto which I thought was outrageous and refused to pay. Overall, highly recommend for pre-theatre but do not appreciate having such a large service charge incorporated.
Food was amazing and it was combined with great music, great atmosphere and very good service. Top option.
Creative cuisine At a fair price. Great service and pleasing decor. A surprising find. We plan to definitely return.
Great atmosphere. We ate at 6pm so had the pre-theatre menu - great value and super quality food.

Sadly they have changed their menu and it's not as Peruvian as it is 'Fusion Asian & Japanese'. They took of most ceviches off the menu and left only the seabass one. It's ok. Generally service was ok. A bit disappointed as it was a real gem and is now just average. Gotta look for another Peruvian now. Luckily there are a few in town.
Great food, exceptionally chaotic surroundings and service
slow service and awkward waitressspare menue needed

We had the pre-theatre menu, which is good value for money. Presentation of the bento box was excellent and the sushi and ceviche was really tasty. Desert was a creme brulet, mochi and chocolate creme. I loved the creme brulet with the citrusy flavour and the mochi were not too sweet.

Tried Pollo den miso one of their top sellers. So good. Asado de tira and vegetables al vapor also fantastic. Noisy ambience upstairs, loud music, dark lighting. Show cook kitchen working non stop, the smell is even tasty. Mocchi is real good, 3 different flavors, hand made. French rose wine very good. Did not try the cocktails but saw them running off quickly from other tables. People seem to be in the mood for this house music loud music atmosphere combined with efficient dishes.

Loved the food and experience.  The pre theatre Bento Box was great value and very tasty.  A good way to try a few dishes as this restaurant was a new experience for us.   It was no problem for one of the chicken dishes to be swapped for my vegetarian friend.  Liked the toilets especially the disco ball in the cubicle I visited!
Great food and far better value for money than Nobu. Very attentive staff

We had an 8.30 booking on a Friday night
On arrival, we were immediately warned that our booking was for 2 hours only and that we were to vacate our table for 10.30. However, our table was not ready until 9.40!! We were compensated with free prosecco- thank you Chocco Matte- however my friend who is currently post-partum and breastfeeding was absolutely starving!!!
Once seated we were excited by the menu and the food arrived promptly and was absolutely delicious! No complaints there. Great menu for sharing and would recommend for groups.

I think this restaurant will be best enjoyed mid-week when less chaotic
And the table allocations clearly need to be for longer so as to not leave customers waiting around.

My friends and I dined here (4 of us) this evening and I was impressed with the service (we ordered 10 dishes) and they came to our table staggered 2 at a time allowing us to enjoy the food without our table becoming cluttered). I am half Peruvian so I can say that the flavouring was authentic (though milder in terms of spiciness). We were are very satisfied after sharing these dishes. Though our table was only booked for 2 hour we were not rushed at all and encouraged to continue ordering. Our bill with 2 bottles of champagne came to ¬£225 which is good value for such a great experience. Would highly recommend trying this restaurant and I will spending more time there too. I suggest a table upstairs so that you can see the cooking too.

We booked in advance through Open Table and on the evening the 6 of us turned up the restaurant was closed for refurbishment. What the hell are Open Table doing taking bookings for restaurants that are not open for business. Ruined the evening we had planned. Not amused AT ALL.

What a treat!  Every dish ordered arrived looking beautiful and wow, it didn't stop there, the taste experience was absolutely delicious.  I've formulated with frankincense, pink pepper, orange, vetiver, coriander, tarragon etc when making perfumes but to taste them in different dishes was so interesting.

Friendly, informed and easy going staff. Cool Scandinavian interior. All dishes we had were of different taste sensation. We were moved to Jamaica...better than going there. Next time we will try the dishes we did not have."Metro" was wrong about the Steak Tartar. It was delicious. How one gets the chilies absolutely right?! Incredible.

I booked Soho bar & kitchen for mine and my friends birthday gathering. I let the bar know beforehand and on our arrival we were shown to our table and then offered free bubbly for all! What a lovely surprise. This really started our evening off our evening in style. We then went on to their elderflower cocktails which went down far too easily !! We shared nachos for starters and had steaks/ribs for mains. The food was lovely however the service was a little slow. That evening was very busy so they must be popular!
I loved the style and ambience and would definitely recommend.
Lovely welcome and staff, pretty decor , nice ambiance but very small portions of not-perfect food,  overly priced. For that reason only , I would not recommend.

We were booked for 6.00 pm, arrived a little late but no table available for us.  We were given a complimentary glass of prosecco whilst we waited - nice touch!  After about 10 mins we were shown to a table.  Service was friendly and quick.  My friend ordered Parmagiana chicken, which she enjoyed.  My risotto was tasteless and microwaved.  Portion size was not very generous either.
a pleasant meal well served with good wine. Good value for money in London too!
closed down with a last minute email which we didn't see because we was out in London - group of 10! not easy to find another restaurant. ended up in pizza hut!
The menu is not explained well... the food was ok.  Ended up paying ¬£25.80 per person which is a lot considering we didn‚Äôt eat very much in this ‚Äòbuffet‚Äô...  we won‚Äôt be going back there.
This restaurant has closed down but is still listed on OpenTable....
Lovely food and good service.
Great food and service. Went there to celebrate a special occasion and had Some of the best Asian fusion we‚Äôve had in London!

I usually visit Novikov and never have any complaints. But on this occasion I was truly disappointed. I usually order the seafood and beef dishes but this time I decided to try chicken. I ordered the chicken with black bean sauce. It was very crispy and too hard to eat. So I made a complaint and the waiter offered another chicken dish. When the second dish arrived, the chicken served was raw and not cooked properly at all. I was already put off my meal by then. I don‚Äôt want to put any of you off by uploading the pics of the raw chicken. The waiter said the chef had apologised. But sadly this experience was not up to the standard I usually have when I visit Novikov.

Love the vibe
Love the food
Love the concept and food
food was really good but it is ridiculously expenive and could go somewhere else for same food but cheaper
Duck salad was disgusting
Food was amazing! Great service too. One of my favourites

Came here for my partner's 30th arrived early and they accommodated us straight away.
The service was attentive and polite and the food was delicious, they made the effort and brought my partner a dessert with a sparkler.
Music was too loud, rest was awesome
Halloween dinner
Amazing food, lively atmosphere. Great place for groups. Tables a little close together - the table next to us complained we were being too noisy!!! Service was fantastic and cocktails were fab too
A nice place with delicious food I recommend it.

Great service. They offered you hand towels and small snacks to start with which was sweet.

Good value for the lunch dim sum set. The food was innovative. Some of them were a bit salty though.

I have eaten at this restaurant on a number of occasions but was disappointed this time. It is an expensive restaurant but if the food is excellent that is fine this time it did not come anywhere near its usual standard and the staff arguing behind us was an added annoyance.
Very nice food (Again). The service however too hasty..

go elsewhere

service was poor , miserable waitress and unless your a regular customer you don't even get noticed

The quality of food you would expect for the prices. The real treat for us was the bar downstairs. We went before and after our meal and got seats both times. The cocktails were really something special. Next time we would be tempted to eat downstairs too.

This is one of my favorite restaurants in London, So fresh & creative Asian...
All the menu is so good..
HAd an excellent meal, service was very good, food amazing, and overall bill for four of us was no where nearly as expensive as i had anticipated.

There's nothing value for money here - in terms of food - but great ambiance, excellent service and a stunning seafood and vegetable market bar. At ¬£50 a head, you'll leave hungry. But it doesn't matter so much............

Would have liked abit more personal space between tables as the restaurant was quiet and all other guests were whispering to converse with each other. So we reduced from the full menu and ate elsewhere. X

I live close to central London and I‚Äôm always dining with friends and family in the area in all different types of restaurants
But this was by far the worst service we have had in many many years can‚Äôt even remember the last time it was so bad
First time to the Italian restaurant normally we go to novikovs other restaurant
First and last time

Kept waiting for table
Offered complimentary drink but no menu to order
We didn‚Äôt want to pay 15% discretionary service, as we didn‚Äôt think service had been that good, they weren‚Äôt happy (we paid 10%)
Said there was no room in the downstairs bar for a post dinner drink. When I said I was never coming back they found a table
Really poor services. The waiters are very rude. I would not recommend anyone and don‚Äôt plan to go back
Restaurant was delicious but table that was offered for 3 people was behind a pole and awkward.
Great food and ambience. Lovely staff and a small surprise for my birthday made my day. I will definitely visit Novikov again.

Amazing vibe in this place,food fabulous,fresh fish bar and amazing menu. Some items on menu VERY pricey and we got stung on wine, we ordered three glasses of house red and it was ¬£24 per glass, I‚Äôll read the menu myself next time. The staff were fabulous and the clientele quite glamorous.
It was amaaaazing
The poor service from the staff sadly outweighed the beautiful design and excellent food. I will never be going back.

Ambience and layout of restaurant is great, the food is tasty but portions are not satisfying enough. Portion size is not reflected in price. My opionion is that the food is over priced for small portions. Not a hearty Italian feast I was hoping for.

Even though there were some good vegetarian options at Novikov Italian, the food was average and nothing special or extraordinary given that Novikov Asian is far superior.  Sorry guys at Novikov...you need to up your game.  At the prices you are charging the food did not live up to the Novikov standards.

I really liked the atmosphere but I am not sure if the food is match what some people said about the food taste

I have been to different Italian restaurant around the world but this one is no different than a regular ones.

The prices is very expensive and not meet the food quality...

The food at Novikov italian was amazing. However I was very let down by the service. The waitress who served us seemed very impatient and did not wait for us to finish our meal before whisking away our plates. I had specified that it was my sisters birthday that we had come to celebrate however no importance was taken to that fact.
An excellent choice for a group celebration of five people.The service was excellent and the food just delicious.We were in the Italian restaurant and will return at the earliest occasion.
Delightful staff and good Italian food.  Obviously tables on. the pavement is a temporary situation, but thank you for a pleasant  lunch, making the best of these tricky times.
A wonderful evening, thank you so much to all the staff, very clever use of outside seating and an evening to be remembered. Our first big outing since lockdown and it was certainly worth the wait

Felt neglected by staff, never offered refill on tea or the food. Staff didn't clear our plates and afternoon tea stand was mainly used for us to put our dirty plates on. Didn't feel like a festive afternoon tea especially one for ¬£78 per person no 5 star service
Excellent afternoon tea. Nothing too much trouble. Lovely birthday experience.

Wonderful venue and impeccable service.  I'd been here before and was excited to come back, and even more so to see that Palm Court is still doing the set menu plus a cocktail for ¬£35 pp. An amazing price - and the menu looked great. However, when we arrived we found out that the set menu had changed so what is available online is not what you will get.  Past menus included lobster bisque, burratina, braised lamb and lovely tatins and tarts for dessert. Sadly I can't say that either I or my partner were as excited about the current menu. The vegetarian options were both a little disappointing, but for the price at this venue of course it was all incredible. I think we were just a little spoilt in the past and excited about a menu that we didn't ultimately get but I recognise this is an error on the OpenTable website that needs updating. Overall, still an amazing and memorable evening and we'll be back.

I‚Äôd been looking forward to this for months, and having been before a few years ago had high expectations. Sadly these just weren‚Äôt met.
The staff were fab, but afternoon tea is supposed to be an experience. The sandwiches came out all ready dished on a plate each, and they just lacked excitement. Selecting them from a stand is half the fun. The scones were the best I‚Äôve ever had, buttery but light and exactly the treat they should be.
The sweet treats again came out plated up not ready to select at will, and we‚Äôre just a bit ‚Äòmeh‚Äô. They were tasty but not inspiring or provocative, and after seeing Cherish in action on tv I just felt like something was missing. For a solidly traditional afternoon tea I would choose the ritz or actually the lanesborough was excellent, but this just made me a little sad.
FINALLY - and this is an issue, the tables! The chairs are not lounge chairs they are upright for dining, so the fact that the tables are so low you can‚Äôt fit your legs under makes the whole thing really uncomfortable. Make the tables higher or the chairs more comfortable!
We visited for Afternoon Tea with family.  Ambience and service were excellent but the food let it down unfortunately.

Afternoon tea experience was outstanding!! Great food especially the cakes!! Made my experience better by giving me a cake to celebrate my birthday.
Staff very attentive and informative of the teas. The room was lovely excellent decor and made to feel special. Thankyou we will be returning.
Lovely afternoon tea. There was no pressure to leave once the 2 hours was over. The staff are super helpful and friendly.

An amazing afternoon tea - the scones & home made jams were some of the best I have had.  Our waiter was attentive & made us feel special.  He recommended some amazing teas which I would never have tried & they complimented the different courses perfectly.
Excellent service and felt throughly spoilt and our waiter Matt, was exceptional.

Luxurious setting inside the Langham hotel. Had the set lunch menu with a choice of three items for each course .  Octopus carpaccio was exceptionally good.  Also enjoyed the belly pork. Portions are small, so overall the prices are expensive but the food is delicious and beautifully presented. A calm respite from the bustle of Oxford Street.
food quality is very good, location is perfect as well as the atmosphere. Highly recommend trying.

My husband and I, visited the Palm Court in July for our wedding anniversary.
It was so superb, delicious and beautiful food, very lovely ambient, very nice and helpful people working at the restaurant. Would recommend to everyone it is very special place.

The excellent waiter made the day.  He was informative, efficient and friedLy.  He organised a little cake with a candle when I commented that it was my daughter's birthday.  We were very surprised. Lovely lunch and look forward to  our next visit.

Found the menu layout for High Tea confusing, and explanation by waiter also unclear about what the difference between afternoon tea and high tea was. Expected Jazz live music, rather than pianist, as per web site. Felt rushed between champagne and tea. Tea not topped up often enough, and therefore got cold quickly. Different tea varieties not promoted. Expected White Glove service.

Very attentive service.  Food was excellent.  The sandwiches were unique.  Tea and scones were delicious.  The star was the desserts, beautiful and artistic.  I plan to return next year to see what the dessert tray will be :)

Greeted like an old friend. The newly decorated Palm Court had xmas tree and other xmas decorations. Not in your face but tastefully arranged. We had Langham afternoon tea, which came with wonderful xmas inspired finger sandwiches and little cakes.  We were able to try as many of the tastes again as we wished. A lttle birthday cake turned up which was a complete surprise as neither of us had organised it.  The experience was a wonderful start to festive period.
Lovely afternoon staff and service excellent.  No sense  of being hurried beautifully prepared afternoon tea with  special attention paid to one of our party who is vegetarian. Great experience.

Everything about this experience was just as it should be. The service, ambience, food presentation could not be faulted. We were made to feel at ease and all and all it was a very enjoyable afternoon. I would say that it was a little on the pricey side but for a special occasion it was worth it
Not only is the food incredible, the venue, the service and the ambiance are, without doubt, 5 star.

Staff were friendly, great ambience. Food was good, however not amazing (compared to Sketch). We want to give special thanks to the pianist who played amazingly well. We very much enjoyed his performance! :-)

I visited Palm Court with my partner on a weekday evening. Had been a bit sceptical about what the food would be like as the place is so well known mainly for the afternoon tea. What a great surprise! Food is so tasty and faultlessly cooked. The dishes may not be the most imaginative or experimental, but who cares when food is bursting with flavour. Great value with TT offer which includes two decent glasses of wine. Service was also friendly and just right. Go when you can!

We were disappointed with our visit - service was very hit and miss, tea was poured immediately and was far too weak, we had to ask for plates to be removed with sandwiches which were not to our liking after sitting there for 10 minutes (what is that brown bread? treacle? chocolate? guinness? - with salmon, bizarre ) and we had to ask for more tea twice. The cakes were tiny and very sweet, we couldn't even eat the lollipop one it was pure sugar, although the scones were lovely. And the glass of champagne was a very small measure, maybe because it finished the bottle off, I thought she would return with a fresh bottle but no. Overall ok but would not return or recommend, not a patch on tea in the Winter Garden at the Landmark.
The attendants were outstanding and catered to our halal needs. Definitely will come back!

Lovely afternoon tea although felt we were rushed at the end. Food very good but would not recommend the smoked salmon on dark rye bread as it was completely tasteless. Otherwise the overall experience was lovely.
Lovely, tasty afternoon tea.Very attentive and friendly staff. I had ordered gluten-free and vegetarian food, which was provided and was excellent.
Palm Court at the Langham lives up to its reputation, with impeccable service and a decadent high tea experience
went here for a coffee with a client and would absolutly come back again - treated very well, not rushed at all and lovely atmosphere.
We have been to quite a few hotels for afternoon tea over the years and The Langham is up there in my top 3

We went as a group of 4 for afternoon tea which was a really good sized group as we comfortably fitted around a round table and very easily chatted away about 2.5 hours. The food looked amazing and tasted even better. Don't be fooled into thinking there isn't enough food because there is - we ended up having to take almost all of our sweets home as we'd asked for an extra plate of sandwiches which filled us up! The tea just kept flowing, with the waiting staff being extremely attentive and ensuring we had enough tea all the time.

We had an afternoon tea for two at Palm Court of the Langham Hotel. It was okay but not more than that. One expects more remarkable food and a little more personal attention from the staff for the price one pays. The only nice thing about this place is the ambiance. I will not go there again.

A lovely afternoon tea in a beautiful room with a pianist playing in the background.  We were offered extra sandwiches and scones, which we ate with glee, plus an extra cupcake, whilst we were finishing the miniature cakes from the cakestand.  Scones in particular were delicious.  The Top Table offer was very good and you just have to start off with a glass of champagne!
Helpfull staff, attentive and non intrusive. We enjoyed our afternoon very much.
Lovely setting, well presented food and excellent service. Staff were efficient and adhered well to the Coronavirus rules - felt safe and well catered for.

A pity the doors were locked until 1200. We‚Äôd have liked to come into the warm even though we knew we would not be served until noon.  I know it‚Äôs the West End but prices were on the high side (¬£14 for a Burger, ¬£3-75 for an American plus 12.5% service).

We went to the Wigmore for my mother's birthday lunch and had a lovely time.  We were seated in the side room which had a lovely relaxing atmosphere and a beautiful christmas tree.  Great menu to choose from, unfortunately we couldn't try it all!  What we did have though was excellent.  The mains were a good size too and filling.  Lunch service was busy, so it was a little slow at times to try to get the waiter's attention, but that didn't bother us.  Would definitely come again.
Great food and wine, thoroughly enjoyed...........

The venison was cold which was not good enough for a meal that was being charged 32 pounds for! Average service. - not really good enough. All in all very expensive for something that proved very disappointing! The range of options was not great either!

Met with my sister and brother in law on a rare sojourn to London before going to the Sorolla exhibition at the National Gallery. Location great for both the exhibition and our hotel. We all enjoyed our meals hugely and would thoroughly recommend  Just one small gripe My sister and hubby arrived ten minutes early and even though we had a booking and it was pelting with rain they had to wait outside but we got over it and a nice time anyway Cheese board was fab.
The food was good but the raw beef was chewy... not a dish I would order again. Service was a quite slow. But given the ambiance and good food otherwise, good spot for pre theatre in the area

Busy pre-theatre on  Saturday, we took the bar seats to get up out of the crowded, busy room. Excellent small plates - terrine, cabbage and eel, smoked roe - and discovered the Sicilian Ciello as a great accompaniment.

Service was relaxed and the girl who served me was very good. When I mentioned I was interested in the natural wine she selected a few for me to try. I found the tables a bit squashed together but the general atmosphere was nice and relaxed. My brother enjoyed his steak but i found my pork very boring and tasteless with no condiments offered to pep it up! Plain boiled broccoli very unexciting. I was bored eating the food which hasn‚Äôt happened to me for a while.
Been here a couple of times pre theatre. Lovely food, vibrant atmosphere and good service. Will be back for more
Terroirs is  real find, great vibe, and "off the scale " wine list. Food delicious in my view though some of the small plates are pricey for the quantity, but always  good.

Having been recommended by a friend I was disappointed on a number of levels.  The wine choice was quite extensive but lucky to find anything under ¬£30 a bottle.  First choice of wine, out of stock so went with the recommended alternative.  On deciding on a different 2nd bottle this was also out of stock.   Having said that the food was good, despite each of us having food served on chipped plates.   Waiter was knowledgeable on the wine, if rather over worked as the restaurant was full which led to longer waits than I would expect for the orders to be taken.  Full to the extent that we were quite tightly squashed next to a table that had more people seated at it than was intended.
Terriors offers something different to your typical restaurant.

This is a great venue for meeting up with friends for wine and charcuterie after work, Terroirs has become a firm favourite since discovering it last year.  Tucked away, but within a minute's walk from The Strand, Trafalgar Square and Charing Cross Station, it is well located.  You need to book as it's very popular, however whilst you are told when booking that you can only have the table for 2 hours, we've never been rushed off a table when we've stayed longer.  We'll be back again very soon.

I regularly eat upstairs as the service is fast and the tapas-style food excellent and good value. The menu is quite small but well chosen and all the dishes are good for sharing. The kitchen opens at 5:30 but the cold dishes are available earlier. The downside is the high markup on the wines. Overall one of the best options for pre-theatre dining, and very handy for the Coliseum.
Very good food- quality ingredients in well prepared and interesting combinations. Thoughtful and interesting wine list with great selections by the glass. Lively atmosphere.
The Artesian never disappoints- love the atmosphere and the drinks are fantastic. Service is always exceptional
Always a wonderful experience.

Was able to book last-minute and the space and menu looked great. Food was perfectly fine... no problems but nothing special either. Service was pleasant enough but they were a bit overstretched so a bit slow. The place itself was really nice including the basement with skylights. We had a good meal and a nice night. If I was in the neighbourhood, I‚Äôd likely go back.

Popped in for dinner after a show, the team there were excellent and we easily managed to find options for my wife (vegetarian) and my 9 year old. the food was very flavoursome. overall a very enjoyable meal

The offer of ¬£29 for 3 courses was good - (seeing you had a ¬£12 cocktail included)


Nice service not rushed in anyway
I loved it all but thought the cauliflower dish for the vegetarian option was over priced.  The broccoli and almond side was much nicer and a third the price.
Good food, service and atmospheres. We enjoyed our evening!

A great evening. I took my teenage son and girlfriend for a New Years Eve treat. The food was amazing, and the service and ambience was just right. Not too formal. The Hollandaise egg starter was amazing - as well as the seasonal mince pie flavoured chocolate truffles.

The drinks menu is minimalist in terms of any help with the variety of drinks and wine. The gin menu tells you nothing about the different types in terms of taste, best tonic, what it is served with. Unless you happen to know any of the wines you have no idea what you are buying. OK, the waiters were helpful, but you feel very much in their hands and the control passes to them rather than staying with the customer.

Upon arrival we were greeted promptly and shown to our table upstairs. The staff were very attentive without being overbearing. Even though the upstairs was far from full, it was quite noisy which made it difficult to hear someone who was sat only on the other side of the table. The food was moderate in quality (it would be good for home-made) and well presented, though the portions were very small. A two course meal with drinks set us back ¬£100, but something closer to ¬£60 would have better reflected the value of the meal.
Excellent meal, good service. We had the fixed price menu which was good value.
Food as always excellent, service fabulous . Live jazz a little too loud to  have a conversation.
Very pleasant, nice decor, helpful staff and good food
Visited Tredewells for an early pre theatre dinner. Enjoyed the food, ambience and attentive service.
Great pre theatre menu but salted caramel ice cream desert a bit over powering. Will be back !

The steaks and mains we ordered were absolutely wonderful. The desserts are some of the best we have had in London, my wife was very pleased with the "Gin and Tonic cheesecake".  Our Server was attentive yet not hovering, we plan to return here again with friends and family.

Booked in for dinner pre show and also to celebrate a very special occasion after a recommendation from a friend. Great location and style and lovely menu options.One of us opted for the 2 course set menu and one chose off the a la carte menu. Good range of choices off both and quality and flavour of food was excellent. Due to time of year there were some large groups on Xmas celebrations so the noise factor certainly impacted and made it impossible to have a conversation across the table with each other. Our request to have our dessert served upstairs at the bar was quickly actioned and we moved to a quieter area. The customer service from Sangram the restaurant manager was superb and he went out of his way to make sure we were happy and looked after and apologised for the noise of the group originally next to us. If there is a problem I always look for how a business handles it and resolves it and based on the impeccable service from Sangram ( and the staff in general) and the quality of the food,  I will definitely return and recommend Tredwells as a great place to eat.

The food was absolutely amazing, my 2 daughters loved their vegetarian dishes.
The busy restaurant and live music made dinner conversations impossible. We will definitely return!
Interesting and fresh food combinations beautifully presented.  The staff were all charming and attentive and service was prompt and efficient.  A very nice evening!

It was a very wet day and my daughter and I did pop in early after the theatre to see if we could bring forward our booking.  The gentleman on the desk was not particularly friendly or sympathetic.  On later arrival at our booking time of 8:00 p.m. we were seated downstairs promptly and greeted warmly.  However, it took 15 minutes before we were offered drinks which I do not think is acceptable.  Also we had booked to take advantage of the special offer menu but when we were seated, we were not offered this menu choice and had to ask for it.  This appeared to delay the taking of our drinks order.  We were not particularly impressed by the dried bread pieces offered as a pre-starter but the rest of our meal choices were delicious.  Unfortunately at one point the whole of the downstairs restaurant filled with thick smoke making it an uncomfortable dining experience.  The serving staff were very friendly and helpful and our only complaint about service was in respect of the delayed drink order.   I felt a little let down by this experience overall.  It may well influence whether I return.  This had been my second visit to Tredwells.

I was one of three females who met up for dinner as we haven't done this in a while.  The atmosphere was good although the bar downstairs was a little chilli.   We were shown to our table upstairs promptly but found we could'nt have a convesation without shouting because the live music was very loud   Nevertheless the food was ok and service was very good.

Weekday evening dinner with friends trying the 4 course meal through Open Table. Great good, very good service, ambiance and decor was excellent and location was great. The food itself was delicious, and we all tried different options on the set menu. Definitely worth a visit.

Very tasty food. The best salmon I have had for a long time.
Maybe the music could be turned down a bit. As always we would like to see more English wines on the menu.

Tredwell's has a buzzy easy-going but also sophisticated ambience.  The food is excellent with great attention to detail and a lovely seasonally influenced menu! - one of those menus where you want to try everything! The service was warm, friendly and  efficient.  Wine is available in reasonably priced carafes as well as glasses and bottles - useful if only one or two people are drinking. Great place!
Outstanding and affordable. 2 words - pork sliders!
A bit overhyped to be honest. Service nothing special, ambiance non existent, food was passible but again nothing special.
A great place to grab a bite and drink pre-theatre

Couldn‚Äôt be better.
The food remains absolutely top class
Exactly what you want for what I think is one of the best restaurants in London.
It doesn‚Äôt show off. It just does what it does for all its customers every time.
Overall a very nice meal and venue, however the portion sizes are very small!
love this place late at night, champagne and fish pie

Superb quality and ambience.

Ideal for any occasion.
Another great trip to this restaurant. Great food and very good wine.
Nice place, nice food, view and ambience. I think it's a good place for a drink and talk.
Excellent visit here. Good cozy place to meet someone and enjoy a drink with good ambiance. Staff very attentive
Excellent food, range of options and warm service. Great for a group of 10.

The restaurant wasn't even open!!!!
No mention on this website that the restaurant is only open for breakfast. Allowed me to book a 17:00 table with confirmation email. Not impressed.
We had afternoon tea with excellent teas but less than exciting food and uninspiring deserts

It's a WOW. Everything is as you would expect. Wonderful. The bar has to be your 1st stop. My friend had a cocktail and the barman mixed it, in full view, just like you see in the films... and it tasted 'the best ever'. Went for the five course lunch. The restaurant is very grand, staff attentive but not obtrusive. We asked the sommelier for a wine to match each course. ¬£70 for five glasses of wine. He suggested we split the glass in two, half each, one with each course. The food/wine were was excellent. Not a lot on the plate but we were very content by the time we had finished the petite fours and a coffee. You've got to make the effort to go at least once in your life...start saving know. If I had the money I would go every month !!

Booked the restaurant at the Ritz, London for my boyfriend's birthday and had an amazing time!  We attended the dinner and dine event held on Fridays and Saturdays and absolutely loved it.  Everyone was dressed to the nines but the atmosphere was easy going and friendly.  A fantastic singer and band played as we ate, with a pianist between sets and lots of couples were up and dancing.  Food was incredible, service attentive but not overly so and the setting is just magnificent.

Dining at the Ritz was a wonderful experience, though expensive it was worth it.  Although a limited menu of three choices(¬£45 for 3 courses inc. coffee and 'friandises') , they were interesting and imaginatively presented. When the lights were dimmed leaving mainly candle light, with the chamber music it was a very romantic ambience.  Wine was expensive and perhaps overpriced as expected, attentive but not overly oppressive service, fantastic chocolate dessert to die for!  Love to go again.
Superb!
The Ritz is a fantastic place to eat at if you have plenty of money. Everything is of a extremely high standard and you pay for it.  I will certainly go again when I can afford to be extravagant.

Excellent for an amicable business lunch, with low noise levels and discrete service.  We had the lunch (table d'hote)  menu which is excellent value while at the same time being a taste of the great cuisine that The Square has to offer.

The food at The Square is superb, service is more relaxed than in other 2* establishments (a good thing) and there's a really decent range of wine price points.
We thoroughly enjoyed dinner although our table wasn't ideal (next to the serving point from the kitchen).
The room could do with an update now but the overall vibe is still Mayfair sophistication and the food is wow!
A+
Amazing food, service and value - loved it.

It was very good experience, very good food, friendly service, very good speed for serving of business lunch.
thank you

We chose the tasting menu with matching wines, the food was pretty good, small portions which is definitely appreciated in a 9 course degustation. So if you're a foodie you'll enjoy this menu coz you get to try a bit of everything this restaurant has to offer. There were two desert courses plus a farewell desert meal at the end and they were each a substantial size, so be warned if u love desert to leave some room for the end! If you don't like desert then opt away from the tasting menu. The duck foie gras with caramel was exceptionally outstanding.
The Australian sommelier was so lovely and knowledgable he was a real delight to chat to.

Five of us dined for my husbands special birthday. I had read so much about the food and service and knew exactly what to expect. I could not fault it. We were looked after very well although I was shocked at a the price of drinks but it is expected.
Had two courses, main and desert, from set menu. Food was excellent (both quality and value) and service was also first class

We found this restaurant very different to other Michelin star restaurants. The food was extremely good, the staff friendly, but the ambience was completely different. This was not necessarily a bad thing as was a refreshing change due to being a more relaxed atmosphere.
The food was extremely good, the service excellent - would definitely recommend to anyone!
Always a pleasure to dine at this restaurant.

We had the set price lunch at The Square and thoroughly enjoyed it.  Although there was only a choice of two dishes in each course each dish sounded so interesting that we certainly didn't feel we needed a wider selection.The food was absolutely delicious, and the service was both friendly and attentive, but not over formal.

Exceptional in every way! We were served by Juan who is an absolute super star of the service industry. You‚Äôre treated like royalty and the staff are just as passionate about the food as you are. Styled in an Art Deco fashion, it‚Äôs incredibly comfortable, stylish and up market. The wine list is very well sourced and even better priced.

The food: OMG! In a word (2 words) - perfectly balanced. We were recommended the Beef Bourguignon and I‚Äôm so glad I had it. Slow cooked for hours you don‚Äôt need a knife, the beef just pulls apart, paired with mash which is more butter than potato, I loved it and I don‚Äôt even like Mash. My wife had the ravioli which was again, perfectly balanced, full of flavour and perfectly cooked. We always pick a winner between us and this was just impossible (although I was the winner - shhh).
