We rarely order dessert but the options were so great we just had to try the chocolate fondant. Served with chilled clotted cream instead of boring vanilla ice cream it was sensational.

Because of the insane quality, it‚Äôs hard not to draw comparison to the top fine dining restaurants of London, in which case, it would have been nice to have varietal stemware (a big ask on only a ¬£42 bottle of wine) however that said, the manager actually offered to ready Bordeaux glasses for our next visit as they have a sister restaurant who are stocked. I mean, if that‚Äôs not top tier service I don‚Äôt know what is.

This place could give the heavy hitters in London a run for their money, and at a much smaller cost it‚Äôs a no brainier. If the food was rubbish I‚Äôd still come back for the service and if the service was rubbish I‚Äôd still come back for the food - thankfully all elements are perfection so we will definitely be regulars.

Quit expensive for the food they deliver.
The furniture is old and in bad conditions
Lovely food and great portion sizes. The service was fantastic.
Amazing Italian food, my only option for lunch in Mayfair!

First visit to Salt n'Pepper. Modern, large restaurant close to Leicester Square yet quiet in the early pre-theatre period. Modern Indian food of a higher standard than your bog standard local. There was some confusion about Opentable offers as they said they had just changed but staff were keen to see all offers would be honoured. We will visit again.

The food and service was great, really fresh and tasty dishes. The setting and decor is more a cafe vibe, so not like many cosy curry houses that I'd choose for a special occasion. Good value with the offer. Would recommend for authentic food in a nice friendly restaurant, where we didn't feel rushed.
Food was fine, but lacks atmosphere and cocktails are just watery mixtures. Won't be returning.

The food was ok but the menu advertised on toptable is NOT the same menu in the restaurant. The restaurant menu is significantly smaller and more expensive.

The restaurant is not particular pleasant, I would find somewhere nicer in London (which isn't hard).

Mid week early, pre theatre meal. Only 2 or 3 other tables in use but service was on the slow side (but good when delivered). The food was very good and worth waiting for. Background music was reasonable and not too loud, giving the room a decent ambience. With the Toptable discount it was excellent value. Really good location for going on to West End entertainment.

This is a very small restaurant which was busy for a Tuesday as there were a few large groups. The seats a large armchairs and so it's a great place to just relax and chill out on quieter days. The staff are very friendly and the food is delicious. The only thing is that it isn't always what you might expect. The makeral pate is actually flakes of fish, not a pate at all. The sea bass with smoked salmon risotto is lovely but the risotto is not a side dish but rather the main dish with the fish on top. And the espresso chocolate mousse which I expected to be dark and in a little pot is actually a rather large dessert with white chocolate as well as dark. It was all very tasty so I didn't mind!

The Leicester Square Bar and Restaurant in London was quite a nice experience.  We went on a Wednesday night, so it was kind of dead, but the up side was that we did get very good service.  The food was tasty and the 50% off deal was fantastic, though even without it, the whole meal wouldn't have been too pricey.  Dessert was the real stand out; the apple crumble and expresso chocolate mousse were both fantastic!  The toilets were clean, but it was a bit of a journey to get down to them.

Leicester Square bar and restaurant in London. Beautiful surroundings and fantastic food. The staff were very attentive and the steak just melted in my mouth. We got 50% off the bill which just about topped off a perfect experience! Would certainly go back for more.

An enjoyable visit. The food was tasty, but perhaps not worth the prices charged without discount. The venue was cosy and well kept but also quite small. There were a mixture of people in there and it was easy to find. It was pleasant but nothing extraordinary of its kind. Having said that I wouldn't refuse to go again.

The Leicester Square Bar and Restaurant is a very modern location with good service (hotel restaurant) close to Leicester Square and Picadilly.
The Eggs Benedict as starter are delicious.
Good value for money with the 50% offer, a bit expensive without it though.

Another good meal at theLeicester Square Bar & Restaurant. The scampi starter and the white bean and smoked haddock broth delicious. We both had the seared tuna on a nicoise salad for our main course, the tuna very slightly over done but other wise very tasty.
Staff as usual attentive and not overbearing. Were earlier than we had booked but the atmospere though quiet was good.
The toilets clean and I always admire the art work.
Definitely one of our favorite places when in the West End
Food wonderful as ever, service easy-going. For some, the speed of service from the kitchen will be a bit too leisurely, so allow plenty of time.
We had a great meal at the Leicester Square Bar & Restaurant. The location was perfect for our plans. We went to a comedy show just around the corner. The service was excellent and the food was too.
Good value with top table & top waitresses

Leicester Square Bar and restaurant was a lovely and comfortable location for our girlie get together.  Excellent value with TT offer, however I was a bit disappointed with the risotto as it was rather bland however my friends enjoyed their choices.

There is usually a c or 3 course set menu here, but this offer allows you to choose anything 2 courses from the menu for the same price and includes a free glass of (very nice) wine. Nice atmosphere, and attentive service in a great central location. Would be happy to eat here again.

LEICESTER SQUARE BAR & RESTAURANT, London, WC2H 7HL

The discounted package gave us the choice of two courses from the ‚ÄòA La Carte Menu‚Äô & a glass of wine-excellent value for money. The menu was varied with an emphasis on fish. The starters looked a lot more interesting than the desserts. The quality and presentation of the starters and main courses were excellent and the glasses of wine were of high quality. We recommend this restaurant for its excellent food, value and enjoyable experience.

Leicester Square Bar and Restaurant, a true Christmas treat for myself and friends, great food, value for money vine and good service. Only let down by a large and loud dinning party (had thought that there was a limit on the size of party permitted). Went for 3 course Christmas special, the smoked salmon with eggs benedict a particular hightlight, with main course recommendation of the bream! Would definetly go again!

Went there for the Toptable deal, which was exceptionally good value for money. The restaurant is chic and modern. The Galway Oysters were incredibly fresh and the Halibut on Salmon Risotto was divine. If you're a cheese lover I'd highly recommend the British cheese board, it's big enough for two and offers a brilliant selection.
great as always

I took my Mum to Leicester Square Bar and Restaurant for lunch on a Thursday and we had a great time.  It seemed the road works outside had deterred other eaters - they missed a treat.  Mum's seared tuna and my garlicky scallops to start were perfect.  Grey mullet fillet and goat's cheese tart for mains were also excellent.  The house white was delicious and we were looked after by charming staff.  A real find, just off Leicester Square.  Will definitely return.

We had a fantastic lunch at the Leicester Square Bar and Restaurant on Sunday, it was pleasantly quiet despite being slap bang in the middle of trafalgar sq, leicester sq and Piccadilly. All the food was excellent.
Good food and wine but still felt a bit like a hotel restaurant (albeit a very good one)
It would of been nice to be informed that they would be closed after making our reservation weeks ahead, the lack of respect from the company means were done with Ed Diner as we were let down badly

We went to the restaurant for dinner on Saturday evening. The booking was made smoothly online and the staff were friendly and attentive throughout the night.
Unfortunately the food was below average of the London Korean restaurants but it charged decent money. I don‚Äôt recommend the restaurant for eating Korean food as there are many other Korean restaurants in central London.
The restaurant is more like a bar. The place has a large counter bar and wide variety of cocktails. Unfortunately they play music really loud like a pub full of 18 years old, and the customers on the night at the counter were really drunk and spoke loudly. It completely ruined my dinner experience at Bo Drake. Maybe the happy hour offer attracted a wrong type of crowd? We ate as quickly as possible and left within less than an hour. It‚Äôs an overrated Soho place which simply caught the recent wave of modern Korean(ish) in London. I will not return again nor recommend Bo Drake to anyone.

Anniversary dinner after the theatre at Bo Drake was spot on, my partner and I shared 6 dishes between us plus desert which was the perfect amount. The pork belly bao and chicken wings were amazing and the sesame soft serve was different and tasty. Would recommend for couples or groups. Great decor, music and location.
We were pretty disappointed in the ribs, adn the menu in general sounds better than it actually is. It may work better as a dinner / cocktails venue than a lunch venue.
Get to keep the hats

A rather limited menu. My grandson disappointed that they didn‚Äôt serve fajitas.
Bill quite expensive for what we had. Wouldn‚Äôt choose to go there again

None of bar and food pictures and reviews have ever mentioned it's Adult Video LGBT Bar.
It was funny to discover it when we reach to the place with my wife :)

The carrot cake was almost ¬£10 for literally 2 bites.
Flavours were not exceptional to make each bit ¬£5.
Meat cooked to perfection.
Starters interestingly yummy.
But portions controlled to the extreme to make it not worthwhile to revisit.
One hit wonder.
Interesting menu of Hungarian dishes, very traditional vibe and service was a bit limited but worth trying if you want something different.

I dont beleive there are many hungarian restaurants around but I'd been aware of this one for a while and finally went with a hungarian friend.  Staff welcomed us into the wooden pannelled room adorned with portrait sketches, I presume of famous people but didnt really look.  We shared mixed starter consisting of slices of different cured meats, fish, fish terrine, peppers, cucumber salad another type stuff..  Another friend (of hungarian decent) used to make chicken paprikash so spotting that on the menu, so I had to try it.  It was served with galuska (dumplings) and was less flavoursome than my friend's.  But there was plenty of it and lots of meat.  My friend had the weiner snitchel which was huge.  I forced my friend to share a slice of cake for dessert which was layers of thin sponge and dense chocoalte mousse. It was all OK, not gourmet, but then I guess Hungary isnt known for it's haute cuisine....  Apart from the water I had one glass of white wine and the bill came to 70 quid which didnt break the bank.  I wouldnt rush back, but still glad I went.

Visit if you want cosy convivial dining with an out of the ordinary menu. I wouldn't class the food as exceptional but there is the chance to try dishes that you won't find elsewhere. Portions are generous. Service was friendly and efficient. The house red was very acceptable - and drinkable. The chestnut puree and whipped cream dessert was probably the richest pudding that I have had (only eclipsed by cream and jam in Moscow). The 50% discount on food offer from Open Table makes this exceptional value and I would certainly dine there again.
Lovely restaurant, wonderful civilized old world Mitteleurop ambience, with attentive but not instrusive service. Would highly recommend.
The Gay Hussar is always consistent and the 50% off food offer made it very good value.
Cracking meal as always

Nice restaurant, was packed on a Wednesday night which was a good sign. Great value with the 50% off deal, but probably not worth full price. The bread was completely stale (would they have given us fresh bread if we were paying full price?) but the main courses were excellent. Desserts not as impressive but with the half price sparkling white wine included in the deal ithe restaurant is overall very recommnded.
This is a top restauarnt in Soho. We had a beautiful meal and were attended to in fine style. It cannot be recommended more highly
Gay Hussar is brilliant - great atmosphere, great food and amazing value
I disagree with the negative reviews and think that the Gay Hussar still offers excellent Hungarian food. The staff is very friendly and helpful, we had an excellent evening.

Gay Hussar was fantastic. The restaurant had bags of character and the service was fantastic -- the waiters charming and engaging. The food was good. I had the sausage for starters and the duck for mains. Both were well presented and prepared and v. big portions. Others had the pate and mushrooms and said they were good as well. Would definitely recommend it to my friends and was v. good value on the 50% offer.
Despite arriving late on a busy night our table was still there for us. Friendly, efficient care plus good food and wine made it a memorable evening.

They were able to accommodate 12 of us at short notice and served up some excellent bento boxes and other meals. Very good value, nice staff, unhurried atmosphere and a central location. Just bear in mind that it's pine benches and good value, not silver service.

The restaurant was closed without notice

There was only a note on its door

Valentine's Day - could only order from set menu, was not told about this during booking or confirmation call!

Spoke to manager regarding my concern of not being able to order from Al la cart, didn't seem too bothered.

Food was very average, service was average... I have been to better Indian restaurants for a lot less than what I paid here. Price does NOT reflect the service or food!

Avoid!

I have eaten here many times over a number of years and gave always met friends in the bar for pre-dinner cocktails. Disappointingly we were told the bar was reserved for a private party. This turned out to be a speed dating event.  I found the menu a big if a puzzle - the first section of starters followed by a section of sharing dishes.  As they were all of similar price I sought advice from the waiter.  Were the sharing  platters meant for two or small tapas-style dishes.  The reply was not very helpful but did clarify that they were all starters.  This meant they worked out quite expensive and double the price of usual sharing dishes being from aroun¬£11-¬£14 each.   They were tasty and well-presented.  My main of chicken in a tomato and fenugreek sauce was sublime - creamy without being rich and I was not disappointed at all.  The chargrilled broccoli florets had clearly only been briefly introduced to the griddle and were almost a crudit√©s.  They have a very good wine list with a good range of prices.  The grilled pineapple with chilli coconut ice cream was almost perfect but the pineapple was somewhat lacking in flavour.  Overall a good meal but not good value for money.  The service was excellent as usual.

We had an early, pre-theatre, dinner at the Mint Leaf.   The location is convenient to West End theatres.   The restaurant itself is very modern, with discreet techno music in the background.   Service was very attentive and the food was excellent.    The pre-theatre menu is good value.    We would gladly return to this restaurant.   Recommended !

I visited Mint Leaf again having had a wonderful dining experience here the previous Sunday. This time I brought a group of friends visiting from abroad. We opted for the OpenTable set menu offer & it was interesting to try a mix of starters to begin with - I quite enjoyed the Kerala fish curry with rice for the mains, and the mango br√ªl√©e finished off the meal quite nicely. As before, the service was brilliant. It's quite a stylish restaurant and yet still maintains quite a homely feel. Another enjoyable evening & I look forward to visiting again soon.

Saturday night dinner - toptable special.
Excellent food, very attentive and helpful service.
Expensive drinks!
I always object to service charge added without a 'by your leave' but in this case would have given the same anyway.
A most enjoyable evening.

Very smart dimly lit modern interior gives a very trendy feel. Food was very good. Service very professional but marred at the end of the evening by our waiter asking whether we wanted to add any additional tip to the already charged 12.5% service charge Ought dinners be put in that position?

In London on a short visit. This restaurant was recommended by a friend in Newcastle who owns a restaurant. Excellent all round. Welcoming staff, excellent food, very smart d√©cor. You can have bar food it you want, cocktails (non-alcoholic ones as well), come as a party or just as a couple, as we did. Well situated, easy to find. Highly recommended.
Good time for a good price on valentines day. Wasn't happy with the pre booking option of having to give up my card details to reserve the table
Great night out with prompt service good food and good drinks!
Everything was good, there could be more choice though

Wonderful flavors and very, very well prepared food and presented very well. The best Indian restaurant I've visited so fare. The decor and ambience were also not the ordinary Indian restaurant but luxurious and high end. Prices are at the high end as well, but the restaurant comes with my full recommendation.

We booked to see a football game and when we got to the site we found that online reservations have nothing to do with the day of the game. Major failure and a disappointment for not having table although the reservation was correct!

Service good but I was disappointed with set menu considering the cost. Starters were good but I wasn't impressed with main course. They didn't have the wine we requested from the menu either.
It was very average food-wise but I didn't think it was good value for money.

Thai square lunch
Red curry was watery...
Good value. Great location.

Why can't other cocktail bars be like this? Everything is so efficient. No look of confusion when our small group tries to pay for our cocktails separately! It's so easy! Compare this with the incompetence in 'upmarket' bars eg. The Connaught where they they charge ¬£7 more per cocktail and always muck up the bill. Long live Bar Termini :)
Excellent! Highly recommended, good food and great cocktails
Bar Termini, whilst small, is one of my favourite bars in London. The drinks are utterly delicious! Cannot recommend enough.
A great establishment. Have been going there for 15 years and it is still great.

A classic old-school Mayfair back street boozer that offers an above par grill. Replete with doorman, a cosy traditional room offers homely classic cooking and service with good ingredients. With beer from Young's or extensive wine list there is something for everyone. Where else can you eat prawn cocktail, beef wellington and have your spotted dick served with matching wine? Probably in Rules, so if you like it there then give this place a go. Lovely pub with good restaurant or vice-versa subject to your requirements. Tip: Probably not suitable for quinoa munchers

We were very disappointed with the meal and service. All three pies ordered were cold and took thirty minutes to replace by which time the other diners had finished . The whole experience was badly managed .
As soon as they realised there was a problem they should of cleared the whole table and started again.
We really loved the english ambience and the food was outstanding! The waiters were very nice and atemptive to our needs. Next time I'll have a pie!
Relaxed atmosphere and a good slab of red meat. What more could you want?
Great steak and sides. It's tight and noisy, but it is a pub. A definite Keeper!

The Guinea is a great spot; have been there many times. A busy after work hours pub in the front with tables in the back. Simple food (steaks and seafood) done perfectly and the service is first rate. Excellent place for business dinners. I recommend it highly!
Good but very expensive. AT ¬£33 for a steak plus extra for salad etc. it should be better than it is.

Nicely done place but seriously let down by the quality of the food and the service. None of the food looked particularly appetising so we opted for the burgers. We were asked how we wanted these cooked and went with the recommended medium. Both burgers were severely well done and lacked any flavour. Service was below par and the final nail in the coffin was the bill included service and then we were prompted to add a further service charge when paying by card.

Came to the restaurant for a quick meal inbetween theatre interval. Me and my girlfriend had an amazing time. The overall feel and energy of the place was awesome. The food was great. The service was great. Can't fault it. Would recommend to all who want an energetic and fun experience, whilst getting a quality meal.

Really disappointing evening. Felt like we were an inconvenience to staff, they tired to take our table away despite never giving us a time to finish and allowing us to order food. Staff were abrupt and rude, unfortunately this place will always be busy because of its location but in reality, it‚Äôs style over substance with completely average food and wine. So many other better options in the area, I wouldn‚Äôt bother.
Very disappointing. Food was average at best. Service ok. Drinks ok and expensive.

our reservation was for 9:30, at 10pm they told us it was last call for food. why take a late reservation if you have to rush the table to eat?

the quesadilla looked like a pizza and tasted horrible. there were barely enough chips for the guacamole. the short rib tacos had more than detailed on the menu - i wish i would have known so i could have asked to eliminate some things. salmon was asked for as well done but was not well done at all. the churros were very good!

the manager tried to be very accommodating by offering us free drinks in light of the quesadillas being not as described and not favorable. our waitress seemed to leave after our dessert was delivered and we didnt see her again. after the whole restaurant cleared out, then we finally got our bill.

would not return.
Food was great but overpriced. Ambience is good
Service and food was excellent!

good fun place - worth a visit even if for the novelty entrance. the menu is small but this is the way forward to ensure good is fresh and spot on. i struggled a little to find some veggie and hot as not all was to my taste at first but tried several small plates and enjoyed.

Had wanted to go for ages after hearing good things and reading good reviews. Was intrigued by the 'different' entrance also.
The ambience is amazing. Low-lit and interesting. It definitely feels like a cool place to be in.
The food is served tapas style in small dishes that you share. We were a group of 3 which I wouldn't recommend. Most dishes were for 2 people so it was very awkward to share. The waiter recommended 3 small dishes each which we did, however I left hungry. The portions are very small and very expensive. I would recommend trying the restaurant, the soft shell crab tacos were phenomenal! But expect to pay a lot for not much food. Frustrating!
Every dish is really tasty, good range for a short menu.

I was recommended this restaurant by a friend and it did not disappoint. While the outside can be misleading, downstairs is a very ambient and enjoyable dining experience. The food and service were both outstanding. Will definitely be returning!

If you love Chinese food then I have to say the Park Chinois is outstanding!  The food was amazing, the service was fantastic and the venue is very quirky and posh.  Definitely one to put on your list and try.

Building was interesting small number of tables on each floor. Menu was quite limited burgers and salads but the food was very good and so was the service. Decent bottle of wine and I thought everything was reasonably priced. Would definitely go back.
Booked the place but was closed. No email or notice to say it will be closed.  Disappointing

Everyone in the group loved the food (I found the seafood risotto tasted a bit bland but it was still lovely) and it's amazing value. The only issue was that it took 20 minutes and we asked three different people for the bill, and eventually had to go up to the counter to ask for the bill and pay. Excellent value and great location.
Escellent service, food, location, valfue for money.  A little gem in Soho.  Would highly recommend.

I still find it amazing that an Italian restaurant of such average quality can exist in Soho when there are so many other better places to eat where the food, ambience, quality etc are so much better. Not sure whether any of the staff were actually Italian in this "authentic" Neapolitan restaurant and although it was friendly it had nothing special going for it except that I was able to book a table for 8 at 8 in the West End on the last Saturday before Christmas on the same day!

I went to Melanie's Italian (London) with a group of 8 people.

The restaurant had a lovely ambiance to it, the variety food choice was excellent, prices incredibly reasonable especially given the great quality of the food and ingredients and the staff were wonderful.

Will definitely be returning!
Need to get WiFi so customers can pay with credit card!

This was my second time at ethos. The food is great and offers gluten free options, which for me is perfect. I love being able to choose what I want to and the amount I want to. A better selection of gluten free desserts would be nice, there were only 2 choices.

Very nice decor with trees. Vegetarian/vegan pay-as-you-go buffet. Most of the food was all right; tasty but not spectacular. Fresh ingredients and nice species, but not really worth the cost. If you fill your plate it's like ¬£20. Very many gluten-free and vegan options, low-sugar cakes. There are nuggets or really tasty food there, and then a lot I could cook better myself.
Great service, amazing food and a great vibe. Have already recommended to a friend.

There was an issue with OpenTable that meant that I couldn't amend my booking. I went in early to request an additional seat. The server was more than happy to oblige us despite a packed reservation list.

From that point service is fairly light touch but the atmosphere of the place feels light, airy and chiq.

We thoroughly enjoyed our final visit to this lively, fun restaurant, with excellent food and wine, and look forward to sampling the new restaurant in Islington after the forthcoming move. Hope Stef makes a very good recovery from his recent health issues.

Great night at Stef's - treated very well (including by Stef himself) in spite of the restaurant being so busy. Pizza absolutely delicious. Very good value for central London - go for a relaxed night with friends.

We were unfortunate to have booked on the hottest day of the year at a restaurant with no air conditioning. I arrived early, before my friend and was seated immediately. I asked for a bottle of water with a lot of ice, which I received quickly and that helped cool me down somewhat. The food was good and service was friendly and attentive. We didn't stay for dessert because it was too hot indoors, but I would consider returning on a cooler day.

I went to Stefs with 2 friends and we went for the toptable deal of 15.95 for 2 courses plus a bellini. There was a good selection on the set menu and the service was very good. We all had different starters which we enjoyed. Only gripe was that one of my friends asked for balsamic vinegar and it never arrived. We all had the chicken with spaghetti for main course which was fine.
The ambience is very pleasant in the restaurant and its a great central location.

From start to finish the service was fantastic. The waiters were extremely friendly and helpful, and couldn't fault them. Food was great - probably wouldn't pay full price for it. But the menu was extensive for the offer, and when it arrived it was delicious. The wine included in the deal wasn't bad either. However it is a small bottle between two - which isn't made clear on the deal. Would definitely go back.

Stef's advertised the offer on top table, when we got there they said it was not available in December, even though it was booked on top table. We paid ¬£40 per head for a truly average and unremarkable meal. Not recommended.
We went to Stefs just of Oxford Street in London, food was ace as was the ambiance. Great place to have a civilised lunch in town.

Really good value for money, 2 courses and a glass of wine for ¬£13.95, but you have to eat early arrive before 6pm and leave by 7pm and the menu choices are quite small mainly pasta, no fish option and only pork no chicken etc. Good location, polite friendly staff. I would recommend it for quick , casual dining.
Stef's in Soho  is a wonderful Italian with a warm, cosy yet urban feel. Food is lovely and staff are friendly.

I booked this on behalf of my parents & their report was good.
Excellent pasta, good house wine & nice ambience. The 2 courses & glass of wine for ¬£12.95 made it great value.

Stef's 3 Berners Street, Soho, London, W1T 3LD
is a really good place to eat. We booked a table for 10. We were looked after really well without being smothered and the banter was both amusing and friendly.

We were served quickly and efficiently and not only was the food good the house wine was very drinkable.

We opted for the 3 course special offer which was excellant value for money.

We would not hesitate to recommend Stef's and we will be visiting there again.

We had a lovely meal at Stef's one Saturday lunchtime, we all had pizzas and they were extremely tasty and on the large side. A 3 course meal with wine for ¬£20 was superb value, and located just off Oxford Circus made it very convenient too.

I've been to Stef's before and booked it again because of it's excellent service, casual but excellent food and brilliant customer service.  I always use this restaurant when booking for a large group as quality, service and timing are never compromised.  Definitely go here for the best Italian in the West End!

Stefs 3 berners street, london

As usual excellent ambience, good food,excellent service. Very enjoyable experience especially with complimentary prosecco.

Couldn't praise Stef's high enough - waiters were friendly and  helpful - when they knew we were running late for the theatre they responded perfectly - the meal was marvelous - definitely go there again (hopefully with more time to enjoy 3 courses. would highly recommend
Good restaurant. Highly recommended. Food was great and the service was excellent.

11 of us had a load of food and wine on Friday evening (from the offers menu and also the a la carte menu).
I think we were the last to leave having been there for over 4 hours!
We all thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and were surprised by the quality and amount of food that was served. The house wine was very nice too.
Service was good - the staff were busy but friendly and accommodating. Even near midnight, when we demanded another cheeseboard!
Great value. Highly recommended!
Stefs is well located for Oxford Street and Soho - friendly staff and good value with the offers they were running.

As per usual, the food and atmosphere was great at Stefs. The waiters are great and the specials we're really good. It wasn't as busy as usual, but it is the holiday season and mid-month. What was really great to see was a load of tourists, (maybe 15 or so), all of whom were noisy and taking photo's looking for a large table, were told to leave by Stef (the owner). He is a true restauranteur, and didn't want some loud, noisy bunch runining his great reputation. Fair play.
Very good food, very good service. A very enjoyable evening
Excellent meal at Stef's. Servic superb food very nice, lovely restaurant great location

When we arrived at 7.30 the restaurant was slowly filling up. The service was decent and the food pretty good, especially the mushroom starter and tagiatelli alla marylin. Also there was quite a good choice of veggie options for both starters and mains.
Steph's delivered exactly what we expected. Really good food and a nice buzzy atmostphere, Would recommend and return.

Stefs:

A group of us dinned at STEFs and all agreed that it was a very nice restaurant and excellent value for money given the toptable offer. The food was of a high standard and made from fresh produce. It has a very nice interior and was packed full of people by 8:30pm. You must make sure that you remind them that you are booked under toptable to ensure that you get the special offer. Overall I would give this a 7/10.
A lovely meal as always at Steph's. Good service & good food.
Good Italian in the heart westend! Well worth a visit.
Had a nice meal at Stef's, friendly service, specials on the board were the best of the lot.

Great toptable offer. Expected the food to be mediocre given the price (2 courses and a bellini for ¬£15), but the portions were generous and the food outstanding. Staff was very friendly, and they were welcoming to the idea of combining the offer with the specials (at a reasonable surcharge). Would definitely go again.

Very enjoyable evening - good, relaxed atmosphere, friendly waiters, not too loud and busy so we were able to talk easily and not feel rushed.  Food was fairly straightforward but enjoyable and exactly what we wanted for a relaxed meal out.

We had the fixed price menu which we really enjoyed with the addition of some fresh oysters which were superb. We watched the other diners‚Äô meals arriving which looked so tempting we will surely be back to try them!
As far as I could tell, it's permanently closed!  !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!   !!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Great service from the staff, one dish wasn't to my liking and they changed it for me without any hesitation. Very delicious and fresh. Will definitely visit a Pataca restaurant again, but perhaps stick to Soho at weekends as it has a bit more of a buzz.
‰∫àÁ¥Ñ„Åó„Åü„ÅÆ„Å´ÂÖ•„Çå„Å™„Åã„Å£„Åü„ÄÇÊúÄÊÇ™
Everything was perfect, as always. My best friend and I go once a year for either our birthdays or our anniversary and the food and staff are always impeccable.
Good food and attentive staff. Food is overpriced but to be expected
Absolutely amazing dinner, fantastic service, best food I have ever eaten by far. The atmosphere is just fantastic.
Long wait between dishes when compared to previous dinners there.

We ordered a tasting menu that was 85 pounds each. It was their signature dishes. I normaly love asian food but this was awful. Only to dishes was good, some of them was not even eatable. Not worth the money.

I love Nobu and as usual, the food did not disappoint. It was outstanding. But the service was terrible. Our waiter was rude and our food (4 appetizers and one entree) was served within about 7 minutes, although it did take about 20 minutes to get our first drink ironically.  The manager did rectify the situation in the end though and I definitely would go back.
Amazing place, outstanding service very kind and quick, food was delicious and high quality, we loved every minute. Rich and unique menu
Great restaurant, just a bit noisy for a business lunch.
Excellent meal food melts in your mouth exploding with flavour and great service

Food was very very tasty, I was able to experiment with new flavours without disappointment. The menu was perfect for sharing. A bit pricey but i would be extremely worried about quality of food considering the location.
Our server was amazing but he was spread thin with no support from anyone else, he took orders poured water, served drinks and deserts for our and nearly half the restaurant ( my hat goes off to your great service).
My partner and I will be back.
Visited many times for many years now and Nobu - Berkeley Street keeps up delivering an exceptional experience. Great place.
First class service, food and beverage!
Verry good food and service

Had an exceptional dining experience at Nobu. Service, atmosphere and food were all five star. I would recommend that some of the dishes be altered in order to provide a slightly larger portion so that we receive more value for  our money.
Fabulous food and great experience
Excellent, can't fault a single thing. Fantastic in every category

Took my girlfriend for her 21st and had a lovely evening, dinner was outstanding some of the best food I've ever had. Ambiance, music and decor of the restaurant oozed class. Service was great, handed everything superbly,also asked for a message to be brought out with desert beforehand in an email, was all sorted when we ordered desert didn't have to mention it when we got there. Pricey but good value for money for what you get in my opinion. Cocktails and bar finished the night off.

I had been dying to go to Nobu for a long time, I'd heard so much about it so thought it would be a great place for a Mother/Daughter dinner after a lovely day shopping.

We'd been sat down for about 15 mins and were still deciding on what to order as we'd never been there before and our waitress kept rushing us saying we only had an hour left on the table. It was extremely off putting, unprofessional and ruined the experience for us.

The restaurant was very busy and the atmosphere was good but It think it is over priced for what you get and all you're paying for is the name and location.

Personally I won't be rushing back in a hurry.

This was the second time that I have eaten at Nobu Berkeley Street and i was rather disappointed with the food and the service. First, we had to wait for about 20 minutes before someone came to take our order. And that was after having asked twice. The food was very salty (understandably it was miso based) but rather than being a subtle hint it was over-poweringly salty. To help with the salt, I asked for a cup of green tea but it never arrived. The food also arrived very slowly and by about 11pm, we were rather full with one more course to come. We couldn't cancel it and asked for it to be wrapped up for take-away. But that never came by the time the bill came. So we just left. Overall, a highly disappointing meal.

With Nobu, you know what you're going to get, exquisite Japanese, pan Asian influenced dishes.
However I think the prices have begun to unreasonably sky rocket. Dinner for two with a bottle of relatively inexpensive wine (¬£45:00) and cocktails ( ¬£14:00 each) with service just north of ¬£250 ! Once you're seated, there is little point in skimping on what you want to eat, the signature black cod is a whopping ¬£42:00 for a single size portion, yet don't be tempted for a half size at ¬£22:00, that would be gone in two mouthfuls.
The food is delicious but even for central London at these prices this is really for very special occasions.

Extremely noisy and tables are extremely close one to the other. GBP 90.00 for 2, no drinks, no desserts, just water, coffee and vegetable plate is really absurdly expensive. Service for 15% is also overestimated!
Service was good and outstanding food quality but restaurant was very noisy on a busy late Friday night but would recommend it for special ocasions.

Wasn't overly sure what to expect as we had heard various reviews of the restaurant, however, it was absolutely fantastic. The food was exceptional, particularly the rock salt tempura, and the cocktails were also superb. I would highly recommend this dining experience.
Great atmosphere, attentive service, fresh food. Will certainly dine again

Excellent loaction.
Chosen for a business dinner. Service very good and we choose the 6 - 9 item special tasting menu. Quality of food was excellent
Acoustics are poor in the restaurant and it can get noisy
Crowded, to much noise, poor service. Very very bad cocktails.

Lovely ambiance and outstanding service. We had a wonderful waiter assigned to us and he made the evening extra special - so attentive and friendly. The food was delicious, highly recommend the shrimp tempura for starters and the blackened cod for main - we thought that was the best fish we have ever tasted! Would definitely go back to try other dishes.

Yellowtail with jalapeno. Incredible.

Service. Beyond terrible.

My husband and I had a wonderful time at Nobu on Saturday night. We order the set dinner at ¬£65 and felt a bit disappointed at the way it had been described to us thinking we were able to choose our own meals.

All in all a great restaurant

The food is always great at Nobu restaurants. We've been to quite a few around the world but this restaurant had some very arrogant waiters and waitresses. It is a shame because when the staff has a attitude you don't have the perfect dining experience.
I took my daughter for a post exam lunch. we had a lovely meal with exellent service.
The restaurant was closed!!!! I didn‚Äôt get to eat there even though the reservation was accepted and placed!!! When calling nobody picked up the phone. Left a message too no reply!

I had an amazing time at Cafe Fiori, not only because the pizza was out of this world but because the staff and people at this corner cafe and restaurant were just fantastic. This is a very social place good to chat to all kinds of people and enjoy superb food and drinks. Definitely worth going! I went here after seeing a show at the theatre so the location was perfect.

I was on my honeymoon in London.  At the time of booking, when I looked through menu, it was not specifically mentioning about the time available for afternoon tea, so I was exited to try this restaurant's tea menu. As we arrived at the restaurant, we figured the afternoon tea is not available at 1:15. We had other schedules follows that, so we only had drinks and left. So sad that I could not try that menu. Maybe next time when I visit London.
delicious lunch  - all dishes most enjoyable I hope to be  back in the new year

Great venue with fabulous views!
Food was wonderful and service excellent
One of the best pizzas I ever had at a affordable prices.

Great lunch at Sartori. The strive was excellent as was the atmosphere and food. The starters were very good and the main courses of spaghetti bolognese, sea bass and pizza all excellent. Would recommend for  lunch.
Yummy as always, can't wait to go back!

Hi,
I came with some friends before attending the theatre. Great location and amazing food! The best pizza I have ever had! Including visits to Sicily!
Amazing pizza and pasta - just like in Naples. Authentic antipasto. Right on top of Leicester Square tube. Reservations essential.
This was our third visit and our first with the kids, and as ever Sartori exceeded expectations - especially when the kids eyes lit up at the full 1kg of pizza! Would strongly recommend.

We had a late lunch at Sartori's on a busy Bank Holiday weekend, and the food was fantastic, including our starters, mains, and deserts. The service was excellent including the perfect timing between courses. The octopus salad and grilled vegetables and veal were the best we tasted in a long time.

The food at Sartori (London) was fantastic, really tasty with generous portions and good value for money.  I recommend the antipasti as a starter to share.  Staff were polite and restaurant was busy with lovely atmosphere.
Good italian food altough i prefer my pizza crispy.

We decided to go to Sartori before going to the theatre.

The reviews of the restaurant were very mixed so we went with a very open mind. I'm glad to report that the food was really delicious and we will definitely return.

The service was slow to get started and we had to ask the for the bottle of wine that we ordered but once they got going they were much better. Although they were slow at times it didn't mar the experience as we'd left plenty of time before the start of the performance.

Amazing food , scallops and truffle pur√©e were incredible.
And so nice staff , thank you for this Spanish with ponytail waiter who give us the best service ever.
We will be back for sure.
RAW was an interesting pop-up at London Editions, very helpful staff and great organic wine menu. We didn't eat any food here

We made a reservation and yet, had to wait 20 minutes to be seated. That being said, it is the holiday period, so I can forgive that. However, being a steakhouse, you would expect that the meat was cooked to the requested temperature. I ordered medium rare, and my counterparts ordered medium. Theirs were borderline, but acceptable. Mine was medium/well, more to well. I told the waiter who started hacking into the steak, trying to prove it was not overcooked. He then grumpily took it away saying that he‚Äôll order a rare steak then. The steak came out a few minutes later, and it was blue rare, not something I‚Äôd usually eat. With all the commotion I decided to accept the steak. Guess it could be a hit or miss.
Fantastic food and great atmosphere
Had a lovely birthday meal, again :D

First time at Umu and we had a great experience.
Pros: great food, chef‚Äôs attention to detail is bar none and really friendly and knowledgeable waitstaff
Con: hostess needs to work on her communication skills

Valentine's Day dinner with wife. Was surprised to get a last minute table the previous night through OpenTable. I have had Japanese at many places including in Tokyo and done the Nobu, Roka Zuma et all but this place was way ahead of the pack. Exceptional fresh local ingredients, presentation that explains why this has 2 Michelin stars, attentive patient Japanese and European staff very well trained in explaining the food preparation and sourcing. I am surprised at myself why I have not been here before since the place opened about 6 years ago.
first i couldn't find the restaurant, it is too modern. the restaurant was very dark inside but crowded. i tried many sushi and they tasted amazingly good.

Located just off Berkeley Square, it's the perfect place to dine away. Friendly yet full of elegance. Conscious of our tab, we would have eaten more at other places but nonetheless enjoyed an amazingly delicious meal!
Truly amazing! In a cetegory of its own!
I would highly reccommend Umu for celebrating special occasions or simply to impress. The food is devine, we had what felt like a  banquet and I left feeling contented.

Avoid, if you want food or decent service. Our experience here was absolutely appalling!

This was booked for a Bank Holiday Monday to celebrate my Birthday with my family, whom I rarely see. When we arrived we were guided upstairs, to our table, that was not ready. On top of this, they set the table in such a way that meant the 5th person was not able to sit down anywhere. We were then left for 15/20 minutes before the staff actually came to take any form of order.

The experience got worse, when one of the party asked for some tap water, the waitress gave him a look of contempt and continued to ask what else he would be drinking. Another member of the party asked for a pint of San Miguel and got an opened bottle partially poured into a glass, so hard to reject. When someone asked for a specific beer, instead of apologising and explaining that the beer was off, the waitress just said, 'No, we don't have that, it's a bank holiday.'

When we finally came to ordering food, the waitress failed to tell us that half the menu was off. After we started ordering, we kept being told 'No.' without explanation. Apparently the Bank Holiday means they don't have as much food or beer. Again when explaining this, the waitress was incredibly rude, no apologies at any point, just saying that this is expected on a Bank Holiday, which it isn't. When you have lots of tables booked for the day, food and drink should be ensured that there is enough, and when there isn't enough, actually say sorry.

After all this, we decided to move elsewhere, as the service was awful and we actually wanted food that we could eat, as someone who doesn't eat meat, there was one option left, which I thought was terrible for a birthday. When we said we would like the bill and to leave, the waitress came over with a card machine and just put her hand out for a card, without actually giving us a bill or a price.

Overall, go to a different pub in the area, much better nearby(Three crowns)
Incredible food in a wonderful atmosphere. Have been to the same in NYC and Paris. All three are outstanding!

We had a great time at the Atelier! Went for dinner pre-theatre and decided to go for the 3 course menu which was deliciosu. Could have the beetroot tartar over and over! The atmosphere is great, we were sat at the bar so could see everything going on in the kitchen which was very entertaining. Staff were very attentive with us and service was excellent. Would go back and have been recommending it to all my friends

45 min wait after reservation at 21:15.
Several things went wrong with getting right table at the counter, got food served twice that wasn't ours. Main lamb course was most ridiculous portion size for an entree i have ever seen, not compensated by extraordinary taste and with a ridiculous price.

After having had a good previous experience at L'Atelier de Joel Robuchon, I decided to bring one of my best friends there. We sat at the kitchen counter. The food was still good and innovative, but the service had changed to the worse, drastically. My friend was totally ignored by the staff who only interacted with me (with one notable exception). We could see no apparent reason for this strange and rude behaviour. My friend complained to the guest relations manager when we left the restaurant and his only explanation was that the staff had recently been changed... I also noticed that the sommelier never offered me to taste the wine he had paired with my dishes, so a lot of things seemed out of the ordinary, in particular for a 1 star Michelin restaurant. Very disappointing!

Very good food at l'atelier with the foie gras burger being the standout. Very helpful French staff, giving off a Parisian vibe to the restaurant. Also ambience was very fun, especially for late dinner.
Excellent food and friendly and efficient service.

We first experienced Roubechon in Las Vegas (MGM) and enjoyed it so much we decided to try here. We weren't dissapointed! Amazing food, great wine pairing. The staff are knowledgable and very friendly, and added to the experience. Recommend sitting at the bar (if 2 of you), to watch the staff working their magic.
Excellent small tapas style sharing plates, beautifully presented. Entertaining sitting at the bar counter watching the food being prepared. Good selection of gins for an aperitif.
Spectacular dining experience .. needs very little words .. other than .. go experience for yourself!

I took my sister here as a birthday treat before going to the ballet. The only downside was that we were late which meant less time to savour the flavours and experience before having to dash off to the theatre.I would recommend leaving enough time to take full advantage of the 2 hour allocation. Fantastic!
Great deco and amazing food, a burst of flavours. Would highly recommend it
Excellent food, great service at L'Atelier de Joel Robuchon in London. Would definitely go back. Set menu a very good deal.

L'Atelier de Joel Robuchon, London

I was very Impressed with the whole lunch experience. Very professional service and excellent food. I would highly recommend.
lunch at Robuchon was a good break from Xmas shopping. The topinambour soup was fabulous
Good lunchtime offer! The food was excellent, nice mix of flavours and the staff was bery polite and friendly! Fresh vibrant ambience aswell!

L'Atelier de Jo√´l Robuchon at covent garden
Great food, relaxing environment ,good place to go with friend, casual but fun.
Really nice food, a bit disappointing service for 2 michelene star restaurant but food/value works well on pre theatre menue

I went to this restaurant for the pre-theatre menu. The food is certainly good, but was below my expectations for this level of restaurant. The starter and main course lacked seasoning, and the bread basket was clearly left over from lunch time because the slices were dry (although I then got freshly baked bread when I asked for it). The dessert (chocolate mousse) was very good indeed.
I had a seat at the bar/counter area, which I think has too narrow seating.

L'Atelier de Joel Robuchon, London: Booked a table yesterday for the 'afternoon retreat' offer (2 courses and afternoon tea for ¬£35 each). Food was delicious but portions are befitting a fine dining experience. After lunch we took afternoon tea in the terrace which is a lovely space. Tea involved a generous number of pastries and it was very filling. Overall, highly recommended.

Had a fabulous lunch with a cracking glass of red, followed by tea on the terrace in the sun.  Total bliss.  Restaurant moved us with zero fuss to the first floor as bad back means can't sit up at the counter seats on the ground floor.  Food was nicest I've had in a long while.  set menu was ¬£22 for 2 courses, tho we did a top table deal which included tea and cakes for ¬£35.  Very good value.

This is a very well put together restaurant and being able to view the chefs in action whilst eating makes for a great experience. Definitely try their mashed potatoes, we had never tasted mashed potatoes like that, incredible, however other than that we didn't find the food to be that amazing and the service wasn't great as they got several of our dishes wrong when we were only there for lunch in a fairly empty restaurant!
Perfect night out......

L'Atelier de Joel Robuchon in Covent Garden has now entered my top 5 restuarants in London. My wife and I dined there before the theatre on a Friday evening and thoroughly enjoyed the pre-theatre menu. Sitting at the bar on the high stools where you can see the kitchen is a delight ,and the fact theat the waiter leans over the bar to chat to you just adds to the warm atmosphere of the place. Highly recommended for couples although I would book upstairs for larger groups. We will be back!
A very nice meal, really enjoyed the experience.
We had the set course as a pre theatre meal. The food, service and overall experience were superb. A wonderful start to the evening and will definately go again.

Food at l'Atelier de Joel Robuchon is excellent. The tapas were delicious, however pricey given the size of the portion. We sat at the counter and had a great view on the open kitchen, watching the chefs prepare our dishes.
One of the best restaurants we have ever been to.  The staff were extremely friendly and knowledgeable which added to the whole experience!

We booked with the offer but were 15 minutes late and the table was already released. We then have to go with a la carte in the la cusine part without the offer. Good service with very good food, a bit let down by the price as it was ¬£130 without ordering any wine.

Had lunch in L'Atelier on their 3 courses for ¬£29 special. Menu was limited (2 choices for main, 2 for main course and either dessert or cheese - but that's to be expected with these kind of deals).

Interesting venue, service was prompts and the food was really really very good. The a la carte menu looked amazing and would probably give that a go next time I go back.

L'Atelier de Joel Robuchon - Covent Garden:

Between the two of us we shared four tasting dishes for our starter, plus a main and dessert each. Every dish was sublime, so we either got lucky with our ordering or it's just not possible to go wrong!

Service was well paced with suitable gaps between each dish.
Fabulous as always!!

What a fabulous restaurant.  The staff were so attentive, and the food was amazing.  The chef's took so much pride in their presentation.  Loved the idea of sitting around the kitchen area, it felt really homely and welcoming.  Would definitely return, and the top table offer made it really affordable.

L'Atelier's combination of excellent food with warm, dark decor and pleasant staff is a winner, offering a great place for a quiet dinner with a friend or a romantic meal with someone special.
Although the portions may be on the smaller side, they are so exquisitely cooked and presented.
The offer menu is comprehensive, but the real thing easily steals the show.
This place is a must.

I had a thoroughly great time at L'Atelier de Joel Robuchon, London. It's fantastic value, serves exceptional food and the excellent service was refreshing. I'm looking forward to going back and sampling the tasting dishes.

L'Atelier de Joel Robuchon is simply without fault. I have now been there several times and still find the set lunch menu interesting - it changes all the time. The service is impeccable, the ambience great and house wines are reasonably priced and very good.
The set menu was very limited - fried fish or steak tartar, which means most people need to order a la carte. Very good food though.

We went to L'Atelier for the pre-theatre menu; ¬£25 for three courses. The staff were really friendly and the atmosphere was relaxed and informal. It has a Japanese sort of feel, with the seats overlooking the kitchen. It was really interesting to see a double michelin starred kitchen at work.....it was a picture of calm! The food was excellent. Main course risotto was absolutely stunning. Dessert was a selection of about 6 tarts; each one was simply wonderful. The service was faultless.

We went to L'Atelier de Joel Robuchon for a work lunch making use of the top table special. If there's one good thing to come out of the recession, this is it. Three courses of great food, fantastic service, nice bottle of wine and all under ¬£60 pp. Result! There are only 2 choices for each course but all were real quality. Good for you Joel.

The food is good at L'Atelier de Joel Robuchon and if you get a counter seat then it's interesting to watch the chefs in action.  Service though could have been better - waiters seem to be stumbling over one another; having to ask for butter and only one dessert arrived when we had ordered two!  Expensive and therefore we had higher expectations...  If you ever have the chance to visit the one in Las Vegas then go - in comparison this 'L'Atelier' is smaller and a little disappointing.
We had a delicious set menu lunch. I had the suckling pig as the main and the chocolate dessert which were all delicious. HIghly recommend this restaurant. Delicious food and great atmosphere.

This was my first time there and trust me I will for sure come back again. The food was excellent and the service was superb. The staff were very friendly and acommondating. If any guy out there want to impress that special someone in your life this is one of those places you would want to take them. Beautiful and well appointed place. We really enjoyed the food.

L'Atelier de Joel Robuchon was a real treat - whilst the deal only provided two options per course, the items on offer were so creative that we had a hard time choosing.  The duck confit was superb and the wines by the glass were surprisingly affordable.  We will be happy to go back...
A truly great experience! Put is on your list.

L'Atelier de Joel Robuchon. Loved the ambience here. A trendy place with loads of atmosphere and buzz!
We went for the lunch menu and it was delicious and well worth the money for 3 courses at ¬£25. The wine list was superb. Loved the concept of high
stools at the glass service station and bar. Would certainly go again.

Normally difficult to get a table at short notice but we virtually had the whole restaurant to ourselves at 7 pm on a Thursday. This was due to local hotel occupancy rates being severely depressed and people working from home due to Covid 19. This empty, there was atmosphere lacking but service excellent. Good choice of all courses and I particularly enjoyed the octopus starter. Grilled cod main course cooked to perfection with large moist flakes  of fish. Crime br√ªl√©e with rhubarb and coffee to finish.  A good choice of wines but the markup is excessive.
Lovely table, thank you
Le Caprice never fails to please.  It is always a pleasure to dine there.

I have been here three times in the past three months, but two things irked me today. My guest & I arrived and were greeted by the friendly Maitre D', who was going to show us to our table. However as soon as the lady behind us came in, he walked past us, kissed her on both cheeks and showed her through first. So we felt second class immediately. This was compounded by our table, which frankly should not have been a table. It was squeezed on the outside wall opposite the kitchen entrance, and the waiters were continually brushing up against us as they walked to and fro. The food and wine were both good as ever, but I wish I'd had the nerve to decline the table.

Altogether a pleasant rather than Wow experience - it's a nice restaurant, but had a slightly touristic feel - good fun but not for a special occasion. I'd recommend it as a venue for meeting a business colleague not for a 'date'.
After coming to Le Caprice for over 40 years I am always delighted that it never fails to impress and live up to its standads and provide the perfect dining experience
Le Caprice London is consistently good.  Excellent menu choice and food and wine always great quality and value.

I should know better by now;  if you want a pho then Pho is the place to go. If you want a wider Vietnamese menu variety than basically pho or pho ingredients (noodles, veg and some meat) on a plate then you are best to seek a full Vietnamese restaurant.  It does what it says on the tin and so should not be criticised for it, but somehow I always expect a fuller Vietnamese choice.  It is fine but not noteworthy.

We used to go to this restaurant quite often. Theres one night where my girlfriend ordered an iced coffee for her drink and realised theres a fly in it. The waitress was surprised, and just gave us a free meal card for our next visit. However, we are a bit  unhappy as she did not apologise to us.
Excellent value for money with the 50% off is truly a bargain for good quality food. Surroundings are nice without being showy or over the top, providing a more authentic feel.
Good value, tasty Vietnamese food at Pho Fitzrovia to bring a smile on a cold day!

Pho located at 3 Great Tifcfoeld Street, Fitzrovia London has fantastic viatnamese food which is healthy, filling and wholesome. I would recomend the Lemongrass chicken and noodles. All in all a nice relaxed yummy place to eat.

This is a regular haunt of mine and it never fails to tick all the boxes. Fab food at fab prices. And you even leave feeling like you've been healthy. Chicken bun and fresh fruit juices are out of this world.

Having not been back to Pho in a while I was keen to find out if it was good as I remember...especially now the 50% deal wasnt available.

We were shown a table straight away (event though we were now one more than orginally booked). Service was quick and the food delicious - would especially recommend the 'morning glory' starter...yummy.

For starters to share, a main each and a bottle of wine the bill came to ¬£14 each - perfick for a Tuesday night out.

If you are looking for authentic Vietnamese Pho - there are better options on Kingsland Road but they do some tasty crepes and i'd highly recommend the meatballs with lemongrass!

Very friendly, great service.

Great value for money.
Pho serves good food, at good value. I've been a few times, have taken friends who have all gone back again. I would recommend it.

Pho was great value, especially on the 50% off deal. Food was lovely, staff were great. The only downside wa sthat service was patchy. But they were full and with people queuing out the door, waiting for tables.Well worth a visit!

This was my second visit to Pho in Fitzrovia, London, which serves very tasty "fast" Vietnamese street food. The service this time was abysmal but they took our drinks off the bill and we weren't in a hurry anyway so it suited us. Great for a low-key after-work meal with friends!
Wonderful meal for just under ¬£10 - including main, shared starter and glass of wine. Always a treat

A great (almost) authentic pho serving cafe.

We started with some fresh summer rolls which lacked the essential pork - still, some tasty prawn though. The fried pork spring rolls we excellent though.

The Bun Bo Hue for mains had a tasty broth, although the beef brisket tasted pre-cooked and was overdone, making it pretty tasteless. The chicken bun was an improvement, but again overcooked on the meat front.

All things considered, a delicious and exceptionally cheap quick bite!

I love Pho! Such friendly staff who were kind enough to give us a bottle of wine because they kept us waiting for 15 minutes! With the 50% off our whole bill was only 8 pounds each - amazing value! And this after over-ordering as well!

Excellent dinner at Pho on Great Titchfield. When we first arrived the only available table was jammed up against the kitchen, but they quickly moved us once other diners left. Food-wise, the summer rolls were a bit light on the prawns, but the bun with lemongrass pork meatballs was outstanding. We'll be back!
Always excellent, top staff, top quality, brilliant value.
Pho is fantastic

I love Pho. I virtually live in the one in Farringdon. Which is why I prefer the Farringdon branch. But it didn't disappoint. It was a lovely meal. Love the soups. And it's such good value for money. Recommended.
Pho is great value for money and delicious
We dined at Pho using the 50% offer on Top Table,  it was a very relaxing and informal meal.  Very enjoyable.  The crispy pancakes for our starters were particuarly good.
Great value with the 50% offer. Came to ¬£16 a head for two courses with plenty of wine!
Pho definitely exceeded my expectations. It is a cosy restaurant with simple decorations and very friendly staff. The food was fresh, light and delicious! It is reasonably priced.
Still as good as ever...

Friendly atmosphere, delicious food, had a really good time.
The only thing I did not like is that the waiter asked for my debit card once we were seated and took it with him. Seemed very odd to me as has never happened to me before.
Very very very friendly service! Went there for Birthday celebration and we both enjoyed the vibe and the food. Definitely will visit again!

Underwhelmed and somewhat disappointed are the thoughts that come to mind when I think back on our (6 pax) lunchtime dining experience at Mews of Mayfair !
The restaurant is comfortably decorated, and enjoys drinking and dining options on several floors including the mews/alley.
The meals were Ok, nothing special, except the fries, sooo good !!

On several occasions we had to send a plate back that was cold, and should have been hot (fries) or ask for plates that were ordered and forgotten.
Condiments were slow to arrive.
Overall there was a lack of attention to detail and service.

I'm not sure that I would go back, maybe for a cocktail if I was in the area.
A good find tucked away off of Bond Street.   Ideal for post shopping trip.

Mews is a lovely restaurant, reasonably priced for most items. The steak is quite pricey, but we thought it would be worth it. However, I had to have mine cooked three times as every time it came out it was wrong and in the end I just had to eat a blue steak instead of medium. The waitress didn't know what gluten was, so wasn't very helpful with a coeliac menu and also bought me the wrong drink. It's hopefully a one off, but not a great experience with service. The food however was very good (other than my steak)

Had another excellent lunch at Mews of Mayfair in London. Menu was innovative and of good quality. Wine list is wide-ranging with plenty of choice at all levels. The TT discount makes this place extremely affordable.
Mews of Mayfair was great as always. Very good value with 50% offer. Amazing service.
Excellent food and service. Great value with the 50% off offer!
Could not fault the meal and service at Mews of Mayfair and with the 50% off food TT deal it was excellent value too! I would go back just for the scallops, delicious!
Only with a toptable offer. But the food is good

We had dinner at Mews of Mayfair using the 50% off offer. The food was excellent and the service really attentive and friendly. We were worried it may be a little formal and stuff in there but actually it was very relaxed. We both had a starter and main course each and were just too full for pudding. I would definitely visit this restaurant again.
Good food. Excellent service. Will definitely return.

We had an enjoyable dinner at Mews of Mayfair, although we felt the service was a bit rushed - we were told straight away on arrival that we only had the table for two hours, which should be plenty of time, but then we felt rather hurried along whilst eating. The food was excellent, particularly the decicious deserts, and the wine was also great  - the ambience was just a little disappointing.

Mews of Mayfair really surprised us for the great food, attentive staff and awesome atmosphere. Great bar for pre-dinner drinks on ground floor and downstairs. You cannot go wrong with the 50% off meal deal - it would be v. nice even without it! I highly recommend the fois gras starter and black bream fish for main!

This was a return visit to Mews of Mayfair and sometimes this can be a let down but not this evening. The service was attentive without being intrusive and the food was as good as before, late in the evening there were a few items off the menu. With the TT 50% off this was a steal, ¬£25 per head with wine in Mayfair - unbelievable, we will be back again next time we are in town.
A* Highly recommend
Great meal at Mews of Mayfair - great food and service plus such good value on the 50% off deal
Really nice place, excellent value with the toptable offer! Very good food, good service, nice atmosphere; I will go there again!
excellent
Lovely dining room, staff friendly and a nice range of food.

Food was excellent, and given the deal we had was good value. Only reason for rating ambience low was we were only people in restaurant as it was midday on a Saturday - it started to fill up later as we were leaving.

Mews of Mayfair was an a very enjoyable dining experience. The food was well presented and was absolutely deliscious. The service was spot on albeit the win came after the food on two occasions. The wine list was well priced and had a good selection of both old and new world wines. Overall a great place for a romantic date or a business lunch/diner.

A fluke!!  I had never heard of Mews before and I took a gamble for my hubby's b-day treat.  What a result.  We had the tasting menu with the wine pairing and the food was delicious.  The staff were really nice and didn't fuss around us but were there when needed.  A great place with a nice buzz to it.  I would reccomend the tasting menu although the sirloin was the only course that neither of us enjoyed.

Very pleasant evening in a lovely venue.  The waiter service was initially a bit intrusive but relaxed as the evening went on. The food was good but not as high quality as I had expected for the cost.  The meal would have been a bit pricey without the deal but this restaurant is well worth visiting.
Very pleasant lunch time visit with our granddaughter before the theatre. Seated immediately, attentive service, well cooked pasta and pizza.

I went to Ponti again, having been with a friend the previous week, because of the great food and value - especially the whiting - which was off! When I asked if they could do another fish dish on the set menu, the waiter made a fuss, and eventually said he would ask. He didn't come back to tell me, and a fish stew turned up. We said that we were in a bit of a hurry (going to the theatre) and he bought the mains before we'd even finished our starters. So service was rubbish and offhand. But the food was really tasty, and great value. So I'd recommend on that basis.
very good...would recommend going back...

Very small wine bar/restaurant.  Cramped downstairs. Shall we say ‚Äúrustic‚Äù decor. Top quality food and a lovely wine list. White Gavi wine could have been colder but only complaint. Excellent carpaccio, and two pasta dishes. Good puddings. Cheap for Mayfair.  Friendly service.

Booked for pre-theatre and they did a great menu just for this, very good value for money and the food was lovely.  Unfortunately we were there early at 17:15 and there was only one chef and one waiter. A lot of people came in at once and the waiter seemed to be struggling, however cavalry did arrive and service improved. I would definitely eat here again.

The restaurant was NOT open when we arrived. Very disappointed here. It was dark and locked. We tried calling and no answer. How does open table take a reservation for a restaurant not open!  Terrible.
Excellent food and service . Would recommend the restaurant to friends and family.

Great tasting food is the major attraction of Dosa Lounge in West Croydon. It's an informal cafe style set up with separate dining areas for strict vegetarian and non vegetarian diners. This is a distinction you often see in the Indian sub-continent, but I've never seen it in restaurant seating before.
We asked for non alcoholic beers and the waiter apologized they were not cold, my white wine wasn't from the fridge either, but it was fine.
We both ordered starters - fried masala fish and masala paneer which were very tasty and plentiful. The dosas we had to follow were large and freshly made with just enough filling.
I would recommend Dosa Lounge for great food without fuss.

Enjoyed it! Food pretty good, interesting pan Asian selection. Starters particularly good. Service in terms of taking orders rather slow, but when order taken food arrived very rapidly. Drinks orders seemed to take for ever. Nice people, we enjoyed our evening. Recommended.

Went here recently for my Sister's Birthday - took a while to find it as it's down an alleyway, but when you do it's in a lovely little courtyard.

We ate indoors, we had to wait a while to get served and when we did our drinks order was taken with the food order which was strange.

Food was really nice, my Mum's a vegetarian and very hard to please, but she loved her pumpkin gnocchi, and the waitress recommended a courgette side which she loved.

The setting was very atmospheric, think I would like to sit outside next time, loos were very nice, was impressed with everything all-in-all, will def' go back and also highly recommend.

Good value for money considering where it was - three mains and three cocktails ¬£100.

Good central location, nicely tucked away from the main road which is great. The food is good and there are a good range of options available. Nive comfrotable restaurant, service was attentive and not crowding us out. Good all round, we had a great time.
I always enjoy coming back to this restaurant ... Consistently good food. Try their aspen fries.
We had a wonderful waitress who was knowledgable about wines and provided great service.

Hadn't been to Hush for a while but had a great evening. Upon arrival we were directed to a nice table and began to relax immediately. The decor is very chic and the menu has a great choice. We enjoyed the 50% offer which made it really good value and it was quiet busy for a Tuesday night. Will definitely revisit while the offer is one as this is a great hideway that really impresses first time visitors & regulars alike.
Hush does one of the better West End business lunches. Good value for good food. Unfortunately, it can get a little noisy when it is busy! Still one of our favourite places.
We've been to Hush out of curiosity to try a new place and I think we'll be going there more often. Food was tasty, nice atmosphere but the service could be better!

I went there on a work lunch on Valentine's day. The location is pretty in the mews but the interior of the place needs updating. Food was good but nothing special, I had the fish cake and green beans on the side. Price is slightly expensive for what it is but then again it's just mayfair price tag.

Curates egg at Hush last night. one starter good but the goats cheese/beetroot mix was clumsy (big chunks of beetroot thrown in a bowl with goats cheese on top). Mains were ok although the slow roat pork belly was moist in middle but very dry on the base.
Service good

FABULOUS FABULOUS! Hendrick's High Tea @ Hush was delicious. The molecular cocktail was strange, but VERY nice.
Yum cakes, yum tea, yum cocktails! Service was very good.
Definitely recommend

Hush Brasseris in London was lovely - great atmosphere and staff and the food was delicious.  Would have been quite pricey without the 30% off food and the cheapest bottle of wine is about ¬£20.  Would definitely recommenf

Hush in Mayfair, London was OK but slightly disappointing. The food arrived too quickly to believe it was freshly prepared - 5 minutes to make saffron risotto and mushroom arancini just made us think it had been pre-cooked and reheated - further supported by the fact it was almost too hot to eat. That being said, the food was tasty and the cocktails were good. Service was friendly and efficient. There are better places to go in London.

I really enjoyed our meal we sat outside on the courtyard and the ambience was lovely.

Service was friendly and helpful and the food was good, the fact we had 30% of everything not just a set menu meant it was really good value for money.

I'd happily recommend Hush and will definately be going back
I love Hush in Mayfair and often go with a group of friends - great atmosphere, great food, and a great price when you have a Toptable discount!

Have always liked Hush, and met my girlfriends this time to announce my engagement! Evening was fantastic, food was lovely and service attentive UNTIL the end of the night when after we had spent copious amounts on wine, the waiter told us rather authoratatively that we were only entitled to 30% off on a Wednesday (?!) and we had to convince him to kindly give us the 50% off food we had booked - showing him email confirms. This did put a dampner on the night, as had a expected a bit more class!
Overall impression with Hush - a bad taste left in the mouth, because:-

Hush Brasserie, Mayfair, London. I enjoyed a delicious lunch , tasty and different with flair. The brasserie is tucked away so feels like a calm
Oasis right in the centre of the city! Great ambience & excellent service I will definitely return.
Even better the second time and with mulled wine now being served outside to warm the chilly nicotine addicts - see my previous review
The Hush Brasserie is a lovely venue just tucked behind Oxford Street.  Good location, good offer via Toptable, excellent food and a fab atmosphere! High recommended!

Visited Hush for lunch, lovely location tucked away and quiet. Service was fast, menus were whisked away before we had chosen the wine.
