Perhaps as we booked for 1.30pm they were in a rush to finish the lunch service. The food was good but expensive without the toptable offer. However, my daughters burger was a very undercooked medium. Portions of sides are generous, 1 bowl of frites would be enough for 2 diners.
Hush Brasserie is a wonderful find for a quick bite to eat. Amazing value for such a good location.

5 of us enjoyed ourselves in Hush with this offer.  Hush is a nice restaurant and bar.  The food was really good.  We didn't get a table outside, which was a bit pity but the inside is quite pleasant too.  In the end, we paid 32GBP each for a 3 course meal with toptable offer, which is very good value!  Would go back again for sure if any such offer available.

Hush Brasserie, London, the restaurant is in a courtyard setting and is very nice and quiet.

The food is was very good and the service was good

The maitre d was a little aloof on arrival although we were slightly late arriving despite this a very enjoyable meal and we would return again

Hush was a lovely venue for a meal to celebrate my cousin's engagement.  I was hoping to be upstairs  (where I had eaten before) but we were seated on the ground floor (pleasant enough).  Service was pleasant and efficient.  The rare tuna salad was delicious.  The monkfish was a little too rich.  I was tooo full for dessert!  My cousin and his fiancee had the salmon sashimi and beef carpaccio to start and the lamb and rump steak as mains.  Both of which they enjoyed.  A good deal at 30% off.
Fantastic , I love this place. Will be back again very soon for sure.

I had the mussels for main which were delicious. Very fresh and tasty. It was pretty expensive though, even with the 30% off, as the alcohol was pricey. I wouldn't use it as a local, but would go every once in a while.

Service was amazing though. Very attentive and polite.
Had a meal last night at Hush Brasserie in Brook Street, London. The food was excellent as was the wine and the service was attentive. Overall very good

Court yard dinning in fabulous with good service and the deal is more than worth a visit.

Decent all round experience
We went to Hush on a Wednesday evening. Food good as always. A bit pricey without a TT offer. A great place to take friends from abroad - they are always surprised by such a hide-away in busy London.

Good food, service was discreet but a little slow at times.
Value for money with the discount offer.
Disappointed with the selection of starters as were almost the same price as the mains!
Hush Brasserie in London was a pleasant dining experience. Calm atmosphere as the name would suggest and extremely good value with the toptable deal.

Hush Brasserie was a great place for a romantic dinner on a Friday night. I had rib eye steak which was melt in the mouth amazing and my date had pheasant pot roasted. The cocktail menu is vast and the wine selection varied and interesting. There is a cool bar upstairs full of suited media types if you want to carry on after dinner. A great deal with 50% off.

The food at Hush was excellent and a bargain with 50% off food (we all had 3 courses).  This restaurant lets its chef down on the ambience, or lack thereof, created mainly by its staff, who are pleasant enough but lack drive and friendliness.
Hush is a nice buzzy place with consistently good food.
Hush Brasserie was very nice. Although a little too loud at times for a business meeting and a little expensive. The food and service was good.

Excellent food - service a little slow but probably because they're so busy but wasn't terrible.
Was told no seats available outside until we pointed out a spare table so were placed there - overall really enjoyed eating here. Wine was fantastic!
Hush is in a great location and very nice food

Went to Hush Brasserie on Saturday night - set on a secluded cobbled street with warm lighting and very welcoming staff. Food was fantastic - decent sized portions and full of flavour. 3 courses, cocktails, wine a water for ¬£100, excellent value for money.

I wouldn't rush to Hush. We sat at 7.30, and yet the daily special, Lemon Sole, Sashimi and Steak Tatare were already off the menu. The goats cheese starter was nice. The mushroom brioche starter was boring. The mains were as inconsistent: the fish cakes were tough and 're-fried' tasting, but the Moules mariniere were actually very good. The house wine was 16GBP and bearable. Coffee and 'bites' were nice. Bill was 62 GBP and all done in 1.5hrs. Quite acceptable, but certainly not exceptional.

Hush was a huge disappointment compared to previous occasions I've visited. Previously I would have highly recommended it for service, ambience and food, but on this occasion both the food and service were distinctly lacking - tastless salmon with a weird tasting sauce (though the chocolate fondant pudding was excellent). Service was stretched very thin indeed....almost to the point of no service! We had to ask at least twice for everything. Very disappointed this time round.

Great Location. Food is expensive. Burger was nice but pasta not so good. Cocktail lounge upstairs is lovely and worth a visit.
lovely area
I took my mother to Hush for dinner on Saturday night.  We had a fabulous time, the food was perfect and the atmosphere was very plesent.  I would definately go aain.
Fab evening out!  Excellent entertainment and service!  Enjoyed our meal and loved everything bit about the night. Can‚Äôt wait to go back!
Great service and great food! Amazing moment for my birthday!
Fantastic food. Friendly service. Exactly what you want on an evening meal out!

The mela didn't even know we had booked and they aren't even open at 5pm, we were really disappointed as we had got meal vouchers with our theatre tickets, we then had to waste time finding another restuarant. Take them off top table!

The service in this venue was fantastic. They had a busier bar area, but offered us to stay in a more private lounge. The night was themed so we had board games available. The staff literally sounded like they could foresee all of our wants.

The food was very good specially the scones. I took one star off for food as the patisserie items were not as refined as in other venues of similar price. But still very good food.

I would definitely indicate this venue as we had a great afternoon tea experience.
Disappointed both with my crab starter and beef main course

We arrived having booked through your web site only to find the restaurant closed to what looked like some major refurbishment. Very unprofessional and a waste of travel time. Since then I have noticed their web site is also now unavailable.
The food was reasonable but not sufficiently hot. The ladies toilets were appalling- none of them flushed
Quieter than normal but in light of the coronavirus it was expected. Love this restaurant, will be returning for my birthday.

Wonderful food, as always, and great advice on the wine - the Mendoza Malbec was so good we had to have two bottles!  A great ambience with a nice ‚Äúbuzz‚Äù when we arrived, and the service was superb. Back soon!
Extremely extremely noisy, to the point that in a table for 3 we could not hear each other or have a conversation
Service was very friendly and efficient and the food delicious. However, the restaurant was very noisy because it was full and busy.
Amazing!!!!  Would defo recommend and if visit London again will book to re visit! Can not describe how good it was!

Very inattentive service.   We had to call the attention of waiters a number of times.  Staff seemed to have lost any interest in their guests or their wellbeing.  I remember this as a charming and warm place, many years ago.  Now this seems to have been lost.  I will never again return to Langan‚Äôs.

I,m pleased to say that Langan's has not changed one little bit in the 30 years that i've been going.
Excellent friendly service from all of the staff ,good food and a lovely atmosphere
I hope to be dining there for next 30 years
Well done Langan's please don't ever change

Very enjoyable evening with good food, plenty of choice and flexibility to customise dishes to particular taste.
Service was attentive and efficient without being obtrusive and pre dinner drinks were made pleasant by helpful and good fun interactions with the waiter.
Exceptional service and food as always.

We arrived slightly early as two of our party had to cancel at the last minute and the Maitre d was helpful in changing our table size and accommodating us immediately.

Once seated we were presented with a wonderful menu with loads of choices. Our table was located against the back wall ¬†offered a full view of the very busy noisy main restaurant and I would suggested it‚Äôs not the place for a romantic meal for two. It‚Äôs a very ¬†lively place and perhaps best enjoyed as a group.

Prices seemed reasonable considering the location and particularly good ¬†value with the offer from Buyagift. All the food we received was excellent however we did have some issues with the service.

I had ordered Rib-eye steak and received the wrong sauce and requested it to be exchanged. I waited and waited and so started my meal and realised that I had not been brought a steak knife. I continued to wait ¬†trying to catch the eye of one of the busy waiting staff which was difficult and so started to try to continue with a normal knife. Eventually I received my sauce (and a proper knife) and tried a small amount to find that it was totally cold.

Again I had to ¬†wait to report my disappointment, and the waiter walked away after a muted ¬†apology leaving me slightly bemused. I continued with my meal without the sauce (lucky I hadn't poured it all on) and when the waiter eventually return and touched the sauce pot, he again apologised but at that point I had finished my meal.

The waiter returned 5 minutes later with a couple of glasses of wine as an apology from the chef, nice but I do not drink ¬†wine (only my wife had previously ordered wine) and so we were appreciative but equally bemused.

Bottom line, great food but some basic service errors from a very well established ¬†restaurant was surprising, disappointing and slightly tarnished the experience.

Lovely food but patchy service slightly tarnished the experience.
Thoroughly enjoyable lunch, appropriate for a friendly business chat.
Wonderful as usual. We always enjoy coming to Langans, lovely food, drink and impeccable service.

Having worked here in the early 80's as a chef, if I'm back in town I will come back to Langan's and it has never disappointed. The ambience remains warm and genuinely classy and whether you have a cut crystal accent or not the staff treat all with equal respect.

The menu is a touch smaller -a realistic adjustment but still offers a great range of dishes still prepared and cooked as Richard Shepherd would of demanded.

Well done all, both upstairs and downstairs, keep up the hard work and customers should keep coming in their droves, if they value quality rather than fashion.

Rick Simpson 1981-1983
As always - consistently SUPERB
2 pound cover charge per person added to bill...no music at the time we had dinner?? Better choices in the area.
AS a well known London Restaurant my expectations were high and they were matched by the service we received. A thoroughly enjoyable evening.
Disappointingly mediocre for a famous restaurant. Very "young" wine list
Really tasty food, lovely setting and super staff. Overall top class venue, cannot recommend highly enough.
Great atmosphere , friendly staff & excellent service . Good food
Had a lovely meal.  My one tiny grumble would be that our table (No. 1) was a bit limited on space for five people. But had a lovely afternoon.

good service and food.
very good wine list
very good variety on menu
Lovely food and great atmosphere.
A great night, again!  Very busy but had a great table.  Food was fantastic, service was a little lacking this time, but super busy and friendly staff.
Buzzy atmosphere  the food was nice and we had a nicer waiter.

I've been coming to Langans for 20+ years and the fact that the restaurant wad full on a Wednesday evening speaks volumes. Great atmosphere, busy, buzzy room, lovely space, outstanding service, great mrnu, exceptional value for money when you consider their location in Mayfair  Highly recommended. Joins my list of favourite restaurants in London along with The Ivy, The Wolseley, Scotts, Hakkasan - they all make it look so easy and of course none of this happens by accident: they all personify truly great, destination restaurants.

Langans Brasserie keeps on delivering a good value meal for any significant occasion.  We organized a gathering of old university friends, from both Australia and the Continent, and were seated at a wonderful round table in the window.  The service was attentive throughout and the food was, in the main, up to the mark.  The one blemish was the roast duck, which we specifically asked to be cooked pink and came well overdone.  However when we complained to the staff this was instantly removed from the bill.  Very happy with the attention though they should look at the kitchen adjusting to diners requests perhaps.   Overall we had a thoroughly enjoyable evening.
This was my second time at Langans and yet again the meal was of  high quality. Service was very good too.

Whilst the streets out side bustled with busy Christmas shoppers we relaxed in the warm, welcoming atmosphere of Langan's. We had a friendly welcome from polite staff.
The classic menu is as you would expect and the food and service perfect
I chose the souffle to start and our waiter gave me a short history of it as well as offering to spoon in the delicious hollandaise accompaniment when it arrived.

Choose this restaurant as we have not visited for years. Still very busy and lively. i had the poached eggs and haddock and the sauce was a bit over enveloping. My Beef Wellington was excellent but the English Chips were a bit dry and therefore dissappointing. We all had the Creme Brulee as I remember it being the signature dish and it was excellent.

We went to Langans for a school reunion on Friday 7th June; we chose the venue for posterity's sake.  The staff were fantastic, very welcoming and totally attentive.  The menu was great and the food superb.  We had an excellent evening, ate fabulously and enjoyed ourselves thoroughly, I'd totally recommend a visit.  The only negative observation I had was that the d√©cor was a bit tired, otherwise 100% fab.
In the brasserie tradition of good well cooked classic dishes with emphasis on quality basics such as steaks, fish pie,escalopes and fish. Service friendly and efficient but a little pricey.
I booked for 21:15 but we had to wait up tp 10:00, having a drink in the meanwhile on me. Then we were sat in a very small table.

This was our first visit. Pity they stuck us in a corner where we really couldn't enjoy the atmosphere. I guess because they never seen us before so put us in the worst location. it was difficult for the waiters to observe us which also effected experience although our waiter was great fun and he made up for this.Food was good though.
Great food Great Restaurant. We have eaten in Langans many times and they never disappoint.

A friend and I met at Langan's for supper on a cold, wet Sunday night. Not a good welcome - a distinctly chilly attitude from the girl on the front desk, not a smile, not a 'do come in ladies, may I take your coats', nothing. It was if she was suprised that customers had actually come through the door. A few lessons in charm and hospitality for the front of house staff would not go amiss.

However, it improved. The waiters were efficient and good fun and although the menu is a little old fashioned and school dinner-ish, our food was very good indeed, enhanced by a couple of glasses of fizz and some above-average house wine. They don't hurry you at all, so we ended up having a very relaxing time and thoroughly enjoyed our evening.
Enjoyed the atmosphere and the service was impeccable. My friend had London on his bucket-list, and what a better place than to go to Langan's once in London. 3rd time since 1994 is great as ever.
We always enjoy Langan's because of the great buzzy atmosphere.  Food this time was excellent especially the lamb.  Service in the bar area was not very attentive but in the main restaurant was good.

Langan's Brasserie London. A lively venue with a considerable menu to choose from. However last Friday lunchtime I thought the food was average, its presentation lacklustre and service was ineffective. We had to wait so long for our first course that we had to ask if our order had been forgotten. Having always been a great fan of the venue but been in the evening on all previous occasions I was disappointed but hope it was just 'a bad day'. Sue

Went to Lnagan's Brasserie for lunch on Sunday. It was Mothers' Day and the restaurant was busy. The menu was more limited than I have experienced before but there was still a very good choice. The staff were very attentive and the food was excellent. Sunday roast was a particular highlight with huge quantities of Roast Chicken. Thoroughly recommended.

Stratton Street- main restaurant.

Food as usual was first class, the waiters friendly and attentive.

Atmosphere "buzzing" which adds to the pleasure

Can't wait for the opportunity to return
Langhans in Piccadilly is most definately not what it used to be - Poor to say the least!!
A lovely meal, they were great with my little boy. Fast service, certainly would recommend for familys, groups and couples.
Langans Brasserie was a great place for a business lunch. Lovely meal and good service would highly recommend.
We had an excellent meal at Langans the food was superb as was the service. Although we were dining early at 5pm the ambience was fantastic, will  definitely return when we can.

the main room at Langan's Brasserie can be very noisy , to a point that private conversations may get very difficult if you are not ready to join the shouting . Prfefer the first room close to the bar which is more private and less noisy . Food and service are very good , the waiters very kind and ready to help . Wines are a little pricey , especially wine by the glass .
Our booking was @ 8pm, they thought it was @ 7pm, then made us wait 40 mins for our table.  Food was absolutely fabulous, service OK-ish, overall I thought it was a bit too expensive for what we got.

I went with 3 friends for cocktails at the Long Bar before going out for a Michelin dinner. Was first disappointed that we were not seated in the bar and had to go outside at the terrace. However turned out the terrace was nicely heated and actually quite cozy and also got an excellent service out there. The cocktails were really nice although a bit small. Would go back.
Love the selection of tea and savoury/sweet food items available on the menu. Will come back!

We loved our experience to the mad hatter tea party in the Sanderson hotel. Lovely venue, very well thought out in the garden with heaters. Staff were amazing knew exactly what was on the menu to whether it was a normal afternoon or vegetarian menu. Amazing food chefs made a very delicious menu. Have already recommended to friends and family. Most definitely be returning back still thinking about it a week later. Thank you Sanderson for a lovely afternoon tea

Took my mum and son on a Saturday in November to celebrate my mum's birthday. After reading some reviews I was a little apprehensive about the level of service, waiting, food that we would experience.
The service was great, always tended to as and when required. The food did take nearly an hour to come out, and we were given complementary cocktails as an apology for this. We sat in the courtyard which was nice and not as noisy as inside (there are blankets on every chair). The food was very well presented, and very yummy. We struggled to finish, so were given a doggy bag to take the remainder home.
This is expensive, so I would suggest it for a special treat, however it was very nice, the service was great, the food delicious.
Thoroughly enjoyed.

A delightful little break for tea in our afternoon. The staff was very knowledgeable, kind, and jovial. They walked us through each step of the way and ensured our experience was fluid. We enjoyed ourselves very much.

I took my cousin to the Mad Hatters afternoon tea as a special treat and it was amazing! The food was excellent and you could request more of anything on the menu, we loved the quails egg and croque monsieur so we were delighted to get some more of those! The teas were really fun and the decor/presentation was creative and really true to the theme. We were served by Kai (I think that‚Äôs the right spelling) and he was brilliant, very friendly and knowledgeable and he really made our visit special. Nothing was too much trouble and we were able to get extra clotted cream and water without a long wait. My only slight negative is that our table wasn‚Äôt outside in the garden which was a shame however next time I‚Äôll try and request for us to be seated outside. Highly recommend this afternoon tea, I would say one of the best in London at the moment!

I have been here twice before and had a fab experience however this time around, it was a very different experience.
We waited well over an hour for food to be served, we had to send back one round of our cocktails because they tasted awful and the replacement round wasn‚Äôt much better.
We could see others who‚Äôd arrived after us being served their food and drinks before us and it didn‚Äôt appear organised.

We also had to prompt the staff that we were missing elements of our afternoon tea and we waited a long while to have our teapots refilled.

We could also see that other tables around us weren‚Äôt happy either which was a real shame.

It was such a shame that this was our experience. We won‚Äôt be going back there for a while and we refused to pay the service charge.

My thoughts on their afternoon tea:
Positives: Sandwiches, tea and cakes were decent (I've had better but it was still good)
Negatives: Service was a little slow, restaurant was in a 1960s looking building which was a bit tatty, heater above us was not working, had expected to be offered a glass of champagne for the price, but no.
Overall - Not bad, but not amazing either

Sorry but I was very disappointed
I specially asked for no bacon but the bacon sandwiches came nevertheless
The tea was served 20 minutes after the cakes. When I asked about the tea I was told very impolitely
‚ÄòWe have ordered it and it is coming ok‚Äô
Lastly, we were told that someone will come along and explain the service and the story behind the cake display, no one ever came. When I told the waitress this at the end she was apologetic and said that her colleague should have told her that he did not do the explanation.
The service felt rushed, no finesse and very much commercialised. Almost like going through the motions. I would definitely not recommend
We loved the mad hatters tea party. The food was good, service was wonderful and was all around a great experience.
Loved this whole experience. All my Alice and Wonderland dreams came true. Just adorable...

Our afternoon at Sanderson for Mad Hatter's tea was absolutely splendid! I recommend this to anyone - locals and tourists alike - as a perfect afternoon tea experience. Their bar is also a beautifully decorated area with great service all around.
We really enjoyed this afternoon tea, food was really nice  and plenty.  The theme was continued all through the food and tableware. Staff friendly  and checked if we wanted more food or drinks.

Although we had booked for afternoon tea, we were seated in the bar dinning area and had to request and wait to move into the afternoon tea area.The scones and cakes were exceptionally good but the sandwiches were rather soggy. Although the service charge was supposed to be discretionary it was put on the bill automatically, we did contest this and were given a full refund, allowing us to decide on  an appropriate service charge.

Really loved this afternoon tea. Everything was well thought out and the little details were lovely. It was my friends 30th and the staff had seated us in a little private part of the restaurant and also bought a little cake over (had to take it home in a doggy bag as we had overloaded so much on sugar!!)
The only criticism I could make is that we were charged ¬£21.70 (15%) service charge, whilst the staff were very attentive and I couldn't fault their service, it made an afternoon tea very expensive (¬£55 each)

We attended the Mad Hatter Afternoon Tea at the Sanderson for my best friends hen party.  The look of the hotel is amazing, with quirky off beat decor.  The reception staff were extremely welcoming and friendly however we found some of the restaurant staff a little cool with their manners and it took a while to be served, we were second in for the sitting with a party of three but four tables were served before us.  The afternoon tea itself looked and sounded awesome, however the taste and execution of the different elements didn't live up to their appearance.  The cakes were stodgy and heavy and a lot of the flavours seemed unbalanced, either flavourless or far too rich.  We left feeling rather underwhelmed by the food experience but loved the surroundings, the centre courtyard with fountain was stunning to sit in.

Excelllent overall but sometimes left alone a little too long. Tea choice was excellent as si was the fact that you could pick and choose if you wanted something more or not. Would definitely visit again for tea if there was a special occasion to celebrate.
To much carbohydrate for me, i prefer some fresh thing like salad

The balance between savoury and sweet food included in the tea was not right. The service was very good, however as the food was so disappointing I wouldn't recommend. You're better off going to Duck and Waffle.
We had a lovely afternoon and we're served by the beautiful and attentive Gabriella
Great service, especially from Claire our waitress.

The quirkiness of the design decor at the Sanderson Hotel was amazing. And the level of detail must be appreciated. The tinkling of the musical sugar box, the carefully aligned plates and saucer and the hidden menu in the book. It all added to the atmosphere. However, this only meant that our food expectations were quite high. While the quiche and the victoria sponge were divine, the sandwiches were little more than dried up squished sandwiches and the mango cheesecake was tasteless. Furthermore, the pea shoots plants used to present the meringues, had mold growing on it. Not a pleasant discovery! Our waitress was excellent and most understanding. Will we go back? No, not for the food. But we were glad we went if only to experience it once.
The staff were courteous and attentive, the food was great and the wines were amazing. Would definitely recommend it.
Fabulous venue, the long bar is the bets in London

We both enjoyed our evening here.  The service was very good: unobtrusive and helpful. We enjoyed the cocktail and my first course of smoked salmon was good.  My companion thought her roast beets rather small as a portion.   We both enjoyed the rump of beef, but considered a plain tomato lacking the finesse that the restaurant might have provided!   Dessert- an interesting crumble, completed the experience.  I especially enjoyed sitting at the Long Bar for a drink before the meal and I will return!
Food was poor - pasta cold with warm sauce on, salad had been pre-made and stored too cold in the fridge such that it was frosted.  It looks like the Pizza is good here, but everything else poor.

Beautiful, spacious restaurant were you weren't hurried. Food was good. Little diffficult to find the restaurant and slightly stretches credibility saying it is in Covent Garden - it is not! On balance worth visiting.
Great atmosphere for drinks and small snacks. Wil be back

Due to new COVID changes, the restaurant lost all their bookings. However, we were accompanied to a private dining cabana, which was a unexpected special treat. Service was amazing, our waiter was very engaging and ensured we were happy. Food was smaller portions than we thought but at the same time we were satisfyingly full.

Went here for a special occasion, and it was well worth the visit. Every dish we ordered was beautifully presented and tasted just as good as it looked. The basil-infused panna cotta, to me, was the piece de resistance: delicate flavours with a hint of sweetness. Our waiter was very attentive without being intrusive in any way. Great service.
Excellent food and would recommend. Service slow to table slow and not well managed.
Great service, friendly and knowledgeable staff. Will be back to try the rest of the menu!
Great menu, great atmosphere and excellent service. It may seem a bit pricey but it was worth it for a special occasion.
Great, expect it was a very cold breeze sitting in the bar.

One word. AMAZING!
We were completely astonished about every course we got.
Best lunch of this year!
We loved it. Great and interesting offers and very nice atmosphere. Service excellent. Very attentive and helpful.
A really novel experience and great to see the links to where the food is grown and the wine made. The staff were also very knowledgeable about the dishes.

We came from west Wales for a birthday trip. It was a fantastic experience in every way. All the  dishes  we ordered were delightful and memorable. Our waiter Nick was excellent. We highly recommend to anyone & will return when possible. Thanks!
Amazing food and service
Excellent service and one of the best brunches I've had in London! Great selection of vegetarian dishes.
Delicious food, it was hard to pick!

Delicious food, well laid out table for 5 on a corner enabling us all to chat.
I didn‚Äôt particular appreciate the slightly obsequious service (I am definitely not a ‚Äúmademoiselle‚Äù) but otherwise it was efficient and friendly.
Great service as always, but even better this time! Very sweet waiter :-)
Waited a bit for the menus to arrive but otherwise service was good and recommendations were spot on. The food was excellent; I would come back

Our experience was enjoyable. After researching vegan options for our stay,  I found this new Ottolenghi restaurant close by in Fitzrovia. While our table was not ready for our reserved time, they immediately sat us at the bar for a drink, and also brought two complimentary small dishes for our troubles. They also immediately brought a menu for the vegan in our group with possible options clearly marked. All the food was  deliciously prepared, beautiful and the service was attentive. The decor was pretty amazing, too. Very happy with our dinner!
Great service from start ti finish, the staff where approachable and friendly with still being professional. great food with great staff

Many of the flavours were lovely, especially the sauces and yoghurts, but some of the dishes were disappointing. The much-hyped crumpet was a dry and flavourless, the polenta was a bit watery, and the squid and lardo was a let down. Somehow these small plates did not come together to form a fantastic and satisfying meal. Nopi is much better. I ate at Kym's the following night - the bill came to exactly the same amount (including two cocktails) and I felt I had feasted. Sorry.
Nice new Ottolenghi experience. Food is as expected, no highlights but okay. Guestroom is light and comfortable. Not so noisy like at other locations.

The corn is the outstanding dish, although the rest are all worth trying. We sat at the bar and had a great time looking at how our cocktail is being prepared while enjoying the dishes, i would recommend the bar seat over the table if you are going in two.
There were 10 of us and the service was great. Food was deciduous and arrived quickly and also waiters were very attentive and professional.
We have visited three times now and every time it has been outstanding.  Fantastic service and great food.  Can't wait to go back!
Noisy place, food not really authentic, sticky rice was dry, overall not a recommendable place to savour thai food

When I arrived the restaurant, I was told that they didn't have my reservation and the restaurant was fully booked. You can imagine how shocked I was! She checked the system and my reservation was clearly there but I have to wait. Finally she showed our table but no apologies. And this was not the end. When my guests arrived, they were told AGAIN there was no booking under my name and my guests were really worried. I was so embarrassed.... To be fair, the staff who served our table was nice and friendly but I really don't think I will go back to this restaurant again.

Unfortunately we arrived late, but I phoned to let them know and that was no problem, They still kept a table by the window for us.
We really liked the decor and atmosphere, the food was very fresh and tasty, We will be going back again as soon as we can.
The food was excellent, will definitely return to Suda. Sadly the service is lacking. Has to actiallly stand up in middle of restaurant to get someone's attention!
Got seated and it took 15 min to be offered a drink. Then a further 20 to get our drinks after 45 min no food and empty glass we left. Would never recommend
Bediening komt gejaagd over. De tagliatelle had iets langer gekookt mogen worden. Antipasti was smaakvol. Ivm theaterbezoek geen tijd voor dessert, dus maar beperkte mening.

We had booked a hotel close by and had been looking online for somewhere close by to have an evening meal. Read reviews and thought we would give it a try. Wasn't dissapointed.  Friendly welcoming staff and  the food was yummy and not overpriced.

Whilst the menu choice is very limited the drinks menu is extensive. We had dinner here after a visit to the theatre and the restaurant had a nice feel and buzz about it. The food was immaculately presented and delicious. Do not expect large portions. Do expect good food and excellent service.

I would love to have given them a review but as the restaurant closed down, and neither the restaurant nor opentable informed us we had to wait until the day the find out it had been cancelled and then we had to rush to find somewhere else - not great service sadly

We were at the restaurant for a Business Meeting. The service was terrible, and it was almost impossible to get any waiters attention. The drinks took ages to come every time we ordered them. The food was very bland.
Bit pricey but food is unexplainable and delicious.  Every item was with it.

I went to Cantina Laredo for dinner with two friends.  I have been a couple of times before and enjoy the restaurants ambience, plus its in a great central location.  We had the guacamole, which was delicious and great that they prepare it from scratch at your table.  It was so much better than the usual pre-made stuff.  We then had Chicken Fajitas which were also very good.  My only complaint is that on requesting some extra sauces to go with the Fajitas, we were charged an extra ¬£3.  When one is spending a decent amount of money for cocktails, food and wine, this seems rather petty.  Other than that a pretty good meal.

Very good choice on the pre-theatre men & good value for money. The starters we ordered were excellent (quesidillas) and it was a large portion. We were a little disappointed with our choice of main (corn enchildas with chicken filling) as it lacked taste - however the side orders we choose were good. Overall, worth a visit and great choice for proximity to Palace Theatre.
Was looking for a good Mexican food  before going to the theatre ... I didn't look any further this place is everything we wished for, and ticked all the boxes.
Not your normal Mexican food - good choice and makes a nice change. The freshly made guacamole is a must and highly recommended as a starter.

Staff was very attentive and both the Margaritas and food were brilliant!

Will definitely visit again and recommend others

This was the 6th or 7th time I have eaten at Cantina Laredo. In fact my two cousins and I have made a pact that all our birthday treat meals (we have one meal each birthday which is just the three of us regardless of what other parties or meals get organised for other friends and family) should be at CL - so every December, February and September you will find us there.

You get taken care of impeccably but never intrusively; serving staff are brilliantly informed and gracious; you can ask for the separate veggie menu (all items are on the main menu but just collected in one place for a veggie menu); all the food is delicious. Plus cocktails plus desserts. Leave room for tequila cheesecake with avocado ice-cream.

I booked based on online recommendations and it did not disappoint. The restaurant was quite busy, had a long waiting list, so would suggest booking in advance. We got a booth, which was nice and spacious. The decor is somewhat modern, but true to Mexican modern style. The drinks were nice and came quickly, we had guacamole made on the table, quesadillas, which were very tasty, and then a variety of dishes. Highly recommend the carnitas and also the papas con crema which are seasoned to perfection. Churros for dessert are a real must, then for a constitutional walk around Covent Garden!!
The food was good but we were kept waiting at least 25 minutes and even then I had to catch the attention of the waiter in order to be served!

It's hard to find Mexican food at anything other than the fast food end of the market, so Cantina Laredo was a great discovery. We went there on a Saturday evening and the atmosphere was buzzing, though you can still enjoy your private conversation without raising your voice. The best of both worlds really.

We ordered the guacamole for starters, which was mixed at the table. It was outstandingly good. Our mains were also excellent - not quite as good as I'd had in Mexico, but the best I've found in the UK. The staff are so friendly and helpful.

A great place for a group to celebrate a special occasion or for an intimate dinner for two. I'd advise you book ahead. They have a lot of tables, but it was almost full when we got there.

I am from Mexico, so I am often weary of restaurants that claim to serve 'Mexican' food. I had sat at the bar of this restaurant a few months ago, and really enjoyed a Margarita and a ceviche starter with my drink, so I thought I'd give it a go. Whilst not everything in the menu is Mexican, the flavour is very good. Just walking in, the smell of sizzling beef got hold of me and I ordered beef fajitas. I really enjoyed them, and my friend had ceviche as a starter and tacos de pescado for a main, and was quite pleased. The micheladas were very good, too. The waitress was attentive and very helpful.

The restaurant is huge, so it can easily accommodate big groups, or allow for a quiet space for a business meal.
We enjoyed the tasting menu with selected wines.  The food, wine and service was first class.
Great service, great staff,  great champagne. thoroughly recommend x
Service was incredible! The people were lovely and really made a good meal, excellent. Food was lovely and really affordable. We had the set menu which I‚Äôd totally recommend.

Superb meal in great surroundings. Perhap you could look into some noise reducing measures as the room gets quite loud when it is full, which make conversation a little more difficult. Realy enjoyed the food and wine which was a delight. Thanks
Far too expensive for what you get which is not much. Argon gas wine was a rip off. A small squirt and massive bill. No issue in paying but you don‚Äôt get what you pay for here!

On this occasion I was meeting a friend for dinner. I booked the 3-course offer which included half a bottle of wine. The menu choices were all good. My quail main course was excellent! Service was very efficient and friendly. Didn‚Äôt feel rushed nor too slow. All in all a lovely dining experience.

I booked a table for two for a special occasion however, I was put at a counter and had to ‚Äòbeg‚Äô to be given a table which I had booked for and to remind staff that I was supposed to have received a glass of champagne on arrival. I stayed for the fact that it was too late to book somewhere else.

We'd been before and both the food and service was impeccable. Unfortunately this time, the service was a little lacklustre (we had to wait for quite a while for our order to be taken and for our glasses to be refilled, we weren't offered Bloody Mary's despite it being one of our requests on the booking and knowing it was part of the bottomless package etc).
The selection of food was pretty mainstream as well - starters were slices of salami and ham, salmon, beetroot, green beans (nothingbyou couldn't pick up at a supermarket), mains were again, pretty mainstream - cod, turkey, pork etc, and the desserts were pretty bland - mince pie, cheesecake, choux.
The food that was cooked, was nice but just not outstanding. Not worth the ¬£90 per person (or the service charge you automatically added)

The Tasting Menu was beautiful and our waiter was kind enough to substitute one of the dishes which I didn't like .
Only slight issue with the service - we had the same person , who was great most of the way through through the meal , then he just dissappeared and we were left with 2 different people which felt odd . Still a great afternoon !

Always a pleasure...thank you.

The Langham has become our home from home in London. The Club is our first port of call, closely followed by a tasting menu dinner at Roux at the Landau on at least one night of our stay.

A fabulous and special place to celebrate or just to enjoy wonderful food and wine. The attentive, but unobtrusive staff, make every meal perfect.
This is still my favourite restaurant in London, although a tad expensive, the food is excellent and the service is first class. It should be on every bodies list to try at least once.
Lovely food, attentive service, well matched and delicious wine choices with the tasting menu.
Excellent quality. Very good service. Interesting menu. Reasonable and varied wine list.

Lovely evening at The Roux. The food was exceptional as you would expect. We had the 3 course set menu which had great choices including cheese for dessert. Every course was delicious. Service was attentive and staff were not snobby about us eating from the set menu. Wine was delicious.

It is an expensive meal even with the set menu but definitely worth it.
everything was excellent, loved it and would definitely go again..

I went to Roux at the Landau for lunch with a friend.  As a result of Roux's reputation, I was really looking forward to it.  However in the event I was rather disappointed.  We both opted for the set menu, which at three courses with a half bottle of wine, petit fours and coffee seemed good value for money.  The starter was ok as was the wine, however I ordered the pork belly for main course have specifically asked the waiter if the meat would be fatty.  He assured me that although there would be a little fat, it would not be too much.  When my meal arrived, the meat was almost all fat and inedible.  I did send it back and it was substituted for the fish, which was ok.   There was very little choice for dessert none of which appealed to me, so I just had ice cream.  Although the inclusion of the wine in the price makes the lunch reasonably good value for money, I was unimpressed and would probably not be in a hurry to go back there again.

I had read good reviews of the Landau so I thought it a good restaurant to celebrate a special occasion. The ambience is really lovely, and the staff the evening we went were all polite and helpful. However, my wife was not drinking alcohol that evening and asked the waiter to recommend something to accompany the meal. He sent the sommelier round, who actually sniffed when she asked him for a recommendation. He said she should just order anything. I asked a waiter for more bread, at which we looked at me and smiled broadly. Oh dear, how un-cultured of us. Set the tone really for the evening really! After that we just ate our meal and did our best not to offend the staff by our presence...
Food was good but I just don't know believe it had the Wow factor for the price paid. Perhaps an off night? Shame as I really wanted to write a fantastic review of the restaurant (I am such a fan of Michel from his TV shows)

I booked this restaurant for the special deal lunch. It was ¬£45 for 3 courses plus coffee and a half bottle of wine. The food was wonderful probably the best I've tasted. The portion sizes were good - not your normal haute cuisine minute morsels. Very important for a Yorkshireman - the thought of being taken the mickey out of for an expensive meal would have spoilt my enjoyment irrespective of how exquisite the tastes.
The wine was excellent - we had a half of white and half of red, just enough for Lunch.
The tastes of the food where exquisite and although it was posh London hotel it was not stuffy or starchy - the staff were helpful, attentive and friendly and obviously liked working for the Roux family.
We were dressed casually after walking round art galleries and doing some shopping which was no problem and the overall ambience was a haven of calm.
When we visit London we go to at least one top class restaurant, and have done for 10+ years, this was the best we have eaten in. I recommend the Roux at the Landau highly and we will go back.

The lunch deal was brilliant value, I had the mushroom soup followed by roast salmon with a half bottle of Chablis. My partner had the beef and onions followed by the rump of lamb with a half bottle of the Roux red. Both of us finished the meal with the cheese course.

I'm lucky enough to have eaten in many Michelin Star restaurants and I was amazed that this restaurant didn't have a star. I have honestly never enjoyed salmon so much (and I love salmon). Both my dishes were simple nowhere to hide fare and they were executed to an outstanding standard.

We left the restaurant promising ourselves another visit, the chefs table menu looked very inviting!

Wonderful value due to the Open Table special offer. The  quality of the food is not influenced by the price being charged during the promotional period.   It will easily entice patrons back later when they will probably try the wider menu.
A lovely meal with caring and attentive staff. Its certainly not cheap but where the money is spent is certainly obvious.

A lovely restaurant but the food was a disappointment, my wife's fish starter was overcooked and overall the food could have been hotter. Very nice but wouldn't return there are better places to visit.

What a treat it is to dine here! You will be pampered, spoiled and nearly pass out from the deliciousness of the food. You may even contemplate taking up a life of crime in order to fund what is sure to be a lifelong Roux addiction. It is no wonder that the gourmands of the day considered the Langham hotel as a second home - for the average person it's more like you've been allowed a hall pass into foodie heaven. It is well worth the money for such an experience, and if you go for one of the set meals you'll be amazed by how reasonable it is - especially considering the restaurant's location. I can't recommend the food or service highly enough - there is no pretentiousness or condescension here - you'll just feel happy, comfy and special!
Very attentive service with a personal touch. Good food, great wines in a beautiful ambience.

The ambience is beautiful and the service is immaculate but the food was okay... Good but not amazing but at least they were decent sized servings. My fianc√© had the lamb and I had the pappardelle with morels. It was okay but nothing special. The desserts were great though- he ordered the souffl√© and I had the doughnuts. I had the 3 course Du Jour menu and it was great that they have some decent vegetarian options (it was a separate menu). We were treating some friends as a thank you so thought we would choose something a little more special and while it was a good night out and we thoroughly enjoyed it, it wouldn't be a regular for dinner. A nice place to celebrate a special occasion or treat some friends to some fine dining.

Food was very bland and actually not that enjoyable, but there was plenty of it - and it was edible, nice atmostphere and good price with the top table deal. If I had paid full price, I would have been angry at the quality of the food. But for the price, it was fair enough.

My daughter is a student at Le Cordon Bleu London and had recently been privileged to have had Alain Roux as a guest chef at school. Am a huge fan of the Roux family and thought it would be a special treat to go to this restaurant.
We could not have been more delighted with everything! The food was absolutely divine, the service impeccable, and we would highly recommend Roux at The Landau!
Perfect service and faultless classical but seasonal food. The Top Table offer made it affordable
The food was very good, if rather expensive, the service was dire:over 2 hours for 2 courses, no wine list until reminded etc. Not good enough.
Best restaurant I've been to. And I've done them all.

This lunchtime visit was just about okay, albeit not really up to expectations. Everything was modest; food, ambiance and service, and was further let down by the wine waiter absolutely INSISTING that their Languedoc wine came from close to the Italian border!! Nothing I said about the meaning of the word would dissuade him, so I just drank up with no further ado.

On the second visit here, I was once again very happy with the dining experience. The food is excellent, the staff very attentive & the atmosphere very comfortable, not in the least pretentious. The ¬£35 set menu option good value, we will definitely be back for a third visit.

I had wanted to visit this restaurant for a long time and was disappointed only in the Top Table offer, which was not much difference to the usual set menu prices. Nevertheless we had a fabulous time. The dishes were imaginative and bursting with flavours. We ate the chicken ballotine and sea trout followed by sea break and flat iron steak then creme brule and cheeses. Exquisite. Service was friendly, attentive but unhurried. We were served at our own pace from 6.30 - 10pm! Adjacent table a bit quicker. Only complaint...pricey wines. Cheapest ¬£40.
We loved it though and will go again.

We have dined here many times but this was the first top table offer. The restaurant still delivered outstanding food and service, a superb table and we were treated exactly the same as those paying 3 times the price. Well worth going and we only booked 4 weeks in advance. A real lunch treat.
The food , service and ambience were all excellent. Only slight quibble, thought wine in bar was rather overpriced. Otherwise it was good value for money.

Went there for a birthday celebration one Friday evening, the staff were very attentive and the service fantastic. We ordered from the al a carte menu and the food was extremely good. Not cheap but worth every penny.
Food and wine was amazing. Would certainly recommend.

Roux at the Landau was a extremely nice location and the food was very good it really was a great place for a special meal in our case get together lunch before Christmas. We could fault nothing other than the cost which was a bit steep
Great Restaurant....defo worth a visit! The olives stuffed with mince veal and then deep fried were probably one of the yummyist things EVER!

My husband and I dined here for our 10th wedding anniversary. The food was outstanding and the wine excellent. We shared the suckling pig for main course, outstanding! My mushroom veloute' with brown shrimp was also delicious.

The waiters were friendly and professional, We were asked if our meal/wine/suckling pig/dessert/ was okay
several times by different members of staff, which did get a little irritating after a while.

I liked the open feel of the restaurant, but many of the smaller tables are around the edges at both ends which means one of you ends up with your back to the room. Not great for people watching!
Took my wife for Lunch on a Friday. Excellent food, wine and service.
This Restaurant treated my child as a paying guest with such flair i was bowled over ,

An excellent lunch at Roux at The Landau in Portland Square London. It was very good value. The food was excellent and the service was superb. Very god wine suggestions from the Sommelier and the cheese selection was very good and explained in some detail.

Definitely a venue to return to.

The usual excellent standard of service on this visit to the Roux at the Landau. The food was perfectly cooked and presented. While certainly not cheap, if you are looking for that venue for a special occasion, I would recommend it.
Everything was outstanding. The food blew my mind.My only gripe was you didn't have a barista to explain the coffee/beans/roast... Many restaurants let themselves down at the last hurdle!
An excellent lunch with superb food and wine a thoroughly enjoyable meal, i would definately gom again

A lovely meal with some nice touches but all a bit too serious. The service felt dated with our waiter (great) being undone by a scorning maitre d'. When my wife didn't finish her dessert (too full) a big fuss was made and our waiter told not to let chef see. Really? Your Chef's ego is more valuable than your customers satisfation! Go to Dinner by Heston and see what is happening in 2011 guys, Close but no cigar!

I have been dining out in London for many years now and have to say that Roux at The Langham is the best overall dining experience that I have  ever had. We have been there twice before and we took friends there on Friday for their TT offer lunch of 3 courses and a glass of Roux champagne. The room is classically elegant and the food was the finest - the service was just impecable. I cannot praise all the staff that served us enough.  Cannot wait to go back.

The food was superb, the ambience excellent and overall it is as good as it gets. Service was very panicky and disorganised for much of the meal and there was a sense of pressure, but that recovered towards the end of the meal and some calm, charm and attention came through. We will return and return!

The Langham itself is a beautiful hotel and the restaurant was lovely, very impressed and the lunch time deal was excellant value for money.

Nina, London

Enjoyed a great lunch with friends at Roux at The Landau in London. We had the 3 course lunch toptable promotion which included a glass of Roux champagne, canapes, coffee/tea and petit fours for ¬£29.50 per person. Excellent food and service. The lamb main was delicious and lemon tart divine. Highly recommended.
Great experience, attentive service and gorgeous food.

What a fantastic evening at the Landau. Fantastic environment, wonderful room, the best service I have ever come across, and truly delicious food. We left feeling full, happy, and relaxed. The menu is rather safe, and really quite light, perhaps in tune with the summer season. I have seen richer and more daring selections elsewhere, but the quality of the dishes cannot be faulted (other than the fact that the fried food tasted slightly oily). Ingredients were fresh and well paired, delicious.

My evening far exceeded expectations. The staff really stood out. They were knowledgeable and engaging without being overbearing.
Food was superb.
I'd aim for 8pm onwards to make it perfect.

My 3rd time at The Landau and it gets better everytime! It was our anniversary so I wanted to spend our special day in my fav restaurant. Booking via toptable, I mentioned that it was our anniversary and requested a table in a quieter area. We were so surprised that they gave us a special table in a designated private area which was so special. The meal was excellent and service as always was top notch. The petit fours with the writing 'Happy Anniversary' on the plate was v thoughtful n sweet!

We had the tasting menu - at lunch time to celebrate a special anniversary. The staff were very attentive and the service was good. We enjoyed the food and the experience immensely. We did however, have a few niggles -
The cheeses were very disappointing. We asked for 2 different selections of cheeses - the French cheeses we had were the same (Roquefort and epoisse- nice but not great and v. small portions. The English cheeses were tasteless and non descript - double Gloucester and something else tasteless. The petit fours weren't very insteresting either.
That said, the bread was fantastic - the tasting menu was on the whole very well balanced and each course was delicious. High points were the scallops, foie gras and lamb.

Roux at The Landau was nice but not good enough to be a destination somehow. Service was kind and adaquate but not spectacular...with things arrving at different times and no description of the dishes upon presentation. The food itself was fine but not particularly memorable. Mark-ups on the wine list were shocking. Good enough if you're in the area but not worth a trip.

We had a very special evening at Roux at the Landau. Excellent food and wine were complimented by excellent service. We enjoyed the whole experience and found the evening completely relaxing and enjoyable - not something you find everywhere!  I will certainly be visiting again when I am next in London.

WE went to Roux at The LandauThe restaurant which is at Langham, Portland Place, London, W1B 1JA last night.It‚Äôs a really good experience to have a meal at the restaurant; it‚Äôs very friendly service and lovely meals. But the restaurant seems are a bit too crowed with so many tables.
I thought the Langham was lovely.  The food and service was good.

The Landau is a beautiful restaurant in a very good hotel. Accordingly, service and presentation are immaculate at all times.

The set menu (3 courses and champers for ¬£34) is great value for money.
Not the best food I have ever eaten, but very good none the less - the addition of a great venue, great service and atmosphere made a super night out.

I would highly recommend.

This is a great place for a special lunch or dinner. The desserts were heavenly and the service excellent. A beautiful building too.
Highly recommended. The restuarant are also doing a 2 for 1 luch promotion throughout August which makes its excellent value too.

Very tasty! Lovely dining room, very attentive sommelier who picked us a fantastic wine to go beautifully with the mainly fish dishes we had - artichoke & trufle salad, asian scallops (partner) and seared tuna followe dby halibut with cokels & clams. Would defintely go again, and would recomend for groups as well as intimate diners - the tables are well positioned so you are not over looked by other diners.

First everyone should know that if they are going to meet someone at this hotel they should send the EXACT NAME of the restaurant and the hotel address to their guest.  It seems that there is another "Langham restaurant" in London!  Our guest went to the other one and so we ended up being very late for our booked dinner.  However we did have a super off the main menu dinner.  The bread boy needs some help/proper instruction and the wiater should serve the wine throughout the meal.  B+/A-

The Landau at The Langham, London W1B 1JA is a great place to have dinner. The food was excellent and has a very good service. Everyone was very friendly and attentive no snobbery that often shown in this class of restaurant. One of the very few restaurant that I feel good paying the 12.5% service charge. Highly recommended.

Had a lovely evening at the Landau. Food is very nice, though expensive if paying full price. Service was excellent and the waiter helpfully suggested a great wine to accompany our food. Would probably go again for a special occasion.

We visited the Artesian bar before our dinner - wonderful setting so felt the expensive prices were worth it for this special occasion. The service was delightful - attentive and friendly but not intrusive. The food was delicious - my friend said 'the best meal he'd ever had' - and he travels the world on business - so praise indeed. The Top Table deal is great value - but beware as the extras do add up - water , wine etc. I highly recommend The Landau and will go back again
some interesting surprises in the dishes
from the moment you walk through the door you are treated to 5* service, the food is exceptional.it made a wonderfull treat for a birthday weekend.we would not hesitate to book again.

The Landau, London.
We had a very lovely lunch and the starter of otopus was excellent.
Service very attentive and would definitely go back. Very convenient location near Oxford Circus

The ambience was disappointing.The restaurant was 50% empty on a Saturday night and people were very casually dressed.
the service was not as attentive as it should be and the evening was punctuated by loud crashing of crockery being dropped.
Shame

On recommendation we went to the Landau and were not disappointed. We were treated fantastically, the food was good (portions did vary in size) and the whole experience was very relaxing. Avoid the  canapes in the cocktail bar!

I would highly recommend the Landau for dinner, I went there for my 30th birthday and I had an excellent evening. The waiter really looked after us and made my birthday special. The food was excellent and the sommelier was brilliant, and chose/advised on 2 good wines with our main meals. I was very impressed over all and would definately go back. Thanks to all the staff who made it special for me.
The Landau was great, lovely setting and fantastic food.

The Landau is an oasis of calm just off Oxford Street. We went for a long lunch pre-Xmas as a prelude to a West End show. Disappointed at first not to see the grazing menu available at lunch but the maitre d' heard our enquiry, chacked with the kitchen and voila seven course grazing arranged. Food was superb and service attentive without being OTT. Wine waiter provided interesting information on my own choice of wines and refused tip as service charge covered!! Water, coffee and tea pricey.

I took my mum to the Landau for lunch on a Monday. The menu was exciting and the food was amazing and beautifully presented. The staff were formal and polite, adding to the impression that this was a special lunch. We had a special offer 3 course meal for ¬£26, but I was amazed at how far our money went with complimentary coffee and a tray of chocolates presented at the end of our meal. We were both very impressed and have been raving about it ever since.

The Landau wass the best meal I've had in London. The Dorchester offers a better overall experience as it has more to do and is unreal, but the food at The Landau was in a different league. I would also rate it higher than Chez Bruce. Superb, and the service was only surpassed by the simple excellent Dorchester
Excellent value at the Landau and very good quality of food and champagne given it was a Toptable set menu.

a great place to impress family/friends from the minute you walk up the stairs, through the hallway with rakcs of wine on either side to the dininig room. TT offer was very good value consiudering the portions. The foie gras to start was smooth and tasty, the salmon and pork are favourties and the cheese as dessert is a good bet! Unlimited bread as well. champagne to start the night is always a great bonus! Will go again and agian. Service is excellent - no complain at all.
Excellent evening at the Landau. Very romantic. Throroughly enjoyed and a great offer with Toptable.

The food - presentation and taste was outstanding. The service was excellent if on occasion a little too showy with swirling wine bottles. I am left with a little nostalgia for the old decor but found the present one nevertheless fresh and breezy. However the best and most important decor are of course the clients and we were able to enjoy our company with a positive background hum which signifies quiet satisfaction shared. Well done.

I look forward to returning.
Faultless.  TT deal was excellent value, the food was delicious and the service was warm and welcoming but extremely professional.  Wouldn't hesitate to recommend and will definitely return.
Excellent first time experience, service spot on and food different and very fast particularly the Ragu!
Great restaurant. Food was first class. We tried several dishes and all were great. No exception. Service was first class. Overall, a great new addition to the London offer.

used to be very good still a year ago but with real chef menu but since the covid, the menu got extremely small serving only jurema dishes. then I received an email saying yopo menu was back but it is actually a very small menu with dishes not as refined as before. too bad chef was really good. I think mandrake hotel is trying to transform yopo in a trendy restaurant with extremely loud music and ok food. too bad. I hope the chef will open soon his restaurant to perform his own dishes.
ah I forgot 4¬£ for 1 simple raw oyster... and impossible to have a conversation because music is too loud and waiter just pat your shoulder and restaurant mangaer is showing a very good example by not wearing mask at all the whole night! ( have you heard of this little thing called coronavirus, well at Yopo they don't )

Best value lunch ever eaten. Stunning clever flavour some food with charming and most courteous service. A tremendous wine last and immensely gracious over misunderstood pricing. Will definitely be back. Most certainly the best value ¬£26 3 course meal I have had in a long lifetime of indulgent lunching.

Thank you all for yet another fantastic experience, really sad to see one of my favourite restaurants go but I'm sure the team will go on to do bigger and better things in the future. Thanks for all the memories!
Tasty and varied with friendly staff and in an informal setting.

Our meal was enjoyable overall although I wouldn't recommend the squid dish which was rather tasteless. The ability to order a mixture of smaller dishes to share is a plus. The ambience was OK but spoiled somewhat by the presence of a rather obstreporous toddler who spent a lot of time screaming.  The cost was about what I'd expect for a decent restaurant in the West End.  The service was excellent.
Beautiful food and wine at a very reasonable price. The staff was super friendly, and the location is great.
We booked this to celebrate our anniversary having just arrived from New Zealand. The staff, service and of course the meal were excellent.

I enjoyed the food especially the duck and crispy polenta. The wine selection is also good and has many options that can be paired effectively with your meal. I enjoyed the French rose that was on offer.
This is not as described! Just some tables on the pavement outside. Food was very good although choice limited.

Kopapa is the sister restaurant to Providores but is definitely the shabbier version. I've eaten there twice, and the first time enjoyed the evening and the food. The second time was midweek, so the restaurant was busier, and the small plates were not impressive at all - much of the food seemed to have been prepared earlier and not freshly to order.

The main courses were lovely but by then I was already disappointed in the food.

The place is also very busy without much atmosphere - it has the feel of people in a hurry to eat and get out with high turnover of tables. I won't be going back.

Had the 3 courses plus prosecco for ¬£25, good value and liked the choices of dishes. Some very tasty dishes with interesting flavour combinations. Service was good, not intrusive and didn't rush us. However, didn't get the wow factor I was hoping for with food or restaurant.

I booked Kopapa for dinner out with the girls on a weekday night. We had the xmas menu (3 course for ¬£x) and was really impressed the amount and quality of food. The starters were amazing, especially the scallops. The mains were good, I chose the lamb, although they were cold which made it slightly less enjoyable. Also our veg came out 15 mins later...although they very kindly brought us a glass of champagne because of that. Overall it was a lovely evening despite the problems though.

We had the pre-theatre menu, and it was really good value for money: ¬£18 for 2 courses/¬£21 for 3. The menu options were interesting and seemed representative of what was on offer on the full menu. Our main courses were excellent and, surprisingly, substantial: I had cod, which was succulent and moist, served with haricot beans and a tasty black olive tapenade. My friend's pork belly and polenta was, apparently, delicious.

I have two complaints:
1. The seating is too crowded. I had to get out of my seat everytime someone at the next table wanted to move to or from their seat.
2. A number of items on the menu were unavailable or had run out, even though it was only 7pm. However, in Kopapa's defence, alternatives were offered.
Interesting menu which I enjoyed, a pity about the service...
Great food as always although, being totally packed as it always is at the weekend, the service was not the best- the staff just seemed to have too much to do. Will still keep going back though!

We went to Kopapa for a friend's birthday dinner. I found the restaurant to be very accommodating - I had to extend the booking twice and they simply dealt with it. Note that parties over 8, you will probably need to have the set menu. We chose the middle option. Food was pretty good all round - the sharing plates and desserts being the stand out items. Everyone was suitably stuffed. The staff were great - attentive and efficient. As Kopapa is a sister restaurant of The Providores, I would go back to try the a la carte menu.

I have been here a few times now, for lunch with a colleague/friend. The food is really interesting and tasty but there are not many veggie options. . The Xmas menus had about six mains, four or five were meat based. One veggie option is NOT a choice.

At these prices one expects an equivalent standard not to feel you're an after thought. Peter Gordon seems to favour meat, but is one of the most interesting chefs in London. I live locally and would be a more regular diner if (a) thee prices were a little lower and (b) more veggie or fish based mains :)
Amazing for their small plates!
cute place to go for brunch, food was delicious and decor was understated

We booked Kopapa for a 4.30pm late lunch/early supper on a Sunday. Waiter very helpful in explaining the portion sizes of the small plates against the main plates. We liked so much on the menu it was hard to choose - I think if the small plates had been a little cheaper we probably would have had a few more! Decor just right - relaxed but with crisp white napkins. Would definately go back to try more on the menu!
Great little restaurant. We had the pretheatre menu and were impressed at te selection available! Food was great, service was polite and fast and the prices were excellent! Highly recommend!
Decent place for a quick pre theatre meal, food was tasty although not unforgettable.

Kopapa in London was a lovely venue for brunch.. the food was interesting but not fussy and used high quality, carefully chosen ingredients. Very quick service.
.
Lovely unusual find

I went to Kopapa for lunch with a colleague, and we were both extremely impressed with the food, as the mix of flavours in some of the dishes were sublime. We went for a selection of Tapas - 5 dishes plus a bread basket was ample for lunch and the choice of non alcoholic drinks was very good and coffee was very nice too(from local company Monmouth Coffee).
The atmosphere was satisfyingly buzzy without being too noisy, and I'll definitely be back, as there are lots more dishes I need to try!
Beautiful food and good wide choices. Very good service and friendly staff. Very quiet relaxed atmosphere really enjoyed our meal
Always a pleasure to eat at The Portrait Restaurant. Delicious food served in such a wonderful setting. The pre-theatre menu is such good value. One of my favourite places to eat in theatreland.
Wonderful location and a real treat for dinner...
Excellent place for meeting and having a long lunch chatting and eating and drinking. Fabulous view fabulous service fabulous food. Quite pricey, but the view makes up for that.

I cannot recommend this restaurant highly enough, the food was incredible, the setting beautiful but the best thing about it is the service - impeccable! Such lovely wait staff, so attentive and so friendly!
The view / location remains exceptional, the food is very good and our server was excellent, attentive without being overbearing, a thoroughly enjoyable Sunday Lunch if a little pricey .

The restaurant at the National Portrait Gallery has very helpful friendly, smart, staff who do their job well. The food is very good as well as excellent value and the views of London are wonderful. I would recommend it for most occasions.
The Portrait restaurant has excellent views over Trafalgar Square and provides an enjoyable and memorable dining experience. The service is excellent and the food good, if not outstanding.
who would have thought this combination would have worked? But it did!

The Portrait Restaurant in the National Portrait Gallery serves extremely good food, with a very reasonable Set Menu, and is blessed with wonderful views over London.  It is always a pleasure to eat there, and the staff are always helpful.
Fantastic views and nice staff. The food is goo as well

We ate at Portrait restaurant at the National Portrait Gallery on Friday 28 Jnauary.  The view was wonderful, the food very good and the service attentive, but discreet.  I would recommend it to anyone and will definitely go again.
Really nice restaurant, but food was a little disappointing, and I had to ask for the champagne included in the deal.

Great location, and nicely decorated space inside. However, the service was really slow. We sat for 30 mins waiting for a coffee, before we ordered our lunch. And even then the waiters never really came over. I actually asked if it was bar service as I thought it must have been. Its a shame, because the people that worked there were super friendly, they just seemed massively understaffed or under-trained.  Tasty food though

The size of the actual burgers, the patties themselves is pitiful especially when charging 11-12 pounds...

In fact all portion sizes were v small for the price!
Small but quality menu. Food very tasty and reasonably priced. Would recommend.
Excellent interesting veggie Keralan food. Makes a change from the average curry and hidden away conveniently close to shopping!
We went for the set menu at Rasa and found the choice excellent. Really fresh food packed full of flavour.

First time here, what a joy!. I have eaten in a lot of Indian places in London and this one is superb. The key thing is that the food is super fresh. The South Indian nature of the food is very different in taste and texture. Which I must say is a delight.
Again, I have eaten in many south indian in the Uk and this one is without question the best. The final suprise is the price. For central London can't beat it.

We all agreed that we had a most enjoyable evening at Rasa.  The food was extremely good, and there was plenty of it.  There were eight of us, and we all chose a fixed price feast.  Each time we ran out of any particular dish, the waiter politely asked if we would like more, a ‚Äúyes please‚Äù promptly resulted in more delicious food.  Highly recommended.

Been going here for a few months now, the staff are all so lovely! Particularly the tall, blonde Australian lady, she is an absolute credit to the company. Incredibly friendly and is always smiling. I hope she sees this message!
The food was fresh and delicious. Service was amazing too and we went with the servers recommendations. He knew what he was talking about!

Despite arriving at 5.30pm it was 7pm that we ended up leaving after 2 courses and physically chasing the bill.

When we arrived on a Saturday afternoon at 5.30 it wasn't particularly busy. We placed our orders and noticed the place soon filling up. But then we noticed that people that came after us and ordered after us were getting their dishes. I did hear the head waiter point out to one of his staff that someone sitting near us was a "good, regular customer". Not us obviously!!

Finally after 40 minutes from arriving our 1st course arrives. Except there is only one of them, the special asparagus soup. It's missing the mascarpone cheese which is in my partners when it arrives 8 minutes later. Our mains take another 15 minutes to appear after having our plates cleared. The polpette meatballs were luke warm while my standard spag bog was nuclear hot.

We asked for the bill and mentioned the 20% off deal for booking via here. The waiter doesn't know anything about it and brings the manager who acknowledges it. A further 10 to 15 mins pass and no bill and no sign of our waiter so we flag another down and ask for the bill. Another 10 mins pass and I get fed up and go to the till and unknowingly bypass the waiter with my bill. He brings it back to me and the 20% discount has not been taken off. A profuse apology from the manager saying he'd been suddenly swamped with people wanting to leave (funny that, given that it was Saturday night in the Theatre district, you'd think he may have noticed it happens all the time). The 20% off is only on the food portion, not the total bill as per this site. I would have saved a further pound, but the will to leave at this point was too great and I just gave up.

Thankfully the evening was saved by the show we saw, but it was an extremely disappointing trip to what normally is faithful stalwart of cheapish West End dining. If only the Stock Pot was still around in Soho.

I had a very simple meal at the St Martin's Lane Spaghetti House, choosing from the cheapest set menu.  The "bruschettina" with tomatoes was fresh and garlicky and the spaghetti alla bolognese basic but good.  Pudding: apple strudel with toffee ice creak and caramel sauce - yum!  Service was fine.  I remember visiting this restaurant 20 odd years ago and it felt honest and authentic: it still does and I would certainly return for a no-frills Italian meal.  I'm very happy!

We were impressed by the quality of the food at the Spaghetti House in St. Martin's Lane. There was a good choice of starters, pastas, pizzas and traditional Italian main courses.Even though the restaurant was very busy on a Saturday night, we fely we received an excellent level of personal service.
Really friendly and efficient service, decent food, good coffee.  Just the job if you are time limited, and have to hurry on to a show or a meeting.
The restaurant closed so I don't have an experience to share, as my booking was cancelled.

We came early, and was excited about the afternoon tea. We was quit surprised when we where told the restaurant had been closed for 3 weeks. Really dissapointed. And why did Opentable let us make an reservation?! Not good.
