I didn't actually end up sitting at the counter which might have been due to some confusion about if I had booked for just myself or two people and that caused a little further confusion as staff was waiting to take my order until my date would arrive :D The food was great and (perhaps apart from that one slightly accusatory questioning about how many people I booked for, I booked for one I assure you) the service fantastic.
Mortimer House does not recognise bookings taken via OpenTable, so there was no booking when we arrived.  They found us a table, but no thanks to OpenTable
The food and service received was of a high standard . I would return here if I was meeting people in the area
Great breakfast venue

Really lovely interiors and great location. I thought the food was tasty but the atmosphere was fairly flat, although I know it's only just opened, so it might take a while to get busy. One thing I would say is that the service could have been a bit more lively and friendly to make up for the quiet setting. It felt all a bit nervous and formal.
Everything was very good. I will visit it again . I recommend it.
Booked Friday 2am arrived 8.45pm the club had gone into administration. Paid a lot for a taxi and was going there to take a meeting with someone- v unhappy

Lovely restaurant only downside was the fact they never got our opentable reservation? but we got a table anyway luckily! Also, another annoyance were the waiters that were circling our table like sharks... a little too much! We were trying to have a private conversation...
Food is great here though!
Matsya was impeccable. The food, service and employees were gorgeous. I was a little saddened by how slow it was because it's such a gem. If you're questioning having a meal here. Don't miss out!
Excellent coconut prawn curry.  Old fashioned decor but friendly service. Doors don't open before 6pm exactly.
Was ok but asked for a table in the or window, they said it was fully booked when their was plenty of tables available so wouldn't recommend in a hurry.

We loved this place in our younger days for romanting evening meals. We moved away and missed it a lot but Sunday night 25th Oct my 75th birthday my wife treated us all at the old Gaylord. We enjoyed the non alcoholic cocktails and varieties of vegetarian dishes.
I enjoyed my meal here but it was on the expensive side for a curry. The TopTable 20% deal helped! I will go back.

I cannot stress enough, the overall quality at The Gaylord. I love curry and I have not enjoyed another curry anywhere in the UK as much as I enjoy that offered by this restaurant. I honestly don't know why they are not packed out every lunchtime and I am baffled as to why the reviews on this website aren't amongst the highest.

With the 50% Top Table offer the prices are ridiculously reasonable. They might be a little on the high side without the offer but in all honesty I still think it's worth every penny.
Met a friend who l had not seen for sometime, we both enjoyed.Service could have been better,I needed to ask for the discount

I went to treat my parents on their 41st Anniversary. Our table was nice and the service was very good. Very friendly staff and the food was very nice too. The food portions could have been slightly bigger but overall we all had a great experience. The restaurant gave a nice little sweet treat surprise at the end which was very touching. I would surely recommend this restaurant.
Good food. Try the paapdi chaat and the quail. The pakoda platter was good. But bhel puri was lame. They forgot the TT discount. But put it back when i mentioned it.
Everything was fine, there were 11 of us and we had the Royal Wedding Special, very good value indeed. Many thanks Gaylord.
Everything was lovely, reception, service, food. Can reccomend it without hesitation.
Authentic Indian food but the place lacked ambience.

Great atmosphere.  Busy which is a good sign.  Good service.  Excellent food.  Loved the pomfret.  Got cold quick.  So maybe keep on a burner at the table?  Tudka dahl, palak paneer - both excellent.  Nice time.
Good food and value for money. Belly dancing performance is a bonus.
Great interior and the tagines are really good. Great tastes and very nice staff.
The set menu on TopTable is great value for money, the portions are very large and the food is tasty. I'd definitely recommend going if you can get a deal.

Having just returned from Morocco, Souk Medina brought back happy eating memories. The food was good and reasonably authentic but a bit overpriced given the ingredients and portion sizes. Lovely decoration and ambience.

I went with a friend and we shared a few starters and a main meal. We found it very expensive for what we had even with the 50% food discount.
Probably won't return for food, but the ambience is nice for snacks and cocktails

The food was good and the service was also good up until the incident. The value was enhanced by the 50% off deal but would have been very pricey without that.

The 'incident' involved me being stuck to the seat with a piece of chewing gum which then stuck to my trousers. The manager was not sympathetic although one of the other staff accepted responsibility. So it was a pleasant experience until the manage suggested I might have already had gum stuck on me when I arrived - 'how was he to know?' After the other member of staff intervened the manager came back and tried to be more helpful.
Good dining experience; food was scrumptious, ambience was lively.
Excellent experience. Very much enjoyed the food and hospitality.

Went to souk medina in covent garden. AMAZING place which brings you to a real morrocan market.
We were warmly greeted by "sunshining" blond boy :) and seated on nice cozy table. Thanks to our waiter Mantosh, he was amazing. The food was delicious and served in real morrocan tagines. Barmen could be a little bit better as coctails were too sweet. Would definatelly recommend for the couples or big groups. With top table offer very good value for such amazing service and taste of the dishes. GO!

Went to Souk Medina in Covent Garden with a few friends and though the atmosphere and the decor is great, the service and food is less impressive. We were kept waiting at the bar for almost half an hour even though there were empty tables around us. I had to remind the manager we were waiting and then only were we were seated. The music is extremely loud when the belly-dancer comes out though it adds to the atmosphere and it's still a good night out with friends.
(null)

I went to Souk Medina with a friend, we had the set menu which was pretty good value as you get lots and can re-order if you want more. Its a good option if like us you are too busy talking to decide on what to eat!
They had belly dancers which was good fun.
The only negative was that the seating and tables are quite low so it becomes a bit uncomfortable after a while with a full stomach!

I loved the atmosphere and design of Souk Medina. Although some might find the couch/table combination a little squashy, it was perfect for me and my friend to have a good catch up without having to shout across the table. The food was delicious. The service, while friendly, was stretched and we never received our water which was requested and had to ask for the top table discount to be applied to the bill. . I would come back here again.

We went for my birthday on the 3 courses and a kir royale offer. It was a great communal dining experience and the selection on offer was just about right. The setting was perfect and the belly dancer did a great show.

The only slightly negative thing was that our bill was brought out alongside our 3rd course and we were told that the table was booked for 9 and we had to leave. It wouldn't have been too bad if we had been told on booking that there was a two hour limit on the table.

Had a lovely time at Souk Medina last night. The ¬£19.95 offer was such good value, enabling us to sample lots of delicious dishes. Service was prompt and the atmosphere very relaxed. The belly dancing provided a bit of fun entertainment! Lots of diners were invited to join in and seemed to be really enjoying themselves! Highly recommended. A good place for a meal with a group of friends.

Pleasant restaurant and food was good value; we opted for the set menu which was good and offered plenty of veggie choice.  Only criticism was the table; we were on a low table when we would have preferred a normal table with chairs.  I can understand the authenticity but it would have been nice to have to option
Souk Medina, Covent Garden, London-lovely location, great food , good service, would recommend and definately go again.

We have been here many times because we like the food but on this occasion, the service was below average. We ordered set menu for the whole party of 4. Starters came at a reasonable time but we waited forever for them to serve our mains until we had to eventually ask for it.

I went to Souk Medina in Shorts Gardens, Covent Garden last night. We had a really great time, the food was wonderful and excellent value, the Moroccan white wine was very good and the cocktails were amazing. Probably the best mojito ever.
The atmosphere was great, very lively and the whole environment is relaxed and enjoyable.
The belly dancing was great, she worked hard to involve the whole room.
Did the set menu deal which was perfect for our group of 9. Lots of food and and the service was very pleasant. We particularly enjoyed the belly dancer who came round the tables. So much fun!

We had a fantastic evening at the Souk Medina in London's Covent Garden last night. There was a good range of dishes in our set menu and there was plenty of everything, as we were able to request additional servings of our favourite dishes. We really enjoyed the Belly Dancer and the way that the staff joined in with the live entertainment. Great atmosphere and very good fun. Ideal for groups.

Souk Medina was absolutely amazing! Right in the heart of covent garden, we initally booked at it's sister restaurant but they were full so we were transferred here. Lovely atmosphere, really delicious food and great cocktails. Even had a belly dancer half way through the evening. We sat in the downstairs area which was a bit like being in a wonderful comfy cave...soft cushions, low table and twinkly lights. Would definitely recommend!

Had the set lunch at Souk Medina, Covent Garden and absolutely loved it. The waitresses couldn't have been more attentive (even singing to me for my birthday!) and the food was great. We were offered more of whatever we wanted but to be honest we struggled to eat everything that was put out the portions were so generous! Will definately be back.

A very enjoyable experience, amazing teas and food is high quality, though I couldn't eat that much as most of is lemon based and I'm allergic, but my colleague gobbled up for the two of us which means everything is cool :-)
I really liked the atmosphere, it's like 1000 and 1 night, beautiful place. Friendly service, will go again.

I thoroughly enjoyed my experience at Souk Medina. I had asked them if they could arrange for a cake as it was a birthday celebration and I was surprised when they came out singing happy birthday! The only downfall is its tooooo busy, however, the food was different and the ambience was excellent! Would definately go again!
Enjoyed the evening at Souk medina - the banquet menu is good value, there is a lot of food!! Tasty, and a good atmosphere.
I liked the ambience. Nice food and good location. Very good for a group dinner.

We had a girl's night out at Souk Medina and were very impressed with the decor and ambience of the whole restaurant. Unfortunately, the food was very average and the TT deal menu was very limited so we ordered via the extensive a la carte menu (which didn't come to much more money!). Service was great and the place was full making it still an enjoyable evening.

Souk Medina perfectly situated. It was small & cute with a great atmosphere. The food was nice but not fantastic but the setting made up for it. The only issue I had was with the size of the table as our food didn't fit on the table.

A great place to enjoy traditional Moroccan food at an excellent price. The set menu for ¬£20 is such good value for money and with free top up's of all dishes, basically equates to an all you can eat offer. Set menu includes mint tea and Baklava's for dessert. All in all, a thoroughly enjoyable experience and would definitely recommend to anyone
I love Souk Medina. The food is plentiful and delicious, the atmosphere is great and it is a fun meal all around. It started our New Year's Eve off perfectly and I will most certainly be back!

Restaurant seemed slightly disorganised but were very accommodating. Seating was a bit cramped but all added to the atmosphere. Drinks menu was excellent but could do with more vegetarian choice in the food. Would recommend this as a change from the usual restaurants and good value for money.
very atmospheric, a little hidden jewel within a hectic city.

Souk Medina was great. Fantastic decor and atmosphere. Helpful & happy staff. I would've probably rated value for money a bit higher but going just before Christmas I think you always get ripped off a bit (we were only offered the Xmas feast menu which was ¬£25 each!). I would def book it again at a less busy time of year.
Souk Medina is nicely tucked away from the hustle & bustle of Covent Garden. Food was good although took a while to arrive at lunch, so I was late for work. Good ambience.
Cozy setting, great charcuterie, friendly service and outstanding home-made fresh paste, all at surprisingly acceptable prices for the area

I booked a table through OpenTable but when I arrived the restaurant was closed. I had received a confirmation of my booking earlier but there was no-one there and no information online about it being closed. Very unprofessional.
Always loved Finos stuffed Courgette flowers, that is why I go there. The staff were brillaint and the food was excellent. Will miss it.

Had a wonderful meal first time tapas! Our waitress was really helpful in explaining everything. Food was delicious, yummy belly pork and fillet beef not to mention the brioche desert! Looking forward to nxt time.

Great Tapas type food in an great ambience with excellent service

Would not recommend table after 10 pm as the kitchen takes its last food orders at 10.30

But food is top notch

Have eaten here several times And never disappointed. Always new things on the menu and you're never sure what it will be as you haven't seen similar things on other boring menus. The flavours care and attention to detail when they arrive !
Sumptuous ! Love this restaurant.

My wife and i had been to Matinee Show on Saturday and arrived freezing cold at 6 pm. into the restaurant. The restaurant is not actually on Charlotte Street but just off it and we informed the manager who agreed that everyone complains about this. We had 3 course lunch and bottle of wine - all choices of Starters/Tapas and Mains were explained by the Waitress. The quality of food - excellent and fresh. The wine was ice cold and kept chilled. Thouroughely excellent experience and we even said that our boys would love the food here.

The restaurant itself is ok, one of the waitresses though seemed in a bad mood, but hey, can't we all be? The food was the problem though, it was relatively expensive for tapas so I was expecting particularly good quality. The octopus with capers was greasy, the courgette flower unexpectedly filled with heavy and creamy cheesy stuff, the Fino chips a bit cold and tasteless, the artichoke was like overcooked crispy paper sans taste, the classic tortilla unappealingly brown with brown liquid and little taste and the fennel never arrived. Salt cod fritters and the red wine were ok though.

I don't normally bother with reviews and it maybe an exception to the rule for this place but our experience was not good. .

Attentive staff and good food made this a great experience. Never had tapas for a business lunch before and it worked really well. Good value too.

Will definitely go back.

Fino Restaurant in Charlotte Street London is always a pleasurable experience. The meal last night didn't disappoint. Huge prawns simply grilled, large scallops served with a puree of Jerusalem artichoke and delicious suckling pig (a special of the day) were the highlights. We were directed to an excellent Rioja (not too expensive) which complemented the food well. Service was attentive but not intrusive. Fino is not a cheap option but it is a great one for a special occasion.

There were definitely more hits than misses. The prawn croquette was a high point - pure heaven in a ball. The restaurant wasn't busy so the time it took for the food to come out could have been faster. However we had the pleasure of being served by attentive and knowledgeable staff and the food did not disappoint.

Fino Restaurant - Charlotte St - London

Lived up to the hype in every way! Outstanding food and service.... an unfortunate rare find in most London restaurants! I would certainly recommend Fino to anyone that asked!
Spanish tapas with a difference. Worth going again just for the soft, melting tortilla and the green beans and peas with poached egg. Good choice for vegetarians.
Wonderful food and especially good value with the top table deal. Would highly recommend.

having tried & failes once previously to secure a table at Fino, we were full of anticipation and it didn't diappoint. The only critcism I would make is that we felt the portion sizes weren't great (with the exception of the pork belly) and for what we spent, we were left wanting more so I guess you need to factor in extra plates

We dined at Fino for the first time on the a la carte menu. The food was delicious and the wine list was extensive. More expensive than a standard Tapas Bar but worth the extra money if you want a treat! Our only criticism was the Squid Ink Risotto was very salty. The Pork Belly was cut into very large chunks and was difficult to cut due to the crackling. I'm sure we will return and would definitely choose a Toptable Special Offer if the time was right.
Impressive, imaginative food with excellent drinks menu. Leave room for shared dessert! Good value with toptable discount, but would definitely return without it. Highly recommended.
This restaurant is closed and boarded up so we weren‚Äôt able to eat there !!
this is a little gem, we loved this place. great and friendly service, lovely tasty food, very authentic, we felt like we were in a bistro in paris. will definitely go back.

Hadn't been for a year or two to this old favourite and was not disappointed. Excellent food and service and the Top Table offer made the lunch very affordable too...was also impressed by the house wine!
Good overall, but nothing to rave about. Good value, service with a smile.
A very pleaseant evening with absolutely no distinction between thoe paying full and discounted prices

We booked Elena's L'Etoile for a family meal, despite some less-than-flattering reviews across the web and we're glad we made the choice. It was a busy Thursday night before Xmas but the service was prompt and pleasant (waiters had personality, which we like) and the food was great. Highly recommend, especially with the 50% off opportunity

Lovely meal, nice ambience, only very slight criticism is that it felt like we were being rushed a bit (6.30pm dinner). Great value with the 50% off deal - definitely would recommend to have dinner there.
food was okay, bit pricey but worth a visit
Very friendly service throughout complemented excellent food.
Great athmosphere, quiet and intimate. Food was great although a bit pricey. Very close to the dominion theatre and great for shopping in oxford st

Another outstanding meal at Chisou! It's the first time we've visited the new location and we're really impressed: it feels lighter and more airy than the previous Mayfair location. Service as ever was outstanding and the food itself was absolutely delicious. Very highly recommended.
The food is  great, and there's the sense of an occasion, but seated around the back of the restaurant the atmosphere is a nit too dull.

Dined alone at the sushi bar two days ago. The two sushi chef did not even want to greet me when I asked if I could order the sushi directly with them (which is customary in authentic sushi bars). One of the chefs said that they are busy and asked me to order through the waitress. Fine. I understand that they have other customers in the shop and he's stressed. But his whole attitude and demeanour didn't make me feel welcome at all.

The sushi when it came was so bad... They were tasteless and the texture feels like that have been deep frozen then reheated a few times. I didn't finish the sushi platter just in case I may get diahhrea.

We were treated very nicely by the staff. The fixed menu was a little bit limited, maybe three choices per course would be nice? The wine was rather more expensive than the indications we had online prior to the visit, possibly this needs to be updated.  Overall a very pleasant experience both food and service very good.

Sadly disappointed with the two main courses on the Prix Fixe menu....the rabbit was tasteless and tough, conversely the mustard sauce on the pasta was strong; the fish dish had no real flavour except old frozen fish.
This is a lovely bistro with great ambience in a great location in theatreland. The staff were very helpful but the food was only average.

Made reservation and arrived on time. Other people without reservations got good tables. We were shown a bad table and when we asked to change the waiter was rude and non responsive. There were plenty of nice tables empty.

Food was good, we tried carpaccio & truffle pasta and a fig desert. Had a few cocktails which were pretty strong & tasty. Good time with friends but I would suggest going there for cocktails and a small desert rather than a full meal. Outside area isnt bad.
However the waiter was very annoying, asking us about our nationality and making other inappropriate comments.
Very nice for an early dinner or quick lunch. Good food. Excellent service and good value for money.
There were only two dishes from the menu available, everything else was unavailable. Told this by a surly staff member without any apologies. Awful service. Will definitely not be returning.

Food wise everything we ordered was delicious. Me and my girlfriend were completely satisfied.
Although appearance wise the restaurant isn‚Äôt the best the food made me forget and I simply relished the taste.
Really great service from Alain and tasty food as always.
very rude. Refused to cook Sukiyaki.  Said they were short staffed.  Not good enough.
Always decent, a bit overpriced for the quality. But always consistent and open 24/7. Friendly staff :)
Wonderful place, very cosy, great friendly staff, the cheese platter is outstanding! I love this place!

Although we changed our reservation to Above, I still believe the overall quality is the same anywhere in the restaurant. The staff is professional and nice, they know what they‚Äôre doing! The food... well, let‚Äôs just say I think it won‚Äôt be long before another michelin star is added to Hide.  They also have a non-alcoholc pairing list (not just wine) which was very good!

Came for breakfast, liked everything. Service, ambiance and pretty much everything you can think of is thought through but feels relaxed and accommodating at the same time. Food for breakfast is good, but pastry deserves a separate mention, very well crafted.
Love everything
Unlike other boring restaurants, Hide really impressed me with the way the food is made and presented.
AMAZING!! AMAZING AND MORE AMAZING. PRICEY UT WORTH IT!

Our dinner at Hide above was just great, we absolutely loved it! One of the most beautiful restaurants in Europe. But there was almost too much service personnel.
Would definitely go back for another time.

Did the tasting menu at Hide Above, and found it underwhelming considering its reputation & price. While the dishes were artistically presented, the taste did not match up, and we found the choice of ingredients slightly incoherent, which in turn caused the entire dining experience to feel rather pretentious. We enjoyed the bread, signature egg dish and dessert the most.
It was Great! Super! I will recommend  Hide to my colleagues

Foe the exclusive place like this I found the restaurant a little crowded like I would follow the conversation at the next table easily...and service is kind of too fast like if they want us out ASAP, no proper "conversational" time between the dishes...rest is no doubt top class!

Staff are great and make sure you have a good time, being helpful and attentive.  Food isn‚Äôt much like the subtle flavours of Goa itself, instead it has been enhanced to appeal to the British view of a curry, but it is excellent value in an expensive part of town and decent quality.

I‚Äôm usually a fan of carluccios but was disappointed. The presentation was poor, the food average at best and resembled a cheaper everyday Italian chain. Generally disappointed having had one drink each and spent over ¬£80 for a meal. The waiters, though pleasant, clearly also looked stressed and frustrated a lot. Maybe they had sickness so we‚Äôre short staffed but it certainly didn‚Äôt make for a relaxed atmosphere.

Booked this restaurant before going to see a theatre production at The Dominion Theatre. Friendly waiter, didn‚Äôt get his name. Food was nice, service was quick, price was good. My only criticism is that they placed us next to the till, so we always had staff coming and going at the till during our meal. Even though the restaurant wasn‚Äôt full, they seem to cram everyone together in a small space. The table next to us was positioned wrongly, so we had to disturb the person sitting at the next table to let us to go to the bathroom. Felt very wedged in.
Been to Cabana before, food was okay. Waiter brought us the wrong meal but then was able to fix our order
Very smily and helpfuld staff, delicious food with good taste, good atmosphere in the restaurant you feel comfortable. We will definitely come back next time we visit London
Good food and service. I will come back next time I'm visiting London!

Starters were stupidly small some delicious some not. Skewers were not cooked on them but presented on them and hence were lacking in expected flavour. They were pork and beef steaks stuck on a skewer! Didnt have seafood skewers although presented in menu and mushrooms skewers were not on skewers just 4 mushrooms with slab of just heated houlumi cheese on top for ¬£9! Food all came lukewarm and we were served by 4 different people which always reduces the personal service tip at the end.
Came away disappointed by flavours, little Brazillian experience, little bit hungry and a feeling of being ripped off.
Quite disappointing really. The portions are small especially the main course. My lamb dish has two small chops and a loin which is all fat.
Tapas 44 was closed and they didn‚Äôt have the courtesy to contact the customers
Very efficient service nice varied menu for my business guests so everyone went away happy
Absolutely fantastic service. Classy furnishings. Disappointed with the food.

Excellent choice on the menu.., we selected  about 75% of the items and all were prepared and presented well. I liked that the choices were delivered when we wanted them and it added to the night. Definitely would recommend Senor Ceviche and look forward to going again.

Excellent food, really worth the experience. Restaurant somewhat cramped inside with very loud music and low lighting so difficult maintaining a conversation without shouting and reading the menu.
Staff enthusiastic and very helpful.
Really awesome guys! Ceviches are rocking! Comfort food and also the vegetable dishes were great

The dining experience was very rushed, even though the restaurant was empty. The waiters take away your food without you finishing it. They also did not give me the preference of how I wanted my steak, which came overcooked.  Overall the service could of been much better, I am disappointed.
Great service! Nice mood lighting the only complaint I have is the squid was extremely salty other than that a great place to dine

I loved this place! It has all you need - delicious food and great service! I ordered a burger with slow-cooked pulled beef and it was amazing. The beef was juicy with nice flavour. I also like the quality of the coffee! Definitely coming back soon.
The food and wine were both very good and we would definitely visit again if in the area.

Closed!
Door locked!
No Plov or manti for us!
üò¢
The food was absolutely delicious - very fresh and beautifully cooked.   Looking forward to going again.

A Christmas business lunch was very well received by all. The food, service and ambience was extremely good and very relaxed, so no rushing people through their meal and trying to fill the seats again! It is a lovely setting, quite tight on space, but somehow that helps the ambience. We'd definitely eat there again.

The food was delicious and the portions were more than decent. Overall great value for money and lovely space. I scored 4 out of 5 because the service wasn't great. We had to wait quite a long time to place our order. We got the shared platter after the mains - which didn't arrive at the same time. Saying that though, the waiter was nice, he just seemed completely overwhelmed.
It was lrettt
The restaurant has closed down but apparently still taking bookings on Opentable.
Zizzi is a good reliable chain of Italian eateries. Fairly standard mid-price range menu, well cooked and served.
Tigelle and gnocco fritto in London?? A dream <3 definitely recommended!
Food was beautiful, service was quick and staff very friendly. Well worth a visit!
Such a cool place, even the chefs are super friendly!

I visited Belgo a decade ago and this time, we enjoyed a lunch with my friend.  We ordered a pot of mussels which was very good. Nice taste of soups and just best size for two. We also love caramari with great sauce.
We sat down for pre-theatre meal. Tasty selection of mussels as usual with wide selection of beers. Shame the venison burger was not available. Attentive service.

Our group of four had a great time. We were originally seated in the main area but we found it to be too noisy. Our request to be moved to a table in front of the kitchen was readily accomodated.

Special mention to our server, Trevor. He was always on hand and was very attentive. We thoroughly enjoyed our time at the restaurant.

Would highly recommend Belgo Centraal for family celebrations.

The music was so loud everyone was shouting to be heard. Uncomfortable and theThai mussels were nothing like as good
As a year ago. Too salty and not aromatic.
Very disappointed. Too full. People queuing. Like factory feeding

Everything was great! It came with unlimited tea, and if there was something in particular you really liked they offered to bring you more. The tea room is very small, but gorgeous architecture. Would come again!
We arrived at the restaurant only to find that it has been closed down!!!

Despite being the only people in the restaurant, we had to seek out someone to take our order. They changed one of the main courses without telling us. The food was average. Despite having a 50% off deal, it still wasn't cheap.

Very good service, made it extra special for an 18th birthday with balloons and dessert on the house. Amazing cocktails, Very good portion sizes, Typical prices for a London restaurant. Wonderful afternoon/evening!
Great cocktails good food and good service. Very enjoyable though also very noisy!

The regular wings were good; the boneless version was a bit dry.  I expected the Nashville Hot quarter chicken to be spicy hotter.  It was also a bit dry in parts.  Will go back and try other versions of the regular wings.
Re-heated food not good. Just another TGI's in a different skin.
Great food, great cocktails and decent service. Would recommend.
Met a friend after the theatre for dinner ,but food was not hot , fries were good but overall not a good experience
Great on all fronts apart from being to hear you friend talk as the music is just at a ridiculous volume!
Lovely good with great service.

I was not expecting very much and I must say I was pleasantly surprised... the concept itself is fun and vibrant so should be accompanied by a few cocktails to enhance the experience . try it you will be happy you did

I opted for the BBQ short ribs and slaw for the main and decided to go full bore and order the paprika corn on the cob, southern potatoes and two bits of southern fried chicken. First the ribs....If I pay ¬£16 for ribs....I expect more than one short rib and a bit of slaw. Yes these are beef ribs, but go to any other place in London (red dog, big easy, even bodeans) and you'll get at least a couple of ribs. The chicken was a good effort at southern style fried chicken but ultimately the seasoning let it down.

Overall, there's nothing wrong with the food, but it doesn't even compare to the Big Easy or Red Dog if you're looking for a real place to eat excellent food with portions to match the price.

We had a 50% off deal for this and it was so good I would have paid full price. Next time I am getting the fried chicken because I was so jealous when I tasted my friends. Go on an empty stomach and do not worry about the calories!

Went to this place with my teenage son today, 6th july. Have to say that i was excited to find another restaurant doing my favourite food. Sadly we were both very disappointed with the food. My son had the pulled chicken burger meal, which was very dry. I sampled a variety of dishes...pulled pork, average...coleslaw, average...bbq beans, average...southern fried pots, ok...brisket chilli,poor...but the mac & cheese, i wanted to cry, please do not call that stuff mac & cheese, its an insult. Watery bowl of nastiness! If you're going to do southern soul food then please do it properly or do not bother. Will definitely not be returning.

Efficient from entering restaurant. Waitress who served us was very nice - polite, friendly yet professional.  Mains took a little bit long & bill was a few pounds more than expected but overall good apart from one thing, we didn't hang around after eating as far too hot at the back of the restaurant ( even waitress agreed) & couldn't wait to get out!
Great food! Lively atmosphere! Perfect for any occasion! Try the cocktails too!
Great place for dinner

Great atmosphere. Great staff.  Great food and fantastic value for money. I would highly recommend coming to Navajo Joes anyday of the week.  We were looked after as soon as we walked in and nothing was aq problem and you even got a big smile with it. the moijitos are a must have as are the fajhitas!!
Went to Navajo Joe London pre theatre and enjoyed very much.  Very good value with 50% off food.  Portions were good size and we made theatre in plenty of time.
We had a great time at the restaurant. The food was excellent and the service was just as good. I really liked the atmosphere and the very large selection on tequila! I'm recommend Navajo Joe.

Navajo Joe in Covent Garden is in a great location. The food is lovely, with a wide variety of tex mex and cajun dishes. There is a buzzy atmosphere and it is great value when you have the toptable 50% off deal. We will return!
Great atmosphere and service!
Great place.. enjoyed it!
Quite nice, good on a discount night And 50% off the bill otherwise pricey.

Deent enough food at Navajo Joe, nothing special.
Good value with offer, would be expensive otherwise.
Service was slow.

We had a very pleasent time at Navajo Joe for lunch with the set menu. Our waitress was lovely, we spent ages ordering as we were chatting too much, we weren't rushed, even at the end when we just avoiding going out into the cold. There was 3 or 4 options, fairly standard food with a bit of a twist excellent value for money.
Navajo Joe Covent Gdn London. Service was good staff helpful.Food was tasty and portions a good size.
This was the best value meal I have had in London. The 50%off food at Navajo Joe is an amazing deal. Lovely staff and a great ambience.

Had a lot of fun, just hate being rushed out of a restaraunt because there is another sitting.
The downstairs bar area was a good escape from the table though.

Navajo Joe (Covent Garden, London) has a good ambience, the decor is not too overpoweringly themed, the service was attending and the food was delicious. Excellent value with the 50% off food offer, would probably not have considered it good value for money at full price. Despite being there for a special offer, we were made to feel like valued customers and there were no menu restrictions on the offer.
Covent garden, london venue was very nice. A good ambience, very good service.
Navajo Joe's in Covent Garden, London is a good restaurant to come to with friends for a catch up and perhaps before the theatre.  The food was good, service attentive and all up, good value!

Navajo Joe for a pre theatre bite to eat is very good and good value. The crab cakes followed by the Jambalaya topped with sea bass were all very good, decent portions. Cocktail list is good, music a bit noisy for old folks. I would go back - service was friendly and fast.
Friendly helpful staff and good atmosphere, food nice.

Navajo Joe - London
This is a great place to take friends. The food is really fun with things like DIY fajitas making the experience colourful, very tasty, but pretty messy. With a group of friends, the happy hour cocktails are really fantastic and make for a very cheap bill!

Atmosphere: Like a nandos, nice and loud
Food: Fantastic! Very vegeterian friendly
Drinks: Have a range of cocktails, which were very nice
Desert: lush!
Overall it is a nice place to catch up with friends, have a cocktail and have a nice dinner!
Great meal at Navajo Joe's.  Would heartily recommend.
Great food at Navajo Joes, also great value with the offer and happy hour too!
great place - great offer - going back to Navajo Joe on Friday.

My wife and I both ate from the reward menu, which is basically the set menu. We started with the Nachos which were excellent, coming with fresh Guacamole and Tomato Salsa. The main course Enchilladas were less successful,but considering the whole meal only cost us the price of a bottle of very acceptable Cabernet Sauvignon I have no complaints at all. A nice place, next time we'll be trying the cocktails.

Very busy but nethertheless we were seated immediately and our food arrived quickly.  Staff werent overly attentive or friendly (they were all very young) but food was superb and with the offer it was excellent value for money.  If we were going to London again we would DEFINATELY eat here!  Toilets werent brilliant but I have seen alot worse.

I had dinner at Navajo Joe last night. The service was great and it had a really good atmosphere which i was surprised at as it was a Tuesday night. The food was very nice and I felt nicely full. The cocktail were out of this world! they were so yummy. i highly recommend the after dinner after eight cocktail. i would go back there for definite
Only portion size let it down

The place is very welcoming and it looks like a good fun venue, perfect to go with a group of friends. Dinner was good although the brownie was cold and dry. They have a downstairs bar for those who want to carry the night. I will recommend this place if you are looking for a fun/informal restaurant with the possibility of carry on the party on the downstairs bar. SA
Great birthday dinner - had 50% off the amin courses which was good. Nic Candlelit atmosphere with pumping music and a good bustling atmosphere. Food is average for mexican.

Navajo Joe in Covent Garden, London was really good. The ambience is amazing and the waiter who served us was lovely. Except they ran out of cod fish and it is apprently one of the better dishes to order there.

Good atmosphere,  but I imagine best sampled in the evening. Starters were a bit on the small size. The Nachos for instance, you just got 6 tortilla crisps for ¬£3.50  (at the standard price).  For the main we had fajitas. These were good, but not sizzling as they should be when delivered to the table (mainly an aesthetic thing). Could not fault the quality of the dishes. The service was impeccable and friendly. Had to ask for salad we ordered, and given coffiees on the house as compensation.

We had a great meal here, it is perfect for a group of friends. Our waitress Emily was fab!! The beef fajitas were especially yum. The 50% off food is great value and appeared on the bill without having to say anything. Would definitely go back.
lovely meal at navajo joes. Good location for a Friday night in London

We went to Navajo Joe for dinner. The service was excellent, the waitress was really very friendly and attentive. We took the offer of 2 courses and mojito for ¬£12.95; set menu was good value although found the menu relatively limited. Whilst the set menu was good value, the drinks were quite expensive. Good atmosphere and overall a nice evening.

I needed a central and affordable restaurant to meet up with friends travelling on a budget. Navajo Joe fitted the bill and the 3 courses plus a Mojito was a great deal. Apart from the ravioli ordered by one of our party the food was really good. Service was friendly but could have been a little more on the ball - we had to reorder forgotten drinks a few times as the waiter appeared to be confused by our addition of more mojitos on top of the ones inclusive of the meal deal.
Good night out at Navajo Joes's... had the 3 courses and mojito for ¬£15 deal. The food choices were a bit disappointing... mostly european dishes, rather than mexican :(

Having been to Navajo Joe many times for cocktails I was sceptical about the food, however I was very pleasantly surprised. The atmosphere for a Wednesday night was great with the place packed. Starters aren%u219t cheap so we opted for 2 sharing plates for ¬£7, which were small and hardly great value but luckily they tasted good. The mains were far better however with the fajitas being a real highlight. Great place to be a vegetarian with plenty of options, the enchiladas infact went down a storm!
Navajo Joe was good as usual.  Food was nice, service was prompt, host was friendly and helpful.

Went to Navajo Joe in Covent Garden. Brilliant atmosphere, very tasty food and we had an excellent waitress who gave us really good service. A tad on the expensive side (bottle of wine was ¬£22) but overall a good night out.....
Navajo Joe in convent garden is great after work hangout spot on Friday's. Food and cocktails were good but get there early or book to avoid waiting for a table.
Navajo Joe's was excellent; the 3 starters for ¬£10 is fab! Main course we had the Swordfish and the Sea Bass...both Delicious!!!! Def going back.
I would rate the coacktails and the venue, however the service at Navajo Joe's was poor. Whole restaurant is smoking - not informed before hand and the waitress was slower than my Grandma!
It does what it says on the tin - serves  up moderately priced food, that while not exceptional,  hits the spot  in a  friendly atmosphere with staff providing a professional caring service.
Nice looking restaurant but the welcome was poor and the place lacked any atmosphere.
Great night. Good ambience. Service really good. Small menu but good choices.

I have been here many times before to sample their excellent wines but this is the first time I tried their cooking. Although the pre theartre set menu has only 3 starters and 3 mains to choose from, they all sounded delicious so we actually had a hard time deciding what to order! But our choices of rabbit terrine and mackerel pate as starters and onglet steak and frits for mains were all good.   The service was friendly and efficient. An all round excellent experience. Will definitely eat here again.

Attended this restaurant after a visit to the theatre on a Saturday evening, i ordered steak and my partner ordered the vegetarian mushroom,spinach and goats cheese pastry. It was very busy for the time of day but not too noisy to be uncomfortable. My steak was cooked to my liking and was good value, however my partners choice was inedible and approximately 75% was left uneaten, a complaint was made and dealt with very well by the very young staff. The bill was adjusted and no payment was taken for the pastry, i feel that this may have been attributed to the fact the restaurant was busy coupled with the usual lack of attention to vegetarian options. I would probably give the place a second chance but not sure about my starving partner!!

Well cooked, not too elaborate food from a small but adequate menu plus a few specials. Friendly staff but not ultra-fast so for a theatre start at 7:30 perhaps best to start dinner here at 5:30 when they open if you want 2 or 3 courses. Gets noisier as the bar fills up - not a soft/padded surface anywhere to absorb the chatter

Booked Bedford & Strand, Covent Garden WC2  for 6.30 and was out by 7.40 for the theatre round the corner. Service polite and efficient. Food was brilliant even for one person who was  vegetarian. Atmosphere buzzing. Really good, will go back again. Good choice. Thank you!!
Bedford and Strand, London - Fantastic food and service!!!
Great food and great service! The perfect place for a before or after theatre dinner.

Bedford and Strand was a buzzing bar together with a good restaurant within, Atmosphere was good with the "after work crowd" contributing to this. Menu could be a little more extensive but all the food was very good.

Booked as advertised as a gastro pub however they were not serving food on the day. If there was a problem they could have made contact to let their customers know.
It was also very busy and noisy with the after work crowd.
Great find, good food and I'd definitely come back!
Second time I‚Äôve had lunch at Havkett‚Äôs which is ‚Äòlocal‚Äô to our office. Good value set menu with nice options and staff friendly.  Must come one evening to hear the live music next!
Good value for money. Food is decent. Service is kind of slow.

The food was original and outstanding. We are vegetarians and had plenty of creative and interesting things to eat. The service was attentive and they gave us glasses of proseco when they learned it was my friend's birthday. The only drawback is that the restaurant is very loud, even with just a few people there, as there were when we arrived.

Inventive and interesting dishes, served up by a friendly and loving staff in small, open space restaurant area.
It's a tapas style restaurant, with most dishes designed to be shared. Each piece is a crafted and delicious food invention sure to excite the pallet of any foodie.
Great place for a relatively quick sharing lunch, is a UK/European tapas style of eating with a large variety of share plates, works very well if you like to share !
Deber√≠an de poner que no sirven bebidas alcoh√≥licas y que es muy muy sencillo.
Despite reservation, restaurant was closed!!!! No email or text was sent
Lost all of its appeal tired decor,bland food , staff that don't care , we can only wonder what happened to this place .... Awful experience
Amazing authentic Chinese food, just as good as high end places but in a more casual environment and better value, forget Chinatown
The service was very good. It a nice little spot for burgers. Good for it price range (fairly cheap)
Great food, well priced.  If you love fish you will love this
Had a fabulous meal from a fairly extensive menu.  Service and ambiance were excellent.  Drinks were  a bit pricey but overall, total cost represented good value.
Birthday with friends
Lovely atmosphere and friendly staff. Food was great

I went there with my friends on open table offer.  Foor was avarage, service wasn't to good either tried to be friendly but it look too unprofessional. We were really tempted to cancel the service charge on the bill as they haven't deserved even half of it what they were charging - won't recommend this place as I wouldn't go back there and none of my friends.
Great value with very attentive staff and well cooked fresh food. My starter steak tartare and main course lamb were delicious. Highly recommended.

A little gem, good wine, good food, very attentive staff.  Not quite sure how they knew the evening out was for my birthday but they did and made it special.  Well worth a visit. We will be back. Well worth a visit but don't tell everyone.

Short walk from Oxford circus and I was underwhelmed when we walked in but led downstairs for a table in the fantastic downstairs dining and the welcome was fantastic - waitress was unbelievably good - then the food - the tag ragu is outrageous - giant chunks of slow cooked steak and the valipolicella is outstandingly smooth like velvet. Good night albeit ¬£130 lighter but worth it.
Will definitely be going back to Bellaria. Food was fantastic and the location was easy enough from Oxford Circus.

I found this restaurant through Toptable and was delighted that it was tucked away from the usual tourist spots of Central London. I don't know if the staff were family but it certainly felt that way with the manner in which they all worked hard together and clearly got on. They were also attentive and very solicitous, giving sound advice on wine choice and food. We sat downstairs in a delightful alcove full of character. The food was authentic, tasty and innovative in its composition. We did find the portions a bit over generous but to many people this would be a bonus.
Excellent service, very attentive staff!! The food was great and the girls all agreed that they would all go back again. Thoroughly enjoyable evening.

We had a Sunday evening meal at the Bellaria. The atmosphere was quiet and relaxed and the service was friendly and efficient. Both members of staff gave well infomed information about the menu. The food was of very good quality and very ample. We had no room for a dessert! The discount offered through Top Table meant our experience was good value for money. I would cerainly thinkof vsiting again.

Went to Bellaria for an evening meal. Used the 1/2 price starter and main offer and was very impressed with the meal. The only minor niggle was that it was quite cold on Saturday night and where we were seated we got a blast of cold air every time the front door opened! People have said that the cellar room is dingy, but it looked cosy and warm to me.

Bellaria serves slightly predictable, but tasty Italian food in a wonderful setting. Its probably a bit expensive for what it is. The wine list provides only Italian wines, which is fair enough, but to get the good ones you really have to fork out.

Booked the TT deal of 50% off most starters/mains. The meat and cheese sharing platters to start were great value with a good sized selection. Noteworthy was the lobster ravioli (25% off) and the tender chicken stuffed with ricotta/spinach.

Great surroundings (if sat in the basement). Attentive staff - who quickly adjusted the air conditioning when they saw us fanning ourselves with the menu in the 'balmy' surroundings. Final bill not cheap even with the deal but will definitely return.
Lovely restaurant-best to sit downstairs. Food was superb. Portions were generous. Good wine list. Service was excellent. Will be back!
Great service and good food. Portions were of a generous portion which serves well in my book. Will go again at some point in the future..

The staff were dealing with a rather busy Christmas party but still were 100% attentive to our needs, and still managed to make a romantic dinner memorable. They were helpful with food choices/wine matching, and for such a busy evening we did not feel pressurised to rush at all. We were sat in a lovely little enclave which reduced the ambient noise a lot! Food was lovely, and with the 50% off, it meant we could indulge in both dessert and wine. The italians definitely know how to romance!

We visited Bellaria, London W1 and enjoyed a pleasant Saurday evening, the service was fine, the food was good and the ambience was excellent. That said I think the full menu price was fairly expensive which makes the Toptable discount very welcome.

Went to Bellaria Restaurant & Wine Bar in London for a work lunch. Ordered from the a la carte menu - which should have more dishes to choose from.
Food was nice but for the price would have expected a bit better quality, Service was great though.
Definitely somewhere to go after an initial drink somewhere else, as I was a bit disappointed there was no bar... but a gorgeous little restaurant with lovely food and wine selection.

Lovely food. Home cooked with nice touches. Be sure to ask to sit downstairs- its like a totally different restaurant and much more romantic. Shame a large party were sat downstairs on the night we visited- because its such a small space the noise of a party ruined the ambiance slightly. This place shouldnt take bookings for such big groups. Overall very good and discount made it worth it.
Food is quite pricey, but worth it. The downstairs area is much nicer than upstairs if you don't mind basements. Overall a lovely place and we'll be going back.

Excellent food as usual at Bellaria, in good-sized portions. The deal makes it pretty good value. It was very warm inside, but this won't be problem once the proper English weather comes back. Definitely worth a look for the high-quality, fresh food and great selection of wines.
Excellent atmosphere, excellent food and excellent service.

Bellaria Restaurant & Wine Bar is a great little place just behind Oxford Street. The portions were generous, and the food tasted amazing. The price was a little high, but for good food I think it was worth it.

This restaurant is a lovely find the other side of Soho - we sat upstairs but it is the downstairs that is its winning selling point - great for an intimate date or a large birthday group I would reccommend this restaurant.
The only thing that needs improving are the toilets.
I would recommend eating at Bellaria in London. Nice vibe, nice food.
great food, atmosphere and service
Bellaria - London - excellent value with 50% deal, enormous portions. Slightly over enthusiastic wine pouring but otherwise service good.  Would recommend.
Service was great for our party of seven. Food ranged from very good to average. The chicken in particular was a little dry.

Had a great meal at Bellaria - and will definitely be going back as there was a lot more on the menu that I wanted to try.

Another plus was that our waiter was v. hot!

Lovely night out here-food was really tasty especially the rib eye steak. Service was faultless and the place had a good ambience. Only fault was being brought a cold coffee but this was quickly dealt with. I will be returning especially with 50% off it is very good value for money.

Bellaria on great titchmarsh street was a surprisingly lovely restaurant. Much nicer than the photo on top table. The food was generous and fresh with good flavour. The atmosphere was very romantic as the lower level room was very dimly lit with candles. In fact, this would be my only criticism, that it was too dark downstairs, so much so that reading my menu was a bit difficult. I would prefer to sit in the upstairs section on the street level. Lovely welcoming staff.

I recently ate here and enjoyed the food.  I like Thai food, and this restaurant didn't disappoint.  The vegetables were fresh.  I had a very tasty cod dish and coconut rice.  It seemed chaotically busy, but the waiting staff were attentive.  I will eat here again.
good as an one-off experience, if you haveing an office party or need some dinning entertainment

All in all a great time.
They just need to add new shows. Cause i go there quite a lot and i just watch the same shows over and over again

excellent food service and entertainment I would recommend it
It was unusual and entertaining something a bit different from run of the mill dining, GREAT FOR A BIRHDAY OR ANNIVERSARY
Lovely experience for date night!

My boyfriend and I went here to celebrate our anniversary which maybe was an error on our part. I get that they're trying to create an ambiance but the music was SO loud that we had to shout at each other to hold a conversation. The entertainment was not as slick as we were expected and was a bit 'Butlins' in places. Food was good, but overpriced. The worst part of the meal was how rushed we were, we were totally aware we had a 2 hour slot but the waiting staff are so pushy about you ordering immediately that you just end up feeling unwelcome - not a feeling which you want when spending ¬£160 on a meal for 2. Especially when there were plenty of empty tables in the restaurant.
Good atmosphere and good surprisingly good. Slightly overpriced for portions, but you are also paying for the entertainment after all. Worth it. Good for a special night out.

It's a nice restaurant to dine at for a special occasion or group booking....less so for an intimate or romantic occasion... I went midweek and the music was played so loud that it was hard to hold a decent conversation for long but entertainment is great and the food is good too... But it's very, very pricey... so make sure you're prepared!!!
We all had a great time. The staff and service wa excellent. Did like the entertainment too - fun and games. Different night out - expensive but worth it for the difference.
Great night - perfect 4th date territory.

We came from Greece for a week trip in london and a friend told us about Circus. So we choose it for dinning in a special aniversary occasion. the truth is that it was a great place! full of energy ! the service was brilliant as was the food! thank you for a great night!
Closed. No notice from opentable. Bad deal. At least the app should have a way to NOT make a reservation in an establishment which is  onlonger in business. Bad form.

I hadn't been here for over 10 years, but had remembered having a fantastic meal so I was sorely disappointed to find it had experienced such a dramatic decline. The serve was dreadful - despite buying several drinks (even though half the wine list wasn't available) we were pressured into ordering. When we asked for a couple more minutes to look over the menu, the manager came over and stood at the table, glowering at us until we made our orders! I would have understood if the place had been even half full and there was pressure for tables!
Once the food arrived, it was a bitter disappointment with prawn cocktails straight out of the fridge and using reconstituted scampi tales!
I'm sorry to say that this old classic needs to either up it's game or give up the ghost!

The waitress was very polite and attentive. I was surprised they wore jeans and converses. The food came out very late. The sharing platter was mediocre. Not what you expect from this well known restaurant. We ordered 2 Dover Soles, the most expensive fish in the menue. Smelt fishy and was very greasy. Neither of us had more than a 1/3. The mixed grill fish and Seafood was a big mess on the plate with over cooked fish. Ironically the steak was the best in this fish restaurant. Very disappointing and put a huge damper on my mothers birthday. On top of that we had to pay ¬£350 for 4 people. Should of stuck to our usual restaurant Roka, a couple of restaurants along!

Took my daughter here for her 30th birthday. We ate at 6pm so there weren't many other customers to start with but the place has a lovely feel to it and the service was excellent. The menu is diverse and tempting, and the seared scallops are the best ever (had them twice now). By the time we left it was getting busy.
Pescatori would be reasonable value in any case - with the current Clubcard Vouchers offer it's a steal.

Enjoyed a very tasty meal here - made all the better by the fact we had tesco vouchers!  So many tempting dishes - we decided to have a selection of starters, tapas style.  Particularly liked the scallops.  A slight mishap with order of food served but swiftly rectified and given extra glass of bubbles to compensate.  Lovely touch and appreciated.  We will be back...
Booked with toptable deal -excellent value for money. Plenty of choice on seafood and service was great. Recommend!
we had an excellent evening at Pescatori. The food was beautifully presented and everyone's meal was very tasty. staff were attentive and helpful in our selection from the menu.

I wanted to take a client somewhere special and I knew they like fish. This place was definitely the wrong choice! The customer service was just a mess, they started off by telling us the specials and then ran off before we could ask for drinks. There were constant things like this that really let them down e.g. pouring wine aggressively. Not what you'd expect for the price! Such a shame as I love the look of the place and the menu looked fantastic, shame they just didn't take the care in serving/cooking it.

Great evening out with friends at pescatori, Fitzrovia on a Saturday evening. Food was really good - we had carpaccio, squid, octopus and risotto to start - all good portions and tasty and well presented. For mains we has dover sole (excellent), squid ink pasta and lobster burgers all washed down with a few bottles of good wine, coffees, grappa etc, and with the 30% off deal, including service the bill was ¬£50 a head - so not a cheap night out but actually great value when you consider the quantity and quality of the food / drink consumed. And the italian radio station in the background provided a quirky musical backdrop to it all.
As always Dinner at Pescatori was great. Service friendly and efficient and with 30% off food at the moment, great value too.

Starters: Lobster Ravioli
Mains: Prawn Pesto Pasta and Monkfish with foie gras

The starter was good with a Asian taste. The prawn pesto pasta was so-so.

Monk fish was very good, fresh and tangy. The foie gras was a good combination.

Nice ambience. One staff was very friendly and approachable, the other was not.

Pescatori Fish & Seafood Restaurant on Charlotte Street, London is a lovely place.  Very nice atmosphere, good lighting and attentive staff (but not too attentive).  The food was very tasty and well cooked and the selection of mains is extermely varied.  I had the John Dory which was delicious (if a little bit too buttery) and my fiancee had the lemon sole which was also tasty.   My only critisism would be I would have found it a little bit expensive had we not saved 30% on food throuh toptable.

Went to Pescatori on Charlotte St with my girl friends last night. My lobster spaghetti was al dente with big chunks of succulent lobster in it. The service was ok although we were a big group so we were mostly left alone. Would definitely go back!
went for a brithday lunch...lobster spaghetti was amazing but fish was a bit of a letdown, especially since the portions were so small. staff were lovely.
Pescatori was great, food was very tastey, service was quick and pleasent. Really enjoyed my meal there.

This was a family occasion and we were given a real treat - excellent food - the oysters were a special delight - and very friendly service and ambience - we keep going back!

GD

This place is great! Cocktails are great! And has a very cool speakeasy feel. The snack selection is limited to nuts and olives but i guess you are really there for the cocktails. Tables are slightly small but managable. Have been here twice and will definitely go again

Not good for dinner, just go for a drink.  It‚Äôs very loud and the tables are not laid out well.  More of an immature crowd & couldn‚Äôt find my booking despite having made it twice since they lost the first one!!
Good food,service and great wines if somewhat expensive.

Have been here several times now and have always had a very good experience. The tapas menu and food quality is great for casual dining. The service wasn‚Äôt as good this time in terms of the friendliness of our waitress although the food arrived quickly and was well presented.

We didn't actually have dinner at Encant.  On the day I received a phone call saying that the restaurant was closed.  The previous day I'd been sent an email reminding me of my reservation.  It was very nice the first time I went there...

Good food but menu limited and some things weren't available. Only 1 dessert offered.
Small venue with mainly bar seating and felt very cramped as full when we were there.
Staff appeared a little indifferent
Lovely atmosphere, VERY tight seating, good food, friendly staff. Be prepared to be turfed out of your table if you linger too long.

Very good food, with some great flavours, and innovative without trying to be too clever.
Far too small a space, however, resulting in cramped seating.
Service was variable, ranging from incredibly polite and helpful, and delivered with a smile, to matter-of-fact forgetful.
Our party was charged for a dish we ordered but didn't receive; we waited for a separate dish we'd ordered, and only after our plates had been cleared and we'd queried its absence were we told that they'd run out of it (ours was a 6.00pm booking, by the way), and when we ordered two of the three desserts on the menu, only two were available, and one of those (the ice cream sandwich) had not set yet.
Would the erratic service stop me from going again, and stop me from enjoying the very good food?
Absolutely not.

I booked this restaurant for 21 December,  6pm through Opentable. When I arrived there with my family for my sister's birthday,  the place was completely shut. It was so disappointingly not to havr been told in advance. Opentable needs to take this restaurant off its books immediately.

Would go again only thing I would like is the food to all come together tapas style but I guess due to the small kitchen it comes out when each dish was ready so we had five dishes separately. Despite that food was great, nice staff and nice feel to the place
Nice new place with great pizza and equally impressive pasta.
Found this restaurant in a Michelin guide and it was really worth it.
A delightful delicious experience

Food was pretty standard and so was the service. Not poor but not what we would expect for a London restaurant.
Large service charge added to our bill... even on a set pre-theatre menu. No mention of this on the menu and it wasn't discretionary
You can't choose a bad cocktail. I tried something I never had, a whisky drink and it was delicious! Lovely barchaps.
Dabbous long a favourite closes. new venture opens next year. I hope its as good or better.

Interesting food and the set menu is good value. There is a separate vegetarian menu, but one of the main course choices was a dish from the main menu, but without the fish (nothing added), so was completely inadequate. Service was fine, although no continuity so we were given the wrong menu from which to choose our puddings. Happily they acknowledged this mistake and didn't charge extra for the choices we had made.
I wanted to like it but really the portions felt like sampling still were very pricey

Had a 5-course special menu, all of which interesting and flawless on its own right: fatty cured goose ham; Jerusalem artichoke and truffle soup; langoustine skewers; Iberico pork roast; and a custard pudding with rose petals, I think. It really was all as refined and high-quality precision cooking as you'd expect, however, fell short on excitement. Bill was 200 for two with a carafe of wine, service included. Will go back.

A refreshing grapefruit cocktail lined my stomach before I dined here. Wholesome food, mostly european with japanese influences, bread in a bag. Industrial, urban decor. Young, casually dressed waitresses telling me it's nice of me to pick up the bill...

Dabbous was simply excellent - the food was precise and stunningly presented. The staff were knowledgeable, excited about their jobs and really rather happy. The wine list was concise, and very well priced, with the sommelier doing an excellent job for us.

I genuinely don't think I can find a fault.

I will undoubtedly be back.

Good local Turkish restaurant - have been many times over 30 years and it always delivers consistently. Nothing fancy but overall a good experience and good value. Music far too loud tonight was only negative.
The service was good, the place looked good, the food was good and the portions and value were outstanding. Would definitely recomend to friends and family.

Greenhouse is the epitome of perfection when it comes to fine dining. The food and services surpasses all expectations with incredible attention to detail in every course. Highly recommended for any blow out meal or special occasion.
Equisite food, wonderful wine pairings, innovative dishes and flawless service! Will come back!
A wonderful restaurant great ambience service and food.

My friend and I took the a la carte menu which might be the problem. We felt the dishes were at best hit and miss. The starters were eels which was ok and scallops which was quite fishy. The beef was good. The desert appeared nice but was disappointing. We were worried that we could not finish the petit forte... but we didn't need to as we only needed to try one bite for each of them

The services was another disappointment. The manager and staff just kept going to one specific table to make conversation. The staff was polite but lack of heart and sincerity.
Food close to perfection.  A wonderful room, great service.

Set lunch was fine, though not spectacular, and decent value. Service ok, a bit stiff at times. Ambiance pleasant. All marred by a charge of ¬£12 (plus 12 1/2% service) for a small glass of tomato juice (out of a carton with half a stick of celery stuck in it). Asked and told that a tomato juice is priced as an alcoholic cocktail. Not, it seems, a hurdle that a tomato juice is a single ingredient non-alcoholic drink. Fed back to restaurant by email subsequently; no reply. Just silly is a polite way of putting this.
Third meal here and as good as any other. Great levels of consistently good food and service, will be back in the future.

The Greenhouse lives up to its 2 Michelin stars, with spectacularly prepared and presented dishes.  The staff are wonderfully friendly, respectful and informative.  We had the ¬£110 tasting menu, which was expensive and worth it.
Amazing experience with a beautiful garden. We felt very special to be taken 'back stage' to meet the chef.

I had the 3 course set lunch which had very good flavours, beautiful presentation and good sized portions.  The remarkable aspect of the Greenhouse is the vast selection of wines by the glass, albeit at a premium price. The sommelier discussed the choice each wine for every course (3) and the wine was offered for tasting before you agree to it. The menu was complemented by an amuse bouche to start and petit fours (even if you did not have coffee) at the end. Overall a  memorable experience .
Food was superb, service excellent, wine list sensational. It is very pricey though. Then not sure what you'd expect from a double Michelin starred restaurant! Will definitely go back

The Greenhouse is a little gem. Tucked away in a secluded part of Central London away from the hustle and bustle. The food and service was fantastic and certainly lived up to it's Michelin star status. Clearly a popular place for anniversaries as there were a few couples who had been coming back every year and it is was clear to see why. Definitely one of the best in London and highly recommended for a special occasion.

Great value if you go for the three courses with wine for ¬£25. Really tasty and beautifully presented. There was also a nice balance to the menu so you will find something that takes your fancy even if you are a fussy eater. Lovely surroundings and very friendly staff. A definite must.
First class! Expensive, though not unexpectedly so. Better value than many dearer restaurants. Amazing wine list, from around ¬£25 to over ¬£3,000. Thoroughly recommended.

fantastic atmosphere, felt as if i was visiting a spa resort while walking into the restaurant.
the food was great - particularly impressed by the amuse boche's and desserts - strawberries,peaches with sponge cake, elderflower ice-cream topped with pistachio foam!

We went to the greenhouse expecting a gastronomic experience and that's what we got. Friendly but professional staff, painstaking attention to detail, lovely surroundings. Not cheap, but then that's not the point for this type of establishment.
Wonderful restaurant, very good staff and the food was great

The Greenhouse, London W1 - not the easiest to find tucked away in Hay's Mews though our cabbie knew where it was. Subdued lighting, rather oriental in style. 3 courses start at about ¬£100 each and a decent bottle of Bordeaux or Burgundy will cost another ¬£200. Hugely attentive staff. 4 menus to choose from and they will happily mix and match. We arrived at 7.30pm and left after 10.30pm having been pampered to within an inch of our lives. If you want to use the toilets pack a torch.
Amazing food that was inventive without being pretentious. Service was second to none.  A very enjoyable evening all round!
Wonderfully inventive food. Utterlly delicious

The Greenhouse, London
The venue, service and food were first class.
We ordered from the ¬£25 menu, but my wife did not like the choice of starter, so was offered something from the main menu.
The staff could not do enough for you and catered for every whim.
The only criticism was the portions were very small.

One of my favourite restaurants in London. The food is  wonderful-imaginative, flavourful and beautifully presented.  Last night however, despite the large number of staff on hand, the service was shockingly slow.  The staff were  friendly and informative, but we had the 7 course tasting menu and often waited 20 minutes between one course being cleared and another delivered.  I know that food should be savoured and enjoyed, but you should not become so impatient in a restaurant of this calibre.

The Greenhouse lives up to its 1 Michelin star. The special offer lunch is great value. The gurnard was excellent as was the guinea fowl although the chard was a little too salty for me. The desserts were not as expected but none the worse for that and although we passed on tea/coffee the petit fours we received anyway were exquisite. This was our first visit but it won't be our last.

The Greenhouse, Mayfair, London.

Great evening with friendly and attentive staff.
You know when you book you are going to get a great meal and true to form The Greenhouse delivered again. It isn't exactly value for money, but then again I did't expect it to be and we did have some rather nice wine.

Had my first meal booked through toptable here today.
The stilton-walnut biscuit amuse bouche was AMAZING. Crayfish in the appetizer wasn't very fresh but apart from that, everything was great. I loved the caramelised cep ravioli and tanariva milk chocolate tart!!
impressive wine list and awesome food
The Greenhouse was very pleasant if slightly stuck in a time warp.  The intricate portions were tiny and served on enormous plates.  In my opinion, this sort of tricksy food is rather old fashioned.
Excellent vegetarian tasting menu.  Very friendly but unobtrusive service.  Fantastic wine list.  Recommended for a treat (it's not cheap...).
The service was excellent. The food good, although the puddings a little disappointing. I would recommend.
Excellent value for money very attentive staff as usual

Great setting and lovely staff, great place to go for an upmarket lunch at very reasonable price. Took a client there for lunch and they felt suitably spoiled.

The only shame was it took nearly 40 min to get the bill once we were done which was excessive. Other than that the staff, service, food and setting were brilliant.
Really enjoyed our meal, we chose off the pre theatre menu, good value and lovely restaurant :)

Hadn't realised it was a hotel restaurant which are often soulless places lacking in personality, but was immediately put at rest by the friendly service. Interesting menu and the food was really delicious and good value on the toptable deal. Would definitely go back.

This was our second visit to Boyds and it did not let us down.  Decor and ambience great and the staff could not be more obliging and pleasant.  The food was excellent (the three of us had the pre-theatre menu) and the wine okay.  I have only one negative comment and that is the inclusion of the 12¬Ω per cent service charge.  I totally disagree with this as I prefer to leave a discretionary tip as I see fit.  Other than that a perfectly pleasant and enjoyable evening.

This was a revelation. The menu is long and varied - perhaps a little too much so - and the food is good but not outstanding. But the real attractions are the surroundings. The restaurant is in a beautifully restored grand Victorian hotel which for years was used as a Ministry of Defence annex. The atmosphere is superb, and the staff - particularly the manager - could not have been more charming and helpful.  One bonus was the offer of small tasting glasses of fine wines that otherwise would have been beyond our price range. We will return.

We had dinner in Roast middle of December. Good food, good service but high prices even for us and we don't mind spending money. It was a noisy place with lots of customers. We had to shout to be heard. Borough Market is worth a visit and Roast is the place for people who like British food and English wines.

I booked with 3 friends for a pre-theatre on Saturday evening. You may be surprised to discover on arrival that Boyd's is actually located off the lobby of the Grand Hotel. The entire lobby, bar and restaurant is beautifully clad in marble and, combined with low level lighting, exudes an elegant feel. The only complaint is that the bar is a little small but if you are going straight to your table, no problem.

Good value pre-theatre (2 courses for 20.50, 3 for 23.50) allows you to select two 'English tapas' from a selection of 8 for your starter. Potted shrimps, mushroom baked with cheese, sausage roll etc. An excellent, fresh sea trout followed, just about leaving room for two desserts between four. Bottles of wine start from the low ¬£20s.

The service was discreet and unfussy and although the tables are relatively close together you don't really notice.

Definitely recommended for pre-theatre, i'm sure the A La Carte is good too.

Marble walls create an opulent ambience but after that it lacks atmosphere.  Tapas -the only value for money and flavoursome one was the beef wellington.  Over priced and incredibly small portions on tapas.  Mains are a bit pricey but portion size is more generous. Irratic but friendlish service felt like a new set of servers.

Didn't know this place existed before but what a find! Really lovely food, tasty and good value. We neneeded somewhere near to the Playhouse Theatre and opted for this but will definitely be back. Gorgeous dining room and bar area, great cocktails and food. I had the set pre-theatre menu, friends opted for the a la carte and no one was disappointed. Thank you Boyd's for a lovely meal.
