Wonderful options for pre-theatre dinner. Nice ambiance and contemporary decor. Staff was friendly but seemed to forget about us halfway through the meal, when we needed to wrap up to make our show.

hi, my partner and i went for an evening meal after reading the menu online. unfortunately the menu we were looking at was one to come in soon and not available. the menu on the night looked very nice but not what were after on that evening. the surroundings, staff and feel were all very good and i will go back again.
Had a lovely pre-theatre meal here, service was excellent and food well prepared and imaginative

We had a lovely pre-theatre dinner at Boyd's last night. I recommend it highly. Beautiful surroundings with friendly staff and lovely bar for a drink before or after.

Pre-theatre menu was lovely, with a choice of 2 starters per person.

Would definitely go again.

The food was very good and value for money considering location in Central London. The service let it down however with the carafe of wine that was part of our meal was removed with wine still in it. There was an apology and our glasses were both filled but you do not expect to have to run after your unfinished wine
A wonderful place for lunch, fab food, the fillet steak was perfection, fab service in a magnificient surroundings. A real find. Will reccommend friends and will be back.
You have booked me a table. I went there to find out the restaurant has closed down a month ago.

The meal at Caribbean Scene was pleasant but not worth the amount charged. The main meal portion was generous, however the same could not be said of the starter - bbq chicken dippers (¬£5.50 seems alot of four tiny pieces of chicken wings). Staff were friendlly. Overall - OK.

We booked online for a pre opera lunch. Very easy booking. A great find, down a quiet street with a window on to an alley which was fun for people watching. Food was delicious, good sized tapas made fresh & full of flavour. The Cava was also a delight. Staff are friendly & helpful. We will be back for our next pre theatre eats üòä Thank You
Excellent tapas and fantastic value. Service was friendly without being overbearing.
Delicious food and very reasonable prices. Would recommend.

A disaster, having confirmed the booking  I assumed that was all I needed to do, and did not have the Groupon Voucher with me. We therefore had to pay again. You need a warning on your Open Table form to say that  payment has not been made  and that any vouchers etc must be presented on the day
this is our fourth or fifth visit.I love the food and position high up in great court roof

Wonderful afternoon tea - was perfect place to refresh and pause between general gallery viewing and a late booking for the Hokusai exhibition. Excellent food, lovely tea and (according to my mother as I was driving!) superb Prosecco. Service was very friendly and efficient - initially the Prosecco came in a hot glass straight from the dishwasher, it was replaced with profuse apologies and no fuss. Will definitely book again - a little oasis of calm and peace with some of the best cakes I've ever eaten.

A wonderful venue and good spacious seating . The food was average , portions reasonable , came to the table a little less then hot, and not great value
So if you want a great pace and not too worried about great dining , its ok .

My wife had a chicken salad. It was abysmal. The chicken was badly presented. The avocado was hard. The lettuce was tasteless and chewy. The croutons were like dry toast. The dressing, purported to be a blue cheese dressing, was tasteless and more like milk. All in all the meal was a disaster. A complaint was made and the restaurant waived the charge for the meal. The waiver of the charge was of little compensation as we had hoped for a nice celebratory lunch.
Our previous experiences at the restaurant have been good and it seems a pity that standards have dropped.

We have lunch at the Court  Restaurant every time that we visit the British Museum (it's best to reserve a table).  The atmosphere is most pleasant and the architecture wonderful.   The vegetarian food is excellent (they offer more than one dish!) as is the wine.  The  waitresses are lovely and helpful.  All in all, a wonderful interlude between forays through the antiquities.  The only downside is that the loos (throughout the Museum) are ghastly.

As usual, lunch in the Court restaurant is a splendid way to relax after visiting an excellent exhibition at the British Museum. The staff were  quietly attentive and there was a good choice on the menu.
I went here with my wife after a long day of travel.   We had afternoon high tea.  Everything tested great and was fun to eat.

There is no publicity given for the lifts. At 77 years old climbing the stairs was not acceptable. We had booked and yet we were given a table up against a wall at the back of the room. The drinks took a long time to come. The food was average. When it came to paying our bill, our waiter had disappeared. Eventually we found another waiter to deal with the matter.

We wanted the special Pompeii exhibition set menu, but there was a problem and only cold food was available. I paid the ¬£59.95 bill with three ¬£20 notes, but nobody ever brought me a receipt, or my 5p change. I should sue!

From the moment we arrived at 7.30, the time we had booked, the staff were trying to hurry us out. We were aware the British Museum closed at 9, but by 8.20 we were being told it was too late for dessert. The place was virtually empty and the experience (which was supposed to be a treat for our friends with whom we had visited the Pompeii exhibition) was miserable. Fortunately we were rescued by the Covent Garden Hotel which was friendly and welcoming and gave us desserts and lovely wine with charming service and a great buzz. We know where we will go next time!

We love meeting friends at the Court Restaurant. The location is good. It is right up close to the beautiful glass roof of the British Museum Court, so, very light and airy. The ambience is lovely, and we usually meet before or after seeing an exhibition. This time, we were somewhat disappointed by the quality of the food. It was all very bland. But the service was attentive and friendly. And we will keep on trying!
Out of business

Enjoyed lunch with 3 friends at Polpo this week. Good advice about portions from staff who were attentive but not intrusive throughout our meals. We stayed chatting after lunch - we hadn't seen each other for some time. Food very good as always.

We actually sat at a well-positioned table and ordered Dover sole meuni√®re which was filleted tableside, and accompanied by a la carte leaf spinach and roasted potatoes, all excellent and served beautifully.  The desert, one Williams peach tart, and one sorbet, looked appetizing and tasted even better.

We celebrated my sister in law‚Äôs birthday, and the restaurant provided the setting for this special occasion.

The service was great and professional throughout, the 3 courses for ¬£29.50 deal was extremely good value for the quality of food we were served, and the professionalism displayed.

We loved our experience and would recommend it to other diners. We had a little misunderstanding when it came to the final bill, but it was immediately resolved to our satisfaction by the Manager, which we greatly appreciated.

Apart from it being a little too dark we had a lovely time. The staff were great and the food was amazing. Just always very aware you were dining in a hotel restaurant, particularly as the toilets are in the hotel . We still had a great meal and enjoyed ourselves
Table booking was incorrect despite calling the day before, service was slow, items were missed, the bill was incorrect however the food was good and it had a busy vibe

Good food, service could be better. Asked for another drink which never came. Not too much space around tables, no where to hang your coat. Asked for theatre directions and never got that either. 12.5% service charge added automatically for poor service! Won't go back!
Great service
Excellant service from greeting to leaving.Nothing was too much trouble and the chef adapted meals as I am a vegetarian.Wine choices good and complimented the food.
Food was good but it was not busy so the atmosphere was a bit dead

Absolutely awful. Had booked a table for a pre theatre meal and when I arrived (on time) and gave my name for the reservation, the staff seem totally disinterested and found an empty table and showed us there. The menu was very limited and a schools canteen would have been more interesting and better. I had chopped liver to begin with which was nothing more than a very thinly spread creamy pate on French toasted bread and not tasting of chopped liver at all. For the main course I had what was supposed to be spicy jerk chicken with pineapple but was as bland as anything with no spice at all and the pineapple was three strips one of which was total core. My wife had what was supposed to be cod cooked in matzo meal but was in fact cooked in batter. It was almost inedible and when she queried this, because someone at the next table also had cod but this was cooked in matzo meal, we were told that they would make a deduction from the bill. When this arrived they had only made a 10% reduction. When I complained, they begrudgingly took her meal off the bill. Never again. I have had better food at McDonalds. At least the show, Ragtime, was very enjoyable.
great location, got a table for 8 at short notice but the place is fairly small and busy - easy to have a late night drink at the bar too

Hidden below Charing Cross Station, this is an unusual combination of an active theatre, but also an excellent restaurant and late-night bar. The menu is up-market gastro-pub, with quality ingredients, very well cooked. It represents amazing value for money, in such a central location. Later at night, it evolves into a piano bar with a late licence, which seems very popular with the post-theatre crowd - very buzzy! All round, a great venue.

I came for lunch with a friend, food was good, excellent choice and no pressure to eat a lot at lunch time which was welcome. Good value for money and house wine was fine. I‚Äôm noise averse so difficult for me to comment but it was really no noisier than any popular venue. Service was excellent, friendly and not pushy, Greek coffee a bonus.

I was stuck without a bus in heavy rain and when I finally got on the bus and tried phoning, 4 times with no answer, to see if they could still accommodate us, we ended up going elsewhere. We were very disappointed to not be able to reach them and to try the restaurant.

Coffee made by Australians - thank the lord! It is the best in the world!
The food is limited but good but the room is tiny, you are basically sitting in a cafe and the table is a big shared table.

Nice venue with high ceilings and view of Royal Opera house, although downstairs looks a little cramped, so I would ask for upstairs table. Pizza was tasty (spicy as requested) and my partner's fish was cooked properly.

Having ordered pudding, I had to ask when it was coming - I think the staff realised they had forgotten to put the order thru : it arrived very quickly afterwards and the waitress apologised for the delay explaining that we would not be charged for the pudding. Basically, the problem was dealt with efficiently, so we increased our tip to show our gratitude.

Our visit to Zizzi in Bow Street London, was very good the food was good, the service and atmosphere was good, Unfortnately when we arrived they did not have our booking they said toptable had not advised them, we do not know who was to blame, but if they had been busier it may have been a problem, however I did have the email confirmation

A lovely, cosy, little restaurant that that serves great Japanese food.
Reasonably priced with a atmosphere.
Go check it out..

Although the food was great, our experience was ruined as from the beginning when we first entered for our booking at 6.30pm we were told we had to leave by 8.30pm (2 hours) and and we were rushed to order our food by 7pm. We were even asked to leave the table at exactly 8.30pm even though there were at least 4 other empty tables! Really ruined what could have been a great meal!
We go back every two weeks so that says it really.

It's difficult to find great tasting sushi in london. I always compare it to the fab sushi i tasted in america and none comes close to it till i tasted the sushi at tsunami. Thoroughly enjoyed our meal there and the staff are all very accomodating and made us feel very welcome. Highly recommending this restaurant. The only suggestion is to make it a little bit friendly for babies (e.g. High chair, changing facility).
As always tsunami one of my favorite!
Keep coming back! very friendly and prompt service; with the discount it is very good value, without rather pricey when compared to other Japanese restaurants as the sashimi portions are smaller.

I have eaten at Tsunami many times, often on 40% TT off. I slightly prefer the Clapham branch, it's more lively and fun, but Charlotte Street is very convenient. It is also nice and quiet. This time we went for special birthday dinner, food is very delicious, beautifully presented, a cut above many Japanese restaurants. We were four and had a selection of different cooked dishes and sushi and rolls and dessert, all done really well. Will go back again!

Tsunami Charlotte Street London.
Awesopme food and service and with the 50% deal this is extremely good value.
Food was delicious and well presented. The scallop served flaming in its shell was quite impressive!
Delicious as always!
Great restaurant....not flash or pretentious ....and super food Tsunami in the west end in simply terrific

Tsunami on charlotte street is an excellent lunch venue if you want a relaxed ambience and high quality sharing food. Good value for money through top table. Ideal location.
London, September 11

We really enjoyed our dinner at Tsunami on Charlotte Street.  Food and service was great throughout, shown by the fact that 4 health conscious girls all had three courses, including some yummy desserts!
very nice meal - some standard japanese dishes, some a little more eclectic/fusion, great dessert, nice wine, fair price with the discount, i may have thought it a little overpriced without.

Lunch time meal deal is great value for money! The prawn starter and duck main are highly recommended! Restaurant really fills up at lunch and gets quite lively! Food service is very quick, however the waiters service skills arent that goid and i wouldnt say they were very welcomming either! Watch out the the 12.5% service charge they also add to the bill!

Overall it was a good meal and i would return as was great value for money!
The 50% off Toptable deal represents extraordinary value.  Very impressed with Tsunami and this will be one of our regular venues in the future.
Good service - amazing black cod and very fine tempura.
Food was delicious. Very well executed and flavorsome, ideal for sharing. Good ambience for a midweek lunch time.
The food was excellent, and atmosphere good. Would definitely go again.
Great ambience, great cocktails and most importantly great food! The dishes were spaced out which meant that the food was hot and overall the service was very good.I would definitely come here again.

Tsunami Charlotte Street was a real lunchtime treat. I'm anyway a fan of the innovative Tsunami cuisine (often eat at the Clapham branch). The Oyster Shooters are blissful and the Wasabi Tobiko roll is a lovely way of vaporising one's brain! V charming waitresses and lovely room - like being inside a gift-box. The more trad sushi could be better - the fish quality sometimes lets it down - yellowfin a bit bland, and the rice could be less dry. But overall, a pleasure worth repeating.
Great little place with nice ambience and exceptional food
Superb, great food, beautifully presented, good service, different and scrummy.

We all enjoyed our evening! A very buzzy atmosphere - lovely food!
VERY annoying that the 20% discount offer was not on the bill!!!!
The manager said that I needed to order before 7pm to qualify! I made the booking over the phone for 7pm!
I would need to have phoned through the order before arriving in that case! The 20% WAS deducted when I pointed this out!

The Tsunami restaurant at 93 Charlotte Street, London, W1T 4PY
Was one of the best restaurants that I have visited for a long time and the staffs were more than helpful?

I would recommend this restaurant to anyone

When there recommended by a colleague a mine. I was surprise as I have tested a few Japanese restaurant. I must say the selection of starters is really good and the ones we had were excellent. The service is friendly. I will certainly come back.

The food was good and resonably priced except for the seafood tempura which was expensive for what it was (not very much). Everything else was a decent size. Lovely sushimi and the maki rolls were excellent! The tables were really close together so it was a bit of a squeeze as it was quite busy. Nice atmosphere, and the staff were very friendly.
Was a good deal with the 30% off.

A little cold but then it was a very cold day. The waiters were a little pushy with clearing up as soon as we had finished a plate and the water was constantly being poured which is a pet hate of mine, however the food is really top notch.
Great to sit outside enjoying the delicious mushroom burger and unlimited fries.  Very helpful staff.
Very noisy. Was not seated in the bar even if I reserved that

I am frustrated as I booked a table for my friends and I to meet here for lunch online. The booking was successful - but when we turned up the restaurant was closed! No one told me this was going to happen. Very frustrating.

Perfect for myself and daughter for a pre theatre visit {to the Waitress - which was literally just across the road}.  Our food was delicious and it was a perfect way to start our evening. The waitress was attentive - even though the restaurant was full. Would recommend
Really central for theater, nice place inside, prices are good but food is just ok. I have been to many Italians and it's not something that you will remember. But in general, still good.

Excellent main course food. The super salad was one if the best dishes i have ever had. Could have done a bit more with the bruschetta starter in terms of size and could have been more garlic on the garlic bread. It was a bit dry. Service was good. Slightly on the pricy side overall but still decent value

This deal of 3 courses for ¬£13.95 was excellent value for money.  The servings were generous and tasted good.  The one negative would be was that the service was incredibly slow but the waiter was pleasant.  I would go again but not if I was pressed for time.

I'd booked this restaurant a while back and was really looking forward to it, but found that the site was closed when I attended. Considering I live up to 2 hours away from London it was terribly disappointing to make the trip out only to discover that I couldn't even eat ay the restaurant and then to be tasked with finding a restaurant elsewhere. A note on the website is all that was needed to inform guests of closure.

My second visit here, preferred the brunch / lunch menu as there were more interesting and varied choices.

There was a birthday going on while my friends and I were dinning and they were incredibly loud and clearly had far too much to drink - it was not an attractive sight.

The waiters and waitresses left their behavior unchecked and unnoticed for a while and it started to affect the enjoyment of our meal / get together. Their behaviour was sloppy and unimpressive. That is not how you act in an upmarket restaurant lol...

What a great shame.

Service was a little slow and couldn't understand what we wanted, which needed several repetitions.
Had a really good time, the food was amazing and loved the deco of the restaurant.
This restaurant no longer exists! I booked and turned up to discover it wasn't even there. You need to update your records!
Place was a bit more rushed than usual and staff didn‚Äôt seem able to fully cope. Food was good, as ever.
Fitted our expectation thank you. We have been to others in the chain. This was the best.
Lovely food and the service was good. Went with my elderly mother and they couldn't have been nicer
The restaurant has closed!
I got as far as the Desserts for the first time - the Rum Baba with Orange Curd was outstanding. Can easily be shared by 2.
Some of my friends wanted chicken added to their dish the staff were only to happy to cater to our request . The food was delicious and overall a very good experience . Would recommend!
Excellent friendly service. Enjoyed a tasty brunch, well cooked fresh to order.  Would recommend for quick snack or meal in Bloomsbury area

This meal was a disaster. We were given a laminated menu with a choice of three starters, three main courses and three desserts. The "extensive wine menu" was hand written on a folded piece of photocopied A4. The 3 of us dined in an empty room which was cold and lifeless. Our 70's style starters; one Parma ham & melon and a Prawn cocktail were served with limp lettuce. The main course - well school dinners were better cooked and served. I went for the more exotic of the three; the chicken and stir fried veg in chili sauce. What I got was a dry chicked breast with a handful of Birds Eye style chunky veg dribbled with chili sauce and more limp lettuce. The sea bass was inedible and even the coffee was awful. Nothing like the write up!
Went around 5pm so not too busy. Big portions, and reasonable prices especially for the area. Nice to check it out but wouldn't rush back

We arrived and were seated. There was some confusion with regards to having booked the pre theatre menu when we hadn‚Äôt. This went on for a while! Drinking water was already on the table with glasses for us. We ordered a lemonade and a glass of red wine. The red wine was nothing special yet cost nearly ¬£9 for a small glass!!!! We both ordered pizzas as that‚Äôs all that was on the menu for mains. They were tasty and filling. Feeling stuffed one of us ordered a coffee but an espresso arrived which wasn‚Äôt what they wanted so it was sent back.
We asked for the bill which was wrong so had to get it changed. They do add a service charge to the bill so be aware of that.
All in all it was ok, nothing special. Would I go again... no.
We really enjoyed Bunga Bunga and laughed so hard. Brilliant night and so much fun. We will be going back for sure
Informal setting, but formal service and food quality

Went to have a lazy, long girls lunch and Ayoush did not disappoint. Interior is fab, yummy food and fantastic staff. Its a shame they have to close down due to building renovations. Hopefully they will find a new home soon.

Unfussy North African cuisine which can be sampled through several set menus including a light Mezze selection from ¬£20 per head. Ayoush is best enjoyed from one of it's downstairs caves (seats groups up to 20 people). An engaging belly dancer and good service make it reliably good fun for a group, but possibly a little run of the mill for a big date.
Good food, good service not quite sexy fish or Scott‚Äôs but was ok
Food was good but not outstanding, service ok, surroundings nice, there is a terrace for smokers/outside, a little pricey if you're not on an offer.

We went on the 23rd December for lunch and had the whole place to ourselves!
The staff were very attentive but not overly and the restaurant looked superb.
We had a main course and a dessert each and both came within a reasonable time and tasted sublime, would definitely go again!

Really enjoyed our dinner at Fat Tony's pasta pop-up at Termini Centrale. Service was attentive, food was delicious, and the cocktails superb. I cannot recommend the octopus salad, beef shin ragu and grilled peaches enough! Though, truth be told, all the dishes, right from the starters to the desserts looked so intriguing that I'm definitely going to have to return to try the other dishes. Thanks, Fat Tony and Termini Centrale!

Nice atmosphere for after theater dinner and food was pretty good.

Service went downhill after we were served dinner - our waitress was busy chatting with coworkers and just disappeared for about twenty minutes.
My mash was cold, although the fish was hot. My husband's food was virtually thrown at him. It was all very disappointing.

Jo Allens was the perfect venue for a 20 year reunion.  The menu had something for everyone (the "off menu burgers are amazing) and was very reasonably priced.  We started with great cocktails, had wine and then more wine.  We were not rushed out, the staff were knowledgeable and friendly and the atmosphere fun.

A pleasant atmosphere and staff. The food was fine.

Service was lackadaisical.

We came here for lunch on a Saturday and I loved it so much I was back the following Wednesday! Staff are very friendly, very good American/Brasserie style food, and the atmosphere, let's just say Don Draper wouldn't look out of place at the bar :)

Joe Allen has improved since we last went.  The burgers (never on the menu, but always available) were cooked to a perfection.    The staff were welcoming and helpful.    The pianist seemed to play more often and more tunefully.    Despite being a busy Friday night, there wasn't the pressure of old to eat up and go.   We enjoyed ourselves much more.   We shall return
Brilliant atmosphere as ever, fascinating people watching and interesting menu, food standards weren't quite up to their usual but the service and ambience were great
Quite tasty food (had ribs) though we had to ask for water 3 times.
Service slowere than usdual due to Xmas Parties but good quality food
It was a good experience with the restaurant, value for money and the ambience was very good.

The takeover has resulted in a more bland menu and a slightly less sophisticated atmosphere. The serving staff are obviously over-stretched and we experienced long waits. The waitress was hassled if pleasant.Have been going here for years but won't be going again.

Excellent meal on a busy Saturday lunchtime. Attentive but not overbearing service and excellent quality food. Very child-friendly and excellent atmosphere. Given location, a perfect spot for a pre or post theatre meal.

Tried & tested and still going strong after 35 years. Ideal for pre-theatre dinner. Rather limited set menu but the quality is always up to standard and the service although rather impersonal ensures you get to the theatre on time.

I love Joe Allen, I've become quite the regular of late - especially for Sunday Lunch. This weekday evening visit was with two American friends who hadn't been before - one tried the now not-so-secret-burger and enjoyed it, high praise from him. The food is always good and the special-offer menus are really great value for Central London.

I've run out of superlatives to describe Joe Allen as I've been here so many times and love the place. A great lunch today - perfectly cooked steak, great service as always. I may sell my house and move in permanently.
Lively friendly restaurant.Good service.
I have eaten here lunch and dinner over a number of years. Joe Allen's has always been able to maintain its good standard of food and service at a reasonable price.
Joe Allen's was wonderful as always; love the place. Brilliant early week set menu which is great value.

My wife and I visited Joe Allen in Covent Garden on a Wednesday night, using a Toptable ¬£20 for ¬£40 discount voucher. Despite being mid-week it was fairly busy. After eating there I'm a little confused as to why. While the food was ok/average it was priced as a high-end restaurant. Before the discount it was ¬£70 per person for 3 courses plus wine, at least ¬£30 per person overpriced in my opinion. Joe Allen is ok but definitely not worth the prices they charge!
Friendly service and comfy food. Great

Joe Allen in London has excellent reviews on toptable and I'd wanted to try it for a while, but was very disappointed. My friend ordered a burrito and asked if she would need any sides with it and when she didn't really get a response from the waiter, decided to get it on its own. When it came it was one single burrito with a couple of lettuce leaves to pretty it up, not what I would call a main meal. She then had to order some fries to fill up. I would not go back.

Joe Allen in London. Excellent ambience as you walk in. We both had dishes from the pre-theatre menu, which is perhaps more limited than it needs to be. We both went for the pumpkin burrito. This was very good indeed, with a fine balance of flavours - possibly a bit small though. This was followed by the moist chocolate cake, which was good if not remarkable. A good choice for a lively atmosphere before the theatre
Lovely ambience and good food at Joe Allen but let down on that day by slow service from the kitchen

On a hot and humid evening in London Joe Allen's was a great place to go - the restaurant itself was cool and the atmosphere still buzzy. We had the pre-theatre menu which always gives a good choice and the cod with lentils was particularly delicious.

Excellent service, great staff, rissotto was a bit cold no problem in taking it back and gave us option of either free dessert or take rissoto off the bill, a great dinning experience, would def go again.

VIsited Joe Allens in Covent Garden, London on Sunday for brunch. The brunch menu was great value for money at ¬£19.50 for 2 courses or ¬£21.50 for free which included a glass of bucks fizz and tea/coffee. The food was pretty much stable fare and nothing fantastic but perfectly adequite. Great buzzing atmosphere though with a mainly "theatrical" crowd and would imagine the place would be really good late evening after the theatres have closed. So it wins on atmosphere rather than food

Dined once more at Joe Allen's in Exeter Street London.  Venue as enticing as ever, pianist understasted and very professional.  Service great and food brilliant.  Constant changes to the well ranged menu mean that it is never boring.
Really busy venue, had a fab ambience.
Good, reasonably priced food

Joe Allen is an ideal pre-theatre, or West End restaurant, that is not over crowded, with a special atmosphere, excellent value for very good food and service.
I would not hesitate to return or recommend to other people, especially friends from out of London who find it difficult to select from the many, often mediocre, over-priced restaurants.
My last meal at Joe Allen's was 8-9 years ago but I certainly won't be leaving it that long before I make a return visit!  I cannot fault a single thing.

Joe Allen's, Covet Garden, brunch: I have been to Joe Allen's for dinner before, and was looking forward to my 11:30 American brunch. Sadly, however, there was very little American about this brunch, regardless of the restaurant's alleged roots; not a trace of pancakes, waffles, french toast, maple syrup, coffee cake or crispy bacon to be seen - instead, a lot of very basic European lunch foods. Bloody Mary's with brunch?? What happened to orange juice, smoothies and milkshakes?? Oh well.
Joe Allen's daily prix fixe menu is a good value and tasty option for lunch in Covent Garden.  And the Bloody Mary must be one of the best in London!

The atmosphere is Joe Allen's is always really good, you really feel like you are in theatre-land. The service is really good too. The portion sizes of the food are on the small side and the presentation of the food is really basic. Our side order of mash potato just came out on a plate in a lump, pressed down with a fork. But saying that, its always worth a visit.

We eat here regularly when going to the theatre and this was the first time we have ever doubted we'd bother to come back.
We chose the pre-theatre set menu which was a bit disappointing. The portion size for my wife's lemon sole was inadequate and the desert of the day was not as described.
Good point: the staff were happy to allow my wife to swap her choice of starter (salad with fruit) for a Caesar salad without quibble or extra charge.
The menu did not make clear that steak with a red wine sauce was braised not grilled so I was slightly baffled by the server asking how I wanted it done.
The pre-theatre menu is light on choice. Local rivals do better.

Joe Allen's London.

Nice meal - went early on a Sunday eve, so ambience was non-existant. Quite expensive too, but good food.
Really good post show venue. Quick, friendly service. Good fresh cooked food.

The food was very enjoyable and the atmosphere welcoming at first. However the service was abysmal. The waiting staff couldn't raise a smile if their life depended on it and spent much of our visit ignoring us. I appreciate that we were a late sitting but it doesn't cost a penny to smile. Not sure I will be going there again.
We had Joe Allen recommended by a friend, I would definately dine there again and would recommend to any of my friends as an excellent place to dine.
Service was the WORST I have experienced in a long time of any restaurant!  I will never go back.

We were given a table between two big, loud groups and next to the bar service station, and were then ignored by our waitress for 15 minutes.

Service of food after that was prompt until after the main course when another waiter took us under his wing and arranged dessert and cocktails for us. He did offer for us to move to a quieter table to have coffee but by that time we'd had enough!

The service was very poor, the waiting staff where the most miserable bunch I have had the misfortune to encounter even considering the resturant was not busy,the hostess was very unhelpful when my 14 year old asked who Joe Allen was all he got in reply was pointed to a picture but no explanation as to who he was.
We shall not return there again and infact will try to disuade any of our friends to eat there.
Joe Allen - a reliable venue for good food, reasonably priced in a lovely atmosphere.  A safe choice every time for business or pleasure.  Or even pleasurable business.

I have been to Joe allens on a couple of occasions and was pleased with service and food.
Not this time.The service was poor, the waitress refused to recommend anything on the menu, when asked a few times.
No bread was brought foir the table until after all the orders were taken(40 minutes into the evening).
side dished turned up uat the end of the meal and the french fies looked and tasted like oven baked chips.
the general concensus was buzzy atmosphere , average to below par food.
The perfect afternoon tea in the beautiful city of London with the iconic reputation that proceeds playboy- classy, sophisticated and extravagant

All six of us really enjoyed a leisurely lunch with very attentive staff, great food with a wonderful choice of wine to accompany it.  We sat in the little private snug area downstairs which added to our experience.  We will definitely be returning on our next visit to the West End.

Unfortunately, when we arrived the restaurant had no knowledge of our booking.  Fortunately that did not matter as there was plenty of space which in itself speaks volumes in this location on a Friday night.  The food was extremely average.  We were not looking for a fine dining experience, simply an accessible spot at which to meet up.  From that point of view this was a good choice.

Came up on Open Table as hosting a table for 10, but really not set up for lunchtime.  Menu different than advertised - food ok but very limited range. Not really a lunch venue so staff not set up for it, and seating options poor.
Excellent choice for a cosy date with very nice food and moderate price. Enjoyed the pistachio sauce on prosciutto :P
Fantastic food absolutely delicious
Service poor. We‚Äôre given a birthday cake, when it was for the table behind. Singaporean crab way too much ginger and overall a very poor experience.
Disappointed with the meal, only couple dishes were nice. Won't rush back.
Amazing food, great atmosphere, unique experience!

A shambles
Ovens were not what the staff didn‚Äôt know there were any reservations for that day. Mix up in orders. They should have apologised and turned is away.
A good solid restaurant. Reliabel and comforting food and good service
A great time as always. Orso is a favourite of mine and often my default  venue.   Fabulous food and drink - with delightful staff and service.   Always a winner.

We came to Orso for a birthday/pre theatre dinner. The place was full and the food and service were good enough to get us through in time for the theatre. I would say it was average if you were wanting a meal to linger over.
Booked online. We were going to the lyceum and the loction of the restaurant could not have been better.The staff were really attentive and helpful, and the food was excellent. definately go back.

A great institution!  Very good, authentic northern Italian cuisine and a well chosen Italian wine list.  Great atmosphere and excellent service - brisk but always very efficient and friendly.   Flexible opening hours makes Orso the go to place for high end 'fast food'.

The service at Orso is excellent,. The food itself is good value but some we ordered was not hot enough. The bread and oil is not special, pea soup was very good.
Wine, drinks, and coffees a bit pricey.
Amazing food! The service was perfect and the team at Mayfair garden was professional
Excellent Chinese. Consistently good food and service. Good for a large party.

Order whole roast duck. Missing 1 breast, so didn't get the whole duck. Manager tried to convince me that there is 2breast. I was not going  to argue with him and spoil my lunch. Fried chicken noodle was nothing like how it should be. Dim sun was average. 15% service charge ridiculous. Been before when is was Princess Garden. It certainly has gone down hill.

Had all intentions to go for a burger.
Saw somebody else's pulled pork and burnt ends, had to have it. Was lovely.
Made reservations. When arrived we were told that the restaurant was closed, and we had to look for a new place to eat.
Restaurant has closed which is a pity as it was a favourite and good value with a great menue

This is a great place for lunch, ideally not of the business kind!  Three of us had an excellent meal which was strong in every course.  We particularly liked the puddings but then the main courses were pretty good too..

We had a brilliant dinner. Restaurant was good about us literally turning our orders into a buffet with several  starters as mains and sharing across the table as we went along. Food was excellent and the variety on the menu left none disappointed.

I go here regularly for lunch or a drink and it's always lovely. This time we went for dinner and it was equally as great. Lovely ambience, delicious food, great wine and cocktail options (I've had many of their margaritas) and the staff are always completely lovely and welcoming.

If you're looking for somewhere in central London that is special but still feels cozy and inviting then this a great option. You wont be disappointed.

I've been before and love the great home cooked food style, it's excellent cooking. Lots of flavour and generous portions. It also does sharing meals - we had the Duck Cassoulet for two. Great wine menu too. Friendly, warm atmosphere. Always busy so worth booking. Not for the pretty plate eater - this is hearty food at its best.

I haven't been to this restuarant before and thought we would go for lunch to celebrate a friend's birthday as I'd heard it was a good restaurant.  Unfortunately I wasn't impressed at all.  Whilst the main courses were OK the green veg side salad was a dish of watery cabbage which hadn't been seasoned at all.  We also had to wait a few minutes for this dish to arrive after our main dishes had been brought out.  The chocolate pudding was nice.  The service wasn't that attentive either even though the restaurant was not at all busy.   Overall I thought it was poor value.
Had a really lovely meal, with great people watching.  Lovely food, great service enjoyable experience.

We went for a pre-theatre dinner so had booked in advance.  It was quiet on arrival but soon picked up and became quite busy.  The staff were friendly and very knowledgeable about the menu/food.  The odd furniture and cutlery/glassware makes the place quirky and different.  They turned the food around quite quickly once we told them we had a show to attend.  They were very accommodating and efficient. Would definitely recommend.
Great cocktail menu with attentive waiting staff
Excellent service & great value
Scrambled eggs in brioche roll was amazing! Staff are lovely, and very attentive. Location, plating, and ambience is perfect too.
Perfect restaurant
amazing foooood

downstairs seating is not great and  felt a bit isolated.  Service was slow and waitress was upset  after we pointed out she made a mistake with the order (confused the juices and forgot one plate).  rather than that food was delicious. Overpriced though.
A must if you are in the Mayfair area! Great ambiance, delicious food, and pleasant staff.
truffle burger is yummy but need more truffle sauce
The waiter was the best guy
Awesome food, bit pricey but outstanding quality.

Love this place! Never had a bad experience there. Casual but elegant atmosphere with friendly service and delicious food. Especially nice on Saturdays for brunch. Best dishes: avocado toast, truffle burger, schnitzel, truffle mac n cheese. Best desserts: chocolate cookies, french toast, ricotta pancakes. Always a good time at NAC!

had drinks with a few friends at their cocktail bar, which looks really cool, very comfortable. we then went upstairs for dinner. place was busy, good crowd. food was delicious, we took almost one of everything, but be careful as bill adds up quickly. standouts were the vegetables, the veal and the beef. churros for dessert was also very good. we ended up going back downstair for one last cocktail (try the 55, tequila with chili and cucumber).
overall a great experience and we will definitely go back!!
The service was friendly if a little slow, drinks ok price wise. Food was typically American style but not very good. I won‚Äôt be going back.
I hadn't been to Smollensky's for a good 10 years....... it was just as I remembered, had a few cocktails and dinner which were both very pleasant.  Good relaxed dining experience.

The food we had was generally pretty good, overall, though nothing to really write home about. The prices were alright, though again, not an excellent value. The service was a little bit negligent at times-our OpenTable booking hadn't been received, we were ignored a few times by servers, waited a fair while to order, etc.

Basically, Smollensky's is OK, and conveniently located for west end shows, but doesn't light the world on fire. You could do worse, but you could also do better.
You can not really go wrong if you want a decent piece of meat!
Glad we arrived early as we were able to take advantage of the happy hour wine offer in conjunction with the top table food offer! Very tasty mussels, nice beef carpaccio. Little aggressive air con!
Booked on 50% offer for after the theatre. Run-of-the-mill American style menu with slightly too loud music. Probably better for groups than couples.
Reasonable service, nice location (once we found it), good value with the Top Table offer, but whilst steak was full of flavour it was very chewy. A fairly unremarkable meal otherwise.
Noisy and busy, but was a Friday night. Took 10 minutes to be greeted when we arrived and the waiter spilled a tray full of drinks in front of us. Not great service...

We went to Smollenskys in the Strand London for a pre theatre meal.  Atmosphere was very good and the service helpful although not speedy.  Food was of a high quality and is good value for a family oriented central London venue.

Smollensky's on the Strand is a great location and the restaurant has a good atmosphere. We booked the 50% off offer, but was a bit disapointed when the restaurant provided us with a much smaller menu than their normal full a la cart and we cuold only have 50% the items on that small menu, so the selection wasn't as good. The food quality was nice though!
Great with the tt offer, food consistently good.

The food was good quality. The restaurant is large and does have some atmosphere but if there's not a lot of people dining then it can lose it all. The service was a little slow but that's only being pedantic. Overall it was a good night.

Excellent steaks. Waitress staff a little rude. TopTable 50% offered in the end, however this offer is for four people or less.  Something we weren't aware of.  Therefore only four people got the discount out of the 7. Overall pretty reasonable price though.

The food was OK (apart from being a bit on the salty side), although nothing special. The service was good.
The place is convenient especially for theatre goers & quite large. However if one goes for pre-theatre dinner, it can be very busy & more importantly noisy, as there is a large (& good) bar area next to the restaurant. It would be more recomended for a place to have a drink with friends/colleagues.

Smollensky's on the Strand was a good find - we enjoyed our lunch in good surroundings.  Service was a little on the slow side but perhaps because they were doing a brisk trade with families popping in on spec.   Good sized portions and beautiful home made green pea soup, a big plateful for only ¬£2.  Kids had hotdogs and burgers which were lovely and adults the crab cakes and beetroot salad and BLT - all very good.
Virtually empty at lunch time, but good simple food.
Great for pre-theatre!
Great value with the 50% off, waitress was smashing. The food wasn't awe inspriring but not substandard either. A good value meal with the deal for sure.
Great value with the 50% off deal. Would go back. Really did like the Smollensky's burger.

Starters were lovely, good portion size but both the mains we ordered were lacking in flavour. House wine was "okay" but the service was slow- although we did go at a busy time Would probabaly go again though as the happy hour offers are good!
Very good food, and nice ambience in a good location. The service for our large group was poor and very slow, which let the restaurant down.
Went to Smollensky's on the Strand yesterday for lunch.  Great value with the 50% off food Top Table deal and a good menu on offer.  Waitresses were cheerful and helpful.
Great meal at Smollensky's on the Strand. Particularly enjoyed the fact they have a happy hour on cocktails 5-7pm :) Would go back again.

Smollensky's on the Strand - we went for a quick pre theatre dinner on the 50% off deal.  Cocktails were also 2 4 1 between 5-7pm as were glasses of house wine.  We were seated promptly, food was served reasonably quickly although we had to ask for steak knives for our steaks.  The bill was a bit cheeky though... 12.5% service charge was added before the 50% discount was given so it actually equated to nearer 20% of our final bill.  Overall ok but nothing super special.

Smollenskys in the Strand was exactly what we needed with 4 children in our party.  During December, lunchtimes, they provide entertainment for the children - a magician and punch and judy show, which was great.  Food was just right for children with plenty to interest the adults too.  Only sad point was that hot chocolate was said, by the waiter, not to be good, which was strange as it was there on the menu.  Service was good despite being busy.  We will go again.

I went to Smollensky's on the Strand with a few friends.
Once we were sitted our waiter came over and asked us what we liked, but as soon as we gave our order in we could never find him again, to order drinks etc.
The live entertainment was really good and the layout of the restuarant is really nice. The food was lovely and great value for money. A nice place to go with a loved one or out for a meal with mates
Great place to go for Thanksgiving dinner. Be sure to get the Pecan pie!

I am amazed that Open Table have asked me to write a review for this restaurant. Despite booking two weeks in advance and receiving a final confirmation text two days before, when my friend and I arrived at the restaurant it was closed! There were hand written notes on the doors saying they have closed down! Very bizarre. Luckily we walked back to Covent Garden square and got a lovely outdoor table at Tuttons where we had a very lovely long and relaxing brunch.
Luca bartender was perfect and the drinks and food recommendation made the night so special.
Very friendly service, and great value, well prepared food

service was terrible, the tables very close together and a little awkward to navigate around.
Staff actually hoovered (multiple times) during the 2 hrs that we were there.
One of us ordered a meal without onions, she obviously got the dish with onions. when pointed out, they went into the kitchen and were back out with it in a couple of mins (picking onions out rather than making fresh - since we have waited for the food for a while).

Portions were quite big. Flavours underwhelming. A bit of a lazy chef (veg were huge, imagine a broccoli cut just twice and put on your plate).

Overall, would not be back. They are trying hard to be classy (the decor is nice), but they are not.
Used to eat here when it was on Park Lane some 30 odd years ago. Wasn't disappointed all these years later. Food is fab. Will definitely be returning very soon!

Went there for a lunch, the place was pretty empty; time of year? However cannot fault the food, all very good and large portions. The whitebait & calamari was almost a meal in itself; perhaps less is more. maybe it is my palate but I couldn't detect anything different about the Kobe Wagyu beef, next time I'll stick to the normal burger.
Excellent lunchtime experience with attentive staff.

Went for the 2 for 1 Burgers which were really very good, and excellent value. The pre theatre menu looked great as well 2 courses and glass of wine for less than ¬£20. Lovely atmosphere and staff friendly and attentive. Would def go back

Wolfe's was a pleasant suprise food good and plenty of choice, the only complaint i have is that we were abit squeezed on our table and very close to next table . I would recommend this restaurant and will go again and will ask for a bigger table, it was very busy so maybe that was the problem.

We ate from the a la carte menu in Wolfes, Covent Garden. The starters were huge and the burgers were very very nice. The atmosphere and the service wasn't as good as expected but the food made up for that.
Food was lovley, service was ok, all in all not bad.

Our second visit to Wolfe's for after theatre dinner was as an enjoyable experience as the last one! the place was packed but we found space and time for a cocktails at the bar and leisurely dinner afterwards. My Kobe burger was huge 10 oz of lovely meat cooked to perfection and my partners steak beautifully presented;  the staff  were friendly and attentive ; really good place to recommend !!

Wolfe's is Retro all the way - its like walking into an early episode of Dallas!  Portions are huge & it clearly caters for a strongly male audience but its great if you are looking for somewhere a little different.
Better food than TGI Fridays and certainly better value for money. Barbacoa burger in pretzel bun was pretty good.
Wonderful food and service! Highlights were the courgette flower fritti and the tortelli with ricotta, spinach and sage butter. They were also very accommodating about my friend's honey allergy.

This may seem a bit harsh, but it's 100% accurate.

I purchased this using a groupon for my family while we visited London. The Groupon is completely misleading, if not fraudulent.

The Groupon we purchased told us that we could order up to one Mai Tai, one appetizer (up to a certain value), one main course (up to certain value) and one dessert (up to a certain value), this is completely misleading.

When you arrive and tell them you have a Groupon, they give you a completely different menu which is also different than the menu that is on the web....and different from the standard menu. You can not order dishes off of the regular menu up to the price limits that are indicated on the Groupon.

When I showed this to the manager (who was actually very nice), I was told "we don't tell Groupon what to put in the coupon." This is also not true....but why was I surprised....like Groupon writes them for restaurants on their own?

To make things worse, the food that we ate was terrible. A good example is fried calamari which looks like tons of bread fried on the worst calamari I ever had. My daughter had a curried Shrimp. They told her that the shrimp was not one of the choices and they charged a $10 up charge - "although we remained under the limit stated on the groupon." To boot, the shrimp were small, tasteless and had a rubber like texture.

You may actually like the food if you are also frozen in time from 1983 like this restaurant.

A few more observations. The curry dishes come with approximately 10 things that you can add. The problem is that they are seemingly, unrelated to the curry dish that they are serving - like hot sauce on chocolate ice cream.

As far as the Mai Tai....no liquor. The upside is that they give you plenty of ice. My wife commented after tasting her Mai Tai "I think I may have to stop drinking if somebody serves this to me again." Nobody in our party drank their cocktails.

Trader Vics looks like a polynesian tiki hut but the food is a mixture of asian & french. The service was impeccable & the food delightful. We were also pleasantly surprised when the bill arrived. I'd thoroughly recommend this place to anyone. The only let down was the lack of non rum based cocktails on the menu however they happily made me a cocktail of my choice so it ended well

Think Hawaii, think Disneyland, think amazing rum cocktails with the contents of a tropical plantation mixed in and you get Trader Vic's in London. Memorably fun and funky. It's one of those experiences you to try at least once in your life. Focus is very much on the cocktails although if there's enough of you (and no vegetarians) they can do you a roast suckling pig.

Went here with some colleagues for a celebratory lunch on the 3 courses for ¬£20 deal. Was pleasantly surprised with the menu on offer and the quality of the food. Service was relatively attentive, probably more so as we were the only 6 people in there for lunch on the Thursday...! The lack of people did dampen the atmosphere, but still a good place to have a meal. Probably better to go for dinner when busier than for lunch on a Thursday though.

It was lovely to combine a shop in Selfridges with a leisurely lunch on the rooftop. We were a bit apprehensive as the menu seemed at first sight a bit fast foodie but we really enjoyed our pork belly  and so  pleased the truffle chips are back on the menu. The waiters were attentive and nothing was too much trouble. Will definitely come again.

The food is nothing to brag about. It is ok. Most of the diners must have booked on the set menu with bottomless prosecco especially three women who were definitely drunk. They were f..ing this and that which you dont really want to hear if you are trying to have a nice dinner. Perhaps there should be a time limit or limit to a bottle per person which should be more than enough. We are not used to it

food disapointed with. veg not cooked properley raw. main  eating  area closed  due to party booking  topdeck a bit grim.should have been informed of cloesure. possibality  will try again at a later date.otherwise ok

Went to Kingsley Two Brasserie with a friend for a catch up. The main restaurant was closed so we were seated in the bar to eat where they had some tables set up to the side. It was very quiet but the food was good and the service was good too.
Fantastic atmosphere great service Melanie our waitress fabulous and we thoroughly enjoyed the energetic ambiance -
